description: Responsible for supporting agency globalization strategy to meet commercial objectives with key agency and airline partners. Role has sales development responsibilities for American Express TLS contracting and performance, worth nearly $1B in revenue annually.  Summary Of Responsibilities (not Comprehensive Of All Tasks) Analyzes and summarizes global market and account performance using a variety of data sources including MIDT, ARC, DDS, and RPAD Works closely with Agency / Corporate Sales Development, Revenue Management, Sales Performance, Field Sales, and agency accounts to understand competitive environment / performance drivers Supports efforts with future partners to implement new strategies toward joint program implementation Oversees projects to integrate alliance partners into contracting tools / technology and agency incentive agreements Supports several Globalization efforts with cross commercial teams to improve worldwide contracting, technology, coordination and partner relationships Prepares internal communications including ad hoc reports, executive summaries, and formal presentations Embraces diverse people, thinking and styles Consistently makes safety and security, of self and others, the priority 3 years equivalent work experience is required Solution-oriented, multi-task capable and have demonstrated the ability to work well with others in a fast-paced time-sensitive environment Demonstrates initiative and self-directs work Possess strong analytical, sound organizational and planning skills, excellent verbal and written communication skills, strong interpersonal skills and a proven ability to make sound business decisions Highly proficient PC skills including advanced level knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint Where permitted by applicable law, must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire to be considered for U.S.-based job, if not currently employed by Delta Air Lines, Inc. Graduate degree in a business discipline and 5 years equivalent work experience Experience working with Delta and partner colleagues located in INTL regions General knowledge of Delta's markets and competitive market position, sales strategies, programs, processes, tools and infrastructure is highly desirable Travel industry sales experience, agency or corporate contracting, building incentive programs, working with field sellers, and executing cross commercial projects are a plus SAS, Tableau, Hyperion, and GSIS skills, along with working knowledge of RPAD and MIDT tables Experience with independently preparing analytical PowerPoint presentations

description: Creating Opportunities!! Being an SDR is one of THE most life changing jobs you will have. It will build you, break you, and mold you into a very important asset to ANY space in the Tech Sales World. There's a lot of money to be made as an SDR my friends.. Come join me at TIDAL!!

At YETI, we believe that time spent outdoors matters more than ever and our gear can make that time extraordinary. When you work here, you’ll have the opportunity to create exceptional, meaningful work and problem solve with innovative team members by your side. Together, you’ll help our customers get the high-quality gear they need to make the most of their adventures. We are BUILT FOR THE WILD™.  As the Vertical Sales Representative, you will be the face of our Corporate Sales team in relation to your assigned vertical account industry. You will be contributing to YETI’s success by proactively achieving sales objectives for new and existing vertical customers while at the same time helping to build out a key strategic area of growth for YETI.  You are a highly motivated & self-driven sales professional with excellent communication skills, ability to engage and build rapport with customers while not being afraid to match recommendations to the need identified. Winning is the nature of what you love to do – for yourself and for the customer. You understand the need to invest time and effort each day into building and maintaining a strong pipeline within your customer base and follow through on commitments. You are passionate about doing the right thing – the right way… and thrive in an environment where you can see the sales process from start to finish.  Responsibilities Represent the YETI brand by managing and growing accounts within your specified vertical industry Increase sales in respective accounts Proactively engage your assigned customer base – meet and exceed designated number of Outbound Quality calls Manage, track and report sales activities and results utilizing Salesforce account management tools Understand and evaluate customer objectives, and provide solutions to generate add-on sales opportunities Help close the sales cycle and ensure prompt order creation for business developed by the Corporate Sales Outbound Account Executives Manage all orders for your accounts from start to finish and serve as the dedicated resource for the partnership Understanding to use strategic thinking and problem-solving skills to navigate complex customer situations Provide timely and accurate responses via email and work assigned leads Collaborate with teammates and maintain a positive and professional attitude fostering teamwork Qualifications And Attributes Bachelor’s degree required At least 2 years of experience in sales, business development, or customer service Exceptional communication skills and strong desire to deliver Best in Class service Highly motivated and results driven Possess high attention to detail, prioritization, time management and organizational skills with a positive, goal-oriented attitude Problem solver that thrives under pressure in a fast-paced environment Comfortable living in the “grey” and understand the need to approach each situation individually Ability to learn and navigate multiple systems at once Experience with collaborating with cross-functional teams at all levels Ability to work in startup - like environment and within a large matrixed organization This role is based onsite at our HQ in Austin, TX YETI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.  YETI's Privacy Policy

description: Full-Time  Overview  We’re SmileDirectClub, and we believe everyone deserves a smile they’ll love. We also believe that you deserve a job you’ll love. Good thing you found us, and we found you. At SmileDirectClub, we’re all about empowering transformation. We want people to become more confident in how they look, how they feel, and how they think. So we’re spreading smiles and positivity all over the country.  It’s no small task. That’s why we’re looking for energetic, passionate, and confident team members who can help turn frowns, into life-changing grins. Are you up for it?  We are looking for an Account Sales Manager (ASM)/Inside Sales to join the SDC Partner Network team reporting to the Sr. Manager, Partner Relations. The ASM will be responsible for working closely with the sales leadership team in the development and performance of all sales activities in assigned geographical areas. The assigned territory will include general dentists, orthodontic specialists and mid-market DSOs. Individual must have high energy and be self-motivated. The ASM will perform the responsibilities listed below.  Responsibilities  Responsible for lead generation, new customer acquisition, and virtual account onboarding and training. To include but not limited to all aspects of creating a customer account. Attainment of assigned monthly/quarterly inside sales metrics; including new account acquisition goals, case start and revenue growth goals, and/or percent to quota. Cultivate and develop a designated sales territory by building long-term relationships with dental practices. Establish strong relationships with Partner Network doctors and staff. Establish strong relationships with Partner Network doctors and staff. Thoroughly train office-level members of the Partner Network, based on company guidelines Ensure that all training opportunities/gaps are addressed with a sense of urgency Assess training and partner activation to ensure that continual improvements are made and that the training is being delivered effectively and is fully understood Identify practice needs and formulate a plan to demonstrate SDC's value Prospecting and developing dental accounts to achieve sales goals through outbound calls Develop relationships over the phone/virtual video conferencing and be able to overcome objections and show product value Communicate company updates to partner offices and develop execution plans with seamless roll out Develop on-going plans to drive engagement and continual/consistent case submissions from partner offices Timely submission of all reports to include weekly/monthly sales activity and expense reports. Provide weekly recaps/updates to leader on progress, opportunities, challenges with partners and the program Answer questions from partners, address and resolve their issues, and oversee partner case submissions for quality and compliance. Coordinate with the larger Partner Network team to implement new initiatives with the goal of growing the partnership Travel to facilitate partner onboarding, internal meetings, trade events and peer to peer meetings check-ins as needed Keep information up to date in CRM application Qualifications  Dental industry experience a plus Bachelor’s degree and minimum 5 years of equivalent business experience Proven experience of delivering training programs with a strong customer focused approach preferred Demonstrated customer service and experience skills Strong interpersonal skills Willingness and ability if needed/requested Excellent communication skills (written and oral), planning, and organization skills Experience with CRM tools Ability to work independently with limited supervisory direction. The ability to work within a team environment to support peers within the local market Excellent time management skills Attention to detail, accuracy, and strong organizational skills Proficiency with the Microsoft Office suite, especially PowerPoint and Excel Proficiency in using virtual tools such as Zoom and Microsoft Teams to execute account training and management. Benefits Of Joining The Club  Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance 401K with match PTO Aligner and Whitening Benefit Collaborative work environment and positive culture Company Profile  SmileDirectClub was founded on a simple belief: everyone deserves a smile they love. The Company is the first digital brand for straightening your smile, created after the realization that recent trends in 3D printing and telehealth could bring about disruptive change to the invisible aligner market by matching licensed professionals, a quality clear-aligner product, and customers together. By leveraging proprietary, cutting-edge technology, SmileDirectClub, LLC-affiliated dentists are providing greater access of care to consumers who couldn't otherwise afford orthodontic treatment to get a better smile. description: FULL-TIME W-2 POSITION  Who We Want  Hard-working winners. Confident, competitive, and results-oriented salespeople who create a track record of success.  Persuasive influencers. People who understand market positioning and can use their relationship skills and depth of knowledge to secure buy-in, cooperation, and loyalty.  Teammates. Partners who listen to ideas, share thoughts, and work together to move the business forward.  Mission-driven salespeople. Fiercely intense representatives who work whatever hours necessary to live out their purpose of changing people’s lives and making healthcare better.  What You Will Do  As the Territory Sales Associate, you will be dedicated to the product platform and procedure. Primary responsibilities will be to drive qualified incremental new technology users and procedure volume in hospital outpatient, ASC and office settings. Critical area of this position requires clinical selling, presence, ability to communicate effectively with HCPs (Health Care Providers) and Staff, train virtually and in person, learn the basics of reimbursement and communicate a clear path forward through resource, work closely with the Field Application Specialists (FAS), work closely with the Sales team and Marketing team, strategic account management and be the champion of the new technology in your geography.  Communication with internal Marketing and Sales Management will be critical. The Territory Sales Associate will help support strategic HCP training and adoption of the device to gain market feedback, support, and drive adoption. He / she will combine multiple functional attributes such as Sales, Marketing, clinical knowledge and support, product and procedural knowledge, communication of field feedback and needs, and leadership capabilities.  The Territory Sales Associate will perform all duties listed below in addition to the above mentioned:  What You Need Drive adoption of the New technology, meet or exceed quota targets, including # of HCPs trained, # of users, # of active sites. Partner closely with FAS team, Marketing and Sales to drive market development of the New technology in outpatient and office settings. Support HCP/Staff training both on-line as well as in person. Serve as product expert to drive adoption of new device, reinforce safe and effective use of product as dictated by product labeling. Be confident in the procedure room, with procedural knowledge, training in accordance with the IFU and approved materials and tools. The ability to educated live time in procedures with presence and a voice. Know competitive devices, clinical data and positioning. Maintain awareness of market trends, threats and opportunities. Participate in and coordinate conference calls to provide feedback and support to Marketing and Sales on relevant topics, concerns, insights, business intelligence, etc. Possess the right attitude, building up the sales territory and being a self-reliant self-starter.  Qualifications A Bachelor's Degree is required; an advanced business degree or equivalent clinical/business experience is preferred. A minimum of 2-3 years of medical Sales experience or similar Sales, Marketing and/or clinical experience. Ideal to have medical device experience within a hospital operating room or office. Experience in developing and managing HCP relationships is essential. Urology clinical experience a plus. The proven ability to develop and grow business based on ‘procedure-focused sales’ is necessary. Must have demonstrated success in developing accounts and training physicians and staff. The ability to execute strategic plans and lead change is essential. Must have strong prospecting skills, and be a self starter. Must be capable of independent action and detail oriented. Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills, as well as interpersonal skills at all levels. Willingness to travel for procedures, customer meetings, internal meetings, and tradeshows as required. 80% travel is required in territory  The following physical demands are required: Frequently Lift/Carry 25 pounds Vision requirements correctable to 20/20 vision Stand/Sit/Walk 8 hours a day Operate moving vehicles  The following work environment conditions exist: Infectious Disease exposure Laser Eye Protection  What We Offer A winning team driven to achieve our mission and deliver remarkable results. Quality products that improve the lives of customers and patients. Ability to discover your strengths, follow your passion and own your own career.  Powered by JazzHR  Pc2QfyYaDv
industries: Medical Devices, Insurance, and Hospital & Health Care

description: MAVRANS is a sustainable clothing brand that focuses on creating collections made for good times. The concept started in 2018 with the idea to redefine leisurewear for the modern lifestyle. With the aim to make the next best outfit, we are continuously redefining our core garment collection intended for being the limelight at the party. MAVRANS now distributes their products globally with our home base in Miami FL.  We’re looking for somebody who can hit the ground running, somebody who brings first-hand experience and knowledge to the brand. Although we would prefer the successful candidate to have worked within fashion, it would not be a deciding factor, as we understand that if the candidate is skilled and experienced enough they will be able to adapt their expertise to fit the role.   Essential Responsibilities  -Your primary objective will be to grow retail and wholesale revenue for the company. -Create long lasting account relationships -Efficiently and effectively manage the set territory -Hold product training sessions for account associates -Effectively communicate with team members -Maintain and service territory account base  Qualities we are looking for:  -roster of clients we can work with -experience with demo or fitting -2+ years of sales experience, preferably in mens/resort -great for an experienced reps with existing mens or swim lines

Wine Wine Situation is one of the most renowned fine wine importer and wholesaler. It is categorized by most of the wine buyers as a “Specialty” wine company.  We bring the top and sometimes hidden treasure wines from Europe, including France, Italy, Spain, and Germany. Currently National Importer and California Wholesaler, we are now expanding our distribution to Nevada.  The ideal candidate will be based in Las Vegas to prospect and close sales lead to help generate revenue for the company. They will also be responsible for developing, implementing, and evaluating the sales strategy.  The company will take care of the import, the logistics, and the portfolio. The regional sales representative will build a list of clients in the Las Vegas market and keep pushing to build new partnerships. We are newly starting in Nevada and we want to find the right person to fit the challenge!  Responsibilities Responsible for establishing and developing account growth in the Las Vegas area, Develop, manage and oversee opportunities, Manage the connection between the company and the top restaurants and retailers' accounts in Las Vegas, Being accountable for reaching sales goals and developing strategic growth plans. Maximize revenues, Coordinate with sales representatives to generate and meet with prospective leads, Track and report all sales activities, Develop and execute sales strategy through market analysis, Be the market expert for all sales-related activity accounted for in the Las Vegas region.  Qualifications Experience as a sales representative, Experience generating and maintaining relationships with sales leads, Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  Employment Type Full-time

Who are we? Placer.ai is a rapidly growing startup in location analytics, building the industry’s most advanced, self-service data platform. We are already working with some of the biggest brands and industry leaders in Commercial Real Estate, Retail, Hospitality and beyond, and are looking for strong and independent professionals to join and help us drive the next wave of growth. Read more on our website: Placer.ai (We recommend that all serious candidates sign up for the platform's free version to research what the Placer platform is and what makes us so special).  Responsibilities Prospect, educate, qualify, and develop target accounts from lead-generation activities, such as outbound cold-calling, and emailing. Engage with prospects via phone by making a minimum of 60 cold calls per day. Generate qualified meetings both before and after events. Distribute new opportunities to appropriate sales executives, collaborate with the executives about the opportunity, and determine appropriate action items. Maintain diligent organization with prospect follow-up and internal communications. Be able to remain focused and detail-oriented, even in a fast-paced environment. Learn and maintain in-depth knowledge of Placer’s platform, industry trends, and data. Some travel for events may be required. Minimum Requirements The ideal candidate will have a high desire to build a career in Sales. At least 1 year of an outbound sales development function Ability to work in a fast-paced, constantly evolving environment. Excellent verbal and written communication skills including high-level interactions with internal and external contacts. Exceptional ability to organize work and tasks; attention to detail and excellent follow-through. Knowledge of the SaaS industry and sales process. Knowledge of the Retail, Real-Estate, or Marketing Analytics market is desirable.  The ideal candidate will have previous experience in Salesforce and Salesloft (or a Salesloft competitor of some sort).

Anutra Medical is a rapidly growing start-up dental business based in Research Triangle Park, NC that has invented a local anesthetic delivery system that will reduce pain for patients and help dentists be more efficient. Our team is made up of self-motivated and highly driven individuals..  We are seeking to fill multiple  Territory Sales Representative Positions.  Florida  Position:  Territory Sales Representative  Summary:  The role of the Territory Sales Representative is essential in the success of establishing this innovative product in the dental marketplace.  This position requires a seasoned professional familiar with both sales and education in the dental industry that has an excitement and desire to be in a start-up environment and launch new products.   Must be willing to cold call.  Responsibilities: ·     Responsible for new sales to customers and conversion to reoccurring orders of existing customers.  ·     Travel and present at key industry conferences, trade shows, regional/state/local dental associations and study clubs engaging with practices to present the product and close initial orders.  ·     Follow-up with current customers in established territory to develop solid relationships  with these dentists/ practices ultimately converting them to raving fans of Infusion Medical products.  ·     Follow-up with customers to gain referral base for new customer sales. ·     Exceed short and long-term sales targets. ·     Work with our Implementation Specialist who will handle the training of new customer acquisition

*Proven work experience as a Sales Representative *Excellent knowledge of G-Suite *Highly motivated and target driven with a *proven track record in sales *Excellent selling, negotiation and communication skills *Prioritizing, time management and *organizational skills *Ability to create and deliver presentations tailored to the audience needs *Relationship management skills and openness to feedback

Base Salary $40K - $45K, total comp at plan first year $80K - $120K. Uncapped commissions which makes your total comp the investment you put in the position.  Leading medical/surgical products distributor is seeking a full-time field sales representative for the South Houston and surrounding territory. This position requires an experienced sales person who can not only sell products but also recognize new opportunities with both new and existing customers. Preferred candidate would have a documented success history selling in the following areas: Operating room, inpatient pharmacy and/or compounding pharmacies, ambulatory surgery centers, and/or IV Therapy. The ideal candidate must be self-motivated and have a strong proven sales record with solid relationship skills.  The Company offers a Base salary, an uncapped commission program, defined and protected territories, approved expenses, mileage reimbursement, insurance benefits package and 401(k) matching. Your success will be measured by your ability to meet sales quotas, attract new accounts and build relationships. This is a phenomenal opportunity in the medical sales industry with an innovative and dynamic leading company. If you meet the above criteria and are looking for a new position with an outstanding organization, please apply as directed. Only qualified candidates meeting the above criteria will be notified.  The top reasons why the best reps want to work for Progressive Medical, Inc: A National Sales Team that is clinically prepared to support the needs of our clinical customers in any clinical environment. A National Account & Contract Team that understands the needs of Group Purchasing Organizations (GPOs) and Integrated Delivery Networks (IDNs) and how they play a significant role in the healthcare supply chain industry. A Customer Service Team that is second to none, fully staffed by Customers Service Specialists who personally answer every call, every time. Our Operations and Distribution Teams ensure our customers receive their product professionally and expediently. A Clinical Affairs Team that is available to answer questions and provide peer to peer training and support to our customers. Sales Education in collaboration with the Marketing Team provide extensive and continuous educational programs for not only our sales force, but the entire PMI organization. Our Marketing Team of professionals works in all aspects of both upstream and downstream marketing, from implementation to analysis, we understand how to take your product to market. Progressive Medical, Inc. is a leading distributor of specialty medical products throughout the United States. Our focus on innovative products helps clinicians to practice the highest quality care and increase safety, while also controlling overall costs in the areas of: surgery/anesthesia, interventional radiology, critical care and IV specialties.

description: About Health Here  At Health Here, we believe that the patient-provider relationship is the essence of healthcare. However, if you’ve been to the doctor lately, we bet you have been frustrated by redundant paperwork, confusing bills, and long waits. We empower medical practices to turn this paradigm on its head with our Clinic Q platform. Providers use Clinic Q to elevate the patient experience, offer upfront cost clarity, and redefine patient payments. We’ve rolled out Clinic Q to hundreds of surgical specialists across the country...and we’re just getting started.   The SDR Role   The Sales Development Representative (SDR) is the tip-of-the-spear for generating new business at Health Here. You will be the “first impression” of the Health Here brand and will be counted on to expand top-of-funnel activity, generate new leads, and respond to inbound opportunities. You will hone your skills as a salesperson in a collaborative, fast-paced environment and have a significant impact on the trajectory of the company.   The role is based in Nashville, TN, but remote candidates will be considered on a case-by-case basis.  Responsibilities  Identify and qualify new sales opportunities Drive meeting and demo set-up with new sales opportunities  Support Health Here Sales Executives in introductory meetings and demos Represent Health Here at industry conferences Effectively communicate the Health Here value proposition in a variety of formats (phone, email, in-person, and conferences) Collaborate and share prospect feedback with the product team to identify new offerings to increase the value of Clinic Q Become an expert on our sales and marketing automation tools to effectively scale your outreach  Requirements  Strong desire to develop as a sales professional 1-3 years of sales experience preferred, with experience in technology companies and/or healthcare industry a plus Curious, self-starter interested in becoming an expert on the healthcare industry specifically healthcare technology and payments Excellent verbal and written communicator Comfortable working on a small team in a dynamic environment Committed to a data-driven sales process Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience

Job Description- This is a great ENTRY LEVEL position for someone wanting to get their foot into the medical field.  Complete Care is currently looking for a dynamic, energetic, outgoing, charismatic, and organized individual to market our growing clinics and services to local businesses, medical professionals, and organizations in the Orlando area.  The ideal candidate is one who loves meeting and connecting with new people, has high energy, is positive, and results-oriented.  Essential Functions:  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform job-related functions. Implement strategic physician marketing plans to accommodate corporate goals. Act as a liaison between Complete Care specialist and retained attorney Review demographics of assigned territory to determine customer needs, competitive pressures, and opportunities to improve communication with the retained attorney. Regularly visit referring physician offices to communicate patient updates and ensure patient records are being handled in a timely fashion. Represent the company at professional events to promote the services offered. Meet with key referral sources on an ongoing basis as a means of developing and maintaining long-term relationships. Effectively manages monthly budget allotted.  Benefits: Great competitive compensation (higher than the median salary in Central Florida) Support from a group of seasoned professionals Vacation time Great hours Comprehensive training course Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance available Uniform Provided  History- After witnessing a lack of proper assessment and support for patients that have been in injured due to trauma we saw a dire need in the community for clinics and doctors who would provide excellent evaluation and treatment of their injuries and the support needed to guide them through the process. This is what led to the family of practices that is Complete Care. Complete Care consists of Integrative Physical Medicine, Centers for Imaging, and Interventional Associates. Together they provide patients with immediate access to chiropractic care, physiotherapy, state of the art imaging, interventional pain management, and orthopedic specialists.  Future Growth- With 30 locations, we serve patients in 10 counties throughout Central Florida. Complete Care is building toward being the national platform for treating the injured in a fully integrated health system, while continuing to maintain our unmatched patient centric pillars of ethics, diligence and clinical expertise. We look forward to continue to serve our patients with the care they deserve.  Powered by JazzHR  CZkoBZMbjs

description: About Us: DynAdmic can target viewers in real-time based on what they are about to watch. Using an AI proprietary audio recognition technology to understand what’s being spoken inside the videos. DynAdmic curates digital video advertising inventory from the world’s leading websites by utilizing smart targeting, activating brand safety and fraud security, while focusing on campaign performance metrics.  About You: Do you consider yourself a go-getter and effective communicator? At DynAdmic, we’re seeking a fast-learning, driven Sales Development Representative (SDR) with a fearless attitude to jump in and join our team. We’re in an exciting period of growth and are seeking talented and passionate individuals that are driven. Are you ready to seize a great opportunity to contribute to DynAdmic’s growth? Reach out to us, this may be the role for you!  What we look for:  1+ years' experience of business development/inside sales or recent college grads with experience in a sales internship Excellent written communication skills to engage and follow-up Collaborative and cooperative attitude A team player, a quick thinker and a fast learner Strong organizational skills, with strengths in being detail and process-oriented Grit and ambition – Hustle and drive to hit and exceed goals  What you will do:  Use internal tools and resources to generate qualified leads and increasing the sales pipeline Respond, engage and qualify leads and inquiries Document all notes on customer interaction in our CRM Work closely with the broader sales team to develop leads schedule appointments  This role is strategic in nature - it’s not about jumping online and contacting everyone you come across, it’s about assessed and focused interactions that are extracted through a high volume of personalized outbound activity.  Bonus Points:    Familiarity with Salesforce or similar CRM AdTech Industry experience   Why DynAdmic:  Generous PTO and holidays 401K with company match Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance  Wellness Benefit Commuter Benefit Plentiful snacks Social outings & team events   We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes future DynAdmic with all experiences and perspectives. DynAdmic has offices in New York City, Mexico, Brazil, France, Germany and Dubai. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.

Since launching our direct-to-consumer sales efforts, we got tremendous traction from skaters worldwide in the United States and Europe. Coinbase has built the world's leading compliant cryptocurrency platform serving over 30 million accounts in more than 100 countries. With multiple successful products, and our vocal advocacy for blockchain technology, we have played a major part in mainstream awareness and adoption of cryptocurrency. We are proud to offer an entire suite of products that are helping build the cryptoeconomy and increase economic freedom around the world.  There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for signals that a candidate will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, disrupt ourselves, and expect sustained high performance because we play as a championship team. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people with the desire and capacity to build and share expertise in the frontier technologies of crypto and blockchain, in whatever way is most relevant to their role.  Sales Operations & Strategy is a cross-functional team, working primarily with the Institutional Sales, Trading, and Prime services business in Coinbase Institutional. Coinbase’s institutional clients are both “crypto-forward” and just getting into crypto. The team is a partner to commercial leadership at Coinbase, focusing on high-impact strategic and operational projects with our institutional client-facing sales and trading teams. For this particular role, the individual will work closely with our Coinbase Cloud offering to our institutional and crypto-native clients.  What You’ll Be Doing (ie. Job Duties) Drive strategic projects that enable commercial leaders to drive revenue opportunities. Establish go-to-market approaches and productivity enhancements. Define, manage, and provide insights on key performance metrics. Create and manage processes such as target setting, forecasting, and pipeline analytics. Analyze large amounts of information quickly and effectively to reduce complexity and make actionable recommendations for Coinbase. Work closely with sales systems and tooling teams, shaping the development and usage of our CRM and data visualization. What We Look For In You (ie. Job Requirements) 3+ years of experience in sales strategy & operations, management consulting, or business insights/analytics (role dependent upon experience level). Solid analytic, problem solving and interpersonal skills working with sales teams. Has experience working with large data sets. Exceptional prioritization and project management skills Passion to do whatever it takes to solve complex problems and build scalable processes. Comfort working in a high growth, constantly changing environment. Nice To Haves Strong interest in the crypto market. Experience working at a high growth startup / tech company. Experience with CRM systems. Commitment to Equal Opportunity  Coinbase is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other basis protected by applicable law. Coinbase will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. For US applicants, you may view Pay Transparency, Employee Rights and Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law notices by clicking on their corresponding links. Additionally, Coinbase participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law.  Coinbase is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations@ coinbase.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. For quick access to screen reading technology compatible with this site click here to download a free compatible screen reader (free step by step tutorial can be found here). Please contact accommodations@ coinbase.com for additional information or to request accommodations.  Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates and Applicants  Depending on your location, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) may regulate the way we manage the data of job applicants. description: Breakaway Consultants a boutique recruiting firm is assisting a medical device client in the Phoenix area look for a Surgical Sales Specialist. Our Client is known for developing, supporting and promoting their surgical sales teams and collaborating with healthcare providers! Additionally, they produce and delivers high-quality surgical instrumentation to healthcare providers around the world. Their portfolio of more than 20,000 surgical instruments includes proven, trusted brands, and we work to bring new innovations to market that can help clinicians deliver superior patient care - from access to intervention to closure in surgical procedures.  The Responsibilities Of Our Surgical Sales Specialist Include Call on acute care facilities within assigned territory in conjunction with our sales representatives to expand the sales of Operating Room products. Provide technical expertise and consultation to each of the various disciplines found within the hospital Operating Room setting, especially handheld surgical devices. Create product cross-references, account savings proposals, and sales presentations representing the energy portfolio Present the features, benefits, and savings proposals of various energy products and services to multiple decision makers Lead and participate in all customer product trials, evaluations, implementations, and in-services as necessary Represent us as the Operating Room product expert within the assigned territory Participate with product division on overall product strategy, competitive analyses, research and development requirements as well as other duties as assigned Education Bachelor's degree required; scientific concentration highly preferred Medical Technologist certification highly preferred Relevant Work Experience At least 3+ years sales experience in Medical/Surgical procedures required within the OR, SPD and/or Materials Management. Prior Surgical Instrumentation sales experience preferred. National Accounts management experience is preferred Experience in the Operating Room within hospital setting highly preferred Manufacturer and Distribution experience highly preferred Familiarity with day-to-day dynamics of each OR discipline within the hospital setting Please apply if you are interested in joining the team!  Breakaway Consultants is an executive search firm that represents many industries across the nation.We pride ourselves in finding the rigth fit for employees and employers.
industries: Construction, Marketing and Advertising, and Hospital & Health Care

description: Job Title: Pharmaceutical Sales  Department: Sales and Marketing  Reports To: VP of Sales and Marketing  FLSA Status: Non-Exempt     Position Summary:  We are looking for motivated Pharmaceutical Sales Representatives to join our team. Our ideal candidate is an expert in building customer relationships who feel comfortable reaching out to potential clients in the healthcare field. You will employ your detailed product knowledge and sales skills to demonstrate the need for our services and products, as well as the benefits we offer. Candidates with experience in this field are strongly preferred. This role requires some traveling between doctor’s offices and is commission based only.    Essential Duties and Responsibilities:    To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the following satisfactorily; other duties may be assigned. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.   ● Build and nurture relationships with customers  ● Effectively demonstrate a healthcare provider’s need for the company's services and products  ● Provide product samples  ● Perform product demonstrations  ● Work strategically to increase the brand’s awareness and use of the company's pharmaceutical and medical products.  ● Undertaking relevant research  ● Maintaining detailed records with the use of company CRM   Dependability- Commits to doing the best job possible. Follows instructions, responds to management direction. Keeps commitments. Responds to requests for service and assistance. Takes responsibility for own actions.   Qualifications:    To be successful in this role, the individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative, but not all-inclusive, of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required as the Deli Attendant.    Education/Experience:    High school diploma or general education degree (GED); 6 months experience preferred.      Physical and Mental Requirements:    • Able to stand for periods of time, while visiting offices  • Able to commute to different locations within their territory  • Basic math knowledge     Supervisory Responsibilities: No    The above job description is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of duties and standards of the position. Incumbents will follow any other instructions, and perform any other related duties, as assigned by their supervisor.

Coinbase has built the world's leading compliant cryptocurrency platform serving over 30 million accounts in more than 100 countries. With multiple successful products, and our vocal advocacy for blockchain technology, we have played a major part in mainstream awareness and adoption of cryptocurrency. We are proud to offer an entire suite of products that are helping build the cryptoeconomy and increase economic freedom around the world.  There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for signals that a candidate will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, disrupt ourselves, and expect sustained high performance because we play as a championship team. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people with the desire and capacity to build and share expertise in the frontier technologies of crypto and blockchain, in whatever way is most relevant to their role.  Sales Operations & Strategy is a cross-functional team, working primarily with the Institutional Sales, Trading, and Prime services business in Coinbase Institutional. Coinbase’s institutional clients are both “crypto-forward” and just getting into crypto. The team is a partner to commercial leadership at Coinbase, focusing on high-impact strategic and operational projects with our institutional client-facing sales and trading teams. For this particular role, the individual will work closely with our Coinbase Cloud offering to our institutional and crypto-native clients.  What You’ll Be Doing (ie. Job Duties) Drive strategic projects that enable commercial leaders to drive revenue opportunities. Establish go-to-market approaches and productivity enhancements. Define, manage, and provide insights on key performance metrics. Create and manage processes such as target setting, forecasting, and pipeline analytics. Analyze large amounts of information quickly and effectively to reduce complexity and make actionable recommendations for Coinbase. Work closely with sales systems and tooling teams, shaping the development and usage of our CRM and data visualization. What We Look For In You (ie. Job Requirements) 3+ years of experience in sales strategy & operations, management consulting, or business insights/analytics (role dependent upon experience level). Solid analytic, problem solving and interpersonal skills working with sales teams. Has experience working with large data sets. Exceptional prioritization and project management skills Passion to do whatever it takes to solve complex problems and build scalable processes. Comfort working in a high growth, constantly changing environment. Nice To Haves Strong interest in the crypto market. Experience working at a high growth startup / tech company. Experience with CRM systems. Commitment to Equal Opportunity  Coinbase is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other basis protected by applicable law. Coinbase will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. For US applicants, you may view Pay Transparency, Employee Rights and Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law notices by clicking on their corresponding links. Additionally, Coinbase participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law.  Coinbase is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations@ coinbase.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. For quick access to screen reading technology compatible with this site click here to download a free compatible screen reader (free step by step tutorial can be found here). Please contact accommodations@ coinbase.com for additional information or to request accommodations. description: Who We Are at Abyde  Built on a single mission to revolutionize compliance in the healthcare industry, Abyde has gone from an idea that started in a garage to the preeminent HIPAA compliance solution in a matter of just five years. With a 95% renewal rate, an NPS score of 83 (world-class!), rapidly accelerating customer list, and over 45 partnerships with medical and technology organizations and associations across the nation, Abyde has earned its spot as the easiest way to alleviate HIPAA stress. Since launching our initial HIPAA compliance program, we have expanded our product line with an additional solution for enterprise-level healthcare organizations and are currently in the process of developing the a sister software solution for OSHA compliance. So if you’re looking for a fast-paced environment with endless opportunities for innovation and advancement - Abyde is the place for you.   Why We’re Hiring  We are a fast growing healthcare technology company and as our product line and customer base grows, we need more like-minded individuals to help us continue on that upward trend. Abyde is seeking to hire experienced SaaS sales professionals who enjoy the hunt. This role is challenging yet rewarding, and the knowledge and leadership skills you’ll learn as a sales professional at Abyde is unmatched.   What We’re Looking For Hard Workers - As industry leaders in HIPAA compliance, the ideal candidate should want to be a part of an organization that prides itself on outworking the competition.   Sales Hunters - The perfect candidate for this position has a history of hunting SaaS sales (not an order taker) and will do what it takes to keep a consistent and reliable pipeline Money Motivated Sales Professionals - We want this person to be goal oriented and full of energy. Abyde enjoys offering competitive and uncapped earning opportunities and especially enjoys paying bonuses for performing above and beyond expectations.   Responsibilities Include: Proactively call qualified medical practices and identify the employee/doctor responsible for their internal HIPAA compliance program Effectively schedule employee/doctor for a complimentary educational webinar or product demo Correctly utilize Salesforce to log calls and scheduled webinars/demos Consistently meet or exceed scheduling goals Work closely with the marketing and sales teams on creating and executing strategic call campaigns  Qualifications: 1-3+ years SaaS sales experience Drive to make money  Desire to be part of something bigger than yourself (WE’LL TEACH YOU EVERYTHING ELSE!)  Compensation & Benefits: Base / Commission / Bonuses OTE Year 1 - $70k-$100k OTE Year 2 - $85k-$120k Medical/Dental 401k with matching  The Abyde Work Environment Work within a fasted-paced, high energy environment with a great group of people that make coming to work each day fun! Participate in internal sales competitions and other ongoing contests  Partake in quarterly volunteer and philanthropy opportunities through Abyde CARES (Creating Community and Cultural Awareness Requires Everyone to Serve) Join regular company events both virtual and in-person that include happy hours and other team-building activities  Be challenged and encouraged to take on different responsibilities outside your daily tasks Enjoy a casually conservative dress-code (whatever it takes to sling deals!)  Employment Type Full-time

About Alpargatas: Alpargatas represents a powerhouse of hyper-connected and iconic brands. The company vision focuses on becoming increasingly global through major investments in digital, innovation and sustainability. Alpargatas is the largest footwear company in Latin America including brands: Havaianas and Osklen. Havaianas is the largest brand in the portfolio producing nearly 250 million pairs a year making it the largest flip flop brand globally. Osklen is a surf luxury brand from Rio de Janeiro and is one of the most sustainable apparel companies in the world.  About Havaianas: Havaianas is the largest brand of flip flops in the world and is increasing the product offering in apparel, accessories and new styles of footwear. The iconic design of its classic flip flop has been unchanged for 60 years and represents the most timeless design in open toe footwear. The brand is geared for growth in the US with 10+ stores, Havaianas.com, and surf specialty, apparel specialty, and presence in major department stores. Alpargatas is making significant investments in the NA&C operation to ensure Havaianas will take a leadership position in the market in the coming years.   Purpose of the Role:  Provide support and assistance to the Key Account Sales Manager in achieving sales targets for key accounts.  Key Duties and Responsibilities Run and format weekly/monthly selling reports. Track and analyze WTD-MTD-STD sales figures to identify trends and opportunities/ risks across all key accounts. Vendor portal management and order/forecasting - Nordstrom, Macy’s, Bloomingdale’s, Saks, Dillard’s, Kohl’s, Von Maur. Manage account requests for completion of new item setup templates, product attributes, image requests, inventory updates, etc.  Manage Key Account Order File. Review daily EDI to ensure bulks are reduced properly, work through corrections/PO extensions with accounts/customer service, and ensure all EDIs are received in a timely manner. Responsible for all seasonal updates in NuOrder to ensure product linesheets are loaded accurately with all relevant information for accounts to place orders. Work with Retail Assistance monthly to review reports, identify opportunities, track in-store presentations and report issues/findings. Responsible for organization and management of seasonal sample lines  Capabilities (Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities including Technical Requirements):  Min of 3 years of Wholesale experience (Sales or Buying) Working knowledge of retail math and concepts  Ability to be resourceful and problem solve effectively  Strong presentation, written and verbal communication skills   Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook Prior experience working in SAP, NuOrder, SPS Commerce strongly preferred Bachelor’s Degree  Talents:  Proactive Results Oriented  Analytical Capability Organizational Skills Interpersonal Relationship Skill
industries: Consumer Goods, Wholesale, and Apparel & Fashion

description: Overview Of The Company  Fox TV Stations  Fox Television Stations is one of the nation’s largest owned-and-operated network broadcast groups, comprising 29 stations in 18 markets and covering over 37% of U.S. television homes. This includes seven duopolies in the top 10 markets: New York, Los Angeles, Chicago, Dallas, San Francisco, Washington, D.C. and Houston; as well as duopolies in Minneapolis, Phoenix, Orlando and Seattle.  Job Description  WNYW FOX5 and WWOR MY9 in New York is seeking a well-organized Sales Coordinator to provide support for a team of Account Executives, Sales Managers and Sales Assistants. The successful candidate will be responsible for the administration and coordination of accounts for WNYW & WWOR-TV. The Sales Coordinator position requires the ability to implement processes and workflow for a team of assistants, maintain filing systems, coordinate order input and resolve discrepancies. The Sales Coordinator is responsible for training sales assistants and maintaining efficient workflow in a fast-paced environment.  Must be extremely organized, possess excellent verbal and written communication skills, detail-oriented, highly motivated, and an aptitude in problem solving. Additional requirements include solid computer and data entry skills, proficiency in Excel and Word; 1-2 years prior sales assistant experience; must be a team player with strong leadership abilities and a great work ethic. College degree preferred.  We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable law.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Online Media, and Broadcast Media

description: Location:               Southeast Regional States (AL, GA, MS, SC, NC, TN, FL) Title:                     Regional Sales Representative, Cayman Islands Dept. of Tourism Department:          Sales Reports To:           National Sales Manager        JOB SUMMARY: Conducts ongoing sales promotional activities within the assigned region in accordance with established sales targets and DOT approved sales and marketing plans. Researches demographic, psychographic and other lifestyle profiles in order to identify target markets and clients within the assigned region. Determines the most effective sales techniques and carries out the sales activities in order to achieve sales targets. In this position, extensive travel is required within the region. Some travel to other locations in the United States and the Cayman Islands.  Essential JOB FUNCTIONS include the following. Other duties may be assigned.  Promotes the Cayman Islands as a preferred travel destination to the travel industry and to consumers through a DOT-approved sales and promotional mix. Develops and executes a marketing and promotion strategy for the Cayman Islands that considers the specific/unique characteristics of the assigned region and the target population or groups within that assigned region. Includes detailed support of direct, nonstop air service routes within the region. Develops, in conjunction with the National Sales Manager and General Manager, and implements the sales activity targets and schedules as well as the marketing and promotional plan for the region within a designated yearly budget. Participates in and coordinates a variety of sales, marketing and promotional activities including sales calls, sales blitzes, destination training to agencies, trade and consumer shows, seminars, public speaking engagements and familiarization trips within an assigned region/territory. Reviews Arrival Destination Information and other data. Monitors sales activity performance within the assigned region; identifies poor performance areas and opportunities for increased performance within the assigned region; develops strategies to address poorly and/or underperforming areas within the assigned region. Maintains databases of contacts, event schedules, participants’ lists, etc. Fulfills or ensures fulfillment in a timely manner, all requests for collateral information from prospective clients, agencies, etc. within the region. At times, may be required to conduct or direct specific projects or studies and provide progress reports within a specified timeframe. Reports to the National Sales Manager on a regular basis on progress within all areas of responsibility.  JOB SPECIFICATIONS:  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.   Individual must reside within the assigned territory.  Qualifications/SKILLS: Essential: ·      Associate degree or equivalent in Marketing or Business Administration, with a concentration or certificate in Marketing or Tourism ·      A minimum of 3 years experience in a tourism-related field ·      Minimum 5 years experience Marketing Tourism in lieu of degree ·      Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite ·      Detail orientated and highly organized ·      Self-starter ·      Outstanding customer service skills ·      Excellent written and verbal communication skills ·      Ability to multi-task ·      Experience with sales and promotional events ·      Routinely handle objects weighing up to 25 lbs. and on occasion may be expected to lift objects weighing up to 40 lbs. ·      Have access to an automobile and possess a valid driver’s license. ·      Must be able to travel internationally and hold a valid passport.  ·     Desirable: ·      Practical knowledge of and exposure to the Cayman Islands and Caribbean region ·      Scuba diving certification   Additional Responsibilities: Supervises/coordinates activities at promotional events.   Please send resume to recruitment@caymanislands.ky                                  Deadline for receipt of a resume: October 8th, 2021

Job Description  Byrdie Golf Designs is expanding to green grass and we are looking for independent sales reps to grow the brand. We have partnered with Proud 90 and Top Knot to create a great complimentary package of products to sell.  Essential Responsibilities  -Your primary objective will be to grow retail and wholesale revenue for the company. This includes irons, wedges, apparel and head wear -Create long lasting account relationships -Efficiently and effectively manage the Southern California territory -Hold product training sessions for account associates -Effectively communicate with team members -Maintain and service territory account base  Qualities we are looking for:  -must enjoy the game of golf -experience with demo or fitting -3+ years of sales experience, preferably in golf -great for an experienced golf sales rep with existing line  Benefits:  Commission - 15% on golf clubs, 10% on head wear and apparel There are product minimums free samples bonus opportunities for exceeding sales goals.  We are looking for reps in the following territories:  Texas North and South Carolina Northern California

Job description Sales Representative Who We Are Medimetriks Pharmaceuticals, Inc. is a specialty pharmaceutical company dedicated to the development, licensing and commercialization of prescription pharmaceutical skin care brands. Our Mission is to leverage our portfolio of innovative brands that fill unmet needs in the Dermatology and Podiatry marketplaces and enhance patient care. Who Are We Looking For? We are seeking an experienced Sales Representative with a proven track record of Business to Business sales success; Experience in the Dermatology and Podiatry markets will be considered. Responsibilities: · Build important relationships with target physicians, establishing credibility and rapport with customers · Possess a high level of product, competitive, customer and territory knowledge · Deliver sales calls that consist of pre-call planning, driving brand messaging and closing effectively using visual aids and other promotional material · Maintain accurate and timely administration of company records, including expenses, targets, budget and sales calls. · Work with sales management to develop and execute sales strategies and initiatives · Execute promotional programs with key customer targets while complying with all FDA, PhRMA and PDMA regulations Qualifications: · BA/BS in marketing, business administration or a related field is required · Experience (2-4 years) in direct and/or outside Business to Business sales with demonstrated selling skills · Pharmaceutical sales experience will be considered as will experience selling to Dermatologists and Podiatrists · High personal motivation with a customer service orientation and an entrepreneurial mind set · Strong oral and written communication skills · Must reside in the geographic boundaries of the territory · A valid driver’s license Compensation and Benefits: · Competitive compensation package, including salary, stock options, 401k plan and bonuses · Company car · Excellent medical, dental and vision package · Generous paid time off and Company paid holidays Job Type: Full-time Job Type: Full-time

Job Description This opportunity is perfect for someone looking to break into medical device sales world or someone that is looking to further their career with a revolutionary company within the space. If you have a passion to lead from the front in the innovative and growing field of point-of-care diagnostics, then this is the position for you. The position of territory manager will provide you the opportunity to sell multiple ground breaking and cutting edge devices within the private practice, hospital, physician network, treatment, government and staffing space(s).  What You’ll Do One of the perks of working for a fast growing company is that the Territory Managers are given autonomy, responsibility, and an environment where they can utilize their creativity. Your main objective will be to increase revenues in your given territory by opening new business and managing your own clientele list. You will have the opportunity to regularly call health care and C-level professionals to educate and support the promotional effort behind our innovative products.  Responsibilities · Responsible for executing all aspects of the sales process in terms of promoting our products directly to a sophisticated audience comprised of healthcare professionals, hospitals, laboratories, C-level executives and other untapped industry requiring diagnostic products. · Responsible for customer support and training, complaint handling, and collections. Ensure customer service standards are high and continuously over delivers to boost client success and loyalty. · Responsible for representing Lochness Medical as a leader in our industry and market place. · Be able to manage a profitable, cost-conscious business including appropriate work expenses, price negotiations, and contracts. · Maintain a strong technical knowledge of products and territory trends · Self-motivated and autonomy- creating efficient route plans and weekly schedules to achieve pre-set sales objectives and commitments. · Fosters and emulates a supportive company culture, and motivational environment for top performers to excel. · Develop and maintain partnership relationships across multiple industries to foster growth and long term sustainability.  Job Expectations · Needs to be prepared to spend up to 90% of time in the field with customers and sales professionals. · Overnight travel up to 20% · Would need a personal car to transport product inventory and travel to support customers · Daily communication with manager  · Learns from set-backs and develops tactics and strategies to minimize recurrence. · Team player- takes initiative to concisely and regularly communicate with Senior Sales Manager, fellow Territory Managers, and C-Level Executives. · Organized, positive, proactive, intellectually curious, self-motivated, enthusiastic, interpersonal skills and using appropriate language. · Thrive in a fast-paced environment developing relationships with multiple individuals on a daily basis.  What We Offer ·  Salary + Uncapped new and residual commissions on existing and new accounts (1st Year OTE $75K-$95K, 2nd Year OTE $110K-$130K, 3rd Year OTE $150K+) · Monthly bonus package · 401K · Health, vision and dental insurance coverage  · Hands-on training with Senior Sales Manager(s) · Coaching and sales education training daily · Travel Allowances · Team Competitions · Reimbursement per mile driven · Marketing & Conference opportunities · Corporate Retreats and Travel Opportunities  Ideal Candidate · Superior professionalism and charisma · Attention to detail   · Creative approach to problem solving · A ceaseless drive to excel and succeed · Ability to learn and adapt quickly in a dynamic market · Effective listening and presentation skills · Intellectual curiosity and confidence · Able to work remotely, autonomously and be a self-starter · Practicality and the ability to “think on your feet” · Organizational skills · Natural born leader  Required Qualifications  · 1-5 years of sales experience · Bachelors Degree from an Accredited University · Personal Car and Driver's License   Preferred Qualifications  · Roles or experience in a competitive environment (Sports, clubs, volunteering, etc.) · Involvement within the community
