description: Looking for ambitious individuals who are looking to join a high paced / high growth team.  Responsibilities Drive top-of-the-funnel lead generation for account executives and sales managers A lot of cold calling and cold emailing. Update and manage all sales activities, opportunities, and account information in CRM Consistently achieve monthly quota of qualified opportunities  Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Business or a related field At least 1 - 2 years' of relevant work experience Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to multi-task, organize, and prioritize work

TITLE: Representative, Inside Sales  DEPARTMENT: Membership Sales  REPORTS TO: Manager, Inside Sales  SUPERVISES: N/A  STATUS: Full-Time, Non-Exempt  Job Summary  The Representative, Inside Sales is primarily responsible for making outbound phone calls to fans and local businesses while using keen customer service skills in an effort to set up customer appointments at Petco Park to reach sales goals.  Duties & Responsibilities Reports daily to Managers, Inside Sales. Makes 75+ telephone sales calls per shift from provided lead lists and active prospecting to set up face to face appointments at Petco Park. Provides top-notch customer service to callers from our main ticket line as well as maximizes sales from this source. Utilizes CRM for contact management, sales pipeline tracking and ensure all record keeping is timely and accurate. Represents the Padres in the most positive way on game days when interacting with clients and prospects at Padres sales tables or at their seats. Additional responsibilities as assigned by the Manager, Inside Sales. JOB REQUIREMENTS: Must meet the following minimum requirements: College degree required or equivalent experience. A strong desire to start a career with a team that has ample opportunity for growth. Must possess a strong commitment to the sports industry, a passion for sales, a strong work ethic, competitiveness, a positive team first attitude, and a thirst to learn. Individuals must be self-starters and comfortable making cold calls. Individuals must be proficient in Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, and Outlook. Fluently bilingual in English/Spanish a plus. As a condition of employment, the job candidate(s) must provide proof of current COVID vaccination and successfully complete a post-offer, pre-employment background check and drug screening. The San Diego Padres are an Equal Opportunity Employer.
industries: Nonprofit Organization Management, Entertainment, and Hospitality

description: We are seeking an experienced, self-motivated and organized individual as a field sales representative who will maintain and grow existing accounts and bring in new referral business with Physicians, and healthcare institutions.  The successful candidate will have a history in Medical Sales building strong relationships with Physicians and their staff!!  The majority of your time will be spent calling on Physician’s offices, developing new sources of patient referrals, conducting lunch and learns, breakfasts and furthering the company brand and value to our Physician partners and their staff.  Staying abreast of the sleep industry and a diligence to participate in constant updates and company training should be important to you as a Medical Sales Professional.  What We Are Looking For At least two years of Medical Sales Experience. Driven attitude with competitive background Existing relationships with PCP's, ENT's, and/or Cardiologists. Good Communication skills Successful track record Compensation Package includes Base Salary, Uncapped commissions, Car Allowance, Entertainment Budget, and competitive Benefit Package.
industries: Medical Devices, Insurance, and Hospital & Health Care

description: Why join us  Brex is reimagining financial systems so every growing company can realize their full potential. As the financial OS, we’re building software and services in one place—disrupting long-entrenched institutions with products and experiences that better serve the ambitions of our customers.  Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We’re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.  Sales at Brex  The Sales team is the driving factor behind revenue for Brex. Every member of our team directly affects our bottom line. We focus on generating new opportunities, acquiring new customers, and building even stronger relationships with our current customers. We have a unified culture recognizing big wins daily and celebrating individual accomplishments weekly and monthly. We make sure that top performers are recognized and have built a competitive environment to keep the team motivated and unified.  What You’ll Do  As a Sales Development Representative, you will be responsible for prospecting and identifying new customers for Brex. You will partner with Account Executives to help startups understand the value of Brex as a corporate credit card and the rewards that it provides fast growing companies. We’re building a team from the ground up that will require a “whatever it takes,” attitude, a high sense of urgency, and a passion for sales. As an SDR at Brex, you will have the opportunity to help create processes and build pipelines for $1 million deals immediately. The opportunity to start your sales career at a unicorn start up and grow your career into an AE and beyond!  Responsibilities Identify growing startups and tech companies that would value from Brex Prospect companies that are growing and spending; educate them on our modern corporate card built just for startups. No personal guarantee on the MasterCard network with embedded expense management software! Navigate through a conversation flow to uncover business needs, understand pains, and position Brex as a compelling solution. Maintain and update an accurate log of activity in the CRM system Use email to correspond with leads to follow up and/or to confirm appointments Provide feedback to others in department related to information prospects share that could be helpful in advertising/marketing as well as our overall programs Requirements 1+ years of experience in a phone sales role OR a driven and eager to learn new grad who thrives in fast paced, constantly-changing environments The ability to proactively engage new clients through email and phone A high sense of urgency that can adapt and pivot in every conversation The skills to passionately and clearly articulate the value of Brex A team-player attitude with a desire to improve internal processes beyond your day-to-day tasks A desire to learn, grow, and get in on the ground floor of a unicorn startup while launching your career in sales Bonus points SaaS or B2B experience Experience with Salesforce, Outreach, and/or ZoomInfo
industries: Computer Software, Internet, and Financial Services

description: Job Title: Regional Sales Associate    Department: Sales (South-Central) Territory: North Texas, North Louisiana, Oklahoma Location: The person who fills this position should live in the North Texas area, preferably in or between Waco and Dallas-Fort Worth             Reports To: North Texas Regional Sales Manager  Position Mission: The mission of the South-Central Regional Sales Associate is to drive sales activity in North Texas, North Louisiana, and Oklahoma. This position will be responsible for building sales, awareness, and loyalty of Stego products to the design community and construction industry.   Primary Responsibilities: Oversee and assist territory with a business manager mindset Develop consultative relationships with architects, specifiers, engineers, builders, general contractors, concrete contractors, distributors, and owners to educate them on the benefits of Stego product lines Collaborate with design professionals to develop specifications Conduct educational seminars, including AIA CEU courses with target audiences Utilize CRM (Salesforce) to document sales efforts and maximize efficiency  Knowledge/Skills/Abilities Required: Proven ability to be a self-starter and driven to succeed in assigned territory Strong analytical, problem-solving, negotiation, and presentation skills Demonstratable ability to integrate and excel in a team-oriented environment Excellent verbal and written communication skills, strong interpersonal skills, and time management skills Ability to display architectural specification and consultative selling skills Proficient in the use of Microsoft applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, etc.) Ability to work productively from a home office within the designated territory, preferably in the North Texas area Willingness to travel within the designated territory—overnight travel is required and may be up to 40% of the time  Education Preferred:  Bachelor’s degree in business or related field  Compensation: The salary range for this position is $45,000 - $70,000 per year depending on the level of experience, skill, and value being brought to the role. Additionally, Stego offers many great benefits - medical, dental, vision, wellness, life insurance, 401k, bonus programs, incentive programs, flexibility, paid vacation and sick time, employee experience perks, etc.  What to Expect for the Hiring Process: It is vastly important for Stego to be thorough in our vetting and interview process to make sure the position is the right fit for both parties.  If your application is selected to move forward, the first step prior to a phone interview will be to submit a video introduction through LinkedIn's video platform. You will be asked to respond to the following 2 prompts: (1) Tell me about yourself, (2) Why do you want to work here [at Stego Industries, LLC]?.  Following the vetting of the video introductions, you may be invited for a phone or video interview with our North Texas Regional Manager. As you move through the hiring process, you'll be invited to interview with several Stego team members. Pending COVID-19 regulations and safety considerations, the final interview stage may be done in person.  Please note that it may take up to a few weeks of vetting and narrowing down candidates before we begin the formal interview process. We appreciate your understanding and patience, and we will endeavor to respect your time and investment as much as possible.

Company Info  Teva is a global pharmaceutical leader and the world's largest generic medicines producer, committed to improving health and increasing access to quality health solutions worldwide. Our employees are at the core of our success, with colleagues in over 80 countries delivering the world's largest medicine cabinet to 200 million people every day. We offer a uniquely diverse portfolio of products and solutions for patients and we've built a promising pipeline centered around our core therapeutic areas. We are continually developing patient-centric solutions and significantly growing both our generic and specialty medicines business through investment in research and development, marketing, business development and innovation. This is how we improve health and enable people to live better, healthier lives. Join us on our journey of growth!  Job Description  Teva is searching for a Sales Representative to join our Neuroscience sales team in the Clearwater, FL area! The role of the Sales Representative delivers results by getting it done together in a compliant and ethical manner. The Sales Representative possesses an understanding of organizational objectives and aligns resources appropriately to meet those objectives. While in pursuit of goal achievement, this person upholds the culture and values of Teva in all interactions and business matters. The Sales Representative effectively and appropriately analyzes trends and applies knowledge in customer interactions in order to deliver value. Additionally, the Sales Representative effectively and efficiently plans and completes all business activities via aligned objectives, analytics, and maximizing available resources. The Sales Representative builds and effectively maintains strong, mutually beneficial networks/relationships with both internal and external stakeholders. The Sales Representative possesses impactful and influential communication and presentation skills and keeps the goal in mind while moving the customer towards the solution.  In This Role You Will Build rapport and relationships by interacting effectively with employees and external contacts (i.e., HCP and office staff) at all levels, demonstrating the awareness of their needs and responding with the appropriate action Provide healthcare product demonstrations, physician detailing and in-servicing of products to current and potential customers Consult with physicians, nurses, as well as medical office staff to appropriately promote product and provide product and patient education Regularly review and analyze all available sales data in order to create effective territory plans and utilize promotional budget funds Maintain a call average as outlined in the sales plan, defined as face-to-face interactions, with healthcare providers focusing on top target customers Apply a range of traditional and non-traditional problem-solving techniques to think through and solve issues creatively to improve performance and company effectiveness Adhere to all Teva’s compliance policies and guidelines Achieve all sales performance goals and objectives for geographical assignment Current Territory Boundaries Include North- Spring Hill, FL East- Brooksville, FL South- St. Petersburg, FL West- Clearwater, FL Qualifications Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in related field A minimum of 3 years pharmaceutical sales experience required Level of the role will be commensurate to years of experience and performance criteria Proven record of accomplishments in this specific market toward meeting established objectives Well-developed written and oral communication skills Ability to interact with HCPs in both face-to-face and virtual environments, and be proficient with technology Demonstrated leadership and interpersonal skills Knowledge of reimbursement, managed care, or marketing preferred New product launch experience preferred Broad therapeutic area experience in CNS preferred Candidate must be able to successfully pass background, motor and drug screening Ability to travel as required, which may include overnight and/or weekend travel Valid US driver’s license and acceptable driving record required Occasional lifting of up to 20 pounds Teva Pharmaceuticals USA, Inc. requires all U.S. new hires to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 (unless an accommodation is legally required) prior to the first day of Teva employment. As required by applicable law, however, Teva will consider requests for reasonable accommodations.  Additionally, U.S. new hires for customer facing roles will be required to complete all credentialing requirements for access to their customers’ targets within 60 days of their start date. Such credentialing requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional vaccinations and medical testing. Any request for an exception to the credentialing requirements will need to be approved by the national sales leader within the first 60 days of employment.  Function  Sales  Sub Function  Medical Representation  Reports To  In process of validation  Already Working @TEVA?  If you are a current Teva employee, please apply using the internal career site available on "Employee Central". By doing so, your application will be treated with priority. You will also be able to see opportunities that are open exclusively to Teva employees. Use the following link to search and apply: Internal Career Site  The internal career site is available from your home network as well. If you have trouble accessing your EC account, please contact your local HR/IT partner. description: Grow with us! Wefivesoft LLC is looking to hire a sales associate to be a vital member of the US team.  Wefivesoft LLC is a rapidly growing software technology company that was founded to design and build innovative Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) products. MarkersPro, our Student Information System (SIS), is built to be very intuitive to use, quickly customizable, easy to integrate, cost-effective to manage, and easily adopted.   Our team is purposely comprised of leaders, engineers, and thinkers who are determined to make a positive impact in the everyday lives of schools, students and families through better software. We value and instill diversity, teamwork, innovation, passion, quality, simplicity, and respect in everything that we do while delivering upon this company mission. At Wefivesoft, you will have the opportunity and support to innovate and make a meaningful difference in the work you will do with our team and our users.  Job Responsibilities Learn to effectively communicate key product features and benefits. Develop a keen understanding of K-12 school needs and values in order to provide personalized calls and product demonstrations. Keep up-to-date on K-12 market trends. Research potential school leads. Provide support for all stages of the sales cycle. Ensure timely processing of leads. Conduct outbound calls. Assist with sales campaigns. Record all communication and outreach to schools in our CRM.  Job Requirements Desire to learn and grow with a K-12 education technology company Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience Excellent verbal and written communication skills Ability to learn product quickly and accurately Must be able to travel roughly 30% of the time  Compensation and Benefits Competitive salary Competitive Health, Dental and Vision Insurance 401K Paid Leave

Sales Development Representative Summit Hosting Charlotte, NC, USA 100% Remote Benefits Offered  401K, Dental, Life, Medical, Vision Employment Type  Full-Time Why Work Here? “We are a growing cloud-based software hosting provider and looking for a skilled SDR to join our team.” Summit Hosting is a fast-growing cloud-based software hosting provider. We are looking for a Sales Development Representative to join our sales team. This is a remote work opportunity. Responsibilities: Utilize CRM to manage your sales pipe from a start-to-close buying cycle. Work with a Sales and Marketing team to contribute creative ideas on how to generate more leads. Identify prospect's needs and suggest appropriate products/services Build long-term trusting relationships with prospects to qualify leads as sales opportunities Track your sales statistics, forecast, and report them to your Sales Manager on a weekly basis. Take advantage of Summit’s lead generation tools to create outbound sales opportunities. Conduct video conference and demo calls with clients to pitch Summit’s product Actively looking for new sales opportunities in the market Consistently meet or exceed Sales goals. Act as a technical project manager to provide a solution for the client Required Skills and Qualifications: Experience within a results-driven company Creative, outside-the-box thinker Ability to be coached and to receive constructive feedback Competitive drive, passionate, motivated, and holds themselves to a higher standard. Strong technical background with server/network infrastructure experience. Not afraid to speak up and apply ideas to improve the Sales process Can work independently at times while others work closely with a team. Bachelor’s degree or appropriate technical certifications required 2-3 years of sales experience, with a history of exceeding lead targets Strong communication skills via phone and email Proven creative problem-solving approach and strong analytical skills Time management efficiency Nice-to-have Strengths: ZenDesk Sell, ZenDesk Support, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, and Outreach experience SQL Server knowledge Cloud hosting industry awareness QuickBooks and Sage exposure Understanding of MS Office licensing   About Summit Hosting: https://www.summithosting.com

We are seeking an experienced, self-motivated and organized individual as a field sales representative who will maintain and grow existing accounts and bring in new referral business with Physicians, and healthcare institutions.  The successful candidate will have a history in Medical Sales building strong relationships with Physicians and their staff!!  The majority of your time will be spent calling on Physician’s offices, developing new sources of patient referrals, conducting lunch and learns, breakfasts and furthering the company brand and value to our Physician partners and their staff.  Staying abreast of the sleep industry and a diligence to participate in constant updates and company training should be important to you as a Medical Sales Professional.  What We Are Looking For At least two years of Medical Sales Experience. Driven attitude with competitive background Existing relationships with PCP's, ENT's, and/or Cardiologists. Good Communication skills Successful track record Compensation Package includes Base Salary, Uncapped commissions, Car Allowance, Entertainment Budget, and competitive Benefit Package.

description: Launched in 2000, Eight Eleven Group committed to 100% organic growth, exclusively promoting from within, while always keeping culture and growth opportunity at the forefront of the business model. What began as a two-person Indianapolis startup, Eight Eleven Group has rapidly expanded to become a market-leading organization within one of the fastest growing industries today: Consulting and Professional Services.   In 2012, Medasource was established to provide niche services exclusively in the Healthcare industry, including these practice areas: Providers, Payers, Government, and Life Sciences (pharma, device, diagnostic, clinical research, commercial labs, consumer goods, food sciences, chemicals, agriculture, and environmental sciences). Our team takes a consultative, solution-driven approach with Fortune 500 and enterprise non-profit clients to help them deliver and execute complex capital and operational projects. We are not just in the business of professional services - we are in the business of making a meaningful and authentic impact both internally with our high-performing team and externally with our clients and consultants.   RESPONSIBILITIES  Associate Account Executives are enrolled in a comprehensive outside B2B Sales Training Program focused on learning how to take a solution-driven, approach to selling consulting and professional services. Once you complete training, 80% of your time will be spent in front of customer decision makers to build partnerships, pipeline opportunities, and secure win-win engagements with our clients. Here are the primary drivers for success in this role:  Strategically identify opportunities and pursuits in 3-5 designated target accounts  Build and sustain long-lasting relationships with new and existing clients within your assigned accounts through onsite client meetings, presentations, and outings such as ball games, dinners, golf, etc.  Consult with clients to create solutions that help drive change and successful projects within their organization that deliver positive outcomes  Act as a client advocate with a focus on improving the experience of our Fortune 500 target accounts  Presenting to C-suite executives and championing solutions for their project roadmap  Continue to meet and exceed target sales goals  Set personal and team goals through frequent sprint sessions with your manager and sales support team   SALES TRAINING  Takes place at our Corporate Headquarters in Indianapolis  Led by Medasource’s President and top sales leaders  Formalized training geared toward our practice areas and core competencies in the healthcare industry  Role playing situational selling exercises and ride-alongs with senior account executives  Establishing your client portfolio  Fostering executive-level relationships    BENEFITS & PERKS  Base salary + uncapped commissions  Monthly smartphone stipend and car allowance  401k match program   Full health benefits (medical, dental, vision, and HSA)  All-expenses-paid Reward Trip each year for top producers and a guest  Expense budget for client entertainment  Eight Eleven’s BeGiving Program: 1 PTO day per quarter for service work/volunteering   Access to Eight Eleven University (internal personal and professional development program)   Top-notch training at every step in your career  Access to a personal financial concierge  Genuine, passionate, family-oriented culture   WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED  Competitive, motivated spirit and desire to succeed  Outstanding communication skills and innate ability to connect with people  Entrepreneurial spirit with desire to learn and grow   Results-driven and forward-thinking  Thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative, and positive work environment   Bachelor’s Degree
industries: Hospital & Health Care, Management Consulting, and Information Technology and Services

description: Responsibilities Own the sales process from qualifying inbound leads, leading product demos, follow-ups and closing sales. Develop new opportunities by up/cross-selling to existing member base. Reach quarterly sales targets through inbound and outbound sales. Attend relevant industry events (virtually) to learn more about our members and create new opportunities. Maintain strong, positive relationships with existing and prospective users.  Requirements One or more years of experience in sales, preferably in the app industry. Proven track record selling to enterprise customers. Bonus points if you've worked in SaaS, mobile, or led product demos. Experience working with CRM software. Excellent attention to detail. Strong presentation and written communication skills. 4-year degree or equivalent.  Benefits Great medical, dental, and vision insurance Strong 401(k) retirement plan Pre-tax transit benefits and subsidized gym memberships Plenty of paid time-off and work-from-home days Awesome workstation, multiple monitors, whatever you need to be happy and productive Fully stocked kitchen with a variety of snacks and drinks Whiskey Fridays  Job Type: Full-time Compensation: $50k - $70k per year (based on experience)

We are seeking candidates with an interest in advancing their career in sales, possess superior communication / interpersonal skills, can see the "bigger" picture, and most importantly demonstrate an enthusiasm in helping customers solve everyday challenges through the use of intelligent metadata leveraging Machine Learning and AI technologies.  Join us on this journey, and help build our success story!  What You'll Do:  Manage incoming leads as well as prospect new customers and nurture channel/partner relationships  Communicate with customers, determine customer needs, explain product functionality and benefits, create quotes, and close deals  Document all opportunities, activities, and pipeline in our CRM as changes occur  Meet regularly with product and development teams to stay current on enhancements and expand product knowledge  Be on the "front-lines", relay any information that may be of value to the team be it best practices, new features, competitive pressures, etc.  Hit and exceed sales targets  What You'll Need:  3-5+ years outbound sales experience (preferred) with quota accountability  Knowledge of Enterprise Cloud technology and SaaS solutions  Strong verbal and written communications skills  High technical aptitude and a desire to learn  Experience with managing accounts, opportunities, and activities in a CRM such as Salesforce.com  More About You:  Love working in a team environment  You can effectively communicate with all business prospects and team members  You're an avid learner – our product and industry is always evolving, and your knowledge must evolve too!  You're a creative problem solver with a strong desire to make an impact at a disruptive technology company  You have a track record of success with a dedication to sales and customer satisfaction  You're a great listener, fearless, and eager to grow a career in the emerging machine learning and AI industry!

description: Coinbase has built the world's leading compliant cryptocurrency platform serving over 30 million accounts in more than 100 countries. With multiple successful products, and our vocal advocacy for blockchain technology, we have played a major part in mainstream awareness and adoption of cryptocurrency. We are proud to offer an entire suite of products that are helping build the cryptoeconomy and increase economic freedom around the world.  There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for signals that a candidate will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, disrupt ourselves, and expect sustained high performance because we play as a championship team. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people with the desire and capacity to build and share expertise in the frontier technologies of crypto and blockchain, in whatever way is most relevant to their role.  Sales Operations & Strategy is a cross-functional team, working primarily with the Institutional Sales, Trading, and Prime services business in Coinbase Institutional. Coinbase’s institutional clients are both “crypto-forward” and just getting into crypto. The team is a partner to commercial leadership at Coinbase, focusing on high-impact strategic and operational projects with our institutional client-facing sales and trading teams. For this particular role, the individual will work closely with our Coinbase Cloud offering to our institutional and crypto-native clients.  What You’ll Be Doing (ie. Job Duties) Drive strategic projects that enable commercial leaders to drive revenue opportunities. Establish go-to-market approaches and productivity enhancements. Define, manage, and provide insights on key performance metrics. Create and manage processes such as target setting, forecasting, and pipeline analytics. Analyze large amounts of information quickly and effectively to reduce complexity and make actionable recommendations for Coinbase. Work closely with sales systems and tooling teams, shaping the development and usage of our CRM and data visualization. What We Look For In You (ie. Job Requirements) 3+ years of experience in sales strategy & operations, management consulting, or business insights/analytics (role dependent upon experience level). Solid analytic, problem solving and interpersonal skills working with sales teams. Has experience working with large data sets. Exceptional prioritization and project management skills Passion to do whatever it takes to solve complex problems and build scalable processes. Comfort working in a high growth, constantly changing environment. Nice To Haves Strong interest in the crypto market. Experience working at a high growth startup / tech company. Experience with CRM systems. Commitment to Equal Opportunity  Coinbase is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other basis protected by applicable law. Coinbase will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. For US applicants, you may view Pay Transparency, Employee Rights and Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law notices by clicking on their corresponding links. Additionally, Coinbase participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law.  Coinbase is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations@ coinbase.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. For quick access to screen reading technology compatible with this site click here to download a free compatible screen reader (free step by step tutorial can be found here). Please contact accommodations@ coinbase.com for additional information or to request accommodations.  Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates and Applicants  Depending on your location, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) may regulate the way we manage the data of job applicants. Our full notice outlining how data will be processed as part of the application procedure for applicable locations is available here: Ireland/EU, United Kingdom, and California. By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Base Salary $40K - $45K, total comp at plan first year $80K - $120K. Uncapped commissions which makes your total comp the investment you put in the position.  Leading medical/surgical products distributor is seeking a full-time field sales representative for the South Miami and surrounding territory. This position requires an experienced sales person who can not only sell products but also recognize new opportunities with both new and existing customers. Preferred candidate would have a documented success history selling in the following areas: Operating room, inpatient pharmacy and/or compounding pharmacies, ambulatory surgery centers, and/or IV Therapy. The ideal candidate must be self-motivated and have a strong proven sales record with solid relationship skills.  The Company offers a Base salary, an uncapped commission program, defined and protected territories, approved expenses, mileage reimbursement, insurance benefits package and 401(k) matching. Your success will be measured by your ability to meet sales quotas, attract new accounts and build relationships. This is a phenomenal opportunity in the medical sales industry with an innovative and dynamic leading company. If you meet the above criteria and are looking for a new position with an outstanding organization, please apply as directed. Only qualified candidates meeting the above criteria will be notified.  The top reasons why the best reps want to work for Progressive Medical, Inc: A National Sales Team that is clinically prepared to support the needs of our clinical customers in any clinical environment. A National Account & Contract Team that understands the needs of Group Purchasing Organizations (GPOs) and Integrated Delivery Networks (IDNs) and how they play a significant role in the healthcare supply chain industry. A Customer Service Team that is second to none, fully staffed by Customers Service Specialists who personally answer every call, every time. Our Operations and Distribution Teams ensure our customers receive their product professionally and expediently. A Clinical Affairs Team that is available to answer questions and provide peer to peer training and support to our customers. Sales Education in collaboration with the Marketing Team provide extensive and continuous educational programs for not only our sales force, but the entire PMI organization. Our Marketing Team of professionals works in all aspects of both upstream and downstream marketing, from implementation to analysis, we understand how to take your product to market. Progressive Medical, Inc. is a leading distributor of specialty medical products throughout the United States. Our focus on innovative products helps clinicians to practice the highest quality care and increase safety, while also controlling overall costs in the areas of: surgery/anesthesia, interventional radiology, critical care and IV specialties.
industries: Medical Devices, Hospital & Health Care, and Pharmaceuticals

Your Role:  Prospect small and large business Conduct direct sales strategies Promote our clients Professionally represent our firm Interact with customers Initiate the sales cycle Assist with product purchases Track and report sales Coordinate territories Participate in classroom training  Qualifications:  0 - 3 years of experience in sales, restaurants, customer acquisition, or a related field Superior communication skills Professional and personable Ruthlessly determined to succeed Team oriented Ability to build quick relationships              Candidates with the following experience are encouraged to apply today: General Labor, Construction, Home Improvement, Labor, Labor and Development Operations, Field Construction, Telecom Construction, Construction Management or Construction Experience

description: INNOVEX is growing! We are seeking a dynamic, consultative, motivated sales professional! You will represent our company by managing the entire sales process to new and existing clients.  What We’re Looking For  The ideal candidate will be a self-starter who is has a passion for developing and growing strong business relationships. You will have 2+ years of work experience, ideally in the outside sales space.  What You’ll Do Provide state-of-the-art technology solutions to businesses in your assigned local territory Utilize the INNOVEX selling process by analyzing needs of the customer and develop and customized solutions Generate net new business and maintain long term relationships with existing customers Meeting forecasting objectives by a focused cadence to sales activity Maintain CRM with daily sales activities: phone calls, prospecting, appointments, assessments, demos, etc. How You’ll Be Measured  Our sales-driven organization loves to set goals and knock them down. With that being said, some metrics for this role will include: Monthly revenue quotas Daily and weekly activity goals Customer retention goals At INNOVEX, our mission is to provide powerful technology solutions and excellent customer service to help companies think, act and thrive without limitations.  Large or small, our clients want to grow. We provide the technology that helps get them there. We believe that by providing great products and even greater service, our company will continue to grow, too.  Our success is all due to the INNOVEX team. Every member is an important contributor. We’re a collaborative team that likes to have fun while getting the job done.  If you’re looking to join our team, please email Careers@INNOVEX.tech or apply to one of our jobs!  Come with your talent, stay for the satisfaction of a job done well.

description: Job Summary  Zimmer Biomet is a medical technology leader. Our team members are part of a company with a heritage of leadership, a focus on shaping the future, and a mission dedicated to alleviating pain and improving the quality of life for people around the world. We are offering a unique opportunity for people to join ZimVie, a new, independent publicly traded company we are creating through the planned spin-off of our Spine, Dental and Bone Healing businesses in 2022. Unlike most new companies, this one has established brands, customers and over $1B in annual revenue. We have a seasoned leadership team focused on building out an exciting future for ZimVie – we hope you’ll consider being a part of it!  As a Part Of The Application Process, Please Copy And Paste The Link Below In Your Browser  Your journey with Zimmer Biomet Dental starts here.  https://www.cindexinc.com/c/75627B  The survey will take 10 to 15 minutes to complete.  Principal Duties and Responsibilities  The responsibility of the Territory Sales Representative is to achieve or exceed Zimmer Biomet’s sales goals. This is achieved through developing relationships with existing and new customers, identifying and tailoring solutions to their needs, educating them on Zimmer Biomet Dental Products, and ensuring customer satisfaction within the assigned territory. The Territory Sales Representative is responsible for increasing sales in their assigned territory by working collaboratively with the ZBD Solutions Team to create differentiated value for your customers.  Expected Areas of Competence  These Include But Are Not Limited To The Following Drive sales growth and exceed assigned quota in the territory by acquiring new customers, and expanding sales with existing accounts through the sale of Zimmer Biomet Dental’s implant, restorative, digital and regenerative portfolios. Ensure the highest standards of patient safety through the proper use of Zimmer Biomet products. Prepare and implement a territory business plan by identifying, targeting and converting new business, as well as expand existing business. Plan, coordinate and execute local customer programs and events to drive sales, build brand loyalty, and ensure the proper use of Zimmer Biomet Dental products. Build strong relationships with surgeons, dentists, laboratories and office personnel. Strictly adhere to all laws and Zimmer Biomet policies and procedures regarding the interaction with HCP’s (Health Care Professionals), product handling and complaints, expense reporting, sales activities and training. Routinely use sales tools such as Salesforce CRM to effectively manage and plan sales activities. Regularly view reports to align sales opportunities with strategic plans to drive sales growth in assigned territory. Attend and represent Zimmer Biomet at customer events as required, including but not limited to local, regional and national trade shows. Collaborate with Marketing and Education teams to support the execution of product launches and new product sales strategies. Education/Experience Requirements Bachelor’s degree (Business or Health Science preferred) 2-3 minimum years of sales experience with a documented track record of overachievement B2B sales experience in health science preferred but not required Completed formal consultative sales training (PSS, Challenger, etc.) Travel Requirements  Up to 95% (predominantly by car)  Depending on territory, 0% to 20% overnight stays as well as air travel may be required.  Additional Information  As a Zimmer Biomet “ZimVie” team member, we want you to feel included, respected, empowered, and celebrated. This is why we offer competitive salaries and benefits, as well as employee recognition and career enrichment opportunities.  EOE/M/F/Vet/Disability
industries: Medical Devices, Financial Services, and Hospital & Health Care

description: Job brief As the Sales Development Representative of the Midwest, you obsess over sharing the great news about Spur with potential customers who need help rapidly responding to their hiring plans with long term, short term, on demand, surge labor, and recruitment support. You are responsible for the development of a sales pipeline through traditional and creative sales methods that foster relationships and human connectivity. Ultimately you seek to understand the needs of each potential customer and customize your consultative sales approach to nurture leads through a delightful sales experience. You will be responsible for planning, creating, and executing cost effective sales initiatives following one of Spur’s guiding principles of responsible frugality. Lastly, you are energetic, enthusiastic, and truly excited about Spur’s mission to power the progress of the hardworking. This position may require occasional travel. Remote work opportunity.  What you´ll do  Manage the research, planning, implementation, and evaluation of your specific sales initiatives and sales goals. Curate a strong pipeline of potential customers by completing a minimum of 250 touch points each week. Manage a sales pipeline, coordinate meetings, and curate creative drip campaigns by leveraging digital tactics such as LinkedIn, videos, and other social media to break through the clutter and nurture opportunities to close. Stay up-to-date on the latest trends in staffing and the new labor market. What you should already have  Passion for economic and workforce development + workforce strategy and technology. Superior time management and organizational skills + ability to meet deadlines. Exceptional writing and interpersonal communication skills. Proven ability to create beautiful, simple, creative and compelling sales content. Exceptional problem solving and critical thinking skills.  Compensation: Salary + Commissions. $50,000-$135,000/Year

Launched in 2000, Eight Eleven Group committed to 100% organic growth, exclusively promoting from within, while always keeping culture and growth opportunity at the forefront of the business model. What began as a two-person Indianapolis startup, Eight Eleven Group has rapidly expanded to become a market-leading organization within one of the fastest growing industries today: Consulting and Professional Services.   In 2012, Medasource was established to provide niche services exclusively in the Healthcare industry, including these practice areas: Providers, Payers, Government, and Life Sciences (pharma, device, diagnostic, clinical research, commercial labs, consumer goods, food sciences, chemicals, agriculture, and environmental sciences). Our team takes a consultative, solution-driven approach with Fortune 500 and enterprise non-profit clients to help them deliver and execute complex capital and operational projects. We are not just in the business of professional services - we are in the business of making a meaningful and authentic impact both internally with our high-performing team and externally with our clients and consultants.   RESPONSIBILITIES  Associate Account Executives are enrolled in a comprehensive outside B2B Sales Training Program focused on learning how to take a solution-driven, approach to selling consulting and professional services. Once you complete training, 80% of your time will be spent in front of customer decision makers to build partnerships, pipeline opportunities, and secure win-win engagements with our clients. Here are the primary drivers for success in this role:  Strategically identify opportunities and pursuits in 3-5 designated target accounts  Build and sustain long-lasting relationships with new and existing clients within your assigned accounts through onsite client meetings, presentations, and outings such as ball games, dinners, golf, etc.  Consult with clients to create solutions that help drive change and successful projects within their organization that deliver positive outcomes  Act as a client advocate with a focus on improving the experience of our Fortune 500 target accounts  Presenting to C-suite executives and championing solutions for their project roadmap  Continue to meet and exceed target sales goals  Set personal and team goals through frequent sprint sessions with your manager and sales support team   SALES TRAINING  Takes place at our Corporate Headquarters in Indianapolis  Led by Medasource’s President and top sales leaders  Formalized training geared toward our practice areas and core competencies in the healthcare industry  Role playing situational selling exercises and ride-alongs with senior account executives  Establishing your client portfolio  Fostering executive-level relationships    BENEFITS & PERKS  Base salary + uncapped commissions  Monthly smartphone stipend and car allowance  401k match program   Full health benefits (medical, dental, vision, and HSA)  All-expenses-paid Reward Trip each year for top producers and a guest  Expense budget for client entertainment  Eight Eleven’s BeGiving Program: 1 PTO day per quarter for service work/volunteering   Access to Eight Eleven University (internal personal and professional development program)   Top-notch training at every step in your career  Access to a personal financial concierge  Genuine, passionate, family-oriented culture   WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED  Competitive, motivated spirit and desire to succeed  Outstanding communication skills and innate ability to connect with people  Entrepreneurial spirit with desire to learn and grow   Results-driven and forward-thinking  Thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative, and positive work environment   Bachelor’s Degree
industries: Hospital & Health Care, Management Consulting, and Information Technology and Services

description: CardioDiagnostics is hiring Territory Sales Representatives in multiple locations (AZ, CA, FL, MD, PA, TX, MidWest) to expand access to its creative cloud-based Cardiac monitoring and remote patient monitoring (RPM) solutions. The company has pioneered a horizontally-integrated cardiovascular monitoring and management solution that takes the patient from symptoms onset, to diagnosis, to condition management.  The position requires 5+ years of experience in cardiology sales.  Your Key Responsibilities:  • Identify, build and develop professional relationships with cardiologists, electrophysiologists, hospital and clinic staff and administrators. • Train and support customers on using company products and services. • Drive appropriate utilization of products. • Apply expertise and knowledge of heart monitoring, the marketplace, applicable competitors, industry, and cross-functional activities/plans to anticipate and optimally manage business opportunities and challenges. • Provide relevant, thoughtful input to other commercial colleagues regarding strategic and tactical planning for territory, area, and region. • Develop and implement effective customer specific territory plans. Communicate insights to internal stakeholders. • Ensure optimal coverage of appropriate physician specialists based on opportunity and potential. • Understand fully the assigned customers’ product and business needs and work to meet those needs while adhering to company ethics and compliance standards.

Machine Health is the key to Global Productivity. We are on a mission to build a world where people can always rely on the machines that matter. We are all surrounded by machines and rely on them in everything we do - from the buildings in which we live and work, the goods that we consume, to the power and running water that we use. There is a significant cost and effort that goes into designing, manufacturing, installing and maintaining the machines that enable and support our daily lives.  Augury is making machines more reliable by combining two key shifts in the industry: artificial intelligence and the Internet of Things. The intersection of these trends allows Augury to provide machines with a mechanical nervous system and the awareness to optimize their own health, thereby accelerating human productivity and safety.  Augury is looking for a proactive, well-spoken and results driven Sales Development Representative (SDR) for a full time position located in New York City. This position will be remote until we open the office back up later this year. We’re looking for a hunter who has exceeded their previous quotas and possesses exceptional communication skills.  In this role, you’ll be the engine that powers our sales team by prospecting and generating opportunities. The SDR is often our customers’ first experience with Augury, so you need to be a people person who makes a great first impression.  This is a phenomenal opportunity to join our growing team as we rapidly grow our business internationally.  A Day In Your Life  You will be - above all else - an Augury expert, working in a dynamic start-up environment Develop your business acumen through exposure to various stages of enterprise sales cycles with Fortune 500 companies Have high impact engagements, develop new relationships and generate opportunities with key corporate level decision makers and influencers Understand specific product applications, recognize prospect pain points, and how Augury can solve them This key role is strategic in nature - it’s not about jumping online and contacting everyone you come across. Rather, it’s about considered, focused interactions that are unearthed through a high volume of personalized outbound activity (emails, cold calls, social touches) Perform thorough and accurate account research and stakeholder mapping to uncover key thought leaders and corporate initiatives Consistently achieve and/or exceed qualified opportunity quotas to ensure sales objectives  What You Bring  Undergraduate Degree 1-2 years experience in a customer facing role Remote working experience a plus Exceptional communication skills (verbal and written) Exceptional research skills Ability to work autonomously within a team Familiarity with sales processes Thirst for learning Motivation to Succeed  Perks  Comprehensive Medical Coverage 401k plan with matching Stock options Paid parental leave Commuter Benefits Phone Reimbursement  Augury is a people-first organization. We believe in fostering an inclusive environment in which employees feel encouraged to share their unique perspectives, leverage their strengths, and act authentically. We know that diverse teams are strong teams, and we welcome those from all backgrounds and varying experiences. We are committed to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. We believe that diversity is more than just good intentions, and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.  Augury is a proud equal opportunity employer, we strive to create a work environment in which everyone, all applicants, employees, customers, guests, and vendors feel safe and comfortable. We commit to maintain a workplace that is free of any type of harassment and does not tolerate anyone intimidating, humiliating, or hurting others. We prohibit willful discrimination based on age, gender, ethnicity, race, color, religion, political opinions, sexual orientation, sexual identity or expression, military or veteran status, disability or any other characteristic protected by law.
industries: Computer Software

description: Job description Position Overview: The ParaPRO pharmaceutical organization represents NATROBA (spinosad) Topical Suspension 0.9% w/w, currently the number #1 prescribed branded topical antiparasitic product in the market. Our Pharmaceutical Sales Representatives (PSR’s) are responsible for sales results and all sales activity within their individual assigned territories. This includes (but is not limited to) sales calls to Health Care Providers, (physicians, NP’s, PA’s, School Nurses, pharmacies), primary wholesaler inquiries and any medical professional (or organization), which may influence ParaPRO promoted product sales. The target audience for Natroba is dermatologist, general practitioners, and pediatricians. ParaPRO PSR’s are expected to make 40-65 unique office visits per week on prescribing health care professionals resulting in multiple calls within each group practice. General boundaries of the territory would encompass Atlanta. Candidate must live within 30 miles of the head quarter city. Major Duties and Responsibilities: A PSR is responsible for achieving assigned company sales goals and performing the following duties: Represent ParaPRO professionally, delivering sales presentations to HCP’s per ParaPRO’s SOPs and sales model training Develop and execute a business plan to maximum sales potential for assigned territory Successfully complete rigorous sales training program Build and maintain quality relations with assigned accounts Participation in national and regional Plan of Action Meetings/Product launches Vet and establish relationships with regional KOL’s Participation in tradeshow management as required by sales leadership (AAP, Etc.) Evaluate, modify and drive performance to increase prescription sales. Maintain updated, organized account files in assigned territory through contact management Complete and maintain sales report activity as defined by policy. Comply with all legal and regulatory requirements governing the sale and promotion of pharmaceutical products. Perform other related duties as assigned Qualifications/Skills/Requirements: College Degree (BS or higher) Candidates should possess a minimum of 2 years sales experience with a proven track record (pharmaceutical preferred) Must have valid state driver’s license & meet company insurability requirements Clearance company security and background check Must have a personal credit card to utilize for reimbursable expenses ParaPRO is a drug-free environment, company does pre-employment and annual random drug testing  Good problem identification, analysis and solving skills Strong computer and e-skills Must live within 30 miles of head quarter city, assigned territory Some overnight travel may be required Physician sales experience is a plus Able to lift packages of 25 pounds on a regular basis Knowledge of pharmaceutical terminology a plus Benefits Include Competitive annual compensation (base salary & target bonus) Expense account Comprehensive product and sales training Use of company iPad Company vehicle Cell phone allowance Internet allowance Health Insurance Life Insurance Dental/Vision Insurance 401(K) with 25% company matching Additional Profit sharing opportunity through 401(K) corporate contribution Access to medical/daycare pre-tax savings Access to short-term and long-term disability insurance Paid Vacation and Holidays

Aguardion is a Twin-cities based software-as-a-service (SaaS) company catering to the needs of county pretrial/probation agencies, community corrections, and private corrections contractors. Our innovative SaaS offerings help streamline fee collection, track equipment inventory and improve offender outcomes through greater transparency and reporting.  Since launching the software in 2016, Aguardion has experienced rapid growth and is looking to expand its sales team with the addition of a full-time, remote Sales Development Representative (SDR).  Job Summary: The SDR is responsible for identifying and developing new business opportunities in collaboration with Aguardion Account Executives, as well as providing support for marketing efforts. This role identifies suitable prospects, identifies the key decision makers and conveys the value of Aguardion’s offerings. As an innovative, software-as-a-Service (SaaS) platform aimed at upturning the case management industry, this role requires a ‘hunter’ mentality. Aguardion is looking for a Senior SDR that is interested in growing with us: the ideal candidate will be interested in eventually becoming an Account Executive or Marketing lead.  Essential Duties & Responsibilities: Identify prospective customers through a variety of channels Proactively contact prospects using a variety of prospecting tactics, including cold calling Place 20-50 outbound calls/emails per day Schedule five (5) sales demonstrations a week. Travel as needed for outside sales duties Attend trade shows & conferences as needed Maintain high levels of productive activity Document all sales activities in Zoho CRM Approximate weekly activity ratio: 60% prospecting communication (calls/emails), 25% marketing activities, 15% administration Design, plan and execute marketing projects Stay up-to-date on trends affecting pre-trial, probation, parole, and other relevant law enforcement topics. Ensure that all processes and procedures are completed, and quality standards are met Collaborate with co-workers as needed Identify potential avenues of new growth  Requirements: 1+ years of sales experience, ideally in lead generation or business development Digital marketing experience Proven ability to generate revenue and meet sales quotas Ability to work well in a high-energy, high growth startup environment SaaS sales required Excellent written and verbal communication skills Top-end organizational skills Organized, detail-oriented and able to work with limited direct supervision Proficient in Microsoft and Google Products Zoho CRM experience a plus Ability to work effectively in a team environment and also be self-directed  Education: Bachelor's degree or an equivalent combination of skills and experience  Benefits: Opportunity to work in a fast-paced, rapid growth SaaS business Competitive base + generous commission structure Competitive benefits: Health, Dental, Disability, IRA match  Aguardion is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Aguardion does not discriminate based on religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), age, status as a protected veteran, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. The Aguardion team celebrates diversity and strives to create an inclusive workplace for all employees.

Company Description  Qwick is changing the way people work. We connect food & beverage Professionals who want on-demand work with the businesses that need them through a technology-driven, app-based staffing platform. Our unique matching algorithm pairs top-rated, high quality Professionals with shifts that match their skillset. If you're eager to make a difference in the gig economy, love what you do, and lead with empathy and transparency, we would like to hear from you!  Our cultural values are an important part of who we are and what we're building: Free to be us - We embrace diversity within mindsets, ideas, race, culture, background, and the things that make us uniquely us. Hustle responsibly - We work hard and we make time to rest and play in order to stay our best. Stand up for what's right - We don't just do the right thing, but we hold others accountable to act with integrity as well. We are human - We act with compassion to take care of ourselves, our team, our families, our Business Partners, and our Professionals. Constantly curious - We seek knowledge from within and outside of Qwick and are continually learning through our successes and challenges. Never give up - We welcome change, celebrate failure, and always keep moving forward.  Role Overview  Do you love the thrill of the hunt? If so, this opportunity will allow you to identify and qualify new business accounts for established and new launch markets for Qwick. You will be an important resource that develops relationships with target businesses, acting as the initial point of contact. This role will be focused on 2 primary objectives: Researching target accounts in assigned territories to support your Business Develop Manager and signing up and onboarding SMB accounts in new launch markets. These will be accomplished by performing outreach through emails, calls, social media, and trade show attendance. You will also have to opportunity to be closely mentored and professionally developed by a high performing sales team.  You'll be a great fit if you like: Promoting and marketing business through creative and consistent communications Connecting with inbound prospective business customers, sharing our value proposition, onboarding businesses onto the Qwick platform and setting them up for success Conducting needs analyses with businesses, scheduling meetings for the Business Development team, and transitioning information about why the business is qualified Researching and evaluating leads Help as needed on special business development projects Working in a CRM and with other software technologies to achieve business tasks Working with a cross functional team of really smart people to collectively bring the best solutions to the customer Working in a fast-paced, transparent, and feedback driven environment that is constantly looking to improve Start-up environments  Requirements And Qualifications 1+ years of experience in an inside sales/SDR role Ability to demonstrate strong articulation of a product value proposition via phone and email Ability to accommodate sales functions including prospecting and research Bachelor's degree preferred Positive attitude with demonstrated ability to deal with rejection Strong oral and written communication skills; excellent listener Ability to develop relationships, influence others and maintain professional working relationships Tech savvy (This is a technology marketplace) Knowledge of working in a CRM, and using other software tools to accommodate daily requirements of the job to service business prospects Self motivated, tenacious, ability to work independently Based locally in Phoenix market  Full-Time Employee Benefits Include: Competitive pay + Employee Stock Option plan Work from home flexibility Medical, Dental, Vision Life Insurance + 401k Unlimited paid time off Paid family leave Employee support resources Short- and long-term disability benefits  Qwick is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class.  For more information on how Qwick uses your personal information, please view our Privacy Policy at https://www.qwick.com/privacy-policy/.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: About Us: Foodsmart is eating well made simple. We are the world’s largest telenutrition and foodcare solution, backed by a national network of Registered Dietitians and designed to yield consistently healthier food choices, lasting behavior change and long-term results. Foodsmart’s highly personalized, digital platform guides members through a personalized journey to eating well while saving them time and money. Foodsmart seamlessly integrates dietary assessments and nutrition counseling with online food ordering and cost-effective meal planning for the whole family that makes the most of ingredients at home and on the go. With national and regional retail partners across the US now accepting SNAP/EBT, Foodsmart helps bring healthier food within reach to eligible members and can also assist with SNAP enrollment.   About The Role: The SDR's role is to find and connect with key decision makers and stakeholders in the commercial and health insurance spaces and to qualify and set meetings for Account Executives. Additionally, your job is to set the account executive up for success on the call and to make sure to research the company and participants once a meeting is set. This job will require a mix of innovative and diverse outreach methods including cold calling, emailing, LinkedIn, and direct mail in order to reach our prospective customers. We are looking for people with creative and entrepreneurial spirits combined with focus and determination who can fill a pipeline and are ultimately interested in learning how to complete a sale from end to end.  Requirements: Excellent verbal, written, and listening skills and executive presence.  A history of demonstrated tenacity and creativity. The ability to map accounts and understand complex organization structures. The desire to learn healthcare and health insurance vocabulary. College degree or 4+ years relative experience. 1+ years of experience as a SDR/BDR  Desired Skills: Prior cold calling and prospecting experience. Familiarity with the health insurance and healthcare spaces. Experience and knowledge of healthy eating practices or experience working with registered dietitians. Prior experience using CRMs like Hubspot. Experience using email cadence software or sales acceleration tools like outreach.io, salesloft, or Hubspot  Benefits, Perks, & Other Details: Unlimited PTO Flexible working hours Location flexible Monthly wellness stipend (fitness equipment, gym reimbursements, etc.) Medical, vision, & dental insurance Stock options & 401K Salary- $80,000 OTE ($50K Base + $30K Incentive)  Why Foodsmart? Foodsmart is a mission-driven organization that creates fulfillment at the end of each day, knowing you are working towards helping people live healthier lives through nutrition. As a fast growing startup, there are significant opportunities for growth early on in your tenure. Besides competitive compensation, we offer many unique benefits, including unlimited PTO, flexible working hours, flexible working location, paid health insurance, monthly gym subsidies, and daily lunch allowances.  Foodsmart is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our firm policy to extend equal employment and advancement opportunity to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship status, religious creed, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth and/or breastfeeding), gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, marital status, disability (physical or mental) and/or a medical condition, genetic information, ancestry, veteran status or service in the uniformed services, and any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

description: Base Salary $40K - $45K, total comp at plan first year $80K - $120K. Uncapped commissions which makes your total comp the investment you put in the position.  Leading medical/surgical products distributor is seeking a full-time field sales representative for the West Virginia, West Pennsylvania, West Maryland and surrounding territory. This position requires an experienced sales person who can not only sell products but also recognize new opportunities with both new and existing customers. Preferred candidate would have a documented success history selling in the following areas: Operating room, inpatient pharmacy and/or compounding pharmacies, ambulatory surgery centers, and/or IV Therapy. The ideal candidate must be self-motivated and have a strong proven sales record with solid relationship skills.  The Company offers a Base salary, an uncapped commission program, defined and protected territories, approved expenses, mileage reimbursement, insurance benefits package and 401(k) matching. Your success will be measured by your ability to meet sales quotas, attract new accounts and build relationships. This is a phenomenal opportunity in the medical sales industry with an innovative and dynamic leading company. If you meet the above criteria and are looking for a new position with an outstanding organization, please apply as directed. Only qualified candidates meeting the above criteria will be notified.  The top reasons why the best reps want to work for Progressive Medical, Inc: A National Sales Team that is clinically prepared to support the needs of our clinical customers in any clinical environment. A National Account & Contract Team that understands the needs of Group Purchasing Organizations (GPOs) and Integrated Delivery Networks (IDNs) and how they play a significant role in the healthcare supply chain industry. A Customer Service Team that is second to none, fully staffed by Customers Service Specialists who personally answer every call, every time. Our Operations and Distribution Teams ensure our customers receive their product professionally and expediently. A Clinical Affairs Team that is available to answer questions and provide peer to peer training and support to our customers. Sales Education in collaboration with the Marketing Team provide extensive and continuous educational programs for not only our sales force, but the entire PMI organization. Our Marketing Team of professionals works in all aspects of both upstream and downstream marketing, from implementation to analysis, we understand how to take your product to market. Progressive Medical, Inc. is a leading distributor of specialty medical products throughout the United States. Our focus on innovative products helps clinicians to practice the highest quality care and increase safety, while also controlling overall costs in the areas of: surgery/anesthesia, interventional radiology, critical care and IV specialties.
industries: Medical Devices, Hospital & Health Care, and Pharmaceuticals

description: Do you love technology, finance, building customer relationships and a purpose driven Startup mentality? Look no further than the TH! We are looking for motivated, results-driven Sales Professionals seeking an exciting career opportunity to actively seek out and engage customer prospects on behalf of a pioneering FinTech company leading financial institutions to the next analytics frontier. Join us on our journey!  Responsibilities Present, promote and sell products / services using persuasive arguments to existing and prospective customers (THC SaaS Analytics) Perform cost-­benefit and needs analysis of existing / potential customers to meet their needs Establish, develop and maintain positive business and customer relationships Reach out to customer leads through introductory and cold calling Achieve agreed upon sales targets and outcomes within schedule Maintain and provide regular sales and status reports to company executives Maintain positive business relationships to ensure future sales Keep abreast of best practices and promotional trends Continuously improve through feedback  Requirements High energy and / or proven work experience as a Sales Professional Interest in and / or basic understanding of bank balance sheets Excellent knowledge of MS Office Ability to build productive business professional relationships Ability to travel frequently to develop relationships with existing clients and prospects Highly motivated and target driven with a proven interest and / or track record in Sales Excellent selling (marketing), communication and negotiation skills Prioritizing, time management and organizational skills Ability to create and deliver presentations tailored to audience needs Relationship management skills and openness to feedback

jobTitle: Global Sales Support – Premium Groups and Specialty - Associate Sales I, Minneapolis or Atlanta
description: Job Summary  Global Sales Support (GSS) is looking for Associates to support managed B2B leisure lines of business recently transitioned from Reservations. GSS Associates provide high value, differentiated customer service to Delta and Air France/KLM (JV) top Global Corporate and Agency accounts via phone, email, or chat, as well as proactive outbound communication in a contact center environment. Associates are responsible for providing program information, researching and resolving service failures, attending joint sales calls/customer events and supporting new sales programs, products, and services to help solidify Delta's and the JV's position in the marketplace.  Job Responsibilities Handle all aspects of managed B2B leisure bookings and servicing from beginning to end including domestic, international and JV group bookings, as well as ensuring contract compliance and optimizing revenue Work closely with HVC’s and premium managed accounts to build account loyalty Build and maintain strong customer relationships and negotiate effective business decisions that support Sales' global strategy and Delta's high-value accounts Provide accounts with information regarding contractual programs and guidelines Offer win-win customer-focused solutions to various travel-related issues Assist with authorized business travel exceptions Practice safety-conscious behaviors in all operational processes and procedures Where permitted by applicable law, must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire to be considered for U.S.-based job, if not currently employed by Delta Air Lines, Inc. 2 years equivalent work experience in a contact center, travel agency, customer service, or marketing/sales position Working knowledge of the following strongly preferred: Deltamatic, TGM, Tigre, and Kana Delta’s Specialty Sales products (domestic and international), including groups Experience with AF/KL policies and procedures Working knowledge of the following is a plus: Axis, DLTerm, and current GDS Travel agency industry policies and ticketing procedures Proficient PC skills, including use of Microsoft Office Suite Fluency in English as well as Spanish, Portuguese or French Must have excellent customer service skills and ability to make sound business decisions and apply creative problem-solving techniques Possess strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills and ability to work well with others in a team environment Demonstrate effective time management and organizational skills Must be a self-starter and able to multi-task Must be willing to work a rotating schedule each week Must be willing and able to travel occasionally Bachelor's degree preferred

description: Job Title: Business Development Representative Reporting to: Director of Global Marketing Location: East Coast, USA (Remote based) Basic Salary: $55,000 + Comms + Benefits Immediate Start  Minimum of 2 years of sales development or telemarketing/teleprospecting experience, within Reg Tech, SaaS, B2B, AML, Fintech.  About our client Our client is a multi-award winning, global Fintech and Regtech disruptor with an almost vertical trajectory of growth. Heavily-backed financially, as part of their continued scaling operations, they are now seeking a smart, hard-working and diligent business development executive to help drive them onto the next phase of growth.  The ideal candidate As a member of our clients' Marketing team, you will play a meaningful role in the Marketing department. You will be a representative of our brand by being the first point of contact with potential customers. You will be also responsible for outbound prospecting into potential customers and also potentially growing our footprint within existing accounts where required. You will support the marketing and sales teams in building pipeline.  This is a phenomenal opportunity for a high-energy, motivated, and organized team member. This role will allow you to gain exposure to all aspects of a marketing and sales cycle and the ability to have a hand in some of the hottest opportunities we work on, in a fast-paced, high-volume environment.  Responsibilities Articulate the business value proposition to assess buying interest Research accounts, identify key players and generate interest to stimulate opportunity Conduct high level conversations with senior level executives Manage and nurture leads and territory in HubSpot through to SQL, collaborating with Sales on key lead stages. Preferred qualification – ACAMS certified Tech Savvy Endlessly curious - you love asking questions and learning Fearless attitude - proven track record at achieving measurable goals Ability to work in a time-sensitive and high-volume environment Experience using Hubspot or Salesforce, or similar preferred Team player - working with the Marketing team to develop a territory plan  Job Perks Opportunity to work on market leading AI and Analytics products for Global Markets Opportunity to innovate, Learn and Grow Attractive variable compensation package Flexible working hours - everything is results-oriented Opportunity to work with an award-winning organization in the hottest space in tech - artificial intelligence and advanced machine learning
