Expectations: Identify and generate leads via cold calling, email, LinkedIn and more Introduce BAD ACE brand and its products to his/her existing accounts - Online / offline retail and distributors Work closely with BAD ACE internal team to fulfill orders and track payment Report to VP of sales on a weekly call  Requirements: 2+ years experience in sales / account management / business development Strong communication skills – written, verbal, presentation Team player who can quickly understand the team dynamic  Compensation: 100% sales commission only (industry standard)

About Huckleberry Huckleberry is rebuilding small business insurance from the ground up. In a multi-trillion dollar industry where paper forms and fax machines still predominate, and customers are wasting countless hours navigating byzantine processes, we provide small business owners with the capability to manage all of their insurance needs through a single, elegant interface. Our team is rethinking every aspect of the experience, from pricing, to underwriting to claims. We're backed by Tribe Capital, Uncork Capital, Crosslink Capital, e.ventures, Postmates CEO Bastian Lehman, Apartment List CEO John Kobs, and several others.  The Role We are seeking driven, motivated Sales Development Representatives (SDRs) to help our team connect with prospective clients through a best in class experience. The SDR will support our Sales Team’s goals by being the first point of contact for clients who apply for a quote through Huckleberry. You’ll proactively reach out to the client to collect information about the ins and outs of their business so we can provide them with the coverage they need at the best price possible. We’re looking for someone who thrives as a team player, has exemplary communication and listening skills, and who loves creating a delightful experience for clients.   Responsibilities:  Review inbound customer applications/requests for quotes.  Serve as a first point of contact and introduce prospective clients to the Huckleberry sales process.  Follow up with customers to gather additional information needed for a complete application.  Collaborate across functional areas when it comes to process improvement ideas and implementing new processes.  Uphold service level agreements and a fast, efficient customer experience through a balance of diligence and speed.   Requirements: Ability to use computers efficiently and effectively with an emphasis on modern office tools such as MS Office Suite and G Suite Exemplary interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills Ability to work efficiently against deadlines Strong work ethic and ability to maintain focus Team player and problem solver Some experience in a sales or customer support role is helpful  Why you’ll love working at Huckleberry:  Comprehensive medical, dental and vision insurance with 95% of premiums paid for by Huckleberry Flexible Spending Account and 401k Commuter benefits Paid maternity and paternity leave Company-sponsored happy hours and outings
industries: Insurance

description: About the Company:  VOZ is an ethical luxury fashion company with a mission to protect the livelihoods, well-being, and cultural values of rural indigenous women. Voz collaborates with artisans located in both Chile and Peru, and continues to value partnerships with talented designers across the Americas.  We are seeking an outgoing individual with exceptional organizational skills and an understanding of the fashion market. In this position, you will have the opportunity to learn directly from the CEO, manage important company tasks, and help grow our wholesale/d2c business. You will be important to the growth of the VOZ community, and as such you value finding creative solutions and efficiency.  VOZ is a certified bcorporation with a commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion. The Sales and E-commerce Coordinator will be responsible for:  - Maintaining the company’s ecommerce presence across platforms, including Shopify, Farfetch, Garmentory, and Maison de Mode - Fulfilling orders received directly from consumers, including packaging and shipping items - Responding to communications received from customers in a client-focused manner - Managing and organizing product inventory - Frequently updating our internal systems to reflect current data around sales and ecommerce - Update website content with new marketing assets and product offerings - Manage company calendars, assist in scheduling meetings and organize files as requested - Assisting the CEO with trade-shows and showroom appointments - Track all merchandise and samples that enters and leaves the store - Communicating with stylists and clients about shipments  Key Requirements: - Strong excel skills. - Luxury fashion retail experience and high-end customer service, working with customers in a positive, friendly, and equitable manner - Proven work experience with retail sales and/or marketing, with a noted interest in fashion and social impact preferred - Strong time-management capabilities with the ability to multitask in a detail-oriented manner under tight deadlines - Experience with social media, and an innate interest in keeping track of the newest social media trends and functionalities - Availability and flexibility to work days, nights, weekends and holidays as needed to support the business - Ability to speak and read Spanish a plus but not requirement Compensation depends on experience.  To apply, please email a resume and brief cover letter to careers@madebyvoz.com detailing skills and why you would be a perfect fit for this position.

Coinbase has built the world's leading compliant cryptocurrency platform serving over 30 million accounts in more than 100 countries. With multiple successful products, and our vocal advocacy for blockchain technology, we have played a major part in mainstream awareness and adoption of cryptocurrency. We are proud to offer an entire suite of products that are helping build the cryptoeconomy and increase economic freedom around the world.  There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for signals that a candidate will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, disrupt ourselves, and expect sustained high performance because we play as a championship team. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people with the desire and capacity to build and share expertise in the frontier technologies of crypto and blockchain, in whatever way is most relevant to their role.  Sales Operations & Strategy is a cross-functional team, working primarily with the Institutional Sales, Trading, and Prime services business in Coinbase Institutional. Coinbase’s institutional clients are both “crypto-forward” and just getting into crypto. The team is a partner to commercial leadership at Coinbase, focusing on high-impact strategic and operational projects with our institutional client-facing sales and trading teams. For this particular role, the individual will work closely with our Coinbase Cloud offering to our institutional and crypto-native clients.  What You’ll Be Doing (ie. Job Duties) Drive strategic projects that enable commercial leaders to drive revenue opportunities. Establish go-to-market approaches and productivity enhancements. Define, manage, and provide insights on key performance metrics. Create and manage processes such as target setting, forecasting, and pipeline analytics. Analyze large amounts of information quickly and effectively to reduce complexity and make actionable recommendations for Coinbase. Work closely with sales systems and tooling teams, shaping the development and usage of our CRM and data visualization. What We Look For In You (ie. Job Requirements) 3+ years of experience in sales strategy & operations, management consulting, or business insights/analytics (role dependent upon experience level). Solid analytic, problem solving and interpersonal skills working with sales teams. Has experience working with large data sets. Exceptional prioritization and project management skills Passion to do whatever it takes to solve complex problems and build scalable processes. Comfort working in a high growth, constantly changing environment. Nice To Haves Strong interest in the crypto market. Experience working at a high growth startup / tech company. Experience with CRM systems. Commitment to Equal Opportunity  Coinbase is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other basis protected by applicable law. Coinbase will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. For US applicants, you may view Pay Transparency, Employee Rights and Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law notices by clicking on their corresponding links. Additionally, Coinbase participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law.  Coinbase is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations@ coinbase.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. For quick access to screen reading technology compatible with this site click here to download a free compatible screen reader (free step by step tutorial can be found here). Please contact accommodations@ coinbase.com for additional information or to request accommodations.  Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates and Applicants  Depending on your location, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) may regulate the way we manage the data of job applicants. Our full notice outlining how data will be processed as part of the application procedure for applicable locations is available here: Ireland/EU, United Kingdom, and California. By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: SalesLeads is growing rapidly and looking for Sales Development Representatives. We are looking for competitive, coachable, and smart individuals with prior experience in B2B business development.   SalesLeads helps industrial and manufacturing suppliers find new customers and win more business. We do this through 3 unique, but complementary offerings:  Outsourced Prospecting Services Industrial Marketing Intelligence Software Product Custom Data and Lead Generation Solutions   At SalesLeads, we’re not babysitters. We hire motivated self-starters with previous B2B business development experience.  Freedom & responsibility go hand in hand at SalesLeads. We have proven systems that work and a team to support your efforts.   Our company culture is exceptional because our team is made up of people who care about your professional and personal development within our organization. We are competitive, smart, and hungry to make our clients successful.   What does a Sales Development Representative(SDR) do?  Prospect for new business opportunities for our outsourced prospecting clients. Maintain multiple client relationships by generating leads, qualifying opportunities, and managing the sales pipeline.  Essential duties of our SDRs include the following:   Initiate high-volume outbound phone and email campaigns Pipeline management  Execute the long-term nurturing process Ability to gain a thorough understanding of each client’s requirements, value proposition, services offerings, and long-term goals Achieve sales opportunity targets and ensure client satisfaction    Other things we look for include:    Prior B2B sales development/business development experience Highly motivated and target driven with a proven track development new pipeline Excellent communication and fundamental selling skills Present, promote products/services to prospective customers Establish, develop and maintain positive business relationships Supply management with reports on customer needs, problems, interests, competitive activities, and potential for new products and services. Familiarity with CRM systems and processes Prioritizing, time management and organizational skills BS/BA degree or equivalent

description: Who We Are:  GlassView's mission is to drive performance through video advertising. We work with over 80 of the top Fortune 100 Global Brands, offering access to over 1.6 billion unique users worldwide, and over 280 million unique users in the United States, reaching 98% of the connected country.   Through emotion based targeting and optimization, high frequency trading (GlassView QuickDraw™) & delivery across connected devices, GlassView is best known for the performance (tangible ROI) it provides its clients.   Just recently, Deloitte ranked GlassView as the number one fastest-growing video company, the third-fastest growing company in the media category, and as the 97th fastest-growing company in North America on Deloitte's 2019 Technology Fast 500™.   Leadership includes Renaud Dutreil, former Chairman of LVMH North America, who previously held several ministerial positions in the highest levels of French Government; Chien Chung (Didi) Pei, chairman of the China Institute and partner in the legendary Pei Partnership Architects; Beauty and Well Being Founder & Editor Clémence von Mueffling; Jim Porcarelli, Co-founder of MediaCom North America; former Conde Nast executive Stephanie Newhouse; CBS Revenue & Operations Executive Director Dennis Colon; Candy Pratts Price, previously Creative Director for Vogue.com; Yann Coatanlem, Former Head of Derivatives, Citi; David Gerbitz, Former Chief Operating Officer, Pandora; and Gregory Barker, former UK Minister of Energy & Climate Change and a current member of the House of Lords.  Launched in 2015, GlassView has offices in Fort Worth, New York City, San Francisco, Chicago, Tokyo, Singapore, London, Paris, and São Paulo, among other locations. For more information on GlassView, please visit www.glassview.com.  Who You Are: An ambitious sales professional looking to join a team of global ad tech experts in a fast-paced startup culture. You're self-motivated, can hit the ground running, and are excited to build a long-term sales career. You'll play a vital role in driving our sales engine by prospecting and qualifying leads, ultimately building a client and agency portfolio.  Job Overview: The Sales Development Representative will play a critical role in qualifying prospects and breaking into new expansion markets, which include many Fortune 500 Brands and their agency partners. This will involve being on the front line of our sales team, building & maintaining a sales pipeline and working closely with sales leaders within our organization to nurture and convert new business opportunities. This role is a full-time position with flexibility to work from home until a safe return to office (date yet to be confirmed).  Responsibilities and Duties: Leverage email outreach to qualify prospects and initiate sales conversations with key decision makers at target companies Learn and maintain in-depth knowledge of the GlassView service offering, industry trends, and competitive landscape Collect market data before and during outreach to understand prospective customer needs and effectively communicate those needs to sales leaders Be the first point of contact for potential clients while executing marketing and sales tactics Help break into new expansion markets Use Salesforce, SalesLoft, MediaRadar and other sales tools, build prospect lists and craft outbound messaging  Requirements & Skills: Bachelor's degree (in marketing, business, or communications is a plus) 1+ year of client-facing or sales experience is a plus Excellent written and verbal communication to express ideas & information clearly and concisely Willingness to learn the intricacies involved in enterprise sales cycles and the outreach process for engaging potential clients Relational; ability to develop and maintain strong client relationships, as well as work with and influence all levels within a global, matrixed environment Required - Microsoft Office, Google Apps Experience with a CRM system such as Salesforce is a plus  GlassView Perks: We are passionate, creative, driven, open, and adaptable. Our core values are the engine of our business & we truly believe in teamwork, joint-thinking and culture. Unlimited PTO Flexible work-from-home policy Travel reimbursement / Commuter Benefits 401(K) plan Benefits Package (Health, Dental, Vision, AD&D) Strong focus on company culture  Casual Dress Code Generous Incentive structures   If you want to gain experience at a fast-moving, innovative, up-and-coming digital advertising company with an all-star team, then this is the ideal position for you.
industries: Marketing and Advertising

jobTitle: Western and Eastern Regional Sales Representative
description: Headquartered in Bend, Oregon since 2013, DrinkTanks® is seeking to fill two Sales Representative role. This is an opportunity for you to have an impact on a growing company. We are looking for a qualified candidate that can jump in and think fast on their feet to maintain and further develop our operations to meet our growing needs. This position will primarily work remotely in the immediate future with occasional work on-site at the DrinkTanks office in Bend. This is a full-time position.  Who We Are  Founded in 2013, Bend, Oregon-based DrinkTanks® makes premium growlers and beverage accessories. With our complete Travel Keg™ system and adventure-ready cups and accessories, customers never compromise on flavor or quality, no matter where life’s adventures take them. DrinkTanks believes everyone from beer connoisseurs to backyard barbecuers deserve first-pour freshness, anytime, anywhere.  We are looking for an experienced sales professional to join the DrinkTanks Sales Team. Currently, we are looking for both an Eastern and Western Regional Sales Representative. Someone who loves beer and wants to sell a product that serves as a perfect companion. Someone who can engage with Brewers, Tap Room Managers, Buyers, and Marketers. Someone hungry and passionate about working within an exciting crossover industry of Craft Beer and Outdoor Retail.  The Western and Eastern Regional Sales Representative will drive sales growth in the assigned half of the United States. In this integral position, you will plan and implement territory sales initiatives throughout the entire distribution cycle to exceed sales, brand, and company objectives.  What You’d Do In The Role Actively participates in territory/overall sales strategy and planning for DrinkTanks Responsible for sales growth and financial goals within the territory; maintains self-education on regional craft brewers and industry trends. Entrepreneurial approach to seeking out new opportunities to grow sales, including new account penetration and retail sales conversion. Conducts regular sales, product, and brand training and activation in the field. When safe to do so. Secures POS presence at key accounts and implements other designated sales and marketing campaigns, while maintaining on-brand consistency across the territory. Primary responsibility is within Craft, promotional, gift, and Outdoor but will also be called on for occasional help with other channels. Collaborates with Sales and other departments on special projects as directed, including backup for Sales Support and Sales Reporting tasks as needed. Maintains budgets for expenses and sales goals for territory, submits regular reports Provide reports and analysis on ROI and KPIs Collaborate with other department team members on special projects as directed Plus other duties and responsibilities that arise, as defined by the Manager Have the ability to travel (at least 30%), work in a vehicle, or in the field Visits to breweries, event locations, and retail accounts will be required The Ideal Candidate... Is a natural -- Goal-oriented, self-motivated, highly organized, and determined to complete projects effectively Has Bachelor's degree (B. A.) preferred Two or more years of proven Sales experience (Craft industry preferred) Candidates must have a passion for craft beverages and the outdoors Excellent organizational and project management skills Proactive with an ability to work both independently and within a team environment B2B sales experience with strategic regional development and selling skills A trustworthy, customer relationship builder, always maintaining a professional attitude Willing to get in the trenches to achieve the company and customer objectives at hand Excellent presentation and communication skills (in person, phone, and written) Proficient in Microsoft Office, G Suite, CRM, Social Media, and ERP Shows adaptability and enthusiasm to do whatever is needed -- You’ll get the opportunity to help in other areas of the business Exhibits accountability and scrappiness - You do what you say you will, you follow through and know when to ask for help, and you always figure out how to get the job done Has excellent communication skills and a positive, people-friendly attitude Is tech-savvy and capable and efficient in all Microsoft Office programs and the Google Suite. Experience with ERP systems is highly desirable Maintains excellent email management Is able to work extended hours and/or weekends during the busy/peak/holiday seasons, as needed Has a valid driver’s license, clean driving record, and reliable car Ability to work a flexible schedule including nights and weekends occasionally For the Westcoast position, you must reside in the Bend, Oregon area Must be able to complete a Pre-employment drug screening, physical and background check are required Why work at DrinkTanks? We are a small, fun, tight-knit team that enjoys celebrating our success together! You would immediately make a personal impact on an established, successful, and growing company No idea is too big or too small, and we encourage the individual ideas and creativity within our team We are supportive and understanding of our team members’ lives and needs outside of work Our products are best in class, and we never compromise on quality craftsmanship We offer a robust benefits package, including unlimited PTO To apply: Please send a cover letter, resume, and three (3) professional references
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Food & Beverages, and Consumer Goods

description: Launched in 2000, Eight Eleven Group committed to 100% organic growth, exclusively promoting from within, while always keeping culture and growth opportunity at the forefront of the business model. What began as a two-person Indianapolis startup, Eight Eleven Group has rapidly expanded to become a market-leading organization within one of the fastest growing industries today: Consulting and Professional Services.   In 2012, Medasource was established to provide niche services exclusively in the Healthcare industry, including these practice areas: Providers, Payers, Government, and Life Sciences (pharma, device, diagnostic, clinical research, commercial labs, consumer goods, food sciences, chemicals, agriculture, and environmental sciences). Our team takes a consultative, solution-driven approach with Fortune 500 and enterprise non-profit clients to help them deliver and execute complex capital and operational projects. We are not just in the business of professional services - we are in the business of making a meaningful and authentic impact both internally with our high-performing team and externally with our clients and consultants.   RESPONSIBILITIES  Associate Account Executives are enrolled in a comprehensive outside B2B Sales Training Program focused on learning how to take a solution-driven, approach to selling consulting and professional services. Once you complete training, 80% of your time will be spent in front of customer decision makers to build partnerships, pipeline opportunities, and secure win-win engagements with our clients. Here are the primary drivers for success in this role:  Strategically identify opportunities and pursuits in 3-5 designated target accounts  Build and sustain long-lasting relationships with new and existing clients within your assigned accounts through onsite client meetings, presentations, and outings such as ball games, dinners, golf, etc.  Consult with clients to create solutions that help drive change and successful projects within their organization that deliver positive outcomes  Act as a client advocate with a focus on improving the experience of our Fortune 500 target accounts  Presenting to C-suite executives and championing solutions for their project roadmap  Continue to meet and exceed target sales goals  Set personal and team goals through frequent sprint sessions with your manager and sales support team   SALES TRAINING  Takes place at our Corporate Headquarters in Indianapolis  Led by Medasource’s President and top sales leaders  Formalized training geared toward our practice areas and core competencies in the healthcare industry  Role playing situational selling exercises and ride-alongs with senior account executives  Establishing your client portfolio  Fostering executive-level relationships    BENEFITS & PERKS  Base salary + uncapped commissions  Monthly smartphone stipend and car allowance  401k match program   Full health benefits (medical, dental, vision, and HSA)  All-expenses-paid Reward Trip each year for top producers and a guest  Expense budget for client entertainment  Eight Eleven’s BeGiving Program: 1 PTO day per quarter for service work/volunteering   Access to Eight Eleven University (internal personal and professional development program)   Top-notch training at every step in your career  Access to a personal financial concierge  Genuine, passionate, family-oriented culture   WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED  Competitive, motivated spirit and desire to succeed  Outstanding communication skills and innate ability to connect with people  Entrepreneurial spirit with desire to learn and grow   Results-driven and forward-thinking  Thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative, and positive work environment   Bachelor’s Degree

description: If you read the below description and feel this position excites you, but your experience does not add up 100%, we encourage you to still apply and tell us why! We look forward to learning what makes you passionate and purposeful.  Levelset’s Sales team is a growing group of sales professionals who are committed to excellence. As an MidMarket Sales Development Representative, you will be working closely with Account Executives to generate qualified opportunities among our MidMarket customer segment. Your target contacts will come from a variety of sources through both marketing and product generated channels. The best representatives are creative and passionate team players who can handle the challenges of cold calling and objections with grit and enthusiasm. This position will give someone beginning their career in sales significant opportunities to grow and a clear learning and earning path to become an Account Executive.  This position is a perfect way to jump start a successful and lucrative career in sales. You’ll receive world-class training, and learn a suite of new and marketable skills, including sales principles, strategic design of SaaS customer acquisition models, business development strategy, and an understanding of a high-growth business environment.  PLEASE READ THIS PART: This is an outbound sales development role, which means that it requires A LOT of activity in the form of phone calls and emails. This is a great way to get started in B2B SaaS sales, and Levelset will invest in you and your skill set so that you grow quickly in your career at Levelset & beyond. Please understand the expectations are that you show up with the energy and attitude to produce a high level of activity with a coachable and resourceful mindset.  Your Responsibilities Generate new business opportunities to fuel Levelset's sales growth by calling outbound and inbound leads to set up demos for MM Account Executives Prospect and identify key decision-makers at target companies and lay the foundation for a strong, long-lasting relationship Use a value-oriented consultative approach to listen to prospective customers and educate them on what Levelset solutions will best meet their needs Work closely with Account Executives to develop targeted lists, call strategies, and messaging to drive opportunities for new business Achieve or exceed monthly quotas of qualified opportunities Keeping a well documented and maintained pipeline Cross departmental collaboration to ensure the health of your accounts What You Bring You have a “high-motor” and are curious, resourceful, and competitive. You’re an active listener You have a high EQ and can truly empathize with our customers who need our help You are looking to kickstart a successful career in tech sales About Levelset  Levelset has been named one of the "Best Places to Work" by New Orleans CityBusiness three years in a row for our mission-driven culture and commitment to internal and external growth. Backed by venture funding, we are growing rapidly and looking for new exciting team members to add their unique talents to our mission. We empower contractors to always get what they earn, and our software platform makes lien rights, payment paperwork, and compliance in the construction industry simple and stress-free, so contractors and suppliers can get paid faster, have easier access to capital, and less surprises.  Levelset is venture-backed by Horizons Ventures, S3 Ventures, Altos Ventures, and Brick & Mortar Ventures. Levelset is headquartered in New Orleans, Louisiana, with offices in Austin, Texas, and Cairo, Egypt, and is about 200 employees strong.  Why Levelset We’re a rapidly growing team working on interesting and worthwhile problems With a newly distributed workforce, we make engagement and employee wellness even more of a priority. We want you to love your job! We believe professional growth (i.e. building your skills) is essential. Working here provides the opportunity for increased responsibility, continuous learning, and more. We have a very welcoming culture that starts at the top with our CEO. Nothing is a secret here, we think honesty and transparency create a productive workplace. Recognition for hard work and demonstrating our core values is important to us. Benefits Competitive health benefits, including mental, emotional, and behavioral health benefits and an easy to use Employee Assistance Program. Flexible sick & personal leave policy needed for health, family, and parenting during this tough time. Open vacation policy without a cap on the number of days-off. We do require employees to take a minimum of 5 days off in a row each year. Subsidized International Travel: We subsidize international travel starting at 6 months, and increasing each year Equity, per company’s general stock grant plan 401k account through Betterment which allows you to seamlessly save money for retirement directly from your paycheck Learning and Development Opportunities: In the spirit of our core value to Learn Enough, we offer a book reimbursement program. If you share what you learned from a book with the team, we'll reimburse you for it. We also provide ample room for learning and development opportunities through Coursera online courses, outside speakers, and opportunities to learn skills from your colleagues. We are committed to fighting injustice throughout the construction industry, and fairness is key to our company's purpose. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate.

description: This position is open to Boston, MA area applicants only.  Deskera is one of the biggest Cloud Players globally, with a loyal customer base of nearly half a million users. Our mission is to enable every small and medium sized enterprise in the world to thrive. We simplify accounting, customer management and payroll for hundreds of thousands of customers, saving them time and money.  We are growing fast, but we have bigger goals to achieve. We want every business, in every part of the world, to get the Deskera advantage and transform into growth machines.  And that is where you come in.  As an Inside Sales Specialist, you will drive Deskera’s future growth by building relationships with prospects, winning new customers, and delighting our current clients in the United States.  We are looking for candidates interested in pursuing a career in sales, who can engage in consultative business and technical conversations. If you are driven to work in a high growth tech startup, this position is for you.  The ideal candidate is a competitive self-starter that thrives in a fast-paced environment. You must be comfortable reviewing and contacting dozens of leads each day, working with partners, generating interest, qualifying prospects, and closing sales.   This position is located in Boston, MA and you must be in the Boston area to be considered.  You will do great if you are Energetic, well-spoken, and eager to close sales and increase revenue Comfortable talking to new people all day and solving business challenges Persuasive and goal-oriented Eager to expand the company with new sales, clients, and territories  Responsibilities Source new sales opportunities through inbound lead follow-up and outbound cold calls and emails Prospect call preparation including company background research and other pertinent lead information Identify customer's buying needs, trends and provide reports to management Guide customers through buying process and execute against a sales pipeline Demonstrate features of Deskera ERP to potential customers Enter, update, and maintain CRM information on leads, prospects, and opportunities  Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Business, Technology, Finance, Accounting or HR 1 - 3 years' of sales experience, preferably at a technology company targeting SMBs Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to multi-task, organize, and prioritize work Strong interest in technology Experience with SaaS ERP systems preferred Only applicants in the Boston, MA area will be considered

INNOVEX is growing! We are seeking a dynamic, consultative, motivated sales professional! You will represent our company by managing the entire sales process to new and existing clients.  What We’re Looking For  The ideal candidate will be a self-starter who is has a passion for developing and growing strong business relationships. You will have 2+ years of work experience, ideally in the outside sales space.  What You’ll Do Provide state-of-the-art technology solutions to businesses in your assigned local territory Utilize the INNOVEX selling process by analyzing needs of the customer and develop and customized solutions Generate net new business and maintain long term relationships with existing customers Meeting forecasting objectives by a focused cadence to sales activity Maintain CRM with daily sales activities: phone calls, prospecting, appointments, assessments, demos, etc. How You’ll Be Measured  Our sales-driven organization loves to set goals and knock them down. With that being said, some metrics for this role will include: Monthly revenue quotas Daily and weekly activity goals Customer retention goals At INNOVEX, our mission is to provide powerful technology solutions and excellent customer service to help companies think, act and thrive without limitations.  Large or small, our clients want to grow. We provide the technology that helps get them there. We believe that by providing great products and even greater service, our company will continue to grow, too.  Our success is all due to the INNOVEX team. Every member is an important contributor. We’re a collaborative team that likes to have fun while getting the job done.  If you’re looking to join our team, please email Careers@INNOVEX.tech or apply to one of our jobs!  Come with your talent, stay for the satisfaction of a job done well.

jobTitle: Enterprise Sales Representative, Key Accounts (remote eligible)
description: Smartsheet transforms work into dynamic work, unifying collaboration, workflows, and content management into a single flexible, secure, scalable, no-code platform that gives everyone the ability to continuously make an impact— so the enterprise, organizations, teams can compete in a transformed world.  Smartsheet is looking for a high energy, creative Enterprise Sales Representative to work with our Strategic Accounts. Responsibilities will include engaging customers and partnering with Account Executives in the execution of account strategies and sales opportunities to drive growth in our largest accounts. The successful applicant will show a strong desire to own each customer engagement.  This exciting role reports to the Enterprise Sales Manager. This is a remote-eligible position supporting the Eastern territory.  You Will Work with Account Executives to execute on a defined territory sales strategy to achieve territory quotas. Leverage rapidly growing accounts to identify and close new solution opportunities. Conduct full sales cycles on opportunities within your assigned territory. Qualify or hand off inbound inquiries from high value targets in strategic accounts. Proactively engage new and current users to expand awareness, educate, ask for referrals, identify new opportunities and develop account intelligence. Experience working cross-functionally with sales engineers, account executives, professional services, and customer success to engage, validate, close, and ensure success of a customer. Maintain accurate and up-to-date records. Accomplish all other duties as assigned. You Have Experience selling technology solutions through the effective use of core sales tools: Salesforce, LinkedIn, Microsoft Office. Strong software / business / solutioning acumen, and experience working with large organizations. Demonstrated ability to collaborate with internal/external cross functional teams. Demonstrated ability to discover customer pain points, requirements and aligning business value to budget and solution scope. Exemplary professional communication skills -- written, verbal, presentation. Time management aptitude managing numerous requests/priorities concurrently, while achieving production goals from assigned territory or set of accounts. Confidence and interest in creative problem solving and building solutions. Drive, grit, team oriented and a strong desire to compete and win. A passion for exceeding expectations. BA/BS degree or relevant experience. Perks & Benefits 100% employer-paid medical, dental, and vision coverage for full-time employees. Equity - Restricted Stock Units (RSUs) Equity with all offers. Lucrative Employee Stock Purchase Program (15% discount). 401k Match (50% up to 6%) to help you save for your future. Monthly stipend to support remote work and productivity. 15 days PTO to start, plus Flexible Sick Leave. Up to 24 weeks of Parental Leave. Personal paid Volunteer Day. Opportunities for professional growth and development Company Funded Perks, including a counseling membership, primary care membership, local retail discounts, and your own personal Smartsheet account. Equal Opportunity Employer  Smartsheet is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to fostering an inclusive environment with the best employees. We provide employment opportunities without regard to any legally protected status in accordance with applicable laws in the US, UK, and Australia. If there are preparations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.  At Smartsheet, we strive to build an inclusive environment that encourages, supports, and celebrates the diverse voices of our team members who also represent the diverse needs of our customers. We’re looking for people who are driven, authentic, supportive, effective, and honest. You’re encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn’t precisely match our job description—if your career path has been nontraditional, that will set you apart. At Smartsheet, we welcome diverse perspectives and people who aren’t afraid to be innovative—join us!

companyName: CIEE Council on International Educational Exchange
description: Position: Sales Representative  Reports to: Sales Manager  Department: Global Navigator High School Study Abroad  Location: New York, New Jersey  About The Company  CIEE is a nonprofit study abroad and intercultural exchange organization that transforms lives and builds bridges between individuals and nations through study abroad and international exchange experiences that help people develop skills for living in a globally interdependent and culturally diverse world.  Summary Of Position  The High school outbound department at CIEE is looking for a passionate representative to share with US high school students and schools the opportunity of a lifetime. Are you looking for a tangible way to make a difference in the lives of High School students and teachers in our U.S. schools? Are you motivated when you see youth receive educational opportunities that they dream about? Do you believe that studying abroad gives kids a sense of the common threads that connect us all, the things that make us, no matter our skin color or culture, human?  If you enjoy building relationships with high school principals, teachers, counselors, as well as, sharing unique study opportunities to students, then we encourage you to apply for this job.  Sales representative must have educational industry sales experience. Past successful sales record and experience managing a targeted territory preferred. We are looking for a proactive, creative and determined sales rep to manage accounts with a goal to get the best results from that relationship and maximize the student travel potential. The High School Study Abroad Sales Representative is responsible for selling High School Abroad experiences in a way that aligns with CIEE’s mission and values. Solid customer service ability a must.  Primary Responsibilities Sell CIEE’s High School Abroad portfolio of programs to prospective schools within a designated territory Manage relationships with secondary educational institutions Foster ongoing relationships with principals, teachers, counselors, and district administrators to keep CIEE at the forefront of study abroad opportunities Approach schools within the designated territory/region to make sales visits and presentations on programs Prospect and cold call to collect relevant information about student and institutions educational needs Establish new relationships that encourage study abroad to be a standard part of secondary curriculum Educate institutions about High School study abroad opportunities Coordinate/facilitate presentations and events target schools in territory Promote CIEE at regional and national educational conferences and trade shows Provide consultation to students and their families on study abroad goals Obtain commitments from students and parents by presenting a tailored study abroad solution to meet each student’s unique need Work with an assigned Sales Coordinator to ensure a smooth transition for students from application to departure Be the lead contact to build and keep excitement at schools as students prepare to travel Maintain an accurate and complete sales database Perform other duties as assigned to generate student applications and teacher opportunities  Skills And Experience Bachelor's degree required 2 – 4 years of sales experience required, or study abroad related positions International travel and/or work experience preferred Excellent Computer skills including MS Word, Excel, Outlook, Salesforce, Powerpoint, Google docs Excellent organizational and time management skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills including ability to present to large groups Energetic, personable, goal and team oriented Tolerance for ambiguity in a fast-moving market A passion for creating opportunities for our students This role involves extensive travel within territory and has the potential for limited international travel.  Diversity Matters  CIEE believes that diversity matters and that professionals with diverse backgrounds provide diverse approaches and ideas to solving problems and finding ways to advance our mission to bring the world together. Candidates from underrepresented groups with diverse backgrounds and experiences are strongly encouraged to apply.  Due to federal regulations a background check will be conducted as a condition of employment.

Job Description  Sales Productivity Team Representative  Collaborate with Innovative 3Mers Around the World  Choosing where to start and grow your career has a major impact on your professional and personal life, so it’s equally important you know that the company that you choose to work at, and its leaders, will support and guide you. With a diversity of people, global locations, technologies and products, 3M is a place where you can collaborate with 96,000 other curious, creative 3Mers.  “For more than 30 years at 3M, I’ve seen firsthand how it’s a place where curious, creative and collaborative people thrive and build a rewarding career. As a leader in this company, my goal is to ensure each 3Mer sees and feels the positive impact we’re making around the world” – Mike Roman, chief executive officer and chairman of the board at 3M  This position provides an opportunity to transition from other private, public, government or military environments to a 3M career.  The Impact You’ll Make in this Role  Here, You Will Make An Impact By  As a Sales Productivity Team you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world.  Acts as the primary liaison with internal customers Communicates clearly and professionally with the customer by telephone and/or written correspondence Educates and informs internal customers of various processes and directs to appropriate resources Has knowledge and understanding of the current processing systems and can provide service to internal and external customers Handles internal and external customer inquiries, claims and complaints; interprets policies and regulations, investigates problems; and communicate with other departments and providers to research and resolve issues, identify and implement service solutions Practices first call resolution with internal and external customers; improves customer satisfaction by identifying patterns of problems and barriers to solutions. Provides insight to resolve problems Participates in and maintains a quality service culture Supports the organization's quality program(s) Participates in or leads department initiatives and shares knowledge with colleagues  Your Skills And Expertise  To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M requires (at a minimum) the following qualifications:  Bachelor’s degree or higher (completed and verified prior to start) from an accredited institution Two (2) years of experience in customer service and/or sales  Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:  Salesforce system experience is preferred Experienced with cross-functional project participation Possesses exceptional customer service competencies Enjoys helping and interacting with other people in a professional, courteous manner and give continuous attention to customer satisfaction Ability to resolve conflicts effectively and take the initiative to resolve issues quickly before they become problems Ability to work in a high volume rapidly changing environment Ability to work in a team environment and willing to collaborate and compromise, including team leadership Strong Active Listening skills Ability to follow through with commitments and show concern for the needs of others Excellent oral and written communication, including presentation skills PC literate, including Microsoft Office products and 3M Customer Service systems Strong organizational and multitasking skills with the ability to stay focused on prioritized tasks Good interpersonal skills Clear and conceptual thinking ability; excellent judgment and discretion Prefers to stay busy with a full workload and enjoys meeting challenges Ability to handle work-related stress; handle multiple priorities simultaneously; and meet deadlines  Relocation Assistance: May be authorized  Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status).  Supporting Your Well-being  3M offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.  Resources for You  For more details on what happens before, during and after the interview process, check out the Insights for Candidates page at 3M.com/careers.  Learn more about 3M’s creative solutions to the world’s problems at www.3M.com or on Twitter @3M.  Responsibilities of this position include that corporate policies, procedures and security standards are complied with while performing assigned duties.  Our approach to flexibility is called Work Your Way, which puts employees first and drives well-being in ways that enable 3M’s business and performance goals. You have flexibility in where and when work gets done. It all depends on where and when you can do your best work.  Pay & Benefits Overview: https://www.3m.com/3M/en_US/careers-us/working-at-3m/benefits/  3M is an equal opportunity employer. 3M will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status.  Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.  3M Global Terms of Use and Privacy Statement  Carefully read these Terms of Use before using this website. Your access to and use of this website and application for a job at 3M are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms.  Please access the linked document by clicking here, select the country where you are applying for employment, and review. Before submitting your application you will be asked to confirm your agreement with the terms.

Are you interested in an opportunity to be the outbound face of an innovative, bootstrapped food tech startup that's eager to make a push into the market? Applying to be the SDR @ Budge the Line means being a self-starting, ambitious individual who has previous field sales experience.  In this role, you will be working remote/on the road while visiting restaurants in and around the Greater Philadelphia Area. The goal of this position is to start as many conversations as you can with the decision makers (Owners/Managers) of the restaurant, in hopes to provide them with a solution using our technology. We do not expect you to have previous experience selling restaurant technology (but it is a plus). With that said, we will initially provide you with in-depth training of software and it's functionality.  What is Budge the Line? Budge the line is an easy to use browser-based software that gives restaurants the ability to deploy new concepts into their operation at no cost. We offer a suite of flexible tools to boost the efficiency of the front and back of the house including a point of sale, integrated online ordering, order and pay at the table, deployable ticket printers/KDS, menu builder, waitlist manager and much more!  Our mission is to completely eliminate the stress, complications, commitment and inflexibility that comes with shopping for and implementing new technology in a restaurant. Helping restaurant owners during this transition is what we do best by building solutions fast, onboarding customers faster and NOT bombarding them with expenses. We are 100% for the restaurant and their success.  Responsibilities Drive top-of-the-funnel lead generation. Update and manage sales activities, opportunities, and account information in CRM. Engage in conversation and build relationships with restaurant decision makers. Consistently achieve monthly quota of qualified opportunities. Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Business or a related field. At least 1-2 years of field sales experience. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to multi-task, organize, and prioritize work. What’s in it for you: Salary + Commission Opportunity Equity/Stock Options Benefits Package (Accessible after 3 months) Personalized sales training and support from a team that always has your back. Access to sales tools of your choice to help in your prospecting. A passionate and determined founding team of like-minded coworkers who are here to help our clients and one another.

description: Healthcare National Account Sales Representative  Overview  The Healthcare National Account Sales Representative will be reponsible for expanding Cognizant’s new client base by prospecting multiple platforms via our internal tools as well as external applications. The Sales Representative will also be responsible for generating new business by marketing, partner relationships as well as cold call efforts. The ideal candidate will reside in the western region of the United States.  Role And Responsibilities Developing and implementing prospect efforts and selling TPS products and services through lead generation. Initiating, maintaining and growing opportunities with prospects via phone, email, WebEx and in person (potentially greater than 10%); and, through internal communication and coordination with Marketing, Vendor Sales/Support. Representing TPS at Channel Partner’s client user meetings, sales meetings and industry events as an attendee or presenter. Maintaing accurate records of all sales leads and proper follow up. Follow-up on new leads and referrals resulting from marketing activities. Prepare presentations, proposals and sales contracts. Manage and oversee multiple daily sales tasks. Manage yoru pipeline and forecasting sales funnel. Developing lead generation activites / Improve market penetration. Identifying market trends that contribute to developing new service and products. Prepare a variety of status reports, including activity, closings, follow-up and adherence to goals. Keep abreast of competitor’s strengths and weaknesses. description: Are you a super star seller who is looking for a fun environment? I’m looking for someone who is dependable, strong seller, and has a skincare background to work at the Chicagoland Sephora’s for support and events. This is a part-time position and the hours vary. You must have reliable transportation. If you’re interested; please send me your resume/information to: denice_schafer@us.Amorepacific.com.

BISNOW OVERVIEW BISNOW is an industry leading, vertically integrated B2B platform serving the trillion dollar commercial real estate industry across North America, Canada, the UK and Ireland.    Our mission is to inform, connect and advance the commercial real estate community to do more business. From events and news to marketing services, talent solutions and now DaaS, BISNOW reaches millions of all-digital readers as well as thousands of event attendees, speakers, sponsors, advertisers and businesses looking to do more deals within CRE.  Operating in almost 50 MSA’s across North America, the UK and Europe, we tend to think globally, but strive to connect people hyper-locally.    Key Responsibilities Establish and maintain relationships with marketing decision makers within all asset classes and sectors of our targeted markets. Drive event sponsorship sales (both digital and in person when they return) by conducting in-depth prospecting research to source and confirm participation of sponsors for our events. Consistently prospect new business to build a strong pipeline for our senior-level sales team and become an expert at specificity prospecting. Connect with sponsorship prospects using phone and email strategies; responding to all inbound leads. Assist event production department in an effort to build sponsor-friendly programs that ultimately align with the interest of Bisnow’s client base. Constantly brainstorm fresh and relevant topic ideas to adapt to trends within the industry. Understand both individual and larger team KPIs and position yourself to hit, if not exceed said KPIs on a daily, weekly and monthly basis. Document daily activities in Salesforce CRM. Work closely with the sales team to accelerate our sales cycle and to extend reach into target accounts. Work with a positive, cross functional team on an everyday basis to make certain of successful sponsorship, marketing and financial performance of these events.  What are we looking for? 0 - 2 years of sales experience. Innate hustle, raw intelligence and infectious enthusiasm. Ability to demonstrate an entrepreneurial yet disciplined mindset, creative yet organized work-ethic and an ambitious yet humble attitude. Ability to learn fast. We’re constantly bringing new digital and event products to market and you need to be able to understand their purpose, how our clients use them and learn to sell them yourself. Demonstrated experience excelling in a group or team environment of any sort. A strong interest in growing into an externally facing sales role or similar position working closely with clients. A strong interest in the commercial real estate industry. A strong interest in media and digital marketing solutions. Ability to remain receptive to feedback and open, constructive criticism. Capability to work in a high-energy, fast-paced, frequently-changing sales environment.  What's in it for you? Competitive compensation structure! Unlimited vacation. Health, dental, vision, commuter, short term disability and 401k benefits. You’ll get to work with incredibly smart, passionate, driven, ambitious, kind, caring and mindful people and will rarely experience an overload of policies, bureaucracy or toxicity (the latter, we do not tolerate).    Our values demand that we be curious, self-aware, fearless, consistent. We say yes to seemingly insurmountable challenges because we dare ourselves to push further. And we go the distance because we are individually and collectively entrepreneurial, always asking: Why can’t it be done? We find a way because we care more than the competition. We embrace team and disown ego. We are ruthlessly disciplined and unabashedly kind. We unreservedly challenge the status quo and vigorously fight for new levels of excellence. We believe the difference between good and great is exceptional communication. We obsess over creating value for our team and our customers. We push ourselves and our industry to be more inclusive, to champion diversity and to fight racism, gender bias and all forms of inequality. We never peak. We never quit. We never have excuses. We own our failures and we commit to being smarter and stronger because of them. We give our best today and even better tomorrow. We are here to win.

Our 10 Experience Centers bring the Miele message and core value of “Forever Better” to life. As our chief brand ambassadors, Experience Center Sales Associates are essential to delivering customer service that offers an exceptional shopping experience and drives sales results. The Miele Experience Center Sales Associate is friendly, full of positive energy, has an entrepreneurial spirit and is driven to provide the highest levels of customer service and achieve our mission to delight our customers.

Why Birdeye?  There’s been a fundamental shift in how we buy and sell. Once, business began with an introduction and ended in a transaction. Then came subscriptions and recurring relationships. Now we live in an Experience Economy, where customers are everything.  The world of Customer Experience (CX) is exploding and BirdEye is democratizing access to it. We bring omnichannel CX to businesses from main street to the Fortune 500. We’re on a mission to empower businesses to meet, convert, and thrive with their customers.  We do it for the customers who need the best, the business innovators bringing it to them, and the global team here building it all. With Birdeye, companies can put customers at the core of every business decision, turning feedback into insights, insights into action, and customer happiness into revenue.  Founded in 2012, BirdEye is headquartered in Silicon Valley. In 2021, Birdeye was ranked #1 in Online Reputation Management and #60 in the “100 Best Software Companies” in the world by G2 Crowd. BirdEye is backed by Salesforce founder Marc Benioff, Yahoo co-founder Jerry Yang, Trinity Ventures and World Innovation Lab.  WHAT YOU’LL DO:  As a Sales Development Representative you will drive BirdEye forward by generating and qualifying a high-quality pipeline for our Account Executive team. Sitting at the top of our sales funnel, you will have the opportunity to create a great first impression for prospective clients and effectively articulate the value proposition of BirdEye. By using strategic research and a technology suite, you will identify, nurture and qualify new leads to generate well researched, qualified meetings for our Account Executive team.  You will be a part of a collaborative sales culture dedicated to innovation and the development of its team members, while maintaining a fun and rewarding atmosphere. As a valuable contributor to the SDR team, you will have growth opportunities into upper sales positions.  Responsibilities Create a lasting and positive first impression of BirdEye for our prospects Become an expert at articulating our value proposition to anyone who asks (or who doesn’t ask) Create successful cold calling and email campaigns targeting new prospects Partner with our account executive team to help generate meetings, build sales pipeline and drive deals Discover new leads through internet research and social media monitoring/messaging, using tools such as LinkedIn Navigator Manage prospecting status, data integrity, and forecasting in Salesforce Identifying champions and key stakeholders within target accounts Meet all key performance metrics and goals on a weekly and monthly basis  To learn more, please visit: https://birdeye.com  Requirements You have a bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience 0-2 years cold calling, D2D or direct consultative sales experience Experience working with a CRM or sales enablement tool (salesloft, outreach, etc.) Drive to succeed and be promoted Excellent written & verbal communication skills Highly organized and able to adapt to changing priorities Coachable and resilient in the face of objections and rejection Exceptional listening skills combined with the ability to synthesize information  Benefits Employer paid benefits with multiple health plan options (HSA, PPO) Unlimited PTO 401(k) with company match Flexible work from home options available Maternity & Paternity Leave Employee Resource Groups - network with like minded "Birds" Abundant opportunities that come with a dynamic and fast-growing organization!

Role: Medical Sales Representative (Contract) Location: Orange County, CA Type: Contracts role for 6 months, then could shift to full-time with salary and benefits  Else Nutrition USA is part of a global company with a mission to create real, plant-based alternatives for parents who want a cleaner, more sustainable way to nourish their babies (than dairy or soy-based options). We are Else. We are a globally patented, plant-based alternative to dairy and soy-based formulas and nutrition products. Else is made with WHOLE plant ingredients, using the cleanest production process and 3 core ingredients – ones you can actually pronounce: almonds, buckwheat, tapioca.  Else is endorsed by Pediatricians, Nutritionists and Parents! That’s because we’re different than anything else out there, meeting the highest standard for nutrition and parent expectations for a clean label product. Most other plant-based products are for adults or contain only ‘some’ plant nutrition or just don’t taste good.   But why flip the script on everything we’ve come to expect from baby nutrition? Because we’ve stood where today’s parents are standing. And we demanded something different too. It’s more than nutrition. It’s truly something Else.  We are actively searching for a Medical Sales Representative for the Orange County, CA area who can join us in a contract role. If successful in this role, we will convert it to a full-time position. Corporate is based in Tel-Aviv, Israel, but all operations for the US and Canada will be based out of our Columbus office.     Responsibilities: Generating leads: Leverage our current database and work to add to it by generating new leads for target Pediatricians/offices in the Columbus area. Influencing Pediatrician Offices: Focus on total office selling to work with front desk, nurses, and doctors to get to the key decision makers and share our products and science. Driving Brand Recommendations: Drive recommendations and samples for Else products among Pediatrician offices, as measured by increase in sales for zip codes in the territory (Online, Sprouts, and others).  Requirements: College degree 2+ years in medical sales, calling on, visiting, and influencing medical offices Experience in infant/pediatric area is preferred Experience in and/or the right attitude to work in a start-up environment (curious, hard-working, can wear many hats, bounces back from mistakes, etc.) Strong verbal and written communication Analytical with ability to track calls and pull out insights from database (Hubspot) Passionate about nutrition Able to meet tight deadlines and multi-task well Outgoing, positive, friendly, and collaborative personality Expert in Microsoft Office and Outlook programs  Great benefits if position converts to full-time! FREE Medical/Dental/Vision insurance for employee Stock Options for everyone 401K with up to 5% dollar for dollar company match Life Insurance (employer covered) Short-term Disability (employer covered) Generous PTO  Join a small, scrappy team focused on bettering the world around us through nutrition! If interested, please apply now

The Opportunity   H-Wave is seeking a Regional Sales Director covering the Southeast (GA, TN, NC,AL ) territory. This person must understand and articulate what it takes to lead a high-performing team of medical device sales representatives as they will be tasked with developing a dynamic and driven team. We are looking for an enthusiastic leader to motivate their team to exceed sales goals and do the best work of their life!    Who we are :   H-Wave is a company that is “All-In”. We are “All-In” for our patient outcomes, family, and are passionate about what we do and our fight towards ending the Opioid Crisis. H-Wave believes in the value of the lives of our patients as we manufacture a multi-functional electrical stimulation device intended to speed recovery, restore function, and manage chronic, acute, or post-operative pain. It is a non-invasive drug-free alternative treatment option without harmful side effects. We are a family-owned business providing life changing pain relief for 40 years and we treat our patients and employees like family. In addition to patient outcome, employee satisfaction is a top priority, and we strive to keep our work culture fun, rewarding, and motivating. Because we are “All-In” in everything that we get to do, and we are looking for people who will be as passionate about our product, service, and work environment as we are!   Duties and responsibilities  • Develop, forecast, and execute upon monthly, quarterly, and annual sales production, growth and profit goals.  • Support and encourage a strategic coaching relationship with Sales Consultants. • Review Quarterly Achievements, Goals and Strategy with EVP of Sales. • Perform Quarterly and Annual Reviews with every member of your Regional Sales Team.   • Identify and present opportunities for professional growth and self-development.  • Build and maintain strong relationships with every member of your Regional Sales Team. • Identify business challenges and develop appropriate action plans with Sales Consultants. • Provide business systems and technical support to Sales Consultants and customers. • Work from and actively engage the use of the H-Wave Sales Playbook. • Identify skills gaps and support sales team efforts to execute on revenue generating sales activities. • Active engagement in ongoing employee recruitment, retention and mentorship of current team members.  • Accountable for region-wide Strategic Partnership engagement, referencing Regional Sales Consultants’ Strategic Partnership Grids. • Formal Annual Quality Assessment of all Regional PCAs with ongoing quality monitoring. • Resolve customer challenges when escalation is necessary.  • Look for, record and report trends, challenges and issues within the region immediately to the EVP of Sales. • Attend regional and national industry specific conventions, symposia, conferences and other events as necessary.  Qualifications  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent professional experience • Must have experience leading a high-performance sales team  • Must have valid Driver’s License and clean motor vehicle record  • History of working in a position that requires significant autonomy and self- motivation • Highly driven and exhibits strong work ethic  • Exemplary written and oral communication skills with any audience • Demonstrate strong problem-solving abilities • Strong proficiency of Microsoft Office applications  • Ability to travel, up to 50% (overnight) on a regular basis   Physical requirements  • The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions • Frequent required travel to customer clinics, hospitals and offsite meetings. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile  Benefits  • Base Salary + Commission • Vehicle Allowance • Matching 401k • Health/Life Insurance • Optional Dental/Vision • Company Issued iPhone • Paid Vacation      Job Type: Full-time    Pay: From $120,000.00 per year
