description: If you’re looking to kick-start, or accelerate, your career in sales by joining a life-changing, successful startup - and work in a fully-remote position - Stock Navigators is looking for a motivated, driven, and ambitious Sales Development Rep (SDR) to join our Sales team!  We are on a mission to help people learn their way to financial freedom! We teach students our strategies for trading in the stock market so they can learn a skillset they can utilize from anywhere in the world to generate income for the rest of their lives - it's a truly life-changing program, please check out our student reviews to see why (https://stocknavigators.com/reviews)!  The ideal candidate will thrive working in a fast-paced startup environment, be able to self-motivate from home, and be driven to constantly improve their craft so they can help us reach our revenue goals. Our culture is built on having high expectations for each other, creating an upbeat and positive atmosphere where we learn and grow together, and providing continuous coaching and support to help our team reach and exceed their goals!  The SDR role will be responsible for making the first contact with potential high-ticket clients to determine if they are someone who would benefit from our life-changing education programs at Stock Navigators. If they are, the SDR is responsible for scheduling a meeting with an Account Executive (AE) so the prospect can learn whether our service is the right fit for them... and if it is, the AE will make the sale, and you'll earn a commission! You may be expected to work weekend shifts as this is a B2C sales role. This is also a generous commissions-only position.  This position is critical to the success and bottom line of our company, and successful SDR team members will have the opportunity for professional and financial advancement within our team and company - come grow with us!  About You:  You’re a self-starter - you can motivate yourself to put in the effort to improve people’s lives every time you start your day, without being told to do so. You are coachable - you want to continuously improve your craft, and you crave honest feedback so you can learn and grow more quickly. You are naturally curious - you want to know “Why?”, and you aren’t afraid to dig deeper when asking people questions. You are intelligent - you have the gift of intellect, as well as the humility to know there’s always more to learn. You have a very strong work ethic - you bring the energy and the effort 100% of the time, so you can maximize your impact while you’re at work. You are successful - you may not have sales experience, but you have examples of how you’ve propelled yourself (& others) to succeed in the past. You’re tenacious, resilient, and have grit – the best way to overcome rejection is to jump in and try again. You’re adaptable and don’t fear change - you know change drives growth. You have exceptional communication skills - you believe in over-communicating and are comfortable and competent conversing via phone, email/Slack, & video. You are highly organized - you know clarity drives focus, and focus drives results. You are passionate about helping to improve the lives of others!  Significant Responsibilities:  Create a positive, upbeat, and confident environment for prospects as the first point of Stock Navigators contact; Efficiently engage and process your lead lists through the qualifying funnel each day, ensuring the most qualified leads reach the sales team; Educate potential clients on the value of Stock Navigators services; Coordinate and schedule follow up appointments for Account Executives; Make large-volume outbound contact via phone calls, emails, and social media touches daily to engage prospects; Diligently and accurately track your activity via our Hubspot CRM system; Create and manage a highly organized schedule to manage your daily workload; Join daily individual team coaching sessions to obtain feedback improve; Hold yourself and your team accountable to goals, KPI’s, and targets; Help us define and improve best-practices for the role to always push for greater success!  Desired Skills and Qualifications:  Confident negotiation and persuasion abilities; Strong organization, time management skills, and high attention to detail; Experience interacting with clients/customers over the phone; Experience using a computer, email, & social media; 1+ years of experience in a customer-focused, customer service, or sales role; Experience using Hubspot or a comparable sales (CRM) tool: Some selling experience is required; High school diploma or GED.  Compensation/Salary:  The expected at-target compensation range for this position is $40k - 60k per year. Compensation and benefits are based on, among other things, employment vs. contract labor status, skills & qualifications, academic achievements, and previous work experience. Stock Navigators offers competitive wages and benefits based on industry standards, as well as contract-based compensation opportunities.

MidSouth Orthopedics – Little Rock, AR 72204 Exclusively serving Arkansas and Northern Louisiana, MidSouth Orthopedics represents Arthrex, a global medical device company developing innovative and minimally invasive orthopedic products and education.  General Overview Sell Arthrex products to new and existing clients through in-person appointments, providing expert knowledge, and various lead sources Represent MidSouth Orthopedics by working with a sophisticated audience comprised of surgeons and healthcare professionals Increase territory results by building and maintaining strong business relationships and by developing and implementing sales strategies Establish and maintain relationships with clients (surgeons, nursing and clinical staff, etc.) Provide doctor and staff with assistance in the installation and set-up of equipment Knowledge Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations Ability to write professional reports, business correspondence, and procedural documents Skills and Abilities Strong written and verbal communication skills Excellent public speaking skills Ability to interact in a professional and courteous manner with clients, doctors, and staff at all times Ability to work collaboratively within a team as well as individually Highly organized and detail oriented in all assignments Strong follow through skills Ability to work independently and interact with all levels of management Accuracy, analytical skills and attention to detail are required Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information Ability to exercise good judgment and discretion Strong negotiation and closing skills Strong multi-tasking skills; must manage responsibilities under strict deadlines Education & Experience Bachelor’s degree required Demonstrated ability to relate to customers and constituents within the orthopedic market Required to maintain vendor credentialing for assigned territory Ability to remain calm and professional in a surgery/ operating room environment Must be able to travel within assigned territory as required Benefits Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance 401(k) Plan Paid Time Off Paid Holidays Up to $5000 bonus potential

Did you know that 40% of Fortune 500 CEOs had a sales background? Are you interested in starting a modern career where you will learn relevant skills to help you increase your career and earning potential?  LaunchSource is the leading hiring platform supporting a new, diverse generation of talent to break into one of the most sought-after roles at tech startups, changing the way early-career professionals start their careers in tech at some of the hottest tech startups in cities like Boston and New York City.  We have partnered with some of the most innovative, high-growth companies that offer incredible potential for advancement so we can provide you, recent college graduates, entry-level and early career candidates with the training and opportunities you need to really showcase who you are and why hiring managers should want to hire and work with you.  We focus on providing you, with interview preparation, professional development, and access to our partners, high-growth tech companies that are modernizing their sales teams all at no cost to you.  Our process puts qualified applicants in front of the people that matter: sales managers and executives that are ready to bring you onto their teams in the next 30 days.  Responsibilities Drive top-of-the-funnel lead generation and build an effective funnel for account executives and sales managers Update and manage all sales activities, opportunities, and account information in CRM Consistently achieve a monthly quota of qualified opportunities Research and identify new business opportunities Call prospective clients in order to identify qualified decision-makers & generate awareness Navigate company structures to get past gatekeepers and influence decision-makers Conduct research on prospective clients and maintain a database of business opportunities Do potentially 50+ outbound dials per day Perform all other duties as needed. Skills, Requirements, and Qualifications Looking to begin a new job within the next 30 days Desire to work in sales and build a career in sales Persistent with overcoming obstacles and approaching challenges Intellectually curious with a growth mindset and entrepreneurial spirit Ability to learn and absorb new products quickly and rapidly adapt to changing business and customer demand Excellent critical thinking, listening organizational, oral, problem-solving, and written communication skills Must be able to commute to Boston Must be able to work in the U.S. without visa sponsorship Salary: Base Salary + On-Target Earnings (OTE)  Base Salary: $40,000-$55,000  OTE: $10,00-$25,000+ (Uncapped OTE)  Here at LaunchSource, we don't just accept our differences — we celebrate them, we support them and we thrive on them for the benefit of our candidates, clients, and our community. LaunchSource and its clients are proud equal opportunity employers.  LaunchSource provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.  By applying to this job, contingent on my acceptance to the LaunchSource process and platform, I consent to have my personal information, including my resume and other materials that I provide to LaunchSource or grant permission for LaunchSource to use, displayed to and accessed by LaunchSource's clients via the LaunchSource platform or other means of communication.

description: Responsible for the sale of Tour Edge Golf products and services in the territory of Minnesota and North & South Dakota by interacting with established green grass and off-course retail customers.  Essential Functions and Key Responsibilities: Successfully sell and promote the company's products and services while maximizing the territory's potential. Meet established goals for territory development and sales quotas Call on and provide service to Strategic Account doors within defined territory (i.e. merchandising, product/fitting training, relationship building, visit reports, etc.) Educate and inform customers about company products to assure growth, product/service development, quality control and profitability. Strong level of written and verbal communication skills. Organization & Time Management Skills. Technical skills (golf equipment, computers, etc.). Our Mission and Opportunity  Early education is one of the greatest determinants of childhood outcomes, is a must for working families, and has lasting social and economic impact. Brightwheel’s vision is to enable high quality early education for every child — by giving teachers meaningfully more time with students each day, engaging parents in the development of their kids, and supporting the small businesses that make up the backbone of the $100 billion early education market. Brightwheel is the most loved technology brand in early education globally, trusted by thousands of educators and millions of families.  Our Team  We are a highly distributed team supporting fully remote employees across every time zone in the US. We also have hubs in Austin, Denver, and San Francisco. Our team is passionate, talented, and customer-focused. Our exceptional investor group includes Addition, Bessemer Venture Partners, Chan Zuckerberg Initiative, GGV Capital, Lowercase Capital, Emerson Collective, and Mark Cuban.  We believe that everyone—from our employees to the students, teachers, and administrators we serve— should be given the opportunity to learn and thrive, whatever their background may be. We celebrate diversity in all forms because it allows our team and the communities we serve to reach their full potential and do their best work.  As a Sales Development Representative, you'll be responsible for owning the top of our sales funnel. From qualifying leads to prospecting inbound and outbound opportunities, you will be the first line of education for our potential customers.  You’ll be in contact with a large volume of customers on a daily basis via phone, with a relentless focus to source new opportunities for our sales team. You'll work closely with Marketing, Data Ops, Operations, and Sales leadership to maximize the funnel conversion and sales processes.  (Note: Must be able to be online and working daily from 8am - 5pm Central Time)  Ideal Candidates Will Have 0-1+ years of sales or relevant customer-facing experience Deep care for our customers, putting their needs first and bringing energy and intention to every customer interaction Proven experience achieving and pushing past goals and quotas Hunger to continue developing your skills and mastering your craft Tendency to celebrate wins, not shy away from misses, and ability to learn from both A strong mix of tenacity and curiosity to help educate potential customers Excellent communication, organizational, time-management, and prioritization skills Comfort with high volume/velocity sales, as well as a dynamic startup environment that will evolve rapidly A passion for improving the world through education  Benefits Health/Dental/Vision Insurance Stock Options Unlimited PTO Monthly Wellbeing & Lifestyle Stipend Learning & Development Stipend 401(k) Enrollment Brightwheel is proud to celebrate diversity and is committed to building an inclusive workplace regardless of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service, or other non-merit factor.

description: NEVADA CITY WINERY  Wine Sales Representative  Full-time  Territory is in and around Nevada City and along the I-80 corridor  Position Summary  The Nevada City Winery Sales Representative is tasked with maintaining and growing the wholesale wine sales portfolio. Responsibilities include identifying and pursuing customers compatible with brand objectives as well as working to increase existing customer order size and frequency. Account management includes maximizing the representation and placement of our wines, as well as merchandising store specific shelves and displays. Industry experience with a focus on sales is preferred but an understanding of wine and the wine industry is acceptable.  Responsibilities Represent the Nevada City Winery portfolio of wines Build relationships with decision makers predicated on knowledge of client needs and objectives Establish & maintain rapport with store managers, restaurant owners, and other store personnel Identify, visit, and close new accounts - 25 appointments/selling situations each week Visit customers frequently to maximize face-time Maintain monthly sales goals within territory Direct and manage order fulfillment Complete daily & weekly preplans, recaps, and distribution reports. Manage case goals vs. actual reports Maximize product placement Maintain merchandise displays Keep track of inventory within individual accounts Fill shelves, build displays, and perform regular housekeeping Host and coordinate tasting events with an ability to educate customers on our wines Be able and willing to travel extensively throughout the territory Attend and contribute to weekly team meetings Participate in role-play presentations Must submit travel and expense reimbursement reports Responsible for carrying a cell phone at all times in order to communicate with accounts and management at any time during working hours. Available to work flexible hours and weekends, when necessary, for special events Preferred Knowledge/Skills Extensive wine knowledge or certification - Certified Sommelier or WSET preferred Have 2+ years of beverage wholesale, retail or hospitality experience. Be computer literate and possess computer, laptop or other device with ability to read and manipulate spreadsheets and other office documents. Must be self-motivated and able to achieve goals while working independently Excellent presentation, verbal communication, and listening skills Advanced writing ability Strong organizational skills and ability to multi-task Must be able to repetitively lift 45+ pounds; be able to bend, squat, climb, kneel, twist and lift repetitively. Must have a valid CA Driver’s License, auto insurance, and a clean driving record Must be 21 years of age or older Company Description  Nevada City Winery is the oldest operating winery in Nevada County. The majority of our grapes are locally sourced, and we’ve been making a broad selection of award-winning wines since opening back to 1980. Our tasting room and production facility are located in the historic downtown area of Nevada City, California. In addition to a tasting room, we have an onsite art gallery, gift shop, and outdoor covered patio for use by guests. Nevada City Winery currently has 23 wines in its portfolio and continues to crush every year.  Compensation  Salary plus commission BOE  Benefits  Vision insurance  Dental insurance  Disability insurance  Paid time off  Paid holidays  Wine allocation  Employee discount  Apply  Please respond with your cover letter that explains why you are well suited for this position at Nevada City Winery, along with your resume to info@ncwinery.com  Nevada City Winery provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Nevada City Winery complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, compensation, and training.

description: At Bayer we’re visionaries, driven to solve the world’s toughest challenges and striving for a world where ,Health for all, Hunger for none’ is no longer a dream, but a real possibility. We’re doing it with energy, curiosity and sheer dedication, always learning from unique perspectives of those around us, expanding our thinking, growing our capabilities and redefining ‘impossible’. There are so many reasons to join us. If you’re hungry to build a varied and meaningful career in a community of brilliant and diverse minds to make a real difference, there’s only one choice.  Cardiorenal Sales Rep  Bayer’s Cardiorenal Division is undergoing an impressive growth trajectory and significant investment. Bayer is committed to improving cardiorenal health both in the US and globally with currently available products and products which are in development, including investigational treatments for Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD), heart failure with reduced and preserved ejection fraction, and renal anemia. Given the profound burden of CKD in Type 2 Diabetes (T2D), Bayer is continuing to make significant investments in further developing and currently launching treatment options for the disease. Specifically, as a member of the Cardiorenal Sales organization, you will have an opportunity to make an immediate impact by connecting our products with patients and continuing to advance a world class Cardiorenal Sales organization.  Your Tasks And Responsibilities  The primary responsibilities of this residence-based role, Cardiorenal Sales Representative - Valdosta, GA, are to: Build and develop professional relationships with (but not limited to) cardiology, nephrology, endocrinology, primary care and pharmacy staff, within assigned customers; Drive appropriate utilization of approved cardiovascular (CV) products; Work closely with other Bayer commercial associates to generate pull-through within local payers and community health care professionals (HCP’s); Leverage expertise and knowledge of diabetes, nephrology and cardiovascular disease (CVD), the marketplace, applicable competitors, industry and cross-functional activities/plans in order to anticipate and effectively manage business opportunities and challenges; Provide relevant, thoughtful input to other commercial colleagues (e.g. sales leadership, regional account managers) in regard to strategic and tactical planning for territory, area, and region; Develop and implement effective customer specific territory plans; Communicate insights to internal stakeholders; Prioritize time and effort to ensure optimal coverage of appropriate physician specialists based on opportunity and potential; Understand fully the assigned customers product and business needs and work to meet those needs while adhering to all of Bayer company ethics and compliance standards; Anticipate potential barriers to achievement of goals and propose responsible solutions for success; Effectively handle customer objections and exceed customer expectations with the value they bring to physicians. Who You Are  Your success will be driven by your demonstration of our LIFE values. More specifically related to this position, Bayer seeks an incumbent who possesses the following:  Required Qualifications: Bachelors’ degree and at least 3+ years of experience in pharmaceutical sales; A valid driver’s license and safe driving record; Proven track record of consistent high performance; Foster an environment that promotes ethical behavior and compliance with company policies and applicable laws; Quick learning agility, with a curiosity and savviness to come up to speed on the product and industry. Preferred Qualifications: Advanced degree; Experience in the promotion of pharmaceutical products; Product launch experience; Outstanding written and oral communication skills; Strong analytical and computer capabilities; Virtual sales experience; Local relationships with HCP’s and understanding of local market. Location:  Pharmaceuticals  Division:  Pharmaceuticals  Reference Code:  490261
industries: Chemicals, Pharmaceuticals, and Biotechnology

description: Company Description  We don’t just collect data we connect data.  We have the best data and the best tools. We continuously challenge conventional approaches to market research, and we disrupt our industry to ensure that our clients always get the best solutions.  YouGov is an international data and analytics group. Our core offering of opinion data is derived from our highly participative panel of 11 million people worldwide, with 33 million interactions and billions of data points. We combine this continuous stream of data with our deep research expertise and broad industry experience into a systematic research and marketing platform. We have 34 offices in 22 countries and panel members in 59 countries.  We are fast, fearless, trust each other and care about getting it right. Incredible comp plan and 50% commissions on sales. I have the best upline to coach you on growing your team. Happy to arrange ZOOM calls with interested people. You can message me questions!

Leading medical/surgical products distributor is seeking a full-time field sales representative for the North Boston, Maine, New Hampshire, Vermont and surrounding territory. This position requires an experienced sales person who can not only sell products but also recognize new opportunities with both new and existing customers. Preferred candidate would have a documented success history selling in the following areas: Operating room, inpatient pharmacy and/or compounding pharmacies, ambulatory surgery centers, and/or IV Therapy. The ideal candidate must be self-motivated and have a strong proven sales record with solid relationship skills.  The Company offers a Base salary, an uncapped commission program, defined and protected territories, approved expenses, mileage reimbursement, insurance benefits package and 401(k) matching. Your success will be measured by your ability to meet sales quotas, attract new accounts and build relationships. This is a phenomenal opportunity in the medical sales industry with an innovative and dynamic leading company. If you meet the above criteria and are looking for a new position with an outstanding organization, please apply as directed. Only qualified candidates meeting the above criteria will be notified.  The top reasons why the best reps want to work for Progressive Medical, Inc: A National Sales Team that is clinically prepared to support the needs of our clinical customers in any clinical environment. A National Account & Contract Team that understands the needs of Group Purchasing Organizations (GPOs) and Integrated Delivery Networks (IDNs) and how they play a significant role in the healthcare supply chain industry. A Customer Service Team that is second to none, fully staffed by Customers Service Specialists who personally answer every call, every time. Our Operations and Distribution Teams ensure our customers receive their product professionally and expediently. A Clinical Affairs Team that is available to answer questions and provide peer to peer training and support to our customers. Sales Education in collaboration with the Marketing Team provide extensive and continuous educational programs for not only our sales force, but the entire PMI organization. Our Marketing Team of professionals works in all aspects of both upstream and downstream marketing, from implementation to analysis, we understand how to take your product to market. Progressive Medical, Inc. is a leading distributor of specialty medical products throughout the United States. Our focus on innovative products helps clinicians to practice the highest quality care and increase safety, while also controlling overall costs in the areas of: surgery/anesthesia, interventional radiology, critical care and IV specialties.

description: RapidAPI is the world’s largest API marketplace and the company that is building the next-generation API platform. We enable developers and businesses to easily discover, test, and connect to any API, making it easier to create new software and services more rapidly. RapidAPI is used by millions of developers around the world and offers more than 20,000 APIs on the marketplace. Funded by a16z and Microsoft’s M12, RapidAPI is experiencing rapid growth, fueled by an increase in the number of developers and companies using our platform.   We’re looking for high energy, self-motivated, and agile sales development representatives to help us on our journey to become the next enterprise unicorn. You will be the primary driver for expanding our footprint across the largest enterprises in the world.  Working with seasoned sales and demand generation professionals, you will be responsible for the full workflow including identifying and qualifying prospects, educating them on the RapidAPI platform, and generating new business opportunities to fuel our sales pipeline. We're looking for professionals with strong organizational and follow up skills who work well in a team environment. If this sounds like the type of environment in which you thrive, then we want to talk to you about this career-defining opportunity.  Job Duties and Responsibilities: Generate new business opportunities via inbound lead generation and outbound prospecting Efficiently respond and qualify inbound marketing leads Research target accounts and identify key stakeholders within a defined territory Conduct high-level conversations and build relationships with Senior IT Executives within prospect accounts Learn, leverage, and help evolve our opportunity qualification and pipeline creation process Meet and exceed quarterly quota to ensure pipeline objectives are achieved  Requirements: 0-1+ years experience in a sales development / account management role Ability & interest in grasping technical enterprise software / developer concepts Highly motivated, driven, self starting individual Ability to work in a fast paced, team environment Excellent time management / organizational skills Strong entrepreneurial spirit, self motivated, and coachable  Salesforce, Outreach, Linkedin Sales Navigator, ZoomInfo experience is a plus

description: Peek is a 5-star reviewed leading software platform for the tours, activities and rentals industry (think hot air balloon rides, ziplining and cooking classes), empowering thousands of operators to automate their businesses and grow revenue by an average of 30%. We have won numerous awards for innovation, including being named one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies in Travel and a World Economic Forum Tech Pioneer (alongside past winners such as Google and Spotify).  Peek follows a “remote-first” philosophy, with our team of over 120 Peeksters distributed across exciting locales such as San Francisco, Salt Lake City, New York, Seattle, Chile, Colombia and beyond.  PS: Peek just made the 2021 Forbes America's Best Startups Employer list!  The Peek Recruiting Team is focused on helping build Peek’s culture, one top talent hire at a time. We partner with hiring managers to design and execute recruiting strategies that enable Peek to hire remarkable talent, in the most efficient ways. We own the candidate lifecycle experience, and the recruiting team is part of the People Operations org.  The Role: We are looking for an established Recruiter with demonstrated success recruiting for operational & sales professionals. This is a unique and highly impactful opportunity to help accelerate growth. This role will report to the Talent Acquisition Manager and partner closely with the Sales Leadership team and entire People Operations team.  Responsibilities Focus on hiring for operations and sales organization, owning the top of the funnel, in both North and South America Collaborate with the Sr. Technical Recruiter and dedicated Recruiting Coordinator to ensure a high touch candidate experience for the full lifecycle Source and identify passive candidates through multiple tools you recommend as the best to build out Peek’s teams Circulate regular weekly reporting to key recruiting partners Ensure candidate feedback & tracking is up to date with a high level of integrity in our ATS (Lever) Maintain professional and courteous communication with candidates to foster long-term relationships, continually building up your network Work closely with teams and all levels of leadership to present hiring recommendations and raise flags Requirements 2+ years of Sales Recruiting experience, preferably in SaaS / Tech Excellent written and verbal communication skills You have mastered successful pipeline management using an ATS, LinkedIn, and a variety of other demonstrated channels Can speak to metrics and utilize them to unblock challenges, make recommendations and report overall efficiency of Peek’s talent hiring process A mix of agency and in-house experience a plus Experience working remotely a plus Personal Attributes Naturally curious - someone who enjoys research and likes to hunt for top talent Insight driven - you utilize data to help drive your decisions, but understand the complexity of the situation and can provide context & color Growth-minded - eager to expand your skill set and excited to carve out your career path in a hyper-growth setting, take risks and create solutions Desire for impact and biased to action - ready to take on responsibility and work collaboratively with teams and get the job done Perks and Benefits Stock options with a standard 4 year vesting schedule Medical, dental, vision and other voluntary insurance 401k with 50% matching up to 6% vested over 3-years 10 days of accrued PTO +16 holiday paid days, which includes the holiday shut-down during the weeks of Christmas and New Year 8 weeks parental paid leave for birthing parent and 2 weeks for secondary caregiver $50 per month WFH allowance to enhance your office, internet and/or connectivity Annual "Peekiversary" gifts Peek Travel Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talent@peek.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for disability assistance as soon as possible.

description: About Amaka Amaka is a fintech company focused on providing professional accounting integrations and automation solutions. Our team spreads across the APAC, EU, NOAM and US regions, delivering/supporting services on a global scale.  Our products vary and range from accounting integrations, automated data extraction and reporting to more complex bespoke solutions, all aimed at saving time and money for small-to-medium business owners, professional bookkeepers and accountants.  Role Summary As a Sales Development Representative, you will be responsible for unlocking additional revenue from our existing active users while attracting new distribution channels (i.e. accountants and bookkeepers) to utilise Amaka’s products and services.   In this role, you will be responsible for taking a proactive approach to increase the company’s presence in the US. Incorporating a strategic and analytical approach, you will derive new value from merchants leveraging point-of-sale, ecommerce and marketplace platforms through a strong understanding of Amaka’s products and services. The Sales Development Representative will seek to identify new distribution channels to reach new audiences that align with Amaka’s company values and beliefs.   Working closely with the Partnerships Manager, you will also be responsible for the execution of targeted sales strategies across multiple verticals of the market. This will involve deriving insights from market data and trends to identify opportunities to upsell and cross sell Amaka’s products and services to merchants nationally.  A core component of this role is the nurturing of relationships with existing active users while building rapport with new merchants that utilise Amaka’s products and services. This position is key to Amaka’s global expansion and will provide the candidate with an opportunity to grow exponentially with the company.  Responsibilities/Duties Identify and target various distribution channels to utilise Amaka’s products and services  Seek opportunities to cross-sell and upsell across Amaka products Assist in growing Amaka’s business through strategic mapping of new distribution opportunities (i.e. reseller programs) Develop holistic, strategic sales campaigns while considering distribution channels and key marketing assets Maintain an understanding of user trends across the POS, e-commerce, payments and workforce management sectors Use data-driven insights to drive decision-making Grow account-based revenue through identification of cross/upsell opportunities for Amaka’s products.  Core Competencies/Requirements 2+ years of practical experience in sales or account management roles working directly with customers in fast-paced environment Highly developed written and verbal communication skills Proven track record of ‘outside of the box’ thinking to achieve revenue/sales goals Proficiency in CRM software Self-starter mentality with a “can do” attitude Ability to derive insights from data to identify new opportunities and trends  Benefits Learning and development programs Flexible work policies Health and fitness incentives

Triplemint is on a mission to create a better real estate experience for buyers, sellers, and renters. We're an innovative full-service brokerage combining technology, teamwork, and personalized service to serve the modern generation of homebuyers and sellers. Triplemint leverages data and predictive analytics to give our clients access to homes before they are listed, resulting in more options for buyers and a strategic approach for sellers. Founded in 2011, Triplemint is headquartered in New York City and has raised $20M from leading real estate VCs. Find out why thousands of happy clients have given us the highest net promoter score in the real estate industry!  The Position:  Triplemint is looking for a Sales Development Representative to join our growing outbound sales team. This individual will be responsible for creating revenue opportunities for our sales team.  You will be part of an experienced, energetic team that promotes collaboration and values creating amazing client experiences. Successful candidates for this selective position will have an interest in real estate, a passion for quantifiable sales systems and a drive to grow a sales career in a rapidly evolving start-up.  What You'll Do: Introduce prospective buyers and sellers to our team of real estate agents Convert leads into appointments Manage outbound calling, e-mail communication, coordination and scheduling of real estate buying and selling opportunities and overall management of the sales pipeline Follow and enhance scripts to deliver Triplemint's value proposition and handle objections Achieve productivity, appointment setting and revenue targets Spend at least half of the day on the phone speaking with clients Follow up with our sales team on leads to maximize selling opportunities  Who You Are: 1-2 years of inside sales experience Great communication skills Proven team player and natural self-starter Excellent organizational and follow-up skills BA/BS from top university Demonstrated success as an SDR/BDR at a fast-growing company Strong interest in real estate Salesforce proficient  Benefits & Perks:  At Triplemint, we offer a wide suite of benefits and perks to employees: Unlimited vacation Comprehensive health benefits 401(k) matching Commuter transit benefits, HSAs & FSAs Employee Assistance Program (EAP)  It is the policy of Triplemint not to discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability or because he or she is a protected veteran.

description: Company Overview: Paragon Enterprises Inc. is a national and international distributor of pharmaceuticals. We are growing our company and looking for enthusiastic people to join our inside sales team at our Weston, Florida location.  Visit our website at www.paragonmeds.com.  The ideal candidate is a competitive self-starter that thrives in a fast-paced environment. You must be comfortable making dozens of calls per day, working with partners, generating interest, qualifying prospects, and closing sales. Our top inside sales representatives earn $200,000 per year (salary + base). We are looking for hungry sales representatives that want a high commission weighted position, uncapped commission potential and want to earn over $100,000+ per year.  Why work for us?  Stability – the pharmaceutical industry is recession proof and had an increase in consumption and sales during the pandemic. Long term career – we have many sales representatives that have been here for 3+ years that earn $100k+ yearly. Competitive pay – we pay more base + commission than our competitors! Not to mention healthcare, 401k, vacation + paid time off. Small- midsize company – we are not a corporate company, have a genuine interest in your success and treat every employee like they are family.  Growth potential – we grow our employees organically. Once you are successful as an inside sales rep, you can move to Team Lead position and other higher-level positions within the company. Entrepreneurs – we are true entrepreneurs and have built many divisions from the ground up. We search for people with entrepreneurial type personalities that have the “run it like you own it” mentality. We put every dollar the company makes into starting new divisions and building growth from within. Hands on CEO – the founder/ CEO will be in the office and works hands on with all employees to help them succeed. Management – you will be trained from Senior Sales Representatives that started in the same position and can provide hands on training to help you be successful.    Responsibilities ·        Source new sales opportunities through outbound cold calls and emails ·        Make 80+ outbound calls/ day to targeted pharmacies, clinics and hospitals across the U.S. and internationally ·        Prospect call preparation including company background research and other pertinent lead information ·        Identify customer's buying trends and provide reports to management ·        Enter, update, and maintain CRM information on leads, prospects, and opportunities ·        Applies pharmaceutical market knowledge and relays information to customers ·        Meets and exceeds monthly quota  Qualifications ·        Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Business preferred but not required ·        At least 1 - 3 years' of sales experience ·        Excellent written and verbal communication skills ·        Ability to multi-task, organize, and prioritize work  Job Type: Full time Hours 9 a.m. – 6 p.m. EST Location: Weston, Florida - in office (no work from home option) Pay: Start at $20.00 per/hr + commission + healthcare benefits + 401K retirement + PTO and vacation

The ideal candidate is an energetic self-starter with the ability to identify influencers and key decision makers within accounts. You will discover qualified opportunities by responding to inbound interests and targeted outbound prospects to build rapport and establish long-term relationships.   Responsibilities Drive top-of-the-funnel lead generation for account executives and sales managers Update and manage all sales activities, opportunities, and account information in CRM Consistently achieve monthly quota of qualified opportunities  Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Business or a related field At least 1 - 2 years' of relevant work experience Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to multi-task, organize, and prioritize work

description: To be considered for this role, please fill out an application on our https://cutwaterspirits.com/join-our-crew/ OR Send your resume to jobs@cutwaterspirits.com  Cutwater Spirits is currently hiring a Sales Representative for the Orange County area to join our growing team.  Determined to grow market share in all segments of the business, Sales Representatives are responsible for growing the company portfolio and engaging consumers through point of sale, shelf assortment, and creative displays at retail accounts. In addition, Sales Representatives identify new market and business opportunities to increase market share while building and maintain relationships with accounts and retailers. The Sales Representative works independently under the loose general guidance of the Regional Sales Manager.  While the company is headquartered in San Diego, CA, this position spends of the bulk of their time in the field in their assigned market.  Daily Duties, Functions, Responsibilities: · Drive sales in off-premise and on-premise retail business. · Assist with merchandising and the implementation of programming in chain locations. · Achieve distribution, display space, and shelf placement objectives in off-premise retail accounts. · Secure menu features, back bar placement, and promotions to bring brand awareness in on-premise retail accounts. · Increase brand presence in the marketplace by facilitating promotional and tasting events each month. · Strengthen and expand current business partnerships with off-premise and on-premise retail accounts. · Educate and manage the Distributor Sales Teams to ensure they are presenting and executing to Cutwater standards. · Passionately share the Cutwater story. · Participate in new product launches, promotions and events as the face of Cutwater Spirits. · Embraces and fulfills the core values and culture of Cutwater Spirits. · Other duties as assigned. Physical Conditions: • Work takes place in variety of environments throughout assigned market. • Requires occasional lifting of up to 50 pounds. • Ability to move products, hang point of sale materials and fulfill other physical requirements including: repetitive lifting, bending and pulling/pushing. • Conducts work in a sitting position; however, job requires frequent standing, walking, bending, stooping, and lifting. Minimum Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: • Strong time and project management skills. • Strong organizational skills and ability to prioritize a varied workload. • Captivating storytelling skills. • Ability to follow oral and written instructions. • Ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing. • Ability and willingness to work flexible hours including nights and weekends. • Strong customer service skills and the ability to develop and grow strong customer relationships. Education and Experience: · Bachelor's Degree (preferred). · High school diploma or equivalent required. · Must be 21 years of age, have a valid driver’s license and safe driving record. · Have reliable transportation to travel to and from various locations. · 1 or more years of sales/business development experience (preferred). · Spirits/alcohol beverage industry knowledge a must. · 1 or more years experience in sales in beverage alcohol industry (preferred). · Knowledgeable about assigned market. 1+ years experience working in assigned market (preferred). · Bilingual English/Spanish (preferred). More: Cutwater Spirits offers competitive pay, benefits, and a fantastic work environment. Compensation package includes paid time off, holidays, and the ability to participate in company benefit programs (health, dental, vision, life, disability, FSA, and 401k).  At Cutwater, we are dauntless spirits. We make whiskey, vodka, gin, rum, liqueur, mixers, canned cocktails, and beyond. We’re always focused on the horizon, the road ahead. We’re just hardwired that way. Armed with some heavy experience, hard earned awards, and boundless energy, we’re charging ahead to carve out our place in the global spirits industry. We invite all who share our passion to join us on the journey.  If you have the passion for spirits, building relationships, and telling stories, this might be the right position for you. If you also have an entrepreneurial spirit, a burning need to build long lasting relationships and a fire to be the best in the industry — we want to talk to you. If you think you have what it takes to be our next Rockstar Sales Representative Orange County, please fill out an application on our website here: https://cutwaterspirits.com/join-our-crew/

description: POP Sells, LLC (POP Yachts and POP RVs), a forward-thinking, high-tech brokerage, is seeking a quality Regional Sales Representative ("RSR") in your area. This is a flexible work-from-home position, therefore your territory would be based upon your specific zip code. If you are in a nearby town, then you are encouraged to still apply, as we may have openings there. If you have ever thought about working in the boating or RV business, now is a great time to get started. We officially ended 2020 with 4,130 units sold and are on pace for well over that sold in 2021. Overall, we have sold over 20,000 units in the 12 years we have been operating. POP Yachts and POP RVs are one of the fastest-growing brokerages on the planet! We currently have approximately 6,000 active boat and RV listings that are generating thousands of worldwide buyer leads each and every month. Our proprietary in-house software is by far the best in the industry and offers the Company a major competitive advantage. The way people buy and sell boats and RVs has changed due to the internet and online sales. Come be part of the future of brokerage.  If you are looking for a career in a fun industry that offers a flexible schedule and performance-based pay, POP may be the solution for you. We are seeking some passionate boat and RV-loving individuals to help continue our massive growth campaign. We are looking for 1099 contractors who are highly ethical, professional, tech-savvy, and who share the vision of the company.  We offer a top-notch training program (no cost). Our goal is to get our sales staff up, running, and making good money as fast as we can.  No cold calling is required for this position. POP provides the listings, marketing, software, and leads to our sales associates, thus dramatically decreasing any ramp-up time.  To learn more about the RSR position and POP, please visit www.sellboatsandrvs.com  If you live in either FL, CA or VA those states do require you to be licensed.  We hold 2-week training sessions each month and hope to see you in one of our future classes.  To learn more about the position and the application process, please visit www.sellboatsandrvs.com.

Common Moon, a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization, is hiring a contract commission-based sales representative for their wholesale division. If you enjoy building networks, solving customer problems, and owning the end-to-end sales process all while supporting noble humanitarian causes, then this is the position for you.  Responsibilities Contact local organizations/businesses to discuss custom merchandise needs + our competitive philanthropic AND cost advantage, and secure wholesale orders (30+ pieces) Send wholesale order form to Common Moon’s manufacturing team to handle production and delivery Update clients about order status Demonstrate professionalism and communicate regularly with management Innovate and grow our profitable branch through any other fundraising/business methods  What we will provide you with All pricing and logistics information Key contacts to get you started Common Moon email account to communicate Priceless entrepreneurial and communication experience, as well as a community of philanthropically-driven volunteers  Compensation As a contractor for Common Moon, you will be compensated on a commission basis per sale  Qualifications Excellent written and verbal communication skills Highly organized with excellent attention to detail

Who We Are: GMA Group dba Capelli New York, Capelli Sport, Sondra Roberts, and Ballet Group LLC. Are a major U.S. manufacturer and distributor of apparel, footwear, novelty and gift products, jewelry, fashion accessories, handbags, PPE, and sports/athletic apparel for women, men, and kids. We were established in 1990 and have approximately 600 employees in the U.S.A. and 2,500 employees worldwide. We have locations in the U.S.A., UK, China, Hong Kong, Germany, and Bangladesh.  What We Are Looking For: We are currently seeking Showroom Sales Assistant at Capelli New York to work at our New York City Office. The overall aim of this role is to assist the sales team by learning all sales systems and processes based on customer needs, and to be a reliable internal resource for all operational tasks. The ideal candidate will be serious about having a career, not just a job.  Responsibilities: ·       Coordinate scheduling with clients and sales team members ·       Help process and complete all Product Development and sample requests for customers. ·       Manage and handle the post-sales support process to fulfill orders placed by customers. ·       Create and process sales orders - if needed ensuring the accuracy of sales orders and purchase orders received from customers. ·       Perform data entry duties related to item set up, and develop an understanding of different customer portals. ·       Generate, manage, update, maintain and distribute reports on a daily and weekly basis related to sales activities. ·       Manage administrative tasks related to sales activities. ·       Perform other duties as assigned.  Skills and Requirements ·       Bachelor’s degree required. ·       Strong written and oral communication skills and able to work as a part of team. ·       Ability to prioritize, multi task, and work effectively in a fast-paced environment in order to meet deadlines. ·       Must be detail-oriented, extremely organized, self-motivated and able to work well under pressure. ·       Encompass a positive attitude, work ethic and exceptional follow up skills. ·       Must have the ability to be punctual, prepared and professional. ·       Excellent computer skills especially Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook.  If you see yourself as our newest team member, please submit your resume and salary requirements to careers@capellinewyork.com.  GMA Group is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to gender, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, age, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law. jobTitle: Pfizer Connect Health & Science Representative (Inside Sales Rep) - Tampa
description: Role Summary  All over the world, Pfizer colleagues have the opportunity to grow and develop a career that offers both individual and company success; be part of an ownership culture that values diversity and where all colleagues are energized and engaged; and the ability to impact the health and lives of millions of people. Pfizer, a global leader in the biopharmaceutical industry, is continuously seeking top talent who are inspired by our purpose to innovate to bring therapies to patients that significantly improve their lives.  The Pfizer Connect Health & Science Representative (PCHR) is responsible for increasing product awareness, educating customers and attaining the goals of their Business Unit through fully remote / virtual customer interactions. The PCHR is charged with relationship development and promotional efforts with U.S. customers and accounts. This position will be based at our Tampa site full-time.  The PCHR should possess strong business acumen and outstanding communication skills with an aptitude to develop in-depth expertise in virtual engagement settings, establish and build impactful relationships and exhibit strong promotional skills. They must understand and follow the call process for their BU including developing pre-call plans, executing calls, and conducting post-call analyses using all available digital and virtual tools. They must have the ability to work independently in virtual collaboration with cross-functional internal teams. Where applicable, the PCHR should coordinate insights, learnings, and customer approach with in-field Health & Science Representatives or Specialists who call on Health Care Professionals (HCP) in overlapping geographical areas.  Role Responsibilities Engage with customers virtually, primarily from a dedicated Pfizer Connect Center, to compliantly grow the business and drive product demand by proactively providing information and resources to achieve business objectives and meet customer needs Generate product demand by educating customers and promoting the product, Effectively builds rapport with customers in fully virtual environment ; develops a methodical approach toward calls (e.g., clear next steps and appropriate documentation, managing to KPIs) ; adapts approach based upon opportunities and insights; uses Total Hospital or Total Office call as required for assigned BU Understands and uses approved promotional materials to support marketing message Uses approved Pfizer resources to support customers, accounts, HCPs and patient’s needs (demonstration units, samples, vouchers, co-pay resources) and works effectively across multiple virtual engagement platforms based on customer preferences/compliance guidelines Integrates guidance and insights from management/other support roles/technical solutions (e.g., content recommendation engines) into pre-call planning ; proactive planning and optimization of call environment (Center location and work-from-home); able to effectively plan day-to-day work based on personal and customer schedules ; collaborate effectively with other Customer-Facing (CF) colleagues and Pfizer Connect team members Builds and demonstrates a mastery and utilization of all virtual tools and resources; effectively uses calendaring tools, leadership goals, and personal insights to address customer priorities on outbound calls effectively Appropriately support HCP and patient access to prescribed Pfizer products by providing relevant information on Reimbursement, Patient Assistant Program (PAP), Pfizer hub programs (excluding patient-specific cases), Formulary and Co-Pay Resources. Learns to apply triaging protocols to create connections for customers with appropriate SMEs using digital apps to send compliant messages for rapid responses; uses warm transfers for real-time reactive hand-offs to cross-functional experts with some limitations Complete cross-training on select to-be-identified assets outside of home BU for ‘surge capacity’ coverage Stays current with all required training, including Compliance, and routinely enhances skills through self-study, development programs, conferences and / or training classes at local and / or remote locations Where needed for the assigned BU, discuss negotiated contract terms and contract options (where appropriate and with approved language); answer on-label questions; advocate for HCP utilization of Pfizer on-demand portal (Galaxy) with access to appropriate targeted content Where needed for the assigned BU, appropriately support customers or accounts on relevant contract value opportunities and virtual in-services on ready-to-use delivery systems. Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree Fluent in English, written and spoken Goal-oriented individual with a strong desire to be in promotional role; have core skills of customer service orientation, initiative, planning and follow up, work management, and judgment/problem solving Able to be on telephone or other virtual platforms for a full working day and speak clearly and effectively to all assigned customers Demonstrated digital acumen Must live within or be wiling to move to a commutable distance to assigned Pfizer Connect Center location Strong organizational and analytical skills are required and ability to analyze and draw relevant conclusions using available data and information Demonstrates change agility; accountability; takes/seeks feedback; the ability to be connected to others; remote collaboration with cross-functional internal teams Market place and business acumen, stakeholder management; and understanding the business priorities The ability to develop strong professional relationships / networks in a dynamic and challenging environment Exceptional time management skills; intrinsically productive and scheduled, even in the absence of direct management oversight Preferred Qualifications 1+ years of previous sales experience preferred Working knowledge of sales operations including: data/reports, call planning, and sales tactics preferred. Preference for individuals who are mobile for potential future career opportunities Non-standard Work Schedule, Travel Or Environment Requirements Some domestic travel may be required Other Job Details: Last Date to Apply for Job: Accepting Applications on a rolling basis Additional Location Information: Selected candidate will be located at our Tampa site. This is not a virtual role. Eligible for Employee Referral Bonus Hire Date: February 2022 Pfizer requires all U.S. new hires to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 prior to the first date of employment. As required by applicable law, Pfizer will consider requests for Reasonable Accommodations.  Sunshine Act  Pfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care provider’s name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. If you have questions regarding this matter, please do not hesitate to contact your Talent Acquisition representative.  EEO & Employment Eligibility  Pfizer is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. Pfizer is an E-Verify employer.  Sales

description: Who We Are Mayanalytics is a technology and data company that develops growth automation software for Amazon sellers. Our initial product set includes: Advertising management, which optimizes the performance of our customers' campaigns to deliver higher sales and profits Inventory optimization, which utilizes forecasting based on organic and ad-driven sales to predict when inventory needs to be restocked We are a venture-backed and Y Combinator (W21) startup that is delivering significant results for our customers across the growing e-commerce space. We are looking to expand the team! For more information about Mayanalytics, please visit www.mayanalytics.com.  Our Culture We value data-driven processes through innovation, collaboration, and a passion for getting things done. For our hires, we aim to cultivate the best + diverse employees as we continue to foster a culture of open communication and transparency. We are redefining what it means to be a remote company with team members living and working across the globe. Work from anywhere and if you and other team members want to work together in Mexico, USA, Spain, wherever — we will help facilitate that. We embrace world-views, diversity in background, diversity in make-up, and diversity in thought. We are driven and hard-working but also committed to having fun along the way with weekly virtual happy hours, semi-annual offsites, and unlimited paid time off. We embrace life-work balance. We know you have a life outside of Mayanalytics and we want to help you nurture that too. We understand that helping you stay happy and healthy are key ingredients to enable you to deliver your best work.  The Team At Mayanalytics, we build innovative tech products that create significant competitive advantages for our customers. Transparency, quality, urgency, and intellectual honesty are central tenets of our work ethics while embracing experimentation and collaboration to produce results that customers love. The core MIT founding team brings experience across e-commerce, tech infrastructure, marketing, finance and deep expertise in the Amazon seller ecosystem. Our founder brings experience of being an early team member at the fastest U.S. startup on record to reach "unicorn" status - also operating within the Amazon ecosystem.  The Role As an Inside Sales Rep, you will be supported by Mayanalytics executives and fellow team members from sales, customer success, and marketing to continue the growth of our customer base. Our sales team is often the first line of communication with customers, so strong social skills are key. Mayanalytics has a strong record of growing revenues for our customers, and the Sales Rep will have supporting collateral and case studies from these customers to help close deals. The Sales Rep will play a crucial role in implementing, improving, and maintaining sales strategies and material. This role will also help in the strategy of sales account management. Your expertise and enthusiasm will drive the Mayanalytics sales team forward into a continually-improved, well-built flywheel.  You will bring: Self-motivation and a drive to succeed within a team and high-growth startup environment A solid work and professional ethic - a self-starter with an ability to manage multiple priorities A minimum of 2 years of sales experience**,** with a track record of successfully exceeding quota targets B2B or SaaS sales experience, with an understanding of ecommerce and digital advertising A data-driven approach to both creating a sales pipeline as well as closing deals Learnings and best practices from your previous roles, and collaborate in learning ours Presentation skills that bring data and our results to life A competitive streak to beat your goals and help the sales team win, quarter over quarter  Qualifications Must Haves: 2+ years working in a successful sales organization Strong business intuition and ability to understand metrics and data insights Proficiency in working with CRMs (HubSpot or Salesforce) Familiarity with ecommerce, specifically Amazon Attention to detail in documenting contacts, tracking progress Ability to run due diligence in prospecting customers, track prospects, and deliver an honest outlook on likelihood of closing prospects in the sales funnel Ability to learn a new industry and sets of products Experience with sales tactics such as prospecting, cold-calling, and creating and developing email cadences Developed repeatable processes that help close deals Cross-team/department collaboration & inclusion Ability to complete and execute sales contracts Excellent communication and organizational skills required  Nice to Haves: Experience with advertising, inventory, or analytics industry is a plus Digital media ad sales experience is a plus Strong personal network with potential to reach Amazon sellers Experience in a tech startup Experience in going to conferences, career fairs, and other networking events where social skills are crucial  Benefits Competitive pay (base plus commission) Unlimited paid time off (PTO) Fully remote - work from anywhere you're comfortable Stipend for laptop & home office set up Semiannual company-wide offsite trips 401(k) investing plan with employer match Health benefits Paid maternity/paternity leave  Mayanalytics does not accept/pay fees for unsolicited resumes from third-party agencies/vendors.  As part of our dedication to our workforce’s diversity, Mayanalytics is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.

Qualifications: Extremely motivated and hard-working with a willingness to learn about the sales cycle Excellent communication, presentation skills, customer service and phone presence Confidence, grit and a go-getter mentality  Plusses: Previous Sales Experience SaaS knowledge or exposure  What you bring to the team: The ideal candidate for this position is someone who has a strong interest for growing and advancing their career in Business Development. This person is interested in understanding the supply chain industry and how Software as a Service advances the space. description: Smartsheet is excited to hire a Sales Development Representative to provide pre-sales support and help set the tone for the sales cycle following. Capability of understanding customer pain points, requirements and delivering a response presenting Smartsheet as a solution Aptitude to manage numerous requests and time demands concurrently, while achieving production goals from assigned territory or set of accounts Perks & Benefits 100% employer-paid medical, dental, and vision coverage for full-time employees Equity - Restricted Stock Units (RSUs) Equity with all offers Lucrative Employee Stock Purchase Program (15% discount) 401k Match to help you save for your future (50% of your contribution up to the first 6% of your eligible play) Monthly stipend to support your work and productivity 15 days PTO to start, plus Flexible Sick Leave Up to 24 weeks of Parental Leave Personal paid Volunteer Day to support our community Opportunities for professional growth and development including access to Audible for Business and LinkedIn Learning online courses Company Funded Perks, including a counseling membership, primary care membership, local retail discounts, and your own personal Smartsheet account Teleworking options from any registered location in the U.S. (role specific) About Smartsheet  Smartsheet is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to fostering an inclusive environment with the best employees. We provide employment opportunities without regard to any legally protected status in accordance with applicable laws in the US, UK, and Australia. If there are preparations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.  At Smartsheet, we strive to build an inclusive environment that encourages, supports, and celebrates the diverse voices of our team members who also represent the diverse needs of our customers. We’re looking for people who are driven, authentic, supportive, effective, and honest. description: Remote  About Pantheon  Pantheon is the only WebOps platform built from the ground up for agility. We help our customers win, where the digital experience starts and matters most - their websites. We empower teams of developers, marketers, and IT professionals to focus on delivering business results while Pantheon handles uptime, performance, scalability, and security. We are the fastest growing Drupal and WordPress platform in the world, powering over 285,000 sites and serving billions of pages every month. Happy customers include some of the most recognized names in high tech, higher education, and NGOs, such as Patch, Apigee, UC Berkeley, Arizona State University, and the United Nations.  With 35% of the web running open-source and significant investments in a $200 billion total addressable market, we are growing aggressively into a huge market opportunity and looking to expand our sales organization.  The Role  You will have the exciting opportunity to be the first BDR hired outside of our San Francisco headquarters. Your role will be to generate sales opportunities through a deep understanding of companies within a territory and using outbound prospecting strategies to set meetings.  With a strong interest in starting or expanding your skills as a Sales Hunter and Farmer, you will support our Enterprise Sales Team by managing a flow of inbound leads within your own territory.  Cool Things You’ll Do Create new opportunities in the enterprise direct & digital agency channel market for the enterprise and inside sales teams through managing inbound interest across multiple territories via a main sales line, form submissions, and chat Effectively sell the value of Pantheon to key stakeholders via managing an outbound pipeline within your assigned territory Conduct high volume of calls and emails to connect with prospects within your territory Work closely with assigned enterprise sales representative(s) Travel to marketing & community-based events for sales support Smash weekly, monthly, and quarterly and annual targets What You Bring To The Table 1+ years of work experience (relevance is a plus, not required) BA/BS degree or equivalent Bonus Points for Proficient with Salesforce CRM, SalesLoft, ZoomInfo, and other sales platforms Experience with inbound or outbound sales development Working experience at a SaaS or fast-paced startup environment Experience selling a SaaS, PaaS, CMS or similar Familiarity with Drupal and/or WordPress What We Offer  We have all the usual perks and benefits but what we can really offer you is a fantastic work environment powered by an amazing team. Industry competitive compensation and stock option plan Unlimited time off and sick days Full medical coverage (medical, dental, vision) Top-of-line equipment Fun at WordPress and Drupal community events Extra benefits like a stipend for reading books and your work-outs and a whole suite of paid apps for mental as well as physical health and wellbeing Events and activities both team-based and company wide that inspire, educate and cultivate Pantheon is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other classification protected by law.  Visa Sponsorship is not available at this time.  #LI -NG1

description: SEASONAL SALES SUPPORT Moncler NYC is seeking seasonal sales support to join us during our busiest time of the year. Our seasonal staff provide assistance to sales staff with customer purchases, and support all front and back-of house operations. This role will last for about 3-5 months based on business needs. Weekend and Holiday availability is a must.   ABOUT THE BUSINESS: Moncler was founded in Grenoble, France, in 1952 and is currently headquartered in Milan, Italy. Over the years the brand has combined style with constant technological research assisted by experts in activities linked to the world of the mountain. This makes the Moncler collections the quintessence of outwear that marries the extreme demands of nature with those of city life. In 2003 Remo Ruffini took over the company, of which he is currently President and Creative Director. Moncler manufactures and directly distributes men's, women's and accessory collections through its boutiques and in exclusive international department stores and multi-brand outlets..  RESPONSIBILITIES: Provide support to sales team Greet customers and ensure sales staff is available to assist them Assist in running merchandise from stock room to sales floor Provide stock support to Operations Supervisor Receive phone orders and provide high level of customer service Assisting with both front and back of house operations  QUALIFICATIONS: Interest in retail or previous experience in luxury retail sector 1-2 experience in high volume, customer driven retail environment Ability to lift (at least 25 lbs.), carry, push/pull, kneel, climb, reach and bend Open availability and flexibility to work days, nights, weekends, holidays, store openings/closings, to meet the needs of the business   ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS: Must have authorization to work in the US and/or Canada Must be willing to work on weekends and flexibility for overtime with short notice Must be 18 years or older or have working papers   DESIRED CHARACTERISITCS: Results-driven and customer focused Ability to communicate with co-workers and customers alike Possess strong attention to detail and can work with numbers Ability to operate and use all equipment necessary within the store Ability to work varied hours and days to ensure store is fully operational Ability to stand and walk for up to six hours each work day
