description: Female-founded and female-led, Knack Collective is a strategic consultancy and creative studio with diversity at our core. We use proven resourcing models to build an agile team of expert talent for each project, leveraging our expertise in MarTech enablement and activation, channel marketing and sales programs, and award-winning creative. We understand today’s consumer, who is increasingly diverse, so that we can help our clients authentically engage and connect with their audience—and transform their business. At our core, we see diversity as our strength and a key strategic asset for our clients. We embrace individuality. We are fiercely inclusive, from ideas to identities. We ask, “Why not?” Because at Knack we believe that when you look at a problem differently, brilliant solutions arise.  Knack Collective is in search of a skilled Sales Engagement Coordinator (known internally as a Client Engagement Coordinator) that will support the Client Engagement and Business Development team with management of Salesforce, updating opportunities, scheduling and attending meetings for new opportunities and managing follow-up, coordinating execution of SOWs, sending out proposals, build decks, get case studies, write proposal drafts, and more. The Client Engagement Coordinator will have the ability to both think strategically and execute operationally. We’re looking for candidates that can solve ambiguous problems and have the initiative to propose new ideas and recommend solutions while providing excellent customer service.  Who You Are: Fearlessly Bold – You consistently seek new challenges and bring a creative and growth mindset to the work that you do. You are curious. You ask, “why not” and recognize that failure is an integral part of our growth.  Fiercely Inclusive – You contribute to our safe workplace where people of all identities are welcome. You seek and embrace diversity of thought and encourage all voices to be heard. You remain open to different possibilities and are comfortable being wrong.  Radically Transparent – You recognize that great ideas can come from anywhere. You engage in discourse and debate founded on data not emotion. You evaluate ideas without ego and move only the best solutions forward. You do this, and all things, with respect and kindness.  Courageously Authentic – We deploy high levels of integrity to everything we do. We express honestly about how we feel, providing direct and timely feedback to move forward, together. We are compassionate to ourselves and others, recognizing the humor and humanity in all of us. We are all a little weird (and we like it that way).  Responsibilities: Support Client Engagement and Business Development team with daily operations Assist in management of the new business intake process, including scheduling and attending new opportunity meetings with clients, executing timely follow-up, opportunity management within CRM tools, development of SOWs and contracting, etc.  Drive opportunity management processes in Salesforce to ensure visibility and engagement on opportunities, supporting regular leadership reporting Execute creation of new business proposals, including building sales decks and case studies Assist in meetings with clients to discuss and close new opportunities Deliver consistent and exceptional support to our sales organization Act as liaison between cross-functional departments, as needed Efficient and goal-oriented with a growth mindset   Job Requirements: 3+ years’ experience as Sales Coordinator or similar (Client Success Manager, Business Development, Project Management, etc.) Experience managing multiple projects and customer onboarding processes Experience working within Salesforce is a must Experience in a client facing role with excellent customer relationship management skills is a must Understanding of the B2B digital marketing space and experience working with enterprise cloud technology clients is a plus Marketing agency and/or start-up environment experience a plus Experience with Excel, Outlook, Slack, Teams, etc.  Knack Collective is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
industries: Marketing and Advertising

description: Sales Development Representative / Business Development Representative  Want to empower digital business through real-time analytics delivered as a service? Passionate about putting the power of machine data analytics in the hands of everyone by unifying all data types, enabling universal access and leveraging cloud economics – all this from a single, unified platform delivered and consumed as a service? Come talk with us!  Our Business Development Representatives are a key part of a Regional Sales team consisting of a Sales Manager and Mid-Market or Enterprise Account Executives. You will support all levels of the sales organization by finding new revenue opportunities that add to the total pipeline. You will foster relationships with Account Executives, Regional Sales Managers, and potential future customers.  What makes a Sales Development / Business Development Representative successful? We are a team of intuitive, passionate hunters looking for green-field opportunities within potential customers. And we like to have fun.  We have a demonstrated track record of providing growth opportunities to our SDR team members to transition down the AE track, Customer Success or Marketing.  What You'll Be Working On Prospect and generate leads with companies within a defined territory Leverage a modern lead generation tool stack, including Discover.org, Linkedin, ZoomInfo and Outreach Collaborate closely with Sales Managers and Account Executives to establish a territory "plan-of-attack", including target companies, target prospects, and messaging/talk-tracks Set up new meetings to hand off to our Account Executive teams Learn, leverage, and help evolve our demand generation process Qualify opportunities and handle objections Participate in regular training & informational sessions Achieve or exceed monthly quotas of Qualified Opportunities and Closed Business Conduct high-level conversations with Senior Executives in Target and Prospect Accounts Create, prioritize, and qualify strategic target account lists within a defined territory Research and build new and existing accounts (i.e. adding contacts, sending regular emails, coordinating strategic discovery meetings) Your Experience And Skills Should Include History of quota over-achievement Thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth, rapidly changing environment Bachelor’s degree These additional skills would be highly desirable: Previous experience in a lead generation role a plus SaaS experience a plus This role is for talent looking to continue their career in sales. If you are naturally curious, a strong communicator, and have a hunger to learn, Sumo Logic is the place for you to launch your sales career! We offer our BDRs multiple career paths/opportunities in various lines of business at Sumo Logic.  Still interested? We’d love to hear from you! Apply now and learn more about our purpose !  ___________________________________________________________________________  About Us: https://app.box.com/v/SLGeneralDossier What we do: We are a cloud-native SaaS machine data analytics platform, solving complex monitoring problems for DevOps, SecOps and ITOps teams. Customers love our product because it allows them to easily monitor and optimize their mission critical, large scale applications. Mission: Democratize machine data analytics through the Sumo Logic platform, bringing real-time data insights securely through the cloud. Massive Scale: Our microservices architecture in AWS ingests hundreds of terabytes daily across many geographic regions. Millions of queries a day analyze hundreds of petabytes of data.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Outside Sales Representative - New Jersey $60 - $80K First Year (Base plus Commission) Guaranteed $55k Year 1& 2  Good things come to those who wait, like earning over $100,000 a YEAR. And look, you’re in sales, so you understand that patience is a virtue.  The first year will see you lay the foundations. By year two, you’re getting there - with a structure in place for your income to build up on top. But it’s that third year when you’ve established your client base and cemented those key relationships where the rewards will truly flourish. In the case of this Trade Sales Rep role, you can expect to start hitting 6 figures.  Because let’s face it. Making a huge splash right off the bat means you’re either having serious beginner’s luck, or you’re working for Jordan Belfort. And we all know how that ended.  There are no wolves here, so you won’t need to pick up the phone and start dialing. You’re going to be mostly out in the field - meeting with builders, architects, designers, and contractors. In time, you’ll become their go-to contact for high-end building supplies and installations.  To help you succeed, our brand-new showroom and experience center will place your products center stage, allowing your prospects to see them in the best possible light. You’ll get support from management, ownership and autonomy, and the power of an industry-leading brand behind you. Anything is possible here if you’ve got the right skills and attitude.  You will be challenged. But then, you chose sales... Would you have it any other way?  It’s important that you’re energized by the hunt (showing the type of enthusiasm for your work that can’t be faked). You’re from a B2B sales background and you’ll be willing to put in the work and be motivated by the potential returns. Otherwise, what’s the point?  You’ll get a $55k guarantee for 2 years. You’ll likely earn between $60-80k in years 1 & 2, but after that, you’d be expected to earn 6 figures. Ideally, you’ll be based somewhere near Paramus, NJ.  So. If you’re ready to start building up to a level of income that could change the entire trajectory of your life, then hit the apply now button or call 877.860.6767 and ask for Andy Schmad (or email him at aschmad@persevus.com). And don’t worry if your resume isn’t up to date; we’ll suss out the details later.    And we don’t ghost people, so expect a response in the not-so-distant future.  Andy Schmad, Talent Scout (877)860-6767 - Ask for me aschmad@persevus.com https://www.linkedin.com/in/andyschmad/
industries: Building Materials and Construction

description: Due to COVID-19, Knock is currently operating as a remote company and all interviews will be conducted over phone or Zoom video calls. We plan to return to an office setting eventually, but that timeline has yet to be determined. When we do re-open our office, we will do so in a manner that is safe and comfortable for our employees and partners. We will continue to be remote-friendly for most employees and have opened up most of our positions to be either Seattle-based, hybrid office/work from home, or completely remote. It is also important to note that we are only able to hire employees who are eligible to work and are based in the US.  The Role  Knock is the leader in Sales, Marketing, and CRM technology for the property management industry. Our CRM and leasing tools are the center of how customers operate their portfolios, creating an opportunity to create a growing ecosystem of integration partners that improve product experience, sales outcomes, retention, and a number growth objectives.  We are seeking a Sales Development Representative (SDR) to join our growing team. In this role, you will be responsible for a quota of delivering sales qualified opportunities. This is a great opportunity for someone with a passion for sales and relationship building to come into a company, learn the product and processes, and have a direct impact on company revenue goals. This position will report to the Director of Sales.  The Team  The Go-To-Market team, which includes Marketing, Sales and Customer Success, is a high energy group that loves evangelizing and delivering industry leading business solutions to both new and existing customers. A happy customer is the best business strategy of all.  The primary objectives of the go-to market team:Generating pipeline for new, quality sales opportunitiesLand new customersExpand business within our existing customersRetain 100% of our customers  Day - to - Day Account research & discovery Inbound / outbound prospecting Daily activities in order to hit your monthly quotas 30 / 60 / 90 day goals: 30 days - learning Knock and processes 60 days - successfully doing prospecting calls (inbound and outbound) 90 days - hitting monthly quotas Basic Qualifications You are a proactive thinker, self starter, and learner You have the ability to handle rejection Must have: Some type of cold calling or sales experience or customer service job, familiarity with software / technology, and a strong level of task management Nice to have: B2B SaaS exposure, startup experience, Multifamily industry, and/or you have been a Knock customer Why You'll Love It Here! You'll join a category-creating company that has enthusiastic customers, an ambitious roadmap, and industry leading products. You are comfortable taking risks and thinking outside the box. Being part of a great team with solid infrastructure in place. You want an opportunity to win, drive change and be in an environment that will optimize for your success. You embrace our set of core values - determination, excellence, trust, and community. 100% medical, dental, and vision coverage for full-time employees. Partial family coverage optional. Flexible time off & paid holidays Parental leave program 401k to help you save for the future Stock options We like to do fun things together (Virtual for now!) such as conferences, off site retreats, and happy hours.  About Knock  We started Knock to solve problems we faced ourselves. One of those problems was that the process for renting an apartment hadn’t evolved at the same pace as technology. Our mission was to improve the experience for both apartment renters and managers.  We’ve developed an industry-defining SaaS platform, an intelligent front office platform providing the productivity and business intelligence tools needed to maximize occupancy, rent growth, and customer satisfaction at every community. Our customers trust us to deliver the consumer experiences and business applications that are essential to their bottom line. The proof is in our 10x revenue growth over the past two years, in addition to our numerous industry awards.  In February 2021 we raised an additional $20 million in a growth funding round led by Fifth Wall, the largest venture capital firm focused on the global real estate industry and the clear leader in PropTech investing. This investment, our largest fundraise to date, will be invested directly into further innovation on behalf of the awesome #multifamily industry: http://bit.ly/knock-5thwall  Past investors include Madrona Venture Group, Lead Edge Capital, Seven Peaks Ventures and Second Avenue Partners.  Our Values  To be successful and recognized as a high performer at Knock, you should naturally encompass our core values: Determination, Excellence, Trust and Community. We take these behaviors seriously and expect everyone to bring a positive Knockstar attitude with them to work every day.  At Knock, we have a #oneteam philosophy. A big part of bringing new capabilities to life is to continue to bring in exceptional talent that works together toward a common goal. We’ve been incredibly fortunate to build an amazing team that delivers real value to our customers each and every day. We can’t wait to hear from you!  Awards  Most Recently These Awards Have Included  We have been recognized over the past several years across multiple platforms as a best place to work.  2021 Built In Seattle's 100 Best Places to Work  2021 Built In Seattle's 50 Best Small Companies to Work  2021 Best Places to Work Multifamily®  2021 Best Places to Work Multifamily® for Women  Important Information  Knock is committed to creating a diverse environment and is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or other characteristics protected by applicable laws. We welcome all, and encourage all to apply!  Please know that due to the nature of our business and housing potentially sensitive data, a background check is required to join Knock. We will, nonetheless, consider qualified applicants for employment with arrest and conviction records in a manner consistent with local requirements.  Knock uses the E-Verify employment verification program.
industries: Computer Software

description: At Emburse our mission is to help make our users’ lives -- and their businesses - better. We are dramatically transforming how organizations manage corporate expenses and invoices. We humanize work by automating manual tasks and saving users’ time, so they can focus on what matters most -- their family, community, or more rewarding work. We help CFO's give their employees a simple and amazing experience while ensuring compliance and reducing costs. Our solutions are tailored for companies from start-ups to enterprises. We have more than 16,000 clients and 9 million users globally.  Emburse has offices across North America, including Los Angeles, Montreal, Portland (ME), San Diego, San Francisco, and Toronto, as well as locations in the UK, Germany, Spain, and Australia.  Our core values - Sincerity, Empathy, Empowerment, Individuality, and Teamwork - reflect who we are as a company. They are central to the decisions we make and the interactions we have with our teams, customers, and partners. As a people-focused company, we are seeking candidates who align with our values.  Emburse is a proud recipient of a 2020 Tech Cares Award from TrustRadius and a 2020 IDC SaaS CSAT Award for Travel and Expense. These awards celebrate companies that have gone above and beyond to provide their communities, clients, and front-line workers with support during the COVID-19 pandemic. We are a people-first company, and this award is a testament to our mission to humanize work.  Follow us to stay updated on news and job openings!  The Business Development team within Emburse serves as a crucial part of the overall Sales organization in building both sales pipeline and nurturing our next group of rising sales stars. On the Business Development team, you will have the opportunity to learn the FinTech software space from the ground up and work alongside our world class Sales team to cultivate new sales opportunities.  What You'll Do Develop new sales qualified opportunities via telephone and email communication within a marketing and sales driven ICP (Ideal Company Profile) focused list of accounts Deliver on key metrics, including but not limited to call volume, frequency and length, and email volume Conduct research to identify potential prospects, ideally influencers and decision makers, within each ICP; import and convert these prospects within SalesForce.com and begin outreach campaigns Conduct research on specific Accounts and Contacts to familiarize, understand and implement key pieces of customized information for targeted and personalized communication Build and cultivate prospective relationships by initiating communications and conducting follow-up communications to move opportunities through the sales funnel; scheduling needs analysis calls and demonstrations for the enterprise and strategic markets Work with Manager, Demand Generation, Sales Managers and VPs of Sales and Marketing to develop and grow the sales pipeline Manage data on prospective clients in Salesforce.com. Contribute to quarterly additions and omissions of ICP list based on direct communication and likelihood of winning business What We're Looking For College Degree 1+ years’ experience in a B2B sales prospecting and cultivating business via email and phone (INBOUND & OUTBOUND.) Working knowledge of SalesForce.com Familiarity with Pardot, Engage, LinkedIn.com, Discover.Org and/or Data.com is preferred, but not required Experience with telephone sales calling techniques and etiquette within a professional B2B market Strong influencing and negotiation skills Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and Google Workspace Excellent communication skills, both oral and written Ability to work autonomously and as part of a team Strong organization skills and ability to manage multiple high priority projects simultaneously and successfully Occasional lifting up to 50 pounds Must be able to work in a climate controlled, office environment Have close visual acuity to perform an activity such as: preparing and analyzing data and figures, transcribing, viewing a computer terminal, and extensive reading Perceiving the nature of sounds at normal speaking levels with or without correction. Ability to receive detailed information through oral communication, and to make the discriminations in sound Sitting for extended periods of time Manual dexterity needed for keyboarding and other repetitive tasks Emburse provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Emburse complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location where the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment.  NXTThing RPO brings our clients the ultimate blend of technology and service.  NXTThing is a recruitment process outsourcing (RPO) company that is creating differentiated RPO services that change how companies hire talent into their organization.  Recruiting is an art AND a science and NXTThing RPO will deliver solutions that leverage innovative tools and technology where it makes sense for our clients and candidates while relying on our recruiting experts to leverage the element of personal connection at critical stages in the process. We educate companies on the talent challenges surrounding their company and rebuild their talent acquisition process from the ground up with innovation and technology. We have multiple delivery options and a world class leadership team who is committed to the success of your hiring initiatives.
industries: Staffing and Recruiting

description: At RxVantage we transform how medical practices engage with life sciences resources and expertise to improve patient care. Our platform intelligently connects healthcare providers with the precise life sciences experts that they need, when they need them. As a result, medical practices stay on the cutting edge of patient care without disrupting workflows. Trusted by more than 6,000 medical practices and all major life science companies, RxVantage has powered over 5 million educational exchanges between healthcare teams and life sciences companies.  Location:  Our "Work from Anywhere" philosophy is aimed at making sure we bring a diverse range of thought leadership so that our technology is better able to serve local health care providers. Our goal is to hire the country's top talent and allow them to create an environment where they can do their best work.  We're looking for a Sales Development Representative who will help build our Sales Development organization. This is a vital role within the company as we continue to scale. We expect the person to work with our marketing and sales teams to identify and conduct outreach to medical practices that are a fit for our free platform. The ideal person is someone who has natural sales instincts and sound business insight. The ideal person for our team is someone who has a persuasive personality and a passion for winning to get prospects excited about our free platform and ultimately schedule demos with our account executive team. The ideal person has great communication and organizational skills, and can function both independently as well as a member of a team. Failure doesn't deter you, and you are always prepared and professional. You want to be the best.  What you'll be doing: Generate new sales leads through a mixture of outbound calling and emailing, following up on marketing campaigns and inbound inquiries Create a great first impression to our prospects by inspiring them to learn how RxVantage can benefit their business Understand RxVantage's offerings and effectively communicate and apply them to each prospects needs Schedule meetings and product demos for Account Executives Accurately enter, update, and maintain daily activity and prospect information in Salesforce.com, and outreach.io, including comprehensive and up-to-date client information Achieve and exceed monthly quotas and objectives Work closely with Sales and Marketing team members to achieve organizational goals  The ideal candidate: 6+ months in a qualifying or prospecting role required A BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience Intellect, passion, curiosity, hunger, and grit Critical thinking and strong decision-making abilities A resilient and persuasive personality  Benefits: Competitive Salary + Commission for Certain Roles 100% Company-Paid Premiums for Employee's Medical Health, Vision, and Dental Plans Short-term and Long-term Disability Life Insurance 401k Matching Work from Anywhere! Flexible PTO - Take the time when you want it!   RxVantage is an equal opportunity employer and dedicated to ensuring that we represent the local communities where our health and wellbeing providers serve as pillars of support to our family, friends, and neighbors. Our representation within these communities allows us to embody a diverse set of backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives; and provide an inclusive environment for our team to feel empowered to be their authentic selves, without fear of harassment or discrimination.
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: Resident is an industry-leader in the Direct-to-Consumer mattress and home furnishings category. Since our founding of the award-winning Nectar Sleep in 2016 (with over 1 million happy sleepers and counting), we have also launched the Dreamcloud, Awara and Level Sleep brands to cater to a variety of sleep preferences. Our mission is simple, we strive to make inspiring products people love coming home to (and to help everyone afford a great night's sleep)!  Our company is built around continuously improving our ability to introduce new customers to our products, and wow them with exceptional experiences through the shopping and post purchase journey. We love to use data and metrics to drive our decisions, while keeping in mind that customers don’t speak in numbers, and that each one should be treated as a member of our family.  Oh, and by the way - we’ve been doing the “remote work thing” since the day we started. So you can expect a hard working team of people that understands how to create meaningful connections and get great work done virtually - it’s in our nature!  Resident’s ideal candidate for this position: a self-starter with an ability to adapt quickly in a fast-paced remote environment who communicates effectively. Enjoys customer management through the entire sales cycle while having the ability for unlimited earning potential. Our Sales Representatives convey passion for our products and their customers each and every day.  This is a Remote, Work from Home opportunity. Candidate must be available to work any Full Time 40 hour work week. Currently, our team has 4 open shifts available (we operate 365 days per year): 8:45a-5:15p, 10:45a-7:15p, 12:45p-9:15p, 4:45p-1:15a EST. Candidates must be willing to work weekends & key holidays. To be considered, candidates must reside and be authorized to work in the United States. Additionally, you must have a dedicated quiet work space to be considered for this role.  What You'll Be Doing Live and breathe a Customer First mindset Provide a world class sales experience to customers and prospects via phone, email, and chat Use a sales oriented mindset to manage customer requests and order generation Comfortable handling a high volume of product and service questions Use our data driven marketing tools to help drive sales via various warm leads on inbound channels and sales interactions Utilize your innate sales skills- active listening, qualifying customers, and helping lead the customer to the right product for them Keeps retention top of mind by creating opportunities and options for customers interested in cancelling/returning orders Be able to treat each customer with respect, empathy and understanding, no matter what kind of day you’re having Be prepared to become a ‘mattress and sleep expert’ - open to learning new concepts, adept at remembering details, quick on your feet with accurate recall of key information Keen to solve problems - do a little research to get the whole picture, and navigate towards customer centric solutions within the parameters of established policies Comfortable engaging non-stop throughout your shift with customers via phone and email Willingness to participate by video chat on all internal team meetings Surface what you see - share your front line insights with team leads, supervisors and managers to help drive continuous improvement in our customer experience Help customers and prospects find the best products to meet their needs - always be looking for opportunities to bring more of our products into customer homes to improve their quality of life - after all - what’s more important than a great night’s sleep? Get excited to come to work every day - bring your best self, be a great team member and get to know fellow employees located around the world! Requirements A minimum of 1 year of sales and customer support experience in any environment A minimum of 1 year working in a contact center environment, either remotely or in person - you thrive on phone, chat and email Have experience handling a high volume of tickets Excellent written and spoken English Strong conflict resolution and de-escalation skills Highly detail oriented with excellent documentation skills and sense of personal accountability Ability to bring an upbeat, professional and respectful approach to work each day Experience/proficiency in programs such as Kustomer, Chat Tools, Zendesk, Google Suite, Slack Comfortability and familiarity with working from home and being a self-starter Tech savvy with the ability to type at approximately 50+ WPM (ideally) Blazing fast internet connection in your zen work sanctuary We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, ancestry, sex, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin, citizenship, genetics, disability, age, veteran status or other characteristics.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Online Media, and Consumer Goods

description: Job Description  The primary focus of an Internet Sales representative is to sell solutions and services to existing Oracle customers and to prospect for new customers in the assigned territory or vertical.  The primary focus of an Internet Sales representative is to sell solutions and services to existing Oracle customers and to prospect for new customers in the assigned territory or vertical.  As an Internet Sales Representative you will sell products and services to an assigned geographic or national account base territory to achieve assigned objectives. Generates sales leads as well as closing the sales on line or by phone. Utilizes inbound and/or outbound calls to pursue sales. Develops account penetration strategies, and closes business. Responsible for understanding Oracle's product offerings and competitive issues. Identifies new business opportunities by creating and implementing territory campaigns with management assistance. Liaise with customer contacts for the purpose of managing the customer relationship, identifying new opportunities, and selling Oracle products and services. Participates as a team member on sales teams including field sales, support and education sales and sales consulting.  Work involves some problem solving with assistance and guidance in understanding and applying company policies and procedures. Works under close supervision. Seeks intervention from his/her manager on complex deals that fall outside of existing guidelines. Two or more years of high tech sales experience. Ability to communicate effectively over the telephone with high level decision makers. Ability to work independently. Typically bachelor degree in Business or Computer Science or equivalent  If you are a Colorado resident, Please Contact us or Email us at oracle-salary-inquiries_us@oracle.com to receive compensation and benefits information for this role. Please include this Job ID: 123429 in the subject line of the email.  About Us  Innovation starts with inclusion at Oracle. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can be themselves and do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued, that we are inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. That’s why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.  Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: We are looking to expand our sales presence by adding an Inside Sales team. The Inside Sales Representative will be responsible for prospecting, qualifying and generating new sales leads. This individual will be a highly motivated, self-starter able to identify and develop new business prospects from multiple sources including inbound marketing leads, prospect lists, discovery and individual research. The ideal candidate will possess both a sales and technical background that enables them to successfully manage a high volume of activity. This is an outstanding opportunity to join a fast growing company leading the third wave of energy information. Core Responsibilities: · Achieve sales revenue targets · Conduct daily discovery calls, hitting daily minimum of call activity · Develop new business via telephone and mass communication such as email and social media to introduce the suite of Oseberg products. · Determine customer requirements and expectations in order to recommend specific products and solutions · Prepare and conduct virtual presentations, while maintaining effective communication with customer decision makers and influencers. · Provide Customer quotes, proposals, order forms, and product information as required · Respond to internal and external customers in a timely manner · Use Salesforce to document all customer opportunities and customer activities · Maintain basic knowledge of Oseberg products, competition and industry trends · Accurately forecast on monthly and quarterly basis to management. Qualifications: •Bachelor’s degree preferred •Proven Inside Sales Experience •Track record of over-achieving quota •Experience working with Salesforce or similar CRM •Excellent verbal and written communication skills •Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively •High level of accountability and ownership of goals and performance targets •Previous experience within Oil & Gas preferred but not required

Growth oriented company based in Orange County looking for a sales representative to manage an existing territory and to pursue new business. The company distributes laboratory supplies - consumables and equipment for analysis of water by analytical chemistry and clinical labs in the public health sector. The territory would include California, Reno, Las Vegas, and Arizona.  The position would require 40-50% travel. Candidates need to have a high school diploma with a college AA or degree preferred. Technical aptitude and willingness to learn basics of analytical chemistry is required. Distributor sales experience a plus.  Compensation would include a base salary, commissions, expenses, car allowance, and partially subsidized health insurance, vision & dental. 401K plan is available. Full training provided with sales materials and territory prospects. Send your resume to rnelson@evantec.com.

description: Brand Sales Specialist  All Market Inc. is and independent parent company of PWR LIFT, Vita Coco, RUNA, Ever & Ever. Despite its growth and success, we maintain the same entrepreneurial spirit upon which we were founded: a can-do culture that’s just beginning to tap into the potential of healthy, better for you beverages. AMI is headquartered in New York City and is looking for a Part-Time Brand Sales Specialist, based in Phoenix, Arizona, to focus on all things PWR LIFT and help bring our brand to the next level.  What’s the gig? You won’t find any cubicles here; this isn’t your typical 9-5. Our sales force is out and about in the local market, bringing the brand to life through various responsibilities. This role is all about forming and developing relationships with our accounts and making PWR LIFT win at retail.  Who is the ideal Brand Sales Specialist? The perfect candidate is flexible, enthusiastic, sociable, and fully alive! An entrepreneurial spirit, along with a great work ethic is the key to success. First impressions are everything – this person must have excellent communication skills, and a well-presented appearance is essential.  As a PWR LIFT Brand Sales Specialist, you will: ·      Be an expert in all things PWR LIFT ·      Find new accounts and sell in ·      Merchandise accounts ·      Visit our top stores to reinforce strong relationships ·      Seed product in existing and potential accounts ·      Be willing to learn and participate in all aspects of PWR LIFT  In addition, you will be an expert in engaging with decision makers. You will: ·      Exude confidence and own every interaction while being an active listener ·      Be a social chameleon; adapt to consumers from all walks of life through engaging and natural dialogue ·      Collaborate effectively within a team environment ·      Bring new ideas to the team and report on best practices ·      Be capable of spotting future opportunities for PWR LIFT  Desired Skills and Experience ·      Excellent communication skills with an outgoing personality ·      A mature mindset and total go-getter ·      Lover of the brand and category ·      Ability to adapt to and work well in all environments ·      Reliable means of transportation (personal vehicle) and valid driver’s license ·      Appropriate availability (per market need) ·      Flexible schedule ·      Must be able to lift/carry 30 lbs.  Job Type: Part-Time Availability: At least 3 days a week (averaging 20-30 hours per week) Hourly Rate: $20/hour Job Location: Phoenix, AZ  All Market Inc. is committed to the principles of equal employment. We are committed to complying with all federal, state, and local laws providing equal employment opportunities, and all other employment laws and regulations. It is our intent to maintain a work environment that is free of harassment, discrimination, or retaliation because of age, race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sex, sexual orientation (including transgender status, gender identity or expression), physical or mental disability, genetic information, marital status, AIDS/HIV status, military service, veteran status, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local laws. The Company is dedicated to the fulfillment of this policy in regard to all aspects of employment, including but not limited to recruiting, hiring, placement, transfer, training, promotion, rates of pay, and other compensation, termination, and all other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment.

jobTitle: Church Products Sales Development Representative - Remote
description: Description  Fathlife is looking for a motivated and dynamic Sales Development Representative to join our growing Church Products Sales team. As an SDR, you will work with sales and marketing to turn leads from campaigns into qualified opportunities. You will hold a crucial role on our team. Being the initial point of contact for new customers, you will have the exciting opportunity to set the tone for the rest of the sales cycle. If you are consultative, results-driven, collaborative, and have excellent communication skills, we’d love to get the opportunity to meet you.  Responsibilities Prospect leads from marketing campaigns to identify new opportunities Schedule meetings with prospective clients and sales representatives Nurture leads until they are ready to meet with sales representatives Stay up-to-date with product features and pricing Ensure successful follow through by providing accurate notes to the sales reps and maintaining accurate records in our CRM application  Requirements Excellent communication and negotiation skills Strong phone presence Able to prioritize and manage time effectively  Benefits Competitive salary 401(k) retirement plan Health insurance plan Free beverages and espresso  About Faithlife  Faithlife (formerly Logos Bible Software) builds award-winning mobile, web, and desktop applications in a casual, yet fast-paced environment. We create a diverse set of products, including Logos Bible Software,Faithlife, Proclaim, Vyrso, and Biblia.com. Faithlife is frequently nominated as a Washington Best Workplace, and has also been recognized as a Best Christian Workplace. Most recently, we were honored as one of Glassdoor.com's Top-10 Best Medium-Sized Companies to Work For.
industries: Computer Software

description: Pond5 operates the world’s largest collection of royalty-free footage and other media assets, with over 55,000 contributors in over 150 countries. Our footage is an integral part of the production process for just about every TV and film production, and our assets provide creators with an array of options that often exceed the types of shots they can film on their own- either because of budget, time, or practicality. Because of the massive demand for our collection and overall growth in the video and social media, TV, and film production market, we are looking to add an additional resource to the team.  Pond5 is seeking a seasoned, energetic, driven, and entrepreneurial talent on the west coast (or anywhere in the US) to work directly with customers to find what they want and to be a creative partner to make sure they make the most out of our library. The ideal candidate is creative, resilient, can talk to anyone, has experience and relationships in the TV/Production space, and is excited to join our newly launched team and take our business to the next level.  Reporting directly to the Director, Enterprise Sales in North America, you will leverage your creative background in a fast-moving, dynamic environment, helping production clients achieve their production and creative goals and helping Pond5 rapidly expand our customer base. If you have deep relationships in the TV production world, want to help clients acquire the content they need and have the creative chops and the stamina to keep up with our rapid-growth high-volume pace, we want to hear from you. Location is listed as NY but is flexible.  Job Description Partner with global production clients and help them identify and purchase the right clips and license levels Maintain and expand relationships with existing customers Grow sales volume in the TV/Production space Assist with general customer service requests that occur during the sales process Gather customer feedback for product development and market research Consistently meet or exceed targets DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE 5+ years of experience in plus relationships within the TV/Production space (with editors, producers, etc.)- you know how to speak their language and you know about tech, media, and digital trends Knowledge of the stock industry, including licensing terms, is a plus but not required Prior experience in a formal sales capacity, using a CRM, preferred but not necessary Experience in TV ad sales is a plus Ability to multi task and stay organized Ability to quickly adapt to changing, global environment BA degree is preferred but not required BENEFITS International team of 160 awesome people Competitive compensation and benefits - medical, dental, generous 401(k) matching, and beyond Daily lunch provided (if/when working from the office) Discounted content One of Wealthront's list of career-launching companies! One of BuiltinNYC's Best Mid-Sized Companies to Work! A fun team and fast-paced environment Learn new things every day! Pond5 is the world’s largest, most vibrant video-first content marketplace, providing filmmakers, creators, and producers of all kinds with the content, inspiration, and tools they need to improve their projects. As the only content marketplace that meaningfully shares licensing revenue with its contributing artists, Pond5 is driven by a commitment to its passionate and growing global community of more than 55,000 professional visual and audio creators, providing a platform where their creative work can flourish, and helping them to make a sustainable living. With groundbreaking features like visual search for video and integrations into all major video-editing software, Pond5 is innovating daily, making it easier to find and use the content that creatives need to bring their vision to life. Pond5 is a venture-backed company funded by Accel Partners and Stripes Group with offices in New York, Dublin, Prague, London, and LA.

Responsibilities: Prospecting and qualifying for new leads Inbound / Outbound cold calling and emailing Booking meetings with prospects and achieving quota-based on-ramp requirements Developing sales strategies and generate new opportunities  Requirements: Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively Solid verbal and written communication skills Full-time availability Some experience in Sales Development, Lead Generation or Sales or Communications is preferred  Apprenticeship Description: During your first three months as an SDR, candidates will also be able to participate in live instructor-led training and receive mentorship from current industry-leading account executives and sales leaders. description: Make connections with medical professionals and maintain/develop a multi-state territory of hospitals, surgery centers, and refurbished equipment dealers. Attention to detail is essential - all communications and contact must be recorded and tracked with accounts throughout the day. This customer- facing role is essential in developing strong relationships with clients and displaying a professional image of AIV.  Don't know anything about medical equipment? That's okay! All training on the equipment and devices we service/sell is provided. One year experience in sales is preferred but not required.   Full Time Benefits: Health, Dental, Vision, Paid Time Off, 401k Annual Salary with bonus and commission opportunities Occasional Regional Travel Opportunities  Base Salary: $28,000 - $35,000 Potential to earn $45,000 to $55,000 with commission

CIBC is a leading North American financial institution with 10 million personal banking, business, public sector and institutional clients. CIBC offers a full range of advice, solutions and services in the United States, across Canada and around the world. In the U.S., CIBC Bank USA provides commercial banking, private and personal banking and small business banking solutions and CIBC Private Wealth Management offers investment management, wealth strategies and legacy planning.  CIBC works to help you make your ambitions a reality with a team that is committed to being always professional, genuinely caring and collaborates to find simple solutions as we build our relationship-focused bank for the modern world.  Every year, CIBC is recognized for its business success, community commitment and employee initiatives. We are proud of this success and are committed to creating an inclusive workplace and an environment where all of our team members can excel. Manage the Community Development sales team (Relationship Managers) in all relevant regional offices. Provide personal and professional growth opportunities for sales team through coaching and training on an ongoing basis. Manage Community Development small business and ETP loan portfolio to defined acceptable risk parameters and performance expectations. Help Relationship Managers structure, and work with Portfolio Managers to underwrite, Community Development loans. Strengthen existing and develop new relationships with community organizations within the bank’s CRA Assessment Areas that partner with the bank under the bank’s specialty lending programs. Represent CIBC at community and partner events throughout designated market areas. Assist Head of Community Development Lending with the development and implementation of policies and procedures for the Community Development lending team. Assist in the larger Community Development effort to achieve the Bank’s CRA, Fair Lending and compliance goals and objectives, including clearing any outstanding issues or exceptions in a reasonable time frame. At least 5 years of experience as a relationship manager in a community development focused lending role, or similar experience. At least 3 years of experience as a manager of a sales team in a community development focused lending role. Bachelor’s degree required. Formal credit training preferred; experience managing workflow of sales team preferred. Advanced Excel, Word, and PowerPoint skills. Experience with IBS/ACBS helpful. Strong critical thinking ability; detail orientated. Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills, including verbal and written communications. Knowledge of Community Reinvestment Act and Community Development Finance preferred. Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously. Strong commitment to community development and relationship building.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Banking, and Financial Services

description: BlueWhale’s Lead Generation solutions are used by Fortune 500 marketers and leading agencies to engage the right buyer at the right time, accelerating the sales cycle and increasing deal size. We have delivered over 2 million qualified prospects to the biggest names in B2B technology. With team members located in London, Boston, New York, and San Francisco, we are singularly focused on delivering marketing services that drive revenue for our customers.  We have a company culture and workplace community based upon the following values: Be honorable Be authentic Be humble Be innovative  We welcome and expect everyone to make these values their own, add their unique contribution to our culture and community, and share the benefits of our ongoing success.  Job Summary The Sales Development Representative (SDR) will identify, qualify, and nurture sales prospects through email and outbound calling activities for both BlueWhale Research and its clients.  The ideal candidate is highly self-motivated and will chase after aggressive goals. They must understand how to assess a company’s needs and organizational structure to cater specific outreach to each prospect, easily initiating relaxed yet informative phone conversations.  What you’ll do: Leverage an account based marketing approach to research high-value accounts Find, contact, and qualify prospects on the selection committee Manage a multi-step follow-up process using lead nurturing software Use complex phone scripts and personalized emails to engage, educate and qualify prospects over time Demonstrate the ability to understand and articulate the campaign’s value proposition Schedule qualified appointments and demos for account executives that convert to opportunities Achieve high-volume outreach goals consistently Maintain accurate records of activity and lead qualification information Utilize critical thinking to solve problems, evaluate data, establish significance, and reach a conclusion Provide constructive and data-driven feedback on lead quality and conversion rates  What you’ll need: This position requires an ambitious self-starter who can effectively produce qualified appointments and meetings. Gain attention and speak confidently with executives in a cold calling environment Showcase professional verbal and written communication skills Understand and document prospect’s pain points and requirements while conveying value Have grit and be resilient in handling objections Show a strong sense of urgency for reaching goals and meeting deliverables Possess an entrepreneurial mind set and proactively provide feedback to improve campaigns Be willing to accept and act on change quickly Take action on coaching recommendations Be self directed and take ownership for your professional development An understanding of IT software and technology (CRM, ERP, HR, communications, security, etc) preferred Familiarity with core sales tools (Salesforce, Salesloft, Google Suite, Linkedin, Microsoft Office) preferred Outbound or cold calling experience required Bachelor’s degree or equivalent  What you’ll get: Unlimited time off Aggressive 401(K) savings plan Competitive health insurance reimbursement plan Office Perks including unlimited snacks and company lunches  BlueWhale Research is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.  Job Type: Full-time Pay: Up to $70,000.00 per year COVID-19 considerations: regular sanitation Vaccination Required

Vivun is the world’s first AI-powered platform for PreSales, unlocking their strategic potential and driving product-field alignment between the technology, customers, and sales. Vivun helps PreSales leaders run their teams like a business by equipping them with the metrics they need. For the first time, PreSales teams have a single place to manage their work. Using Hero by Vivun®, organizations increase forecast accuracy by leveraging the technical conscience of every deal, find revenue by reviving dormant opportunities, and deliver winning products by tapping into the collective insights from the field. Vivun works with startups like Harness and Fivetran, growth companies like Seismic and Okta and global enterprises like Autodesk and Dell.  Position Summary  An Inbound Sales Development Representative at Vivun is responsible for working inbound marketing generated leads. You’ll collaborate with the Marketing team to action leads from sources such as Webinars, Virtual Events, Asset Downloads, Direct Mail, Trade Show and meetup lists, Digital Ad responses, and Inbound Demo Requests. The Inbound SDR will work in conjunction with Outbound SDRs & Account Executives to make sure each marketing lead is followed up in a timely manner and is delivered appropriate and personalized content. Daily activities include reviewing daily marketing leads, conducting prospect and account research, responding to company webpage chat, social media messaging, email messaging, and cold calling.  Key Responsibilities Responding to all Inbound Demo Requests Sending out invitations to key accounts/prospects for upcoming marketing campaigns (Webinars, Virtual Events, etc.) Following up with all leads generated through marketing campaigns Nurturing and converting High Scoring MQLs (Marketing Qualified Leads) Messaging prospects in LinkedIn Personalizing emails for key prospects/accounts Cold calling Working with Account Executive(s)/Outbound SDRs Inputting and updating data in Salesforce Desired Skills Previous experience in a sales role or equivalent experience through extracurriculars or course work (Sales/Negotiation Class, Sales Competitions, etc.) Familiarity with Outreach.io, Salesforce, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, and LeadIQ or equivalent tool, or demonstrated ability to learn new tech/tools quickly Ability to demonstrate success working remotely Basic understanding of what PreSales is Bachelor's degree or equivalent field experience  You Are A believer in Vivun’s core values: Don’t be greedy. Do the right thing. We, not me. Transparency. Be different. Experienced working in high growth startup environments: You have the ability to move fast, adapt, and thrive in a dynamic startup environment where you derive priorities, requirements, and goals from company context. Collaborative: You are ready to roll up your sleeves and create strategies that work across roles and departments to achieve company goals. A Clear Communicator: You effectively and positively present your informed opinions on strategy clearly to multiple teams and areas of expertise. You come with a solid rationale behind every decision you make, you understand the importance of listening as part of communication.  What You Will Have At Vivun Competitive salary and full health benefits Stock Options at a well funded, pre-IPO company on a fast growth track Flexible work schedules and work from anywhere at a fully remote company Unlimited PTO with two weeks designated as “quiet period” each year An experienced team who will fight beside you in the trenches to accomplish your goals

description: Job Description As a Clinical Sales Representative (CSR)for the East Area, this individual will serve as the point person for all program development and clinical success, including procedural disposable sales and driving utilization for all Aquyre Biosciences Inc. technologies and applications.  The CSR will be primarily responsible for developing and executing business plans for assigned territories by managing any post sales installation of the CelTivity™ System and will support adoption and utilization of the technology intra-procedurally, including educating physicians and staff on the use of the products.  The CSR will be tasked with leading clinical and technical product discussions and demonstrations as part of the sales process, conducting customer business reviews, and expanding customer usage.    Primary Responsibilities •Develop and execute quarterly business objectives which achieve procedural and disposable sales revenue targets within the assigned geographical territory. •Initiate post CelTivity™ System sales installation, implementation, and adoption in collaboration with the health system and Aquyre internal support team to achieve the desired business objective.  •Maintain a detailed, frequently updated business plan with accurate sales forecasting for the territory. • Work with the Capital Sales Team to execute key strategic sales activities that maximize all CelTivity™ system capital and disposable sales. •Lead product technical and clinical demonstrations to ensure proper utilization of the CelTivity™ technology. • Partner with customers to ensure they can achieve the best possible clinical and economic outcome of implementing the CelTivity™ System in their programs, improving overall satisfaction and utilization.  •Ability to develop and demonstrate an expert level knowledge of all Aquyre Biosciences Inc. products and services and a complete understanding of industry and market trends.  Qualifications •A minimum of a bachelor's degree and 3-5 years of Medical Device or related sales experience is required. Start-up experienced is preferred. •2+ years experience working in a procedurally focused sales position attending live patient cases as when required as part of the job. •Demonstrated ability to learn and communicate technical product as well as clinical knowledge of disease states to physicians and economic buyers. •The ability to travel extensively up to 50-75%, including overnight travel within Eastern U.S. is a must for the role. Ideal candidate will be based out of Boston, Philadelphia or Baltimore / DC markets. •Entrepreneurial self-starter who performs well with autonomy and problem solver who can think critically in high pressure environments.  •Receptive to constructive feedback and collaborates well within a team environment.  •Must be highly organized with the ability to manage and execute multiple projects/tasks simultaneously and effectively prioritize action steps. •Ability to communicate at a high level and frequency daily with their peers, sales leadership, and the broader organization.  Work Environment and Travel Requirements This position operates in a field-based sales territory environment. Candidate must be able to work autonomously with a detailed plan of action.  This role requires a personal vehicle for field travel with a valid driver's license.  Business mileage re-imbursement will be provided for the personal vehicle.  A company issued computer will be issued as well as monthly re-imbursement for mobile device plans. The physical demands of the role are as follows; stand for long periods of time in the procedure room sometimes while wearing lead aprons and PPE equipment, ability to lift and move demonstration equipment sometimes in excess of 40 lbs.  This position requires travel within the assigned geographical sales territory up to 75% of the time with potential frequent overnight hotel stays.  Company Description At Aquyre Biosciences Inc. (Cambridge, MA) our mission is to become the standard of care for tissue adequacy assessment.  What Makes Aquyre Biosciences Different? Our technology combines two unique and proprietary technologies in one exam, offering a non-invasive, non-destructive, intra-procedural tissue adequacy assessment, in freshly excised tissue, within 2 minutes. Our technologies include Full-Field Optical Coherence Tomography (FFOCT) which offers an en-face (transverse), high resolution, 3D image of biopsy tissue micro-architecture, at a resolution of 1μm. FFOCT also allows for depth exploration at different focal planes, without compromising 1μm resolution. The second technology, Dynamic Cell Imaging™ (DCI) is used to enhance the cellular contrast by capturing the residual microscopic intracellular activity and behaviors in freshly excised tissue, without staining or destroying the tissue.   Aquyre Biosciences Inc. is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

High-Quality Water, a worldwide leader in the residential water treatment industry, is expanding its sales force. The demand for our products and services is at an all time high. We are looking for energetic, success and career-minded individuals to join our fast-growing sales force. HQWAA has many years of experience in the industry with a proven track record of success. Some of our strategic partners include Rainsoft - the world's largest manufacturer of water treatment equipment and The Home Depot - the world's largest home improvement retailer.  Our management team has a combined 50 years of experience and all are eager to coach the next group of leaders in the industry.  Benefits Include Qualified Appointments - our marketing team will set up all appointments! 2-week in-classroom training with ongoing field training State of the art Ipad presentation - Ipads will be provided Unlimited income potential Company discounts - after 90 days of employment Yearly Conventions Excellent work environment - HQWAA is one of the fastest-growing dealers in the nation. This is largely due to our amazing work environment and team-oriented atmosphere. Mentorship - our management team is amongst the best in the business. We are looking forward to sharing more information about this amazing opportunity!  RainSoft has been dedicated to producing The Worlds Finest Water Treatment and superior customer satisfaction since day one. We also ensure all of our air and water conditioning products meet customer expectations and demands.  Dedicated laboratory R&D and manufacturing facilities  Rigorous third party testing and certification programs  Exceptional dealer training and support network  Unsurpassed product warranties  With water softening and air purification products ranging from the small, portable water filtration systems for homes and apartments, to larger treatment systems for factories, hotels and hospitals, RainSoft water treatment systems continually strive to produce the worlds finest water for businesses and homes alike.  With better quality water you can see, taste and feel, the quality difference is clear.  We have over 50 years of combined experience in the water treatment industry, High Quality Water the exclusive RainSoft dealers for Arizona, Oklahoma and San Diego is fully licensed, bonded and insured.

description: At RxVantage we transform how medical practices engage with life sciences resources and expertise to improve patient care. Our platform intelligently connects healthcare providers with the precise life sciences experts that they need, when they need them. As a result, medical practices stay on the cutting edge of patient care without disrupting workflows. Trusted by more than 6,000 medical practices and all major life science companies, RxVantage has powered over 5 million educational exchanges between healthcare teams and life sciences companies.  Location:  Our "Work from Anywhere" philosophy is aimed at making sure we bring a diverse range of thought leadership so that our technology is better able to serve local health care providers. Our goal is to hire the country's top talent and allow them to create an environment where they can do their best work.  We're looking for a Sales Development Representative who will help build our Sales Development organization. This is a vital role within the company as we continue to scale. We expect the person to work with our marketing and sales teams to identify and conduct outreach to medical practices that are a fit for our free platform. The ideal person is someone who has natural sales instincts and sound business insight. The ideal person for our team is someone who has a persuasive personality and a passion for winning to get prospects excited about our free platform and ultimately schedule demos with our account executive team. The ideal person has great communication and organizational skills, and can function both independently as well as a member of a team. Failure doesn't deter you, and you are always prepared and professional. You want to be the best.  What you'll be doing: Generate new sales leads through a mixture of outbound calling and emailing, following up on marketing campaigns and inbound inquiries Create a great first impression to our prospects by inspiring them to learn how RxVantage can benefit their business Understand RxVantage's offerings and effectively communicate and apply them to each prospects needs Schedule meetings and product demos for Account Executives Accurately enter, update, and maintain daily activity and prospect information in Salesforce.com, and outreach.io, including comprehensive and up-to-date client information Achieve and exceed monthly quotas and objectives Work closely with Sales and Marketing team members to achieve organizational goals  The ideal candidate: 6+ months in a qualifying or prospecting role required A BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience Intellect, passion, curiosity, hunger, and grit Critical thinking and strong decision-making abilities A resilient and persuasive personality  Benefits: Competitive Salary + Commission for Certain Roles 100% Company-Paid Premiums for Employee's Medical Health, Vision, and Dental Plans Short-term and Long-term Disability Life Insurance 401k Matching Work from Anywhere! Flexible PTO - Take the time when you want it!   RxVantage is an equal opportunity employer and dedicated to ensuring that we represent the local communities where our health and wellbeing providers serve as pillars of support to our family, friends, and neighbors. Our representation within these communities allows us to embody a diverse set of backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives; and provide an inclusive environment for our team to feel empowered to be their authentic selves, without fear of harassment or discrimination.

ABOUT KEET Were a team of passionate, fun-having, taco-loving people on a mission to make healthcare experiences feel better.  At Keet, we help put humanity back into healthcare. It feels good to know that what we do ultimately contributes to a patients well-being. We know our clients, and our clients patients want to get back to doing more of what they love, so that is the core of our culture merging talented people doing what they love, to create products that help others do the same. Keet is part of the Clinicient family of companies.  SALES DEVELOPMENT REPRESENTATIVE  The Sales Development Representative (SDR) is responsible for identifying and creating new qualified sales opportunities in Target Accounts for the Strategic Sales Executives. As part of the lead generation team, the SDR manages the inbound lead activity, qualifying active buying interest and developing opportunity in prospect accounts. The SDR will also coordinate with the sales team to determine the accounts that require research and conduct outbound prospecting activities to secure a sufficient flow of additional qualified opportunities. An implicit responsibility of the SDR is to conduct business dealings in a way that creates a superior prospect experience that will set the stage for effective sales follow-up, as well as future product sales.  ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  Coordinate with marketing team to conduct rapid follow up on inbound leads, performing necessary research and qualification in advance. Use ICPS, buyer personas, market and sales intelligence to inform outbound prospecting within target markets and accounts, generating new, quality leads. Perform a minimum number of sales activities per day to generate interest with prospects and reach a predetermined monthly meeting goal. Develop and orchestrate outreach cadences in partnership with marketing and sales enablement, ensuring optimal conversion of MQLs to SQLs. Customize communications to prospects using creative approaches, including Vidyard embedded videos, to capture attention and start conversations. Maintain a high-quality professional social media presence on LinkedIn, using Sales Navigator and Keet marketing materials to engage in social selling efforts. Hold first meetings with prospects, preparing in advance for productive conversations that qualify fit and BANT, before scheduling follow-up meetings with senior reps. Uncover pain points, explain the Keet solution, overcome objections, identify opportunities and generate interest, taking detailed notes to inform future follow-up. Utilize consultative approach to evaluate and understand customers business and needs, becoming an expert on target markets and key selling points for our personas. Disseminate opportunities to appropriate sales representative, educating rep as necessary about the opportunity and recommend appropriate follow-up action items. Work in conjunction with sales representatives to develop superior relationships with prospects, building trust and affinity. Partner tightly with the Senior Manager of Growth & Automation on lead generation opportunities to drive funnel performance. Work with sales and marketing, providing closed-loop feedback to ensure continuous process optimization and alignment between teams.  Be internal expert on resources available to sales team (ex. Case studies, white papers, etc.) and use them to accelerate sales conversations. Work within Keets technology stack, including Outreach.io, Drift, Gong.io, SFDC, etc. to align with processes and maintain accurate records.  SECONDARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  Projects ad hoc  EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION  Bachelors degree or equivalent  1-2 years of experience in an SDR role Experience interacting with prospects via telephone and email. Training in solution selling or similar consultative selling models a plus. Experience and understanding of healthcare, EMR, Practice Management, Revenue cycle and/or SaaS-based BPO a plus.    KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES  Must be a role model of Keets Core Values:  Collaboration, Heart, Innovation, Service, and Humility. Exceptional written and verbal communication skills. Experience with sales technologies, and strong technical aptitude. Team-player, adept at working with cross-functional teams. High-energy, strong work ethic, and commitment to delivering results. Ability to work independently, prioritize responsibilities, and manage time efficiently.  Ability to develop relationships easily and be viewed as a trusted resource. Sales DNA with a contagious attitude that is eager to learn and win.  Proactive attitude and quick learner of new methods, strategies, and technologies.   Willingness to roll-up sleeves and do what it takes to deliver for clients.  Innovative thinker who is constantly looking for a better way to do things and is willing to take measured risks to achieve the desired result.      PERKS  (We've got them).  Keet offers a competitive benefits package with medical benefits, unlimited PTO, company hosted lunches, happy hours, and special events.   We have a flexible work from home policy dependent upon productivity and ability to communicate effectively. Oh, and we have snacks. Our office is located in the hip south river district of Austin, TX in the heart of Austin weirdness, but this role can be located in any location. OUR CORE VALUES* Collaboration: We're continuously learning how to work together, better. Heart: We've got it, and we're not afraid to show it. Innovation: We are lifelong learners. Service: Were here to serve. Humility: We're humans, and we come from dirt.  *We love and strive to embody our core values daily, and well expect you to do the same.   Keet is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

jobTitle: Field Sales Representative Southeast US Region
description: **This is a home-based position, that requires travel (50%). We welcome candidates living in the southeastern region.**  A.C. Lighting Inc., based in Toronto, is a member of the worldwide “AC Group of Companies”, one of the world’s largest suppliers of professional lighting and associated equipment to the entertainment industry. We supply world-class lighting and associated rigging technologies for the theater, film, television, worship, exhibition, and commercial markets. Our vast choice and stockholding of products, accessories, and consumables, coupled with in-house cable manufacturing facilities, provide a complete ‘one-stop’ service to meet all your lighting needs.  A.C. Lighting Inc. is the North American distributor for world-class technology brands including;  Chroma-Q® LED Lighting Vista by Chroma-Q Lighting and Media Control Surfaces PROLIGHTS high value and high-performance range of lighting, video and effects products Luminex Network Intelligence manufacturer of Data Distribution Equipment LumenRadio Wireless Lighting Control Follow-Me Remote Follow Spot Control Systems Manfrotto and Avenger Professional Lighting Stands and Accessories Prolyte Staging and Trussing; and Jands StageCL.  We have an opportunity for a driven, customer focused Field Sales Representative to join our growing team and support the Southeast US region. The territory includes Virginia, West Virginia, Maryland, North Carolina, South Carolina, Georgia, Florida, Alabama, Mississippi, Tennessee.  Position Summary  The Field Sales Representative is responsible for building A.C. Lighting’s market and driving the sales of Premium Lighting products in the Theatrical, Production Rental, Houses of Worship and Corporate A/V markets.  Reporting to the Vice President of Sales, the scope of work includes growing and driving new sales including lead qualification, quota management, funnel management, budget management, sales planning, dealer recruitment and product training.  Primary Responsibilities and Duties: ·       Work from a home office (ideally in an area that is within the region of your customers and a major airport) with the target of spending 50%+ of the time in front of customers on the road. ·       Grow the A.C. Lighting’s business and achieve/ exceed annual sales targets with existing and new accounts. ·       Develop strategies in generating and developing business growth opportunities within defined market while developing relationships with dealers, rental companies, lighting designers, theatrical lighting consultants and key influencers. ·       Arrange travel schedule to visit existing and new potential clients, attend dealer open houses and trade shows, including product training with the target of spending 50%+ of the time in front of customers on the road. ·      Learns all exclusive product lines and develops the skill set to effectively demonstrate and showcase each product line. ·       Attend all required Trade Shows. ·       Organizes, promotes and assists in coordinating product, dealer and staff training sessions.  Qualifications: · Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills, and effective strategic and analytical thinking skills, with the ability to plan, present, and execute a territory sales strategy. ·       Demonstrated success in effectively negotiate with clients ·       Entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to work independently or with a team        ·       Demonstrated awareness of the market and strong technical knowledge, with the ability to deliver business value to the account and build on customer relationships. ·       Ability to build, maintain, and develop relationships with dealers, rental companies, lighting designers, theatrical lighting consultants and key influencers. ·       Proficient with MS Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint ·       Ability to stoop, kneel or climb and on occasion lift up to 50 lbs.   AC Lighting is a respectful, caring and inclusive workplace. We are committed to championing accessibility, diversity and equal opportunity. Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process providing the applicant has met the bona-fide requirements for the open position. Applicants need to make their requirements known when contacted or alternatively you may contact Human Resources.
