description: Easy Ice combines top-quality ice-making machines with top-level support. With our preventive ice machine maintenance, cleanings, and breakdown ice, customers will have a dependable supply of ice seven days a week, 365 days a year.  Easy Ice continues to grow and seeks a bright, highly motivated Sales Coordinator to join their team in the Denver, Co market. This candidate must be an energetic and enthusiastic individual, who is able to assist the Sales Representatives in establishing new accounts. This position requires a person that strives to assist in the growth of a rapidly expanding company.  Responsibilities Support the Sales Representatives to ensure prompt communication with customers and proper documentation to maximize sales potentials. Assist in several local marketing initiatives, working closely with the Sales Managers. Work closely with Sales reps to secure the first order while building a lasting business relationship with our customers. Proactively manage customers’ expectations regarding timing, and quality service during the sales and installation processes. Setting up new accounts and coordinate with operations on all necessary documentation Positively impact the customer retention efforts and reputation of the company. Position Qualifications Associates/Bachelor’s Degree or 2+ years of related experience 3-5 years of experience in customer service role Demonstrated track record of delivering highest level of customer satisfaction. Demonstrated track record of working effectively with employees in various departments of the company. Working knowledge of computer programs and multi-line phone systems. Benefits Include Medical (Company/Employee) Dental and Group Life (Company Paid) Vision (Employee Paid) Employee Referral Bonus Fitness Membership Reimbursement (per company policy) The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all job duties performed by the personnel so classified.  Easy Ice was founded in 2009 in Marquette, MI, with the goal of providing no-hassle ice machine subscriptions to businesses that require ice for their customers and employees. Over the last decade, our company has grown beyond its humble roots in Marquette, to becoming the only nationally-located ice machine leasing service in the country with over 20,000 ice machines currently under management. In the last few years, we have established additional offices in Chicago, Phoenix, Denver, Florida, Texas and Kansas City, and our company still grows by leaps and bounds year-after-year.

description: Newt Studios produces leading-edge 3D animations to communicate the innovative science of therapeutics, medical devices, and biotech platforms. Our studio combines the latest visual effects techniques and biomedical expertise to create stunning medical animations for the life sciences industry.  www.newtstudios.com  We are searching for a driven team member to help elevate our business to the next level.  Your Role — develop new business opportunities by connecting with prospective clients and generating definitive interest in our digital products. You will suggest appropriate solutions tailored to the prospect and negotiate fair pricing. You will cultivate strong, ongoing relationships with clients to sustain our animation production pipeline.  High-level commission on deals closed, commensurate with medical sales. Potential for a salaried role after 3 months.  If this opportunity fires up your heart and neurons, we would love to hear from you.  Responsibilities: Build our robust sales funnel and expand the pipeline. Utilize existing lead lists and generate deeper lists of clients in pharma, biotech, and medical device companies. Qualify leads and prioritize account targets in our CRM. Outreach to prospects in layered channels – including cold call, email, and LinkedIn. Iterate on messaging and pitches to achieve higher success rates. Develop quotes and proposals for clients Schedule appointments for qualified leads with Directors. Communicate closely with leadership to align strategy, targeting, and messaging. Follow emerging trends in new media and visual communication. Represent Newt Studios at scientific meetings and medical conferences.  What the Role offers: Deep exposure to scientific animation production for biopharma, medical device, and commercial industries. Creative and passionate company culture with multidisciplinary backgrounds. Exciting and meaningful projects at the interface of animation, education, and emerging technologies. Early-stage, mid-sized company with potential for rocket growth. Potential for leadership role. Remote position. Flexible schedule.  Your Experience and Skills: 2+ years building sales funnels and pipelines for B2B. Strong communicator and skilled negotiator – verbal and written. Tenacious and results-driven. Independent self-starter. Positive and solution-oriented. Demonstrated integrity in output. Evidence of sales achievements requested. Medical sales or healthcare agency background preferred. Bachelor’s degree.  About Newt Studios: Newt is a creative collective of 3D animators, trained medical illustrators, and science communicators based out of the Hudson Valley, New York. We are on a mission to deliver the highest fidelity scientific animations that distill complex technologies into instructive visualizations to engage audiences across video, VR, and AR platforms.  Our services include: MOA and MOD Medical Animations Scientific Visuals for Campaigns and Conferences 3D Demos for Device and Product VR and AR Instructive Experiences Full-service agency from script to storyboard to final approval.

description: At Bazaarvoice, we create smart shopping experiences. Through our expansive global network, product-passionate community & enterprise technology, we connect thousands of brands and retailers with billions of consumers. Our solutions enable brands to connect with consumers and collect valuable user-generated content, at an unprecedented scale. This content achieves global reach by leveraging our extensive and ever-expanding retail, social & search syndication network. And we make it easy for brands & retailers to gain valuable business insights from real-time consumer feedback with intuitive tools and dashboards. The result is smarter shopping: loyal customers, increased sales, and improved products.  The problem we are trying to solve : Brands and retailers struggle to make real connections with consumers. It's a challenge to deliver trustworthy and inspiring content in the moments that matter most during the discovery and purchase cycle. The result? Time and money spent on content that doesn't attract new consumers, convert them, or earn their long-term loyalty.  Our brand promise : closing the gap between brands and consumers.  Founded in 2005, Bazaarvoice is headquartered in Austin, Texas with offices in North America, Europe, Asia and Australia.  It’s official: Bazaarvoice is a Great Place to Work in the US , Australia and the UK!  Are you interested in jump-starting your career in sales, but need hands-on training to set you up for success? As a Sales Development Representative at Bazaarvoice, you will be part of a team whose mission is to spearhead the sales process with market-data driven prospecting, creative problem solving, and leveraging product knowledge. We provide world-class training to get you confidently up to speed. Driving pipeline, shadowing complex sales cycles and collaborating with experienced Account Executives are all part of day’s work.   Responsibilities and Duties Building and maintaining a pipeline of business through email, phone and LinkedIn prospecting Uncovering a company’s needs and catering Bazaarvoice’s value according to those specific needs Demonstrating the value propositions of our products and services via webinars, emails, phone calls, etc. Positioning a high-ROI solution to some of the most well-known brands and retailers in the world Partnering with an Account Executive to cultivate new business opportunities Learning the Sales cycle from beginning to end Learning a range of best in class Sales Development tools and processes  Requirements Strong work ethic: Self-motivated with an ability to learn quickly. Ownership of role as if it was your own business Resilience: Must be comfortable handling objections, rejection, and hearing “No”, shaking it off, and continuing forward Energy: You have a high level of enthusiasm and energy that can be felt on the other end of the line Coachability: You must be able to listen and take training/feedback with a positive approach Communication: Clearly and concisely communicate, as well as effectively listen with both clients and internal business partners Curiosity: Desire to learn about both Bazaarvoice and the clients we are reaching out to  Nice to have Experience with Salesforce, Salesloft, Powerpoint and Excel Public speaking and presentation skills  Why join Bazaarvoice?  Customer is key We see our own success through our customers’ outcomes.   We approach every situation with a customer first mindset.  Transparency & Integrity Builds Trust We believe in the power of authentic feedback because it’s in our DNA.  We do the right thing when faced with hard choices. Transparency and trust accelerate our collective performance.  Passionate Pursuit of Performance Our energy is contagious, because we hire for passion, drive & curiosity.  We love what we do, and because we’re laser focused on our mission.  Innovation over Imitation We seek to innovate as we are not content with the status quo.  We embrace agility and experimentation as an advantage.  Stronger Together We bring our whole selves to the mission and find value in diverse perspectives.  We champion what’s best for Bazaarvoice before individuals or teams.   As a stronger company we build a stronger community.  Commitment to diversity and inclusion Bazaarvoice provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all team members and applicants according to their experience, talent, and qualifications for the job without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, sex (including pregnancy, gender stereotyping, and marital status), sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, military/veteran status, or any other category protected by federal, state, or local law in every location in which the company has facilities. Bazaarvoice believes that diversity and an inclusive company culture are key drivers of creativity, innovation and performance. Furthermore, a diverse workforce and the maintenance of an atmosphere that welcomes versatile perspectives will enhance our ability to fulfill our vision of creating the world’s smartest network of consumers, brands, and retailers.

description: Sales Specialist – Pacific Northwest  Company Description Personalized immunotherapies are the future of the fight against cancer, and IsoPlexis (www.isoplexis.com) is Making the Difference in enabling the lofty goal of employing immunotherapies to combat our toughest diseases. Our integrated systems, named #1 Innovation by Scientist Magazine & World-Leading Design by Red Dot, are changing cancer research by connecting biological readouts to what is actually happening in patients. Our game changing hardware technologies, originally from Cal Tech and Yale, combined with our next generation software and data visualizations, are powered by our amazing R&D team and used throughout the world. We work with a growing list of leading researchers who are publishing findings that connect our readouts to what is truly happening in patients, and that excites & drives all of us to do more! If you like working at the intersection of biological sciences and healthcare, and you enjoy intellectually challenging yet fulfilling projects, give us a call. Our fast growing, 400+ person team has a sense of integrity, energy, and urgency to ‘make things happen’ in our collective careers and in the broader world, and we look forward to talking.  IsoPlexis is welcoming self-motivated, high energy individuals who are looking for career growth working with cutting edge technology, to apply today!   Responsibilities Pitch IsoPlexis to our customer base on our new and exciting products and publications that have been released.  Define game plan for your territory’s customers, identify key influencers and purchasing PIs for each opportunity. Responsible for selling IsoPlexis instruments and consumables in translational institutions and biopharma; Achieve annual sales quota, and close key accounts Partner with customers, focus on opportunities, key influencers and decision makers to ensure swift revenue generation and deals closing. ·       Manage time and resources efficiently to perform all responsibilities associated with customers, while maintaining salesforce.com and other internal processes (training, weekly reviews, etc.). Collect data and assist Isoplexis Marketing/Communication team with the development of marketing materials.  Communicate all relevant customer information including product and/or customer experience or opportunities to Field Sales, Marketing, Internal Consulting Group and Technical Support. Including keeping CRM up to date with customer information and interactions Actively pursues tasks/projects, and ways to enhance their team and the business beyond their day to day responsibilities Travel 50% of the time Desire to thrive in a light-speed start-up environment  *Candidates local to the Pacific Northwest region strongly preferred*  Skills/Experience ·  Bachelor’s degree biology, or related field ·  2 yrs biological lab experience in a small lab is preferred, including experience with most basic laboratory techniques ·  Biomedical or biotechnology industry background is preferred ·  Immunology/ flow cytometry a plus ·  Ability to handle multiple tasks and meeting short-notice deadlines, with daily reprioritization of work  Traits ·  Coachable ·  Collaborative / Team Player ·  Commitment to quality ·  Self-motivated ·  High energy ·  Sense of humor  ISOPLEXIS is only considering applicants who have valid authorization to work in the U.S., in this position, for the Company. ISOPLEXIS does not sponsor employment-based visas for this position.

Kaléo is a new type of pharmaceutical company, dedicated to building innovative solutions for serious and life-threatening medical conditions. We were founded by patients, and patients remain our central focus and common passion.  Kaléo is not like other pharmaceutical companies. We are a growing organization of driven, passionate people who challenge each other to do things differently and better. If you thrive on change, a fast pace, and making a big impact in a place where everyone knows your name, you will love it here!  Our sales professionals play an important role in our business by educating healthcare providers about our products. Successful Medical Sales Professionals enjoy learning, analyzing business data, talking to people, and being accountable for their own performance. They are people with high integrity who believe in hard work. In turn, Kaléo offers a comprehensive sales training program, a supportive sales management team, and a sales force structure that combines the best of collaboration and competition. Our sales career path offers opportunities to advance and grow within your career, while earning competitive compensation and balancing your life with generous benefits from the beginning.  As a Kaléo Medical Sales Professional, you will: Complete all compliance, product, and other required training and maintain a learning and growth mindset. Travel within your assigned territory to represent Kaléo's products in person to health care providers, effectively communicating the most up-to-date, approved information about products' features and clinical benefits. This territory includes the greater Tampa area, Saint Petersburg, and Spring Hill. Deliver medical educational programs for health care providers and complete appropriate follow-up. With support from your Area Sales Manager, use sales analytics and other data to develop strategic business plans and territory routing plans to maximize sales opportunities. With support from your Area Sales Manager, devise and implement account access strategies to achieve territory and business goals. Manage your time effectively; record and report expenses and complete other administrative responsibilities in a timely and compliant manner. Travel overnight occasionally for Company meetings or events.  A successful Kaléo Medical Sales Professional will have: Demonstrated ability to implement a sales model and/or follow the required steps of a sales process. Understanding of the value of data to make strategic and tactical decisions within an assigned territory. Demonstrated resilience and relentlessly positive attitude in the face of challenges. Powerful internal drive and motivation to achieve individualized sales goals. Demonstrated professional accountability and ability to make proactive, independent decisions. Strong communication skills, including written communication and presentation skills. Excellent organizational skills. Desire to partner with sales colleagues to support the success of the team and the company and commitment to participating in and upholding an inclusive work environment. Growth mindset; willingness to continue to learn and receive feedback. Flexibility and adaptability to changing environments, expectations, and requirements. Strong integrity and commitment to doing the right thing.  To be considered for the position, you must have: A bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience. A driver's license in good standing. At least 1 year of successful transactional business-to-business sales experience, or combination of relevant sales and clinical experience. A track record of exceeding sales quotas and an outstanding work ethic. A desire to pursue a career in pharmaceutical sales.  Additional preferred qualifications: Two or more years of full-time, quota-carrying business-to-business sales experience. Experience with customer relationship management (CRM) software (e.g., Veeva, Salesforce). Familiarity with the pharmaceutical industry.
industries: Medical Devices, Hospital & Health Care, and Pharmaceuticals

description: As a Sales Development Representative, you will be responsible for identifying and creating new qualified opportunities for your VP counterparts. This role manages the outbound campaigns of the sales pod, identifies critical decision-makers, and generates interest in the Paymerang solution. The Jr. Account Executive will serve as an ambassador for Paymerang and will need to articulate and champion the Paymerang value proposition. This position reports to the Sales Director.  Responsibilities: Become an authority at using lead generation tools to discover contacts and craft accurate and targeted lists of prospects Conduct sales development best practices with email, phone, and social selling outreach using set cadences to connect with new prospects Utilize smart, targeted questions to speak intelligently with decisions makers such as VPs, Controllers, Accounting Managers, Directors of Finance, and CFOs Expertly build interest and opportunities with new prospects Oversee consultations on VP’s calendar and log activities in Salesforce CRM Exceed quota of qualified consultations  Basic Qualifications: High degree of persistence, self-confidence, and comfort with cold calling Outgoing, energetic, and personable High impact communication and presentation skills Highly organized with the ability to prioritize and focus on key opportunities Capable of building trusting relationships  Preferred Qualifications: Understanding of complex financial products and the ability to simplify into a coherent story Experience in Software as a Service (SaaS) is a plus  Why You’ll Love It Here Base salary + uncapped commission potential Incredible growth potential 100% employer-paid medical and dental premiums for full-time employees 18 days of PTO (& 10 Paid Holidays) 401k retirement plan -- with a 6% non-elective contribution, so you get the money no matter what! Maternity and Paternity Leave: because both moms and dads are parents. Fun company and team outings because we play just as hard as we work Employee referral bonuses to encourage the addition of great new people to the team Plus, daily catered breakfast and snacks to keep you fueled up throughout the day  Please note: at this time Paymerang is unable to sponsor candidates for this role.  Paymerang is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will be considered regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, age, gender, marital status, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or sexual orientation.

description: At Orascoptic, our brand sits at the intersection of consumer eyewear and medical technology. Our expertise is in stunning innovation and precision custom manufacturing of surgical loupes, coaxial headlights, and associated products. Our mission is to enable healthcare providers around the world to see more and practice longer. We deliver clinical vision. Our innovative product portfolio, direct sales teams, optical expertise, and commitment to leading disruption have created a winning company and a trusted brand. As part of Envista’s portfolio of businesses, we combine the agility of a smaller, focused business with the resources of a large enterprise. We are an ambitious, high energy team intent on creating solutions to help medical professionals improve patient lives. Headquartered in Madison, Wisconsin, our teams and partners are located around the world. For more information about Orascoptic, visit www.orascoptic.com  Job Description  Looking for a medical device sales position in the dental & surgical markets! We provide a cool, unique and premium product to a deserving & grateful customer base. We make a living helping those who help others. And the opportunity is endless. Put your skills to good use and be rewarded for it at Orascoptic.  Position Overview  This is a professional position selling Orascoptic products directly to dentists, dental school students, residents and faculty. Dental hygiene programs and military accounts are included. The majority of the Sales Representative's time is spent calling on dentist group practices, as well as, coordinating and conducting appropriate training sessions, clinics, and trade shows. Responsible, with limited supervision, for the development of new sales opportunities and support of current customer base. Establish contact with key management, decision makers, and influencers in dental schools, medical schools, private practitioner offices, hospitals as well as any outpatient or surgery centers where the use of magnification would be useful. Make presentations and obtain orders from above contacts. Presentations shall include: product specs, marketing information, promotional product information, introduction, and explanation, discussion of application specs and include the use of company provided slides, video, computer, and/or other presentation material. Prepare formal written quotes and/or proposals to present to new customers, in accordance to company policy regarding pricing, terms and level of account activity. Meet Sales Pillars and other KPIs. Develop strategic plans to increase territory-ordering activity. Analytical skills (quantitative and qualitative) are required to effectively manage activity within the assigned territory. Monitor progress and prepare counter measures. Uncover and develop potential sales opportunities with dental private practices, dental schools, dental hygiene schools, government medical/dental facilities to increase business opportunities. Remain in contact with established customer to provide proper information flow from Orascoptic to customer. Support ongoing product training and assist in retraining customer base in proper procedures to use with Orascoptic products. Competency in budgeting and forecasting by account and product for the territory. Staffing national and regional tradeshows as assigned. Facilitate communication and liaison between Orascoptic’s functional departments and customers. Work and leverage relations with sister companies. Preferred Skills 3 + years previous outside sales experience selling a premium product with a proven track record of success. Demonstrated ability to manage a territory of similar size and scope. Completion of formalized sales training course(s) preferred. Ability to work independently and creatively. Strong organizational skills with proven time management skills. Proficient communication skills (both written and verbal) are required. Solid computer skills are a necessary to input orders, navigate reports, and manage territory. Must act in a professional, confidential, and positive manner. Requirements  Job Requirements: Bachelor’s degree (Business /technical background a plus) Or Equivalent work experience in a similar industry. Ability to travel overnight 50%. IND123  Operating Company  Orascoptic  Envista and all Envista Companies are equal opportunity employers that evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other characteristics protected by law. The “EEO is the Law” poster is available at: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/ compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf.  Envista and its family of companies (Envista) will not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Envista will consider unsolicited referrals and/or resumes submitted by vendors such as search firms, staffing agencies, professional recruiters, fee-based referral services and recruiting agencies (Agency) to have been referred by the Agency free of charge and Envista will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt such unsolicited resumes. An Agency must obtain advance written approval from Envista's internal Talent Acquisition or Human Resources team to submit resumes, and then only in conjunction with a valid fully-executed contract approved by the Global Talent Acquisition leader and in response to a specific job opening. Envista will not pay a fee to any Agency that does not have such agreement and written approval in place.

description: Your Mission Are you full of energy, curious, creative, and ready for a role in a fast-growing SaaS sales division? Do you thrive on being told no, hung up on, and still dialing another prospect’s phone number?  We are looking for an Outbound Sales Development Representative to join and contribute to the growth of our rapidly expanding organization. This is an excellent opportunity for an individual who is excited by the prospect of playing a major role within an established industry leader with a fast-growing start-up division. We are looking for a long-term team member that is driven and loves to learn!   As our Sales Development Rep, you’ll work closely with the enablement and sales teams to help them better understand lead behavior at the top of the funnel. You'll successfully identify customer needs and articulate Thryv’s value proposition. This is strictly an outbound SDR position - we are looking for individuals to come in and gain or enhance their B2B SaaS sales experience.   You'll develop a sales pipeline by prospecting and qualifying new demo opportunities. You’ll advise enablement and marketing on how to target new leads based on what worked. You’ll then handover these leads to sales and recommend how best to take that deal to close.    About You   You’re a people-person. You understand that every customer is a person, has equally important problems and you are great at communicating with them so they know they are important. Communication skills are high on your strengths list, from speaking over the phone to sending a carefully crafted email to a prospect customer, your message is clear, friendly and meaningful.   You are able to critically reflect on your tasks with a view to make things better. When you work on something consistently you look for ways to automate or make improvements that will benefit you and your wider team. You are coachable and willing to roll up your sleeves and do what needs to be done as the rule, not the exception.  You are goal driven, focused and ready to knock your quota out of the park. This is a role that opens the door to other opportunities at Thryv, so if you like to kick goals and smash records, it’s perfect for you!  The Role & Responsibilities Identify revenue opportunities and schedule demos within the prospect base through various outbound programs such as cold calling, cold emails, and opportunity qualifications. Meet or exceed activity metrics for outbound calls (50-80+ per day), appointments set, opportunities added, and prospecting time. Successfully manage and overcome prospect objections. Provide opportunities to the demo sales team, working closely with sales reps as necessary about the opportunity. Build relationships and effectively communicate with Sales Coaches. Proactively look for opportunities to improve, optimize outbound lead management. Qualifications   Adaptability- You are excited by change vs. change averse. You are adaptable and thrive in new situations where you can think on your feet. Coachability- You are coachable, able to implement feedback and dedicated to continuous self-improvement. We are all about improving and giving and receiving feedback that will make us better. You must be open to adjust and try new things. Drive/Achievement- You must have a strong track record of performance in a previous role or in college and a competitive nature in some field. A positive attitude and desire to win are a must. You thrive on challenges and have a proven history of consistently achieving quotas or objectives. A desire to pursue a career in sales is preferred.  Process Orientation/Focus- Being able to follow a specific process and iterate on it for maximum results, is a crucial skill. Detail oriented, organized mindset with an ability to manage time effectively. You must be able to remain focused in the face of many competing interests. Curiosity- Genuine curiosity about people, technology and business, with excellent listening skills is required.  Communication-You must have strong persuasion and negotiation skills and excellent communication (written and verbal), presentation, and client relationship skills are critical. Technological Savvy - Strong Internet, email, Salesforce and SalesLoft application skills are preferred. 12+ months prior experience in an SDR/BDR, role in Software/High Tech company selling to the SMB market preferred. Bachelors Degree OR equivalent industry experience required Be eager to learn, committed to getting 1% better everyday and be open to feedback   TOP CHARACTERISTICS AND TRAITS CONSISTENT WITH SUCCESS IN THIS POSITION: Learn and articulate complex subject matter Great listener Adept at investigation and research Thick skin! Getting hung up on is a badge of honor for you! Natural storyteller Curious and not afraid to challenge the status quo Strong written communication, phone, presentation, and interpersonal skills Experience selling technology and/or software Highly organized and strong time management skills Ability to work in fast-paced, changing environment with minimal direction Hustle and Persistence The highest level of integrity Should have SAAS Industry experience
industries: Computer Software

description: Company: Specialty Pharmaceutical Company that sells into the office setting to Psychiatrist and Pediatricians with medication to treat ADHD and Insomnia Description: Selling Two Medications to Treat ADHD Presenting a New Sleep Medication that has a unique delivery system Demonstrates business acumen and ability to understand ADHD disease state, products, and marketplace Managing a two state territory: Nebraska and Iowa with 20% overnight travel Requirement: 4 Year College Degree 1-3 Years of Professional Outside Sales Experience Valid Drivers License Excellent Oral Communication and Written Skills Strong Organizational and Presentation Skills Required Proficient with Microsoft Office Compensation: Competitive Base and FYE 80-85K, Car Allowance $600 per month, Mileage Reimbursement, Travel Expenses Covered

jobTitle: Sales and Education Coordinator - Orange County
description: MAIN JOB OBJECTIVE  The Sales and Education Coordinator is responsible for providing the fresh Sales & Education Executive with training and sales support in an assigned territory, as dictated by the needs of the business with an emphasis on the Sephora and Nordstrom accounts.  RESPONSIBILITIES  Achieve sales goals, as determined by management, in assigned stores throughout assigned territory. Conduct all Sephora and Nordstrom in store trainings in line with Sephora and Nordstrom Brand expectations. Plan and execute in-store events in conjunction with Sales & Education Executive to support Sephora, Nordstrom and Fresh initiatives. Work with store management for visual placement in-store. Establishing and developing strong relationships at store level with Sephora BA’s, Store Leadership, DM’s, Nordstrom CM’s, Point Person, Beauty Stylists and Department Managers. Handle in-store training of Fresh selling specialists (if applicable) and store personnel for new product launches and core product categories. This includes Selling Specialists, Nordstrom employees and Sephora BA’s. Lead strong partnership with Sephora BA’s, Nordstrom CM’s and Clients by providing service and support for any needs when in store. Assist Sales & Education Executive in the recruitment, direction and evaluation of Selling Specialists Ensure Fresh homebays, counters, endcaps, towers, etc. are visually impeccable and in accordance with Fresh merchandising standards. Maintain regular communication with Sales & Education Executive regarding opportunities for brand to participate in additional training, event or BA/employee support. Maintain regular call cycle to stores and effectively manage schedule and travel (when applicable) Use company supported reports and tools to create customized in store strategies related to BA’s/employee training and selling experience.    PROFILE  At least three years beauty industry experience required. College Degree preferred. Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, required. Experience in Sephora and Nordstrom environment, preferred. Must be proactive in approaching potential clients and promoting the Fresh brand. Must be able to motivate others and work as part of a team. Must be able to travel within the territory. Hours of work must be flexible to meet job objectives Position requires heavy traveling and driving. Must be able to work remotely, without home office responsibilities. Standing, walking, moving for min. of 4-6 hours daily.
industries: Cosmetics

jobTitle: Healthcare Sales – Outside Healthcare Sales Rep
description: A senior Sales Executive opportunity with an entrepreneurial and growing Professional Employer Organization (PEO.) You will provide service offering to existing and new, organic Healthcare clients by managing full-cycle sales and continued business development.  Job Description  As a Sales Executive, you will identify and cultivate new business opportunities by sharing our service offerings (PEO, ASO, HRO) with healthcare organizations containing 50-1000 employees. You will work with internal and external partners, to project manage the full sales cycle, and accurately forecast sales while managing a pipeline. The C-suite relationships you create throughout the sales cycle will be the backbone for the ongoing relationship development and management of your client base.  Roles And Responsibilities Outside Sales and Relationship Management Business Development Leverage sales tools, cold outreach and cold email to set new business intro appointments Network with industry vendors, clients, and organizational strategic partners to drive new business intro appointments Track, report and achieve weekly and monthly intro appointment metrics Attend industry association events and work exhibitor booths Sales Process Management and Execution Conduct intro and second appointments independently to cultivate relationship and qualify opportunities Conduct internal and external contracting, pricing & negotiations Complete organizational sales mapping file to assist with picture of sales positioning Coordinate and conduct internal sales strategy discussions Complete funnel reporting and metrics analysis Manage internal resources and prospective clients to follow organizational Sales Process Complete in between drips/touch points & build relationship with prospective customers Relationship Management Cultivate and maintain close relationship with key customer influencers Organize and attend customer events and entertainment Coordinate with Client Engagement team to work through customer issues and recovery Other duties as assigned Skills And Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in business or finance preferred Sales Experience | 10+ Years of IT Outsourcing Required Primary Skills | Business development via cold outreach and networking, sales, CRM navigation, negotiating, relationship management About Versique  Versique is one of the largest recruiting firms in the Midwest and specializes in both consulting and permanent placement. With a valuable blend of functional, industry and recruiting experience, our award-winning team of headhunters has a proven track record of delivering exceptional talent acquisition solutions. The Versique brand represents a powerful combination of “versatile” and “unique” as it hints at the concept of “search” in it’s pronunciation: ver-seek.  Versique is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or veteran status, among other factors.  job39460

description: Job Description  BlueOptima is NOT where you figure out if a career in sales is for you. As a Business Development Representative, you know what you’re getting into. You love the ups and downs of seeking out the right contact!  Calls, Emails, LinkedIn outreach will be the norm. You’ll bounce back with a new strategy when you don’t get a yes the first time.  A passion for technology is also a big plus! That’s how you’ll thrive as a Business Development Representative (BDR) at BlueOptima.  At BlueOptima, you’ll be immersed in the full sales-cycle - from generating that initial lead, all the way to helping close the deal with major national and international clients.  Our experienced Sales team will give you all the mentoring and support you need, and as much responsibility as you can handle!  With BlueOptima, the exposure you will receive to the cutting edge of software sales (from sales technique training to client relationship management) will put you at the forefront of a growth sector that is the future of the economy.  Qualifications  Undergraduate Degree or equivalent experience  Additional Information  You can be a part of our next step, working with a group that will coach you, support you, provide step by step training to be successful and cheer you on to your wins!  Oh, and did we mention a generous PTO plan, lots of company outings, snacks, an amazing dog-friendly office and flexible work schedule? Also working with a global company opens up travel opportunities!  Go ahead, apply already.  BlueOptima an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to ensure all people feel supported and connected at work.  Renumeration: $40K-45.5K base + 6K bonus + uncapped commission
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: At Glidian we are revolutionizing the healthcare industry by fixing one of its most broken processes: prior authorizations. Prior authorizations have been shown to cause dangerous delays in patient care and produce a significant administrative burden on healthcare providers. We have built a revolutionary cloud-based prior authorization solution that communicates with hundreds of insurers to get patients the care they need in a timely manner. We’re a series A startup on an incredible growth path (over 8million raised total, with very strong revenue growth). Our solution has already helped thousands of patients and we expect to help millions of others.  We value flexibility in working style, welcome employees from anywhere in the United States, and encourage our employees to work from the location that suits them best -- whether that is the office, home, or a hybrid of the two.  In the past year, we have seen significant customer growth and we want to sustain that growth. We are seeking a talented Sales Development Representative (Inside Sales) to work side-by-side with the Head of Sales. If you love talking to prospective customers we want to talk to you.  In This Role You Will  Prospect and qualify for new opportunities via cold calling, email outreach, and networking (e.g. LinkedIn)  Share metrics of successful campaign strategies with the sales team  Maintain an organized pipeline and keep track of customer outreach  Reach and exceed KPIs including calls scheduled, calls completed, and deals won from your meetings  We Are Looking For People Who Have  A Bachelor’s Degree  Relentless attitude towards selling  A strong desire to learn and grow rapidly in a startup  1+ years of sales experience  Strong written and verbal communication  Excellent organizational skills  Benefits  Competitive salaries  Paid vacation and paid sick time  Health/dental/vision coverage, Glidian pays 80% of the medical premium  Remote-first with flexible working hours  An open work environment where everyone has a voice  Reimbursement for tools to support a productive remote environment  Work with fun, hardworking, nice people who are committed to making a difference!  Diversity & Inclusion At Glidian  Glidian is committed to bringing together individuals from different backgrounds and perspectives. We strive to create an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, feel a sense of belonging, and do great work together. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status.  Must be authorized to work in the U.S. No employment sponsorship.
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: Job Description  BlueOptima is NOT where you figure out if a career in sales is for you. As a Business Development Representative, you know what you’re getting into. You love the ups and downs of seeking out the right contact!  Calls, Emails, LinkedIn outreach will be the norm. You’ll bounce back with a new strategy when you don’t get a yes the first time.  A passion for technology is also a big plus! That’s how you’ll thrive as a Business Development Representative (BDR) at BlueOptima.  At BlueOptima, you’ll be immersed in the full sales-cycle - from generating that initial lead, all the way to helping close the deal with major national and international clients.  Our experienced Sales team will give you all the mentoring and support you need, and as much responsibility as you can handle!  With BlueOptima, the exposure you will receive to the cutting edge of software sales (from sales technique training to client relationship management) will put you at the forefront of a growth sector that is the future of the economy.  Qualifications  Undergraduate Degree or equivalent experience  Additional Information  You can be a part of our next step, working with a group that will coach you, support you, provide step by step training to be successful and cheer you on to your wins!  Oh, and did we mention a generous PTO plan, lots of company outings, snacks, an amazing dog-friendly office and flexible work schedule? Also working with a global company opens up travel opportunities!  Go ahead, apply already.  BlueOptima an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to ensure all people feel supported and connected at work.  Renumeration: $40K-45.5K base + 6K bonus + uncapped commission
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: At Glidian we are revolutionizing the healthcare industry by fixing one of its most broken processes: prior authorizations. Prior authorizations have been shown to cause dangerous delays in patient care and produce a significant administrative burden on healthcare providers. We have built a revolutionary cloud-based prior authorization solution that communicates with hundreds of insurers to get patients the care they need in a timely manner. We’re a series A startup on an incredible growth path (over 8million raised total, with very strong revenue growth). Our solution has already helped thousands of patients and we expect to help millions of others.  We value flexibility in working style, welcome employees from anywhere in the United States, and encourage our employees to work from the location that suits them best -- whether that is the office, home, or a hybrid of the two.  In the past year, we have seen significant customer growth and we want to sustain that growth. We are seeking a talented Sales Development Representative (Inside Sales) to work side-by-side with the Head of Sales. If you love talking to prospective customers we want to talk to you.  In This Role You Will  Prospect and qualify for new opportunities via cold calling, email outreach, and networking (e.g. LinkedIn)  Share metrics of successful campaign strategies with the sales team  Maintain an organized pipeline and keep track of customer outreach  Reach and exceed KPIs including calls scheduled, calls completed, and deals won from your meetings  We Are Looking For People Who Have  A Bachelor’s Degree  Relentless attitude towards selling  A strong desire to learn and grow rapidly in a startup  1+ years of sales experience  Strong written and verbal communication  Excellent organizational skills  Benefits  Competitive salaries  Paid vacation and paid sick time  Health/dental/vision coverage, Glidian pays 80% of the medical premium  Remote-first with flexible working hours  An open work environment where everyone has a voice  Reimbursement for tools to support a productive remote environment  Work with fun, hardworking, nice people who are committed to making a difference!  Diversity & Inclusion At Glidian  Glidian is committed to bringing together individuals from different backgrounds and perspectives. We strive to create an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, feel a sense of belonging, and do great work together. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status.  Must be authorized to work in the U.S. No employment sponsorship.
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: Smartsheet transforms work into dynamic work, unifying collaboration, workflows, and content management into a single flexible, secure, scalable, no-code platform that gives everyone the ability to continuously make an impact— so the enterprise, organizations, teams can compete in a transformed world.  Smartsheet is a viral software platform that produces an extreme amount of inbound sales opportunities. We are looking for a high energy, creative Enterprise Sales Representative to work within our largest customers to maximize account growth. Responsibilities include engaging customers and partnering with Account Executives in the execution of account strategies and sales opportunities and driving growth. The successful applicant has a strong interest in software solutions and demonstrates a strong desire to own each customer engagement.  This exciting role reports to the Regional Vice President, Federal Sales. This is a remote-eligible position located on the EC supporting Federal/Gov  You Will Work with Account Executives to execute on a defined territory sales strategy to achieve territory quotas. Leverage rapidly growing accounts to identify and close new solution opportunities. Conduct full sales cycles on opportunities within your assigned territory. Qualify or hand off inbound inquiries from high value targets in strategic accounts. Proactively engage new and current users to expand awareness, educate, ask for referrals, identify new opportunities and develop account intelligence. Experience working cross-functionally with sales engineers, account executives, professional services, and customer success to engage, validate, close, and ensure success of a customer. Maintain accurate and up-to-date records. Accomplish all other duties as assigned. You Have Experience selling technology solutions through the effective use of core sales tools: Zoominfo, Outreach, Salesforce, LinkedIn and Leadership Connect Strong software/business/solutioning acumen, and experience working with large organizations. 4+ Years of experience selling to Federal or government accounts preferred. Demonstrated ability to collaborate with internal/external cross functional teams. Demonstrated ability to discover customer pain points, requirements and aligning business value to budget and solution scope. Exemplary professional communication skills -- written, verbal, presentation. Time management aptitude managing numerous requests/priorities concurrently, while achieving production goals from assigned territory or set of accounts. Confidence and interest in creative problem solving and building solutions. Drive, grit, team oriented and a strong desire to compete and win. A passion for exceeding expectations. BA/BS degree or relevant experience. Perks & Benefits 100% employer-paid medical, dental, and vision coverage for full-time employees. Equity - Restricted Stock Units (RSUs) Equity with all offers. Lucrative Employee Stock Purchase Program (15% discount). 401k Match (50% up to 6%) to help you save for your future. Monthly stipend to support remote work and productivity. 15 days PTO to start, plus Flexible Sick Leave. Up to 24 weeks of Parental Leave. Personal paid Volunteer Day. Opportunities for professional growth and development Company Funded Perks, including a counseling membership, primary care membership, local retail discounts, and your own personal Smartsheet account. Equal Opportunity Employer  Smartsheet is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to fostering an inclusive environment with the best employees. We provide employment opportunities without regard to any legally protected status in accordance with applicable laws in the US, UK, and Australia. If there are preparations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.  At Smartsheet, we strive to build an inclusive environment that encourages, supports, and celebrates the diverse voices of our team members who also represent the diverse needs of our customers. We’re looking for people who are driven, authentic, supportive, effective, and honest. You’re encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn’t precisely match our job description—if your career path has been nontraditional, that will set you apart. At Smartsheet, we welcome diverse perspectives and people who aren’t afraid to be innovative—join us!

description: Job Description  Gillmann Service Inc looking to expand our National Sales Team, we are currently looking for a talented and competitive sales representative to grow our national business.  If you are a self-starter with initiative and can regulate your own desk without interference, contact us immediately. Whether you have 10+ years in sales or only couple years’ experience, we would like to speak with you. We're looking for someone that can walk onto a job site and be able to talk to just about anyone. Our top Reps make $100,000 + per year while our beginners/average reps bring home $60-80k per year. Salary/commission/bonus  *** LARGE SCALE CONSTRUCTION KNOWLEDGE IS A MUST ***  Job Description Must be able to engage gate keepers and decision makers to persuasively drive and educate them about our staffing services. Speak with anyone from a construction foreman on a job site, admin/gate keepers in an office, to a CEO. Rapport building with potential clients, customers and field employees. Source new account opportunities through outbound calls, emails and market research. Research accounts, identify key players, and generate interest. Must be able to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively while juggling multiple and shifting demands, urgencies, and priorities. 50% travel nationwide required, must be able to travel on short notice. Skills Works collaboratively with client facilities, industrial and commercial construction, warehousing, shipyards etc… Can do, must do, get the job done no matter the obstacles ability. An articulate, confident, and conscientious communicator able to multi-task A trainable, coachable, constant learner Verbal and written communications skills Strong listening and conveyance skills Please respond to this posting or give me a call/text to discuss the position in greater detail. Thank you!  Scott Lee  Gillmann Services Inc  Knoxville TN  865-851-8054  Skilled Trades Staffing company specializing in matching talented workers with hiring businesses.
industries: Construction, Machinery, and Staffing and Recruiting

description: Pre COVID, as with any start-up, we were finding our way, working out the kinks, putting the wheels on the moving bus. 2020 happened and our bus stalled for a few months. We brought it to the shop, swapped some new parts for the old, buffed and waxed it, and came out on the other side stronger, smarter, and yet, still working out the kinks. As the stakes rise, we’re not the puny pre-teen we once were. All that being said, our 90 year old grandpa tells us we never have it all figured out, so we’re not over here trying to. Here we are in the middle of our journey, thankful for the past that built us, and excited for the future that awaits us. Practice makes progress and that’s all we can say about where we are today.  We are psyched about where Booksy is headed. Chances are high that we need you on board to help execute our big plans 🤩  For this particular job, we’re looking for determined sales people eager to call, connect, and create rapport with business owners. You’re looking for a community feel (because that’s what you’ll get from your co-workers and our service providers), while also equipped to work autonomously. The challenge of introducing Booksy to a brand new area invigorates you.  Requirements  Why are you here? Because you saw the job title and want to know more!  As part of our outside sales team, you will be responsible for building relationships with select clients, scheduling and conducting safe, masked face to face demos at barbershops and salons and becoming part of the fabric of the beauty and wellness community that Booksy is growing so rapidly in.  What You’ll Do Hunt for new business in the North and Northwest suburbs of Chicago. You get excited about showing others our product. You take “no” as a “not yet, challenge accepted.” Manage your own pipeline of potential clients and take advantage of every opportunity to grow your book of business Attend and create some amazing events to further engage potential and current Booksy users Cold calls, walk-ins, sliding into DMs - you’re personable and persistent Meetings, meetings and more meetings! You understand that face to face interaction is key in closing that sale and identifying your clients needs Own the entire sales cycle from prospecting to close. You are determined to spread the Booksy gospel Set your clients up for success by conducting demos and educating them on all our app features and how they can best utilize our product for their business needs  Who You Are You’re scrappy, you take risks, and put yourself WAY out there You’re comfortable making cold calls and walk-ins and conducting safe, masked in-person meetings. You basically live outside your comfort zone You’re a straight shooter who can talk to other straight shooters You’re human (click here to prove you aren’t a bot) We’re dropping the ‘p’ word again. Passion is what our industry runs on. Put that first before any sales tactic you’ve ever learned You’re an effective, metric-driven sales person with a proven track record of success You’re humble and hungry - you don’t take rejection personally You have experience closing deals and taking clients through the entire sales cycle You’re a self-starter, we’re a start-up. Innovation is a requirement and ideas are expected You’ll let us know if you suck at something. We suck at things too At the end of the day, you fully see the reward in this job (hint: it’s not green) You have 3-5 years of solid sales experience under your belt. You’ve worked closing deals with small businesses and/or in the health and beauty space  Benefits  What we offer Health/Dental/Vision/Commuter Benefits & 401k Awesome (paid) Parental Leave Policy Monthly Commission Unlimited Paid Time Off Ample opportunities for professional growth Amazing co-workers Work/Life balance Creative and collaborative culture to flourish in
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Breakaway Consultants (a leading executive search firm) is currently conducting a search engagement for a Medical Sales Representative for a safety medical device company.  Our Client, one of the largest privately held manufacturer and distributor of healthcare safety supplies in the US our client has an immediate opening for a creative, enthusiastic, and dedicated individual to join their medical sales team in the Seattle area. We are seeking a dynamic, hard-working professional with a background in b2b sales, medical sales, GPOs & IDNs, wound care products and acute devices are preferred.  Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To Growing and developing a territory of residual based medical supplies in assigned territory; Building relationships and developing a customer base within the hospitals focusing on IDNs and GPOs Making new calls on a daily basis to develop new customers; Working with manufacturers to present products to the physician community; Acting as point person/ project manager on company roll out of products Prepare and deliver quotations for product; Develop long term relationships with customer base; Prepare and maintain a territory plan; Create a grow a residual base of customers in the alternate site marketplace; Train and learn new items to present to customers and explain the medical and fiscal benefits Requirements Bachelor’s degree required; 5 years plus outside sales or account management experience (preferably in the medical supplies and/ interacting and dealing with IDNs and GPOs. Background in commissioned, tangible product sales required; Track record of demonstrable sales growth and quota attainment; Ability to present multiple product lines; Excellent communication and organizational skills; Stable work history; Computer proficiency especially in MS Excel, Word, and Outlook Due to the nature of an outside sales representative position, the ability to drive a car, travel in that car 90% of each day, and interact with healthcare providers on site is required. We offer an entrepreneurial work environment with strong growth potential; a competitive compensation package; a complete benefits package including medical/dental/vision/life insurance; 401(k) with company match and much more!  Breakaway Consultants is an executive search firm that represents many industries across the nation.We pride ourselves in finding the rigth fit for employees and employers.

description: Sales Development Representative / Business Development Representative  Want to empower digital business through real-time analytics delivered as a service? Passionate about putting the power of machine data analytics in the hands of everyone by unifying all data types, enabling universal access and leveraging cloud economics – all this from a single, unified platform delivered and consumed as a service? Come talk with us!  Our Business Development Representatives are a key part of a Regional Sales team consisting of a Sales Manager and Mid-Market or Enterprise Account Executives. You will support all levels of the sales organization by finding new revenue opportunities that add to the total pipeline. You will foster relationships with Account Executives, Regional Sales Managers, and potential future customers.  What makes a Sales Development / Business Development Representative successful? We are a team of intuitive, passionate hunters looking for green-field opportunities within potential customers. And we like to have fun.  We have a demonstrated track record of providing growth opportunities to our SDR team members to transition down the AE track, Customer Success or Marketing.  What you'll be working on:  Prospect and generate leads with companies within a defined territory Leverage a modern lead generation tool stack, including Discover.org, Linkedin, ZoomInfo and Outreach Collaborate closely with Sales Managers and Account Executives to establish a territory "plan-of-attack", including target companies, target prospects, and messaging/talk-tracks Set up new meetings to hand off to our Account Executive teams Learn, leverage, and help evolve our demand generation process Qualify opportunities and handle objections Participate in regular training & informational sessions Achieve or exceed monthly quotas of Qualified Opportunities and Closed Business Conduct high-level conversations with Senior Executives in Target and Prospect Accounts Create, prioritize, and qualify strategic target account lists within a defined territory Research and build new and existing accounts (i.e. adding contacts, sending regular emails, coordinating strategic discovery meetings) Your experience and skills should include:  History of quota over-achievement Thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth, rapidly changing environment Bachelor’s degree These additional skills would be highly desirable: Previous experience in a lead generation role a plus SaaS experience a plus  This role is for talent looking to continue their career in sales. If you are naturally curious, a strong communicator, and have a hunger to learn, Sumo Logic is the place for you to launch your sales career! We offer our BDRs multiple career paths/opportunities in various lines of business at Sumo Logic.

Our newest client has requested for us to immediately hire a team of 7 individuals to assist with the launch of an interactive, promotional campaign.  Your Role:  Prospect small and large business Conduct direct sales strategies Promote our clients Professionally represent our firm Interact with customers Initiate the sales cycle Assist with product purchases Track and report sales Coordinate territories Participate in classroom training  Qualifications:  0 - 3 years of experience in sales, restaurants, customer acquisition, or a related field Superior communication skills Professional and personable Ruthlessly determined to succeed Team oriented Ability to build quick relationships              Candidates with the following experience are encouraged to apply today: General Labor, Construction, Home Improvement, Labor, Labor and Development Operations, Field Construction, Telecom Construction, Construction Management or Construction Experience

description: Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 160,000 employees who are committed to safe, responsible and sustainable ways to nourish the world. This position is in Cargill’s protein and salt business, where we provide wholesome, high-quality food products to a wide range of customers, from foodservice operators and grocery stores to manufacturers and exporters.  Job Purpose and Impact  The Sales Specialist will participate in face-to-face and remote selling to our new and existing customers, selling directly or indirectly through various sales channels. We seek a results-oriented professional who will help assess customer needs and suggest appropriate products, services, and solutions.  Key Accountabilities Development and delivery of sales proposals and conducting detailed presentations for effective product demonstration. Build a business plan for each account developing strong client relationships. Plan daily activities, including customer visits and establish quantitative and qualitative objectives to achieve. Follow market and competition evolution, relaying information to senior staff. Independently solve moderately complex issues with minimal supervision, while escalating more complex issues to appropriate staff. Other duties as assigned Qualifications  Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience Minimum of two years of sales related work experience Experience with email, spreadsheet, word processing and presentation application Ability to travel up to 10% Written and Oral communication skills Other minimum qualifications may apply Preferred Qualifications Experience in Customer Service Project Planning experience Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Vet

jobTitle: Entry Level Account Executive Sales Representative
description: ADP is hiring an Account Executive - Outside Sales. In this position, you'll identify and cultivate new prospects from relationships built with Bankers, Accountants, existing clients, as well as direct prospecting efforts. In addition you will cross-sell solutions to existing clients, and effectively close sales, with the support of exceptional sales training and the rewards of advancement opportunities and industry-leading compensation, benefits, incentive trips and awards. Unlock Your Career Potential: Sales at ADP. It takes a relentless team to lead an industry. ADP's world-class sales team is driving our global growth as a worldwide leader of workforce solutions. If you believe in the power of relationships, we'll give you the tools, training and support you need to connect with new and current customers, ranging from Fortune 100 corporations to small start-ups. And as you achieve success, you'll enjoy the rewards, support and recognition you deserve. At ADP we are driven by your success. We engage your unique talents and perspectives. We welcome your ideas on how to do things differently and better. In your efforts to achieve, learn and grow, we support you all the way. If success motivates you, you belong at ADP. We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values: Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, & Social Responsibility.  RESPONSIBILITIES:  Develop and execute a cold calling strategy to target prospects Mine existing clients for referral business Build mutually beneficial relationships with Bankers and Accountants Reach or exceed assigned sales goals Implement sales strategies Connect customers' business needs with ADP products and services Cross-sell other ADP solutions to existing clients Build network in person and via phone with key decision makers in a designated territory QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:  Bachelor's degree At ADP, we believe that diversity fuels innovation. Our diversity benefits our associates, clients, and our communities. ADP is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, genetic information, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, lawful alien status, national origin, age, marital status, non-job related physical or mental disability, or protected veteran status. We support an inclusive workplace where associates excel based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance.  ADP is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer; M/F/D/V. ADP believes that diversity leads to strength.

description: If you have ever wanted to get in early and play a critical client-facing role for a rapidly growing new product partnership, this is the opportunity you have been looking for! Control Risks - a trusted team of the best political and security analysts, has teamed up with Geospark Analytics - a SaaS platform powered by AI. Together we are creating the most exciting technology and tools for predictive security analytics on the market. Our partnership is already growing fast, and we need motivated and determined sales professionals to reach our goals. Control Risks and Geospark Analytics are looking for an exceptional person to join our Sales team and work directly with leading commercial organizations to help them achieve success. You will be responsible for feeding the sales pipeline by identifying and developing new sales leads for Online Solutions Team.    Location: Preferably in Houston, New York, Los Angeles or Washington DC where there are Control Risks / Geospark Analytics offices, but alternative options accommodated due to remote working Requirements: The ideal candidate will quickly become an expert in generating, prospecting and qualifying leads, arguably the most important components of the sales process. This role is an excellent opportunity to prove yourself in a fast-paced sales environment in a growing SaaS environment with an enormous opportunity for career growth. We are looking for a candidate that is a fast learner, has an intense passion for creating lasting relationships, and an ability to learn, excel and adapt with our growing company. If that sounds exciting and rewarding keep reading.    Tasks and Responsibilities  Research target leads utilizing ZoomInfo, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, and other prospecting tools Qualify and engage sales leads, supplying leads with information that is relevant to succeeding in their role Effectively communicate with prospective customers by telephone, email, and online social networking tools to better identify opportunities Coordinate and participate in video conference calls and demos with potential clients and partners. Work collaboratively with the Sales and Marketing teams to develop and strengthen the pipeline. Consistently hit and exceed goals by identifying opportunities, developing prospecting techniques, and qualifying leads at an exceptional pace and quality. Engage in ongoing training programs to strengthen sales methodology, skills set, and product pitch. Consistently and reliably maintain all relevant sales activity data and results within client management systems. Strive for and achieve growth milestones to advance career    Knowledge and Experience  Passionate about technology and changing the world Self-starter with an entrepreneurial spirit and ability to work independently Flexible and adaptive to change with the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment A proven track record delivering results and increasing pipeline 1-3 years' experience in prospecting and development role (SaaS preferred Excellent listening, written and verbal communication skills with great attention to detail Experience working with CRM platforms (Microsoft Dynamics and/or HubSpot CRM experience preferred)

During your first 3-months in the SDR role, candidates will also receive supplemental coaching, training and mentorship from the Vendition coaching team to help ensure productivity, ramp, full understanding of all platforms used, and overall success.  Vendition has helped thousands of candidates with little to no technology/SaaS sales experience go on to see tremendous success in the SDR role and eventually move into an AE position and beyond.
