description: About Us:  New datasets are being created every day and investors need to incorporate them to remain competitive.  YipitData is the go-to, 200+ person data team for hundreds of the largest institutional investors and corporations in the world. We identify, screen, license, clean, and analyze alternative data to help clients answer their key questions.  We have amazing reviews (and a 5-star rating!) on Glassdoor and are one of Inc's Best Workplaces - a fast-growing technology company based in NYC, backed by Norwest Venture Partners and with a strong culture focused on mastery, ownership, and purpose.  About The Role:  We are hiring a Sales Development Representative to help our Sales team engage new clients. Our newest Sales Development Representative will qualify inbound sales leads/opportunities, follow up with marketing qualified opportunities, as well as identify prospective opportunities and utilize a number of communication methods to begin a sales engagement.  The Sales Development Representative career progression is a path towards being a Sales Associate and then a Sales Executive, focused on bringing on and engaging new business.  In this role, you'll gain experience in: Owning the inbound sales process by developing and iterating on the prospect experience, qualifying the opportunities and delivering the YipitData value proposition to ensure sales success Developing creative outbound sales skills by leveraging a number of communications methods including cold calling, cold emailing, direct mail, Bloomberg message and others Working with Hedge Funds and Investment Managers who rely on the next generation of alternative data research to help with their investments Collaborating with Marketing to optimize the opportunity conversion process Mapping out organizational structures of leading Hedge Funds and Investment Managers to identify prospective users Opportunity to develop skills across a broad range of sales technology tools such as Salesforce, Gong, Groove, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Zoom Info, Asana and others  You are likely to succeed if: You have minimum 1-2 year of inside sales experience in a SDR, BDR, or Sales Executive role You are passionate about contributing to the future of data-driven investment research You are excited by understanding the needs of investment professionals You are creative and like to think of different ways to engage prospects You are empathetic and have strong interpersonal skills and high emotional intelligence You thrive in fast-paced, dynamic environments You have a highly positive outlook You are resourceful and excited to learn You have sound judgment when handling new situations  What We Offer : Our compensation package includes equity and highly competitive salary & commission plan We care about your personal life and we mean it. We offer flexible work hours, unlimited vacation, generous 401K match, parental leave, team events, wellness budget, learning reimbursement, and more! Your growth at YipitData is determined by the impact that you are making, not by tenure, unnecessary facetime, or office politics. Everyone at YipitData is empowered to learn, self-improve, and master their skills in an environment focused on ownership, respect, and trust. To learn more about our culture and values, check out our Glassdoor page!  We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
industries: Financial Services

description: The Clarion Media Group—which includes The Daily Dot, the leading internet culture publication, the acclaimed science magazine Nautilus, the Phire influencer network, and Mememtic, an in-house branded content studio—is seeking a contract Sales Development Representative to join our growing partnerships and digital sales team.  The role focuses primarily on building our pipeline of potential advertisers, across our email newsletters, websites, social platforms, and branded content initiatives. The role will be responsible for outbound sales prospecting, generating and qualifying leads, researching clients, and opening up new client conversations. The role is a terrific opportunity for a junior sales person looking to grow into digital media sales roles, or account managers looking to make the transition to sales. The ideal candidate will already be comfortable with the ins and outs of digital media sales, with an emphasis on newsletters, branded content, and audience measurement.  Location Austin, TX or remote  Scope This position reports to the Director of Brand Partnerships, and is a full-time position.  Hours are flexible based on time zone.   What You’ll Do Research companies and reach out to potential brands strategically through phone, email, social media, and meetings/events Effectively communicate and present our value proposition to prospects with the goal of securing meetings with them Work with existing and potential clients to determine their business needs and formulate an advertising solution Develop tailored communications and test different strategies to engage potential/existing clients Provide ideas to help continuously improve our solutions and keep the team informed about customer feedback and data gathered in the field Collaboratively work with internal team members to develop lead generation strategies to generate lead opportunities with prospective customers Identify new and interesting data points and insights that add value to the sales process  What We’re Looking For You are a highly motivated and self-starting individual You are a team player with high energy and positive attitude You have excellent written/verbal communication skills You are internet savvy and like to dig deeper to find what you are looking for You can prioritize and manage time effectively You have a sense of humor You are intellectually curious and have a desire to learn about the business and potential clients You have experience working with sales CRMs, and you understand the basics of media sales terminology and the media sales process (and if you don’t, you’re eager to learn)  You have high familiarity and comfort with spreadsheets and data analysis You have familiarity with Google Analytics, Google Documents, social promotion, and navigating LinkedIn You have experience in media (a plus, not required) You’re not just comfortable with cold-outreach and client communications, you’re hungry to interact as much as you can Clarion Media Group recognizes the value of the broad and rich variety of experiences, ideas, and skills our team members bring to the business. Beyond compliance with government regulations, we foster diversity by encouraging an environment that taps the full potential of each employee consistent with the Clarion Media Group’s high standards of performance. We believe that there is an ongoing benefit to our families, employees, and community when Clarion Media Group supports a diverse workforce. We are committed to equal opportunity in all of our employment practices to all qualified employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military status, sexual orientation, genetic information, gender identity/transgender status, or veteran status.

Our client, a rapidly growing software startup, is looking to add a Sales Development Rep to the team here in Dallas! The ideal candidate is an energetic go-getter with the ability to identify influencers and key decision-makers within accounts. You will discover qualified opportunities by responding to inbound interests and targeted outbound prospects to build rapport and establish relationships.   Qualifications & Compensation Bachelor's degree in Business or a related field At least 1+ years of inside sales experience related to software/SaaS $90k total comp year 1, uncapped commission + bonus Fast-track to promotion Full benefits, 401k, Equity, lunch stipend, tech package
industries: Staffing and Recruiting

description: Company Description  Form-on USA Corp. is a young, global enterprise which is specialized in the supply and trade of used formwork, new formwork components and plywood. As a subsidiary of Doka Group, we can build on a high-performing production facility as well as an international logistics network. We are proud of our team and our product portfolio. For our team in the U.S., we are looking for an enthusiastic and innovative candidate who will - together with a strong team - contribute to the company's success.  Job Description  The Sales Representative will develop and maintain a sales territory (Midwest, Northeast or Far West) consisting of a defined sales goal which may be subject to change. He/she, as a strategic partner, will be accountable for retaining existing accounts and widening business in the entire US market while maintaining strong and trusting partnerships with customers. Moreover, the Sales Representative is responsible for conducting market research, identifying and selecting new markets as well as establishing a network of formwork retailers. He/she acts as a 'broker' for our clients (wholesalers, retailers, distributors, re-renters, brokers and agents). He/she will approach potential customers mainly via telephone and support them in handling first-time as well as follow-up business. He/she will prepare calculations and aligned offers for the daily business. Identify potential customers and make cold calls that result in meetings and convert prospects into actual sales. Develop both new and existing accounts and expand business through face-to-face contact with the customers. Prepares proposals and obtains appropriate managerial approval. Drafts final proposals, ensuring management approval and customer signatures are obtained. Presents proposals while selling the features and benefits of Form-on products to close sales. Ensures that the customer is satisfied with the equipment and the production he/she is obtaining and ensures proper recording and coordination of shipments and returns. Accountable for all credit interactions with the customer including obtaining contractor approval of invoices, making adjustments through credit requests and ensuring prompt payment, as well as preparing and distributing monthly account status reports. Accurately and timely completes weekly sales reports and provides information as needed for backlog and sales projections. Visits clients as required. Continually builds product knowledge. Assists in ensuring safe working practices and a safe working environment. Overnight travel as required. Additionally, he/she may be called upon to make sales or service calls outside of the designated territory as needed. Collaborates with management to ensure company and branch sales initiatives are aligned and achieved. Qualifications  Qualifications Minimum two to three years of experience in Sales, preferably in trading construction supply or formwork supplier Bachelor Degree with a concentration in Construction a plus. Consistently handles confidential information with the highest level of integrity and delivers the highest standards of service to customers. Strong interpersonal, communication, organization, follow-up and negotiation skills along with a strong numerical aptitude required. Effectively manages multiple tasks and handles all responsibilities with a strong sense of urgency. Takes initiative, manages time effectively, and manages and adjusts priorities based on business demands. Excellent communication skills including an excellent command of English (speaking, reading, writing). Spanish is a plus. Qualitative abilities including strong analytical skills, commercial proficiency and effective selling and problem solving skills. Strong computer skills including proficiency using Microsoft Office applications, (Word, Excel and Power Point). Willing and able to learn new computer systems, products, concepts and techniques as well as an eagerness to keep abreast of customer, industry and competitor development. Self-motivated, assertive, team player with a strong work ethic, able to work independently in a results-driven, fast-paced environment. Understands how the sales, business development activities and account management of Form-on USA impact the corporation worldwide. Problem Solving  This position requires the ability to support the office and serve as a liaison to the customers and sales personnel resolving issues at times on short notice with minimal information.  Communication  Extensive daily interaction with customers, colleagues and management. Consistently delivers high standards of customer service and communicates effectively.  Mental Effort  This position requires the ability to think strategically. Position requires the ability to work in a fast-paced environment and the ability to be organized and manage time effectively to meet deadlines.  Working Conditions  Working conditions of an office environment: dry, cool, and well lighted. At times, visiting the material yard where weather conditions may vary from extreme hot to wet or extreme cold depending on the location and the season.
industries: Construction, Marketing and Advertising, and Staffing and Recruiting

description: Company Overview: The Bee Corp is a benefit corporation based in Indianapolis, IN that applies data analytics to crop pollination. Our mission is to empower growers and beekeepers by delivering insights into beehive health. The Bee Corp pursues this mission by offering growers infrared inspection technology to measure pollination value and drive decisions to protect yield.  Position Summary: The Bee Corp is looking for a Sales Representative to grow our customer base. We are looking for a candidate passionate about building lasting relationships with customers. To be successful in this role an attention to detail and organization skills are required. Candidate should be self-motivated, able to juggle multiple projects, and work in a team environment. Beekeeping knowledge is not required, but we are looking for a candidate with a background in agriculture. This is a salaried position with additional commission-based bonuses. This position will work closely with the company’s CEO, Director of Operations, and Sales Representative. This position will be based in Fresno, CA (or flexible to other Central Valley location) but will require some travelling within the San Joaquin and Sacramento Valleys to meet with almond growers once pandemic conditions improve.  Position Responsibilities: Source new leads to achieve sales goals Manage Pipedrive CRM to track deals Refine sales strategies iteratively Actively work on deals at all stages of the sales process Collaborate with other team members conducting sales, marketing, and strategic partnerships  Qualifications: Bacheloror Master’s degree in Business or a related field Sales or Grower Representative experience Experience working in agriculture preferred, but not required  Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment The Bee Corp is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

Regional Sales & Repairs Representative  The Surgical Equipment People, LLP (TSEP) provide high quality repair of Endoscopic, Orthopedic, Biomedical, and Ultrasound surgical equipment. With a strong record of continued growth, we are one of the most successful privately held companies in our industry.  As a Regional Surgical Repairs & Sales Representative, your training will begin at our headquarters office learning the technical and sales basics of the surgical industry. TSEP is committed to the continual growth and development of our Representatives.  In Addition To Formal Technical And Sales Training, Our Representatives Gain Hands-on Experience As They  TSEP's Representatives will learn the latest technology and trends in the surgical field. Contact Hospitals and Surgical Centers on a daily basis Manage an extensive database of healthcare facilities Work closely with a diverse array of healthcare personnel within Hospitals and Surgical Centers to provide appropriate repair and sales solutions We believe that the best Regional Repairs & Sales Representatives are self-motivated and will thrive within the fast-paced surgical equipment industry.  We Offer Training salary plus commission for first 12 months Lucrative commission-only compensation policy afterwards Performance bonuses Uncapped commissions Blue Cross Blue Shield Medical Insurance Delta Dental Insurance Delta Vision Insurance 401K following a year of service To learn more about TSEP, please visit our website at www.tsep.us  The Surgical Equipment People, LLP (TSEP) is a medical service company designed to maximize healthcare facility and physician performance. TSEP repairs flexible and rigid endoscope systems, orthopedic power systems, biomedical equipment and ultrasound probes.
industries: Medical Devices, Insurance, and Hospital & Health Care

description: Company Description  “We’re not in the shipping business; we’re in the information business” -Peter Rose, Expeditors Founder  As a Fortune 500 company, Expeditors employs more than 15,000 trained professionals in a worldwide network of over 300 locations across six continents. Expeditors satisfies the increasingly sophisticated needs of international trade through customized solutions and seamless, integrated information systems. Our services include the consolidation and forwarding of air or ocean freight, customs brokerage, vendor consolidation, cargo insurance, time-definite transportation, order management, warehousing, distribution and customized logistics solutions. Expeditors is headquartered in Seattle, Washington.  Job Description  Scope of Position  The focus of Sales Operations is to optimize the effectiveness of the district sales team by providing support to the District Sales Team and Manager. The Sales Operations candidate must have a desire to become an expert in sales fundamentals and process, and the drivers of results for their Sales team.  Using strong communication skills and deadline management, sales operations will effectively collaborate with a variety of people and job functions, accomplishing tasks of moderate to high complexity and scope, and have the ability to perform in a challenging and fast-paced environment. This role provides growth opportunity, recognition and reward for the achievement of business results. Position gains great insight to moving into a field Sales position if desired.  Reports to District Sales Manager  Key Deliverables  These Are The Minimum Results Expected From Sales Operations Manage monthly delivery of key reports to the District Sales Manager. Manage weekly sales meetings, as directed by the District Sales Manager. Organize sales events to drive existing and new customer engagement. Ensure updated marketing materials are accessible to Sales team and create customer-focused PowerPoint presentations from various marketing material. Work with CHQ-Marketing team for customized content when needed. Manage company visitors and arrange meeting schedules with sales team. Deliver qualified sales leads to the team. Deliver and coordinate bid response information requested by the local Sales team or the Expeditors network. Provide rates and pricing support. Attend training & development sessions to understand the requirements of Sales. Organize training sessions related to Sales for your branch, as directed by the District Sales Manager. Update CRM and ensure data integrity measurements are met for the branch. Take on additional assignments, as required, in support of company needs. Qualifications  To be the most effective in this position we are looking for the following skills and experience: Must be proficient in Excel, PowerPoint and Word The ability to work off-site for local events Oral and written proficiency in the English language Strong problem solving, organizational, and interpersonal skills Ability to work productively both individually and in a team environment Sense of urgency for goal achievement Self-motivated with ability to work in a fast-paced and constantly changing environment Comfortable with regular data entry on a laptop computer Strong rapport and relationship-building focused Empowered to make quick decisions in response to changing condition Influence others to action Timeliness and accountability for results Additional Information  Expeditors Offers Excellent Benefits Paid Vacation, Holiday, Sick Time Health Plan: Medical, Prescription Drug, Dental and Vision Life and Long Term Disability Insurance 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan (US only) Employee Stock Purchase Plan Training and Personnel Development Program All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
industries: Logistics and Supply Chain, Human Resources, and Financial Services

description: Le Bleu Ultra Pure Water & Keurig has the best water and the best people on the planet! Our team members earn significant money and work every day in a passionate culture of respect, excellence and motivation. Our customers have awarded us 5 stars on Facebook and 4.8 on Google and it's all due to our world-class people, our passion for our water and our vibrant culture! We're excited to be expanding our presence in the Greater Triad market due to large growth opportunities in the area. If you're a positive, money-driven, upbeat "people person" who loves meeting and engaging with others, we would like you to contact us. This opportunity provides a base salary, commissions, full benefits plus 401K, totaling first year realistic earnings of $75,000 with an achievable, year one, six figure upside. This territory role is designed to evolve into future leadership positions with full development and mentorship provided. While you would be centered in the greater Triad area, our reps have to ability to sell into other key markets such as the Columbia, Charleston and the Charlotte, NC regions. If you are who we're looking for, please connect with us today!

Sales Representative  Bring your incredible sales skills to our team and help add to our growth. Your future is bright on our team. We provide our team members with outstanding hands-on sales and marketing training that will teach you the techniques necessary to succeed and achieve sales goals.  This job involves one on one sales interactions with retail customers, so outgoing, competitive personalities with charisma and integrity are encouraged to Apply Today!  Responsibilities For a Sales Representative Use our proven sales methods to achieve sales goals Welcome customers with a friendly face Speak with customers and help identify their needs Be informed of all our clients' products and services Help fit customers with the best products and services Gain new customers by providing an excellent service Requirements, traits, and skills that we look for in a Sales Representative: Active learner Enjoys learning Unmatched work ethic Loyal and honest High levels of integrity Acts with grace Like constructive criticism A team player Benefits Of Joining Our Team As a Sales Representative Go on incredible trips No two days are alike Meet new people every day Work in a fun, positive, encouraging office environment You determine your own success No glass ceiling or micromanaging We offer Virtual Care - prescription drug benefits and 24-hour access to doctors via video TCG is an outsourced sales, marketing, and consulting firm. We are a privately-owned business based in San Antonio, TX that represents the largest telecommunications companies in the world. Our clients hire us to handle their promotional retail sales campaigns, and our primary responsibilities are to increase our client’s market share and acquire new customers on a daily basis.
industries: Consumer Goods, Human Resources, and Financial Services

description: Company Summary  Selected by Business Insider as one of the 81 startups expected to boom in 2021, Sorcero is the leader in medical and technical Language Intelligence (LI). Working with some of the largest and most innovative life science and STEM enterprises, our platform delivers a 1,000% increase in analytical capacity and complex insights to track therapeutic performance, generate evidence for regulatory compliance, and improve medical decisions.  Sorcero is composed of experienced, mission-driven people from diverse backgrounds. Our employees span four continents and speak over eight human languages and any number of machine ones. We bring our individual backgrounds and creative talent together to solve challenges as a team.  Our founders have extensive experience in transforming global markets, positively impacting billions of lives. Dipanwita Das, Co-Founder and CEO, built international public health platforms informing over 3 billion health outcomes in 20 countries. Fellow Co-Founder and Chief Technology Officer, Walter Bender, established the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) Media Lab and invented personalized content, as well as the netbook category. Richard Graves, Co-Founder and Chief Commercial Officer, has co-founded and grew revenue at data-science driven startups from $0 to over $200 million.  WHY JOIN SORCERO?  Sorcero is making significant strides towards transforming decision-making by empowering stakeholders with insights to augment their expertise and, ultimately, improve patient outcomes. We have an incredible understanding and appreciation for these markets. We are building technology that is powerful and differentiated, all while solving huge challenges in people's lives and health that were previously intractable. By joining our team, you would play a critical role in our growth and success by collaborating with our network of passionate entrepreneurs to build a scalable, impactful organization.  No matter what challenges await us, the Sorcero team grows together by learning from one another and supporting personal development. From flexible working arrangements to encouraging meaningful interactions with teammates across the globe, Sorcero provides a supportive community to bring out the best in us.  We find our employees are driven by the following common values: Pursuit of excellence and mastery of their craft Humility in defeat and in success Kindness and empathy towards others Desire to create large-scale, positive change  Job Description  Sorcero builds AI powered solutions, combining the power of deep learning with the accuracy of ontologies to drive natural language understanding. Our platform and applications are used by top Pharma companies, scientists and researchers. We are looking for a Sales/Marketing Development Representative to contribute to inside sales, outbound prospecting, and lead qualification.  Ideal candidate will be an innovative thinker with the ability to execute quickly. Someone who thrives on developing new technology, challenging the status quo and is not afraid to ask questions. A good fit would be a Sales/Marketing Development Representative who has expertise in the Life Sciences domain and a natural curiosity for big data and analytics. You will be expected to contribute to the decision making process and influence the design, functionality and application of our product line.  Keep in mind - this is a challenging domain. We make decisions fast, based on scientific facts, using advanced custom technology. We are not building standard, ordinary applications. Our products are innovative and so is our team. This is a great opportunity for someone looking to contribute meaningfully and learn a LOT while having fun in the process.  Requirements & Qualifications Extensive experience with sales and marketing tools, including HubSpot and LinkedIn Navigator Proven track record articulating products/services and building rapport with prospects Experience in technology sales, specifically SaaS applications to C-suite and key stakeholders Track record of meeting or exceeding sales goals within the last 12 months Experience working with engineering and product teams to create customized sales material Bachelor's degree 3-5 years experience in sales and/or marketing 2+ years experience working in an early startup business Excellent written and oral communication skills; ability to communicate effectively with multiple levels including executives, peers, managers and junior staff Confidence to ask questions. You will be an active contributor and business problem solver. You will be expected to understand, research and solution possible design alternatives in support of the product's success. You have done enough projects to understand the Life Sciences customer or you're able to quickly gather and decipher what problem our customers are trying to solve. Excellent planning, analytical and interpersonal skills Effective team player and collaborator, working across Commercial, Product and Engineering business lines  Bonus Located in the DC area and able to meet in-person 1-2 days a week  Benefits  Sorcero offers a competitive benefits package: Competitive compensation package, including equity in a fast growing startup Four week of PTO plus one additional week during the December Holiday season Medical, dental and vision benefits for you and your family 401(k) retirement plan Company-provided laptop and hardware Being a part of a brilliant, fun and supportive team  Because ∑ (human + AI) > human or AI alone  Sorcero is an Equal Opportunity Employer dedicated to the goal of building a culturally diverse environment, and strongly encourages applications from diverse candidates.
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: Who are we? Sift believes that people are at the heart of every great organization. But without proper insight, harnessing the power of the thousands of individuals who make up today’s organizations can be nearly impossible. That’s why Sift’s platform empowers everyone in the organization to easily surface the talent, skills and experience of thousands of colleagues.  At Sift, we believe that empowering people is the key to the success of every organization, and we’re building a platform to help the largest organizations on the planet leverage the immense power of their team members’ combined knowledge.  Sift is built by people for people. It should be simple to learn about the superpowers of your team and know what matters most to them. People data is critical, but we also behind every metric are real team members that shape your culture and community. We’re a modern workplace directory that helps organizations better leverage their human capital, and become more human themselves in the process. If this excites you—we’d love for you to join us.  As our company grows and matures, we are consciously seeking to build a culture of inclusion. We are a proud equal opportunity employer and value the unique contributions that each team member brings to the organization.  What will you do? This is a great opportunity for a professional seeking an access point to a highly rewarding sales career in the enterprise SaaS or technology industry. The Sales Development Representative will work with a group of seasoned software sales and marketing professionals to generate sales leads. The SDR will schedule appointments for the sales team, make cold outreach contacts to generate leads, and qualify and validate leads from our marketing campaigns. The ideal candidate is competitive, energetic, passionate and customer focused.  Everyone at Sift is here to help you succeed. You’ll have complete access to our amazing team who are excited to answer your questions, provide training, and generally do whatever it takes to help you be successful. You’ll also have lots of great tools to do your job.  More specifically, you will - Prospect and qualify leads for the sales team. Enthusiastically make outbound calls when necessary and represent the company in a highly professional manner. Successfully and accurately answer prospect questions and provide appropriate additional information to the sales team to start a sales cycle. Capture accurate and legible documentation on all call activity in Salesforce. Achieve defined productivity and performance goals.  Requirements College Degree and 1 year equivalent work experience in Sales (tech experience a plus) Strong phone, video call etiquette You’re a quick learner, open to coaching, and always working to get better Demonstrated strengths in verbal and written communication skills including appropriate grammar and punctuation. You have a big-time “motor,” always operating with a sense of urgency You’re agile, continuously testing, learning, and changing course as necessary You’re a resourceful, tenacious, outside the box thinker You deal with and thrive on objections Even moving quickly you’re a great multi-tasker and manage your time wisely You’re excited to play a big part in the success of Detroit tech startup  Anything that will make me stand out? Proven track record generating leads Experience selling HR Software or related tech. Experience working directly for a fast-growing tech startup Experience with sales prospecting, CRM, and automation tools Prefer a candidate in Detroit or SE Michigan, but open to fully remote with the right fit - Sift is a hybrid working company where we offer the flexibility for employees to work fully remote, or work some days remotely and others from our Downtown Detroit office.

Summary/Objective- The Sales Operations Specialist works under the direction and supervision of the General Sales Manager. This role will assist with new/existing customer management, sales promotion, and analysis of market data. Other responsibilities include dealing directly with internal and external customers, maintaining, and updating product database, processing order entry, and monitoring customer call/email activity.  Essential Functions Develop sales toolkit to enable acquisition of new customers and launching new products. Provide updated, correct product information to new customers to enable sales order. Manage and maintain product database that includes product specification, product images and pricing. Lead communication with prospective customer to acquire necessary information and documents for new account setup. Analyze internal and external sales data and make recommendation of sales strategy, promotional activity, and product assortment. Support international/domestic trade show execution. Own and manage internal product sample by conducting regular inventory check, processing internal/external requests, and shipping. Assist the General Manager of Sales in establishing/improving internal processes. Assist data/sales order entry and processing as needed. Support general administrative tasks. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  Competencies Detail-oriented, collaborative, and team-oriented personality Must have excellent communication and presentation skills Excellent organizational and analytical skills Ability to multi-task, prioritize and manage time effectively Proficient in MS Office and ERP software experience Required Education And Experience College degree required. 1-3 years’ experience in a sales operation role and/or consumer goods industry is preferred but not required. For 23 years, NPIC has proudly manufactured N-Bone® and Get Naked® natural pet treats. Where pet's health and well-being are first in everything that we do. That's why we formulate our treats to make your pet feel and be their best. Our treats help enrich the lives of pets, their owners' lives, and the relationship between the two of them.
industries: Food & Beverages, Food Production, and Consumer Goods

description: From smartphones to connected cars, location data is changing the way we live and the way business happens.  CARTO is the platform that turns location data into more efficient delivery routes, better behavioral marketing, strategic store placements, and much more.  Everyone, from business analysts to developers and data scientists, use our software and data to understand where and why things happen, optimize business processes, and predict future outcomes. Trusted by brands such as Mastercard, T Mobile, Bain, New York City and Postmates, our platform allows them to increase revenues and decrease costs through the power of Location Intelligence.  To continue our growth in enterprise, we are looking for a high-energy, creative and curious Sales Development Representative (ideally in DC or NYC, but we're open to remote candidates).  This individual would report to our Sales Development Lead, who is based in our Madrid office joining a sales development team of 8 people split between London, Madrid, NYC and DC, as well as working closely with our NA (North America) team of Account Executives and Partnerships Manager.  As An SDR You Will Develop new business leads and enhance existing relationships with strategic accounts, using outbound and inbound tactics to identify new opportunities. Use our sales toolbox to drive opportunity creation. These tools include Salesforce, Hubspot, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Outreach, Zoominfo and Lusha, among others. Learn and be curious about our customer’s business problems, whether it’s geomarketing for CPG firms or supply chain optimization for last mile delivery players. You will invest time attending webinars, listening to podcasts, reading industry reports and following industry influencers who help you understand our prospects better. Conduct sales development best practices with email, phone, and social drips using enablement technology to connect with new prospects. Work closely and collaboratively with the sales and marketing team to develop and implement appropriate prospect communication plans in line with our Account Based Marketing strategy, coordinating with our Account Executives to qualify opportunities; prepare for and book pitch meetings with target prospects. Be able to demonstrate the value of CARTO for enterprise organizations, adapting your demo scripts and messaging to the needs of the customer. As an SDR, you are: Energetic, with a positive attitude Curious about technology and business Determined to get the job done and productive in the way you do it Creative and proactive in daily tasks, whether it’s copywriting for an outbound cadence or throwing together a follow up deck in Google Slides Diligent and good at multitasking in a fast paced environment, a long to-do list doesn’t freak you out A critical thinker, fast learner and very capable of internalizing information and articulating relevant value. Tenacious – you know every “no” you hear is a learning opportunity and one step closer to the next “yes.” Assertive – you’re likable, but aren’t afraid to ask for what you want. Coachable – no matter your experience you’re never done learning. Quick witted – you see objections as an opportunity to practice verbal jousting. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience. Driven, eager to learn, and desire to pursue a career in tech and SaaS sales. Ideally 1-2 years business experience, preferably in a results-oriented sales environment. But open to recently graduated individuals looking for their first opportunity in tech. Prior lead generation experience or cold-calling experience a plus. Benefits Competitive compensation. Flexible work hours in a focused but casual environment. Excellent benefits, including 100% medical, dental, and vision coverage for employees. Generous—really generous—time off, 401k with match, and stock options. Growth prospects at a truly welcoming, multicultural and multilingual company. A big vision: to help the world use location-based data to make better decisions. We believe that openness and sustainability are baked into this vision, and we’re sharing it with the world. To Apply  Provide us your resume and a letter explaining your interest. Be sure to let us know why you’re a great match for this role and for CARTO!  If you really want this job, then please share 3 brief bullet point reasons in the cover letter section as to why you would like to work at CARTO. No need for a long, formal cover letter, but just something punchy to show why you’re our next rockstar SDR.  Do you feel that you don't check all of the requirements? At CARTO we believe that professional development happens through teaching and learning from your peers and managers. Even if you’re uncertain about whether you have the experience we’re looking for, please apply if this position sparks your curiosity.  A diversity of identity, perspective, and experience makes us stronger. We welcome you to apply to CARTO regardless of your background, gender, ethnicity, orientation, or ability.  To learn more about us, please visit our blog or follow us on Twitter (@carto) or Instagram (@cartohq).
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: The Junior Sales Coordinator is responsible for the development and maintenance of the sales funnel and managing all inbound sales inquiries. Using a combination of traditional sales methodologies and cutting-edge technology tools, the Junior Sales Coordinator works directly with Inside Sales Representatives to meet revenue goals. By proactively managing the customer-facing sales experience, you will contribute directly to the success of the Sales team.  Responsibilities Manage customer-facing communication channels Manage person engagement and re-engagement strategies Send outbound emails with information on BrainStation's courses, workshops and events Handle inbound and outbound phone conversations Handle front facing communications with excellent customer service skills Execute and identify strategic sales opportunities through community initiatives Liaise and leverage partnerships with key players in the digital space Identify areas of improvement and communicate them in our daily standups  Successful candidates will have Bachelor's degree Proven ability to work independently and under pressure Customer Service experience Ability to engage in conversations with small and large groups with ease Proven work ethic with the utmost integrity and desire to excel and succeed Outgoing, energetic, upbeat and fun personality Motivation driven by KPI's Previous sales experience - an asset Previous experience in student recruitment - an asset  Perks And Benefits Comprehensive Health & Wellness Benefits Package Retirement Planning Parental Leave Program New Device Allowance Socials, Outings & Retreats Culture of Learning & Development Flexible Working Hours Work from Home Flexibility  About BrainStation  Established in 2012, BrainStation is the global leader in digital skills training and workforce transformation. BrainStation has worked with digital leaders from the most innovative companies in the world, developing cutting-edge, real-world digital education that has empowered more than 100,000+ professionals.  Bonus: Have you been to a campus or joined an online learning opportunity? We are actively seeking individuals that believe in lifelong learning and that have taken part in our On Campus or Online offerings.  NOTE: Only those applicants under consideration will be contacted. Please accept our utmost appreciation for your interest.  BrainStation is committed to maintaining a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants, regardless of race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status will receive consideration for employment. If you have any accessibility requirements or concerns regarding the hiring process or employment with us, please notify us so we can provide suitable accommodation.
industries: Higher Education, Computer Software, and Education Management

description: URGENTLY HIRING!  A privately owned company, Costa Fruit and Produce Company is a produce and specialty foods purveyor serving fine dining establishments throughout New England.  In addition to offering a complete line of fresh products that include fresh fruit and produce, dairy and value added fresh cut produce; Costa works closely with local farmers and producers bringing a wide variety of local artisan items such as cheese, meats and hors d’oeuvres to their diverse customer base.  Costa is a sustainable business leader certified by the Sustainable Business Network of Massachusetts and has been a recipient of the Boston Green Business Award for their support of local agriculture and green initiatives.  Sales Opportunities in Boston and points North, South, and West   Develops customer base for our extensive line of produce, perishable, and Specialty food items.   Markets Costa Fruit and Produce Company as the premier produce/specialty distributor for the market.   Maintains/builds/manages relationships with existing customers.   Develops penetration strategies to maximize sales at all accounts.   Provides timely competitive reporting for market.   Assists in pricing strategy with all accounts to maximize margin.   Strong interface with Credit Accounting Department.  Essential Duties And Responsibilities   Achieving set Sales and Profitability goals for all individual Sales Territories within Region. In general, this number is always set to exceed previous years’ sales and GP numbers.   Working with Pricing to maximize profitability on all accounts under each of sales people   Perform semi-annual personnel reviews on all sales people within your region   Sales Training for all sales people within your region   Complete CRM Integration for all sales people in your region   National and/or Regional Key Account Responsibility to be determined  Qualifications And Previous Experience   2 -4 years of sales experience   Proven track record of sales success   Recent and verifiable professional sales experience within the industry   Strong influencing skills   Ability to Drive/Travel by automobile, current valid driver’s license required.   Relationship Management and Excellent Customer Service skills   MS Office (MSWORD, MS Excel), Internet, FACEBOOK skills  Only qualified individuals with recent and verifiable work histories need apply.  No agencies or recruiters please!  Costa Fruit and Produce Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V  Costa Fruit & Produce Co. is a privately-owned warehouse and distribution company located in Charlestown MA.  Costa Fruit and Produce Co. is an industry leader and has provided fresh produce grocery items, and specialty food to New England's finest restaurants and eateries.  Come join us as we celebrate over 70 years in business!
industries: Food & Beverages, Logistics and Supply Chain, and Food Production

description: Job Description  HealthSpire is a multi-carrier e-broker agency, directly responsible for utilizing digital channel to generate Individual Medicare business (e.g., MAPD, PDP, Med Supp., and Ancillary products) and provide client support through web-tele-advisors empowered with the latest data analytics. The sales operations specialist will support HealthSpire sales technology in platform refinement, scalable design, new and refined integrations. The role will require strong understanding of optimizing user interfaces, telephony, integrated CRM and/or integrated platform designs ensure design enables optimal reporting solutions and enhancements.  Job Responsibilities With limited direction, translates business requirements to technical specifications. Creates technical designs for a new enhancements or refinement of integrated call center technology including inbound, outbound, integrated CRM record management for sales/customer service campaigns. Performs ongoing system maintenance, research, problem resolution and on- call support, according to defined plans. Documents required policy and procedures for existing systems. Independently performs testing and design scenarios/projects to optimize performance of platforms. May perform or assist with integration and system testing, according to detailed test plans to ensure high-quality systems. May assist business partners with User Acceptance Testing. Independently supports processes related to the implementation and project management production systems, including integration of purchased solutions. Independently supports the Code Asset Management process. Works cross-functionally to deploy multi-faceted integrated design, to include database, sales operations, digital, member engagement management teams. Independently works on small and large moderately complex projects that require increased skill in multiple technical environments and disciplines, that have system wide impact and that may integrate across the organization. Other duties as assigned Accountabilities Is fully familiar with the prescribed methodology and is in strict compliance with all required artifacts. Developing business requirements and creation of procedures in support of business operations. Documentation of required procedures for integrated system designs, refinements, and standard packages. Developing and becoming a subject matter expert with regards to data flow and capture from integrated endpoints, agent interfaces, and the call center technology suite. Work across functions to optimize HealthSpire’s performance. Required Qualifications  3-5+ Years demonstrated proficiencies in some of the following HTML, Java, PHP, inContact telephony platforms (or similar contact center platforms).  3-5+ Years Expertise in one or more programming language, development tools, and/or databases and the systems development life cycle, applicable to development organization.  Excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills.  Proficiency with standard corporate software applications, including MS Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint, as well as some special proprietary applications.  COVID Requirements  COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement  CVS Health requires its Colleagues in certain positions to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including any booster shots if required), where allowable under the law, unless they are approved for a reasonable accommodation based on disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief that prevents them from being vaccinated. If you are vaccinated, you are required to have received at least one COVID-19 shot prior to your first day of employment and to provide proof of your vaccination status within the first 30 days of your employment. For the two COVID-19 shot regimen, you will be required to provide proof of your second COVID-19 shot within the first 60 days of your employment. Failure to provide timely proof of your COVID-19 vaccination status will result in the termination of your employment with CVS Health. If you are unable to be fully vaccinated due to disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief, you will be required to apply for a reasonable accommodation within the first 30 days of your employment in order to remain employed with CVS Health. As a part of this process, you will be required to provide information or documentation about the reason you cannot be vaccinated. If your request for an accommodation is not approved, then your employment may be terminated. Preferred Qualifications  3-5+ Years Medicare program experience, sales and/or call center technology including integrated telephony and CRMs preferred.  Education  4 year college degree  Business Overview  At Aetna, a CVS Health company, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.  We are committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, age, disability or protected veteran status. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Financial Services, and Hospital & Health Care

jobTitle: Marketing & Sales Operations Associate - Full Time
description: Company And Opportunity  Legacy.com is the place where life stories live on. We are the global leader in online memorial tributes; a top-50 website in the United States, and a destination for over 40 million unique visitors each month. Founded in 1998, Legacy.com is honored to help consumers express condolences, share direct support for families, and celebrate the people who have touched their lives. Uniquely open to profound messaging at this focused moment, users respond by sharing memories, purchasing gifts, finding event information, and making plans. Legacy delivers its community-targeted content daily via 1,500 local news media partners. We continue to broaden our offerings in our mission to help people seeking information and guidance on all aspects of end-of-life. Our vision is to become a full-service end-of-life and memorialization resource.  We have a diverse and talented team of employees who come to us from many kinds of backgrounds. We have an immediate need for a talented, experienced Marketing & Sales Operations Associate for our new Downtown Chicago office that will report to our Director of Operations.  See our new Chicago HQ:  Overview  Work with Ecommerce, Marketing, and Partners teams to help grow revenue across various customer groups. This role requires handling inbound and outbound phone calls on a daily basis, regular email correspondence with customers, flexibility in your day-to-day responsibilities, learning and adaptation of operational workflows, and confidence to improvise as needed.  Responsibilities Service phone order requests for consumers shopping sympathy gifts directly on Legacy. Service phone order requests for consumers shopping sympathy gifts on partner websites. Assist in fulfilling orders when no delivery address is available for the obituary. Manage your workstream, follow ups, and cases in Salesforce. Contribute directly to team performance targets monthly. Provide empathetic, top-tier service to every customer and contact you engage with.  Requirements Confidence and willingness to develop exceptional phone conversation skills. Excellent communications skills, both written and verbal. Excellent problem solving and time management skills. Ability to work independently or collaboratively as needed. Proficient in MS Office products (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) and Google tools (Google Docs). Familiarity with e-commerce operations preferred. Experience with Salesforces is a plus.  Benefits  Legacy.com offers a very generous and comprehensive benefits package, including: Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance Generous Paid Time Off 401k plan with discretionary employer match Parking/Transit Flex Spending RTA and CTA pre-tax payroll deductions Catered lunch provided 2x per week, breakfast 1x a week Employee Assistance Program Casual dress every day Daily, company-provided coffee, tea, soda, and snacks Friendly, team-oriented, open environment Located within a few blocks of CTA, Ogilvie, and Union Station  Powered by JazzHR  xKrmsUuxjd
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: About Us  Oblong is delivering the future of work with Mezzanine™ — a groundbreaking collaborative conference room solution that is already changing the way groups of people meet and work, in the same room or across distances. We need top-notch, lifelong learners who are excited to share ideas and solve challenging problems that will help shape the future of collaborative work.  The Mezzanine team at Oblong has an opening for a Sales Development Representative to support Account Managers/Executives to acquire new business by going outbound to generate qualified opportunities. This is an exciting opportunity to be a key contributor in the evolution of the sales organization as we scale our team.  Ideal Candidates: An ideal candidate would be in Austin, TX as we will be opening a local Austin office (we have an additional office in Los Angeles) as part of our effort to both design and implement the office of the future. To be successful at Oblong, you will need a flexible growth mindset that embraces teamwork and collaboration to win. As our product evolves, you will need to be comfortable with visionary selling methods. As a Sales Development Representative, you'll be responsible for owning the top of the sales funnel qualifying inbound leads to prospecting outbound opportunities. You will be the first line of communication to potential customers about how Mezzanine can deliver value above and beyond contemporary meeting services.  Responsibilities  · Drives sales volume via outbound cold calls and emails to generate leads  · Contact and Qualify Marketing Leads for Account Managers/Executives  · Execute on established sales methodology to push beyond gatekeepers to reach the right people at the right time in the right way to provide the right information to create opportunities  · Generate opportunities using our technology stack (Salesforce, SalesLoft)  · Documenting and seamlessly handing off prospects to Account Managers/Executives to create a positive customer experience  · Conduct Prospect research to maintain up-to-date records of contact and account information within the CRM (Salesforce)  · Draw upon your personal experience and knowledge to assess complex business structures and challenges, identify and obtain information that is critical to the sale, and create clear next steps to guide the customer in the sales process  · Contributing to other sales projects on an as-needed basis    · Bachelor's degree and/or equivalent industry experience in sales  · 2+ years of sales or relevant customer-facing experience  · Aptitude to learn and continue to develop and master your sales skills  · Tenacity to keep pushing to achieve or exceed goals  · Excellent communication, organizational, time-management and prioritization skills  · Comfortable with high volume of outbound cold calls (65-80 calls per day)  · Proven ability to work collaboratively and constructively as part of a team  · Great phone and Web conferencing demeanor and professionalism.  · Familiar with CRM and Sales Engagement tools  Additive Qualifications  · Experience with Hardware and SaaS  · Experience working in the AV/IT Industry  · Experience working within partner ecosystems  Additional information Benefits and Perks  · Competitive compensation package  · Amazing insurance with the premium fully paid for you and your dependents on our medical, dental, vision plans. We also provide disability and life insurance.  · Unlimited PTO policy  · Excellent Work/Life balance  · 401K plan with match    All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, national origin, veteran status, marital status, and any other status protected by federal, state, or local law.    PM21    PI147793688

description: JBS Marketing & Sales is looking for a full-time sales rep based in Dallas to independently manage several accounts in our territory which covers primarily Texas and Oklahoma. The qualified candidate will be expected to travel to customers several times throughout the year, meet with buyers and vendors, and successfully manage relationships between the customer and vendors we represent. Offices are located in Dallas, TX.  Managing the relationship entails: Detailed knowledge of the vendor catalog and specific items carried with each customer Troubleshooting customer concerns and problems that may arise as it pertains to shipping, pricing, new item set ups, etc. Become knowledgeable about customer stores and ecommerce strategies (merchandising, layout, review schedules, etc..) Understand the competitive landscape within our sales channels – Military, Craft & Hobby, and Grocery Taking buyer meetings to review and discuss new products as well as optimize the current catalog of items Work closely with your vendor sales manager to ensure each customer’s needs are being met in a timely fashion  Salaried position + Annual Bonus  Health Insurance  Flexible work schedule

description: At Hiya, we are on a mission to modernize the voice call with trust, identity and intelligence. We are trusted by global enterprises, carriers and consumers to provide secure, engaging connections and stop unwanted calls. Built on the world's leading Voice Performance Platform, Hiya protects people from spam and fraud calls, connects businesses with their customers, and helps carriers secure their networks for all. Our SaaS applications, Hiya Connect and Hiya Protect, serve more than 200M users worldwide, power services like AT&T Call Protect and Samsung Smart Call, and deliver voice performance insights that move businesses forward. We're passionate about creating a culture where employees love to work, feel supported and energized, and are empowered to create, innovate and challenge the status quo.  We are seeking a Sales Development Representative (SDR). In this role, you will build a strong sales foundation and be responsible for driving market share and qualifying leads that build a pipeline for the sales organization. The SDR will follow up on web inquiries, pre‐qualify leads, find and create new leads through the outbound process and develop to the point of handoff for Sales.  What You Will Be Doing…  You will be working closely with the sales team to qualify and schedule meetings for the Account Executives through inbound and or outbound processes. The SDR will perform prospecting, marketing event outreach and perform general sales development functions to build a pipeline within targeted accounts designated by management.  An implicit responsibility of the SDR is to conduct business dealings with prospects in a way that creates a superior customer/prospect experience to set the stage for future product sales for Hiya. SDRs are the first impression for our prospects and have a huge impact on Hiya's success  In this role you will: Build and manage lead development pipeline Deliver outbound phone calls, emails, LinkedIn messages and other touch points to customers and potential customers at a high volume Achieve or exceed goal for qualified leads to Sales on a monthly basis Qualify all sales leads based upon lead qualification criteria definitions Provide baseline research within targeted accounts to identify key contacts and critical account information prior to prospecting call Develop superior customer service relationships with prospects Provide weekly activity reports to management Proactively learn Hiya product, competitive products, and market knowledge via website, on‐line webinars, and other marketing information Update lead status and all prospect interaction in CRM application daily Continuous learning through mock calls, formal training, and regular coaching and feedback Work different time zones  You don't have to check all the boxes, but we think these are important requirements for this role: Sales and/or lead qualification experience (including outbound prospecting) Experience with lead qualification at all levels within organizations – managers, directors, VPs, executives You know what to say and more importantly, how to say it Comfortable with making phone calls and objection handling Ability to work in a high energy, fast‐paced sales environment. You think out-of-the-box and wow people with your interesting angles and quality work Proficient with standard corporate productivity tools Experience using Hubspot or Marketo, Salesforce, Outreach , LinkedIn Sales Navigator and other 3rd party integration tools Energized working at a fast-paced company where the feedback and cycle is measured in hours rather than weeks with lots of change "Get it done" attitude and team spirit while building a career-defining opportunity in a proven, results-oriented team  Hiya is a fast-growing startup that offers a team of dynamic and experienced executives at the helm, and a hardworking team of international colleagues at your side. We value getting things done for our customers and consistently improving ourselves and products along the way.  Hiya is an equal opportunity employer. We value and embrace diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, age or disability status.  This role is based in Seattle.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

Sells a subset of product or services directly or via partners to small-and-medium sized accounts. The role is a combination of a Field Sales Rep and Inside Sales Rep.  Works to achieve maximum sales profitability, growth, and account penetration within an assigned territory. description: Position Summary:  Primary responsibility is to drive Lumivascular therapy utilization through case coverage and supporting marketing and training events.  Core Job Responsibilities:  Partner with the Territory Sales Representative to execute sales plan tailored to the assigned territory/accounts. Become an expert of Company products and marketing programs to assist in the development of surgical teams to treat peripheral artery disease (PAD) Work with senior hospital staff and key surgeons in the development and execution of a plan to effectively integrate the marketing programs at new customer sites, ensuring ongoing commitment to the products. Instruct physicians on products and drive utilization by collaborating with surgical teams. Manage and oversee marketing programs from beginning to end and track results. Other duties as assigned. Requirements:  3 to 5-years of successful experience in a clinical role (Catheter Lab or Operating Room Technician) Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent, relevant sales and industry experience. Working knowledge of the catheter lab and operating room environment 3+ years of work experience in endovascular space preferred Understanding of endovascular anatomy, physiology, and terminology preferred Good knowledge of endovascular procedures preferred. Solid verbal/written communication and interpersonal skills to work across multiple constituents. Team player Self-starter with the ability to take leadership in an unstructured environment. Able to prioritize and productively manage multiple tasks. Desire to work in an open, collaborative, and fast-paced environment. Willingness to develop creative solutions to overcome challenges. Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams with and without formal authority. Accustomed to and anticipates travel (30%+) Other Responsibilities:  Understand the job-specific quality system procedures and processes as defined in the Training Matrix and adhere to the requirements listed in those documents. Always maintain corporate confidentiality.
