description: Who we are: Join a fast-paced, leading technology company with an exciting business and ambitious growth plans. SilverIP is a leading Internet Service Provider (ISP) in Chicago and Milwaukee, consistently ranked as one of the top independent networks in the region. We compete with AT&T and Comcast by providing Gigabit Internet to multi-family properties, businesses and to large events such as Lollapalooza. Our advanced network enables us to offer carrier-grade, high bandwidth Internet access service at highly competitive rates prices. We are continuously growing and are looking for talented and amazing people to join our team in Chicago and Milwaukee!  The Position:  As a Sales Development Representative (“SDR”) for SilverIP, you will play an important role in helping us grow our Residential (apartments and condominiums) Internet business in the Chicago region. You will work closely with our EVP of Business development to contact property managers and real estate developers and introduce them to SilverIP.  The ideal person for this position is self-motivated with an entrepreneurial spirit, is comfortable communicating with customers on the phone, via email and in-person, can develop and manage relationships.  Hands-on sales and technical training, a generous base salary of $55K-$60K, and a commission plan offers you significant earnings potential. A full benefits package takes effect within 30 days of employment.  This involves:  Report to and work closely with the Executive Vice President of Business Development to approach and market to new residential apartments and condominium buildings Identify and qualify new opportunities through market research, direct calling, networking and email campaigns to property managers and real estate developers. Compliment prospecting and selling efforts through field work such as building walks, lobby events, property management relationships, and customer face to face meetings Understand and effectively communicate SilverIP’s value proposition and our technology Work closely with our Marketing Director in the development and implementation of innovative marketing ideas, including media campaigns, events, and marketing collateral Work closely with our account managers in seamlessly onboarding new buildings post-sale Manage and maintain our CRM system with up to date contact and opportunity information   What you will need to bring:  Strong work ethic and self-motivated Excellent communication skills Able to travel 10% of the time 3-5 years of business development, marketing or sales experience A college degree is preferred Flexibility to work remote, hybrid or in person in our south loop office Experience working in the multi-family real estate sector a plus

Description  What Makes Verbit Unique?  Verbit’s 200+ individuals share a vision of making all video and audio content accessible to everyone. Verbit’s in-house, AI-based solutions take live and recorded audio and video to the next level with the support of 22,000 human professional transcribers. Our captioning, transcription, translation, and audio description are trusted by leading universities, corporations, legal agencies, and media entities to make their content accessible, engaging, and interactive!  Verbitizers are actively making the world more equitable for individuals with disabilities every day. After achieving the milestone of becoming a “unicorn company” and showcasing 6x revenue growth year over year, we are humbled and still fascinated by this ride. You too can join our journey toward accessibility and the reinvention of industry practices. Join our offices in New York, San Francisco, Tel Aviv, and Kyiv to take advantage of flexible remote work opportunities and work with amazing people.  Do You Have Verbitzer DNA?  Verbitizers have the initiative to bring goals and dreams to fruition with a can-do attitude and the motivation of true go-getters.  We’re a Group Of Tech-savvy individuals who are always open to more growth and learning opportunities Adaptable and flexible people who thrive in a fast-paced, startup environment Creative minds who rethink and question how to outperform past results Effective communicators who can promote and represent Verbit’s tech and brand If this sounds like you, keep reading.  Responsibilities Conduct analysis of complex data and translate the results into actionable deliverables, business insights, and reports. Work cross-functionally with sales teams, marketing & CS to optimize sales results and implement processes. Manage the booking forecast process including close work with Sales management. Help build the systems, reports, and processes to measure metrics and KPIs. Remain knowledgeable of key processes, business initiatives, and internal resources to assist the sales team in accomplishing company goals. Collaborate with internal resources to ensure reports are translated to actions and results are monitored. Provide maintenance and support to internal stakeholders. Assist sales teams with crafting Quotes, Rate Cards, and Enterprise Licensing Agreements Assist with developing, deploying, and managing tools that are needed to increase productivity. Sales Focal point for any Salesforce question or help Responsible for technical training to the sales team (Salesforce, Dealhub CPQ) Requirements  The Ideal Candidate: Bachelor's degree in business, finance, or related field/ experience 2+ years of successful sales operations experience (SaaS experience preferred) Strong analytical, data mining, and modeling skills Able to drive execution, initiate projects, and manage them start to end Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment Be creative and solutions-oriented Process-oriented, well-organized, and autonomous learner High proficiency with Excel Experience with configuration and administration of Salesforce, and comfortable working with Salesforce flows, formulas, custom views, reports, and dashboards Curious, proactive, loves to help others, and is excited about getting things done Ability to leverage numbers and insights to influence & drive sound decision making
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

jobTitle: Global Sales Support – Associate Sales I Latin American Caribbean (LAC) Fort Lauderdale, Minneapolis/St. Paul or Atlanta
description: Global Sales Support (GSS) is looking for new Associates who are fluent in Spanish and/or Portuguese to support Delta’s top B2B customers. GSS Associates are a fundamental part of Delta’s Sales model and strengthen the overall B2B relationship by building and maintaining strong customer relationships. Associates provide high value, differentiated customer service to Delta and Air France/KLM (JV) Global Corporate and Agency accounts via phone, email, and chat in a contact center environment. Associates are responsible for resolving complex travel agency ticketing issues, interpreting and verifying unique fare and ticketing rules for multiple airline partners, resolving travel-related issues from pre- to post-travel, providing program information, and researching and resolving service failures. In addition, Associates attend joint sales calls/customer events and support new sales programs, products, and services to help solidify Delta's and the JV's position in the marketplace. This position can be in Fort Lauderdale, Minneapolis/St. Paul, or Atlanta.  Job Responsibilities Evaluates B2B customer requests and determines appropriate solutions to resolve issues efficiently and effectively at first point of contact (i.e. business exceptions/waivers; inventory access; airline fares; seat selection; refund requests; etc.) Uses analytical reasoning and knowledge of sales guidelines, account value and customer benefits to independently respond to Global Sales B2B customer requests for travel-related inquiries such as flight availability, schedule changes, ticketing changes, large scale service disruptions, service failures, etc. Consults travel agency partners to help them understand Delta and global partners’ policies, products, ticketing fare rules and penalties, and online agency resources Consults with travel agents to troubleshoot global ticketing issues and direct them to the appropriate resources (GDS provider, ARC/IATA, other airlines, etc.) Collaborates across internal business partners (i.e. airport, reservations, RM, etc.) to resolve customer issues, oftentimes requiring research and follow-up over multiple days and time zones Distinguishes customer segments such as agency, corporate or industry-specific verticals, and applies appropriate solutions (customer benefits vary by geographical region and point of sale) Demonstrates proficiency of core Delta and industry business principles, processes and upholds Delta’s Rules of the Road standards Available to work extended hours beyond normal assigned hours as operationally required Practices safety-conscious behaviors in all operational processes and procedures Where permitted by applicable law, must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire to be considered for U.S.-based job, if not currently employed by Delta Air Lines, Inc. 12 months of relevant work experience required Requires excellent customer service and interpersonal skills Demonstrated ability to negotiate sound business decisions using creative problem-solving approaches Must possess ability to quickly acquire expertise in airline ticketing processes and systems as well as to interpret and apply fare rules for Delta and global partners Knowledge of airline pricing, ticketing and distribution systems is preferred Possesses business maturity to independently manage through ambiguous situations and scenarios Excellent reliability, time management and organizational skills required to be successful Demonstrates clear and courteous verbal and written communication skills and appropriate use of grammar, spelling and business terminology In addition to fluent English, verbal and written proficiency in Spanish and/or Portuguese are required (Trilingual preferred) Constant access to a virtual/home-based office suitable for conducting business over a phone Willingness to work overnight, holidays and weekend rotating schedules to support a global operation Works well in a fast-paced environment where efficiency and customer service must be balanced Must be willing and able to travel occasionally Bachelor's degree preferred
industries: Airlines/Aviation and Consumer Services

description: Vodori is on a mission to transform lives by empowering life science companies to bring their vital drugs, vaccines, medical devices, and diagnostic solutions to market faster with modern technology.  Our Pepper Cloud Product Suite streamlines and automates how life science companies get critical marketing, medical, and scientific content to key audiences like patients, healthcare providers, and key opinion leaders. Our software is used by thousands of life science professionals in more than 50 countries worldwide.  Vodori is in a rapid growth phase and in search of a Sales Development Representative to grow our pipeline. We expect that you're early in your sales career and have 0-2 years of full-time, sales experience. No matter how many years of experience you have, you should have a passion for sales and thrive in an entrepreneurial environment. We need you to be proactive and have a hunger for experimentation, refinement, and learning. Pepper Flow is a sophisticated B2B SaaS product and is sold to sophisticated buyers. You should have a knack for identifying the decision makers and the influencers and altering your message to these potential customers.  As a Sales Development Representative, you will be tasked with continuously evolving our outbound sales tactics. Your written and verbal communication skills should be superb, as you'll need to be a master at calibrating your message for a range of audiences. We use Sales Navigator, Hubspot, Outreach.io, Terminus, Gong, and ZoomInfo. You should have extensive experience with CRM systems and know how to leverage their capabilities.  In 3 months, you will… Learn about Vodori's strategy and product offerings and become comfortable with Pepper Cloud Get acquainted with our sales and marketing tooling and how we use those tools to inform our outreach efforts Prospect, identify, and enroll new potential customers in various outreach programs Convert customer conversations into scheduled meetings and demos  In 6 months, you will… Have a polished understanding of Vodori's business and offerings Execute, analyze, and report on outreach results and KPIs Exceed monthly sales goals of qualified leads Have a perspective on successful outreach tactics and help craft future messaging Work directly with our marketing department to convert warm leads into interested prospects  In 12+ months, you will… Become a lead generation machine Continue to learn about and sell Vodori's product offerings Qualify inbound sales inquiries based on your knowledge of our software tools, digital marketing services, and the potential growth of that prospect  What We Offer  In addition to joining in our mission to help life science companies bring their products to market faster, we offer: Competitive salary Medical, dental, vision benefits Retirement program and company match Stock options Remote work option 10 weeks paid family leave Unlimited vacation time (Yes, really!) Employee recognition programs Employee assistance program Transit benefits Professional growth and training opportunities An environment that rewards creativity, calculated risk taking, and continuous learning  Our Values  We look for people who care about our mission and align with our values: Customer first, always Be bold, pursue the unexpected Support the team (it's not about you) Aspire to excellence Move, think, act swiftly Keep it simple  Vodori is committed to creating diverse and inclusive workplaces where people can make a positive impact. Women, people of color, LGBTQ individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, and veterans are encouraged to apply.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Management Consulting

description: Paychex is looking for passionate, enthusiastic, and self-motivated individuals to join our fast-paced virtual sales team. These individuals know that what they put into their career is what they are going to get out of it. They want a company that cares about their success, is dedicated to personal growth and professional development, and can deliver on results through demonstrating our core values.  Responsibilities ·        Utilizes the telephone, cold calling, and qualifying leads, overcoming objections, while prospecting new clients and new referral sources. ·        Presents Paychex payroll products and services to final decision-makers and end-users within the prospect universe to educate them on our services with the goal of having them become Paychex Payroll clients. ·        Completes and submits accurate new business paperwork and weekly activity reports by agreed-upon dates set by Sales management to assist with forecasting. ·        Analyzes the customer needs and interests to determine which products are appropriate and refers to the appropriate party when necessary. ·        Schedules phone appointments by cold calling prospects and current referral sources to secure referrals to end-users. ·        Expedites the resolution of customer problems or complaints to the appropriate channels to ensure client satisfaction. ·        Closes sales by asking for the business  Qualifications ·        Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Business ·        At least 1 - 2 years of sales experience ·        Excellent written and verbal communication skills ·        Ability to multi-task, organize, and prioritize work

Merfish United is the leading distributor of pipe and steel products. We are working on a search for an Inside Sales Representative to join growing Sales Team.  The Inside Sales Representative is an essential and valued member of our team. This position is responsible for selling products to an assigned geographical region, and servicing the existing customer base. Growing the territory and bringing on new customers is critical as well. This role will partner with the Outside Sales Representative in their region to accomplish these goals.  Position Responsibilities Generate and qualify leads and sales opportunities by making outbound phone calls to customers; initiating calls for new accounts; responding to inbound inquiries. Generate new and repeat sales by providing product and technical information to customers in a timely manner. Process orders, prepare correspondence, and fulfill customer needs to ensure satisfaction. Create and adjust content of sales presentations with an understanding of the different type of sales outlets. Research and resolve service/product issues to ensure customer retention and satisfaction. Prepare and submit activity/results reports to outside sales team and others as needed. Use sales management tools to maximize sales effectiveness and efficiency. Update and maintain accounts including contact names and numbers for future sales. Analyze existing and potential volume of dealers. Achieve annual sales targets. Additional duties as required. Position Requirements Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with a can-do attitude. Work experience should include a minimum of 2 years in an Inside Sales role. Must be able to build trust-based relationships with customers over the phone. Strong organizational skills and the ability to multi-task. Working knowledge of MS Office, and comfortable learning sales software; experience with operating in an ERP/CRM environment. Knowledge of commonly-used concepts, practices and procedures within the distribution industry a plus. Plumbing, heating, electrical or irrigation industry experience preferred. Merfish United is the leading master distributor of domestic steel pipe, globally sourced steel pipe, copper tubing, plastic pipe, electrical conduit and related products to independent wholesale distributor customers. We are seeking talented individuals to join our team and grow with us.
industries: Logistics and Supply Chain

description: Job Description  Job Title: Sales Coordinator, WWPC  Job Status: Full time - year round  Job Summary  The Group Sales Coordinator is an essential member of Woodward Park City's Guest Experience team, reporting to the Senior Manager of Guest Experiences, and collaborating closely with the Senior Manager of F&B and the Manager of Events & Brand Experience. The ideal candidate will meet or exceed personal and departmental goals through planning and execution of proven sales and promotional techniques and ensuring client loyalty by delivering service excellence in all aspects. Candidate must have exceptional Guest Service, negotiation, communication and organizational skills, fine attention to detail, and knowledge of Word, and Excel programs. Responsibilities include generating leads and soliciting new accounts, as well as developing and maintaining relationships with key clients to produce group and private event business for Woodward Park City. Candidates must maintain a high-level of professional interaction with ability to attend weekend/evening events.  Essential Duties & Responsibilities Contact and solicit prospects, set appointments, and conduct on site visits with new clients. Sell and organize group bookings including: site tour, date of booking to departure, meeting requirements, food & beverage requirements. Establish and maintain rapport with clients, prior to, during and post conference, encouraging repeat business. Responsible for answering the phone, greeting callers, and answering caller inquiries. Create plans for each event with client approval to ensure departments and clients are in agreement prior to set up. Initiate contract and billing procedures, ensuring any deposits and/or credit applications are received with adequate information and within an acceptable time frame. Conduct and/or attend weekly BEO meetings to review event contracts and ensure last minute changes are communicated with appropriate departments. Sell and fulfill access for groups of 20+ more participating in activity. Attend trade shows and community events to increase patronage. Cold Call for various events, tradeshows, expos, etc. Follow departmental policies and procedures. Follow up on every event hosted at Woodward Park City to obtain feedback on product quality and service levels. Sets a positive example for guest relations. Other duties as assigned. Personal Attributes Embodies Powdr's Mission: Deliver memorable experiences. Enhance people's lives. Have fun doing it. Embodies Powdr's Vision: Inspire every human being with cool experiences in awesome places. Embodies Powdr's Values: Enduring, Responsible, Entrepreneurial, Soulful and Teamwork. Ability to develop strong relationships with diverse groups of people. Preferred Skills Four-year college degree is preferred. 2+ years of experience in related field or four-year college degree preferred. Hotel and conference experience preferred. Proficiency with CRM software, Microsoft Office suite and Adobe Creative Suite preferred. Proven ability to collaborate well across functions and departments, to work as part of a team, and to lead teams in achieving goals. Supervisory Responsibilities: none  Company Overview  Woodward empowers and inspires the next generation of action sports. We do this through the innovative environments we create, the intuitive programming we deliver, and the passionate community we cultivate. Woodward Park City is a world class all season sports facility that connects sport, progression and youth inspired programming in one of the greatest outdoor regions in the world.  POWDR is an adventure lifestyle company with offices in Park City, UT and Louisville, CO. Founded in 1993, POWDR's mission is to deliver memorable experiences, enhance people's lives, and have fun doing it. Within POWDR's portfolio are nine mountain resorts, including Copper Mountain and Eldora Mountain Resort in Colorado; Killington Mountain and Pico Mountain in Vermont; Boreal Mountain Resort and Soda Springs in the Lake Tahoe region of California; Mt. Bachelor in Oregon; Lee Canyon in Nevada, and Snowbird in Utah.  Also in POWDR's portfolio are the Woodward camps and progression centers, which include Woodward Copper at Copper Mountain, Woodward PA, Woodward Tahoe, Woodward West in Stallion Springs, CA, Woodward Riviera Maya, and Woodward Park City.  POWDR fuels participation in the adventure lifestyle with a collection of festivals, competitions, and branded events. Outside Television, based in Westport, CT, is the national active, outside-lifestyle programming network subsidiary of POWDR, Sun Country Tours in Oregon is the company's river rafting outfitter, and Powderbird, based out of Snowbird Utah, is POWDR's heli-skiing operator.  Website: www.woodwardparkcity.com  Instagram: @woodwardparkcity  Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/WoodwardParkCity/  Twitter: https://twitter.com/woodwardpc  If you need assistance with your applicaion or require accommodation, please reach out to hr@woodwardparkcity.com  Winter Season Update: Woodward Park City will be requiring proof of vaccination upon hire.  Basic Requirements  Requirements A valid driver's license is required. Physical Capabilities: bend, twist, push, pull, stand, lift 50lbs. Must be comfortable working in an outdoor environment, as well as indoor office setting. Ability to work weekends, holidays, and evenings. Due to the sensitive nature of this position, a criminal background check will be conducted after position is accepted. Start Date for Position  By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.

description: WeOffr is a vertically integrated single-family residential platform. WeOffr's tech-enabled approach to acquiring, renovating, and leasing single family rental homes allows us to move at scale and operate in multiple markets across the United States.  Responsibilities Analyze property data, using public and private data sources to accumulate offers. Manage leads and follow up through daily CRM use to update and stay on task until deals are closed Build rapport with prospects and clients; Overcome objections Reply quickly to all incoming leads and client requests for information Track all necessary contact interactions, details, and monitor the closing process using our CRM system Respond to all leads in a lightning-fast manner Understand market trends, comps, sales data, renovation budgets, and property valuations. Prepare purchase agreements using docusign Build out, and monitor your follow up system, deals are closed in the follow up!  Qualifications Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, and superior phone skills to set and close appointments Must be driven and passionate about real estate asset selling and goal-oriented 4-year college degree in Sales, Business, Real Estate or related experience highly desired  Our full-time employee benefits include: Per closed transaction bonus Flexible PTO including 9 paid holidays Employer-paid benefits (medical, dental, and vision) Relaxed casual environment

Seismic, a rapidly growing Forbes Cloud 100 company, is the global leader in enablement, helping make sales teams better by becoming more productive and engaging with buyers in a compelling way. Seismic’s platform provides continuous guidance to improve behavior, content, and skills to win more deals and deliver better experiences. Nearly 2,000 organizations including IBM and American Express have made Seismic their enablement platform of choice. Seismic integrates with business-critical platforms including Microsoft, Salesforce, Google and Adobe. Seismic is headquartered in San Diego, with offices across North America, Europe, and Australia.  Our Sales and Marketing teams help companies understand how Seismic can power collaboration internally through the use of content. We’re thoughtful and committed to telling the Seismic story, with the goal to ultimately help brands focus on enabling their go to market teams.  In your role, you’ll be influential in spreading the word about our cutting edge technology and expanding our footprint.  Our Sales Development Representatives are a group of competitive individuals who are the first step in spreading awareness of our world class sales enablement tool.  Who You Are An individual who is passionate for selling a great product; 6 + months of inside sales experience preferred Your high energy, enthusiasm and ambition enables you to want to grow in your career You possess excellent verbal and written communication skills, with experience cold calling preferred Good organizational skills and attention to detail Experience in MS Excel, Word and Outlook Familiarity with CRM Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience What You'll Be Doing Cold-calling into targeted accounts, lists or personally researched contacts within a specified region/market to uncover and qualify opportunities. Clearly communicating value proposition over the phone by thoroughly understanding Seismic’s products and business values. Identify client needs and develop positive rapport with both clients and the team. Building a network; research prospective clients through the use of web/social media, internal databases and external tools to identify leads. Documenting client interaction and/or prospecting efforts through the use of a CRM. Ensuring qualified leads meet quality standards and that channel partners actively engage in following up on these leads Partnering and strategizing with Outside Sales to build pipeline and set monthly goals. Not settling for average, always striving to exceed quota. What We Have For You Generous PTO, paid holidays, and paid parental leave Competitive Medical, Dental and Vision Plans Robust 401(k) fund options with company matching Flexible work schedule Seismic Cares volunteer program #OneSeismic culture that celebrates wins, encourages autonomy, ownership, and transparency Headquartered in San Diego and with more than 1,300 employees across the globe, Seismic is the global leader in sales enablement, backed by firms such as Permira, Ameriprise Financial, EDBI, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and T. Rowe Price. Seismic also recently expanded its team and product portfolio with the acquisition of Percolate, Grapevine6, and Lessonly. Our board of directors is composed of several industry luminaries including John Thompson, former Chairman of the Board for Microsoft.  Seismic is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, age, race, religion, or any other classification which is protected by applicable law.  Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

description: Malwarebytes believes that when people and organizations are free from threats, they are free to thrive. Founded in 2008, CEO Marcin Kleczynski had one mission: to rid the world of malware. Today, Malwarebytes has grown beyond malware remediation to ensuring cyberprotection for every one, providing device protection, privacy, and prevention solutions in the home, on-the-go, at work, or on campus. With threat hunters and innovators across the world, we want great people, like YOU, to join our team!  Malwarebytes is looking for..  The Corporate Sales Specialist focuses on SMB opportunities acting both internally to promote the business and externally with the partner community to effectively drive new business in prospective accounts. The ideal candidate will have direct sales experience with experience working for and selling high-tech software/hardware or solutions.  What You’ll Do Manage a heavy flow of inbound leads and support the full sales cycle. Contact prospects via telephone to identify decision makers and drive leads through the sales pipeline. Manage a large pipeline and forecast accurately. Schedule and perform product demonstrations for prospects and customers. Work with Product and Marketing to convey feedback on customer requirements and drive product strategy. Develop and execute an annual sales plan for managing assigned territory, updated quarterly. Make outbound telephone calls to all organizational levels and functional areas where purchasing decisions are made. Utilize data sources to analyze and develop sales opportunities. Communicate key competitive activities, market trends, and changing customer development plans and priorities. Facilitate online purchases for SMB customers. Skills You’ll Need To Have Bachelor’s degree in Business, Communications, or related field desirable or equivalent experience. Previous outbound phone sales experience required. 1-3 years of quota-carrying sales experience with SaaS, desktop software, and/or security solutions highly desired. Metrics-driven individual with track record of achievement and consistently exceeding sales quotas and goals. Must be a self-starter with the ability to multi-task and adapt to changing situations. Able to effectively partner and engage with internal sales resources such as sales specialists and sales engineers, as well as liaising with external partners at all levels. Excellent written and verbal communication skills resulting in the ability to influence others. Strong presentation skills. Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills. Ability to work independently; must be task oriented, organized and focused. Works with a sense of urgency and drive to bring issues to closure. Benefits And Perks An opportunity to do something great for yourself and the world A great work environment that supports growth, development, and most importantly having fun! Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and life insurance coverage Competitive salary and equity stock incentives 401k + company match Open Time Off Policy Employee Referral Bonus Program Wellness programs

description: Job Description Outside Sales Representative – A-Laser, a division of FCT Assembly Inc.  A-Laser is currently looking for an experienced Sales Representative to join our fast-growing team. Must be highly motivated, hardworking, and a team player to fill the position of Outside Sale Representative in California and Pacific Northwest. 50% travel requirement. If you’re interested in being a part of a great company, we encourage you to apply today. We’re passionate about our people, our customers, our values and our market, which is a variety of markets and services including printed circuit board assembly and the electronic manufacturing segment. We are looking for a person with a growth mindset and the pragmatic insight to solve our customer’s issues today while building a strong relationship for a successful future. The Sales Representative will have direct interface with customer engineers to provide solutions for process manufacturing improvement. While managing existing customers the Sales Rep must be able to generate new business opportunities for the sale of specialty materials, machine parts and services that our company provides, with a goal of growing sales within the California and Northwest markets. Sales Representative will make sales calls to manufacturer's in the electronics manufacturing, medical, defense, aerospace, and general industrial markets working with customers to improve manufacturing processes, working with authorized distributors of lines represented, developing a pipeline of opportunities (both direct and through distribution) and expanding the customer base within the territory. Candidate will be required to manage sales calls and opportunity records in CRM database. Only career minded individuals need apply: Sales Representative to service the following territory: CA (75%) , OR-WA-ID-UT (25%) Responsibilities Develop new business prospects and qualify new sales leads Schedule meetings and presentations with prospects Create, plan, and deliver presentations on company services Preparing proposals, negotiating contracts with customers Track all sales activities and keep current by updating account information regularly Maintain a well-developed pipeline of prospects Develop strong, ongoing relationships with prospects and customers Meet and/or exceed sales quotas Coordinate with other team members and departments to optimize the sales effort Ability to multitask and manage more than one client account Other duties as assigned by management Qualifications Associate degree or higher in Business, Sales, Marketing, Communications, Engineering or related field Knowledge of PCB / SMT assembly or related field a huge plus 1-4 years of sales and/or engineering experience in related field a huge plus Highly self-motivated work with minimal supervision Proven ability to meet and exceed sales quotas Proven track record of successfully managing customer relationships Excellent interpersonal skills Strong verbal and written communication skills Proficient in Microsoft Office Have experience working with customers in a pre-sales or post-sales technical role Have outstanding skills presenting to both technical and executive audiences, whether impromptu on a whiteboard or using presentations and demos Be able to consult with clients, understand their needs, and assist in sales cycle/closing new business opportunities. Represent the company at industry conferences and trade show events Benefits Salary Base + Bonus Health, Dental, Vision, Supplementary Insurance 401k Car or Car Stipend

GET STARTED IN SOFTWARE MARKETING!  Start a career in software sales with the Nation's largest Healthcare digital marketing company.  iMatrix is the leader in Healthcare digital marketing solutions for over 12,000 small and medium-sized health and wellness businesses across the United States.  We are looking for passionate individuals that enjoy sales and building relationships and going the extra mile towards ensuring client success.  About The Position:  In this role, you are responsible for prospecting new healthcare practices and developing relationships over the phone with each of their assigned clients. Internet Consultants work closely with Account Executives to identify prospective clients' marketing goals, match the best service level to each client’s needs, and then ensure those clients achieve their designated marketing objectives. Our in-depth training and growth path mean that if you are willing to put in the work, you will be rewarded!  Responsibilities: - Perform outbound calls daily to identify prospective new clients. - Consult with perspective clients about our digital marketing services - Demonstrate an in-depth knowledge of digital marketing. - Understand the fundamentals of our products and services. - Required to meet weekly and monthly productivity and sales metrics.  Requirements: - A can-do attitude. - Strong work ethic. - Great communication skills. - Confident phone presence. - Ability to work as an individual as well as on a team. - Hungry for success.  About Internet Brands:  Headquartered in El Segundo, Calif., Internet Brands® is a fully integrated online media and software services organization focused on four high-value vertical categories: Health, Automotive, Legal, and Home/Travel. The company's award-winning consumer websites lead their categories and serve more than 250 million monthly visitors, while a full range of web presence offerings has established deep, long-term relationships with SMB and enterprise clients. Internet Brands' powerful, proprietary operating platform provides the flexibility and scalability to fuel the company's continued growth. Internet Brands is a portfolio company of KKR and Temasek. For more information, please visit www.internetbrands.com.  iMatrix is a subsidiary of Internet Brands.  Internet Brands and its wholly-owned affiliates are an equal opportunity employer.

description: Medline Industries, Inc. has an immediate opening for a Sales Specialist for the Clinical Services Division. This position will provide superior service and support to both our internal and external customers. We are seeking a dynamic, hard-working professional with excellent communications skills, the ability to establish relationships with clients and provide field support during product evaluations or conversions. This individual must have people skills with the ability to identify issues and propose solutions to provide superior clinical support.  This is an excellent opportunity for those interested in moving into a Field Sales position with Medline in the future.  This position will be working out of the New York City area.  The Challenging Responsibilities Of The Position Include Style which exhibits maturity, high energy, sensitivity, team work, and the ability to relate to wide variety of professionals. Strong troubleshooting skills with ability to research and identify problems and implement creative problem-solving solutions. Strong communication skills with ability to overcome objections and gain customer acceptance. Solid organizational and interpersonal with a proven track record of making sound decisions. Provides excellent service to clients by effectively responding to requests, inquires, suggestions, and/or concerns. Conduct quarterly business reviews with key accounts RVP’s and senior clinical staff. Develop customer retention service proposal through consultation with key clients. Manage account product formulary and introduce new technologies to improve margins. Provide on-site education on clinical programs, products and services. Identifies problem areas and recommends changes and solutions. Collaborates with the clinical team to evaluate policies and procedures related to patient care in specialty area. May visit patients and discusses specific problems with assigned nurses and physicians. Participate with development, revision, and implementation of patient education programs, materials, and resources in specialty area. Provides, coordinates, and teaches workshops and classes on wound care, skin care and patient handling. Studies regulatory changes in specialty area and seeks additional knowledge to become an expert. Supports sales force during clinical product evaluations, conversions and follow-ups. Represents Medline Clinical Services Division by making presentations and participating in forums, committees, and professional associations Contributes to the Division's culture and environment by providing positive teamwork and collaboration Medline offers a business casual, entrepreneurial work environment with strong growth potential, a competitive compensation package, and a complete benefits package including medical/dental/vision/life insurance; 401(k) with company match. And much more!  Please be aware that Medline requires all employees starting in this position to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. This position will require the successful candidate to provide proof that they are fully vaccinated by their start date. Medline is an equal opportunity employer, and will provide reasonable accommodations to those individuals who are unable to be vaccinated for COVID-19 consistent with federal, state, and local law.  Education Bachelor's degree. Relevant Work Experience One to two years of customer service or sales experience Additional Willing to travel at least 100% of the time for business purposes (overnight travel each week) Desire to eventually move into a sales position in the future is a plus Computer literate with knowledge of Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel Strong problem solving abilities and ability to work independently Roll-Up the Sleeves Attitude, Amazing Work Ethic, Passion, and Reliability  Primary Location  US-NY-New York City

description: Sales Hunters Wanted. Please read carefully.  Note: Once you apply, we will send you a website URL to take a Sales Assessment test. This is required to be considered for the position. Please budget approximately 40 minutes for the test and answer it honestly.  OVERVIEW  We are helping fill this position for a customer of ours.  If you have previously excelled at creating a new customer base from scratch, with minimal guidance, then this position might be for you, so please read on…  You will be working at a well-funded software startup company based in New York City that sells software to restaurants, bars and other such venues. Their established competitors are doing fantastic so there is qualified opportunity in the market.  You will be going up against establish brands, can you handle this challenge?  This company is not just amount money, it’s about helping customers and doing what’s right.  You will be provided with leads and you need build relationships with them to sign them up for the platform.  You have the opportunity to earn up to $60K in income (salary plus commissions). And opportunities for equity in this company.  You need to be in New York City and able to get around Manhattan and Brooklyn to meet with customers.  More details below. If this all sounds like you, then we suggest you apply and let’s discuss further.  Responsibilities  Get to know the product Outbound prospecting and communicating with businesses via in person visits Build relationships with customers Communicate product value, features and benefits clearly Lock-in partnerships with businesses through face-to-face meetings Research possible customers, identify stakeholders/decision-makers, and generate interest about platform Benefits  Equity incentive Guaranteed base, plus commission and bonus plan Healthy and responsible corporate culture Ethical sales standards Daily meal allowance Commuting reimbursements to customers Paid leave and insurance benefits Requirements  1-3 years of B2B sales experience, preferably in a startup environment Strong work ethic Good presentation and interpersonal skills; ability to make a connection with business owners/managers A commitment to professional appearance and attitude; willingness to represent the brand with integrity at all times. Businesses are our partners and therefore trust and goodwill needs to be established. Adept at using technology required for sales presentations (iPad, Email, PowerPoint, Word, etc.) Knowledge and contacts in the food/hospitality industry is a significant advantage but not required Must be able to document meeting outcomes and next steps Must speak excellent English Fluency in Mandarin or Spanish is a significant advantage

Field Sales Representatives - Hiring across US  Who We Are:  We’re changing how the world practices security. We’re a passionate, diverse group of people working to ensure every organization has access to a trusted adversary, one attack at a time. We’re hacker led and mission-driven, applying our endless curiosity, passion for excellence, and persistence to help the world hack a better, more secure future.  At Randori, everybody hacks. Whether you’re in engineering, sales, or finance, we look for folks who believe in the impossible, question convention and embrace the hacker mindset.  Trust, empathy, and expertise are at the core of everything we do, and we reward those who embrace them. We seek out individuals confident enough to know they’ll succeed, love to take on big challenges, and are excited to do so as a team.  If this sounds like you, come join us!  The Position:  We are looking for experienced, enterprise sales professionals. The ideal candidates will have demonstrated success with large complex sales cycles within the Global Fortune 2000.  Responsibilities of the Role: Drive the full lifecycle of an opportunity - including prospecting, presenting, running product evaluations, quoting, negotiating etc. Align with your sales engineer to establish proper success criteria, run product evaluations to map to that success criteria etc. Exceed booking, revenue and pipeline quota targets Work closely with Product teams to prioritize feature requests, bugs, support requests etc. Work closely with Marketing to analyze messaging and positioning, quantify brand awareness, coordinate marketing campaigns etc.  What is Required: 5+ years of successful enterprise sales experience in Cybersecurity and ideally experience in the vulnerability management and pentesting markets C-level contacts and the ability to articulate an executive message Demonstrated experience in successfully selling large, multi-stakeholder deals Desire to be part of a fast-paced, category creating company with unlimited potential  If you don't meet 100% of the requirements below - that's okay, nobody's perfect! We believe in hiring people, not just a list of skills. We encourage you to apply if you think this is a role that would make you excited about coming to work every day.  Randori is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. We will consider all qualified candidates regardless of race, color, national origin, sex, age, marital status, personal appearance, sexual orientation, gender identity, family responsibilities, disability, education, political affiliation or veteran status  Security Responsibilities:  Every Randori employee has the responsibility to ensure all tasks performed adhere to Randori’s Information Security requirements. This includes understanding and following security policies, participation in information security training, and helping improve the organization's overall security maturity. Each member of our team must understand their role in protecting company assets and the subsequent handling of confidential & customer data.

description: Sales Development Representative Hardy Boys Consulting  This is a full-time, seasonal position. Initial agreement includes 3-month term, with promotions to 6-month and then full-time employee status should established sales objectives be met.  Salary (3-Month Term): $1,000 per month Commission Rate: *25%            *Average sales price equals $5,000. Salary to increase with each promotion.  About HBC Consulting is a flawed industry. A fundamental misunderstanding of purpose, where top firms demanding million-dollar payouts tragically neglect small business. Left then by the wayside, those in greatest need of assistance and coaching are sadly ignored.  Let us introduce a time for change. An opportunity for dramatic re-altering of perceived possibility, letting drift focus from greed and profit, towards acts of true service. A new age for innovators, poised to captivate, enrich, and even inspire the world.  Our mission is to serve. To lend a helping hand to those most in need. From the startups, to the nonprofits, to the passion projects. We believe in the power of people, an undeniable conviction that one great idea can change everything. And for us at Hardy Boys Consulting, we’re here to help.  Position Summary The Sales Representative role plays a vital toward the growth of our company, acting as a lead toward our outreach and goal plan. HBC strives to be a creative thought leader in the industry, for which this role will play a critical element.  Primary Responsibilities Actively seek out new sales leads and business opportunities Profile potential prospects based on advantageous criteria Nurture customer relationships to encourage future initiatives  Preferred Qualifications Must be proactive, self-directed, detail-oriented, and organized SaaS or technology-based industry knowledge preferred, but not required Passion for technology and disruptive strategies

ENTRY LEVEL - no experience required - training provided  Vendition is a paid training and certification program designed to transform individuals with little or no technology sales experience into world-class prospectors and revenue generators.  Position Summary: Through our Sales Apprenticeship, candidates will work hands on at a technology company, gaining real world SDR experience in the technology and SaaS space. During your first 3-months in the SDR role, candidates will also receive supplemental coaching, training and mentorship from the Vendition coaching team to help ensure productivity, ramp, full understanding of all platforms used, and overall success.  Vendition has helped thousands of candidates with little to no technology/SaaS sales experience go on to see tremendous success in the SDR role and eventually move into an AE position and beyond. Building a strong foundation is key to long term and overall success and Vendition is here to help!  Responsibilities: Answer inbound company questions via email and phone Outbound prospecting - cold calling, email marketing campaigns, social outreach, etc. Set appointments with your assigned Account Executive Conduct discovery calls with sales managers to learn more about their needs Develop and maintain territory plan from your assigned geography Achieve quota on number of qualified opportunities per month  Requirements: Previous sales or customer-facing experience is a plus Full-time availability Have an interest in working in a sales role in the technology industry

description: About Us: TTI is a world-class leader in design, manufacturing and marketing of power tools and accessories, outdoor product equipment and floor care for consumers, professional and industrial users in the home improvement, repair and construction industries. Our unrelenting strategic focus on powerful brands, innovative products, operational excellence and exceptional people drives our culture. This focus and drive provides TTI with a powerful platform for sustainable leadership and strong growth.  Our brands and products are recognized worldwide for their deep heritage, superior quality, outstanding performance and compelling innovation. Our products include professional power tools and accessories, outdoor power equipment and floor care. Brands represented include Milwaukee®, AEG®, Ryobi®, Hoover®, Dirt Devil®, HART®, Oreck ® and Vax®.  TTI is fast-paced, our team is high energy, and we reward out-of-the-box thinking to foster innovation in order to be the best in our industry. We provide a multi-faceted training program and hands-on field experience that will stimulate, challenge and reward you!  Duties and Responsibilities: • Perform best-in-class sales and service to consumers while demonstrating knowledge and enthusiasm for TTI products. • Maximize sell through of TTI Power Tool brands by properly merchandising point of purchase material. • Support and implement strategic corporate brand marketing initiatives and promotional activities. • Strengthen and maintain positive relationships with customers, Team TTI Management, and our retail partners. • Maintain regular contact with assigned retail partner store associates and management to cultivate strong relationships. • Monitor weekly sales and analyze monthly results to identify additional opportunities and understand the competition. • Participate in the training program and implement all acquired skills to deliver results. • Initiate and provide in-store product training sessions and demonstrations to educate store associates, management and customers. • Professionally communicate with all peers, customers and management. • Plan and execute demo events, stores walks, trade shows, etc. • Develop primary knowledge of the market place (users, applications, products, competition, and channels) to effectively analyze market potential and communicate competitor market data. Note: Employee's duties and responsibilities are not limited by the above. Other duties may be assigned as deemed necessary by employee's supervisor. In addition to the basic requirements of the position, all employees are expected to meet the company's goals of continual improvement in the areas of knowledge, skills, processes and quality.  Education and Experience Requirements: • Bachelor degree or equivalent work experience in retail sales, field sales or customer service required. • Valid driver's license required. • Relocation may be required for future promotional opportunities. • Ability to work nights and weekends. • Capable of lifting and transporting heavy tools (up to 50 lbs.) and requesting assistance as needed. Capable of reaching and/or lifting overhead in addition to ascending/descending ladders to move product. Capable of using hands to maneuver small objects, assemble tools and build displays. • Applicant should be self-motivated and a team player with strong organizational, planning and time management skills. • Applicant must be MS Office proficient.

China Telecom Americas, a fast growing company, is seeking a strategic sales professional who enjoys developing new prospects and interacting with existing customers as well as hunting and developing channel distributors and building long-term partnerships. Regional Sales Managers work prospecting and qualifying clients, ultimately building a sustainable pipeline to increase sales of China Telecom Americas' products and services. Successful Sales Managers are familiar with a variety of marketing concepts, practices and procedures. This position relies on broad knowledge of (sales or telecom) and judgment to plan and accomplish sales goals.   Major Tasks & Responsibilities: Reporting directly to the Regional Sales Director, the Regional Sales Manager will be responsible to develop business for China Telecom Americas’ focused on Fortune 1000 companies, and ASPs in the North American markets. This position also has the benefit of development and implementation of Company channel strategy and partnerships to help ensure achievement of Company business plan.   Focusing on large multi-national organizations and other companies requiring such services as contained in China Telecom Americas’ product portfolio, Regional Sales Managers will be expected to meet, and also encouraged to exceed aggressive revenue targets while accomplishing the following:   Responsible for selling IP, IPLC / IEPL, MPLS VPN, IDC, ICT and other data products in the US market, meeting quarterly and annual sales targets Develop long-term relationships with our enterprise customers, especially multi-national corporate customers Identify sales leads, provide sale support (including working with engineering and operations for the successful cutover of sold services), manage sales processes, close sales deals, and negotiate terms and conditions Manage against branch budget goals relating to direct and indirect expenses Review and organize business case documentation for Bid Reviews and/or other requests requiring approval from senior management Take overall leadership position on contract negotiations and coordinate Executive, Legal and Operational resources to drive process to timely completion Develop and document formal territory plan that clearly analyzes and defines the target customers, and articulates the strategies and tactics to develop business with them Manage and document adequate sales pipeline (estimated 5X annual revenue target) Provide accurate weekly activity, and various monthly and ad hoc reports to senior management Act as an escalation point for customers to remove any and all obstacles to developing business in the target markets Cold call and use industry contacts to acquire new distribution partners Identify and negotiate agreements with suitable partners that correspond to Company mission and business objectives Manage regular process of communication to channels, and other important stakeholders throughout the organization Develop corresponding training and marketing programs to generate sales activities from channels Work closely with distribution partners to effectively manage marketing and merchandising Proactively identify and track programs for revenue attainment, cost, and overall business progress Analyze and recommend solutions important to channel management function Essential Skills, Qualification and Education Needed: A minimum of one plus year sales experience selling telecom or related services Sales experience selling to multinational corporations a plus Experience selling both business and technical solutions preferred Strong interest in selling global network solutions between the US and Asia Pacific regions Selling techniques and strong account management skills; able to conduct prospecting and manage customers independently Good understanding of global telecom / IT solutions industry and sound knowledge of the market trend Solid individual network and/or corporate community within region a plus Flexibility to work seamlessly with global sales team in different time zones Self-motivated, customer-focused, result-oriented Excellent interpersonal and communications skills; verbally, written, face-to-face and over the phone with customers and jobTitle: Associate Sales Rep, Wound Reconstruction & Care - Connecticut
description: Integra LifeSciences is a global leader in regenerative technologies and neurosurgical solutions dedicated to limiting uncertainty for clinicians, so they can focus on providing the best patient care.  Founded in 1989, Integra develops, manufactures, sells and supplies best-in-class products to regenerate tissue, remove brain tumors, prevent infection and much more. And over the last three decades, we’ve evolved into one of the world’s leading global medical technology companies with more than 4,000 dedicated employees who deliver innovative medical technology solutions.  But that’s just the beginning. Integra is growing at an unprecedented rate. We’re at a moment in time where the experience you’ll gain is more robust than the experience you bring. And we’re out to invest in your future because it’s the best way to maximize ours.  The Associate Sales Representative will be a responsible Integra’s Tissue Technologies product line and solely responsible for supporting these products within for sales of these products for a defined territory within the Hospital OR/Surgery setting. Your primary responsibility will be to support and grow business in order to achieve or exceed sales revenue targets. You will provide case coverage, transport trays, and develop select accounts by building relationships, demonstrating extensive product knowledge and providing exceptional customer service. Your primary call points will be plastic surgeons, podiatric surgeons, orthopedic surgeons, and general surgeons. 50% of your time will be spent in the Operating Room. You will work side by side with an experienced Account Manager for approximately 18 months. If performance qualifications are met, then you may be considered for an Account Manager position for a full territory anywhere in the U.S.  An essential function of this role is making in-person onsite regular visits to hospitals, medical facilities and other customer locations. To be considered for this opportunity you must be able to comply with all customer onsite requirements, including COVID-19 vaccination requirements unless otherwise permitted by law.  Essential Duties And Responsibilities Target and develop new account opportunities while supporting current initiatives in the territory Provide service of existing accounts which may include case coverage in the operating room as well as excellent customer service and product/tray logistics Assist Account Manager in achieving revenue growth and attainment of quota. Submit weekly and monthly reports as defined by sales management Operate within defined budgets and strictly with in accordance with Corporate policies and procedures Strictly adhere to the policies and procedures within the Advamed Code of Conduct and the Sunshine Act The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required for this position. Bachelor’s Degree or an equivalent combination of education and/or experience is required Preferred 0-2 years of outside sales experience, business to business sales experience, any healthcare experience or background, athletic trainer, allied health background (physical therapy, occupational therapy, athletic training, etc.), or other health and fitness background. Excellent analytical, written and verbal skills. Confidence to communicate with established physicians and other surgical personnel. Strong negotiation and selling skills. Physically capable of standing for long hours in the Operating Room during cases. Must be able to lift and carry 50lbs In an effort to minimize the spread of the coronavirus and to protect our employees, all new hires in the US and Puerto Rico will need to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 in order to be considered for employment with Integra LifeSciences, unless eligible for an accommodation as provided by law.
industries: Medical Devices, Hospital & Health Care, and Pharmaceuticals

description: Position Title: Sales Representative  FLSA Status: Exempt  Position Type: Full-Time/ Remote Role  Department Name: Sales  Supervisor’s Title: CEO  Why eSub?  If you're bold in your pursuits and passionate about change, then this might be the environment for you! eSUB provides world class, venture backed SaaS and mobile project management solutions to the skilled trades that build projects like the Freedom Towers, airports, major ballparks and tech campuses of the world. If you desire to be mentored by proven executives and collaborate with connected teams, consider joining our team.  Purpose Of This Position  The Sales Representative is primarily responsible for revenue generation through strategic alliances with prospects. This role will be responsible for increasing sales and profitability by leveraging resources for sourcing and completing the sales process into larger accounts.  Essential Functions Generate new business through prospecting, and other developed strategies. Develop trusted relationships with prospects and clients while representing eSUB with integrity and professionalism. Expand & maintain relationships. Learn and expertly articulate the industry pains and solution selling accordingly. Become adept at identifying the critical business issues our customers face. Work with domain experts and outside sources to leverage relationship parties and navigate through complex sales processes. Achieve or exceed monthly, quarterly and annual targets. Stay up-to-date with new product features and product launches. Stay informed on our customers’ business issues, industry trends, and competitive offerings. Update and manage all sales activities, opportunities, and account information in Salesforce.com. Occasionally participate in industry events or networking opportunities as required. Suggest innovative ideas to increase sales and improve customer experience. Collaborate with Client Account Management Team to maximize profit by up-selling. Collaborate with Implementation Team and Solution Engineers to meet all client needs and deliverables according to proposed timelines. Competencies Have a history of success in consultative selling of software or system solutions to large customers. Be willing to adapt, learn, and continually refine your skills. Be willing to provide senior guidance to more junior sales executives in a mentorship capacity Be able to run a complex sales process with multiple parties and interests. Have a great work ethic, flexible schedule, and desire for success and growth. Have sharp focus on goals and professional development. Have a passion to help customers solve costly problems through the use of technology. Have proven ability to communicate effectively through telephone, email, and in person. Required Education And Experience Have 3+ years of successful B2B sales experience, in software or SaaS. Minimum BA/BS from an accredited university Experience with MicroSoft offices products Experience using Salesforce CRM Previous training in a sales methodology Have proven ability to communicate effectively through telephone, email, and in person. Supervisory Responsibility  This position has no supervisor responsibility  Work Environment  This position is a remote role and requires the individual to work virtually from their home  Physical Demands Talking/Hearing Over Phone & In Person 50% Sitting 90% Frequent Alpha/Numeric Keyboarding 90% Ability to View Computer Monitor 90% Take Notes in Written Form 10% Position Type/Expected Hours Of Work  This is a full-time position. Days of work are Monday through Friday. Our teams core hours are 10am to 3pm with flexibility to arrive before or after rush hour as you prefer. Occasional evening and weekend work may be required as job duties demand.  Travel  This position requires no regular travel. Travel will be on an on demand basis as may be needed for training purposes.  Additional Eligibility Qualifications  Must submit to a background check as a contingency for the position.  Work Authorization/Security Clearance (if Applicable)  Must be authorized to work in the United States. Each candidate is required to comply with federal and local laws and authorization will be checked through E-verify.  AAP/EEO Statement  eSUB, Inc prohibits discrimination or harassment based on the following categories: race, color, religion, religious creed (including religious dress and grooming practices), national origin, ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, medical condition (including cancer and genetic characteristics), genetic information, marital status, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), gender, gender identity, gender expression, age (40 years and over), sexual orientation, veteran and/or military status, protected medical leaves (requesting or approved for leave under the Family and Medical Leave Act or the California Family Rights Act), domestic violence victim status, political affiliation, and any other status protected by state or federal law.  Other Duties  Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.  If you're bold in your pursuits and passionate about change, then this might be the environment for you! eSUB provides world class, venture backed SaaS and mobile project management solutions to the skilled trades that build projects like the Freedom Towers, airports, major ballparks and tech campuses of the world. If you desire to be mentored by proven executives and collaborate with connected teams, consider joining our team.

description: Our Company  IBISWorld is growing. Fast. And to keep up with our rapid growth, we’re looking to build on our biggest strength: our people. IBISWorld is a global company with offices in New York, Los Angeles, London, Sydney, Melbourne, Beijing and Frankfurt. We are the world’s leading publisher of business research. Our success has created abundant opportunity and we’re looking for fresh and intelligent new talent to join us as we continue to expand our operations. Our mission is to be the premier provider of highly valuable information to the largest and most influential enterprises in the nations where we operate. We do this while maintaining a culture where people are passionate about their work and are surrounded by like-minded, intelligent achievers. Your mission is to find out how you can be a part of our future.  The Role  IBISWorld is looking for a result oriented and innovative Sales Manager to join our New York Industry Research team. In this role you will lead a team of 8-10 Business Development Managers empowering them to reach their highest potential and ensuring they are consistently meeting their sales goals. You will cultivate and lead a target-driven team that is ambitious, yet supportive of one another. You will also work one on one with each of your team members to understand their needs, maximize talent and amplify performance. Additionally, you’ll have the opportunity to serve as a collaborative partner and direct report to our VP of Industry. Together, you’ll ensure that sales strategies and processes are innovative, aligned with client needs and focused on driving revenue.  As an IBISWorld Sales Manager you’ll be part of a strong and growing company that values employee development. We offer internal growth opportunities that allow employees to expand their skills and team roles within the company. You’ll join a collaborative and fun group of people who respect each other in an environment that promotes professional growth.  Principal Duties & Responsibilities:  Proactively provide daily support, guidance and training to a team of 8-10 Business Development Managers. Maintain 100% of monthly quota and hold all team members accountable to performance. Motivate individuals to navigate and build their sales strategy with the goal of optimizing each deal. Coach staff through development and management strategies to create a balanced opportunity pipeline. Serve as a guide who can teach BDMs how to educate decision makers, build rapport, and negotiate contracts. Lead the sales training and on-boarding process. Identify key sales performance indicators and develop benchmarks for growth. Foster a positive, upbeat, and winning culture that grows with healthy competition, teamwork, and strong commitment to individual and team accountability. Provide monthly performance and forecasting reports and conduct individual performance reviews.  Qualifications:  2-3 years of sales experience (preferably inside) with a consistent record of exceeding targets. 2+ years of leading an inside sales team that regularly exceeded sales goals. Experience with a consultative sales approach and a demonstrable history of coaching sales people throughout that process, but also the ability to understand when to apply a more transactional approach. Experience working with long sales cycles that involve multiple decision makers. Enjoys the challenge of selling products and services ahead of and/or new to the market. A motivator and competitor who can cultivate and maintain high morale and inspire pride at a team and individual level. A solutions oriented individual who is not deterred by rejection, obstacles and unpredictable challenges Excellent communication and active listening skills and ability to teach and develop this crucial skill within the team. Possess extraordinary leadership abilities, and instinctively know how to use team and company assets to achieve success. Strong organization and time management skills with experience working in high growth and unpredictable environments. Salesforce and LinkedIn Navigator experience preferred.  Compensation & Benefits:  Competitive base salary (based on experience) Comprehensive health insurance, including medical, vision, dental, disability and life insurance Generous paid vacation accrual, paid holidays, paid family and sick leave 401(k) plan, subsidized gym membership, commuter benefits and more Hybrid working environment in the State-of-the-Art One World Trade Center In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire. You must be available to work full-time in our NYC office. IBISWorld does not pay relocation costs.  Equal opportunity employer IBISWorld provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, IBISWorld complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Are you excited about solving difficult problems? Kizen is for people who want to accelerate their careers, while contributing to something greater than themselves.  Kizen helps businesses grow faster and work smarter by leveraging cutting-edge technologies like intelligent automation, digital assistants, big data, and AI. We’ve built a complete business solution that is ready to compete and win against Salesforce, Microsoft, Oracle, SAP, Hubspot, etc.  Our Kizen with Zoe next-gen technology platform empowers marketing, sales, and experience teams across every organization to supercharge productivity, accelerate profitable growth and perform better than ever before.    We are looking for a Sales Analyst to join our rapidly growing team. This person is responsible for promoting organizational growth through data harvesting and analytics. They will build target lists for outreach by the SDR Team, assess trends, refine the targeting of personas and our Ideal Customer Profile, anticipate issues, diagnose the root cause of problems, generate potential innovative solutions, develop an action plan, and execute.  Key Responsibilities. Utilize tools to target desired personas within our Ideal Customer Profile to build outreach lists for SDR Team Members to execute on. Utilizes analytical skills to produce reporting, interpret data, clearly articulate findings, and provide recommendations for action (A/B testing). Use analytical methods to identify areas for operational improvement and streamlining processes. Participates in strategic and tactical brainstorming sessions to create strong, executable growth plans. Maps and documents standard operating processes. Interacts with stakeholders in resolving problems.  Required Qualifications. Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required 1 year of experience in a related field Exceptional collaboration, organizational, time management, and communication skills The ability to navigate ambiguity and adapt to a quickly changing environment Driven and self-motivated with a track record of finding and solving difficult problems Must have a demonstrated ability to drive projects from inception through to completion  Preferred Qualifications. 2 years of experience in related fields 2 years of experience working directly with reporting tools and enterprise reporting preferred Experience using common data tools and CRM knowledge preferred  At Kizen we approach challenges creatively and collaboratively, while always trying new things and having fun along the way. You will be able to do your life’s work; and help us build the company of your dreams. If this sounds like a fit, we look forward to speaking with you about unleashing your genius!

To reinvent an industry, you have to build the best team. Join Formlabs if you want to bring groundbreaking, professional 3D printers to the desktop of every designer, engineer, researcher, and artist in the world.  Successful customers are the foundation of our business. At Formlabs, our Customer Team is filled with highly skilled 3D printing specialists who care about real people and their work. We're building a team that offers the best sales, support, and logistics to all our users around the world.  In this role, you'll be the company's first point-of-contact for customer inquiries. Based on the need, you'll be interfacing with our sales, services, and other teams to get customers the answers and information they need. Please note this position is based out of our Somerville, MA office**  The Job: Process sales orders via email and phone calls Organize and follow up on sales orders and quotations Act as the first point of contact for prospective and returning customers, routing them to the appropriate channels Proactively reach out to customers in sales and services situations Become an expert in the product, service, and sales process, to be a resource to customers and prospects alike Gain 3D printing industry experience by working with the most talented and creative customers on the planet Print in 3D to your heart's content  You: Are a clear and effective communicator, both written and on the phone Demonstrate exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail Are a team player who thrives by learning from others Enjoy meeting new people, being curious about them and solving their immediate problems as it relates to our products and services  Bonus Skills (Optional): Use of CRM and other service platforms (Salesforce, Zendesk etc.) Experience in order or invoice processing Experience in customer service or sales Personal use of digital fabrication, design, 3D CAD or other relevant tools  Our Perks: Flexible vacation Premium healthcare coverage Paid parental leave Commuter benefits Unlimited 3D prints  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.  Even if you don't check every box, but see yourself contributing, please apply. Help us build an inclusive community that will change the face of 3D printing.
