Managing your own territory, you will present and sell a fantastic product into surf shops, coffee shops, souvenir and tourist destinations, schools, markets and support with in store marketing execution to build a great brand. Wabi2B, a Coca-Cola partner, is seeking B2B Sales Representatives for their wholesale technology platform.  This is a full-time position with an hourly rate of $30.00 per hour plus commissions of up to $1200.00 per month!!!! In addition, you will be reimbursed $500.00 per month for your expenses. Wabi also offers paid time off, sick leave, and holiday pay.  Wabi2B has created a tool developed to revolutionize traditional retail within the mass consumption and FMCG industries. Partnering with one of the world's largest beverage companies (Coca-Cola), Wabi2B has created a global ecosystem for traditional retail, through which they accompany and disrupt end consumer habits creating a new purchasing experience. Today, Wabi2B has operations in Argentina, Brazil, Mexico, Colombia, the Dominican Republic, Peru, Uruguay, Chile, Vietnam, Malaysia, Spain, and the US. But that's not it given the nature of their online channels, they are constantly seeking to optimize and increase efficiency for their tools, which means they work in an extremely dynamic and results-driven way. Our high-paced work environment allows them to be, as a company, highly adaptive to diverse challenges and opportunities.  We are looking for highly motivated Sales Representatives to help us develop and grow our client's presence in the US. The ideal candidate will be enthusiastic, with a passion for service and excellent interpersonal skills. Additionally, we look for someone that can work in a professional yet autonomous way, and who can be sensitive to customer pain points and needs while being highly result-oriented.  What Youll Do  Carry out sales efforts to grow our client's marketplace, which recently launched in Los Angeles, CA.  Own all stages of the sales funnel: prospecting and lead generation, initiating contact with prospective clients, communicating the platforms value proposition, and registering them as customers on the platform  Onboard customers and train them on platform use and best practices  Build loyalty and provide after-sale support and solutions to customer inquiries and concerns that  Meet ambitious monthly performance goals aligned with business KPIs  Provide feedback to management on customer experience and insights  What Youll Need  Knowledge about platforms and solutions within our client's ecosystem, as well as competitors (well provide this!)  Past sales strategy or experience preferred. Experience within wholesale/distribution environments a plus  Feel comfortable with hard selling and cold selling  Self-starter and can-do attitude! Always looking to grow, learn, and exceed expectations  Strong problem solving and conflict management skills  Strong verbal and written communication skills this is an outside sales opportunity, for which you will need your own car. Must be able to show a valid driver's license as well as current motor vehicle insurance.

description: SalesScreen was founded in 2011 and has rapidly grown into a profitable product company with more than 40 employees globally developing and operating the best product in our niche. We have the leading motivation software on the market, and we only hire the best. In the course of the last couple of years, we have opened new offices and welcomed new teammates in Scandinavia, USA and Singapore.   SalesScreen is now used by thousands of top-teams all around the world, and our portfolio includes large, well-known brands from all over the world.  Our goal is to become the #1 software for any sales team worldwide. Do you have what it takes to join our team?  As a Sales Development Representative here at SalesScreen, your primary responsibility is to proactively contact outbound leads for the purpose of qualifying them for a more in-depth discussion with our Account Directors. Your overall responsibility is to quickly qualify these opportunities and work with the sales team to bring them to closure. You'll be creating new relationships, find and explore new business opportunities by contacting potential clients via email, phone, social platforms, etc.    What you'll do  Manage the prospect outreach process via emails, phone calls, social media interactions, etc.  Contacting and qualifying leads to set appointments for our Account Executives to close Being the first point of contact and education leads to help generate increased interest and to lead to sales Anticipating needs and concerns of potential clients and maintaining a knowledge of problems and issues that they are facing in their work Collaborate with the Marketing and Sales team on lead quality and conversion  Who you are You have a proven ability to sell with a 2+ years of related experience from similar role You're able to identify and qualify sales opportunities  Clear communication skills/excellent phone etiquette, with the ability to speak with C-Level and Senior Executives and ask thought-provoking questions  Able to work independently in an entrepreneurial environment and adaptive to change Strong interpersonal skills (friendly, outgoing, not afraid to talk to strangers)  You're highly motivated, passionate and able to keep a positive attitude with a passion for growth You thrive in healthy competition but are also a strongly team oriented and focused on the success of your peers as well as yourself  What you'll like about SalesScreen Competitive compensation  Generous commissions Flexible work hours and options for remote work Yearly summer & winter company retreats  Free daily lunch and coffee Medical, vision and dental insurance 401(k) plan A dedicated and playful company culture!  Come work with us At SalesScreen, we are one a mission to help our customers, sales teams around the world to unleash their full potential, and we need your help to do that. Are you talented, brave, dedicated and playful? If so; you might be the person we need. If you are looking for a company that has a strong company culture that is human, inclusive and friendly; we might be the company for you.

description: Job Summary  Responsible for attaining sales goals and objectives determined within the assigned area. This position will drive sales growth through communication and in-person interactions with current and prospective customers regarding Zimmer products. Support the sales team through surgical case coverage, training of operating room personnel and logistics of instruments and implants.  Principal Duties and Responsibilities  Provide surgical case coverage support within assigned sales team to include training surgeons and hospital staff on proper servicing of devices, and ensuring that proper instruments and implants are available and ready for a case prior to its onset. Build strong relationships with key surgeons in the given area, while covering more routine orthopedic procedures with clinical proficiency and business acumen. Utilize this process to further develop strong clinical and product knowledge critical to future sales growth. Work collaboratively with area sales leader and other sales representatives to build, implement and execute a sales plan for the assigned area. Assist with planning, coordinating and executing local educational and sales events intended to augment the business and help to deliver assigned sales goals. Strictly adheres to all laws and Zimmer policies and SOPs regarding the interaction with HCP’s (Health Care Professionals), product handling and complaints, expense reporting, sales activities and training.  Expected Areas of Competence  In-depth understanding of customers and their requirements.  Clinically proficient in anatomy and willing to work within a medical facility’s operating room.  Ability to become technically proficient with the designated portfolio of products.  Demonstrated ability to communicate with and influence others.  Willing and capable of carrying weights up to 50 pounds, independently  Education/Experience Requirements  Bachelor’s degree required. 1-2 years sales experience.  Travel Requirements  Up to 95% predominantly by car, depending on territory.  Up to 20% overnight travel may be required.  Additional Information  This is not an exhaustive list of duties or functions and may not necessarily comprise all of the "essential functions" for purposes of the ADA.  EOE/M/W/Vet/Disability

description: Your Impact  edX seeks a Sales Development Representative (SDR) to join our edX for Business team. edX for Business brings the edX platform to learners at work. Through leadership and development skills investment, our clients build competitive advantage. If you’re looking for a sales position that is a little different than the others, this is it!  You’ll play an integral part in the development, execution, and continued success of edX’s Large Enterprise Sales group. You will have an opportunity to shape the future of corporate learning and training, a fast-moving, high-demand market.  This is a multi-billion dollar industry that is ripe for disruption, and edX has the ideal product.  Your Team  The driven, collaborative SDR team comprises sales professionals just starting their careers but delivering high-performing impact across the team along the way. Our SDRs are responsible for qualifying inbound and outbound leads. Their outreach and prospecting efforts enable edX to meet our quarterly revenue goals. Whomever fills this position will join a high-performing team of five reps.  You Will Initiate the sales process with the world’s largest companies looking to provide learning opportunities for their workforces by running initial qualification meetings to help determine if prospects should be part of the Large Enterprise new business pipeline Conduct email, phone, and video outreach to leads at the executive level of seniority in order to hunt new and expand current accounts using Account Based methodology Attain (and eventually exceed) your monthly quota for meetings set and qualified leads converted into sales opportunities Continuously further professional education by researching and implementing best practices related to sales prospecting and the e-learning industry Expertly represent edX’s products, vision, value proposition, and solutions to large enterprises in the US and across the world Actively contact prospects - both outbound and inbound - to build a pipeline of large business opportunities for your team Independently uncover and understand prospects' learning needs at a granular level - establishing budget, authority, need and timeline Consistently nurture a hybrid pipeline of both qualified leads that could become sales opportunities and potential deals that have yet to close Evolve and implement targets and measurement KPIs for both operational effectiveness and financial results Be able to clearly promote and evangelize edX in a highly professional manner Continuously further professional education by researching and implementing best practices related to sales prospecting and the e-learning industry You Have One year of experience in an enterprise Business Development role (SaaS or EdTech/content sales experience a plus) Experience prospecting into the C-Suite Demonstrated ability to write compelling personalized emails and professionally communicate edX for Business ’s solution to the highest levels of leadership. A track record of success selling into F1000 companies The ability to generate a high-quality pipeline, manage a large volume of opportunities through a sales process, and accurately forecast sales Hunger to succeed in a startup or hyper-growth business environment Experience as a high achiever Solution selling approach and willingness to partner with internal colleagues to meet the business requirements of your prospects Experience selling into multinational organizations Experience using Salesforce or similar CRM Strong communications and presentation skills, you are representing 160 of the world’s top ranked universities and their content A self-motivated dynamic - goals driven A willingness to work with seasoned, experienced, industry professionals. You are capable and willing to take input, learn, adapt and apply to maximize success over time Preferred Skills Experience working in a SaaS environment Experience selling training products and services Experience selling to HR, Learning and Development departments Experience leveraging Account Based Marketing edX is the education movement for restless learners. Together with our founding partners Harvard and MIT, we’ve brought together more than 38 million learners, the majority of top-ranked universities in the world, and industry-leading companies onto one online learning platform that supports learners at every stage. And we’re not stopping there—as a global nonprofit, we’re relentlessly pursuing our vision of a world where every learner can access education to unlock their potential, without the barriers of cost or location.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Job Description Summary Job Description  Roles and Responsibilities Customer facing staff responsible for winning business Executes standard sales tasks and typically subject to instructions and work routines. There is latitude to rearrange the sequence to complete task/duties based on changing work situations May be responsible for targeted clients, stable regions, and/or small/medium sales territories Identify and close daily order opportunities based on analysis of customer usage patterns Evaluate and edit request for proposals Provide clarification on quotation questions Determine pricing and availability through online systems / negotiations with product business Obtain credit approvals as needed Develop proposals and determine status of proposal on customers’ smaller, routine orders Verify customers’ orders against quotation and resolve any discrepancies Enter orders on appropriate product business Assure compliance with customer contract requirements Expedite order to meet customer’s requirements Coordinate and document all modifications to orders including drawing changes and bill of material changes; adjust pricing accordingly Verify shipment of equipment; investigate shortages, damages, and missing equipment Issue Return Authorization and track repairs as necessary Assist in resolution of claims and incorrect invoices Submit spare parts proposal to customer and expedite all customer-specified documents Determine warranty status on customer complaints and proactively resolve customer issues Be the key liaison with field sales and product / service businesses to achieve account plan goals Provide technical assistance to the customer and other Sales Associates as necessary Provide product, process and computer training to distributors Assist Account Managers and Product Business personnel in developing winning strategies Required Qualifications Associate's Degree (OR GED / High School Diploma with a minimum 5 years of experience in customer service) Minimum of 1 year technical and business experience Desired Characteristics Bachelor's Degree Utility industry experience Proficiency in second language such as Spanish, Portuguese, French - other than English Computer literacy and typing proficiency (70 -90 WPM) Excellent written and verbal communication skills Strong analytical, problem solving, and decision making skills Ability to acquire a basic understanding of electrical and mechanical equipment Ability to interpret and decipher specs and to comprehend specific customer requirements Ability to work well under pressure and adapt quickly to a high level of change Excellent time management, organization, and prioritization skills Self-motivated and goal-driven with a proactive attitude This role will be located in Charlotte, NC and is not a remote position Ability to effectively work within a diverse environment Additional Information  GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer . Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).  Relocation Assistance Provided: No
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Information Technology and Services, and Computer Software

description: Job Summary  Responsible for attaining sales goals and objectives determined within the assigned area. This position will drive sales growth through communication and in-person interactions with current and prospective customers regarding Zimmer products. Support the sales team through surgical case coverage, training of operating room personnel and logistics of instruments and implants.  Principal Duties and Responsibilities  Provide surgical case coverage support within assigned sales team to include training surgeons and hospital staff on proper servicing of devices, and ensuring that proper instruments and implants are available and ready for a case prior to its onset. Build strong relationships with key surgeons in the given area, while covering more routine orthopedic procedures with clinical proficiency and business acumen. Utilize this process to further develop strong clinical and product knowledge critical to future sales growth. Work collaboratively with area sales leader and other sales representatives to build, implement and execute a sales plan for the assigned area. Assist with planning, coordinating and executing local educational and sales events intended to augment the business and help to deliver assigned sales goals. Strictly adheres to all laws and Zimmer policies and SOPs regarding the interaction with HCP’s (Health Care Professionals), product handling and complaints, expense reporting, sales activities and training.  Expected Areas of Competence  In-depth understanding of customers and their requirements.  Clinically proficient in anatomy and willing to work within a medical facility’s operating room.  Ability to become technically proficient with the designated portfolio of products.  Demonstrated ability to communicate with and influence others.  Willing and capable of carrying weights up to 50 pounds, independently  Education/Experience Requirements  Bachelor’s degree required. 1-2 years sales experience.  Travel Requirements  Up to 95% predominantly by car, depending on territory.  Up to 20% overnight travel may be required.  Additional Information  This is not an exhaustive list of duties or functions and may not necessarily comprise all of the "essential functions" for purposes of the ADA.  EOE/M/W/Vet/Disability
industries: Medical Devices, Financial Services, and Hospital & Health Care

description: Reporting into the regional sales manager the successful candidate will be tasked with optimising business intelligence subscription sales through proactively identifying, targeting and closing relevant prospects. This includes understanding the market, competition, developing leads, booking appointments with and presenting to decision makers and closing deals over the phone.  Requirements  Requirements Proactively call and engage with all incoming leads. This involves following up on pay wall hits on our websites, first month registrants and email clicks from marketing campaigns. Seek out new opportunities and build a strong pipeline of potential customers and business via existing client base, networking and other means. Research and understand the market whilst working closely with the Sales Team Leader to identify and target key sectors, through intelligent use of the information and data PEI produces. Book multiple virtual meetings daily with decision makers in relevant organisations. Ensure colleagues within the company fully informed of your activities and of all developments within the marketplace, both informally and through formal reporting Assess sales literature used by the team and take a view as to whether it can be improved. If so, co-ordinate this work and ensure each team member uses this in an effective way Contribute to ad hoc projects, reporting & data analysis and attend PEI events to network with prospects and subsequently contact to pitch relevant services as required. Ensure all sales support tasks are completed accurately and to specified deadlines Deliver confident, well-researched and tailored sales presentations to prospective customers. This includes (a) researching the prospective customer (b) identifying relevant profiles/articles in advance of meetings to best demonstrate how the service will suit them. Proactively engage with PEI Client Executive and trialists to ensure that the prospective customer is convinced of the product(s) value to their work. Define decision making process and persuade them to purchase PEI’s services over the phone. Create and maintain accurate up-to-date records in our Microsoft CRM, ensuring best practise on internal processes. Ensure all exchanges with prospective customers including issues, opportunities and competitive information are fully recorded and evaluated. Have a thorough understanding of the market and products. Liaise with colleagues within the business in order to keep up to date with the latest product developments and through your own research.  Essential Experience: Proven experience as a sales executive or relevant role Good interpersonal and communication skills  Desired Experience: Minimum 1 year business development experience  Essential Knowledge/Skills: Negotiating skills  Desired Knowledge/Skills: Financial Media Sales An interest in Private Equity  Personal Characteristics: Fast learner and a passion for sales Self-motivated with a results-driven approach. Ability to work independently Self-motivated and willing to take responsibility Dynamic and charismatic leader of people: able to lead by example from the front and be the face of a new business area for the company Comfortable operating in a grown-up working environment where regular feedback is provided and the eyes of several (senior) interested parties will always be focused Resilient under pressure – able to remain focused in the face of multiple competing priorities and ensure key deadlines Diplomacy: able to display multi-faceted communication skills in a persuasive, but diplomatic way to ensure that outstanding results are achieved, and the right deadlines and initiatives get prioritized High degree of personal pride in own and company work, constantly striving to improve  Motivation: Highly goal-focused and motivated by achieving high personal standards in all aspects of work – ambitious to meet own personal and organisational goals Desire to be part of a dynamic business with high growth expectations Keen to stretch self and develop career at PEI  We strive to ensure that opportunities to work and develop at PEI Media are fair, inclusive, and open to all. We welcome applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, or gender expression, race, ethnicity, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, or any other equality characteristic  PEI Media supports flexible working arrangements, and we welcome career returners.  Benefits Competitive base salary + uncapped commission Healthcare options 401K 24 days PTO annually with options to sell or purchase additional days Up to 10 sick days annually Flexible and hybrid working options Career progression / further learning support Family friendly policies Employee Assistance Program offering free/low-cost resources
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Online Media, and Financial Services

description: We are seeking a passionate sales analyst who is motivated by our mission at Revol Greens. The sales and production analyst will be responsible for collecting, cleansing, and analyzing sales data from our internal systems and customers, creating forecasts for future sales trends and projecting future product and packaging needs, and making informed suggestions to the leadership team.  Role and Responsibilities Collects data from sales reports for analysis Develops methods and strategies for assessing large amounts of data Closely studies past sales data to determine trends in productivity Understands company budget and evaluates cost components against budgeted goals Conducts research into competitive companies and the surrounding market Studies shopping and purchase trends of consumer base and target demographic Creates sales evaluation reports and trend reports based on collected data Presents sales reports to Revol Greens sales leadership team Suggests adjustments and revisions to promotional strategies to improve sales and profitability Leads customer sustainability reporting campaigns with our customers Manages internal and external item databases and new customer item set-up  Preferred Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Demonstrates proficiency in the use of sales forecasting software Possesses knowledge of the fresh produce and transportation industry Exhibits proficiency in leveraging Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint Speaks confidently and articulately in front of a group Demonstrate the ability to think both analytically and creatively Possesses strong problem-solving skills Pays close attention to detail Manages time efficiently Works well with a team Can translate financial and mathematical jargon into layman’s terms for explanatory purposes Possesses strong written communication skills Can conduct independent research  Education and Experience: Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Business Administration, Finance, Accounting or Marketing Analytics. Prior work experience in the sales, finance, or marketing are a bonus. Work Environment: Role would be full-time 40 hours per week with part-time on site and virtual.  Technology allows for us to work remotely at times but their will be an on site presence required to build relationships with coworkers and customers as well as to become familiar with our production at the Greenhouses.  Hours-Benefits Monday – Friday (weekends if necessary) 401k plan with 4% company match after 6 months of employment Health and Dental Insurance benefits Potential bonus and/or a mix of options

Are you looking for a lucrative opportunity in the industrial automation industry? NEFF Industrial Automation is looking for a motivated energetic B2B sales hunter who is competitive, has a high sense of urgency, and is motivated to make excellent money.  Position Benefits Base Salary + Lucrative Commission Plan Uncapped Earning Potential Profit-Sharing (100% vested after 2 years) 401k Match Health/Dental/Vision/Life Insurance Outstanding Team Atmosphere Training Provided Work from home At NEFF, our mission is to enhance our customers’ competitiveness by delivering top-quality products and custom automation solutions.  NEFF is a growing company with a team-oriented, collaborative, and employee-focused culture. We value learning, professional development, customer service, and results.  If you are looking for an exciting role with a great company that compensates for performance, we want to talk to you.  Position Summary  The Technical Sales Representative is primarily focused on new client acquisition. Also, you will be responsible for maintaining relationships with current customers and expanding revenue within existing accounts.  Essential Functions Actively seeks out and calls on prospective customers by acquiring, at minimum, the following information through a consultative sales process: Type of Business, Size of Business, Current Level of Automation, and Existing Equipment. Actively calls on existing customers in assigned territory either in-person, via e-mail, or by phone. Develops a thorough understanding of the customer’s business goals and objectives, operating systems, and manufacturing processes. Determines business potential for NEFF products and services. Identifies opportunities to solve existing customer problems and/or enhance customer’s operating systems and processes utilizing NEFF products and services. Is familiar with and uses all NEFF resources to creatively solve problems or enhance the effectiveness of the customer’s automation technology. Develops and maintains a Customer Contact and Activity Database for assigned accounts. Monitors Sales Activity Reports, projecting annual sales goals, preparing territorial sales forecasts, and verifying that sales activity supports the forecast and projected sales. Reviews customer activities at least quarterly with Team Leader or Product Sales Manager. Strategizes ways to maximize revenue throughout the assigned territory. Participates in training and development opportunities as assigned. Education And Experience A relevant Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Industrial Technology, with robotics and/or PLC Controls; or A Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Marketing, Psychology, Communication, or Organizational Development with strong, demonstrated mechanical/technical aptitude; or A relevant Associate’s Degree in a related technical field with experience with strong, demonstrated mechanical/technical aptitude. Employment Type: Full Time  Years Experience: 3 - 5 years  Salary: $80,000 - $100,000 Annual  Bonus/Commission: Yes
industries: Marketing and Advertising

description: Are you being compensated for all of your efforts and paid for what you are truly worth? Do you get rewarded for producing class leading results?  If you are looking for more, check this out....  We are looking for a B2BSales Development Leader to join us on our journey expanding our unique First Aid Van Service in Denver and want to reward you for your success.  If this interests you, we'd love to have you join us and be part of this growth while you can. Read on....  HART Health has an amazing opportunity for the right motivated person to join our team as a Business Development Representative (BDR) in the Denver area. Backed by a 45 year growing company based in Seattle, WA, HART Health is leading the business first aid market into a new and exciting direction.  Always looking to the future, HART Health is passionate about first aid and keeping employees safer in their workplaces. We start with great products, add services that the competition cannot match, and have value that our customers love. Being rooted in the stable health care field, we focus on business-to-business sales and services helping our customers stay compliant with national/state/local regulations for first aid requirements.  Our ideal candidate must be accomplished in working independently and communicate seamlessly with our team and our prospective clients, one who can see the big picture and manage the details to bring about successful client relationships. Your experience in sales, customer service, and managing a client base is a great start and we will help you develop to the next level.  This opportunity is a full-time position. You will initially train with our pros in Seattle. You will be provided with everything you need to set-up your home office in Denver, and a company vehicle prepared to demonstrate to prospective clients our goods and services.  Read through the qualifications below and contact us right away.  Qualifications 4 year Bachelor’s Degree preferred but not required Minimum 5 yrs full cycle sales experience- lead generation through closing of sale All candidates must successfully pass a background check Clean driving record and valid driver’s license We Are Looking For Someone Who Is highly motivated and innovative Is great at navigating through obstacles Has high energy and a collaborative spirit Has excellent written and verbal communication skills Has a proven track record of success Has an ability to learn and work in a fast-paced environment Can drive high levels of efficiency Has an entrepreneurial spirit and a consistent over-achieve  Job Type: Full-time  Pay: Base salary of $50K to $60K depending on experience plus commission. OTE: $80k - $90k  Over the past 45+ years, we have been a leading manufacturer and distributor of industrial first aid kits and immediate care medical supplies. We offer exceptional quality, world-class service and great value. We are committed to helping businesses keep their employees safe and productive while minimizing the expense of illness or injury. We are manufacturing and distributing one of the most extensive lines of industrial first aid kits, products and immediate care medical supplies. HART Health prides itself on having a focused but fun environment!
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Wholesale, and Consumer Goods

description: We are seeking an experienced, self-motivated and organized individual as a field sales representative who will maintain and grow existing accounts and bring in new referral business with Physicians, and healthcare institutions.  The successful candidate will have a history in Medical Sales building strong relationships with Physicians and their staff!!  The majority of your time will be spent calling on Physician’s offices, developing new sources of patient referrals, conducting lunch and learns, breakfasts and furthering the company brand and value to our Physician partners and their staff.  Staying abreast of the sleep industry and a diligence to participate in constant updates and company training should be important to you as a Medical Sales Professional.  What We Are Looking For At least two years of Medical Sales Experience. Driven attitude with competitive background Existing relationships with PCP's, ENT's, and/or Cardiologists. Good Communication skills Successful track record Compensation Package includes Base Salary, Uncapped commissions, Car Allowance, Entertainment Budget, and competitive Benefit Package.
industries: Medical Devices, Insurance, and Hospital & Health Care

description: PITT OHIO, a $826 million, high service, highly profitable, transportation solutions provider offering SUPPLY CHAIN, GROUND, LTL and TRUCKLOAD services is seeking to fill an Outside Sales Representative for the Richmond, VA transportation market.  We offer competitive wages, hospital/medical insurance with no monthly premiums, vision, discount prescription, dental, 401K, profit sharing, paid vacations, pleasant work environment, and much more!  Essential Duties Identify and deliver new PITT OHIO Customers. Promote and sell all PITT OHIO Enterprise services. Efficiently maintain existing PITT OHIO customer relationships Prospect and develop retention program for new PITT OHIO Customers Effectively negotiate rate increases Support all Company goals and policies Sales territory must meet or exceed scorecard growth goal  OTHER DUTIES Interface with Operations, Pricing, Claims, Collections and Business Development Representatives Able to react to change in response to changes in the Company’s go to market strategy. Proficiently use PITT OHIO Sales applications. Participate in “Huddles” (collaborative sales meetings) to grow business.  MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS Minimum 3-5 years sales experience in the transportation field Previous experience or ability to learn in business to business selling.  Fluent English language skills required to effectively communicate with internal and external customers Must possess excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills Experienced in Microsoft Office programs and the Internet Skillful typing Valid Drivers License and clean driving record required Problem solving, negotiation, and time management skills are essential  WORKING CONDITIONS Travel is required; must be able to energetically travel by car, plane or public transportation Weekend and evening client contact required  To navigate to the PITT OHIO Career Center and apply for this position, please go to pittohio.balancetrak.com .

Job Description  The primary focus of an Internet Sales representative is to sell solutions and services to existing Oracle customers and to prospect for new customers in the assigned territory or vertical.  The primary focus of an Internet Sales representative is to sell solutions and services to existing Oracle customers and to prospect for new customers in the assigned territory or vertical.  As an Internet Sales Representative you will sell products and services to an assigned geographic or national account base territory to achieve assigned objectives. Generates sales leads as well as closing the sales on line or by phone. Utilizes inbound and/or outbound calls to pursue sales. Develops account penetration strategies, and closes business. Responsible for understanding Oracle's product offerings and competitive issues. Identifies new business opportunities by creating and implementing territory campaigns with management assistance. Liaise with customer contacts for the purpose of managing the customer relationship, identifying new opportunities, and selling Oracle products and services. Participates as a team member on sales teams including field sales, support and education sales and sales consulting.  Work involves some problem solving with assistance and guidance in understanding and applying company policies and procedures. Works under close supervision. Seeks intervention from his/her manager on complex deals that fall outside of existing guidelines. Two or more years of high tech sales experience. Ability to communicate effectively over the telephone with high level decision makers. Ability to work independently. Typically bachelor degree in Business or Computer Science or equivalent  About Us  Innovation starts with inclusion at Oracle. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can be themselves and do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued, that we are inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. That’s why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.  Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: About Pave  Here at Pave, you’ll be joining a world class team with tremendous growth potential. We’re a Series B start-up backed by top Silicon Valley investors Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), Y Combinator Continuity, and Bessemer Venture Partners.  The world of compensation is broken today. Pave is here to fix it. Today, teams cobble together hundreds of messy spreadsheets and outdated surveys to determine how to compensate their workforce. Covid and remote work have made the situation far more difficult, and the notion of “market compensation” is now confusing to everyone.  At Pave, you will reinvent the world of compensation and help build a more transparent future of work.  Pave allows companies to benchmark compensation to leaders in their industry, analyze internal compensation data and make the right adjustments, then visually communicate compensation to their employees. We’re building the world’s largest real-time compensation data platform to accomplish this goal, and are acquiring amazing customers like Credit Karma, Discord, and Allbirds at an unbelievable pace. Come join our team on this mission!  Your Responsabilities  Develop a deep understanding of the lead to close processes, expansion & renewal processes and how we scale our systems and operations as we grow Help define our KPIs per each and build the infrastructure for proper tracking and reporting Ensure our CRM consolidates all our prospect and customer information to provide trusted insights for all teams at Pave Help set goals for each of our sales teams and ensure accurate forecasting Assist with compensation and headcount plan design and rollout One-off projects as needed to gain insight into the business and help make resource & allocation decisions (i.e funnel metrics, revenue forecasting) About You  1+ year in revenue operations experience, preferably in high volume SaaS Proficient in Salesforce.com administration, system configuration, architecture, reporting/dashboard creation, integrations (Extra points for SFDC certifications) Comfortable presenting to executives, and able to tell a story backed by analysis Comfortable manipulating very high data volumes in Google Sheets / Excel (SQL experience ideal) A collaborative working style, with experience working across the company with teams of varied size to achieve common goals Life at Pave  Pave is growing incredibly fast, and we have high ambition. In true work hard / play hard fashion, we've complemented our ambitious goals with a world-class culture and a variety of early startup benefits. As an early hire, you’ll play a key role in shaping what this looks like, but some of the benefits that we already offer include:  Compensation: Competitive salary and startup equity (it's in our DNA)  Wellness: Top tier health insurance along with exercise & wellness benefits  Food: All meals while working, plus snacks. We take our snacking seriously  Tech: Choose your laptop and accessories of choice  Team: Retreats, happy hours, and events for our team, friends, and family  Flexible Time Off: Take the time you need  WFH Wednesday: A dedicated work from home day each week  Location: Our company is based in San Francisco's SoMA district with a high energy in-person culture  And much more... we want all Pave employees to define the best benefits based on our combined interests.  Pave is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please email recruiting@pave.com.
industries: Computer Software

jobTitle: Sales Rep-Home Health ($2,500 Sign on Bonus)
description: Company Overview The Account Executive is responsible for executing the sales strategy to increase company market share through account development and educating the medical community on services provided by the company while operating within set budget. ***$2,500 Sign on Bonus*** Extendicare Home Health of West Tennessee, a part of LHC Group, is the preferred post-acute care partner for hospitals, physicians and families nationwide. From home health and hospice care to long-term acute care and community-based services, we deliver high-quality, cost-effective care that empowers patients to manage their health at home. Hospitals and health systems around the country have partnered with LHC Group to deliver patient-centered care in the home. More hospitals, physicians and families choose LHC Group, because we are united by a single, shared purpose: It's all about helping people. Essential Functions Achievement of monthly Personal Production Goals and MC admit budgets for assigned locations. Successfully executes a weekly, monthly, and quarterly strategy to increase market share through key account development including prospecting/diversification and call frequency/routing. Plans activity to maximize territory coverage of both existing and prospective accounts. Responsible for executing effective sales calls that identify and meet the needs of the referral community and clearly communicate the features and benefits of the LHC Group. These include pre and post call planning, establishing rapport, effective questioning skills, proposing solutions, handling objections and closing. Works closely with the Executive Director/Clinical Director to drive a vision of growth by focusing every team member on the needs and expectations of the referral community and patients. Responsible for all sales administration duties including, but not limited to, Playmaker, CRM expense entry compliance, BOA with associated Policies and Procedures, payroll time sheets, Weekly 3LS meetings with strategic updates, PTO requests, paperwork (485/F2F) delivery or pick-up when needed, timely cell phone and e-mail correspondence. Responsible for being a good steward of the company's financial resources by projecting a return on monies spent and managing to a Sales and Marketing expense budget. Knows the features and benefits of the services provided by LHC Group. Is able to articulate competitive advantages, specialty programs, and Medicare guidelines. Educates the medical community about the services of our organization through effective sales calls and in-services with the appropriate tools and literature. Any other tasks that are assigned. Education & Experience Formal Education: High School Diploma or equivalent required; Bachelor's Degree PreferredExperience Requirements Two to three years of prior successful Home Health or Hospice sales experience preferred.Skill Requirements Excellent presentation, negotiation and relationship-building skills required. Must have strong computer skills to meet Microsoft Outlook and CRM software requirements. Must have the ability to work independently with minimal supervision and be self motivated.
industries: Hospital & Health Care

description: Company Description  Who is Authenticx?  Authenticx is on a mission to help humans understand humans. Our platform is the new standard for humanizing customer interaction data at scale. We do this by channeling our passion and talent into helping health care leaders listen to their conversational data in a way that delivers value to the enterprise.  Job Description  Who is our ideal Sales Development Representative?  You have experience working in a sales role that prioritizes outbound sales strategy. You can quickly learn a product offering and share that product knowledge with outside prospects. You are comfortable making cold calls to potential clients and demonstrating how Authenticx’s unique product offering can benefit the client’s organization. You can autonomously handle lead generation and setting up new meetings. You are an accountable self-starter that enjoys working in a fast-paced, energetic and collaborative environment.  In this role you will be responsible for the following: Meeting monthly targets for meetings set and revenue generation Providing accurate weekly, monthly, and quarterly forecasts Leveraging sales tools (CRM and other areas of tech stack) Calling and emailing marketing-generated leads Sourcing and creating new sales opportunities Conducting research for personalized outreach Collaborating with leadership (C-Suite, Product, Sales, etc.) about the value of Authenticx product Qualifications  Qualifications Bachelor’s degree 1-3 years of relevant work experience (cold calling, customer outreach via phone and email, utilizing CRM, etc) Exceptionally strong written and verbal communication Strong organizational skills and attention to detail Documented track record of success against KPIs and quota Ability to give and receive feedback in a fast-paced environment Excellent problem-solving skills Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite Experience documenting results and knowledge in Customer Relationship Management (CRM) software Additional Information  You must be authorized to work, now and in the future, in the United States without requirement of sponsorship/visa.
industries: Market Research

description: Our newest client has requested for us to immediately hire a team of 7 individuals to assist with the launch of an interactive, promotional campaign.  Your Role:  Prospect small and large business Conduct direct sales strategies Promote our clients Professionally represent our firm Interact with customers Initiate the sales cycle Assist with product purchases Track and report sales Coordinate territories Participate in classroom training  Qualifications:  0 - 3 years of experience in sales, restaurants, customer acquisition, or a related field Superior communication skills Professional and personable Ruthlessly determined to succeed Team oriented Ability to build quick relationships              Candidates with the following experience are encouraged to apply today: General Labor, Construction, Home Improvement, Labor, Labor and Development Operations, Field Construction, Telecom Construction, Construction Management or Construction Experience
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Retail, and Wireless

description: Sprout Social is looking for a highly driven, tech-savvy Sales Engagement Specialist with strong business acumen to join our Sales Strategy team. This individual will be maintaining, monitoring and optimizing the sales engagement platform our Sales and Customer Success team members use to effectively communicate to our prospects and customers.  Our Sales and Customer Success teams work with more than 30,000 brands around the world including the Chicago Bulls, Sony Electronics, Indiana University, Make-a-wish Foundation, Edelman, and Subaru. These businesses rely on Sprout to create stronger relationships with their customers through social media.  This position will partner closely with Sales & Customer Success leadership, Sales Operations, Enablement and Marketing to ensure we are using our sales engagement platform as efficiently as possible to drive the success of our revenue generating teams.  If you are an enthusiastic sales operations professional with past experience managing an instance of Outreach.io, Salesloft or similar tool, we'd love to talk to you!  Qualifications  These are the minimum qualifications that our hiring team is looking for in this role: 2+ years experience in Sales Operations or Revenue Operations within a fast paced tech environment, ideally enterprise software or B2B SaaS Admin-level expertise with sales engagement tools such as Outreach.io, Salesloft, Groove, Mixmax etc. with a history training and supporting a dispersed user base.  Additionally, these are the preferred qualifications that would indicate a particularly strong candidate: Successful track record of being a partner to marketing, sales and customer success leadership, with the ability to prioritize and balance driving key business objectives with requirements across multiple stakeholders Excellent verbal and written communicator with strong project management skills in an agile environment Strong reporting background using standard reporting tools like Google Sheets and Excel Technical expertise and ability to acquire knowledge of new products Strong understanding of effective sales engagement strategies and techniques Experience working with Salesforce.com or other CRM platform  Within 1 month, you will… Complete Sprout Social's new hire training & onboarding program alongside other new Sprout team members. You'll gain a broader understanding of our products and how your role fits into the organization. Partner with Sales Strategy leadership to define key success metrics for your role and how you will measure against them. Acclimate yourself with the day to day responsibilities of managing our sales engagement platform by shadowing team members and receiving training on the current set up. Meet key stakeholders to learn their needs and requirements and set up recurring syncs Assess our current processes and practices as they relate to our sales engagement platform and make recommendations on future improvements  Within 3 months, you will… Become fully ramped in your role as an Sales Engagement Specialist and use your expertise to proactively monitor and maintain our platform configurations Maintain regular coordination with our Sales Content lead to ensure messaging and content are in alignment with strategic business goals Plan and act upon a strategic roadmap to improve content strategy, governance and permissions of the system Start to create a library of documentation to educate and enable stakeholder teams on how to properly leverage the platform Support the user base on day-to-day questions and concerns  Within 6 months, you will… Be seen as the internal expert on sales engagement best practices with a particular focus on understanding and reporting on messaging and communication performance data and trends Define the metrics and processes for determining effectiveness around templates and asset creation. Communicate analytical findings, conclusions and recommendations to executives and senior management on quarterly or ad-hoc basis Collaborate with our platform vendor on any system issues and bugs and enhance tool roadmap to support our evolving business needs.  Within 12 months, you will… Obtain (solicited and unsolicited) and act upon peer and customer feedback. Have a consistent and collaborative process for guiding content creation and Sales engagement strategy Host regular meetings with stakeholders on the improvement and guidance of our Sales Engagement solution Work with operations to create a repeatable and automated reporting framework making Sales engagement data more actionable and useful.  Of course what is outlined above is the ideal timeline, but things may shift based on business needs and other projects and tasks could be added at the discretion of your manager.  About Sprout Social  Sprout Social powers open communication between individuals, brands and communities through elegant, sophisticated software. We are relentless about solving hard problems for our customers and committed to both customer and team success. Our team's shared belief in Sprout's mission promotes a culture of openness, empowerment and fun.  We're proud to regularly be recognized for our team, product and culture. Our benefits program includes: Insurance and benefit options that are built for both individuals and families Progressive policies to support work/life balance, like our flexible paid time off and parental leave program High-quality and well-maintained equipment—your computer will never prevent you from doing your best Wellness initiatives to ensure both health and mental well-being of our team Ongoing education and development opportunities via our Grow@Sprout program, employee-led diversity, equity and inclusion initiatives and mentorship programs for aspiring leaders Growing corporate social responsibility program that is driven by the involvement and passion of our team members Beautiful, convenient and state-of-the-art offices in Chicago's Loop and downtown Seattle, for those who prefer an office setting  Whenever possible, Sprout wants to provide our team with the flexibility to work in the location that makes the most sense for them. For those that prefer an office setting, this role may be based in our Chicago or Seattle locations. If you prefer to work from your home, we can accommodate that for many locations across the United States. We are not set up in all states, however, so please take a look at the drop down box in our application to see whether your state is listed.  Sprout Social is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and an Affirmative Action Employer. We do not discriminate based on identity- race, color, religion, national origin or ancestry, sex (including sexual identity), age, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, veteran or military status, unfavorable discharge from military service, genetic information, sexual orientation, marital status, order of protection status, citizenship status, arrest record or expunged or sealed convictions, or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state, or local law. Learn more about our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion in our 2021 DEI Report.  If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please contact us by email at accommodations@sproutsocial.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. We'll do all we can to ensure you're set up for success during our interview process while upholding your privacy, including requests for accommodation. Please note that only inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this email address.  For more information about our commitment to equal employment opportunity, please click here (1) Equal Opportunity Employment Poster (2) Sprout Social's Affirmative Action Statement (3) Pay Transparency Statement.  When you apply for employment with Sprout Social, we will process your job applicant data, including your employment and education history, transcript, writing samples, and references as necessary to consider your job application for open positions. For more information about our privacy practices please visit our Privacy Policy. California residents have additional rights and should review the Additional Disclosures for California Residents section in our Privacy Policy.  Additionally, Sprout Social participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law.

description: About Lumen  Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies.  The Role  Sales Support Associate (SSA) is a support extension of the sales team to drive greater efficiency and productivity for the sales organization. The Sales Support Associate will be responsible for maintaining understanding of Lumen's internal sales systems and processes while acting as the subject matter expert for all internal questions and escalations around these processes.  At Lumen we know that our customers deserve the best possible experience when working with our team members and sales professionals. As the sales process needs to be unique and customized for the customer, we are looking to bring on Sales Support Associates who are the driving force behind efficiency and productivity in the Sales organization. Our SSAs are fully integrated into the sales process and will be able to demonstrate their knowledge, passion and expertise by handling escalations and questions around the sales process.  The Main Responsibilities Supporting pre & post-sale activities around project quoting, order support & accuracy, and ensuring proper sales recognition. The focus of the role is to limit administrative burden on sellers while enabling sales to focus on customer facing/revenue generating activities Serve as subject matter expert for quote creation and order submission for sales representatives. Providing guidance to sales team and end-to-end accountability on the order creation to sales recognition process. Administrative tasks involve Salesforce management (accuracy and accountability of opportunity value), SFDC reporting and supporting forecasting efforts of sales team, assisting with meeting Sales Exit Criteria, and managing large data sets for customer quoting/ordering. Expedite sales process by facilitating requests with appropriate internal groups, coordinating completion, and ensuring timely responses. Facilitate service inventory investigation. Provide support to sales staff as needed. Will provide direct sales support by utilizing a variety of organizational and project management skills. Basic Qualifications  What We Look For in a Candidate Strong cognitive skills to grasp complex systems and process (Positive attitude and willingness to learn complex systems and processes) Be flexible to learn new process and articulate effectively to broader sales audience (you can remove based on revision to top bullet) Governance and accountability to drive productivity of sales team Verbal and written communication skills necessary to fulfill basic duties of the role. Preferred Qualifications Up to 2 years' experience around sales or marketing support Ability to work with senior management to complete assigned tasks on time with minimal supervision. Ability to work with complex databases and systems Experience with Salesforce and Excel applications Ability to prioritize multiple projects in a dynamic and fast paced environment. Detail oriented, self-motivated, pro-active, and results-oriented professional Develop effective working relationships with peers, sales team and across organizational lines. Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills What To Expect Next  Requisition #: 265264  EEO Statement  We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all persons regardless of race, color, ancestry, citizenship, national origin, religion, veteran status, disability, genetic characteristic or information, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, family status, pregnancy, or other legally protected status (collectively, “protected statuses”). We do not tolerate unlawful discrimination in any employment decisions, including recruiting, hiring, compensation, promotion, benefits, discipline, termination, job assignments or training.  Disclaimer  The above job definition information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. Job duties and responsibilities are subject to change based on changing business needs and conditions.  Salary Range  Salary Min  42120  Salary Max  93840  This information reflects the anticipated base salary range for this position based on current national data. Minimums and maximums may vary based on location. Individual pay is based on skills, experience and other relevant factors.  This position is eligible for either short-term incentives or sales compensation. Director and VP positions also are eligible for long-term incentive. To learn more about our bonus structure, you can view additional information here. We're able to answer any additional questions you may have as you move through the selection process.  As part of our comprehensive benefits package, Lumen offers a broad range of Health, Life, Voluntary Lifestyle and other benefits and perks that enhance your physical, mental, emotional and financial wellbeing. You can learn more by clicking here.  Note: For union-represented postings, wage rates and ranges are governed by applicable collective bargaining agreement provisions.  Salary Range  Salary Max  93840  This information reflects the base salary pay range for this job based on current national market data. Ranges may vary based on the job's location. We offer competitive pay that varies based on individual experience, qualifications and other relevant factors. We encourage you to apply to positions that you are interested in and for which you believe you are qualified. To learn more, you are welcome to discuss with us as you move through the selection process.

description: The Diagnostic Sales Specialist (DSS) is responsible for effectively communicating and selling the benefits of the APTIMA product line, the ThinPrep Pap Test and adjunctive testing, and the ThinPrep Imaging System, to clinicians in an assigned geographic territory. Additionally, the DSS provides educational support to OB/GYNs and other clinical professionals in the office and hospital setting as well as strategic business planning and development for primary and secondary product lines.  Duties & Responsibilities: - Meet and exceed sales goals and achieve maximum sales in assigned territory - Accurately forecast and maintain an individual territory book of business in accordance with a 90-day quota for assigned and acquired products as required - Achieve individual sales revenue quota on a quarterly and annual basis for assigned and acquired products as required - Develop and execute business plans for targeted accounts. Complete a territory business analysis for management review on a quarterly basis - Maintain ongoing business planning with customers in territory; this includes periodic business reviews with customer's financial departments, as well as sales planning with customer's sales department - Effectively route plan and manage business for assigned territory - Attend quarterly Plan of Action Meetings within district - Periodically provide Rapid fFN Fetal Fibronectin in-services and training to laboratory personnel and Labor and Delivery Staff, per the territory needs of the local Strategic Account Manager (SAM) Perinatal - Support territory sales goals by maintaining core ThinPrep Pap Test business (Account Executive's Primary Line of Business), increasing usage, and prospecting new customers - Effectively sell Hologic's sales message to all customers in the targeted territory - Effectively insulate accounts against competition and regaining lost customer accounts - Maintain consistent and structured communication with Account Executive counterpart and articulate summarized communication to District Sales Manager on a periodic basis - Integrate successfully into team selling environment by partnering sales efforts with Territory Manager and Account Executive, and other Hologic colleagues and laboratory partners - Assist in generating leads for other Hologic products - Manage time effectively; prioritize and make good business judgments and decisions in relationship to efficiency, effectiveness while meeting daily call expectations - Partner with marketing department to support the development and execution of marketing programs and sales materials - Attend local and national professional trade shows and events and promote products to all customers - Update and sync all relevant customer account information into Hologic's Data Management System daily - Perform other duties as required Qualifications: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the basic knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required: - Demonstrated track record of success and sales accomplishments - Ability to sell in a consultative manner such that the customer need is discovered and addressed in an individualized clinical and data-driven manner - Strong persuasiveness and influence skills required - Ability to understand and articulate complex scientific literature and use extensive and complex clinical data as a key factor in the sales process. - Familiarity with clinical and economic outcome data, reimbursement, and managed care policies and procedures Education: - Bachelor of Arts/Science from an accredited university required  Experience: - Candidate must have a minimum of two years sales experience - Medical background/sales experience, laboratory experience, and/or managed care knowledge desirable - Business-to-business experience highly desired Additional Details: - Since this position requires extensive driving during the workday, a valid driving license and satisfactory driving record, as well as a serviceable vehicle available for work use is mandatory Agency and Third Party Recruiter Notice: Agencies that submit a resume to Hologic must have a current executed Hologic Agency Agreement executed by a member of the Human Resource Department. In addition Agencies may only submit candidates to positions for which they have been invited to do so by a Hologic Recruiter. All resumes must be sent to the Hologic Recruiter under these terms or they will not be considered.  Hologic, Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer inclusive of disability and veterans.
industries: Medical Devices

description: Job Description  The primary focus of an Internet Sales representative is to sell solutions and services to existing Oracle customers and to prospect for new customers in the assigned territory or vertical.  The primary focus of an Internet Sales representative is to sell solutions and services to existing Oracle customers and to prospect for new customers in the assigned territory or vertical.  As an Internet Sales Representative you will sell products and services to an assigned geographic or national account base territory to achieve assigned objectives. Generates sales leads as well as closing the sales on line or by phone. Utilizes inbound and/or outbound calls to pursue sales. Develops account penetration strategies, and closes business. Responsible for understanding Oracle's product offerings and competitive issues. Identifies new business opportunities by creating and implementing territory campaigns with management assistance. Liaise with customer contacts for the purpose of managing the customer relationship, identifying new opportunities, and selling Oracle products and services. Participates as a team member on sales teams including field sales, support and education sales and sales consulting.  Work involves some problem solving with assistance and guidance in understanding and applying company policies and procedures. Works under close supervision. Seeks intervention from his/her manager on complex deals that fall outside of existing guidelines. Two or more years of high tech sales experience. Ability to communicate effectively over the telephone with high level decision makers. Ability to work independently. Typically bachelor degree in Business or Computer Science or equivalent  About Us  Innovation starts with inclusion at Oracle. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can be themselves and do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued, that we are inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. That’s why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.  Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services
