jobTitle: Entry Level Sales and Marketing Representative
description: The entry level Sales and Marketing Representative and their team will work directly with potential customers in order to establish a proper marketing plan, comprehensive solutions, and an outstanding sales pitch designed to fulfill a client's needs and goals based on the client's products, services, and promotions within the desired timeframe. The entry level Sales and Marketing Representative plays a major role in the success of our company and the future success of our clients. The entry level Sales and Marketing Representatives are the liaison between our clients and our customers and are responsible for increasing the customer base by maintaining relationships with existing customers and by developing new relationships.  Duties and Responsibilities of the entry level Sales and Marketing Representative: Generate new clients to increase revenue through leadership development and elite sales tactics Analyze sales/marketing data to create and implement strategies for client product development Identify new incremental business opportunities in existing accounts and new territories Perform professional presentations in the office and in the field with customers by demonstrating client products and services Maintain accurate records, including sales reports, networking reports, and other documentation The ability to communicate (both written and verbal) clearly and professionally Coordinate and implement sales strategies with other marketing and sales representatives  Skills to Have and to Hone: Excellent written and verbal communication skills and speak with confidence and conviction. You are able to convince people to consider options beyond that of which they have already considered or discovered themselves Well organized with effective time management skills and have the ability to manage multiple tasks Goal-oriented, hitting monthly and quarterly goals with the energy and stamina to work well in a fast-paced environment Ability to work independently as well as on a team  If hired, one of our Corporate Trainers will introduce you to our exclusive new hire manual. From up-to-date product knowledge, sales/marketing how to's, promotion checklists & evaluation guides.....Our main goal is to make sure that each trainee is learning and growing at their highest capable level.  Fun Facts: All promotions are done from within. We provide all online/offline training materials for free. Merit-based advancement is available within the first year. One on one training. Client swag & incentives. Epic travel opportunities (when it’s safe again of course!).  Powered by JazzHR  yDxzSNZeuS
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Public Relations and Communications, and Management Consulting

description: An outside sales representative conducts sales out in the field via face-to-face interactions with both potential and existing customers. They are responsible for offering the best possible customer experience as well as providing hands-on explanations of any new or updated products when necessary. Their excellent social skills allow them to foster strong relationships, to which they can attribute much of their success.

The Perfect Petal is hiring for a Wedding Sales & Design Specialist within the Wedding Department.  This is a part to full time position in charge of driving the design sales of small wedding through our wedding design team. Our perfect candidate will have 2+ years of floral design, set-design, venue management and/or corporate event planning. The candidate will also possess excellent communication skills, customer service skills, be self-motivated, committed to the industry, have a desire to learn and grow within the company. Strong organizational and time-management skills combined with flexibility and adaptability are required in this position to be successful.  Job Role + Responsibilities   Manage event inquiries by phone and email Conduct phone and in-person consultations with clients Draft design proposals Oversee event production "from booking to breakdown" Oversee inventory Support sales and marketing efforts of the department Follow up with clients post-event Highly organized with attention to detail Excellent interpersonal, communication and problem solving skills Knowledge of Floral and event services preferred Knowledge of Denver event industry is preferred Ability to multi task and prioritize responsibilities Work under pressure in a fast paced environment and interact with a wide range of people Excellent customer service skills Familiar with budgeting and sales reports Proficient in Google Drive, including Sheets & Docs, Excel, & Word Working knowledge of Sketch-up a plus   The Perfect Petal offers a competitive pay package with PTO and options for health insurance, dental & vision for full time employees.

Overview  As a Veterinary Sales Representative you are responsible for the maintenance and expansion of your assigned customer base within an assigned territory for veterinary supplies, products, & programs. This includes achieving annual sales, revenue, and gross profit goals within a specified territory.  Click here to learn more about a day in the life of a Territory Manager!  Building connections for healthier communities  Patterson Companies and our dedicated teams create healthier communities by building strong partnerships, one person at a time. We connect expertise to inspired ideas, products and services while creating a relevant, memorable difference in the lives of our clients and their customers.  As a market leading animal health and dental company, we supply technology, products and equipment, as well as marketing, support and logistics services across North America and the U.K.  Responsibilities Regularly calls on veterinary offices, labs, and institutions within a defined sales territory to achieve budgeted sales volume and other established goals. Maintains and further develops established accounts, and develops new accounts to increase market penetration. Actively prospects, pursues, and closes equipment and technology sales in assigned territory. Responsible for maintaining and growing existing consumables base. Responsible for generating leads for technology offerings, exclusive products, and capital equipment. Prepare presentations and price quotes for customers. Must be able to meet forecasted goals. Promotes Patterson Vet marketing programs & demonstrates new products. Participates in and supports meetings and activities as requested by the Branch Manager, Region and/or General office. Performs other Veterinary Pharmaceutical Sales Representative duties as assigned. Qualifications  Veterinary Sales Representative Minimum Qualifications:  Candidates Must Possess ONE Or More Of The Following A four year degree or Three or more years of experience in business to business sales or Three or more years of experience in the HEALTH/VETERINARY industry Veterinary Sales Representative Preferred Qualifications Prior direct, retail, or telephone sales experience Knowledge of veterinary industry (or experience) PC skills required including knowledge of spreadsheets & word processing software Ability to analyze financial information Skillful negotiation and presentation abilities Excellent verbal and written communication skills Benefits  What's In It For You:  We provide competitive benefits, unique incentive programs and rewards for our eligible employees: Full Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits and an integrated Wellness Program. 401(k) Match Retirement Savings Plan. Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP). Paid Time Off (PTO). Holiday Pay & Floating Holidays. Volunteer Time Off (VTO). Educational Assistance Program (Tuition Reimbursement). Full Paid Parental and Adoption Leave. LifeWorks (Employee Assistance Program). Patterson Perks Program. Why Join Patterson?  Click here to see what it’s like to be a part of our winning team! Patterson isn’t just a place to work, it’s a partner that cares about your success.  EEO Statement  An Equal Opportunity Employer  As a people-first company, Patterson promotes a culture that embodies and celebrates diversity and inclusivity. We believe our employees’ unique experiences and differences are what strengthen us and drive our success. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.  We are Patterson. We welcome you.

description: Canvas Freaks™ is an E-commerce company that sells Canvas Wall Art. Find us at www.canvasfreaks.com or instagram.com/canvasfreaks Established 2016 Our HQ is by Central Florida Parkway and OBT  PLEASE READ UNTIL THE END BEFORE APPLYING We are looking for Sales Representative with at least 1 year of experience. Must be willing to work in a changing, and fast paced work environment. Experience can be any type of sales experience. Retail, commission, commercial, door to door, etc. Must be willing to learn new things and take direction well. Creative & open-minded We are hiring Part to Full Time. (25-40 hours). Monday-Friday. (May require Saturdays during busy times) Open Availability preferred  PRIOR Experience is a MUST Our goal for 2021 and beyond is to be the number one wall art company online and you'll be helping us make that happen by bringing in new business by efficiently searching and closing clients. We hope to learn from you just as much as we hope to teach you!  Responsibilities and Requirements: Generating Leads - Organic and Inorganic sales Meeting or exceeding sales goals Knowledge of social media sites, applications, and other platforms where goods are exchanged. Ability to navigate around as well. Out of the box / critical thinking skills. Desire to grow and develop within a position or company Business development strategy and execution 1+ years of Sales Experience Strong verbal or written communication skills - Proper email/phone etiquettes Proficient in Microsoft Office or Google Suite. Preferably EXCEL / SHEETS, and WORD. Punctual and Professional (Knows how to deal with different personalities and practices patience) Highly organized. (Plans ahead) Self Motivated, Self proficient, and takes initiative 1-2 years of experience in ecommerce or warehouse setting (not required). DocuSign - Being able to generate and send document. Making sure of their completion.  Please READ the following: *****All in all we are looking for someone young, driven, and motivated. Someone who will be willing to put in the work and stay here long term to develop our sales team further and help us grow. There will be a lot of new things to learn here that most typical jobs don’t do; but if you are willing to put in the time and effort on this and really invest into this role, we can promise you it can turn into a career opportunity with a lot of potential to do other things.*****  **All tasks may not be done every day, the above list is a high-level overview on what to expect for the job. Depending on the experience we may be able to pay more. **  Job Type: Part to Full-Time (25-40 hours) Days: Mon-Friday (Open to work Saturday if needed but very rarely) Salary: Starting $30k salary (base) + Commissions (no maximum but can realistically average $55K+ annual) ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- COVID-19 considerations: Sanitation stations are set up all over the warehouse and offices. Masks are provided every single for our staff.

The Inside Sales Representative is responsible for the development and maintenance of the sales funnel and managing all inbound sales inquiries. Using a combination of traditional sales methodologies and cutting-edge technology tools, the Inside Sales Representative works with various team members to meet revenue goals. By proactively managing the customer-facing sales experience, you will contribute directly to the success of the Sales team.  Responsibilities Manage customer-facing communication channels Manage person engagement and re-engagement strategies Send outbound emails with information on BrainStation's courses, workshops and events Handle inbound and outbound phone conversations Handle front facing communications with excellent customer service skills Execute and identify strategic sales opportunities through community initiatives Liaise and leverage partnerships with key players in the digital space Identify areas of improvement and communicate them in our daily standups  Successful candidates will have Bachelor's degree Proven ability to work independently and under pressure Customer Service experience Ability to engage in conversations with small and large groups with ease Proven work ethic with the utmost integrity and desire to excel and succeed Outgoing, energetic, upbeat and fun personality Motivation driven by KPI's Previous sales experience - an asset Previous experience in student recruitment - an asset  Perks And Benefits Comprehensive Health & Wellness Benefits Package Retirement Planning Parental Leave Program New Device Allowance Socials, Outings & Retreats Culture of Learning & Development Flexible Working Hours Work from Home Flexibility  About BrainStation  Established in 2012, BrainStation is the global leader in digital skills training and workforce transformation. NOTE: Only those applicants under consideration will be contacted. Please accept our utmost appreciation for your interest. description: Sales Representative, Coastal  Central, MA Territory  Company Overview  As one of the New England’s leading spirits, wine, beer, and non-alcoholic beverage distributors, Horizon Beverage Group connects a network of makers, retailers and consumers throughout Massachusetts, Rhode Island, New Hampshire, Maine, and Vermont. Since 1933 we’ve fostered an environment of ingenuity, innovation, and expertise to help brands and retail & restaurant entrepreneurs alike reach their goals. Now in our fourth generation of family ownership, we employ a team of over 700 beverage enthusiasts working toward a united mission with our partners to deliver the perfect drink.  Position Summary  The Outside Sales Representative is goal orientated with entrepreneurial spirit and motivation to maintain a competitive edge in the marketplace, while selling to on and off premise business within the Cape Cod, MA territory.  Daily/Position Responsibilities (Other Duties May Be Assigned) Develop and enhance customer relationships Answer customers' questions about products, prices, availability, product uses, and credit terms Consult with customers after sales to resolve problems and to provide ongoing support Demonstrate competent sales abilities through successful presentation of products and creditable promotion of new and existing portfolio items Utilize sample inventories to promote product sales Exhibit discipline and innovativeness to meet assigned monthly quotas Participate in sales meetings, on-site training, and trade events to maintain a high level of product/supplier knowledge Submit orders utilizing the company tablet Utilize Microsoft Outlook, Excel, and Word, to create sell sheets, and selling presentations Review customers credit status, collect monies owed, submits checks and cash according to the collection and deposit procedures Stock shelves and storage areas with product Education/Experience  1-3 years’ previous industry experience within the distribution, hospitality, and supplier community  One (1) Year Of Demonstrated Sales Skills Strongly Preferred  College degree and beverage industry experience a plus  Skills/Requirements  The ideal candidate will have a strong attention to detail, and the ability to prioritize within a multi-tasking environment. Ability to work calmly under pressure and meet tight deadlines; must possess strong analytical, negotiation and conflict resolution skills. Excellent presentation, verbal and written communication skills are also required. Must demonstrate intermediate to advanced level of proficiency within Microsoft Office applications. This role requires lifting and carrying of a 40+ pound case of product on a regular basis and requires extensive travel throughout assigned territory with personal vehicle.  What We Offer  Horizon Beverage Group provides benefits, support programs, resources and expertise to help employees live healthier and safer lives—at work and on the road. Eligibility for the following benefits depends on employment status. Competitive pay Medical & dental 401(k) Plan Paid Holidays Generous paid time off policy Company paid Short & Long Term Disability Company paid Life Insurance Employee Assistance Program Supplemental Insurance Options Horizon Beverage Group is an Equal Opportunity (EEO) employer. It is the policy of the Company to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status.

description: Overview  Are you interested in working in one of the fastest growing industries in Hawaii that helps homeowners save money by switching to renewable energy? We founded Alchemy Solar with the goal of helping as many homeowners as possible find the best solar and battery solution for their home. With this goal in mind we have helped families all over Hawaii install solar and home batteries saving money on electricity, protecting themselves from power outages, and protecting the environment.  As one of the fastest growing solar companies in the state of Hawaii we are looking for driven, creative, passionate individuals who want to excel in the customer focused world of solar and home battery sales. At Alchemy Solar we focus on making sure our team is able to provide our customers with the best solar solutions by providing team members with the training, resources, tools, and support they need.  Our Solar Sales Consultant is a commission only in home sales role, with travel required in your market. Some presentations and team meeting will also be completed via video conference, so computer literacy is needed.  Responsibilities Hit sales and prospecting targets set by the Branch Manager Source, self-generate, and complete appointments for potential solar customers Conduct solar sales presentations in-home or via digital consultations Construct an effective sales approach Educate and evaluate a customer on solar and energy storage to help develop a strong lasting relationship Update, track, and report on the outcome of opportunities using digital tools Proactive and professional communication to make sure exceptional customer experience as the project progresses Provide the best customer experience and service from start to finish of the solar installation Proactive follow up and management of all prospects, opportunities, and appointments Prepare for appointments by reviewing data, building a proposal and constructing an effective sales presentation Attend required trainings, company leads and follow all Alchemy Solar processes Continue to educate yourself on Alchemy Solar, utility policies, and solar by engaging with trainings and other industry resources Qualifications Proven success in sales, lead generation, or customer service Solar or sales experience preferred Proficiency on CRM tools, Google Suite, and other digital platforms Must proactively travel for appointments and lead generation Ability to work nights and weekends Exceptional communication skills within a variety of different departments and partners Have access to a computer, tablet and consistent internet access Ability to drive a vehicle during the normal course of business Must maintain a clean driving record with the ability to pass a driving background check Must be 21 years of age and possess a valid driver’s license We’ve built Alchemy Solar on the idea of giving the best options to homeowners without compromising the quality of the material and installation. After being in the industry for 15 years I’ve seen what to do and what not to do. As an owner of solar myself I know it’s a big decision that can feel overwhelming. At Alchemy Solar we are there through every step of the process to make sure the job gets done right.
industries: Renewables & Environment, Construction, and Consumer Services

description: Hiossen is currently looking for smart and passionate Sales Associates to join our rapidly growing sales team! Successful candidates are passionate, positive and detail oriented person that can build a professional relationship with customers who are engaged in world-class Dental implant courses. As a Hiossen Implant Sales Associate, you will be part of a dynamic implant sales team that positively affects the lives of our customers on a daily basis. The Sales Associate will be responsible for dealing with any and all customer questions about the products and services the company offers as the public face of the company.  LOCATIONS Chicago, IL Tyler, TX Denton, TX Waco, TX Houston, TX Keller, TX The Woodlands, TX San Antonio, TX New Orleans, LA Responsibilities Assist and support branch manager, assistant branch manager, and territory sales representatives with customers’ requests and sales related tasks. Regularly recruit and schedule dentists and other dental professionals to attend Hiossen trainings and seminars (Master course, One-day hands on, etc.). Find new leads and potential clients through cold callings and cold visits. Expected to visit/call six different dental offices per day on average and report to CRM system. Maintain the presentation of the products, signage, displays and training/seminar environment. Prepare to become Sales Representative by attending and satisfactorily completing Hiossen training programs, attaining the ability to demonstrate required product and sales knowledge. This position may include additional responsibilities assigned by Sales management. Required Skills And Experiences  In order to be successful at Hiossen Implant, you must be able to perform this job successfully; an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Excellent verbal and written communication skills Enthusiastic, energetic, personable and friendly disposition Proactive Team player Maintain a positive attitude and focus on customer satisfaction in a fast-paced environment Education And/or Experience Required  High school diploma or general education degree (GED); or one to two years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.  Benefits  Performance-based bonuses  $230/bi-weekly car allowance, plus fleet gas card.  Health, life, dental, vision insurance  Long- and short-term disability  401(k) with 50% company match (up to 2% of salary)  PTO (15 days for first year-[9 days paid vacation,6 sick days]);(20 days for second year)  Paid holidays  Cell phone reimbursement  Paid clinical and product training  HIOSSEN, Inc. was established in Pennsylvania in 2006 as a subsidiary of Osstem Implant. Osstem Implant is leading the Asian-Pacific market with the largest market share and ranked one of the top five implant companies on the globe. HIOSSEN Inc. produces a wide variety of implants at the state-of-the-art manufacturing facilities in Fairless Hills, PA. The quality implants are exported to more than 20 different countries in Europe and Asia. HIOSSEN is striving to improve implant quality by monitoring the market and gathering feedback from clinicians. All the ideas and opinions are analyzed with rigorous scientific tests and incorporated into the research and development process. The recent launch of H series (HS, HG) implants are a reflection of this effort.
industries: Medical Devices, Financial Services, and Hospital & Health Care

description: Sales Associate – Education Division  Reports to: Sales Director – Education Division  Location: Lewisville, TX   Job Summary  The primary role of the Sales Associate in our Education Division is to employ effective techniques such as pre-call planning and productive questioning strategies to lead to winning education accounts (K-12). A successful candidate must skillfully generate leads that will allow Performance Scoring's Education Application to be demonstrated to key decision makers at educational entities. The sales associate will work closely with the Sales Director to continually hone the marketing pitch according to the client’s needs. The sales associate will regularly work within Performance Scoring’s Education Application in order to have a continual working knowledge of the product and a deep understanding of how it works and can meet various needs of clients.   Essential Job Functions   Lead generation of new clients, targeting K-12 schools/districts.   Work closely with the Sales Director to hone the marketing pitch according to the client’s needs.   Ensure the timely processing of leads and assist with and support sales campaigns  Identify growth opportunities for the sales teams to ensure growth attainment  Regularly work within Performance Scoring’s Education Application in order to have a continual working knowledge of the product and a deep understanding of how it works and can meet various needs of clients  Diagnose and assess client needs at a strategic and business outcome level. Ability to skillfully facilitate face-to-face, live in-person and live online meetings.   Very technically savvy with sales, platform, and social media technologies.   Job Requirements    This position requires experience in three, but preferably all areas:    A minimum 1-3 years of experience in K-12 education sales, preferably subscription-based models and/or professional services environment selling to the K-12 education environment.   A minimum 2-4 years of experience in education, as a teacher or administrator, with demonstrated capabilities to transition into an education sales role.   Skillset should be in consultative sales with demonstrated capability in the areas of lead generation, prospecting, forecasting, and driving quality opportunities to closure.   Strong verbal, written communications and technical skills are essential with the ability to facilitate compelling, polished sales presentations for targeted K-12 decision makers.  Bachelor’s degree in education or educator’s certificate preferred.   Benefits Information  Base Salary: $35-45k  Commission: Up to $50k per client, comp plan for a minimum $25k in commission per year   Bonus: Based on time/tenure, company success- Estimated 1-5k per year  Total Comp Plan: $75-$125K year one, $95k-$155k year two  Benefits: medical, dental, vision, and retirement available   Company Information  Built for performance management, Performance Scoring is a total organizational performance engagement platform delivering real-time, objective data and key results to executives, managers, vendors, and employees; empowering managers to manage better, employees to know where they are performing well and where they need coaching. Founded in 2017, Performance Scoring has grown in multiple industries and vertices, and currently is headquartered in Lewisville, Texas.    Performance Scoring is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate our corporate diversity and are fully committed to creating an inclusive environment for all our employees.

description: COMPANY BACKGROUND  Based in Boulder, CO, Purely Elizabeth is a high-growth natural foods company focused on creating products using elevated, nutrient-rich ingredients. Their award-winning products include granola, oatmeal and baking mixes. Founded in 2009 by Elizabeth Stein, a certified holistic nutrition counselor, the company is dedicated to helping consumers thrive on their wellness journey.   SUMMARY Purely Elizabeth is seeking a self- motivated and detail-oriented Sales Support Admin to join our sales team. This person will be responsible for submitting retailer promotional contracts, managing retailer portals, and assisting in the entry and maintenance of our trade management system. This person should have experience with completing trade contracts, calculating rates and margin, data entry, and Microsoft office. You will be working alongside our broker and sales teams to ensure our promotions are submitted and executed. This person will report to the Sales Assistant Manager. KEY ROLES + RESPONSIBILITIES  Manage and submit accurate retailer promotional contracts Communicate with broker partners and internal team to get information and proof of performance Enter promotional deals into our Trade Management Tool to ensure reporting accuracy Assist in the creation of sales materials for meetings Organize and deliver on all internal and external deadlines Seek solutions to problems and try to create efficiencies when possible Help organize and deliver on retailer category reviews  REQUIREMENTS Education: Bachelor’s Degree required Minimum 3 years outside or inside sales experience Minimum 1-2 years’ experience at a food CPG Entrepreneurial mindset and ability to work independently while also being a part of a team Exceptional team player, able to manage cross-departmental communication with positive mindset Must be very detail-oriented and enjoy fast-paced, dynamic environment Must have strong organizational and communication skills Must be solution oriented Must be comfortable using mac and excel to analyze data   COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS ·      Competitive salary ·      Flexible Paid Time Off ·      Benefits include, health and dental insurance, 401k plan ·      Summer hours, social office gatherings (post-COVID), and more ·      An extremely strong, driven, ambitious, fun, startup work environment  TO APPLY: Please email resume and cover letter to info@purelyelizabeth.com  .

AutoServe1 is a fun, fast-growing software company with customers across Canada and the US. Our cloud based software is a game-changer to the automotive service industry. We bring fresh transparency and customer trust by providing digital inspections that allow auto shops to send actual photos and videos of problem parts to their customers’ smart-phones in real-time.  As we continue to grow and keep up with demand, we're always looking to meet people who want to build something challenging and impactful. We're now looking for high-energy, growth-minded Sales Development Reps (SDRs) to help the company generate new business opportunities.  You will produce new qualified leads to fuel the sales pipeline by identifying, qualifying, and setting meetings for the Sales Team. You will be working closely with our SDR Manager and be part of the founding SDR team.  Responsibilities Work as part of a selling team with a focus on the initial relationship development Quickly communicate the Value of AutoServe1 to our target market Engage Business Owners and other Decision Makers using methods traditional and non-traditional methods Continuously leverage creative prospecting tactics using multiple channels such as LinkedIn Qualify new business opportunities through email and cold-calling and set appointments for the Sales Team Continuously learn and grow in your role, adapting as you gain new information Qualifications Sales experience preferred Experience working with CRM applications, Zoho or Salesforce preferred Self-starter with the ability to learn quickly Demonstrated initiative, negotiating and coaching skills Excellent English communication skills Strong interpersonal, communication and leadership skills with the ability to work well with cross-functional groups University/College Degree Preferred Familiarity with the Automotive and/or Software Space This Describes You You sleep and breathe sales You strive to be great, not good…And understand what great result require You have a positive Attitude You are NOT afraid of high levels Activity You're a hustler with an entrepreneurial spirit who will stop at nothing to help generate leads You care about the customer needs and understand how to deliver value through software solutions You have a sense of humor and you check your ego at the door The Package Competitive Base Salary Uncapped Commission Stimulating environment Tremendous growth opportunity Exceptional Training At AutoServe1, we're passionate about our clients and especially passionate about our people. We want you to learn more, accomplish more, and to succeed. We don't just care about our goals - we really care about your goals - come work with us to achieve both.

jobTitle: Hospitality Sales Manager - Caesars Las Vegas
description: Job Summary  Job Description  The Hospitality Sales Manager is responsible for the end to end booking of social-group room blocks and contracting restaurant groups process, while cross-selling all areas of the Caesars Entertainment. The Manager assists guests with inquiries for hotel and/or restaurant accommodations, booking and communicating trip details including food and beverage contracts, ensuring inquiries are transferred to appropriate departments and assisting in the overall plan for a group’s trip. The Hospitality Sales Manager is an expert in “what to do” while visiting Caesars Entertainment properties and will provide insight and suggestions for a unique experience.  Hotel Accommodations  Assists guests seeking hotel accommodations of 10 or more rooms by reviewing request, quoting the trip and providing recommendations on properties and/or room types based on guest’s budget. This leader will partner with Hotel Operations and Revenue Management to ensure specific accommodations may be met including premium room types and pricing. When necessary, the manager will meet with clients for site tours of rooms/space. Proactively reaching out to previous guests and upselling all groups into premium accommodations and dining/activities while on property is critical to the success of driving results.  Restaurant Sales  This leader will manage the guest’s inquiry process for restaurant group events which may include receiving phone calls, conducting site inspections, menu and accessory selection, writing standard and customized menus. When applicable, introduces client(s) to manager of restaurant hosting event. Hospitality Sales Manager works closely with all restaurant managers and chefs, compiling accurate and detailed Banquet Event Orders within department timeline parameters. Must be able to post event reconciliation and perform light accounting.  All duties are to be performed in accordance with departmental, property, and corporate policies, practices, and procedures.  Essential Job Functions Effectively partners with business associates of Caesars Entertainment to fulfill client needs including lodging, F&B and event accommodations Maintains efficient and detail-oriented reporting of client/guest trip and function information Practices proper guest relations; meets guest relations standards Courteous and timely telephone/email etiquette; ensures that all guest inquiries have a response within 24-48 hours Proactively reach out to repeat guests and clients to drive incremental bookings Remains informed of current property, entertainment, restaurant and lounge information Has flexible hours and be able to meet and greet clients at arrival of event when necessary Complete task(s) as assigned by Senior Sales Manager, Director or Vice President Assist in site selections of Food and Beverage Group Events and attend site inspections, tastings and pre-con meetings Suggestively sell menus, entertainment and décor for Group Events Sell events, write menus and Banquet Event Orders, enter data into programs including Salesforce, GuestCenter and Tripleseat, distribute bookings to management/culinary teams, etc. Ensure flawless communication of event/trip details Communicate with room managers, chefs and sommeliers to review selections and special requests Attend departmental meetings Organize groups, as assigned to them Adheres to each restaurants’ set of rules and parameters Required  QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor’s degree in Hotel Management, Business, or related field or equivalent education and experience. At least 3 years’ experience in Hotel Operations, Sales, Food and Beverage, and/or Restaurant Sales Must be proficient in Microsoft Office Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Professional and courteous phone etiquette. Excellent analytical, problem-solving, critical thinking and decision-making skills. Must have a flexible schedule/ability to work nights and weekends as required Work varied shifts, including weekends and holidays Able to effectively communicate in English in both written and oral forms. Preferred Previous experience in LMS, Salesforce, Guest Center, and Tripleseat Physical, Mental And Environmental Demands Must be able to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends. Must be able to handle a heavy business volume, and sensitive situations relating to team member, candidate, and guest problems, in a timely manner. Must be able to tolerate areas containing secondhand smoke. Must be able to lift and carry 10 pounds. Must be able to bend, crouch, kneel, twist and work at a desk/counter when performing functions of the job. Respond to visual and aural cues. Must have manual dexterity to operate all office equipment. Must be able to maneuver around office and property. Given the demands listed above, this candidate must be able to tolerate areas containing secondary smoke, handle more than one function (or one customer) at a time by being well organized while producing accurate and error free results. Also given the demands listed above, our candidate must be adept at using a personal computer, phones, copier, and PDA. Information Provided By  DIRECTLY SUPERVISES (PLEASE LIST POSITION TITLES ):  Flsa  Exempt (Salary): Non-Exempt (Hourly):  Property Code  Multi-Property: Dual Rate:  Bonus Plan: MGNT CSA Other SALES  License(s) Type: None  EEOC Code  About Us  Caesars Entertainment is the world's most geographically diversified casino-entertainment company. Since its beginning in Reno, Nevada, more than 75 years ago, Caesars has grown into a family of affiliated resort casinos on four continents. Caesars-affiliated casino resorts operate primarily under the Harrah's®, Caesars® and Horseshoe® brand names. Affiliates of Caesars also own the World Series of Poker® and the London Clubs International family of casinos. The Caesars Entertainment family’s success is a result of an unblinking focus of building loyalty and value with guests through a unique combination of great service, excellent products, unsurpassed distribution, operational excellence and technology leadership. Caesars and its affiliates are committed to environmental sustainability and energy conservation and recognize the importance of being a responsible steward of the environment.  Team members of the Caesars family of resort casinos are driven by our Mission, Vision, and Values. We take great pride in living our values Integrity, Service with Passion, Celebrating Success, Diversity, Caring Culture, and Ownership every day. Our mission “We inspire grown-ups to play” fuels our passion for an exciting guest experience and a rewarding career. If you have the desire to create memorable experiences, personalize rewards and delight every guest, every team member every time, we invite you to explore our dynamic yet unique career opportunities.  Caesars Entertainment will engage in an interactive process and make reasonable accommodations, as required by law, for individuals with disabilities or to accommodate pregnancy, pregnancy-related conditions, or where a conflict exists between the position and an individuals’ religious beliefs or practices.  The below statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed in this position. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of the position.  The Company reserves the right to make changes to the job description whenever necessary.  As a part of the new hire process, finalist candidates will be required to complete a drug test and background check prior to an offer being extended, except where applicable law requires that such pre-employment screening occur post-offer. The Company is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against employees or applicants based on race, color, national origin, sex, age over 40, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

description: Date Posted  2021-09-30-07:00  Country  United States of America  Location:  CAN19: CRS-NYC 80 Bomont Place, Totowa, NJ, 07512 USA  Job Description  Carrier Rental Systems provides year-round solutions for temperature control, power generation, or special event needs by renting and selling HVAC equipment during emergency breakdowns, planned outages, equipment retrofits, and plant expansions.  Carrier Rental Systems is seeking a motivated, energetic, customer-focused individual to join the organization as a Sales professional to support our NYC location. This position will be based in our Totowa, New Jersey office  Responsibilities Manage and grow assigned territory or group of accounts Define new potential customers, seeking new markets through cold-calling, while maintaining relationships with the customers currently in the portfolio Achieve annual sales and collections goals Conduct customer needs assessments, including going to the various job sites Conduct walk-throughs and ensure compliance with all safety regulations Serve as the customers’ single point of contact during the sales and implementation process Manage entire project from requirements gathering to implementation, including interacting with customers and vendors, managing subcontractors, and completing required paperwork Utilize Salesforce.com to update and maintain customer records, create quotes, and funnel required paperwork Qualifications High school diploma or equivalent required Associate’s Degree with 4-7 years of relevant experience preferred Bachelor’s Degree with 2-5 years of relevant experience preferred Must be self-motivated to achieve annual sales goals and objectives Willingness to travel regularly throughout the assigned territory Ability to analyze the situation and problem solve Strong teamwork and communication skills Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite Salesforce.com experience preferred May be required to climb stairs and/or ladders Rentals industry or HVAC Sales experience preferred Work is performed in various environmental conditions with exposure to outdoor temperature variations, noise, vibrations, gas or fumes, grease, cleaning solvents, degreasing agents, machinery and its moving parts, odors, and dust particles.  Carrier is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class. description: Hiring for 2 positions! Account Manager and Field Sales Representative Both can be either Full-time, Part-time, or Internship!  About Rallie, Inc. Let’s Rallie is a spontaneous mobile app that immediately sends you available things to do within 10 miles of your current location. Rallie, Inc. is rapidly growing and employees are needed in all neighborhoods. Employees can create flexible hours and will be assigned to a territory that is close to home. Rallie, Inc. is looking for teammates who are willing to put on multiple hats and do whatever it takes to create a strong brand presence in all neighborhoods. Check out Rallie’s Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, and website.  Account Manager Position Summary Account/Project Manager works under the supervision of the partners. A/P Manager oversees overall day-to-day customer/ partner service and supports to ensure the effective execution of customer and partner objectives in marketing and sales. The position encompasses administration, project tracking duties, and management of field sales representatives. Duties of an A/P Manager include composing client correspondence, maintaining contact lists, and assisting with marketing and sales. They will also work closely with users, businesses, partners (clients), and internal teams to best meet client needs. They must also pitch ideas, assist in developing strategies, and demonstrate problem-solving abilities to address client issues and business growth.  Field Sales Representative Position Summary The Field Sales Representative reports to the Account/Project Manager. As a Field Sales Representative, you will develop sales strategies and be responsible for attracting new users and businesses to the Let’s Rallie app. The field representative is responsible for new sales opportunities and closing deals. This person is responsible for tracking their time, and reporting their conversions.  Contact Information If interested, please reach out to Robbie Verna at robbie@letsrallie.com for more information!

POSITION SUMMARY:  This position is responsible for all sales activities in assigned accounts or regions. Individuals must manage quality and consistency of products and service delivery. They must be able to persuade and influence others, develop and deliver presentations. They must be able to create, compose, and edit written materials. Visibility requires maintaining a professional appearance and providing a positive company image to the public. Work requires willingness to work a flexible schedule.  KEY FUNCTIONS & RESPONSIBILITIES: Achieve individual annual operating plan as assigned. Present and sell company products and services to current and potential clients. Prepare action plans and schedules to identify specific targets and to project the number of contacts to be made. Follow up on new leads and referrals resulting from field activity. Identify sales prospects and contact these and other accounts as assigned. Develop and maintain sales materials and current product knowledge. Establish and maintain current client and potential client relationships. Prepare paperwork to activate and maintain contract services. Manage account services through quality checks and other follow-up. Identify and resolve client concerns. Prepare a variety of status reports, including activity, closings, follow-up, and adherence to goals. Communicate new product and service opportunities, special developments, information, or feedback gathered through field activity to appropriate company staff. Coordinate company staff to accomplish the work required to close sales. Develop and implement special sales activities to reduce stock. Participate in marketing events such as seminars and trade shows. Follow-up for collection of payment. Coordinate shipping schedules and delivery of merchandise and services. Conduct monthly customer visits as needed, individually or with Branch Manager. Other duties as assigned.  KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, & ABILITIES:  Required: High School diploma / GED or equivalent work experience. Ability to work independently and in a fast-paced environment Self-starter – ability to initiate and execute with limited assistance. Effective writing, communication and interpersonal skills. Assertive, analytical problem solver with a can do attitude is required. Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills. Ability to exercise mature judgment. Proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel  Desired: Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution in a business related discipline. JD Edwards software experience desired 5+ years of related work experience Must be able to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization Knowledge of the automotive industry / drivetrain components.
industries: Automotive

description: We are seeking a Nutritional Supplement Retail Sales associate to become an integral part of our team! We are an integrative and functional medical clinic with an onsite nutritional suppelment dispensary. You will be responsible for selling products, managing inventory, and light office work relating to the medical clinic.  Responsibilities Welcome and identify customer needs Explain products and services to customers Monitor inventory to ensure product is in stock Enter and process customer orders Investigate and resolve customer complaints Ship orderd to customers as needed Assist with front office work for Medical Clinic including answering phones and scheduling apts Qualifications Previous experience in sales, customer service, or other related fields Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment Ability to build rapport with customers Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to handle money Ability to lift 40 lbs and climb stairs Ability to learn Electronic Medical Records System Sophia Health Institute is an Integrative & Functional Medical Clinic with a team of specialized medical providers, an on site Infusion center, and a medical spa. We welcome patients from all over the world, many of whom are struggling with chronic illness. Our world class medical providers are like minded in our holistic approach to healing and are passionate about healing both the body and the mind. Our unique approach to healing combines traditional and alternative medicine to obtain the maximum benefit for our patients. Our founder Dietrich Klinghardt MD, PhD is world renowned for his research and advancements in the medical field relating to the treatment of chronic illness. SHI is a teaching institute as well as a research institute and we are continually advancing the methods in which we treat patients. Our providers understand the nuances of treating patients and the necessity for individualized, unique care.
industries: Health, Wellness and Fitness, Medical Practice, and Hospital & Health Care

description: The Diagnostic Sales Specialist (DSS) is responsible for effectively communicating and selling the benefits of the APTIMA product line, the ThinPrep Pap Test and adjunctive testing, and the ThinPrep Imaging System, to clinicians in an assigned geographic territory. Additionally, the DSS provides educational support to OB/GYNs and other clinical professionals in the office and hospital setting as well as strategic business planning and development for primary and secondary product lines.  Duties & Responsibilities: Meet and exceed sales goals and achieve maximum sales in assigned territory Accurately forecast and maintain an individual territory book of business in accordance with a 90-day quota for assigned and acquired products as required Achieve individual sales revenue quota on a quarterly and annual basis for assigned and acquired products as required Develop and execute business plans for targeted accounts. Complete a territory business analysis for management review on a quarterly basis Maintain ongoing business planning with customers in territory; this includes periodic business reviews with customer's financial departments, as well as sales planning with customer's sales department Effectively route plan and manage business for assigned territory Attend quarterly Plan of Action Meetings within district Periodically provide Rapid fFN Fetal Fibronectin in-services and training to laboratory personnel and Labor and Delivery Staff, per the territory needs of the local Strategic Account Manager (SAM) Perinatal Support territory sales goals by maintaining core ThinPrep Pap Test business (Account Executive's Primary Line of Business), increasing usage, and prospecting new customers Effectively sell Hologic's sales message to all customers in the targeted territory Effectively insulate accounts against competition and regaining lost customer accounts Maintain consistent and structured communication with Account Executive counterpart and articulate summarized communication to District Sales Manager on a periodic basis Integrate successfully into team selling environment by partnering sales efforts with Territory Manager and Account Executive, and other Hologic colleagues and laboratory partners Assist in generating leads for other Hologic products Manage time effectively; prioritize and make good business judgments and decisions in relationship to efficiency, effectiveness while meeting daily call expectations Partner with marketing department to support the development and execution of marketing programs and sales materials Attend local and national professional trade shows and events and promote products to all customers Update and sync all relevant customer account information into Hologic's Data Management System daily Perform other duties as required  Qualifications:  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the basic knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required: Demonstrated track record of success and sales accomplishments Ability to sell in a consultative manner such that the customer need is discovered and addressed in an individualized clinical and data-driven manner Strong persuasiveness and influence skills required Ability to understand and articulate complex scientific literature and use extensive and complex clinical data as a key factor in the sales process. Familiarity with clinical and economic outcome data, reimbursement, and managed care policies and procedures  Education: Bachelor of Arts/Science from an accredited university required  Experience: Candidate must have a minimum of two years sales experience Medical background/sales experience, laboratory experience, and/or managed care knowledge desirable Business-to-business experience highly desired  Additional Details: Since this position requires extensive driving during the workday, a valid driving license and satisfactory driving record, as well as a serviceable vehicle available for work use is mandatory  Agency and Third Party Recruiter Notice: Agencies that submit a resume to Hologic must have a current executed Hologic Agency Agreement executed by a member of the Human Resource Department. In addition Agencies may only submit candidates to positions for which they have been invited to do so by a Hologic Recruiter. All resumes must be sent to the Hologic Recruiter under these terms or they will not be considered.  Hologic, Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer inclusive of disability and veterans.
industries: Medical Devices

description: Description  The Specialty Sales Coordinator is responsible for facilitating Specialty Sales Operations Representatives administrative, technical and sales support. This position serves as the first touch of the Dealer Services Phone line, necessitating excellent interpersonal skills. This position will work closely in collaboration with the Specialty Sales Manager and Sales Ops Representatives to facilitate the BD order book in a timely and professional manner in regards to both day-to-day and seasonal aspects.  At BD, benefits begin on the first of the month following your date of hire with a generous portion of medical and dental paid for by BD. You also will get employer paid life insurance, Short and Long Term Disability, as well as other wellness benefits, 401k, vacation and wellness time off, paid parent time, paid volunteer days, and company paid holidays. If that isn't enough, we are also a pet-friendly workplace with a casual dress code! If your passions are also in the outdoors, then you will also enjoy employee discounts on BD gear and apparel.  Requirements  Required Qualifications: Highschool diploma or GED Two (2) to four (4) years of college education (preferred) One (1) plus years of experience in retail and/or wholesale sales in outdoor specialty We Will Count On You To Maintain Dealer Services Workgroup phone line. Including but not limited to; greeting customers and transferring to the appropriate in-house representative, communicating order and product status, new dealer requests and RA tracking Build customer relationships as it pertains to the Sales Operations functions of order related details such as timing, availability, backorder management, PO adjustments, overall account performance, and identifying areas of opportunity. Authorized to answer incoming dealer calls and make outgoing calls to customers. Responsible to report problems and recommend solutions to the Specialty Sales Manager. Authorized and responsible to issue Return Authorizations for any restockable product in accordance with the guidelines set forth in the ISO Returns Procedure. Responsible for obtaining the Specialty Sales Manager & Field Sales Manager’s approval for other returns (i.e.: overstocking and large order cancellations). Authorized to collaborate with regional sales representatives/ sales management as needed to provide the best possible customer experience. Including completion of pre-season product worksheets and facilitating pre-season order revision requests Responsible for importing and distributing all Specialty Retail orders into the internal ERP. Seasonal imports of pre-season orders as well as forecast and ASAP order submissions. Responsible for maintaining New Dealer Requests, Front Desk Fax inboxes, Internal Package Delivery Notifications and maintaining the office supply cabinet Drive account communication in conjunction with NA Sales Coordinator on items that are one month late, SKU swap execution and notifications to internal contacts for account communication Responsible for assisting in territory coverage, order book management and order processing when Sales Ops Representatives are out of office or utilizing paid time off. Black Diamond Equipment, Ltd is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex; including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran Status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

description: Sales and Marketing  Broadleaf is a premier supplier of specialty meats. We import and distribute high quality meats to Food Service and Retail Operators. We are committed to delivering to our customers at a high level of standard and consistency. We seek individuals that are highly motivated, dependable, results oriented and operate with a high level of responsibility and integrity.   We are looking for a creative individual who would enjoy building a career that incorporates developing monthly marketing materials for our on-line customers, and a monthly newsletter for established, as well new customers. The position involves creating and building brand awareness, while incorporating sales of Broadleaf specialty premier proteins. Take advantage of this unique opportunity to work for a family owned company in business for over 30 years and growing! www.broadleafgame.com

jobTitle: Marketing & Sales Operations Associate - Part Time
description: Company And Opportunity  Legacy.com is the place where life stories live on. We are the global leader in online memorial tributes; a top-50 website in the United States, and a destination for over 40 million unique visitors each month. Founded in 1998, Legacy.com is honored to help consumers express condolences, share direct support for families, and celebrate the people who have touched their lives. Uniquely open to profound messaging at this focused moment, users respond by sharing memories, purchasing gifts, finding event information, and making plans. Legacy delivers its community-targeted content daily via 1,500 local news media partners. We continue to broaden our offerings in our mission to help people seeking information and guidance on all aspects of end-of-life. Our vision is to become a full-service end-of-life and memorialization resource.  We have a diverse and talented team of employees who come to us from many kinds of backgrounds. We have an immediate need for a talented, experienced Marketing & Sales Operations Associate for our new Downtown Chicago office that will report to our Director of Operations.  See our new Chicago HQ:  Overview  Work with Ecommerce, Marketing, and Partners teams to help grow revenue across various customer groups. This role requires handling inbound and outbound phone calls on a daily basis, regular email correspondence with customers, flexibility in your day-to-day responsibilities, learning and adaptation of operational workflows, and confidence to improvise as needed.  Responsibilities Service phone order requests for consumers shopping sympathy gifts directly on Legacy. Service phone order requests for consumers shopping sympathy gifts on partner websites. Assist in fulfilling orders when no delivery address is available for the obituary. Manage your workstream, follow ups, and cases in Salesforce. Contribute directly to team performance targets monthly. Provide empathetic, top-tier service to every customer and contact you engage with.  Requirements Confidence and willingness to develop exceptional phone conversation skills. Excellent communications skills, both written and verbal. Excellent problem solving and time management skills. Ability to work independently or collaboratively as needed. Proficient in MS Office products (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) and Google tools (Google Docs). Familiarity with e-commerce operations preferred. Experience with Salesforces is a plus.  Benefits  Legacy.com offers a very generous and comprehensive benefits package, including: Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance Generous Paid Time Off 401k plan with discretionary employer match Parking/Transit Flex Spending RTA and CTA pre-tax payroll deductions Catered lunch provided 2x per week, breakfast 1x a week Employee Assistance Program Casual dress every day Daily, company-provided coffee, tea, soda, and snacks Friendly, team-oriented, open environment Located within a few blocks of CTA, Ogilvie, and Union Station  Powered by JazzHR  hx0P6p5xV3

This is a valuable opportunity for those who want experience in team leadership, sales, entrepreneurship, and anybody with a competitive mindset.  Responsibilities include:  Utilizing strong leadership skills to build a high performance, cross-functional team environment Keeping up to date with client promotions Managing customer acquisition and retention by driving sales with a high level of customer service  Job Requirements:  Competitive individuals with a winning mentality Candidates who are serious about a long-term career with a growing industry Positive attitude and humble student mentality   Our team enjoys:  An excellent work environment where fun meets success Guaranteed base pay and weekly bonuses One-on-one mentorship Paid training, bonuses, and weekly leadership development meetings Travel opportunities  *Please note: this position is not remote.*  Social Media: https://www.instagram.com/obrochicago/ https://www.facebook.com/Obro-101586898754728

description: CASCADES  Founded in 1964, Cascades produces, converts and markets packaging and tissue products that are composed mainly of recycled fibers. The Company employs 11,000 employees, who work in more than 90 production units located in North America and Europe. With its management philosophy, half a century of experience in recycling, and continuous efforts in research and development as driving forces, Cascades continues to deliver the innovative products that customers have come to rely on.  CASCADES TISSUE GROUP  The Tissue Group, a division of Cascades, is the second-largest tissue producer in Canada and the fifth-largest in North America. The Division manufactures, converts and markets a huge selection of paper products, such as hand towels, bathroom tissue, facial tissue, napkins, paper towels, wipers and dispensers for the North American away-from-home and consumer products markets. The Group has more than 2,200 employees and operates seven manufacturing plants, nine conversion plants and four plants with both manufacturing and conversion facilities.  Your challenge!  Reporting to Sales Manager, the Senior Sales Representative role is accountable for achieving maximum sales profitability, growth and account penetration within an assigned region/market or portfolio. This position is to support our High-Quality Printing department for our retail division. The successful individual will have deep knowledge of different printing methods such as: digital, lithography and flexography. You will be sale to the USA and Canada, Ontario market therefore, heavy travel will be necessary. The role is responsible for establishing and maintaining customer relationships and ensuring customer excellence.  Your Responsibilities Maintaining and growing revenues for their accounts Educating and training customers on products and solutions Managing contract creation and negotiation for regional accounts Developing and managing account plans for regional accounts according to given guidelines (i.e. revenues) Maintaining excellent client relationships and ensuring customer satisfaction Your Background and Strengths Bachelor's degree or College degree in a relevant field Knowledge of the high-quality printing techniques and industry Ability to identify customers' needs, issues, interests, competitive activities and potential for new products and services Ability to demonstrate products and solutions; actively involved in knowledge transfer on Cascades solutions within our sales team and to customers Self-driven person with abilities to effectively communicate and present solutions Superior knowledge of the market and customers/consumers Master of negotiation with strong networking abilities that stays on top of customers and market signals to secure opportunities Ability to develop a thorough understanding of Cascades' offering to identify and report cross-selling opportunities Ability to actively participate, together with Account Managers, in key phases of the sales process with prospects #revealyourpotential #LifeAtCascades  Cascades believes in the success of an inclusive organization that values diversity within its team. It will fairly consider all those qualified for this position. The use of the masculine in our communication refers to both women and men.  About Cascades  Being part of Cascades means revealing the full potential of matter, people and ideas. We are a source of possibilities. Since 1964, we have been offering sustainable, innovative and value-creating solutions in terms of packaging, hygiene and recovery. Join 12,000 women and men working in a network of more than 90 business units located in North America and Europe.
industries: Staffing and Recruiting, Consumer Goods, and Retail

description: Primary Function: The Account Manager position is responsible for generating and increasing sales of manufacturing capacity and manufactured products for Kaspar Wire Works.   This ideal candidate will have a lean business background, and will be focused on safety, quality, delivery, productivity, and costs while simultaneously maintaining an in-depth knowledge of products and services offered by company. This individual will be focusing on retail display wire products as well as construction products.    Position Responsibilities (including but not limited to): ·         Develop and implement a sales plan for existing and new customers, access their needs and opportunities for growth, and attain sales goals outlined in the sales plan and approved by VP of Sales. ·         Analyze and assess customer needs and industry/segment sales trends. Plan sales activity based on business needs to ensure that the business attains or exceeds the KPI’s and strategic objectives. ·         Identify, build, and maintain strategic relationships throughout the sales channel.   Maintain regular contact with accounts to develop and implement strategies to convert opportunities to sales. ·         Establish and maintain a travel schedule that provide consistent face to face interaction with established accounts. Travel up to 90% of the time and includes overnight travel, the schedule must be aligned with the sales strategy and follow a logical routing plan. ·         Manage the assigned accounts and segments within the expense budget. ·         Complete all administrative tasks in a timely manner, including expense reports, daily sales call reports, and other assignments set forth by management. ·         Work with manufacturer representatives as needed. ·         Participate in all trade shows, promotional events, and company meetings as needed.   ·         All other duties assigned by management   Skills: ·         Persuasive speaking and formal presentation skills are required to sell and close deals ·         Excellent communication skills in both written and spoken formats ·         Active listening, attention to detail, planning and organizational skills required ·         Ability to digest, to comprehend and verbalize complex data and product information related to the business. ·         Must be able to work autonomously, be a self-starter, and be highly motivated and success driven. ·         Effective time management, organization, and multi-tasking skills ·         Proven forecasting and customer service skills ·         Proven track record of developing business strategy and progress tracking ·         Strong follow up and follow through skills. ·         Intermediate math skills (add, subtract, multiply, divide) required ·         Basic software program skills using MS Office and MS Outlook required ·         Ability to maintain a clean and neat work environment and personal appearance   Qualifications: ·         Undergraduate degree, plus 3+ years’ experience B2B sales experience required   ·         Knowledge of the after-market truck accessory industry preferred ·         Must be currently established in the designated territory   ·         Must possess current and valid driving record with clear history for the past three years ·         Must be willing to use multiple travel methods (drive, fly, taxi, etc…)   Physical Requirements: ·         Extended periods of sitting and/or walking (33% - 75% of time) ·         Stooping, bending, twisting, leaning (10% - 25% of time) ·         Lifting of 25-50 lbs. occasionally (0% - 33% of time)   Work Environment: ·         The work environment is field sales based with a home office with regularly scheduled trips to the home office. ·         Occasional exposure to manufacturing environment where the use and wear of proper protective equipment (PPE) such as safety glasses or side shields on glasses and closed toe shoes are mandatory+ ·         Overnight travel is required, is predicted by the territory activity, business need.

Are you looking to get your start and break into tech sales? If so, come join a rapidly growing startup, whose SaaS application is taking the auto repair industry by storm!  What you’ll do: Cold call into auto repair shops throughout North America Work closely with account executives to schedule demos with prospective clientele    Qualifications: Minimum of 6 months of cold calling experience Hunter type, highly motivated, and previous success working in a fast-paced environment  Experience in B2B sales is preferred, but not required  Outstanding conversational skills, with the ability to develop long term relationships and build rapport over the phone   Perks/Benefits: Enjoy working from the comfort of your home with remote-friendly work culture Opportunity to accelerate your sales career with a quick path to promotion for rockstar employees Generous salary and comprehensive commission program Great benefits and 3 weeks of PTO  Connect with CEO during 2 step interview process

description: Primary Function: The Account Manager position is responsible for generating and increasing sales of manufacturing capacity and manufactured products for Kaspar Wire Works. This individual will be focusing on retail display wire products as well as construction products.    Position Responsibilities (including but not limited to): ·         Develop and implement a sales plan for existing and new customers, access their needs and opportunities for growth, and attain sales goals outlined in the sales plan and approved by VP of Sales. ·         Analyze and assess customer needs and industry/segment sales trends. Plan sales activity based on business needs to ensure that the business attains or exceeds the KPI’s and strategic objectives. ·         Identify, build, and maintain strategic relationships throughout the sales channel.   Maintain regular contact with accounts to develop and implement strategies to convert opportunities to sales. ·         Establish and maintain a travel schedule that provide consistent face to face interaction with established accounts. Travel up to 90% of the time and includes overnight travel, the schedule must be aligned with the sales strategy and follow a logical routing plan. ·         Manage the assigned accounts and segments within the expense budget. ·         Complete all administrative tasks in a timely manner, including expense reports, daily sales call reports, and other assignments set forth by management. ·         Work with manufacturer representatives as needed. ·         Participate in all trade shows, promotional events, and company meetings as needed.   ·         All other duties assigned by management   Skills: ·         Persuasive speaking and formal presentation skills are required to sell and close deals ·         Excellent communication skills in both written and spoken formats ·         Active listening, attention to detail, planning and organizational skills required ·         Ability to digest, to comprehend and verbalize complex data and product information related to the business. ·         Must be able to work autonomously, be a self-starter, and be highly motivated and success driven. ·         Effective time management, organization, and multi-tasking skills ·         Proven forecasting and customer service skills ·         Proven track record of developing business strategy and progress tracking ·         Strong follow up and follow through skills. ·         Intermediate math skills (add, subtract, multiply, divide) required ·         Basic software program skills using MS Office and MS Outlook required ·         Ability to maintain a clean and neat work environment and personal appearance   Qualifications: ·         Undergraduate degree, plus 3+ years’ experience B2B sales experience required   ·         Knowledge of the after-market truck accessory industry preferred ·         Must be currently established in the designated territory   ·         Must possess current and valid driving record with clear history for the past three years ·         Must be willing to use multiple travel methods (drive, fly, taxi, etc…)   Physical Requirements: ·         Extended periods of sitting and/or walking (33% - 75% of time) ·         Stooping, bending, twisting, leaning (10% - 25% of time) ·         Lifting of 25-50 lbs. occasionally (0% - 33% of time)   Work Environment: ·         The work environment is field sales based with a home office with regularly scheduled trips to the home office. ·         Occasional exposure to manufacturing environment where the use and wear of proper protective equipment (PPE) such as safety glasses or side shields on glasses and closed toe shoes are mandatory+ ·         Overnight travel is required, is predicted by the territory activity, business need.

description: MAIN JOB OBJECTIVE  The Sales and Education Coordinator is responsible for providing the fresh Sales & Education Executive with training and sales support in an assigned territory, as dictated by the needs of the business with an emphasis on the Sephora and Nordstrom accounts.  RESPONSIBILITIES  Achieve sales goals, as determined by management, in assigned stores throughout assigned territory. Conduct all Sephora and Nordstrom in store trainings in line with Sephora and Nordstrom Brand expectations. Plan and execute in-store events in conjunction with Sales & Education Executive to support Sephora, Nordstrom and Fresh initiatives. Work with store management for visual placement in-store. Establishing and developing strong relationships at store level with Sephora BA’s, Store Leadership, DM’s, Nordstrom CM’s, Point Person, Beauty Stylists and Department Managers. Handle in-store training of Fresh selling specialists (if applicable) and store personnel for new product launches and core product categories. This includes Selling Specialists, Nordstrom employees and Sephora BA’s. Lead strong partnership with Sephora BA’s, Nordstrom CM’s and Clients by providing service and support for any needs when in store. Assist Sales & Education Executive in the recruitment, direction and evaluation of Selling Specialists Ensure Fresh homebays, counters, endcaps, towers, etc. are visually impeccable and in accordance with Fresh merchandising standards. Maintain regular communication with Sales & Education Executive regarding opportunities for brand to participate in additional training, event or BA/employee support. Maintain regular call cycle to stores and effectively manage schedule and travel (when applicable) Use company supported reports and tools to create customized in store strategies related to BA’s/employee training and selling experience.    PROFILE  At least three years beauty industry experience required. College Degree preferred. Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, required. Experience in Sephora and Nordstrom environment, preferred. Must be proactive in approaching potential clients and promoting the Fresh brand. Must be able to motivate others and work as part of a team. Must be able to travel within the territory. Hours of work must be flexible to meet job objectives Position requires heavy traveling and driving. Must be able to work remotely, without home office responsibilities. Standing, walking, moving for min. of 4-6 hours daily.
