description: Medical Sales is the place to be during times like these. Whether we’re in a pandemic, a recession, or life is normal our sales people are making great money year round!  LPT Medical is one of the largest distributors of home and portable oxygen concentrators in the world. We have a fun, fast paced work environment where you can be in control of your own pay.  Our current sales reps are making anywhere from $75k - $200k per year with no commission cap. We also offer full benefits; health, vision, dental, and a free $20k life insurance policy!  We are looking for highly motivated people that want to make a difference in someone’s life by helping them regain their freedom and independence with a portable oxygen concentrator.  Our agents are only reaching out to individuals that have requested information, there is NO cold calling required at all.  For Example  The best part is that there is no sales experience required. Some of our top performing reps have come from other industries with no sales experience. Teachers Flight Attendants Massage Therapists Counselors Retail Workers Waiters and Waitresses Etc. You just have to have a strong work ethic and the willingness to learn and you will have no problems succeeding!  By Working With Us You Will  We are in a huge growth pattern right now and generate too many leads for our current sales force to handle. Help people by selling them something they need, not something they want Have plenty of opportunity to grow with the company Have a fun fast paced work environment in a nice modern office Make as much money as you possibly can (Up to $300k) About LPT Medical  LPT Medical is one of the top distributors of home and portable oxygen concentrators in the United States. We service the entire country and have been in business since 2017. We have been experiencing a major growth pattern from our first year and there’s no better time than now to join our team!

Arizent’s mission is to advance professional communities across a variety of today’s most transformational industries, including Financial Services. We do this by uncovering powerful ideas, rallying industry leaders around them, and benchmarking their progress. Our services include the distribution of powerful content across digital channels, as well as making meaningful connections through our live events and peer networks.  Our company has entered an exciting new chapter following a major brand refresh, the launch of some key products and services as well as some exciting new team members. We are looking for creative thinkers with the skills to bring our vision to life across a variety of critical roles. If you’re interested in an organization that combines a storied 150-year legacy with a start-up mentality, we invite you to get to know us: www.arizent.com  About The Position  We currently have an excellent opportunity for an energetic and driven Sales Manager. This position reports directly to the Sales Director and is responsible for all sales pertaining to the full suite of brands in Financial Services, with a focus on Accounting. Sales products include digital advertising, account based marketing, data products, video, live custom events, print, research, content marketing and a full host of custom solutions for our clients.  The successful candidate will have at least 3-5 years of sales experience, a strong background in digital media sales, a demonstrated track record of creating integrated campaigns and must be able to break new accounts. A background in lead generation solutions is a must and experience with a variety of products is essential (digital, print, on-line, video, etc.). Daily responsibilities include building and managing client relationships, forecasting, budgeting and closing new business. Travel is required for industry events and client presentations.  Primary Job Functions Independently build a large pipeline of leads to drive RFPs and IOs Build relationships with ad agency and direct client contacts, and be able to explain the power integrated media Work with the sales planning team to build and present proposals Manage a robust pipeline and accurately forecast territory revenue Interact with an Account Management team to effectively manage client expectations, ensure successful campaign delivery, and help set the expectations for future potential growth Daily responsibilities include building and managing client relationships, forecasting, budgeting and closing new business Travel is required for industry events and client presentations Required Qualifications  The ideal candidate will have at least 3-5 years of sales experience, a strong background in digital media sales in the B2B space, a demonstrated track record of creating integrated campaigns and above all, a constant desire to break new ground. Must be a strategic thinker. A background in lead generation solutions is a must and experience with a variety of products is essential (print, digital, online, video, etc.).  We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package. Our extensive offerings include medical, dental, and vision coverage; disability and life insurance; paid time off; a 401(k) plan; a pre-tax transportation payment program; and fitness reimbursement program.  Arizent complies with all federal, state, and local laws that prohibit discrimination because of age, race, color, religion, creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, predisposing genetic characteristics, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, arrest records, unemployment status or any other protected category.

description: We offer an excellent opportunity for not only a job, but a career with growth potential. At Transtar, we seek applicants who roll up their sleeves, enjoy hard work, thrive in a team environment, and who embody our core values of Safety, Honesty, Action, Relationship, and Product.  Transtar Autobody Technologies, a business unit of Transtar Industries, is a coatings manufacturing company in the automotive refinish business headquartered in Brighton, Michigan. At Transtar Autobody Technologies, we are dedicated to developing, producing, and marketing quality refinish products for the automotive aftermarket. TAT is prideful of our history of creative and innovative research, which enables us to bring products to the marketplace in a manner highly beneficial to our customers, the industry and our environment.  We have an immediate opportunity for a Territory Manager in our Austin, TX market and surrounding areas. This position will primarily service customers located in the metro San Antonio area, but may also include customers in the surrounding areas.  WHY TRANSTAR AUTOBODY TECHNOLOGIES?  The Territory Manager is responsible for managing a territory by selling products through our established distribution channels. As a Territory Manager, you help developing and established customers leverage our various products and programs, optimize their product, and maximize their utilization.  WHAT YOU WILL DO WITH YOUR TALENTS: Execute the TAT sales plan, work within company policies & programs, and meet annual sales performance goals expectations. Plan Pre-call sales, establish customer relationships, identify sales opportunities, present & demonstrate product /programs, and close sales. Develop annual Business Plan, submit annual territory review, monitor customer inventory levels, partner with customers to improve metrics, identify & capitalize on opportunities, and complete post-call activities & follow-up. Manage accounts – key, existing, and new, supervise distributor activities, evaluate distributor performance, and train distribution personnel. Control sales expense, manage time efficiently, develop monthly sales forecast, and address & resolve problems. Improve product knowledge, selling skills, and business acumen.  WHAT YOU WILL BRING: Three + years of outside sales experience (automotive aftermarket preferred). Excellent oral and written communication skills, as well as presentation abilities to people at all levels of management Prior PBE experience Product Knowledge & Confidence Business Acumen which includes financial literacy, market orientation, and strategic perspective Territory Planning & Management Proficient computer skills; MS Office products  EDUCATION:  Bachelor's degree (B. A.) from four-year college or university preferred; or a combination of education and experience / training. Management experience or desire/ability to lead a sales team is desired but not necessary.

jobTitle: Inside Sales Representative - Tech Sales (multiple positions)
description: Whova Job description  We are recruiting for full-time software sales located in San Diego, CA. See our latest video here: https://whova.com/jobs/we-are-hiring/  Whova revolutionizes event engagement and attendee networking by providing the Whova event management software and services to support events, conferences, expos globally everyday. Whova is a fast-growing company and are backed by Venture Capital in Silicon Valley as well as US government funding, with customers in America, Europe, Asia, etc. Our easy-to-use app brings people together. Whova's headquarter is in the "Pyramid" building, San Diego Innovation Center. We are a fast-paced, people-oriented company seeking candidates who like working directly with customers and will grow with us.   This role is ideal for someone sales-minded who is looking for a career path that offers a future in sales, marketing, or account management. As an inside sales representative, your primary focus will developing customer relationships and selling our event application to prospective customers using email, social media, and outbound calling. All the calls are warm calls.  Whova has been named as one of the Best Places to Work in San Diego in 2021 (for 5 years now), and also won the Fastest Growing Private Companies award in 2018, 2019 and 2020.  Whova is the top product in our space, supporting events in 100+ countries. The Event Technology Awards (ETA) — the world’s largest and most prestigious event tech awards program — recognized Whova’s innovative networking technology for four years in a row since 2016. Especially, Whova won the People’s Choice Award in 2018, with the most votes from event industry professionals, and also Best Event APP Award in 2019. Whova recently made into the Global Top 100 Software Companies in G2's ranking.  Responsibilities:  Cultivate strong relationships with prospective customers  Engage prospective customers via phone, email, and outbound warm calls from leads generated by marketing  Qualify prospects and manage a pipeline to close  Identify customer needs and recommend appropriate solutions  Develop in-depth knowledge of the market, products and benefits  Perform effective demos of products and services  Close sales, impact sales results, and achieve monthly quotas  Accurately report on activity related to customer interactions via CRM   What we offer:  Base salary + commission + bonus Performance based commission increase  Mentorship commissions (if you are a senior rep and mentoring junior reps) Health benefit package  Paid holidays  Vacation  In-office work and training   Desired Skills and Experience Excellent customer service and listening skills  Self-assured, results driven, and outgoing  Adaptable and able to manage time effectively  Professional, fast and eager learner, and a team-player

ABOUT ALLSEATING: For 40 years, Allseating has been a leader in the design and development of solutions that adjust to the needs of customers in the office, educational and healthcare industries. Our 150,000 square foot facility in Mississauga, Ontario, Canada is home to our broad line of seating solutions. Whether it’s through innovative designs or comprehensive service programs, we’re always working at making people feel comfortable. Allseating is a company that’s growing. In order to accelerate innovation, we are recruiting talented individuals who will become vital and interconnected leaders of our development process. Allseating has corporate showrooms in Mississauga, New York and Chicago.  JOB DESCRIPTION:      Reporting to the VP Sales, and working with the New York Sales Team Territory Manager and New Business Development Manager, we are looking for an enthusiastic Sales Associate who will foster the development of new and existing customers within the New York and New Jersey Territories. He/she is responsible for working with the existing New York/New Jersey Team to develop and execute a plan to achieve the sales goals by working with dealers, end users, and the A&D community.  POSITION OBJECTIVES: The objectives of the Sales Associate are as follows:  Leadership: Attend ongoing training sessions to ensure superior knowledge and delivery of key selling messages, internal processes and general selling skills; Strong motivation to meet or exceed targets and to overcome adversity.   Distribution Management: Work with the NY/NJ Sales Team to foster both top to top and sales level relationships with key stakeholders within our dealer and A&D network; Provide ongoing product and program training for sales and project management staff within Dealerships and Design Firms.   Client Relationship Management: Build and manage key accounts using our Strategic Account Planning process and our CRM system to farm new business to key Dealers. Identify potential new customers within defined vertical market sectors and make presentations on solutions and services that meet or predict the client’s future needs. Develop and maintain relationships with key Dealer Partners to build awareness of the Allseating brand relative to existing and all new product launches Work with the sales team to develop proposals that speak to the client’s needs, concerns and objectives Implement the company’s methodology to identify target customers, set meetings, pre and post meeting follow up and position Allseating as a potential supplier for future seating requirements.   A&D Community brand and relationship development: Work with NY / NJ Sales Team to develop a target account coverage plan; Develop relationships with one or more key people in target firms and turn those relationships into project specification and standards program opportunities; Development and execution of promotional event calendar featuring activities such as lunch and learns, coffee breaks, events and scheduled visits; ·      Participation in ARIDO, IIDA, ASID or other such organization where appropriate.  Administration: Territory budget management including sample, travel, and entertainment expenses; Activity management with emphasis on sample moves and sales pipeline Maintaining updated account information and opportunity pipeline through our company CRM system ·      Maintain a sales pipeline of aprox 2-3 x personal sales goal at all times  REQUIRED SKILLSET:  In order to thrive in our fast-paced, highly flexible work environment the candidate must possess the following:  Minimum 2 years of sales experience in a manufacturing, Dealer or A&D environment; Competitive, energetic and self-motivated professional with excellent interpersonal skills Ability to network and prospect for future potential customers and to develop and grow national and/or mid market accounts Public speaking and presentation ability Must be extremely detailed oriented; Must have the ability to focus on each and every aspect of a sales opportunity; Must have a strong technical aptitude with the ability to understand Allseating’s product line and all associated components; Must have strong communication skills (English written, English reading, and English verbal); Must have strong interpersonal skills; Must be capable of working individually and in a team environment; Must have exemplary time management skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced and high demand environment; Must have a positive attitude and pleasant demeanour with a commitment for service excellence; Must have the ability to think outside the box and create winning sales tools to maximize business potential; Must have strong computer skills including Microsoft Office suite and Excel;  WORK ENVIRONMENT:   The expectation when not on the road is for the applicant to work from home office or out of our New York showroom. It will be a requirement to be in the Manhattan area for the majority of the work week.   COMPENSATION:  Compensation is aligned with industry standards and includes a healthcare allowance. We are a Canadian company and as such our US Sales Team are hired as contracted independent consultants.  If you are a team player and looking for a position to demonstrate your drive, enthusiasm and initiative we look forward to hearing from you.  Please submit your resume and cover letter (including salary expectations) to resumes@allseating.com quoting “NY/NJ Sales Associate” in the subject line.

description: Overview  THIS IS A REMOTE POSITION  Canopy Biosciences, a Bruker Company, is a rapidly growing and fast-paced biotechnology company located in beautiful midtown St. Louis. We are committed to providing cutting-edge, multi-omics products and services to the academic and biotech research community. We are a team of dedicated scientists, passionate about our work and intent on making a difference in the pursuit of better drugs and technologies. We offer comprehensive benefits that give our employees the right environment where they can thrive. We seek to expand our team with the right individuals who are passionate about their work, desire to both contribute and learn, have a flexible mindset, and want to grow with Canopy Biosciences.  Canopy Bioscience is part of the Bruker family. As one of the world’s leading analytical instrumentation companies, Bruker covers a broad spectrum of advanced solutions in all fields of research and development. All our systems and instruments are designed to improve safety of products, accelerate time-to-market and support industries in successfully enhancing quality of life. We’ve been driving innovation in analytical instrumentation for 50 years. Today, worldwide more than 6,000 employees are working on this permanent challenge, at over 70 locations on all continents.  Responsibilities  Canopy Biosciences is seeking an Inside Sales Specialist with a background in biology or molecular biology. We seek an innovative and motivated self-starter who enjoys working in a fast-paced start-up environment. As Inside Sales Specialist, you will be responsible for finding prospects, qualifying, and developing leads, and transferring qualified leads to Business Development for further development and closure. You will source new opportunities through inbound lead follow-up and outbound cold calls and emails.  Responsibilities Prospecting of leads from multiple sources, including LinkedIn, Pubmed, academic websites, and more Engage with prospects via email and/or phone, positioning Canopy’s offerings to their needs Qualify incoming leads, providing product and pricing information, assessing needs, and establishing budget and timelines Transfer of qualified leads to Business Development Qualifications 1-3 years of experience in an inside sales role Knowledgeable in technologies for protein detection, immunoassay, and microscopy, including spatial biology Experience in pharma/biotech industry preferred BS, MS, or Ph.D. in Biology, Molecular Biology, or a related field Desire to work in a fast-paced startup environment Remote position

description: Company Description Rocky Mountain Barrel Company is the premier source for supplying new and used oak casks to thousands of clients all over the globe. Originally focused in North America, we have expanded our operations over the years to include multiple countries and a wide variety of barrels. Our business has grown consistently, and we continue to increase our volumes, selling primarily to wineries, breweries, distilleries, and furniture makers. The Role: This dynamic role will be responsible for learning the key components of our business and will cross-train under all departments to have a deep knowledge base of our daily operations. The successful candidate has the motivation and skill to pick up new knowledge and skills quickly and be able to manage different tasks at any given time. Key Responsibilities: Collaborate closely with the sales team to assist with client communication, outreach and strategy as directed Identify and implement best practices and support the continuous improvement of processes and quality standards Work closely with our shipping department to create accurate documents Manage data integrity of the CRM (NetSuite) Be comfortable answering phone calls and handling customer appointments Assistance with special projects as needed Other core expectations as defined and requested by leadership Qualifications: Strong Communication Skills and Excellent Customer Service Skills 2+ years in sales and/or operations Previous experience with a CRM Platform Candidate must have a high degree of organizational ability and be able to multi-task Ability to learn quickly and retain information Sense of urgency and ability to prioritize as needed Professional phone manner and presentation Able to take initiative & work independently in a dynamic environment Positive, and energetic attitude Benefits 2 weeks paid vacation per year, with one additional day each year of employment Paid holidays including the week of Christmas Major Health Insurance provided by Anthem BlueCross/BlueShield  Salary is DOE

About Us:  New datasets are being created every day and investors need to incorporate them to remain competitive.  YipitData is the go-to, 200+ person data team for hundreds of the largest institutional investors and corporations in the world. We identify, screen, license, clean, and analyze alternative data to help clients answer their key questions.  We have amazing reviews (and a 5-star rating!) on Glassdoor and are one of Inc's Best Workplaces - a fast-growing technology company based in NYC, backed by Norwest Venture Partners and with a strong culture focused on mastery, ownership, and purpose.  About The Role:  We are hiring a Sales Development Representative - Investor (official title: "Sales Development Representative") to help our Sales team engage new clients. Our newest Sales Development Representative will qualify inbound sales leads/opportunities, follow up with marketing qualified opportunities, as well as identify prospective opportunities and utilize a number of communication methods to begin a sales engagement.  The Sales Development Representative career progression is a path towards being a Sales Associate and then a Sales Executive, focused on bringing on and engaging new business.  In this role, you'll gain experience in: Owning the inbound sales process by developing and iterating on the prospect experience, qualifying the opportunities and delivering the YipitData value proposition to ensure sales success Developing creative outbound sales skills by leveraging a number of communications methods including cold calling, cold emailing, direct mail, Bloomberg message and others Working with Hedge Funds and Investment Managers who rely on the next generation of alternative data research to help with their investments Collaborating with Marketing to optimize the opportunity conversion process Mapping out organizational structures of leading Hedge Funds and Investment Managers to identify prospective users Opportunity to develop skills across a broad range of sales technology tools such as Salesforce, Gong, Groove, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Zoom Info, Asana and others  You are likely to succeed if: You have minimum 1-2 year of inside sales experience in a SDR, BDR, or Sales Executive role You are passionate about contributing to the future of data-driven investment research You are excited by understanding the needs of investment professionals You are creative and like to think of different ways to engage prospects You are empathetic and have strong interpersonal skills and high emotional intelligence You thrive in fast-paced, dynamic environments You have a highly positive outlook You are resourceful and excited to learn You have sound judgment when handling new situations  What We Offer : Our compensation package includes equity and highly competitive salary & commission plan We care about your personal life and we mean it. We offer flexible work hours, unlimited vacation, generous 401K match, parental leave, team events, wellness budget, learning reimbursement, and more! Your growth at YipitData is determined by the impact that you are making, not by tenure, unnecessary facetime, or office politics. Everyone at YipitData is empowered to learn, self-improve, and master their skills in an environment focused on ownership, respect, and trust. To learn more about our culture and values, check out our Glassdoor page!  We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
industries: Financial Services

description: About The Position  Highly creative and intelligent, our Sales Development Representatives identify the value add of FiscalNote products to prospective organizations. Through effective listening and market research, our sales development representatives will tactfully leverage all manners of communication to get our platform in front of senior executives in the policy, ESG, advocacy, and legal worlds. SDRs partner with FiscalNote Account Executives to develop an account targeting strategy to bring in new clients for FiscalNote  FiscalNote SDRs have a level of critical thinking and intellectual curiosity far exceeding that of a generic SaaS sale.  Our Sales Development Representatives hustle and thrive on driving high growth for a fast-paced technology company. Our training and development program enables SDRs with the necessary skills that will accelerate their future Sales careers. Our team is highly collaborative, fun, and supportive of each other's goals and broader organizational goals.  About The Business Development Team  The Business Development Team at FiscalNote is the key touchpoint for our client-focused approach. Our mission is to help our clients identify challenges and provide innovative, data-driven, and practical solutions to better navigate risk, opportunity, and uncertainty. We leverage our platform of software and information-services products to empower people and organizations with the right information at the right time. FiscalNoter’s on the Business Development Team, both experienced and new professionals, gain opportunities for learning and professional development in a diverse and innovative culture, rooted in our company values and mission. Our workspace, located in downtown Washington D.C., champions our culture through a vibrant, modern, open concept that still offers privacy, fostering collaboration and success. Our team is committed to being a good neighbor, woven into the fabric of the DC-metro area community, and continually looking for new opportunities to support our neighbors.  About You  Hungry. Curious. Unflappable. Intelligent. You view every phone call you make and every email you send as one more data point to guide you to understanding the quickest path to success. Because you communicate clearly and skillfully through both writing and speech, others always understand the context of your message. Your intellectual curiosity is one of your greatest assets and allows you to effectively interact with people from all walks of life. Able to think quickly on your feet, you handle any situation with extraordinary tact and composure.  What To Expect In This Position Engage potential clients Perform both cold and warm outreach to potential clients Develop industry-specific policy expertise to take a consultative approach when communicating with senior-level executives Receive mentorship from senior associates, strategists, and enterprise directors Leverage internal marketing materials to engage target executives/organizations Strategically plan account penetration Leverage Sales Enablement tools (like SalesLoft, ZoomInfo, etc) to manage your engagements with target prospects Develop a deep understanding of our target personas and their needs Actively and regularly attend industry events Develop industry-specific policy expertise What Sets You Apart Bachelor’s degree or equivalent A consistent record of surpassing personal and organizational goals Clear written and verbal communication skills A relentless drive to succeed 1+ years in business development ideally preferred Knowledge of public policy and or law a plus Reference ID  About FiscalNote  FiscalNote is the premier information services company focused on global policy and market intelligence. By combining AI technology, expert analysis, and legislative, regulatory, and geopolitical data, FiscalNote is reinventing the way that organizations minimize risk and capitalize on opportunity.  Home to CQ, Roll Call, Oxford Analytica, and VoterVoice, FiscalNote empowers more than 5,000 clients worldwide to monitor, manage, and act on the issues that matter most to them. To learn more about FiscalNote and its family of brands, visit FiscalNote.com and follow @FiscalNote.  At FiscalNote, we Lead with Values  Know your Audience ∙ Find the Truth ∙ Drive Alignment ∙ Level Up ∙ Own the Job ∙ Bias for Action ∙ Support the Family  FiscalNote is continuing to hire new talent, with all interviewing and on-boarding done virtually due to COVID-19. New team members, along with our current staff, will temporarily work remotely (unless communicated otherwise).  If your background and experience align with the competencies above, we encourage you to apply so that we can review your experience and learn more about how you can add to FiscalNote’s growth and success.  Company Benefits  FiscalNote offers competitive salaries, equity packages, and retirement accounts to ensure we’re all FN owners. We work hard, so our open vacation policy helps us ensure you’re getting the R&R you need. We offer comprehensive health, vision, and dental insurance options supplemented by a flexible spending account (FSA). We have a slew of other benefits which you can check out at careers.FiscalNote.com .  FiscalNote values diversity. We are committed to equal opportunities and creating an inclusive environment for all our employees. We welcome applicants regardless of ethnic origin, national origin, gender, race, religious beliefs, disability, sexual orientation or age. FiscalNote is an EEOC employer.  FiscalNote uses E-Verify to confirm the employment eligibility of all new employees. To learn more about E-Verify, including your rights and responsibilities, please visit www.DHS.gov/E-Verify .
industries: Computer Software, Internet, and Financial Services

description: Purpose  Primary responsibility of the Inside Sales role is to assist outside Builder Sales team in the sales cycle, adding value to create customers for life. This includes problem solving, tracking orders, creating orders, communicating backorders, scheduling deliveries, trouble-shooting issues, and maintaining samples. Most of the customer interactions will be by phone or email.  Secondary responsibility will be to provide support to the showroom team as needed by answering questions where possible or directing to the right person.  Key Responsibilities  OPERATIONS Full understanding of product lines, nuances to products, and be able to create complete, accurate specifications on demand. Utilize Eclipse to manage backorders communicated by writer (calling queue). Convert quotes/purchase orders to orders as directed by consultant. Manage backorders by contacting vendors for updates on ETAs and communicate to the writer and the customer. Provide solutions as needed. Successfully complete all assigned training within given timeframe. Follow company & showroom level standard operating procedures. CUSTOMER FOCUS Solve problems in the best interest of the customer and company. Schedule deliveries and installations ensuring the home is ready for installation. Interface with project managers and construction superintendents to coordinate deliveries, provide etas, etc. Release product as indicated by “need by” date or otherwise requested. Answer phones promptly (within three rings) using Reece phone etiquette. Own the call by trouble-shooting issues and following up with updates until resolved. Manage inbound post-sale service requests. Close the feedback loop by noting anything pertinent in Eclipse. Provide clear communication to customer as well as writer utilizing internal notes section in Eclipse. In effort to be paperless and consolidate information, all email communication corresponding to a sales order should be maintained in Eclipse. Work closely with vendors to make sure product shipment /delivery dates are adhered to and communicate changes appropriately to the customer. Achieve Net Promoter Score (to be implemented) and online reviews of >4.5. Routinely share feedback with Director, tracking trends of customer issues and communicating potential process improvements. SALES Provide sales assistance, acting in place of the consultant if not available. Willingly assist all customers on phone as part of managing overflow delivering on the Reece customer promise. Provide proactive post-sale service to ensure deliveries and installations went well. Perform other duties as assigned  Communication Skills  KEY CAPABILITIES Strong verbal communication skills with the ability to convey information concisely. Strong written skills in order to respond professional and concisely via email. Maintain composure and demonstrate urgency to give customer confidence that their issue(s) can be resolved timely. Listen to understand the core issue and demonstrate empathy. Upward communication on trends, vendor issues, etc. Navigate conflict by diffusing and offering solutions. Collaborates with Volume Builder Consultant openly Selling Skills Ability to persuade and influence purchase decisions. Solution-based selling demonstrating value beyond order taking. Adopt Reece product & sales training. Time Management Skills Effectively managing one’s time and resources to ensure that work is completed efficiently. Ability to prioritize customers based on deadlines. Self-structure to manage workload, creating tasks. Minimum Qualifications Associates degree 1+ years in customer service role within wholesale, retail or hospitality Proficient in Excel, Word, Outlook Preferred Qualifications Bachelor’s degree preferred 1+ years in customer service role within an industry with complex sales cycle Strong technical skills
industries: Retail

description: About Moxe:  Moxe is reimagining healthcare by unlocking access to clinical data. Our API-first approach makes securely sharing clinical information and insights between providers, payers, and patients easy. We work with health systems and payers to streamline release of information requests, optimize risk adjustment, improve HEDIS and Star ratings, ensure regulatory compliance, and more. www.moxehealth.com  Summary:  Repotring to the Head of Revenue Operations, as Sales Development Representative for Moxe, you will collaborate with Sales and Marketing on lead generation efforts to bring in new sales meetings.  Responsibilities: Gain a strong understanding of both industry and Moxe Health product knowledge Generate new sales leads through email, phone, LinkedIn, and other outbound methods Communicate the value proposition of Moxe Health to prospects and key stakeholders Identify client contacts and leads for outreach Qualify initial leads and convert them into sales meetings Create weekly lead generation reports and meet/exceed sales goals Update and track all sales activity into Salesforce  Requirements: Minimum of 2 years of experience in a Lead Generation or Inside Sales role in Healthcare or Health/Tech Experience generating meetings and client engagement Ability to persevere with top of funnel sales approach Consultative and thoughtful in sales approach Positive, hard working with strong capacity for learning Self-driven, motivated with grit to be successful Competitive, goal oriented, accountable, with the ability to think strategically Start-up ready, able to adapt well to change and work in fast paced environment Persuasive, inviting communication style Ability to effectively communicate via phone, internet, video conference, and in-person Team oriented with the ability to establish relationships with key stakeholders Experience with Outreach, SalesLoft, HubSpot or other sales automation tools Experience with MS Office and Google Drive tools  Education Requirements: Bachelor's degree in related field of study, preferred High School diploma, required  Got Moxie?  Join Moxe! We're a fast-growing company focused on making a difference in healthcare. An equal opportunity employer, Moxe is looking for passionate, inclusive team players who like to solve problems, think outside the box, and thrive in a dynamic environment. We hire great people from diverse backgrounds, and that makes us stronger. If you share our values: integrity, transparency, respect, frankness, persistence, and unity, let's talk.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment irrespective of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.  For more information on Job Opportunities at Moxe Health, please email info@moxehealth.com

description: The Sales Development Representative Position  The Sales Development Representative (SDR) role is a full-time, 12-week contract opportunity for ambitious, hard-working, outgoing individuals who desire an elevated professional opportunity in sales but have not had the opportunity to develop a track record/resume to qualify for our primary Sales Professional opportunity.   During the 12-week contract, the SDR will learn and gain mastery of our proven prospecting, lead nurturing and appointment setting methodologies. The SDR will be assigned to an experienced Sales Professional to support their sales activities by adding additional selling opportunities to their schedule. SDRs who demonstrate the work ethic, coachability, and aptitude for generating quality leads and appointments will have the opportunity to be hired into our full-fledged Sales Professional opportunity at the end of their contract.  In addition to increasing sales through their core prospecting and phone calling activities, SDRs will also have an opportunity to learn about our long-term career path and witness our selling processes and client interactions during a 1x/week field ride with their assigned Sales Professional. This allows both the SDR and Tom James Company a first-hand look at whether a long-term selling opportunity at Tom James is a fit for the SDR.  Expectations for our SDRs are set high to result in high rewards. Our SDRs are paid a competitive hourly wage as well as commissions on orders sold to prospects and former customers they book into their leaders’ calendars. SDRs who achieve expectation in the program can earn up to $3,500 - $4,000/monthly while developing the skills and habits necessary for even greater opportunity in our uncapped, unlimited Sales Professional opportunity.  SDRs will participate in a comprehensive, structured training program equipping them for each activity assigned.  At the end of the 12-week contract, depending on performance and other factors, Tom James will determine whether to:  Extend an offer for regular employment with Tom James, including the potential for our full-time Sales Professional position; Extension of the SDR contract; Opt not to renew the contract, and provide verification of program completion to assist the SDR in their next job search  Job Duties include but are not limited to: Prospecting for potential new clients: utilize our prospecting platforms including ZoomInfo, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, and Outreach to identify, connect with and warm up quality prospects; Updating contact information and conducting direct contact/marketing outreach to customers who haven’t purchased from us in a while; Phone Skills & Dials: 85+ dials/day with a goal to set around 20-25 appointments/week Conduct client & prospect research on the individuals the Sales Professional meets with to identify potential connections to other ideal customers for referrals; Assist with some customer service communications to provide a world-class experience and additional sales opportunities  About Us Tom James is the world’s leading professional image consulting business. Our customers come to us for our custom fit, convenience, selection and expertise. Our product is clothing, but our passion is developing sales professionals to achieve extraordinary results. We are an employee-owned, privately held clothing company with 100 locations and 16 subsidiaries in the specialty retail industry. Our “We come to you” model has earned the trust of the world’s leading professionals in markets throughout the world.  What We Do Our clients are highly successful, busy professionals, and we help them look better and feel more comfortable in their clothing, whatever the setting. You don’t need to be a fashion expert to do what we do, but you DO need to be passionate about listening to and serving your customers! We can teach the rest from our 55 years of experience building wardrobes for men and women. We network and prospect for great potential clients, and we use the phone, email, social media and other communication tools to connect and share our service with them. When we do our job right by taking care of our clients, they work with us season after season as we help them stay current, updated and fresh for whatever comes their way.  www.tomjamescareers.com
industries: Luxury Goods & Jewelry

description: Job Description  BlueOptima is NOT where you figure out if a career in sales is for you. As a Business Development Representative, you know what you’re getting into. You love the ups and downs of seeking out the right contact!  Calls, Emails, LinkedIn outreach will be the norm. You’ll bounce back with a new strategy when you don’t get a yes the first time.  A passion for technology is also a big plus! That’s how you’ll thrive as a Business Development Representative (BDR) at BlueOptima.  At BlueOptima, you’ll be immersed in the full sales-cycle - from generating that initial lead, all the way to helping close the deal with major national and international clients.  Our experienced Sales team will give you all the mentoring and support you need, and as much responsibility as you can handle!  With BlueOptima, the exposure you will receive to the cutting edge of software sales (from sales technique training to client relationship management) will put you at the forefront of a growth sector that is the future of the economy.  Additional Information  You can be a part of our next step, working with a group that will coach you, support you, provide step by step training to be successful and cheer you on to your wins!  Oh, and did we mention a generous PTO plan, lots of company outings, snacks, an amazing dog-friendly office and flexible work schedule? Also working with a global company opens up travel opportunities!  Go ahead, apply already.  BlueOptima an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to ensure all people feel supported and connected at work.  Renumeration: $40K-45.5K base + 6K bonus + uncapped commission

companyName: Pella Windows & Doors of Northern Indiana
description: Pella Trade Outside Sales Representative - South Bend  Who we are: We are a private, locally owned Pella distributorship that sells, services and fulfills Pella Projects. We believe in transparency, trust and honest business. Not only do we have world class products and warranties, but we have an open and supportive culture, and an all-star roster to achieve excellent results. This is a team you will enjoy working with and a fun and rewarding culture.   What will you be doing? You will take your training, sales tools, and expertise and dive into your sales territory with an existing account base sourced out of the South Bend branch. Your day to day will be diverse with detailed office work on one end, visits to job sites on one, and formal product presentations on yet another. You will bring to the table a myriad of products and services by which you will enhance the building experience for new home builders, remodelers, architects, designers, and homeowners. By a careful study of inputs vs outputs will develop this customer base into a group of pre-Pella advocates and become the window and door expert for your area.  What will we give you for being GREAT at it? You will receive a salary base with a no-cap commission plan. Achievable monthly and yearly bonus. Home office setup, cell phone, reimbursed car allowance, reimbursed expenses, and a financial and health insurance package.  Who is the right person for the job? The right person is one who thrives on crossing over into hostile territory and winning over accounts and market share. He or she works best as an autonomous, self-reliant, and resourceful salesperson and can make the necessary adjustments to scheduling and work hours without a watchful eye. The right person has a temperament and personality that facilitates a sales friendly experience. He or she is outgoing, personable, articulate, versatile, and professional.  We are open to those with or without sales experience if there is a healthy sense of urgency to become successful and proven. Clean, ethical business, having fun, and a desire to be successful are not negotiable. Clear driving record and background check is required.  How do you Apply? Contact Brittany Brown – bbrown@pellani.com Or Richard Handley – rhandley@pellani.com

Hardworking, Professional Inside Sales Representative Needed for Print and Digital Publishing Company  Times Media Group, located in Tempe, seeks a full-time Inside Sales Representative to join its team of talented professionals. You will be responsible for developing new business, primarily through cold calling using the phone and email, offering solutions to drive company revenue.  A top candidate will possess excellent communication skills, phone presence, and enthusiasm, and must be able to meet critical deadlines, have a positive, professional attitude, and the ability to work as part of a team.  Responsibilities Present and sell company products and services to new and existing customers Prospect and contact potential customers Reach agreed upon sales targets by the deadline Resolve customer inquiries and complaints Set follow-up appointments to keep customers aware of latest developments Create sales material to present to customers Qualifications Previous experience in sales, customer service, or other related fields Familiarity with CRM platforms Ability to build rapport with clients Strong negotiation skills Deadline and detail-oriented This is a good position for an individual who is financially motivated, and offers a base pay plus commission and a real opportunity for income growth for those who can aggressively and professionally close and maintain a book of business.  Times Media Group is a digital and print media company that operates in the Phoenix, Tucson, and Los Angeles markets. It serves a wide variety of demographic audiences and communities, with millions of printed copies and online readers each month.

jobTitle: Pulmonary Specialty Sales Representative - Macon, GA
description: Do you want to join an international team working to improve the future of healthcare? Do you want to improve the lives of millions of people? Grifols is a global healthcare company which, since its foundation in Barcelona in 1909, has been working to improve the health and well-being of people all over the world. Our four divisions - Bioscience, Diagnostic, Hospital and Bio Supplies - develop, produce and market innovative medicines, solutions and services in more than 100 countries and regions.  Grifols has been a leader in the healthcare industry since 1909 by creating innovative products and services based on the values of ethics, quality and responsibility. Grifols' activities focus on fulfilling the needs of its patients as well as healthcare professionals working in therapeutics, pharmacy, diagnostics and blood banking. For more than 100 years, Grifols has developed, manufactured and marketed product designed to improve human health. Grifols manufactures plasma derived biopharmaceutical products of proven efficacy, quality and safety. For more information, please visit our website: http://www.grifols.com  Overview  Primary responsibility of the therapeutic specialist is to represent the Grifols plasma portfolio with identified regional/local systems, accounts and customers related to disease awareness, product discussions and collaborating with key opinion leaders. Position requires strong sales and clinical expertise, business acumen and stakeholder relationships.  The Pulmonary SSR will focus on sales performance and engagement with the account and targets. The SSRs should focus on a multi-channel strategy for example once virtual engagement/face to face has completed, follow up with requests and set up the next interaction point. The SSRs will have a hybrid rep-enabled capability and will have a omnichannel approach to the business to respond to customers, business and environmental needs like connection to Marketing, Managed Markets, Operations, CL&D, and Medical Affairs. They are also tasked at hybrid rep-enabled capabilities to move at a rapid pace using digital resources for customer engagement. The SSR is also tasked at using technology for call planning/targeting, field communications, field reporting, sales data analysis, reporting and generating insights.  Other Skill Sets CRM evolution/expansion Enhanced approach to customer targeting and engagement Remote engagement Use of analytical data to generate insights Better use of existing tools like excel, word Use of Technology like digital platforms Adoption of new enhancements to build innovate, automated, and future thinking solutions  Primary Responsibilities  Sales Excellence/Clinical Expertise Consistently demonstrate an in-depth knowledge of and represent the entire Grifols plasma product portfolio with an advanced comprehension of disease state knowledge as well as treatment approaches. Provide branded product and clinical insights aligned with the product’s label to relevant customers. Lead in-depth discussions requiring an advanced comprehension of product knowledge, disease state, and treatment approaches. Keep abreast of competitive product dynamics, changing treatment practices or guidelines with potential impact on Grifols product positioning or usage. Engage a broad range of audiences with various levels of expertise. Understand how to work regional/local systems, centers of excellence, patient advocacy, specialty pharmacy customers and individuals involved with the customer journey. Clearly communicate clinical messages that are relevant and specific to each influencer in the decision process (Buyer, Clinical Pharmacists, DOP, Physician, therapeutic departments, ADR/SP Partner, Infusion Suite Nurse, etc.) Demonstrate account-based selling skills (including group presentations, etc.). Build relationships in institutions aligned with customer segmentation. Develop physician influencer champions to submit and approve P&T requests to add product to formulary Utilization of Managed Markets, Marketing, IgNE, MSL, etc. Detailing customers including Pulmonologists, Primary Cary Physicians, Allergists, Respiratory Therapists, Pharmacists & Nurses. Key Opinion Leader mapping and appropriate relationship with Medical Liaison.  Business Acumen Understand the major fluctuations a market can have and overall plasma economics of the system/institution, e.g. GPO, SP, ADR, membership, specific account trends. Knowledge of the distribution of biologics, key local customers (i.e., specialty pharmacies, hospitals, accounts), market dynamics (i.e. workings of GPOs, relationship with system/IDN, distribution channels) and local/national demand trends. Ability to build strong working relationships with the distributors aligned with MM. Understand and be able to communicate how and why the Prolastin Direct model is different. For Prolastin - Credit application and pharmacy license needed rather than a contract, buy & bill for infusion center Understanding of Physician Management companies, e.g. Intrafusion, Corinthian, Healix, etc. Leverage a deep knowledge of customer needs, targeting segmentation and behaviors to apply to territory planning with the ability to change course and modify business strategies or plans if needed. Must know how to create a plan of action for key accounts through data analysis. (Recognize buying patterns, trends, lost business, anomalies in purchases, threats, opportunities, etc.) Use this information to have conversations with customers to generate sales. Represent customers in the customer forecast process – understand national strategy, align with contract strategy and represent needs of the customer. Know how to present a contract to an institution and working knowledge of the steps (departments, contacts and procedures) involved for that institution to sign and return the agreement. Align with national strategy, answer questions, represent terms, etc. Ability to present contract performance expectations (quarterly/annual). In addition, review regional or local system/institution/account vs Grifols responsibilities/expectations. Assess needs for potential contract opportunities. Know Managed Care throughout the territory including major accounts and large players. Medicare and Medicaid information. Coordinate with the Specialty partner to understand the entire book of business (product portfolio). If a hospital does not have a contract or use a Grifols product, how to move the business forward. Work with pharmacy to ensure product status is updated in EMR system and include in-patient and owned practices. Ability to understand and navigate account contract information within the Salesforce system/account information.  Stakeholder Engagement Establish credibility and trust with key targeted customers to become regarded as a valued strategic partner and trusted advisor providing customer-centric solutions. Consistently demonstrate follow through and the responsibility to ensure customer satisfaction is achieved. Strong communication skills to external stakeholders. Strong communication and collaboration with Grifols internal stakeholders to align on national strategy and facilitate pull-through of key account priorities and contracts. Bioscience collaboration across therapeutic boundaries to understand local market needs and aligned strategy for pull-through post- formulary additions and customer-centric solutions. Manage resources to fulfill customer needs and impact pull through, e.g. MSL, Nurse educator, reimbursement specialist. Gather and provide customer insights to Marketing teams for development of integrated solutions for the regional or local system/customer/account. Share any necessary customer revisions or contract change requests. Communicate/understand SOC impact to regional or local system/institution/account (financial vs clinical). Communicate/educate Legislative impacts to regional or local system/institution/account- leverage Corporate Affairs.  Legal, Ethics & Compliance Ensure appropriate training and alignment to guidance.  Skills/Qualifications/Education Requirements: (To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, education, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions) Position requires a BS/BA degree; Healthcare/Life Science and/or business/marketing degree is a plus. 4 years pharmaceutical or biological sales experience is required. Must be a self-starter capable of organizing time between many unexpected circumstances involved in day-to-day selling situations. Should have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Should have demonstrated proficiency in Word, Excel, Power Point and be able to perform market analysis presentations. Should be able to effectively utilize a lap top computer on a daily basis for planning, call activity and other territory needs. Overnight travel required. Weekend or evening work may be required Depending on the area of assignment, directly related experience or a combination of directly related education and experience and/or competencies may be considered in place of the stated requirements. Example: If a job level requires a Bachelor’s degree plus 4 years of experience, an equivalency could include 8 years of experience, an Associate’s degree with 6 years of experience, or a Master’s degree with 2 years of experience.  Work is performed in an office environment with exposure to electrical office equipment. Frequently sits for 4-6 hours per day. Frequent hand movement of one hand with the ability to make fast, simple, movements of the fingers, hands, and wrists. Frequently walks. Occasionally bends and twists neck. Light to moderate lifting and carrying objects with a maximum lift of 35lbs. Frequently drives to site locations and travels within the United States. Able to communicate complex information and ideas so others will understand; with the ability to listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences. Frequently interacts with others, relates sensitive information to diverse groups. Ability to apply abstract principles to solve complex conceptual issues. Performs a wide range of complex tasks as dictated by variable demands and changing conditions with little predictability as to the occurrence. Plans work assignments to meet objectives.  EEO Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans
industries: Pharmaceuticals

description: Twingate is building a modern remote access solution that simplifies and improves the way businesses secure access to their cloud, SaaS, and on-prem resources. Twingate is backed by leading investors such as WndrCo, 8VC, Green Bay Ventures, SignalFire, and Dropbox founders Drew Houston and Arash Ferdowsi. Our investors share our belief that in a world where workforces are becoming increasingly distributed, it is critical to be able to effectively secure access to apps, data, and environments.  As part of our company culture, our belief in putting the customer first permeates our thinking in everything from our customer communications to the design process behind the product itself. If you take pride in creating experiences with the customer firmly at the center of the picture, we'd love to work with you.  The Role  Our team is looking to hire a sales manager to help grow our team while continuing to build strong relationships with our customer base. You'd be working closely with our VP of Enterprise to lead a team of genuine, authentic account executives helping companies leave their legacy VPN environment and adopt a modern alternative.  We're still a growing company, so in addition to leading the AE team, you'll be shaping the Twingate go-to-market strategy in collaboration with marketing, product, and engineering.  Responsibilities Manage and hire a team of 4-8 account executives to run full sales cycles from prospecting to qualifying all the way through to closing Be able to be an escalation point during deals while interfacing with CTOs, CIOs, CISOs, DevOps, and engineering leaders Help lead Twingate overview and demo sessions for potential customers Collaborate with Product to funnel customer feedback directly into the product development process Work directly with sales operations to scale + fine-tune processes around CRM tracking, proposal and contract workflows, and pricing escalations Work closely with marketing to develop messaging around Twingate's unique opportunity as an easy to deploy zero trust solution Qualifications 10+ years of experience working in sales 3+ years of experience in a sales management role Proven track record of mentoring and promoting account executives both from a career and skills development standpoint Experience in B2B tech SaaS is a plus Customer-first approach: you do whatever it takes to get the right answers for our customers & partners Strong communication and coordination skills to collaborate across time zones Solutions-oriented problem-solving. You look for a path forward and are able to find creative ways to seed relevant use cases of Twingate at innovative companies. Equal Opportunity  Twingate is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that diversity is integral to Twingate’s success, and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, age, or any other basis protected by law.
industries: Computer Software

description: Core Requirements & Responsibilities We're looking for a professional and high energy individual who will help us build the PurpleSun brand Background in inside sales, marketing, business development, healthcare, science, or nursing Excellent written and verbal communication skills Experience cold-calling, comfortable making calls to potential new customers Conduct outreach via Zoom, email, phone, and LinkedIn Keep detailed schedule of leads and ensure follow up is conducted in a consistent and organized manner Ability to work within PC Microsoft Windows and Apple environments. Advanced computer and software proficiency working in Microsoft Office, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Adobe, Slack, and CRM systems Self-starter with excellent follow through and time management skills High energy, helpful and enthusiastic. “No task is too big or too small” attitude #PSP = PurpleSun Prepared Summary Of Position  In this position, you will play a key role in supporting PurpleSun’s outreach, leads, and sales development by directly interfacing with potential clients in the healthcare space. You will work closely between the marketing team and the sales team to ensure inbound leads that are generated through Advertising and Marketing efforts, are appropriately engaged to better qualify and grow interest before being warmly handed to the sales team. Leads should be organized and followed up with consistently to ensure opportunities are maximized.  We will support you with key verbiage, training, and coaching to success.  This is a part-time contract position with the opportunity to transition to full-time employment. We are looking for someone to start right away!  PurpleSun is a healthcare-technology company with novel UVC-based products that provide healthcare facilities with the fastest, data-driven, sustainable solutions for infection prevention. We were called a “Game Changer in Health-Tech” by the Wall Street Journal, won top infection prevention product in 2020 from Newsweek, and we are on a new level of growth in 2021.  Our products are the best in the market, it’s ultraviolet light re-imaged. We have the fastest cycle times (90 seconds), users don’t have to leave the room while disinfecting equipment, and we eliminate shadowing with proprietary Focused Multivector ultraviolet (FMUV) technology.  For more information visit our website purplesun.com
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Hospital & Health Care

description: About Us:  Torch is a rapidly growing start-up (5x last year) that has raised over $30+ million from top VCs including Bessemer Venture Partners, Felicis, Health Velocity, and FJ Labs. Torch is targeting the $100+ billion office-based healthcare supply industry, starting with dental practices. Our innovative e-commerce software platform streamlines healthcare professionals’ procurement process and helps them secure the best prices.  Our founding team has experience from Blackstone, SmartAsset, Dropbox, and Datadog, from schools including Harvard and MIT. We’re a close‑knit team that enjoys working together every day to solve real‑world problems. We’re working to create better solutions to help healthcare professionals succeed, and we’re looking for people like you to help bring them to life!  Your Contribution:  The ideal candidate is an energetic, driven self-starter with the aptitude for engaging with people and small businesses. You succeed when given the opportunity to build rapport, pitch a vision, and create interest.  You will be joining Torch's growing sales team as a Sales Development Representative. Torch's SDR training program will teach you business fundamentals to grow your career. You will have a training period, ramp period, then be expected to begin speaking with prospects and customers within the healthcare industry.  Your Day To Day:   As a Sales Development Representative you will help sell Torch's software solution. You will be responsible for performing targeted outbound prospecting to find new customers, qualify the right customers, and create new sales opportunities. You will partner closely with experienced sales team members to execute on sales opportunities, and have the opportunity to observe and learn the full sales process.  What We’re Seeking:  •Recent graduate; Bachelor's degree •0-1 years of related work experience •Excellent written and verbal communication skills •Strong work ethic with a positive attitude towards learning •Persistence and motivation to achieve goals •Ability to multitask, organize, and prioritize work  Why Torch:  •Collaborative, high performing culture, with a focus on working as a team •Structured training program to help you learn critical business skills •Highly competitive base salary and additional commission compensation package  •Demonstrated investment in benefits for employees (i.e., medical, dental, 401k, commuter benefits) •Teladoc virtual health and TalkSpace online mental health memberships •Promotion opportunities and potential for quick career growth •Social outings & team events (Virtual & In Person)  https://www.torchdental.com/
industries: Computer Software, Hospital & Health Care, and Information Technology and Services

description: [REMOTE] Account Development Representative (B2B IT Sales exp. req.)  Territory: New Jersey, NY metro area, and eastern PA  Location: must live in territory with ability to commute to NJ headquarters once per week  Salary: Base + Uncapped Commission (1st year OTE $120k-$150k) + Incentives + Benefits  Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, 401(k), Mileage Reimbursement, Company Car Option  Job Type: Full-Time  Start Date: ASAP  Sponsorship not available  [REMOTE] Account Development Representative (B2B IT Sales exp. req.) Description  Our client in the information technology services industry is looking for a motivated and energetic Account Development Representative to add to their team. You will be responsible for maintaining existing vendor accounts as well as identifying and developing new client acquisition within the company’s geographical footprint by formulating and implementing sales strategies for services and product offerings. Our client is looking for an enthusiastic and experienced salesperson with at least two years of business-to-business IT sales. To be successful in this role, you must be technology savvy, and detail oriented with exceptional multi-tasking, organizational skills. This is a great opportunity to join an exceptional team with a strong presence in their market.  [REMOTE] Account Development Representative (B2B IT Sales exp. req.)Responsibilities  Achieve annual sales and profit objectives for a defined account list  Build and maintain long term relationships with clients & vendors  Negotiate contracts and close sales  Obtain new business and exceed annual territory sales budget each year  Develop and maintain a full pipeline of prospective clients and assume all account management  Provide timely and accurate pipeline report, account plans, and account management activities  Maintain knowledge of competitors and their presence within account base  Report to headquarter office in New Jersey once a week on Mondays  [REMOTE] Account Development Representative (B2B IT Sales exp. req.) Qualifications  2+ years of business-to-business IT sales experience required  Experience In Business Development Required  Experience in security solutions sales preferred  Track record of successful sales, meeting annual revenue targets of $1M+ preferred  Computer proficiency in MS Office, Excel, e-mail, and Internet functions required  Valid Driver’s license and reliable transportation required  Willingness/ability to travel within coverage area 60% of the time required  If you have trouble applying via the "Apply Now" button, please copy and paste this text link into your browser:  https://twonice.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk0sqou?cjb_hash=O_VoDm66&apply_now=true  Having trouble applying? Submit your resume to "apply@twonice.com" with "[REMOTE] Account Development Rep (IT sales, OTE $120-150k)" as the subject line. With the lowest fee in the industry, the longest guarantee, and commission-free senior recruiters - we align our interests with the long-term success of every placement.  Need recruiting help? www.twonice.com
