description: Launched in 2000, Eight Eleven Group committed to 100% organic growth, exclusively promoting from within, while always keeping culture and growth opportunity at the forefront of the business model. What began as a two-person Indianapolis startup, Eight Eleven Group has rapidly expanded to become a market-leading organization within one of the fastest growing industries today: Consulting and Professional Services.  In 2012, Medasource was established to provide niche services exclusively in the Healthcare industry, including these practice areas: Providers, Payers, Government, and Life Sciences (pharma, device, diagnostic, clinical research, commercial labs, consumer goods, food sciences, chemicals, agriculture, and environmental sciences). Our team takes a consultative, solution-driven approach with Fortune 500 and enterprise non-profit clients to help them deliver and execute complex capital and operational projects. We are not just in the business of professional services - we are in the business of making a meaningful and authentic impact both internally with our high-performing team and externally with our clients and consultants.  RESPONSIBILITIES Associate Account Executives are enrolled in a comprehensive outside B2B Sales Training Program focused on learning how to take a solution-driven, approach to selling consulting and professional services. Once you complete training, 80% of your time will be spent in front of customer decision makers to build partnerships, pipeline opportunities, and secure win-win engagements with our clients. Here are the primary drivers for success in this role: Strategically identify opportunities and pursuits in 3-5 designated target accounts Build and sustain long-lasting relationships with new and existing clients within your assigned accounts through onsite client meetings, presentations, and outings such as ball games, dinners, golf, etc. Consult with clients to create solutions that help drive change and successful projects within their organization that deliver positive outcomes Act as a client advocate with a focus on improving the experience of our Fortune 500 target accounts Presenting to C-suite executives and championing solutions for their project roadmap Continue to meet and exceed target sales goals Set personal and team goals through frequent sprint sessions with your manager and sales support team  SALES TRAINING Takes place at our Corporate Headquarters in Indianapolis Led by Medasource’s President and top sales leaders Formalized training geared toward our practice areas and core competencies in the healthcare industry Role playing situational selling exercises and ride-alongs with senior account executives Establishing your client portfolio Fostering executive-level relationships   BENEFITS & PERKS Base salary + uncapped commissions Monthly smartphone stipend and car allowance 401k match program Full health benefits (medical, dental, vision, and HSA)  All-expenses-paid Reward Trip each year for top producers and a guest Expense budget for client entertainment Eight Eleven’s BeGiving Program: 1 PTO day per quarter for service work/volunteering  Access to Eight Eleven University (internal personal and professional development program) Top-notch training at every step in your career  Access to a personal financial concierge Genuine, passionate, family-oriented culture  WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED Competitive, motivated spirit and desire to succeed Outstanding communication skills and innate ability to connect with people Entrepreneurial spirit with desire to learn and grow  Results-driven and forward-thinking Thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative, and positive work environment  Bachelor’s Degree    EEO STATEMENT Eight Eleven Group provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, citizenship, disability, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, amnesty or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.
industries: Hospital & Health Care and Staffing and Recruiting

description: What we expect  The first 3 letters in workplace safety are Y-O-U!  TK Elevator is currently seeking an individual to join us in our Sales Development Program in Cincinnati, OH. The Sales Development Program will coach individuals to advance into sales and leadership positions to effectively manage our business and interact with internal and external customers, all within a safe environment.  Program Requirements Bachelor’s degree Successful completion of 2 phases of training Be open to relocation based on company needs after successful completion of the program, with expenses paid Phase I – Field Sales Training Gain an understanding of the company’s safety culture and policies by participating in the orientation class and safety training Gain an understanding and experience of operations including new installation, modernization, repair and service of elevator Complete online training modules and attend training events to gain a better understanding of the company and its products and services Develop and deliver weekly presentations as well as a final presentation at the end of phase one training Phase II – Office Sales Training Participate in a number of activities associated with elevator sales, including New Installation Sales, Modernization Sales, Service Sales and Repair Sales Shadow sales representatives in all lines of business to gain an understanding of the area business markets Complete online training modules and attend training events to gain a better understanding of the company and its products and services Gain a strong understanding of TK Elevator, it’s mission and objectives, customer focus, safety, ethical standards, and compliance Who we are looking for Bachelor’s Degree required Strong computer skills and math aptitude Technical aptitude to learn new software (Oracle, SAP, or other ERP systems) Strong organizational, written and oral communications skills This position requires up to 15% travel Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions Additional information  TK Elevator is an equal opportunity employer and committed to diversity. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, gender, race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age and veteran status or any other protected status required by applicable law.  Applicants with disabilities who require reasonable accommodation in connection with the application process are encouraged to contact us directly at 1-844-427-5461.

description: About The Role  Here’s a chance to kickstart your sales career as a member of a fun, ambitious, and successful team!  On OneLogin’s Sales Development team you will learn everything you need to know about sales amongst the highest achieving sales reps in the tech space. We guarantee lots of challenges, growth and learning within our world class team.  Due to high demand for our product, we are scaling our team to help us keep up with our extraordinary pace of innovation and growth. As a OneLogin Sales Development Representative (SDR), you will prospect, qualify, and generate opportunities to support the overall growth of the business. This is a pivotal role within our sales organization as you would be one of the first touch points for prospects, setting the tone for the sales cycle and future customer relationships.  We believe each team member plays an integral role in the company! Through our top standard training programs we help you polish your sales and technology acumen. OneLogin prioritizes growth from within allowing you to explore and develop skills in sales and other departments.  Our culture is more than lunch, it’s where we celebrate individuality and encourage collaboration and creativity! If this sounds like the role for you...  Specific Job Responsibilities Include Manage and prioritize inbound leads and convert them into sales opportunities. Respond to sales phone calls, sales emails and live website chat. Research accounts and leads to identify contacts and triggers for tailored outreach. Use tools such as LinkedIn Sales Navigator, ZoomInfo, Cognism, and Salesforce. Use calls, emails and social platforms to connect and engage with prospects. Use Outreach to ensure a consistent and scalable cadence of touch points. Deliver high quality meetings to account executives by following qualification criteria. Develop specific daily, weekly and monthly activity metrics to help you achieve targets. Collaborate with account executives on a daily basis. Leverage lead generation programs, content and events provided by the marketing team. About You A minimum of 6 months of experience in an IT Sales related environment Excellent written and verbal communication skills Passion for sales and SaaS technology An eagerness to learn, you are curious and customer-centric A “Can Do” / “Winner” attitude, you are highly motivated to achieve and exceed targets A commitment to team and company success, you are a team player who wants to contribute and learn from others Salesforce or other CRM experience Experience in a fast-paced prospecting/ outbound sales development role is a bonus. WHAT MAKES US GREAT? Continuous career development and pathing opportunities One-on-one training with sales manager and account executives Internal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentally World class training that includes: Technical training with solution engineers, pipeline training, prospect training, role playing, BASHO off-site prospecting class Friendly and inclusive workplace culture About Onelogin  OneLogin, the leader in Unified Access Management, connects people with technology through a simple and secure login, empowering organizations to access the world™. We are headquartered in San Francisco, California. The OneLogin Unified Access Management (UAM) platform is the key to unlocking the apps, devices, and data that drive productivity and facilitate collaboration. OneLogin serves businesses and partners across a multitude of industries, with over 2,500 customers worldwide.  We are proud that Gartner has named us a Leader in the 2020 Magic Quadrant for Access Management. For more information, visit www.onelogin.com, Blog, Facebook, Twitter, or LinkedIn.  Our core values Security first - We make it our #1 priority to protect data and privacy. From the way we work to the technology we provide, security is top of mind Customer focused - We design for, listen to and partner with customers to come up with smart solutions that drive business value Collaborative - We take bold steps and work together to thrive across boundaries. We drive productivity as we grow as one team Accountable - We get things done and take ownership in our work. Showcasing consistent quality and pride to perform at the highest levels Creative - We embody creativity in everything we do. We embrace a diversity of ideas. We execute with ingenuity, flexibility, and agility
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Computer & Network Security

description: s (SDRs) are tasked with identifying and crafting new qualified sales opportunities in Target Accounts for their regional Account Executives. The SDR will become a trusted resource and develop relationships with prospects, acting as the initial point of contact. This role will be primarily focused around researching the Target Accounts in your territory and performing outreach through emails, calls, and social media. You will have the opportunity to be closely mentored and expertly developed by credible enterprise sales professionals.  Responsibilities Promoting and marketing Bluecore's business through extensive and persistent cold calling, emails and communication(s) to prospective clients Scheduling Initial Prospecting Meetings for the Sales Team Providing in depth information to Account Executives to enable the most qualified and productive demos Researching and evaluating additional leads/prospects through web research Meet or exceed assigned quota of a minimum of 40 calls / 30 emails per day Working together with Account Executives to grow a specific sales territory Working with the Sales Director and Account Executives to support the acquisition of new accounts in the region Maintaining all contacts/opportunities and recording, and generally first class Salesforce hygiene Qualifications: 1+ years of marketing, inside sales or business development related sales experience (preferred) Consistent track record demonstrating strong articulation of a product selling points via phone and email Ability to assist in coordinating sales functions including prospecting and leads research High tech or e-commerce knowledge is highly preferred Four-year post-secondary education/Bachelor's degree (preferred) Positive demeanor and proven track record to deal with rejection Strong oral and written communication skills along with excellent listening skills Ability to develop rapport, influence others and maintain strong working relationships Demonstrated ability to explain sophisticated issues clearly Must be self-motivated, persistent, and able to work independently  Bluecore is a marketing technology company that’s reimagining how the world’s fastest growing retail brands transform casual shoppers into lifetime customers. Through our patented retail data model and the recent release of Bluecore Communicate™ and Bluecore Site™, we replace manual processes with an intelligent, AI-driven workflow. We are credited with doubling email revenue, and increasing customer retention for more than 400 brands, including Express, Tommy Hilfiger, The North Face, Teleflora, and Bass Pro Shops. We have been recognized as one of the Best Places to Work by Glassdoor and ranked No. 241 on the Inc. 500 List, the most prestigious ranking of the nation’s fastest-growing private companies.  We are proud of the culture of flexibility, inclusivity and trust that we have built around our workforce. We are a remote first organization with the option to potentially work in our New York headquarters on occasion moving forward. We love the opportunity to come together – but employees will always have the option on where they work best.  At Bluecore we believe in encouraging an inclusive environment in which employees feel encouraged to share their unique perspectives, demonstrate their strengths, and act authentically. We know that diverse teams are strong teams, and welcome those from all backgrounds and varying experiences. Bluecore is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and to building a welcoming environment for all team members. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, familial status or veteran status.  We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Join Us!  We're based in Eugene, Oregon, but are open to remote candidates in U.S. time zones who can be highly collaborative while remote.  We’re a growing company looking for people who exemplify our values: appreciate one another, succeed together, strive for balance, seek to improve, and immerse yourself in users’ needs and goals. Our work environment is flexible and personal, offering excellent work-life balance and an ever-improving benefits package, and our inclusive team is working to build an increasingly equitable workplace. We’re excited by the opportunity to have you grow with us!  Job Overview  The Sales Development Representative is responsible for promoting Concentric Sky’s Badgr platform and services, establishing customer relationships, and providing qualified, motivated leads to the sales team. As a key member of the sales team, the successful candidate will gain in-depth knowledge of the company’s solutions, competition, and have a keen interest in the badging/credentialing industry. The primary market focus is within the K12, higher education, and corporate sectors.  We are looking for an energetic, polished individual with exceptional communication skills and a talent for relationship building. The successful candidate will gain expertise in accurately capturing and qualifying leads, effectively managing a sales pipeline, and achieving quarterly revenue targets.  We're looking for candidates who are local, or who have a proven success record working remotely with highly collaborative teams.  Job Responsibilities Responsible for exceeding objectives within your assigned territory Able to understand and deliver Badgr’s unique value proposition Actively participate in outbound calling campaigns to generate sales opportunities Conduct market research and keep updated on product and industry knowledge, as well as competitors Accurately capture and qualify leads gathered from tradeshows, webinars, inbound calls, and other marketing initiatives Follow-up with existing Badgr contacts and develop them into sales prospects Distribute leads and make qualified appointments for sales directors Monitor and respond to Badgr sales inquiries – responding and redirecting incoming customer requests for information, etc. Create and update lead generation emails and phone scripts Update customer interaction records in the CRM Complete sales reports and present findings to executive management Job Requirements 3+ years demonstrated experience in eLearning, the education sector, enterprise software and/or SaaS solution providers preferred Interest in pursuing a sales career within a fast-paced environment Pro-active and goal-oriented with the ability to maintain consistent levels of customer activity to generate sales leads and meet achieve quarterly objectives Excellent written and verbal communication skills Excellent time management skills with the ability to multi-task and organize/prioritize work independently Strong interpersonal and customer orientation skills with the ability to influence decision-makers Demonstrated ability to work individually and collaboratively within a team environment Degree or diploma in Business, Marketing or related About Concentric Sky  Founded in 2005, Concentric Sky has a dedicated staff of more than 70, and we’ve delivered more than 300 custom enterprise software products, mobile applications, and websites. We have exceptional domain knowledge in education, particularly digital badging and skills-aligned workforce development. We design software for the future, looking for opportunities to apply machine learning and advanced data technologies.  In addition to working on numerous client projects at any given time, we also develop our own Badgr (info.badgr.com). The Badgr SaaS ecosystem is one of the most widely used micro-credentialing platforms in the world, trusted by over 12,000 organizations spanning 100 countries.  We’ve also worked extensively on open standards development, including as lead developer of the Open Badges 2.0 Specification on behalf of the MacArthur Foundation and as a lead contributor at W3C, IEEE, and IMS Global.  Compensation And Benefits  We’ll work with you to establish mutually agreeable compensation that reflects your skills and experience, the job market, and other factors.  We support generously flexible work schedules and great work-life balance, and we have an operations team devoted to keeping us happy and comfortable — and when in the office, well fed.  We continually improve employee benefits, currently offering paid time off including parental leave; excellent health, dental, and vision insurance; employer-paid short-term disability and life insurance; a 401k plan; and an FSA plan, including annual employer contribution.  If you want an excellent opportunity to put your skills to work, learn some new ones, and be part of a team that values you, send us your resume and portfolio. No phone calls, please.  We look forward to hearing from you.  Concentric Sky, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Candidates must be eligible to work in the United States.  Powered by JazzHR

description: About Us: TTI is a world class leader in design, manufacturing and marketing of power tools and accessories, outdoor product equipment and floor care for consumers, professional and industrial users in the home improvement, repair and construction industries. Our unrelenting strategic focus on powerful brands, innovative products, operational excellence and exceptional people drives our culture. This focus and drive provides TTI with a powerful platform for sustainable leadership and strong growth.  Our brands and products are recognized worldwide for their deep heritage, superior quality, outstanding performance and compelling innovation. Our products include professional power tools and accessories, outdoor power equipment and floor care. Brands represented include Milwaukee®, AEG®, Ryobi®, Hoover®, Dirt Devil®, Oreck ® and Vax®. TTI is fast paced, our team is high energy, and we reward out of the box thinking to foster innovation in order to be the best in our industry. We provide a multifaceted training program and hands on field experience that will stimulate, challenge and reward you!  Duties and Responsibilities: Perform best in class sales and service to consumers while demonstrating knowledge and enthusiasm for TTI products. Maximize sell through of TTI Power Tool brands by properly merchandising point of purchase material. Support and implement strategic corporate brand marketing initiatives and promotional activities. Strengthen and maintain positive relationships with customers, Team TTi Management, and The Home Depot. Maintain regular contact with assigned Home Depot store associates and management to cultivate strong relationships. Monitor weekly sales and analyze monthly results to identify additional opportunities and understand the competition. Participate in the training program and implement all acquired skills to deliver results. Initiate and provide in store product training sessions and demonstrations to educate store associates, management and customers. Professionally communicate with all peers, customers and management. Plan and execute demo events, stores walks, trade shows, etc. Develop primary knowledge of the market place (users, applications, products, competition, and channels) to effectively analyze market potential and communicate competitor market data.  Note: Employee's duties and responsibilities are not limited by the above. Other duties may be assigned as deemed necessary by employee's supervisor. In addition to the basic requirements of the position, all employees are expected to meet the company's goals of continual improvement in the areas of knowledge, skills, processes and quality.  Education and Experience Requirements Bachelor degree or equivalent work experience in retail sales, field sales or customer service required. Valid driver's license required. Relocation may be required for future promotional opportunities. Ability to work nights and weekends. Capable of lifting and transporting heavy tools (up to 50 lbs.) and requesting assistance as needed. Capable of reaching and/or lifting overhead in addition to ascending/descending ladders to move product. Capable of using hands to maneuver small objects, assemble tools and build displays. Applicant should be self motivated and a team player with strong organizational, planning and time management skills. Applicant must be MS Office proficient.

description: Make Work Better Every Day   Quantum Workplace is a fast-growing software company on a mission to make work better every day. Our tools help elevate the employee experience by transforming employee voices into conversation, understanding, and positive change.   We’re in the business of creating awesome work environments—and are committed to being one also. We are smart people who care deeply about what we do. We work hard but laugh harder. We wear casual clothes, work flexible hours, and get stuff done. You’ll love it here.   What’s the Opportunity?   Quantum Workplace is growing, and we are looking for Sales Development Representatives! The Sales Development Representative (SDR) is primarily responsible for scheduling discovery calls with HR executives at mid-market and enterprise organizations. To be successful, the SDR will identify “Mobilizers,” pitch the idea that employee success equals business success and set meetings for the Account Executive. The role requires hard work, coachability, business acumen, and attention to detail.   What does the day-to-day of this role look like (yes, this adds up to 110%, that's what we expect!)?   Prospecting [70%]  Research and build out companies, adding contacts and any relevant information inside of Hubspot for cold calling and emailing  Make 300+ cold calls and 100+ cold emails each week  Leverage LinkedIn to interact with prospects  Identify "Marketing Qualified Leads" that have engaged with Quantum Workplace  Effectively prioritize and manage accounts   Meeting Management [10%]  Set 2 discovery calls each week for Account Executives  Qualify opportunities by collecting ACT - Authority, Consideration, Timing  Support Account Executives with discovery call notes and research  Join and be an active listener in discovery calls  Create $100,000 in new pipeline each month   Learning [20%]  Take ownership in skill development, seeking out and applying feedback  Be an active participant in team huddles and monthly Boot Camps  Strengthen cold calling skills by practicing with teammates   Above and Beyond [10%]  Occasionally putting in extra work to ensure goals are met  Mentor new teammates  Identify ways to close gaps and improve processes   You’re a Great Fit if You Can:   Independently manage prospecting activities and prioritize tasks  Consistently hit activity metrics  Efficiently prospect a territory in partnership with an Account Executive  Identify “Mobilizers” and influence them to accept a meeting  Lean into and apply constructive feedback  Quickly bounce back from rejection  Handle objections and overcome obstacles  Collaborate with teammates and maintain a positive attitude   What You Have:   Previous work cold calling and creating sales opportunities  Knowledge of enterprise software sales, ideally HR software  Experience working with HubSpot, Chorus.ai, ZoomInfo, PandaDoc   Why Quantum Workplace?   Compensation: $40-$45k annual base salary + commission and bonuses Health Insurance: We offer 3 options (1 option is 100% premium paid for employees) + Telehealth  Dental & Vision: We cover 100% of premiums for employees  401k: We match 100% of contributions up to 4% and you're fully vested on Day 1  Adoption assistance  Professional Development stipend Zoo memberships  Summer hours and flexible work schedule  No dress code - wear what makes you feel confident - BE YOU!  Monthly manager-employee lunches for goal planning and development  Paid time off including holidays & your birthday  We work hard but we have fun too - ping pong breaks increase productivity

description: At this role you will launch sales on your territory (Southern New Jersey and Philadelphia). The essential goal for the Sales Representative is to achieve the sales objectives.   Reporting to the Regional Sales Manager, the Sales Representative will be responsible for the following essential duties: ·      Analyze and target clients ·      Achieve quarterly and yearly sales targets ·      Onboard new high potential Orthodontists, who use Computed tomography images for their patients and help them to grow the business ·      Create & execute plans for highest potential Orthodontists, based on a deep understanding of their goals, challenges, and opportunities ·      Collaborate with Orthodontists to close business opportunities efficiently. Drive Computed tomography and Deep CBCT implementation through upselling of the portfolio of 3D Predict bone and roots-based treatment planning  Qualifications and Experience ·      Qualified candidates are strategic persons who will prioritize and maximize business opportunities while building trust and providing a great customer experience ·      Preference to candidates with experience at top pharmaceutical companies  ·      The ideal candidate will have experience selling innovative patented products and tailoring solutions to diverse customer needs  Benefits Excellent compensation, including high commissions. We strongly believe that best sales must be compensated with high and fair commissions  Travel expense compensation  Opportunity to manage Customers as your own business and be compensated for your success in driving the organization’s growth Opportunity to be part of a rapidly growing company with future opportunities  We look forward to working with you. You will have unlimited opportunities to embrace your ambitions and realize your potential in a fast-growing company in a rapidly developing industry.  Contact Please send your CV and ask any questions, We are happy to provide you additional information: ryan.healey@3dpredict.com

Job Description  BlueOptima is NOT where you figure out if a career in sales is for you. As a Business Development Representative, you know what you’re getting into. You love the ups and downs of seeking out the right contact!  Calls, Emails, LinkedIn outreach will be the norm. You’ll bounce back with a new strategy when you don’t get a yes the first time.  A passion for technology is also a big plus! That’s how you’ll thrive as a Business Development Representative (BDR) at BlueOptima.  At BlueOptima, you’ll be immersed in the full sales-cycle - from generating that initial lead, all the way to helping close the deal with major national and international clients.  Our experienced Sales team will give you all the mentoring and support you need, and as much responsibility as you can handle!  With BlueOptima, the exposure you will receive to the cutting edge of software sales (from sales technique training to client relationship management) will put you at the forefront of a growth sector that is the future of the economy.  Additional Information  You can be a part of our next step, working with a group that will coach you, support you, provide step by step training to be successful and cheer you on to your wins!  Oh, and did we mention a generous PTO plan, lots of company outings, snacks, an amazing dog-friendly office and flexible work schedule? Also working with a global company opens up travel opportunities!  Go ahead, apply already.  BlueOptima an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to ensure all people feel supported and connected at work.  Renumeration: $40K-45.5K base + 6K bonus + uncapped commission

description: At Orascoptic, our brand sits at the intersection of consumer eyewear and medical technology. Our expertise is in stunning innovation and precision custom manufacturing of surgical loupes, coaxial headlights, and associated products. Our mission is to enable healthcare providers around the world to see more and practice longer. We deliver clinical vision. Our innovative product portfolio, direct sales teams, optical expertise, and commitment to leading disruption have created a winning company and a trusted brand. As part of Envista’s portfolio of businesses, we combine the agility of a smaller, focused business with the resources of a large enterprise. We are an ambitious, high energy team intent on creating solutions to help medical professionals improve patient lives. Headquartered in Madison, Wisconsin, our teams and partners are located around the world. For more information about Orascoptic, visit www.orascoptic.com  Job Description  Are you looking for a medical device sales position in the dental & surgical markets? We provide a cool, unique and premium product supporting those who make a living helping others, and the opportunity is endless. Put your skills to good use and be rewarded for it.  The Pitch – What’s in it for you? Uncapped commission – Earn as much commission as you’re capable of. Control over your daily schedule. Healthy opportunity for career advancement. A winning team who enjoys celebrating success together. Refine your sales/interpersonal skills. The Skill Set – You’re Sure To Succeed If You’re a multitasker – managing your schedule, balancing the sales and customer service needs of our client base & keeping in contact with your funnel comes natural to you. You work well with others, but prefer not to be micro-managed. You enjoy helping others & improving their professional experience. You’re good at sniffing out new opportunities & maintaining beneficial relationships. Responsibilities Establish contact with key management, decision makers, and influencers in dental schools, medical schools, private practitioner offices, hospitals as well as any outpatient or surgery centers where the use of magnification would be useful. Uncover and develop potential sales opportunities with dental private practices, dental schools, dental hygiene schools and government medical/dental facilities. Customer presentations may include: product specs, marketing information, promotional product information, introduction, and explanation, discussion of application specs; and include the use of company provided slides, video, computer, and/or other presentation material. Prepare formal written quotes and/or proposals to present to customers, in accordance to company policy regarding pricing, terms and level of account activity. Develop strategic plans to increase territory-ordering activity. Analytical skills (quantitative and qualitative) are required to effectively manage activity within the assigned territory. Monitor progress and prepare counter measures. Staffing national and regional tradeshows as assigned Requirements  Job Requirements: Bachelor’s degree. 3+ years of proven outside B2B sales experience Valid driver’s license with an acceptable driving record. Must live within the territory. Overnight Travel: Approximately 50% TRAVEL/LOCATION: Laptop, iPad, iPhone and company car allowance provided. Company travel/business expenses will be reimbursed. Eligible for incentive trip and other company sponsored promotional activities. Geographic Territory includes: NYC and Long Island. Candidate should be based out of NYC and Long Island. description: Competitive Compensation Packages Growth Opportunities PTO 401K with Employer Match Medical, Dental, Vision & Health Savings Account Join Life Line Screening's Remote Sales Representative Team and be a part of the future of healthcare! We offer Full Time hours, comprehensive benefits, permanent work-from-home opportunities, and a supportive, growth-oriented, environment.  We're looking for Sales Representatives who are compassionate and consultative. You will be responsible for educating our callers about the benefits of early health screenings and additional services available.  What Our Sales Representatives Need  Please read the following information carefully before applying. Those who do not meet this criterion will not be considered further The desire to work in a sales environment. Outstanding phone etiquette with a strong ability for Consultative Sales Stable job history with no job-hopping! Ability to effectively handle stress and time management. A competitive mindset to meet and exceed performance/sales goals. Satisfactory completion of a pre-employment drug screen and criminal background check. MUST have a minimum internet speed of 50 Mbps. Designated work area in your home free of noise and distraction. High school diploma or equivalent required; some college preferred. The Benefits Of Working At Life Line Screening We provide all equipment (computer, monitor, phone, etc) and 3 weeks of paid training (conducted virtually) to build your career on the strongest possible foundation. Monday-Friday or work Saturday with Friday and Sunday off Available schedules 10am-630pm or 1230pm-9pm Eastern Time Competitive hourly pay ($12-14/hr) with bonus incentive paid time off and paid holidays, medical/dental/vision insurance, 401k plan with company match, professional development, referral bonus program, courtesy preventative health screenings for you and additional family members or friends. What you’ll do as a Sales Representative with Life Line Screening:  Preventive Healthcare Advisors (Inbound Sales Representatives) take an average of 35-45 incoming calls per shift from both new and returning customers. Collect relevant health information from your callers to understand their specific health risks. Educate callers on the benefits of early health screenings, which improve length and quality of life through the prevention and early detection of chronic/major health conditions. Use a consultative sales approach to recommend medically relevant services, while converting leads and meeting sales goals. Schedule screening appointments and collect payments over the phone. **Ask our Hiring Team for more information about Retention Specialist (Outbound Sales Representative) roles if you're someone who loves a challenge!**  About LifeLine Screening  Cardiovascular disease is the leading cause of death in the US and the number of lives lost is increasing every year, which is why Life Line Screening's mission of prevention is so important!  Since 1993, Life Line Screening has helped over 10 million people identify their risk factors for diseases such as cardiovascular disease, strokes, heart attacks, and lung cancer. We are proud to give our customers the opportunity to identify health risks before they start exhibiting symptoms so they can take proactive steps towards improving their health. We do this in an affordable, easily accessible way going into the communities that need us most.  Life Line Screening is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age disability, protected veteran status, or other characteristics protected by law. Life Line Screening will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditional upon the successful completion of a background check and drug screen.  Life Line Screening is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age disability, protected veteran status, or other characteristics protected by law. Life Line Screening will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditional upon the successful completion of a background check and drug screen.  Life Line Screening is the nation's leading provider of community-based preventive health screenings. Along with a medical team of trained professionals, you will contribute to helping over 700,000 adults each year gain useful insight into their health by administering medical appropriate health screenings and tests. These services are designed to help provide people become aware of their health risk factors for chronic vascular diseases, stroke, and other diseases early so they can take proactive steps towards maintaining or improving their health through lifestyle changes or under continued care with their doctor.

description: Job Description  Sells a subset of product or services directly or via partners to small-and-medium sized accounts. The role is a combination of a Field Sales Rep and Inside Sales Rep.  Sells a subset of product or services directly or via partners to small-and-medium sized accounts. The role is a combination of a Field Sales Rep and Inside Sales Rep.  Works to achieve maximum sales profitability, growth, and account penetration within an assigned territory. Territory may be combination of geographic, product, industry and other customer / market dimensions. Sells to the territory directly or via partners. The territory that this rep covers does not have an Inside Sales Rep or Field Rep. Utilizes inbound and/or outbound techniques to identify, qualify and close new opportunities. Manages accounts throughout the entire sales process, and collaborates with team members in business development, consulting and support to uncover all customer needs. Responsible for understanding Oracle's product offerings and competitive issues to develop solution proposals encompassing all aspects of the application. Travels to customer sites to identify / develop sales opportunities. Participates in the development, presentation, and sales of a value proposition. Onsite customer presentation with C-levels to negotiate and close strategic and complex deals. Liaises with customer contacts for the purpose of managing the customer relationship, identifying new opportunities and maximizing sales.  Duties and tasks are standard with some variation. Completes own role largely independently within defined policies and procedures. Successful sales track record. Oracle knowledge and/or knowledge of Oracle's competitors. Interaction with C level players. Team player. Ability to penetrate accounts and meet with stakeholders within accounts. Excellent communication, negotiating, and closing skills. Strong marketing skills. Travels to customer as needed. 2 or more years of relevant sales experience. BA/BS degree or equivalent preferred.  If you are a Colorado resident, Please Contact us or Email us at oracle-salary-inquiries_us@oracle.com to receive compensation and benefits information for this role. Please include this Job ID: 124426 in the subject line of the email.  About Us  Innovation starts with inclusion at Oracle. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can be themselves and do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued, that we are inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. That’s why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.  Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.

Company Overview The Account Executive in Hospice serves as the customer service representative for all hospice agency referral sources, including sales calls, hospice education and information, and community in-services regarding hospice. Highpoint Hospice, a part of LHC Group, is the preferred post-acute care partner for hospitals, physicians and families nationwide. From home health and hospice care to long-term acute care and community-based services, we deliver high-quality, cost-effective care that empowers patients to manage their health at home. Hospitals and health systems around the country have partnered with LHC Group to deliver patient-centered care in the home. More hospitals, physicians and families choose LHC Group, because we are united by a single, shared purpose: It's all about helping people. Essential Functions Helps build collaborative working relationships both internally and externally. Responsible for being a good steward of the company's financial resources by projecting a return on monies spent and managing to a marketing expense budget. Responsible for executing effective sales calls that identify and meet the needs of the referral community and clearly communicate the features and benefits of the LHC Group. These include pre and post call planning, establishing rapport, effective questioning skills, proposing solutions, handling objections and closing. Successfully executes a weekly, monthly, and quarterly strategy to increase market share through key account development including prospecting/diversification and call frequency/routing. Plans activity to maximize territory coverage of both existing and prospective accounts. Participates in collaborative strategic planning and problem solving as it relates to marketing growth strategies and community education Responsible for achievement of admission goals/expectations as established at hire or at review of annual agency budget goals. Completes specific assignments timely as requested by supervisor. Attends staff meetings to give an update regarding accounts, customer needs, and progress towards agency growth strategies. Coordinate in-services with community and medical-based groups to educate them on hospice services on an as needed basis Responsible for checking e-mail daily and responding to phone messages within 24 business hours. Responsible for all sales administration duties including, but not limited to, CRM compliance, expense reports, payroll time sheets, medical director time sheets, strategic territory planner, PTO requests, paperwork (POC) delivery or pick-up when needed. Education & Experience Education Requirements High school diplomaEducation Desired Bachelor's DegreeLicense Requirements Automobile insurance coverage must be current. Valid driver's licenseSkill Requirements Ability to professionally and effectively interact with a variety of individuals. Ability to be creative and generate ideas as they relate to marketing and community education. Effective and persuasive communication skills with a positive and outgoing attitude Strong time management and organizational skills. Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Power Point, and Outlook). Must have independent means of transportation, possess a valid Driver's License and able to drive. Some understanding of home health/hospice coverage issues. Ability to maximize cost effectiveness in the use of resources. Equal Opportunity Employer – vets, disability.

description: We offer an excellent opportunity for not only a job, but a career with growth potential. At Transtar, we seek applicants who roll up their sleeves, enjoy hard work, thrive in a team environment, and who embody our core values of Safety, Honesty, Action, Relationship, and Product.  Transtar Autobody Technologies, a business unit of Transtar Industries, is a coatings manufacturing company in the automotive refinish business headquartered in Brighton, Michigan. At Transtar Autobody Technologies, we are dedicated to developing, producing, and marketing quality refinish products for the automotive aftermarket. TAT is prideful of our history of creative and innovative research, which enables us to bring products to the marketplace in a manner highly beneficial to our customers, the industry and our environment.  We have an immediate opportunity for a Territory Manager in our San Antonio, TX market and surrounding areas. This position will primarily service customers located in the metro San Antonio area, but may also include customers in the surrounding areas.  WHY TRANSTAR AUTOBODY TECHNOLOGIES?  The Territory Manager is responsible for managing a territory by selling products through our established distribution channels. As a Territory Manager, you help developing and established customers leverage our various products and programs, optimize their product, and maximize their utilization.  WHAT YOU WILL DO WITH YOUR TALENTS: Execute the TAT sales plan, work within company policies & programs, and meet annual sales performance goals expectations. Plan Pre-call sales, establish customer relationships, identify sales opportunities, present & demonstrate product /programs, and close sales. Develop annual Business Plan, submit annual territory review, monitor customer inventory levels, partner with customers to improve metrics, identify & capitalize on opportunities, and complete post-call activities & follow-up. Manage accounts – key, existing, and new, supervise distributor activities, evaluate distributor performance, and train distribution personnel. Control sales expense, manage time efficiently, develop monthly sales forecast, and address & resolve problems. Improve product knowledge, selling skills, and business acumen.  WHAT YOU WILL BRING: Three + years of outside sales experience (automotive aftermarket preferred). Excellent oral and written communication skills, as well as presentation abilities to people at all levels of management Prior PBE experience Product Knowledge & Confidence Business Acumen which includes financial literacy, market orientation, and strategic perspective Territory Planning & Management Proficient computer skills; MS Office products  EDUCATION:  Bachelor's degree (B. A.) from four-year college or university preferred; or a combination of education and experience / training. Management experience or desire/ability to lead a sales team is desired but not necessary.
industries: Automotive

description: Job Description  Work with the brightest minds, and industry-leading solutions, to help customers solve the business challenges that stand in the way of their growth and success!  Oracle is a fast-paced, collaborative environment passionate about creating customer success. We offer the most comprehensive, cloud-based technology. At Oracle, learning is constant. We develop our workforce through training, mentoring and internal mobility opportunities to help everyone succeed and achieve their aspirations.  Join us in identifying, progressing, and closing opportunities in established high profile organizations and be a part of the exciting transformation to the cloud!  Our Solutions: https://www.oracle.com/cloud/  Your Role You will be responsible for identifying, progressing and encouraging long-term strategic relationships within specialized industry verticals such as; Financial Services, Utilities, Communications, Healthcare, Oil & Gas, Logistics. You will develop a robust project pipeline and handle account planning, creating, owning and forecasting You will be the trusted advisor and influencer in winning customer decisions to buy, architect and adopt Oracle solutions. You will understand what motivates customers to buy and know how to tap into those needs in an effective way. You will work across the Oracle ecosystems and our technology partners to transform customer organizations and build enduring capabilities. What You Will Do Master and share the “why Oracle story” that represents the value we provide to customers with our unified, multi-pillar offerings. Nurture client relationships by building trust, partnership and an emotional connection to the Oracle brand and team. Build and execute key sales and business development initiatives to improve awareness of Oracle OCI and increase sales pipeline. Successfully prospect into your assigned accounts to discover, and develop viable selling opportunities. Gain access and build relationships with key executives and decision makers. Initiate and manage complex sales cycles, leveraging the support and strengths of key internal partners (Pre-Sales, Product Management, Executives and Industry Global Business Units to name a few). Travel as required. About You You have an entrepreneurial spirit, and thrive in a dynamic environment You are creative You excel in a team-selling environment You are driven You have deep experience selling SaaS, IaaS, PaaS, Database You have experience selling to the C-suite, engineering and DevOps You are familiar with open source and other cloud tools (Dockers, Kubernetes, Terraform, Linux, Java) You are solutions-oriented You are inventive You are results-oriented You have a track-record of success selling complex solutions and exceeding expectations You are committed to continuous learning You are confident You have expertise in building business value proposals What You’ll Bring  Required Skills/Experience You demonstrate sound independent judgment, initiative, collaboration and leadership You exhibit outstanding written, verbal, presentation and negotiation skills Your sales experience has a proven record of accomplishment of selling to large, complex accounts, working with C-level executives, qualifying prospects, solving problems and generating positive customer outcomes. You have 3+ years of relevant work experience with a Bachelor’s degree Sells a subset of product or services directly or via partners to a large number of named accounts/non-named accounts/geographical territory (mainly Tier 3 accounts).  Primary job duty is to sell technology software products and related services in a defined territory. Identifies, qualifies and closes new opportunities. Manages accounts including the entire sales process from business development prospecting and specifications through contract negotiations, signing, and post-sales support. Leverages the Oracle sales model to maximize revenue growth and increase local market share. Builds and expands business partner revenue and self sufficiency.  Job duties are varied and complex, needing independent judgment. May have project lead role. 5 years field sales experience including technology sales experience. Ability to forecast, manage sales expenses, and successfully close new Oracle business. Business development, prospecting and presentation skills. Excellent communication skills and problem solving ability. Proven track record of exceeding sales objective and territory/account development. Experience as the focal point for clients for all sales and related issues. Oracle knowledge and/or knowledge of Oracle's competitors. Travel may be needed. Bachelor degree or equivalent.  If you are a Colorado resident, Please Contact us or Email us at oracle-salary-inquiries_us@oracle.com to receive compensation and benefits information for this role. Please include this Job ID: 121884 in the subject line of the email.  About Us  Innovation starts with inclusion at Oracle. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can be themselves and do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued, that we are inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. That’s why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.  Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.

description: Homebound’s mission is to create a better way to build homes, leveraging technology to make homebuilding simpler and more transparent. We’re delivering on that promise in places that have been impacted by natural disasters, and now we’re expanding to help families across the country build the perfect home.  With a better labor model, a more efficient building process, and a delightful homeowner experience, Homebound is transforming the homebuilding market. The Homebound team includes software engineers, product managers, designers, marketers, people operations and legal experts, interior designers and the best construction experts in the world — all of whom have come together to improve homebuilding as a whole.  We are already helping hundreds of homeowners across California, Texas, and The Bahamas, and we are poised to help hundreds more. Join us.  Role Overview  Homebound is seeking high energy and organized Sales Development Representatives to seek and engage individuals that are in the market for new homes, through outbound prospecting methods including phone, email, LinkedIn and traditional outreach. This role will be based out of our Denver office.  Whether prospects need to rebuild their homes due to a natural disaster, are looking to custom build a new home, or have a desire to sell Homebound land, SDRs will focus their energy on effectively communicating Homebound's value props and building relationships with customers, with the ultimate goal of connecting them with our Homeowner Consultant for a meeting on-site or in Homebound's design studios. Ultimately, SDRs are responsible for boosting sales and contributing to Homebound's rapid growth. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it’s the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger.  You’ll be a key contributor in helping to build the fastest-growing, and soon to be largest, home building company in the industry!  What You'll Do Contact potential clients through phone, email and other methods. Schedule meetings for and work closely with Account Executives to ensure meeting hand-off successfully occurs. Act as the subject matter expert on homebuilding, providing prospects with peace of mind that Homebound is unlike any company in the industry. Qualify inbound leads from marketing campaigns, demo requests, emails/calls, etc. Present Homebound's value props in a clear and concise manner. Diligently update Salesforce, ensuring our CRM system stays up-to-date with correct information. Have full knowledge of target prospect base and manage an ongoing prospect pipeline. Report to sales leadership on numbers including outreach, connects, meetings scheduled, etc. What You'll Bring You have excellent verbal and written communication skills and enjoy interacting with people via phone, email and social media to articulate ideas and gain their trust, and have experience drafting clear communications that demonstrate attention to detail. You have experience as an outbound prospector, including making cold calls. You have a track record of personal accountability, and a high standard of integrity and professionalism. You've demonstrated resilience and a desire to succeed in the face of new and/or unforeseen challenges. You are a team-player with a strong desire to help enforce and improve internal processes. A desire to learn, grow and get in on the ground floor of a company that is changing how homeowners build homes. You are receptive to feedback, with the willingness to learn and embrace continuous improvement. Bachelor's Degree or relevant experience. Background in homebuilding, real estate or construction sales is a bonus! Compensation + Benefits At Homebound, we care for our teammates by supporting their physical, mental, and financial wellbeing through a comprehensive benefits program. Industry competitive pay, including equity in the company for all Homebounders. Robust health, dental and eye insurance package options for both you and your dependents. Flexible PTO policy Paid Parental Leave Base Pay: $50,000 / Annual On-Target Earnings: $75,000 (uncapped commissions) We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you’re excited about this role, but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply.  Homebound is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetics or any other basis forbidden under federal, state, or local law. Homebound considers all qualified applicants in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.  Please review our CCPA policies here.

description: We are seeking a Sales Development Associate to become an integral part of our team! You will gauge sales opportunities and provide extensive customer service to all clients.  Primary Objective Of Position  The Sales Development Associate is primarily responsible for supporting the sales team in the areas of: retailer digital item set up and catalog database management, marketplace tracking and assessment, and new product launch support. This role requires strong partnerships with cross-function departments and calls for a candidate who possesses an analytical mindset with a “stay curious” mentality.  MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS (Experience, education, certifications, general knowledge, skills and abilities)  Education: College degree in business/marketing related field. Any equivalent combination of education, experience or training will be considered.  Years of Related Experience: 1 - 2 years’ experience with a CPG or semi-durable company, ideally in eCommerce sales, and/or trade marketing.  Essential Functions (Fundamental duties necessary to achieve the objective of the position) Completion of key retailer PDP set up, from inception through post launch audit. Submission & management of all retailer asset needs (photography, videos, etc.). Completing retailer comp shops to gather/report competitive and marketplace intelligence. Development and maintenance of master retailer information file which houses all account programs, retailer assortments and pricing by item. Weekly tracking, analyzing and reporting of Travelpro and competitor promotional cadence at key retailers. Management of consumer review campaigns and retailer review syndication auditing. Maintenance of customer meeting calendars. Completion of Product Development New Product request forms. Supporting new product launch initiatives. Management of product sample shipments and distribution files (ex. line review support, sell sheet creation, training/pop material, etc.). Specific Requirements of the Position (Knowledge, skills and abilities to perform the functions) Excellent communication skills, both oral and written, with internal and external partners Strong attention to detail and a high degree of accuracy Ability to learn quickly and adapt to change Highly motivated/self-starter with a sense of ownership, a willingness to learn, and a strong desire to succeed Physical/Working Requirements  Ability to perform occasional lifting in the handling of work materials; up to 50lbs for a fully packed luggage item  Primarily works in an office environment  Mental Requirements  Ability to analyze data and provide recommendations  Requires visual skills necessary to comprehensively review physical products  Equipment Used  PC Computer  Dedication is at the heart of our success. At Travelpro®, we believe that a company is only as good as its people, and when associates are treated as the greatest asset, the worth of the company is magnified. We demonstrate this by fostering individual achievement, recognizing contributions, and rewarding excellence. With customers as our focus and people as our priority, even the sky is no limit.

description: The Position: Aesthetic Sales Representative – Inside Sales Job    Why LaserAway?     Generous compensation structure including uncapped commission.  Career growth and advancement.  Flexible schedule and work-life balance.  Cutting edge medical equipment.  Employee discounts on products and services.  Supportive and uplifting office culture.       Aesthetic Sales Representative Job Description:    A LaserAway Aesthetic Sales Representative is vital to delivering customer service and driving sales results by selling and promoting LaserAway’s hair removal and non-surgical cosmetic services. We are looking for top performers with a track record of success. The Ideal candidate is confident with high integrity coupled with a customer-centric attitude. This person will be responsible for consultations and generating enthusiasm for our non-invasive procedures.    Our expert marketing team will provide you with warm leads through their social media initiatives. This position does not require any cold calling or telemarketing. In addition to new patient sales, this role requires following up with previous potential clients/patients who have not purchased with us in the past. Our successful Aesthetic Sales Representatives are able to renew interest by promoting laser hair removal and non-surgical cosmetic services.      Aesthetic Sales Representative Job Responsibilities:     Initiate sales process by scheduling appointments with warm leads; conduct initial consultation; describe LaserAway’s treatments and skincare line professionally and with an expert knowledge base.  Close sales by building rapport with potential patient; explain product and service capabilities; overcome objections; prepare financing contracts with lenders such as Care Credit and Loan Hero.  Expand sales in existing accounts by introducing new products and services.  Create client retention by upselling additional products and services.  Recommend new products and services by evaluating current aesthetic treatment process.  Manage front desk duties such as checking patients in/out while ensuring a positive and warm experience and maintaining a clean and professional clinic.  Adhere to LaserAway policies and protocols.       Aesthetic Sales Representative Skills and Qualifications:     Education/ Experience:Previous sales experience required.  Communication Skills:Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to effectively communicate with patients, peers, and management. Ability to communicate with proper etiquette.  Reasoning Ability:Ability to multi-task, while being attentive to patients and remaining flexible to the needs of the business. Ability to work as part of a team and take initiative independent of direct supervision.  Other Skills:Enthusiastic, friendly, and energetic with a genuine desire to provide outstanding service.     About LaserAway:    LaserAway is a medical company set in beautiful retail settings that offer the latest innovations in non-surgical aesthetic dermatological treatments. We are the fastest growing company in the industry with 70+ locations in CA, NY, TX, NV, AZ, FL and IL.    From attentive sales representatives to meticulous clinicians, we are a team of professionals driven by customer satisfaction to offer the most advanced aesthetic dermatological treatments including laser hair removal, skin rejuvenation, CoolSculpting, and Botox.      Our Commitment to the Safety of Our Employees and Patients:    LaserAway is open and offering ALL treatments across ALL locations! We are busier than ever and following strict COVID-19 safety protocols to protect our staff and patients. LaserAway provides PPE, including masks and gloves, for all staff. Our enhanced safety protocols also include in-clinic social distancing, pre-shift wellness questionnaires, and temperature checks.       Aesthetic Sales Representative Compensation:    LaserAway offers a generous pay structure with additional earning potential through commissions and bonuses. Additional benefits include (but not limited to)     Healthcare benefits  Dental, Vision, and 401(k)  Paid Time Off  Generous employee discounts.    This job description is not all inclusive. In addition, LaserAway reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. LaserAway is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.       IND2
industries: Medical Practice

description: Do you enjoy working on a variety of tasks and priorities in a fast-paced environment? Are you good at navigating change? We are looking for a talented sales support associate to join our centralized team, supporting diverse, distributed sales teams spanning the US and Canada. What you’ll be doing The Sales Support Coordinator role is an integral part of our team providing transactional, operational and project support to sales and sales support teams in the US and Canada by completing tasks and assignments on their behalf that allow them to focus on selling activities. Overview Of Responsibilities Receive and process majority of work requests from the team queue and complete them following standard processes Participate in and contribute to team/project groups Complete special assignments and projects Assist local sales leaders and teams with specific onsite needs and projects and other local/onsite responsibilities as assigned Document all work activities in Salesforce.com Duties Frequently Include Standard and custom report request submitted to a variety of source data systems File consolidations, formatting, VLOOKUPS, pivot tables, formula creations and other intermediate actions within Excel Associate on-boarding, termination and transfer management Presentation creation/editing using a combination of PowerPoint, Excel and other tools Forms assistance (signature processing, fulfilling requests for W9’s, COI’s, etc, and completing basic company information) Product and account research activities Meeting management and support (on/offsite) Event/trade show support Accounts Payable processing Document and system upkeep (org charts, distribution lists, equipment assets, paid time off tracking) Local office duties, supply and materials ordering Other projects, as assigned What you bring to the table You are comfortable working within a hybrid model of work assignments that is primarily centralized-driven but has some local aspects to the role You have an aptitude to follow process and contribute to process improvements You are adaptable - flexible to changing processes and able to work well with minimal daily direction You have strong problem-solving skills Basic Qualifications Qualifications : High School Diploma or GED Required 1-2 years professional experience in a support/customer service role, or combination of higher learning education and experience Intermediate Computer Skills with the entire MS Office Suite including: Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook Preferred Qualifications Prior sales support experience, preferably within a distributed environment Detail-oriented, with strong written/verbal communication skills Ability to self-direct and drive your own initiative Solid organizational skills with proven ability to multi-task, manage and prioritize multiple high-level tasks/small projects simultaneously Ability to work cross-functionally and with a variety of personalities Knowledge in Salesforce.com Interested in joining the team? Check out our perks and benefits !

description: Sales Representative - B2B Industrial Sales - Precision Die Tooling Manufacturer - Michigan  This sales role will have direct responsibility for introducing Future Products to target customers and selling die tooling to provide solutions to improve the customer’s overall business performance. This role is a combination of account management and new business development with a specific focus on growing existing accounts and generating NEW business with new accounts.  Here’s What You Will Need to do to be successful in this role: Generate revenue that meets or exceeds a defined quota from the direct sale of Future Products products, while contributing to overall organizational goals Manage all aspects of the sales process: prospecting, qualifying, meeting, negotiating, and closing customers Tenacity to prospect, penetrate, and sell Future Products to prospective customers Develop strong and mutually valuable relationships with customers Work with the internal Future Products team to create and deliver compelling, customized solutions that address core business issues and opportunities faced by both prospective and existing customers Key Elements Required In This Role Prospecting - cultivating leads Assessing business needs of prospective customers Presenting solution options and closing business Development and growth in Key accounts assigned Daily use of CRM system for entire sales process and customer management The ability to travel up to 30% DEMONSTRATED SUCCESS DOING THE FOLLOWING Meeting or exceeding annual sales goals/quotas Consultative sales approach Proactively acquiring new customers Growing customer accounts Expanding customer relationships within accounts Experience dealing with engineering, purchasing and area supervisors Good negotiating skills Team player and collaborative style/approach Qualifications And Experience Bachelor’s degree or equivalent real-world experience in sales, business development, marketing, industrial sales and / or project management Previous experience in industrial sales or similar B2B sales environment Experience with customer management Proficiency in the following Microsoft Office products: Word, Excel, PowerPoint Proficiency in CRM systems and best practices Flexible style; perseverance; action oriented Aptitude for problem solving; ability to determine solutions for customers (consultative sales approach); customer focused Valid driver's license with clean driving record Compensation  Future Products offers a competitive compensation package that includes salary, company car, healthcare, 401K and paid time off. The company will provide all sales tools necessary for the position.

Dupure rarely has positions open for our direct sales team and we are searching for the best candidate. description: Hiring for 2 positions! Account Manager and Field Sales Representative Both can be either Full-time, Part-time, or Internship!  About Rallie, Inc. Let’s Rallie is a spontaneous mobile app that immediately sends you available things to do within 10 miles of your current location. Rallie, Inc. is rapidly growing and employees are needed in all neighborhoods. Employees can create flexible hours and will be assigned to a territory that is close to home. Rallie, Inc. is looking for teammates who are willing to put on multiple hats and do whatever it takes to create a strong brand presence in all neighborhoods. Check out Rallie’s Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, and website.  Account Manager Position Summary Account/Project Manager works under the supervision of the partners. A/P Manager oversees overall day-to-day customer/ partner service and supports to ensure the effective execution of customer and partner objectives in marketing and sales. The position encompasses administration, project tracking duties, and management of field sales representatives. Duties of an A/P Manager include composing client correspondence, maintaining contact lists, and assisting with marketing and sales. They will also work closely with users, businesses, partners (clients), and internal teams to best meet client needs. They must also pitch ideas, assist in developing strategies, and demonstrate problem-solving abilities to address client issues and business growth.  Field Sales Representative Position Summary The Field Sales Representative reports to the Account/Project Manager. As a Field Sales Representative, you will develop sales strategies and be responsible for attracting new users and businesses to the Let’s Rallie app. The field representative is responsible for new sales opportunities and closing deals. This person is responsible for tracking their time, and reporting their conversions.  Contact Information If interested, please reach out to Robbie Verna at robbie@letsrallie.com for more information!
