description: Plastic Surgery Practice - Practice Sales Patient Coordinator  • World class Houston, Texas plastic surgeon - based inside the loop near Medical Center - is seeking a sales superstar living within 20 minutes of the office for a daily patient care coordinator role with a strong sales background, for a growing medical practice. • This practice is owned by a board certified, well-respected, fellowship trained plastic surgeon, and caters to an elite, but family-focused clientele, where thousands of procedures have been executed with the most natural and impressive results, while maintaining a down-to-Earth family-focused office setting. This practice specializes in breast and body procedures, skin resurfacing, fillers and injectables such as Botox, esthetician services and more. • The winning candidate must be willing to work in a sleeves-rolled, hands-on fashion, doing "whatever it takes" to help the team grow. There must be a focus on driving sales and results, coupled with a strong desire to implement and sustain organization and efficiency throughout the practice. There is a need for the winning candidate to be comfortable and capable working with a team of tenured front and back-office employees and surgical patient care coordinators. Relationship building ability as well as a desire to perform outreach with a positive attitude and friendly demeanor is a must.  • Responsibilities: 1. Sales - sell plastic surgery procedures and aesthetic services to prospective patients through extensive phone conversations and live consultations. 3-5 days per week will be focused on selling, driving leads to sell, and other sales-related functions. Comfort with quoting and selling procedures and treatments ranging from hundreds of dollars to over 30 thousand dollars is necessary. Making 100 or more calls and emails daily can regularly be a part of this position so you must love people, phones, and computers! 2. Additional Responsibilities - • Organization – Task orientation, timely completion of assignments, and an innate desire to “get things done” is a must. Knowledge of medical software like Patient NOW or NexTech is preferred but not required. • Positivity – we love patient care and seek a bubbly, positive, sunny outlook from our winning candidate. We have a zero-tolerance approach to drama and team members must work together positively and build one another up. • Whatever it takes attitude with a sales focus – Typical hours 9am-6pm M-F, but at times more or less is needed. The winning candidate will have significant income upside - with no cap or limit - if results are achieved but must be willing to learn new concepts and unlearn intuitive ideas that do not match with the practice's structure. This is a great role for an achiever looking to grow and accomplish vs. seeking purely stability and a place to come daily. The selected candidate will report directly to the physician owner and practice manager as well as have oversight and training from an industry leading medical practice consulting group which has overseen some of the most selected doctors in the nation.  Job Requirements: o Bachelor’s degree preferred o 2-5+ years of sales experience – preferably in cosmetic medical, plastic surgery, direct sales, Vector Marketing, med spa field or similar - ideal candidate will be able to demonstrate prior results in a sales and service capacity - real data showing achievement is key vs. simply tenure in a particular job. This position is not an administration position with sales work. It is a sales position with administrative work. Are you no-drama, task-oriented, self-competitive, and motivated to achieve personally and for your team? Then this may be a great position for you. o Must be confident and comfortable presenting prices ranging from 5 to over 25 thousand dollars and asking for the order and closing the sale on the spot. A belief in and understanding of how to sell luxury items is a must. o Outstanding communication and presentation skills o Belief in the power of cosmetic surgery to change the lives of appropriate candidates for the better o Type accurately at no less than 40 wpm - 55wpm a must. Strong computer skills with the ability to learn proprietary software for the medical industry quickly. Nextech skills are a plus. o Excellent follow-up and organizational skills – an addiction to timely task completion without compromising quality is a must. o Professionalism in dress and presentation, honesty, excellent work ethic, and positive attitude a must. o Willingness to utilize existing skills and talent, while simultaneously learning and executing the company’s proven system  Pay Structure, Perks, and Benefits: • Annual pay based on results for year one is composed of a base pay and bonuses. Typical base is around $40,000-$49,000/year with average bonuses of $20,000 to $50,000+ in year one. Income can grow significantly over time based on results and top executive sales patient care coordinators regularly can earn six figures over time. • Paid Vacation • Medical benefits provided after probation period per company policy • Positive work environment working directly, daily, with the doctor. Trust is placed to work independently several days per week. Reasonable hours. • Opportunity to grow by working with a successful practice, but also with a larger practice training organization committed to the success and personal growth of every employee  PLEASE INCLUDE A BRIEF COVER LETTER AND CURRENT RESUME AND PERIODICALLY CHECK YOUR “JUNK” FOLDER FOR CORRESPONDENCE FROM OUR OFFICES SHOULD YOU NOT RECEIVE A REPLY. WE APPRECIATE YOUR TIME AND CONSIDERATION.

👋 It’s great to meet you. Thanks for taking the time to read about our latest job opening. Read on to find out more about Blocknative, get some insights into the role we are hiring for, and learn about our process.  Blocknative is the leading provider of mempool data. We count many of the top DeFi and NFT projects as customers and we power many top trading operations. Our diverse product portfolio includes Mempool Explorer , Onboard.js , Notify.js , Gas Platform , Simulation Platform , and our API and SDK .  To learn more about Blocknative, please visit our About or Career pages.  Overview  At Blocknative, you will be working with some of top blockchain projects to help them manage the mempool. We are excited to have you join our global, remote team to help scale foundational blockchain infrastructure.  Responsibilities: Develop account plans and strategies to drive revenue growth within new accounts. Conduct periodic business review meetings with stakeholders to ensure ongoing alignment with our clients’ business objectives. Contribute to the design and implementation of new strategies to generate revenue from current clients. Facilitate delivery of feedback and any new product requirements back to the Product and Engineering teams. Contribute to GTM team projects that will further shape and refine our sales and relationship management process. Develop a deep understanding of our product and industry to help our customers succeed.  Preferred* Experience: You are able to form and foster deep client relationships You have a deep understanding of traditional financial services, products and strategies as required to provide thought leadership and strategic support to your clients and the goals they have to implement their own strategies You know how to tell a good story in both conversation and writing - i.e. you have excellent narrative skills, a refined vocabulary, a compelling voice, and an engaging personality You have "executive presence," i.e. confidence and composure interfacing with financial investors and C-level executives You have deep technical knowledge or are able to quickly gain knowledge on Blockchain primitives. You have a keen ability to adapt and learn quickly as business strategies evolve and new products are introduced. You self-describe as some combination of the following: creative, humble, ambitious, detail-oriented, hardworking, trustworthy, eager to learn, methodical, action-oriented, and tenacious You have experience using a modern CRM (ex. Hubspot, Salesforce, etc..) You’re willing to travel for business (as COV-19 allows) We prioritize people above all else. If you think you’d add to the depth and diversity of our team but don’t fit these qualifications exactly, we want you to apply!  We hope you apply!  We are also open to exploring contract opportunities as we get to know each other.  We’re a bunch of data nerds 🤓  Our CTO started his career at NASA’s Jet Propulsion Lab building real-time data streaming software  We’ve published several reports that have been well received in the space:  Evidence of Mempool Manipulation on Black Thursday: Hammerbots, Mempool Compression, and Spontaneous Stuck Transactions  Ethereum Gas Prices: How the Mempool acts as a Competitive Market for Settlement  Understanding Ethereum Transaction Simulation — And Why It Matters  Blocknative’s infrastructure records thousands of mempool events every second  We’re backed by leading VCs  Given our early stage, we strive to have you meet as much of the team as possible before extending an offer. Here’s what you can expect:  Application review  Schedule a call with the recruitment team  Schedule a call with the our CEO (Growth) or CTO (product/technical)  Schedule a group interview with the growth or Product Technical team  Reference calls/security checks  📝 Offer
industries: Computer Software

description: Job Description Supreme Golf is seeking a qualified sales development representative (SDR) to find, screen and close golf course customers who can benefit from our SaaS technology and consulting services. As the first line of communication with prospects, ideal SDRs have a strong understanding of the sales process, starting new relationships, and closing sales. You should be a quick learner with strong communication skills and have the ability to build a book of business. Successful SDRs have great career path opportunities at Supreme Golf. Knowledge of the golf industry is a plus, but not required.  Objectives of this Role Generate leads and build relationships by finding new prospects and nurturing leads Utilize HubSpot, cold calling, email & LinkedIn to generate new sales opportunities Manage and maintain a pipeline of prospects Identify best practices to refine the company’s lead generation playbook Identify prospect's needs and suggest appropriate products/services Build long-term trusting relationships with prospects to qualify leads as sales opportunities Set up meetings or calls between prospective customers to close sales Report to sales manager with weekly, monthly, and quarterly results  Required Skills and Qualifications Prior experience as a sales development rep with a track record of achieving sales quotas Previous success cold calling prospects 2-3 years of sales experience, with a history of exceeding lead targets Strong communication skills via phone and email Proven creative problem-solving approach and strong analytical skills Strong desire and ability to move up within a sales organization  Preferred Qualifications ·     Proficiency with HubSpot or other CRM software  Opportunity Career advancement with a fast-growing golf technology firm Work in our office in Dallas, TX preferred but not required To join a fun and exciting organization  About Supreme Golf Supreme Golf, in association with CBS Sports Digital, offers the world’s largest inventory of golf tee times, providing golfers the ability to search and book over 16 million tee times at more than 12,000 golf courses in 41 countries. Supreme Golf owned booking sites include SupremeGolf.com and GolfBook.com, which are also available on iOS and Android. Partner sites include PGA Tee Times for The PGA of America, Barstool Sports, Golf Digest and CBSSports.  Supreme Golf works closely with golf course owners and operators to provide technology, marketing and business solutions to help manage their facilities. Leading management companies such as Century Golf Partners, Arnold Palmer Golf Management, American Golf Corporation and Hampton Golf, and golf courses such as the world-famous PGA West, The Citrus Club, Walt Disney World Golf and PGA Member owned Trophy Club of Apalachee are just a few of the courses who leverage Supreme Golf’s software and business solutions.  Our business solution's team is made up of the brightest, and most knowledgeable minds in golf who are experts in advanced revenue and cost management. Previously only available to large golf course management companies, Supreme Golf offers public memberships, tee time distribution and other business solutions to all golf course owners.

We're looking for someone with the right energy and passion to join our team as a New Home Sales Assistant. GreenTech Homes offers an industry leading sales training program where we focus on sales skills, product and process training. The ideal candidate will have a passion for sales and a strong desire to be the best! The ideal candidate will also have a high level of energy as well as a willingness and dedication to continuously learn and grow.

jobTitle: IMMEDIATE HIRE: Entry Level Sales & Marketing
description: OVERVIEW: We are hiring extroverted professionals to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for portraying our firm and our clients to the public with professionalism and positivity. Your goal is to connect with customers in the local market and ignite interest in the promotional packages our clients offer.  HOW YOU’LL CONTRIBUTE:  Increase brand awareness through direct sales Persistently pursue opportunities to promote products Creatively adjust product presentations to customer needs Build rapport with potential new customers Track and report sales daily Participate in training sessions Offer feedback and suggestions based on the successes and failures of particular approaches  WHY YOU’LL MAKE AN IMPACT:  You’re hungry to grow in your career You have outstanding communication skills You love being part of a team You’re a goal setter with ambitious dreams You have an entrepreneurial spirit You’re proactive about finding answers You’re tenacious and resilient You have a positive and professional attitude  As a part of our firm, you’ll enjoy unlimited career growth and earning potential. You will have networking opportunities at your fingertips and you’ll enjoy ample bonuses that recognize your performance. Apply today.            Candidates with the following experience are encouraged to apply today: General Labor, Construction, Home Improvement, Labor, Labor and Development Operations, Field Construction, Telecom Construction, Construction Management or Construction Experience

description: Zearn is the nonprofit educational organization behind Zearn Math, the top-rated math learning platform used by 1-in-4 elementary students nationwide. Zearn Math supports teachers with research-backed curriculum and digital lessons proven to double the learning gains of a typical year of instruction. Zearn Math instructional materials - including 400+ hours of digital math learning - are free for teachers and families. Zearn also offers school- and district-wide licenses and professional development to support implementation. Everything Zearn does is driven by the belief that every kid can be a math kid.  As a Zearn Inside Sales Associate, you’ll play a critical role in guiding schools and districts who are interested in Zearn through the decision making process. In this role, you will focus on communicating with potential customers, answering questions or providing additional resources, and being the key Zearn contact for a school or district administrator.  What You’ll Do Lead all purchase-related communication with a school or district administrator who is considering Zearn Math, acting as their main point of contact at Zearn Guide potential customers through the purchase process by responding to questions, creating quotes and purchase agreements, and problem-solving purchasing hurdles Follow up with customers as they advance through the sales process, customizing emails as necessary Track sales-related information in Zearn’s CRM, Salesforce, to ensure customers move efficiently through the sales process and nothing falls through the cracks Coordinate with other teams including Support, Finance, Legal and other members of the Partnerships team to ensure a smooth handoff Manage the customer renewal process by emailing renewal customers, creating quotes and purchase agreements, tracking progress, and sending personalized follow-ups, with the goal of a high customer renewal rate Who You Are B.A. degree with minimum of 2 years of experience Previous experience in Education, SaaS, or Sales a plus Ability to manage a high volume of emails and tasks, with strong prioritization and organizational skills Excellent written communication skills to engage and follow-up with customers Exceptional attention to detail and follow-through Experience with Salesforce or other CRM systems is a plus Work experience in customer support, sales or sales operations at a top-tier business-to-business company, ideally in education or technology, is a plus Commitment to Zearn’s mission of ensuring that all students learn and love math Desire to join an entrepreneurial, fast-paced environment at a high-growth organization
industries: Education Management

description: About Wheel  Wheel is powering virtual care. We are a healthcare technology company bringing together both the tech infrastructure and clinicians to power many of the industry’s leading telehealth services. By enabling more companies and clinicians to participate in virtual care, Wheel is helping to connect patients to the best care for their health needs.  We’re a remote-first company with a hub in Austin, Texas, and we are proud to have been recently named one of Built In Austin’s Best Places to Work and Best Small Company to Work For. Wheel is backed by top investors; Lightspeed Venture Partners, CRV, Tusk Ventures, and Silverton Partners. We’re looking for new Wheelies who share a passion for making a positive difference in healthcare and feel connected to our core values.  Learn More About What We Are Building In Forbes.  Our Values: We believe we can help build a future for everyone by ensuring how we work is aligned with our core values of:  Further, together.  Empathy, every day.  Be trusted.  Grit to grow.  High Velocity.  To learn more about how we work, check out our careers page .  Position Summary  We are seeking an insightful, strategic, and creative sales enablement professional that is passionate about helping others succeed.  Responsibilities Responsible for owning the strategy, design, and implementation of our Sales Enablement function Responsible for training, instruction and continuous education across the Commercial organization. Your ability to measure and action on data will be an essential aspect of the role. Own the process of evolving our training and onboarding system to keep up with the growing needs of the team as we scale. Leverage your strong operational management skills to establish an appropriate cadence for critical meetings across the commercial team. Lead the planning of all-commercial All Hands, stand up structure, and more. Partner with Product, Operations, Legal, Marketing, and Clinical teams to ensure accuracy and consistency of client facing materials. Partner with Management and top performing Account Executives to uncover business needs, design solutions, launch, iterate, and measure the impact of those materials. Qualifications 5+ years sales enablement experience, preferably in SaaS Ability to represent complex concepts into a curriculum that sales professionals can absorb and apply Highly proficient at building trust with senior level sales managers Excellent written and verbal communication skills Experience using Sales Enablement tools to build agile learning programs. Highly organized and proactive A collaborative working style, with experience working across the company with teams of varied size to achieve common goals Strong project management and operational management skills Possesses strong background and understanding of the sales process and various sales methodologies Background in Healthcare is preferred, but not required Wheel continues to maintain its commitment to creating an inclusive and equitable work environment, and believes pay transparency is an important component. We are reviewing our internal policies and practices to ensure this is enabled for all employees, regardless of where they are located. In the meantime, this role can be performed remotely, with the exception of Colorado on a temporary basis. Colorado-based candidates will resume consideration in Q1 2022.  Equal Employment Opportunity Statement - At Wheel, we know we will go further together by celebrating diversity and that starts by honoring each of our unique lived experiences. We look for a diverse pool of applicants including those from historically marginalized groups: women, people with disabilities, people of color, formerly incarcerated people, people who are lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and/or gender non-conforming, first and second-generation immigrants, veterans and people from different socioeconomic backgrounds. We are committed to ensuring a safe work environment where employees are not discriminated against based on age, race, ancestry, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, national origin, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer that believes in health, equity, equality, and prosperity for all so we can succeed in changing the way healthcare works.
industries: Hospital & Health Care

description: Arizona Propane is a locally owned and operated propane company (48 years) servicing greater Phoenix area including: Tucson, Casa Grande.  We are seeking an experienced Sales Representative.  Sales Representative will be primarily responsible for growing the customer base, customer satisfaction, as well as pro-active problem solving.  Employee Benefits  Health, Vision, Dental and Life Insurance  401 K  Vacation pay  Company Vehicle  Account Sales Manager  This is a high energy/high profile area that is looking to increase our sales for residential and commercial customers: Residential,  commercial, forklift gas, exchange cylinders, patio heater exchange cylinders, etc.  Candidate must have all sales skills necessary to close, and retain customers, and establish strong relationships with prospective customers through the use of various prospecting and business development techniques.  Key Responsibilities  Develop a Growth Action Plan for assigned territory.  Travel throughout assigned territory to call on prospective customers to solicit business.  Exercises a leadership role that supports and champions customer service as a TOP PRIORITY.  Train customers on the safe handling and dispensing of propane by becoming an "expert" on product knowledge and solutions.  Develop an Account Retention Plan that builds customer loyalty and protects customer base from competitive threats by conducting periodic visits with key accounts.  Secure necessary permits from city building department and fire marshal ordinance for propane tank installations.
industries: Construction, Oil & Energy, and Consumer Services

description: Job Description: We are for sales reps, professional and motivated individuals looking for a great place to find a real opportunity. As a new team member, you will start out handling our current client lead database through follow up calls, emails and will also be calling out on targeted data lists with some warm lead calling. Previous experience in business loans or commercial lending is a plus. SBA, Equipment Leasing, mortgages, home loans, MCA or Merchant Cash Advance very helpful.  Position is base + commission.  Health benefits after 90 days.  This company handles small business consulting nationwide so 100% of work is phone based. The ideal person for this accounts manager is someone who is mature, can work independently and is looking for professional growth opportunities.  This commercial loans account manager duties include but are not limited to:  Inbound ,and outbound calls  Current client follow up  Closing new accounts  Maintaining relationships  Required Qualifications  Phone Sales/CRM  2+ years B2B sales experience, preferably in a fast-paced environment.  Excellent written and oral communication.  Basic computational skills including; typing proficiency, MS Office Suite, Adobe Acrobat, ability to manage multiple browser tabs at a given time, navigating Windows 10.  Prior utilization and understanding of CRM systems.  Ability to multi-task and manage a pipeline at various stages of sales process and development.  Ability to meet required performance metrics and manage time effectively with little to no supervision.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Financial Services, and Real Estate

Position Overview   We are looking for a passionate certified Inside Sales Growth Manager  to join  our growing team!  The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions.  The perfect candidate will live and breathe sales, with a passion in upselling current clients for social media services.  The Inside Sales Growth Manager will communicate with clients regularly and discuss their needs surrounding brands and competitors, to better understand the services that may be of best assistance to them. They will optimize relationships, suggest improvements, and support with client requests. If  you are a self-drive individual who is passionate about social media and sales, we want to talk to you!   100% fully remote opportunity! Work from anywhere in the world in the US or Canada.  Inside Sales Growth Manager responsibilities include:   Communicate with clients and help them to better understand ways to optimize their impact in the social media space Upselling clients on current services to further develop sustainable, bi-lateral business partnerships Optimizing services on an ongoing basis to support client social listening needs Respond quickly and nimbly to client requests  and be ever involved in the nature of the brand and its client relationships Work with management to prioritize business and information needs Locate and define new process improvement opportunities  Requirements   Proven working experience in business development and/or sales  (5 years)  Must have Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, and LinkedIn accounts; be a regular user on them; and be knowledgeable of other social media and data sites to include Snapchat, Tik Tok, Google Analytics, etc.  Technical expertise  regarding social media management, listening, and analytics tools  Strong  analytical skills  with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy Strong usage of Microsoft Suite and comfortable in a virtual office environment.  Strong time management skills with the ability to plan, prioritize, monitor, and respond to changes quickly Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint proficiency needed.  Background in business development and sales EMEA location or willingness to work according to US/Canadian time zones  ICUC embraces and celebrates diversity and inclusivity. We are committed to creating a safe and respectful work environment and building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We are a worldwide media agency network that represents global clients. The more inclusive and collaborative we are, the more great work we can create together.   ICUC encourages all qualified candidates to apply and has an exceptional record of accommodating the needs of our staff. If you require accommodation at any stage of the application process, please let us know. ICUC thanks all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted
industries: Marketing and Advertising

description: Project Sales Representative (Dallas - Fort Worth, TX)  Growth-Minded, Established Rigging Contractor In the last 10 years, ProLift Rigging has become one of the nation’s leading rigging, crane, and transportation contractor serving fast growing US markets. Our local branch sales and operations teams collaborate to develop engineered rigging, crane, and transport solutions based on our customers operational pains. ProLift has deep roots in rigging, and brings fresh, innovative solutions to an established marketplace.  We are Driven by these Core Values Safety – Evaluate risk, plan to mitigate it to protect our customers, our team, the public and property. Superintend – Take seriously the opportunity to wisely invest our time, talent, and capital for the benefit of others. Diligence – Remember that any meaningful goal is achieved through diligent persistence and staying engaged. Do whatever it takes to achieve our mission within the constraints of our values. Teamwork – We are a team that needs each members’ contribution to achieve our mission.  Does the Following Describe You? Value-seller Sales Hunter Always prospecting Coachable Top performer who excels under pressure  Enjoys accountability  Who We Want As we continue to grow our market and customer footprint in DFW, TX, we are seeking a local Project Sales Representative who believes they are a true Sales Hunter. They are self-motivated and take pride in exceeding their prospecting and closed sales goals. Our ideal Project Sales Representative can strategically prospect into new and existing top accounts within our ProLift Rigging major markets. They welcome the challenge of working our sales process to discover and solve their top account’s operational pains related to rigging, crane, and transportation scopes of work to build ProLift/Top Account lasting relationships.   What You’ll Do As a Project Sales Representative, you will be responsible for uncovering and qualifying new prospects in our DFW, TX region. You will work with our team to learn and execute our sales process to solve our customer’s pain(s) relating to our core scopes of work. As a valued member of our branch team, you will collaborate internally with our sales, operations, and engineering departments to close quality work, continuously improving and growing our local DFW, TX branch. You will maintain a high level of personal accountability by keeping our CRM system updated and actively participating in our branch weekly sales meeting.   Qualifications  Required: 5+ years of successful outside B2B sales experience Excellent hunting/prospecting skills  Preferred: Experience in the crane & rigging industry Strong CRM skills Consultative approach to building relationships and achieving sales goals  What We Will Include ProLift Rigging will set you up for success through a targeted onboarding process. For the right individual, it will be an amazing fit and opportunity. We offer a competitive base salary plus a performance-based bonus, retirement and health care benefits, PTO, and recurrent training.  How to apply Please click “Apply” & send a copy of your resume with a brief cover letter or email explaining who you are and why you believe you are the best choice for this position.

AppOmni is looking for a talented Sales & Marketing Operations hire to join our rapidly growing team.  The opportunity:  As the first Sales & Marketing Operations hire at AppOmni, you'll help build and shape the entire revenue ops function. You'll work closely with the sales, marketing, financial, and product teams to support go-to-market (GTM) initiatives. You will be responsible for optimizing the GTM process and the sales enablement experience by driving tool enhancements, improving cross-functional team workflows, and enabling internal stakeholders to maximize the effectiveness of their available tools. You will also be responsible for managing marketing automation solutions and tracking pipeline performance.  Successful candidates will have experience supporting sales and marketing operations at a high-growth technology company. Title and compensation for this role will be determined based on the candidate.  You have: 3+ years experience with Salesforce as an Administrator, Reporting Analyst, or Power User. Domain knowledge of sales methodologies, tools, and operational best practices. Strong communication and interpersonal skills to support cross-team collaboration. Self-motivation and the ability to work both independently and with cross-functional teams. A level of comfort working in a fast-paced startup environment. Experience with marketing automation software such as: HubSpot, ZoomInfo, 6sense, Sendoso and future martech stack additions. Working knowledge of the latest digital marketing and sales enablement strategies to connect the dots throughout the contact lifecycle.  In the role, you'll: Serve as a champion for process improvement and scalability by managing the various systems and tools aligned to the GTM organization, including Salesforce, HubSpot, ZoomInfo, and other SaaS tools. Partner with the sales and product teams to advise and execute on technical components of GTM initiatives. Support data-driven decision-making, and help teams prepare for board meetings with Reports and Dashboards. Communicate effectively across functions with status updates to relevant stakeholders. Enable AppOmni stakeholders with training and collateral to ensure team members know how to leverage the tools available to them in their roles.  We have: One of the fastest-growing security startups with triple-digit growth and incredibly high customer retention, and A flexible, supportive, remote-first culture, with A team of talented individuals who love answering questions, guided by A high bar for quality and commitment to self-improvement and personal growth, and An open mind for new ideas and methodologies, offering Competitive salary and benefit options, as well as Opportunities and support for massive career growth  Location  This position can be fully remote or located in either of our two engineering offices: San Francisco Bay Area Carbondale, CO  Note that due to COVID-19, this role will start fully remote regardless of location.  Culture  We believe in cultivating excellence - within ourselves, and in the work that we do. Our team of customer-centric, data-driven experts are brought together by a shared passion to create tools for the greater good. We are determined to make a difference, to positively impact our way of life by securing the technology that is changing the world.  We believe in being a trusted and transparent partner to our customers, and we are fervent about providing them with high-quality, usable, and dependable software focused on the human experience, built out of a collaborative culture and a deep understanding of customer needs and goals.  We value passion, courage, and kindness. We also know that outstanding talent isn't found in one location. Our team - veterans of cloud software, security startups, international travel brands, and some of the biggest giants in technology - spans from the mountains of Colorado to the skylines of San Francisco and New York City.  We value our people, and know that wellness and a healthy work/life balance enables them to thrive and bring us their best.  About AppOmni  AppOmni is a leading provider of SaaS Security Management software. The company was founded by a team of security veterans from top SaaS providers and cybersecurity vendors, and its customer base includes global leaders across technology, healthcare, banking, and finance as well as many of the most well-known cybersecurity providers.  AppOmni's patented technology scans APIs, security controls, and configuration settings to compare the current state of enterprise SaaS deployments against best practices and business intent. The solution offers fast deployment, instant visibility, and makes it easy for security and IT teams to secure their entire SaaS environment from each vendor to every end user. As SaaS applications evolve, AppOmni stays current with all updates and releases to keep customer environments secure over time.  https://appomni.com/about/
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Remote-based position; MUST reside in the ATL area*  ClearScale is a leading cloud systems integration company and AWS Premier Consulting Partner providing a wide range of cloud services including cloud consulting, architecture design, migration, automation, application development, data & analytics and managed services. We help Fortune 500 enterprises, mid-size businesses, and startups across various verticals and market segments succeed with ambitious, challenging, and unique cloud transformation projects. We architect, develop, and launch innovative solutions using cutting-edge cloud technologies. ClearScale is growing rapidly and there is a high demand for the services we provide; e.g. Migrations, Data & Analytics, Containerization, Serverless Infrastructure, Microservices, IoT, Machine Learning, DevOps and more.  ClearScale is looking for a high energy and dynamic Sales Development Representative to identify and generate sales opportunities through both inbound and outbound activities. The right candidate will be one who works well under pressure, thinks out-of-the-box, easily initiates relaxed but informative two-way phone conversations with prospects, and is highly self-motivated. The right candidate will also understand how to assess a company’s needs and cater the outreach to each prospect specifically. This position requires heavy outbound phone calling, qualification, consultative selling skills and tight collaboration with the Account Executives to generate new opportunities. The SDR will be expected to report on qualification and call activity and stay thoroughly informed on all ClearScale offerings and the Public Cloud industry in general. This is not a silo position. We want a collaborative and energetic individual that can contribute to the sales and marketing teams, work in a dynamic environment, deliver messaging and solution feedback back into the marketing and product organization and work proactively to drive overall sales performance.  Requirements: 0-4+ years experience (will consider a new grad or someone with applicable experience) Proven business development success through effective use of core sales tools like Salesforce, Zoominfo, LinkedIn, Outreach, etc Demonstrated ability to collaborate with a distributed sales team Capability of understanding customer pain points, requirements and correlating potential business to value that can be provided by ClearScale Strong and professional communication skills -- written, verbal, presentation Aptitude to manage numerous requests and time demands concurrently, while achieving production goals from assigned territory or set of accounts Promotes a strong sense of urgency for reaching goals and key deliverables. Acts without being told what to do. Brings new ideas to the company. Contributes fully to the team effort and plays an integral part in the smooth running of teams without necessarily taking the lead Drive, Grit, Team Oriented: strong desire to compete and win BA/BS degree or relevant experience  What’s in it for you? Competitive Salary; Benefits Paid Time Off Opportunity to build a sales career in the fast growing Cloud industry with an industry leader Annual compensation re-evaluation Collaborative, high-energy culture Flexible work arrangements Learning opportunities Powered by JazzHR  fnxLM5gE4G
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: About Kin Euphorics:  Kin believes in a night where social isn't sinful and self-care doesn't stop at sunset. It didn't exist at the bar, so we turned to ancient remedy and modern alchemy to create Euphorics: a non-alcoholic adult beverage made from nourishing nootropics, balancing adaptogens, and replenishing botanicals that open the mind, calm the body, and connect the spirit. The ingredients in our products help balance the body's response to stress and refill our pleasure tanks for a blissful night ahead. As we move from a mode of depletion (feeling less) to a mode of rising (feeling more), we can connect with others well into the night.  What we stand for:  True to our name, we're a team of people who started as strangers and wound up a family. We genuinely like working with each other and it helps that the work is rooted in a mission that is felt every day. The atmosphere we create and cultivate is collaborative and encouraging, even in the remote workplace. We're a multicultural team and we embrace diversity. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, sexual orientation, gender expression, or ability.  The role:  Kin Euphorics is seeking a Field Sales Specialist candidate who possesses the rare blend of marketing and story-telling expertise, yet is highly analytical and sales driven. This person will be a local expert in curating relationships, trade advocacy, brand building activations, and supporting our distributor partners. This position is a hybrid of sales, field marketing and distributor management, designed to establish Kin as the industry leader, while elevating Kin's presence throughout the market. Kin's Field Sales Specialist is our face of the brand throughout the territory. At the helm of sharing our passion, energy and expertise to all. A crucial part of how Kin shows up for our guests.  What you'll do: Develop relationships with key On & Off Premise partners, industry influencers and Distributor sales teams, while leveraging existing relationships. Drive new business in the On & Off Premise channels by focusing on increasing Points of Distribution, gaining menu placements, leading staff trainings and supporting our distributor sales teams. Design and implement market-specific distributor business plans and account programming. Lead ongoing communication with distribution partners and invest quality time building relationships with, and selling alongside their ASM and Sales reps. Drive sales with category specific trade programming, brand education and activations. Build a strategic account universe of essential On & Off Premise accounts gaining new distribution, menu placements while increasing visibility and overall footprint. Be the Market expert identifying leading opportunities to excel brand awareness, build brand loyalty & create new users. Plan, organize, manage logistics and execute on event opportunities with excellence. Effectively and accurately manage your defined budget, including sampling, event and account support spends. Provide Market reporting including weekly pre-plans, monthly sales recaps, wins, trainings and trade marketing events.  What you'll bring to Kin: 2-3 years of experience in relationship management and account development. A love of engaging with people in a sales and marketing environment. Ability to authentically share Kin's story while effectively communicating category education. Hospitality focused to ensure our accounts and partners always have the best possible Kin experience. Strong organization skills, Excel knowledge and extreme attention to detail.  You are: A self-starter who can identify opportunities quickly and act on them immediately. Down to work in a demanding, deadline-driven start-up environment, outside typical 9-5pm working hours. Looking to be part of a mission-driven company, fueling the next social movement. Excited to bring new ideas to a highly collaborative environment. A multitasker with the ability to juggle several projects at once. Seasoned in taking feedback gracefully and translating it into smart improvements and solutions. Interested to explore the world of Euphorics and sober curious living.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Online Media, and Internet

description: Now, more than ever, the Toast team is committed to our customers. We’re taking steps to help restaurants navigate these unprecedented times with technology, resources, and community. Our focus is on building the restaurant platform that helps restaurants adapt, take control, and get back to what they do best: building the businesses they love. And because our technology is purpose-built for restaurants, by restaurant people, restaurants can trust that we’ll deliver on their needs for today while investing in experiences that will power their restaurant of the future.  As a Sales Associate (SA), you will help expand our customer base by connecting with prospective customers, understanding their unique needs, and identifying the best way to position Toast. You’ll have the opportunity to master your sales skills in an environment that fosters continuous learning and growth. With uncapped earnings and a clear, results-oriented career path, we are invested in promoting from within.  About this roll*: Handle inbound marketing leads and set up product demonstrations for field and inside sales representatives Collaborate with the field and inside sales teams as well as the marketing team to develop creative outreach strategies Invest in the future of your career through our extensive sales training program and on the spot coaching Do you have the right ingredients*? Excellent written and verbal communication skills Passion for sales and a desire to work in a results-driven environment High customer empathy and ability to handle objections Attention to detail and strong organization skills to be able to keep track of many opportunities at one time Special Sauce* Previous sales experience is great, but not required Bread puns encouraged but not required As part of our commitment to the health and safety of our employees and their families, all individuals entering our US workspaces are required to provide proof of full vaccination against COVID-19 unless they have an approved medical or religious accommodation.

description: Launched in 2000, Eight Eleven Group committed to 100% organic growth, exclusively promoting from within, while always keeping culture and growth opportunity at the forefront of the business model. What began as a two-person Indianapolis startup, Eight Eleven Group has rapidly expanded to become a market-leading organization within one of the fastest growing industries today: Consulting and Professional Services.  As Eight Eleven Group’s flagship brand, Brooksource was established to provide human capital solutions to the Information Technology industry. Our team takes a relationship-based, solution-driven approach with Fortune 500 clients to help them solve their technology challenges. We are not just in the business of consulting services - we are in the business of making a meaningful and authentic impact both internally with our employees and externally with our clients and consultants.  RESPONSIBILITIES Associate Account Executives are enrolled in a comprehensive outside B2B Sales Training Program focused on learning how to take a relationship-driven, client-focused approach to selling consulting and professional services. Once you complete training, 80% of your time will be spent in front of customer decision makers to build partnerships, pipeline opportunities, and secure win-win engagements with our clients. We use a solution-based selling approach, which includes a Relationship Lifecycle methodology, a structured sales playbook and strategy, and quantitative activity-based goals. Here are the primary drivers for success: Strategically identify opportunities and pursuits in 3-5 designated target accounts Build and sustain long-lasting relationships with new and existing clients within your assigned accounts through onsite client meetings, presentations, and outings such as ball games, dinners, golf, etc. Consult with clients to create solutions that help drive change and successful projects within their organization that deliver positive outcomes Act as a client advocate with a focus on improving the experience of our targeted accounts Present to C-suite executives and champion solutions for their project roadmaps Continue to meet and exceed target sales goals Set personal and team goals through frequent sprint sessions with your manager and sales support team  TRAINING Multi-stage sales training begins with organizational, IT industry and sales foundations Sales Readiness program equips you with knowledge of our sales playbook, core competencies and key selling skills Role playing situational selling exercises and ride-alongs with senior account executives Establishing your client portfolio and fostering executive-level relationships In-Person training at our Headquarters puts knowledge into practice Continued education provided as you ramp up in your sales career Led by Brooksource’s President and top sales leaders  BENEFITS & PERKS Base salary + uncapped commissions Monthly smartphone stipend and car allowance 401k match program Full health benefits (medical, dental, vision, and HSA) All-expenses-paid Reward Trip each year for top producers and a guest Expense budget for client entertainment Green Team: Opportunity to earn additional compensation for hitting activity goals Eight Eleven’s BeGiving Program: 1 PTO day per quarter for service work/volunteering Access to Eight Eleven University (internal personal & professional development program) Top-notch training programs at every step in your career Access to a personal financial concierge Genuine, passionate, family-oriented culture  WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED Competitive, motivated spirit and desire to succeed Outstanding communication skills and innate ability to connect with people Entrepreneurial spirit with desire to learn and grow  Results-driven and forward-thinking Thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative, and positive work environment  Bachelor’s Degree   EEO STATEMENT Eight Eleven Group provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, citizenship, disability, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, amnesty or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.

description: ToolBelt, the fastest growing construction tech platform, is seeking top sales talent! We are looking for an outgoing, well-spoken inside sales representative with experience overcoming objections and closing deals to join our elite sales team.  This full-time remote sales position will play a fundamental role in achieving our team's ambitious growth goals this year and into 2022. Are you a skilled closer? Join the construction industry’s fast-growing technology company!  Ideal Candidates Will Possess The Following B2B, SaaS, or construction sales experience (5 Years Minimum) Strong video demo skills, cold calling telesales ability, focusing on delivering value proposition, overcoming objections and closing sales Sell to Enterprise Customers Ability to effectively explain and demonstrate production services to decision-makers in residential building and general contracting Proficient use of Microsoft products, video conferencing software & sales CRM (Hubspot) Ability to develop report, listen to understand needs and deliver solutions Ability to insure successful onboarding of new customers Benefits Include Full-time, salaried position plus bonuses Remote sales position working Monday-Friday 8am-5pm PST with occasional weekend appointments Appointments set for you Goals in place to help you meet and exceed targets Huge growth opportunities within the ToolBelt organization Serve as an ambassador for a technology product that is redefining the residential contracting industry Job Type: Full-time, Remote, Telesales  What Makes Us Great  Fast growing tech startup located in PDX/Vancouver, WA  Excellent corporate culture & work / life balance  Competitive pay + health / stock benefits  Solid 2 yr. growth plan  OEN Company of the Year 2020  TAO Company of the Year 2020

jobTitle: Church Products Sales Development Representative - Chandler AZ
description: Description  Fathlife is looking for a motivated and dynamic Sales Development Representative to join our growing Church Products Sales team. As an SDR, you will work with sales and marketing to turn leads from campaigns into qualified opportunities. You will hold a crucial role on our team. Being the initial point of contact for new customers, you will have the exciting opportunity to set the tone for the rest of the sales cycle. If you are consultative, results-driven, collaborative, and have excellent communication skills, we’d love to get the opportunity to meet you. This position is located in Chandler, AZ.  Responsibilities Prospect leads from marketing campaigns to identify new opportunities Schedule meetings with prospective clients and sales representatives Nurture leads until they are ready to meet with sales representatives Stay up-to-date with product features and pricing Ensure successful follow through by providing accurate notes to the sales reps and maintaining accurate records in our CRM application  Requirements Excellent communication and negotiation skills Strong phone presence Able to prioritize and manage time effectively  Benefits Competitive salary 401(k) retirement plan Health insurance plan Free beverages and espresso  About Faithlife  Faithlife (formerly Logos Bible Software) builds award-winning mobile, web, and desktop applications in a casual, yet fast-paced environment. We create a diverse set of products, including Logos Bible Software,Faithlife, Proclaim, Vyrso, and Biblia.com. Faithlife is frequently nominated as a Washington Best Workplace, and has also been recognized as a Best Christian Workplace. Most recently, we were honored as one of Glassdoor.com's Top-10 Best Medium-Sized Companies to Work For.

description: Our team at BDE Inc is growing quickly and looking to add to our department for a Sales Representative opening. For over a decade our organization has worked with some of the biggest names in telecommunications and technology to target specific markets for new customer acquisition and brand awareness. We have 30 offices across the nation and anticipate to almost double in size within the next two years.  Our ideal candidate for the Sales Representative role is someone who is outgoing, competitive, and learns quickly! We are open to a variety of backgrounds - no past experience in sales is required and we are willing to train.  Sales Representative Responsibilities Present, promote and sell products/services using solid arguments to existing and prospective customers Perform cost-benefit and needs analysis of existing/potential customers to meet their needs Establish, develop and maintain positive business and customer relationships Expedite the resolution of customer problems and complaints to maximize satisfaction Achieve sales targets Analyze the market’s potential, track sales and status reports Supply management with reports on customer needs, problems, interests, competitive activities, and potential for new products and services. Keep abreast of best practices and promotional trends Continuously improve through feedback Pay And Benefits Hourly guaranteed wage Opportunity for uncapped commissions Performance Bonuses Performance Recognition Upward advancement Travel and Network Opportunities Qualifications Past sales experience (will consider entry level with quick learning abilities) 2 years Customer Service experience Background Check 18 or older Valid drivers license and reliable transportation required If you are looking for a new career to grow and have been searching for sales roles - apply today! Our recruiting team will be reviewing all applications and look forward to speaking soon.  BDE Inc is a leader in third party customer acquisition for some of the biggest brands in telecommunications and technology. Our organization has been recognized as a "USA Top Workplace" and have expanded into 20+ locations over the last decade.

Primarily Tennessee and Alabama with possibly some accounts in Georgia, Mississippi or Florida. Knowledge of carbon flat rolled steels, stainless steel, aluminum and fabricated parts are all helpful. jobTitle: Pediatric Patient Sales Specialist - Olympia, WA
description: Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals, and branded generic medicines. Our 109,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.  About Abbott  Our nutrition business develops science-based nutrition products for people of all ages, from helping babies and children grow, to keeping adult bodies strong and active. Millions of people around the world count on our leading brands – including Similac®, PediaSure®, Pedialyte®, Ensure®, Glucerna® and ZonePerfect® – to help get the nutrients they need to live their healthiest life.  Our location in Olympia, Washington, currently has an opportunity for a Pediatric Patient Sales Specialist. This position is responsible for the promotion, management and growth of Abbott Pediatric Nutritional products in hospitals and office settings.  TERRITORY Southern Point: Vancouver Northern Point: Tacoma Including: Olympia, Tacoma, & Puyallup What You’ll Do Developing and supporting territory sales goals in each hospital and office service area for Similac, PediaSure & Hospital Portfolio. Hospital negotiations and contracting. Comprehensive knowledge of all products, clinical studies, protocols and guidelines as well as the ability to deliver the information in a selling environment. New product launches. An understanding of the hierarchy of hospital departments such as NICU, Pediatrics, Pharmacies, Purchasing, PICU, Nurseries and Nursing units. The ability to work effectively with Dietitians, Physicians and Nurses. Effective administrative skills. Budget management. Ability to function independently with a high degree of initiative, independence, and autonomy. Desire to be self- motivated, seeking out success at achieving both short and long term goals. Required  EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE YOU’LL BRING Bachelor's degree required. RD/RN and/or 2-3 years sales experience. Preferred Local candidates only please – No Relocation support for this opportunity. What We Offer  At Abbott, you can have a good job that can grow into a great career. We offer: A fast-paced work environment where your safety is our priority (Include for Manufacturing roles only) Production areas that are clean, well-lit and temperature-controlled (Include for Manufacturing roles only) Training and career development, with onboarding programs for new employees and tuition assistance Financial security through competitive compensation, incentives and retirement plans Health care and well-being programs including medical, dental, vision, wellness and occupational health programs Paid time off 401(k) retirement savings with a generous company match The stability of a company with a record of strong financial performance and history of being actively involved in local communities Learn more about our benefits that add real value to your life to help you live fully: www.abbottbenefits.com  Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that provides the growth and strength to build your future. Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to employee diversity.  Connect with us at www.abbott.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Abbott and on Twitter @AbbottNews and @AbbottGlobal.

description: Your Purpose at SHAiR!  We’re looking for go-getters who don’t mind being pushed out of their comfort zones. For perfectionists who are willing to put in extra hours to make sure their tasks are completed not just to their own satisfaction, but beyond others’ expectations. For confident self-starters who want to be part of something greater than themselves.  We’ve grown from a single, 5-person office to a thriving business with 3 new locations just this year. And we did it by expecting all employees to go above and beyond the call of duty. We don’t believe in “coasting” or doing just enough to get by. We're here to win. And if you want to be part of this winning team, and if you’re ready to give your all (not just what it lists in the job description), we would like to receive your application.  EXPECTATIONS:  PROVIDE SUPPORT  Apply effective troubleshooting techniques under pressure Develop and maintain a knowledge base of the evolving products and services Develop relationships with Users via Intercom and e-mail  Document and update User records based on interactions, Intercom and SF updates Intercom response times: First greeting within 5 seconds and an average Intercom conversation response time of 10 seconds or less Minimum 100 outbound chats per shift Manage a Users profile requests Document and update User records based on interactions; record any information about activities and or accounts in the CRM systems Develop and maintain a knowledge base of the evolving products and services Mandatory to become verified on the SHAiR app Mandatory to learn and understand SHAiR policies Mandatory to learn functionality of SHAiR app Onboard new Users, Hosts and Renters Participate in daily team meetings and offer ideas, suggestions and recommendations to improve User experience Uphold SHAiR in a professional manner at all times; represent SHAiR in a positive light, help raise brand awareness and provide Users with a memorable face-to-face experience Provide information about the products and services Provide recommendations to Users for bookings and postings Read one book a month from Team Reads Troubleshoot and resolve product issues and concerns Written daily goals    SALES SUPPORT ANALYST: Responsible for building lists for business to business partnerships Responsible for building lists for qualified Hosts Organizing, building, and managing relationships through research and outreach Locate decision makers, analyze the business, qualify them, send intro email - then transfer to Sales Managers  QUALIFICATIONS:  Passionate about helping people become financially literate Passionate about cars Enjoys prospecting for new clients and meeting with existing clients  Proven customer support/sales experience, ideally 2-year minimum  Enjoys shift rotation, 10 hour shifts; 4 days on 4 days off Business knowledge - experience in business to business sales or experience owning a business - cold calling experience is considered a valuable asset Open to remote work and travel depending on business needs Strong speaking and negotiating skills Problem-solving skills Excellent customer service skills Thrives in a team environment Have a clean record - you’ll need to pass a criminal background check to work at SHAiR  Someone with management aspirations and/or experience A motivated self-starter  COMPENSATION:  $45,000 - $55,000 yearly salary  BENEFITS:  Dental and Vision Insurance Medical Insurance  ANTICIPATED SCHEDULE: Shift Work 4 days on 4 days off May include days, split shifts, and night shifts  Employment Type Full-time

jobTitle: Sales Rep-Home Health ($5,000 Sign on Bonus)
description: Company Overview The Account Executive is responsible for executing the sales strategy to increase company market share through account development and educating the medical community on services provided by the company while operating within set budget. ***$5,000 Sign on Bonus*** Cavalier Home Healthcare, a part of LHC Group, is the preferred post-acute care partner for hospitals, physicians and families nationwide. From home health and hospice care to long-term acute care and community-based services, we deliver high-quality, cost-effective care that empowers patients to manage their health at home. Hospitals and health systems around the country have partnered with LHC Group to deliver patient-centered care in the home. More hospitals, physicians and families choose LHC Group, because we are united by a single, shared purpose: It's all about helping people. Essential Functions Achievement of monthly Personal Production Goals and MC admit budgets for assigned locations. Successfully executes a weekly, monthly, and quarterly strategy to increase market share through key account development including prospecting/diversification and call frequency/routing. Plans activity to maximize territory coverage of both existing and prospective accounts. Responsible for executing effective sales calls that identify and meet the needs of the referral community and clearly communicate the features and benefits of the LHC Group. These include pre and post call planning, establishing rapport, effective questioning skills, proposing solutions, handling objections and closing. Works closely with the Executive Director/Clinical Director to drive a vision of growth by focusing every team member on the needs and expectations of the referral community and patients. Responsible for all sales administration duties including, but not limited to, Playmaker, CRM expense entry compliance, BOA with associated Policies and Procedures, payroll time sheets, Weekly 3LS meetings with strategic updates, PTO requests, paperwork (485/F2F) delivery or pick-up when needed, timely cell phone and e-mail correspondence. Responsible for being a good steward of the company's financial resources by projecting a return on monies spent and managing to a Sales and Marketing expense budget. Knows the features and benefits of the services provided by LHC Group. Is able to articulate competitive advantages, specialty programs, and Medicare guidelines. Educates the medical community about the services of our organization through effective sales calls and in-services with the appropriate tools and literature. Any other tasks that are assigned. Education & Experience Formal Education: High School Diploma or equivalent required; Bachelor's Degree PreferredExperience Requirements Two to three years of prior successful Home Health or Hospice sales experience preferred.Skill Requirements Excellent presentation, negotiation and relationship-building skills required. Must have strong computer skills to meet Microsoft Outlook and CRM software requirements. Must have the ability to work independently with minimal supervision and be self motivated.

description: About Us  Threekit is changing commerce by creating incredible experience in 3D, Augmented Reality, and Virtual Photography. In the last year eCommerce growth has exploded and buyer expectations have too. We help brands create experiences that wow customers.   Our rapidly growing client roster spans industries and continents— from savvy startups to Fortune 500 enterprises. We also partner with the “who’s who” of eCommerce and CRM, including Salesforce, Adobe, SAP, Shopify, BigCommerce, Commercetools and many more.  Want to make sure you are betting on success? Our team has decades of experience building and scaling great software companies including BigMachines (Acquired by Oracle), Steelbrick (Acquired by Salesforce) and G2. With over $30M in backing from top-tier VC’s (Shasta Ventures, Salesforce Ventures) and strong results -- we are well on our way building an amazing organization.   Threekit is looking for Sales Development Representatives to engage with and qualify inbound prospects - this role is an important key so we can change eCommerce forever.  As a sales development representative you will work with a fast-paced and experienced sales and marketing team. You will be responsible for explaining how Threekit works, demo’ing our product, and developing skills to teach, tailor, and win over prospects on the value of Threekit.  This role is important to the success of Threekit because it’s the first line of engagement with future customers. We need energetic and hungry people who want to grow an amazing career with us. This is a great role for supercharging your sales career and entering the eCommerce space.   What you’ll do:  Respond to, and qualify inquiries into Threekit’s solution to source pipeline across small-to-enterprise businesses globally Craft a great first impression to our prospects and customers over email, phone, and live chat by adding value during every customer touchpoint Engage with inbound prospects quickly and reliably  Maintain active engagement with new and existing leads through creative follow-up communications designed to increase interest and excitement in Threekit Partner closely with sales and marketing to develop creative strategies to increase conversion rates from lead-to-opportunity in order to achieve monthly goals Use a data driven approach to forecast and execute on a self-developed strategy to consistently achieve goals Develop an understanding of the Threekit product offering and the value it will have for potential customers.   Master your ability to discover and understand prospects' business needs and articulate why the Threekit solution will make their lives easier and have a positive ROI for their business.  You’re a great fit if you…  You have 1+ year(s) of work experience in sales or business development You have consistently been a top performer in prior roles You have experience working with a technical product or possess the aptitude to quickly learn this You are a self starter with the hunger to be great  You thrive in an environment where you have control over your own destiny. You know how to stay organized and prioritize your time to allow you to be most effective. You aren’t afraid to ask for help knowing that in doing so you will become better and in turn better the company. You love to learn & want to break into eCommerce  Threekit was founded on the idea that beautiful and immersive experiences can change eCommerce. Today, we’re delivering on that mission. We create billions of visuals in 3D, AR, and virtual photography so brands like Crate & Barrel, HP, TaylorMade, and others can show buyers their amazing products.  We want people of all backgrounds to see themselves represented and included in our work, so we actively seek to diversify our team and bring more voices to the table. All applicants are welcome!
industries: Computer Software
