description: Come Join Our TEAM! Are you an Inside Sales professionals with a demonstrable track record of creating pipeline for enterprise accounts? ExaGrid is in high-growth mode, partnering each field sales rep with an Inside Sales Rep (ISR) in a 1:1 relationship to drive qualified new pipeline opportunities in a defined geographic territory. You will benefit from a product that is truly differentiated in the market, a solid value proposition that is relevant, and a robust collection of customer success stories. You’ll be expected to bring your own outbound Account Penetration experience, Territory Management capabilities, and prospecting proficiency with data center staff and management. ISRs are responsible for generating new business through outbound prospecting, cold calling, reengaging with building relationships over time through ongoing prospect outreach and education. The target audience is Managers, Directors, and VPs of IT in enterprise data centers responsible for nightly backup of all IT data. Qualified prospects will be provided to the ExaGrid field sales team to work through the sales cycle. The ISR will continue to nurture/educate and strengthen relationships with prospects who do not complete the sales cycle. At ExaGrid, we invest in YOU! And in the tools you need to be successful, including dedicated research staff for accounts and contacts, marketing coverage, and relevant content that resonates with the target audience, including customer success stories and videos that help you connect with your prospects. ExaGrid emphasizes continuous training on the market/industry, the product, the competition, and sales skills for its employees If you have experience in outbound prospecting and lead qualification into data centers, the drive to win, the passion of an entrepreneur, and love for inside sales with uncapped earning potential drop me a note, and let's talk!

Who We Are Incorta delivers the industry’s first hyper-converged analytics platform. We are the fastest way to analyze complex data which powers business decisions in seconds not weeks. Incorta is on a mission to bring quicker, better insights and data-driven decisions to every business. Everything we do is aimed at making sure our customers love every aspect of Incorta, from our great products and technologies to our ease of doing business and support.  Enterprise Sales Development Representative Overview The Sales Development Representative (SDR) is an extension of the Field Sales organization generating qualified sales opportunities through responding Marketing generated leads, inbound interest and targeted outbound prospecting. In close collaboration with Account Executives, SDRs establish prospecting plans for strategic accounts to uncover new business and grow existing customers. SDRs also manage small deals and renewals in their assigned territories. Strong business acumen and the ability to quickly assess and understand a prospect or customer’s business environment and needs and apply the business value of Incorta is essential to success in this role. Ideal candidates possess the aptitude to easily engage and establish rapport executives and line of business professionals.  Qualifications 1-3 years' B2B enterprise software tele-sales or business development experience Consultative and solution prospecting/selling expertise Marketing lead nurture and qualification History of effectively managing a large territory, high volume of leads, and building/maintaining relationships Superior written/oral communication and presentation skills. Experience conducting account mapping and developing prospecting strategy Capable of and eager to make 50+ dials daily Systematic but flexible, self-directed; can prioritize and manage multiple work streams Perseverance; handles objections and rejection Thrives in a competitive team environment Intuitive with the capacity to hit the ground running Desired College degree preferred Experience prospecting and selling enterprise software solutions, Business Intelligence, or Analytics software This is an excellent opportunity for someone aspiring to become a full quota carrying sales professional for a market leading strategic analytics company. This is a full-time, traditional office position with a competitive base salary and variable compensation based on lead conversion and pipeline generation and quota attainment.  Find yourself checking a lot of these boxes but doubting whether you should apply? At Incorta, we support a growth mindset for our associates through all stages of their careers. If you meet some of the requirements and you share our values, we encourage you to apply.  We could tell you that we’re building something that truly optimizes the way business intelligence is done. Or, that we’re backed by marquee VC's such as Google Ventures and Kleiner Perkins. All true, but the real reason you will want to come work for Incorta is that you’ll be part of an early team that is building a game-changing analytics product that will allow companies to answer complex questions in seconds...not days or weeks like the current solutions.  Incorta provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: Position: Sales Operations Analyst Location: Remote - (North America)   Who are we: Canto empowers marketers to spend more time doing what they love - building great brands. With our elegant, intuitive digital asset management platform, marketing & creative teams increase asset velocity and ensure their colleagues across the organization have access to the right content on-demand, every time. Canto’s corporate headquarters is in San Francisco, with an office in Berlin, Germany.   What we are looking for: Canto is rapidly scaling its sales organization and is seeking a solution-oriented, sales operations analyst to administer, maintain and optimize the sales and customer success technology stack.     How you’ll contribute:  Administer, maintain, and optimize the sales technology stack  Ensure sales technology is implemented and integrated in a way that drives sales team efficiency while capturing key sales data for data analysis and reporting  Continually update and enhance system operations to align with best practices  Serve as the sales organization’s trusted advisor and go-to-resource sales technology support  Keep accurate and up-to-date documentation of system processes and workflows     What you need:  2+ years of experience in sales operations, preferably in a SaaS sales organization  Salesforce administration certification preferred  Experience and working knowledge of other popular sales and customer success technology such as ZoomInfo, Outreach.io, Gainsight, Gong.io, etc. Experience with Hubspot is a plus.   Tech-curious: problem-solver who seeks out creative solutions using process + technology.  Highly organized and high attention to detail   Ability to multitask and prioritize at times of high volume  Ability to communicate within all levels of the organization  Ability to thrive in a start-up environment, highly self-motivated, extremely detail-oriented, analytical with demonstrated problem solving, and have sound business decision-making skills in a fast-growing/fast-paced environment    Why Join Canto? Startup environment within a stable, industry-leading company. Competitive salary, commission structure & equity 401(k), Health, Dental & Vision benefits Vacation and Sick Time pay Regular team outings & events 20 - Days PTO in your first year $125 monthly fitness/education stipend     Canto is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. We do not discriminate against qualified employees or applicants because of race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual preference, sexual identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, military status, or any other characteristic protected by local law or ordinance.

Descriptions  Samirian Chemicals has an immediate opportunity for a sales specialist. The successful candidate will be responsible for growing and developing Samirian Chemical’s business in specialized markets. Markets include Water Treatment (Including oilfield and municipal), Mining (including gold and rare earth), Food/Pharma and Industrial Chemicals. The successful candidate will have experience in one or more of these markets. The position is remote and ideally located in the eastern US.  Responsibilities  Identify, prospect, pursue and develop new revenue opportunities  Communicate with customers through outbound calls  Create and maintain a database of current and potential customers  Qualifications  Technical or business college degree.  5-10 years sales experience.  Experience in one or more of the above targeted markets.  Self-starter and ability to work remotely.  Good communicator with the ability to think outside the box.  Ability to build strong relationships.  Bilingual with Spanish or French a plus.  About Samirian  Samirian Chemicals is a private company based in California and for 30 years we have been involved in imported chemical distribution. With a flat organization and a small but dedicated and talented team we can accommodate customer needs and desires very quickly. We pride ourselves of thinking outside the box and quick decision making.  Benefits  Medical  8 Paid Holidays  Paid Time Off  Travel: No  Equal Employment Opportunity Policy  Samirian Chemical Inc, provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.  This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.  We are a chemical distributor/manufacturer headquartered in Campbell, Ca. We have established warehouse locations and developed relationships with customers all over North and South America. These recent changes have brought us to the forefront of our industry. In our rapid expansion, we have evaluated the need for new team members to aid in our growth.

description: PLEASE NOTE: WE ARE ONLY LOOKING FOR A CANDIDATE TO BE BASED IN OUR DELRAY BEACH, FLORIDA OFFICE WILLING TO TRAVEL THROUGHOUT THE US (as needed).  About Us  Lumitec has established a strong brand presence in the marine industry and beyond as an innovative, industry-leading developer and manufacturer of extreme environment LED lighting. We have an incredibly loyal and enthusiastic customer base that grows by the week. Our products are distributed for retail sales globally and used by the world’s top boat builders. We’ve also made strong inroads into a myriad of other opportunity-rich industries. At this stage, our opportunities are nearly limitless. www.lumiteclighting.com  For the last 12 years, Lumitec has achieved double digit, annual growth. We are looking for an exceptional sales representative to help us continue this phenomenal success. The ideal candidate is thorough, professional, and above all else is RESULTS focused.  We are eager to round out our already strong sales team with an experienced territory or channel sales representative, focused on growing our existing business and exploring domestic and international business opportunities. This is a unique opportunity for an exceptional salesperson with 3+ years’ proven sales success in a field, territory, and/or business development sales role.  The position(s) are primarily responsible for executing sales goals and sales plans by managing your assigned territory or vertical. The objective is to maintain and grow Lumitec business in marine-based markets. In this role, you will also qualify and seek new customers in horizontal industries and non-marine markets.  Travel may be required based on prospect, customer, or market demands. Some non-traditional hours (evenings and some weekends) may be required, to successfully meet customer/business needs. Marine industry sales experience a definite plus.  The Candidate Must Also Possess The Following REQUIRED Attributes  The ideal candidate is thorough, professional, and above all else is RESULTS focused. The individual would be a self-starter with a strong work ethic and follow through. Demonstrated understanding of sales processes. The ability to build strong relationships and close business A “customer first” approach to sales and business management. Think strategically to create new business opportunities. Strong organizational and planning skills. Meet expected sales activities with appointments and follow up. Excellent negotiations/problem solving skills. A polished, professional presence - written, in person, and on the phone. A “customer first” approach to sales and business management. Qualifications  Bachelor’s Degree preferred  3+ years outside business-to-business territory /field sales experience with proven success.  Prior marine industry sales experience is preferred, but not required. Experience selling a technical consumer product is preferred. Boating experience is a plus.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills.  Strong organizational and planning skills.  Self-starter with demonstrated strong work ethic and follow through.  Excellent proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook), Salesforce.com, and internet research.  This could be the opportunity you are looking for to expand your skills, contribute to a winning company, and work with talented people who love what they do and take pride in our company.  Lumitec offers a comprehensive benefits package that includes group Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, and Short and Long-Term disability coverages. We also offer individual, ancillary insurance plans and a generous 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan with a Company match.  Please respond with a resume and a salary history.  References, drug tests and background checks are required.  Offices are close to I-95 and an easy commute from Ft. Lauderdale to Palm Beach Gardens.  We are a group of results oriented people who are committed to the success of the company. Having tremendous pride in our products, we are passionate about serving our customers. With the desire and opportunity to learn and grow professionally, we are supported by a collaborative culture of cutting edge innovation.
industries: Consumer Goods, Insurance, and Retail

description: Due to our expansive growth, we are seeking motivated individuals with no experience in sales looking for an opportunity to make $13.50 an hour with uncapped commissions.  American Power & Gas offers green solutions to both residential and small commercial energy customers and have been leaders in Customer Choice programs across America for over 15 years.  We are one of the oldest and most reputable companies of its kind in our industry and the largest company of our kind in the Tampa bay area with over 100,000 customers and a state of the art 30,000 square foot facility.  Recently we won an award for the #1 fastest growing company in Tampa Bay.  Requirements Likes talking on the phone Motivated to improve their life Likes working in a team with others Ability to work in fast paced dynamic environment Open to coaching, adaptable and willing to try new approaches To schedule an interview call 727-733-8520  Check out our Careers Website  https://careers.americanpowerandgas.com/  Check out our Career Page on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/apgcareer/  American Power & Gas  10601 Belcher Rd South,  Seminole, Fl 33777  American Power & Gas specializes in helping small commercial businesses, and residential homes, and apartments, reducing their natural gas and electricity bills. American Power & Gas is the oldest and most reputable company of its kind in our industry. We offer, Health Benefits, Life Insurance, sick and vacation days and the opportunity for promotions-room to advance.

Do you like to organize your friends and family for fun?  If you answered YES! ...then this job is for you!  We Offer The Following Work close to home No Cold Calling Monthly Bonus opportunity Paid training A flexible schedule - Variable hours Pre-Set appointments with new and repeat clients Excellent marketing materials provided No previous sales experience necessary We Are Looking For People Who Have Great people skills Fun and outgoing personalities Creative problem solving skills Apply Today!  Closets by Design has become the leading company in the home organizing industry over the past 35 years. Our Designers create the beautiful spaces you’ve seen in magazines and television. So, if you are a motivated individual who loves organization, being creative and working with people, Apply Now!  Call Sofia  Phone: 562-551-4602  OR  Email Us At  recruiting@closetsbydesign.com  Average Compensation is $2k to $4k per month  Since 1982, we've built a reputation of integrity as the industry leader in customer service and total customer satisfaction. From our no obligation in-home consultation, custom tailored designs and the highest quality product construction, our products simply offer the best value in the industry!

description: Sales Development Representative • Grocery TV Location: Austin, TX We are looking for a Sales Development Representative (SDR) to join the Grocery TV retail sales team. In this role, you'll prospect and qualify grocery retailers to partner with us as we expand our network.  Grocery TV Grocery TV is the largest digital out-of-home (DOOH) advertising network in U.S. grocery retail, with an initial focus on point-of-sale advertising displays. Our long-term vision is to make it easy for advertisers to reach their audience at every key point along the retail shopping journey.  Learn more about how we have helped brands connect in over 6,000 locations across the U.S. at grocerytv.com.  Responsibilities Strategically prospect for new business, researching companies and individuals that meet criteria for prospective partnership with Grocery TV Gain interest through tailored outbound cold calls, emails, and multi-touch campaigns Qualify inbound inquiries Work to meet and exceed monthly activity goals defined to maximize deal flow with outbound emails, calls, and meeting scheduling Learn to manage a full sales cycle with opportunities to close SMB-scale retailers Work with our Marketing team to grow brand awareness, increase inbound leads, and execute sales strategies as new products and features are released Play an integral part in our company's development and have the opportunity to be a founding member of the retail sales development team  Growth Opportunities As an individual contributor, you will help us by vetting, prospecting, contacting, qualifying, and scheduling meetings with prospective customers. As part of your role, you will work directly with our retail sales team leader to develop all the foundational skills necessary to become a Retail Account Executive. As an AE, you’ll sell directly to regional retail chains and independent retailers. If you're interested in management opportunities, you'll have regular coaching opportunities for new SDRs hired after you.  Qualifications 1+ years of relevant professional experience (or relevant internship experience) Excellent people & communication skills Comfortable presenting information to potential clients and decision-makers with confidence & enthusiasm Detail-oriented and an appreciation for organization Ability to work and collaborate with a small, fast-paced team Love for the startup environment and building new things Intrinsic drive to take initiative, to figure it out and to take ownership to be successful in the role Previous retail experience is a bonus, but not required  Compensation We are proud to have full salary transparency on our team, and use a market-based formula that provides consistency across roles & experience levels. The current compensation for this role is: Base Salary: $48,000/year On-Target Earnings: $79,600/year (with 100% quota attainment) Uncapped Commissions  Perks One of Austin's Best Small Companies to Work for in 2021 Strong team values in transparency, ownership, people, and teamwork Passionate, high-achieving teammates excited to help you succeed and learn Competitive pay and salary transparency Generous time-off programs (including parental leave) Flexible work schedule Our own (amazing) space in East Austin Quarterly offsites and an annual retreat  Feeling imposter syndrome? Reach out to us! We're happy to help you better understand the role and what we're looking for.

About Pave  Here at Pave, you’ll be joining a world class team with tremendous growth potential. We’re a Series B start-up backed by top Silicon Valley investors Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), Y Combinator Continuity, and Bessemer Venture Partners.  The world of compensation is broken today. Pave is here to fix it. Today, teams cobble together hundreds of messy spreadsheets and outdated surveys to determine how to compensate their workforce. Covid and remote work have made the situation far more difficult, and the notion of “market compensation” is now confusing to everyone.  At Pave, you will reinvent the world of compensation and help build a more transparent future of work.  Pave allows companies to benchmark compensation to leaders in their industry, analyze internal compensation data and make the right adjustments, then visually communicate compensation to their employees. We’re building the world’s largest real-time compensation data platform to accomplish this goal, and are acquiring amazing customers like Credit Karma, Discord, and Allbirds at an unbelievable pace. Come join our team on this mission!  Our Team  Enterprise Sales Development Representatives (ENT SDR) are the driving force of Pave's go-to-market engine for strategic accounts.  You’ll strategically outbound enterprise companies, identifying the decision makers of world class tech companies and finding opportunities for them to leverage Pave's compensation planning tools.  You’ll receive hands-on mentorship from Pave's sales team and have early exposure to founders, investors, and finance / HR executives. Over time, you’ll become an industry expert at the cross-section of compensation and technology.  This is a mission critical role that will result in Pave signing many of its most recognizable customers.  Your Primary Focus  Map enterprise accounts - Create territory plans in partnership with your account executive to break into renowned logos for Pave.  Engage in cold outreach - Strategically research, call, and email top tier tech companies to acquire more customers.  Collaborate on strategic projects - As a member of an early stage team, you’ll work directly with the CEO and founding team members on a wide array of key initiatives from compensation benchmark surveys to strategic customer outreach.  About You  On day one, you’ll have exposure to founders, executives, and investors. The ability to “punch above your weight class” is key. We’re looking for sharp, hardworking, eager-to-learn SDRs who will evolve into Pave's top account executives:  Experience: 6+ months experience as an SDR.  Grit : You aim high and raise the bar for your colleagues. You're not afraid to pick up the phones and take rejection head on.  Coachability: You become a master of your craft and immerse yourself in the industry.  Emotional Intelligence: You can read the room and communicate with impact.  Life at Pave  Pave is growing incredibly fast, and we have high ambition. In true work hard / play hard fashion, we've complemented our ambitious goals with a world-class culture and a variety of early startup benefits. As an early hire, you’ll play a key role in shaping what this looks like, but some of the benefits that we already offer include:  Compensation: Competitive salary and startup equity (it's in our DNA)  Wellness: Top tier health insurance along with exercise & wellness benefits  Food: All meals while working, plus snacks. We take our snacking seriously  Tech: Choose your laptop and accessories of choice  Team: Retreats, happy hours, and events for our team, friends, and family  Flexible Time Off: Take the time you need  WFH Wednesday: A dedicated work from home day each week  Location: Our company is based in San Francisco's SoMA district with a high energy in-person culture  And much more... we want all Pave employees to define the best benefits based on our combined interests.  Pave is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please email recruiting@pave.com.
industries: Computer Software

description: Description  Paychex is looking for high-energy, driven professionals with sound business insight and natural sales instincts to join our Sales Development organization. SDRs will help lay the foundation of sales efforts through prospecting and articulating the value of Paychex to small and medium-sized businesses. As a Sales Development Representative, you will work strategically with assigned field sales partners to find new clients. As the first line of contact, SDRs are able to understand the diverse business needs of our prospective clients. They are quick on their feet, agile, and possess the ability to overcome objections. As an SDR you will use your business acumen and conversational skills to create qualified opportunities for the full cycle sales team. You will use a process-driven approach to outbound prospecting that incorporates phone/email outreach, lead nurturing, and data gathering/validation/updating while leveraging a robust tech stack. Work from home environment Generates appointments for sales representatives utilizing technology as well as targeted telephone, email, webinar, and social media. Builds rapport via a multi-touch, nurturing approach. Partners with selling representatives to strategically target accounts and identify potential opportunities for Paychex. Continually updates and cleans SalesForce.com (SFDC) records. Manages calendar, campaigns, timely follow-up and engagement with sales representatives. Articulates competitive advantages in conversation and email communication with prospects by highlighting our differentiators. Consistently leverages CRM, social media, and automation tools/processes to find opportunities and capture market share via a systematic and disciplined approach. Expertise in overall value proposition tied to Paychex’s suite of products and services Requirements High School Diploma - Required Bachelors Degree - Preferred 1 year of experience in sales support / lead generation role working in a fast paced and agile environment Work from home environment Our Commitment  Paychex is dedicated to fostering a culture of intentional Inclusion and Diversity (I&D). Our valued employees and commitment to I&D is the essence of our internal and external success. Inclusivity is a key value of our corporate culture and is exemplified through our reputation as a top employer for employee development, diversity, and ethics, as well as a focus on fairness in recruitment, selection, and decision making.  Click here for more information on our corporate social responsibility.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Insurance, and Financial Services

description: I am looking to #hire a visual sales representative that will be handling specify job duties such as Online marketing, Payroll and book keeping, email correspondence, posting online advertisement, collect and sort invoices and checks, keep a record of business transactions and enter data into the cash register, process invoices and bills so that they can be paid.  Responsibilities The main responsibilities of a Sales Representative revolve around the ability to network, build relationships with clients and persuade others to purchase products. There is a wide range of duties in this position, including to: Be knowledgeable about the product Identify prospective customers, lead generation and conversion Contact new and existing customers to discuss needs Emphasise the features of products to highlight how they solve customer problems Answer questions about the products Negotiate prices and terms and prepare sales agreements Collaborate with colleagues in many different sectors Maintain contact lists and follow up with customers to continue relationships  Qualifications Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience Customer-service oriented Proficient in Microsoft Office. Three to five years of industry sales experience

Talented sales representatives wanted to sell advertising in the RWJBarnabas Health Arena, Bennett Indoor Sports Complex, Toms River and Central Regional football stadiums and gyms, school bus advertising, and municipal advertising assets of the township of Toms River including parks and recreation, ice rink, community pool and more.  Ideal individuals will have at least one (1) year business to business sales experience in advertising sales, media sales, or sports sponsorship sales. We are an entrepreneurial spirited company looking for employees who are aggressive, creative, idea generator, researcher, independent worker, highly organized and can build a strong customer base. Prefer individual who is from the Ocean County area.  The Advertising Sales Representative is responsible for:  · New business development with small and medium size businesses in Ocean County · Building strong rapport, trust and credibility with current sponsors · Prospect/canvas local and regional businesses · Ability to book in person appointments for presentations · Use consultative sales philosophy to help create true partnerships with sponsors · Develop custom PowerPoint presentations that meet the sponsors’ marketing objectives · Commitment to world class customer service · Other duties and responsibilities as assigned  The ideal candidate:  · Self-starter, self-motivator with entrepreneurial spirit · A “HUNTER” who can book meetings, make presentations and close business. · Bachelor degree a must and preferred in Advertising Sales, Professional Sales, Sports Sales, Business, Marketing · At least one (1) year of business-to-business sales or sales related experience · Ability to work independently and take initiative · High organizational skills with attention to detail · Excellent communication and interpersonal skills · Commitment to highest level of customer service · Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite software a must!! · Occasion nights and weekends events  If you do not meet these requirements in any way you will not be considered.  About Fox Run Group Fox Run Group is a sponsorship and advertising sales representation firm. We are a fast-growing company specializing in sponsorship and advertising sales for university athletics, alumni associations, club sports and student affairs in addition to live events and esports. Job Description  Join Our Team!  Sunbelt Rentals strives to be the customer's first choice in the equipment rental industry. From pumps to scaffolding to general construction tools, we aim to be the only call needed to outfit a job site with the proper equipment. Not only do we offer a vast fleet that ranks among the best in the industry, we pair it all with a friendly and knowledgeable staff. Our employees are our greatest asset, and although we present a comprehensive equipment offering, our expertise and service are what truly distinguish us from the competition.  We pride ourselves on investing in our workforce and offer competitive benefits, as well as extensive on-the-job training for all eligible employees.  As a highly successful national company, we are constantly looking for talented individuals to support our growth. If you are interested in pursuing a rewarding career, we invite you to review our opportunities!  Job Description Summary  Industrial Sales Representative  Are you seeking an entrepreneurial, empowering workplace that allows you to: Develop a career track Leverage your current skills while developing new skills Work with an incredible team of people  Sunbelt Rentals--the fastest growing rental business in North America--is seeking a Industrial Sales Representative. As an Industrial Sales Representative, you will develop and maximize market share in the industrial and utility sectors for assigned territory, district and/or region.  Duties & Responsibilities Develop assigned territory via prospecting, cold-calling, qualifying leads, following up on referrals, setting up appointments and making sales presentations, etc. to maximize sales potential and Sunbelt’s reputation. Provide sales direction, motivation, and leadership for sales representatives in Sunbelt’s Specialty Businesses. Perform other duties assigned as assigned by the manager. Prompt completion of all administrative duties, which include; but are not limited to: Sales Plans. Sales reports. Daily Call Reports.  Qualifications Professional level knowledge of principles and practices involved in new business development, product marketing and sales, including experience developing territory business plans. Ability to incorporate Sunbelt’s Specialty Businesses (Industrial Resource Group, Scaffolding, Pump and Power, Compressed Air Solutions, etc.) into presentations and business solutions. High energy, entrepreneurial–spirited self-starter. Excellent time management, planning and organizational skills. Territory management practices must be exceptional. Experience selling to all levels of management. Excellent presentation skills. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Bachelor's Degree in Business, Marketing or Engineering or related field is preferred, but not required. 2 years successful sales experience in the industrial, manufacturing, power generation or maintenance fields. Previous rental industry experience a definite plus.  The physical demands of this role require bending, squatting, crouching, reaching, lifting 50 pounds or more, and working indoors/outdoors when required by the job. The above description is not a complete listing of all miscellaneous, incidental or similar duties which may be required from day to day. Reasonable accommodations may be made to comply with applicable laws. Sunbelt Rentals is an Equal Opportunity Employer — Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran and any other protected class.  Gear up for an exciting career!  If a current Sunbelt Rentals employee has referred you for an employment opportunity please notify them that you are applying for this position. In order for the employee to get a referral bonus they need to contact their regional recruiter.

You are focused on helping the potential customer see why CrowdHealth may be a better option for them and their family and answering any questions they may have about how and why CrowdHealth will work for them. Also have the ability to take inbound emails or calls from interested potential members. • Building rapport with potential members, ability to ask for referrals and identify other friends or business associates who may be interested in CrowdHealth. • Achieving quarterly sales and activity goals  Qualifications: • 1-2 years previous sales experience preferred. • Should have excellent interpersonal skills, and be able to effectively communicate over the phone. • This is a highly active, results-oriented position. Candidates should thrive on meeting and exceeding goals. • Strong business acumen and ability to understand a prospects current pain point and buying motivations.

description: Who We Are  Bandwidth lives for innovation! Our technology powers brands like Google, Microsoft, GoDaddy, Arlo, Netgear, Zoom, Rover and more of the most exciting leaders in technology. Our intelligent voice, messaging, 9-1-1 access, and phone number services— all backed by Bandwidth’s own nationwide, all-IP voice network—allow us to power the way people communicate, connect, and do business.  At Bandwidth, your music matters when you are part of the BAND. We celebrate differences and encourage BANDmates to be their authentic selves. #jointheband  What We Are Looking For  Are you excited about the position and its responsibilities, but not sure if you’re 100% qualified? Do feel as you can work to help us crush the mission? If you answered ‘yes’ to both of these questions, we encourage you to apply! You won’t want to miss the opportunity to be a part of the BAND.  As the Sales Enablement Specialist, you will be an instrumental part of the Bandwidth Sales Operations team by ensuring that the Sales organization is successful in delivering annual sales objectives. This role works closely with internal Bandwidth departments such as Sales, Billing, Finance, and Product to assist the Sales team in meeting their quarterly goals.  What You Need BS/BA in related field with 1+ years directly related experience Experience: 1+ years directly related experience Understanding of forecasting concepts and basic sales cycles. Salesforce.com prior experience preferred. Strong verbal and written communications skills, ability to communicate clearly with a wide range of personalities and handle urgent requests with correct prioritization and accuracy. Ability to handle multiple activities with a short turnaround time and work both independently and as a team. Ability to work flexibly, adapting quickly to change and new ways of working. What You'll Do Respond to ad hoc support requests from the sales team including SFDC assistance, training requests, process improvement suggestions and general support related function. Assist sales with the creation of salesforce.com (SFDC) opportunities used to track and manage both new and existing sales engagements Build close partnerships with sales representatives and leaders in order to proactively support their efforts Gain a detailed understanding of active sales opportunities to drive accurate sales forecasting, pipeline management activities and maintain data integrity Serve as a subject matter expert in all sales tools in order to help sales executives resolve any technology or process related issues Serve as an advocate for sales representatives during the implementation of new processes, products and procedures Ensure that the sales organization is well-equipped with the content and knowledge of all products and processes to most effectively nurture and close deals in the pipeline Serves as dynamic team player who is an integral part of the sales team and helps drive the business to the desired level of performance The Whole Person Promise  We make a “Whole Person” promise to our team. You can have both meaningful work PLUS a full life at Bandwidth. We focus on accomplishing our mission as “whole people.” That means we take care of our people—in body, mind, and spirit. Health: We pay 100% for benefits coverage including Medical, Dental, Vision, Prescription, Life, and Disability. Corporate chaplains, EAP and 401K match. Fitness:90-minute fitness lunch with a paid gym membership with shuttle service available for workouts. On-site cardio gym, locker room/showers, classes, and sponsored sports and leagues. Nutritionist and personal trainer on-site. Volunteer: We have a program dedicated to providing volunteer opportunities to employees, Bandwidthcares. Applicant Privacy Notice

jobTitle: Field Sales Representative II - DEKALB/Asgrow - Eastern Iowa
description: At Bayer we’re visionaries, driven to solve the world’s toughest challenges and striving for a world where ,Health for all, Hunger for none’ is no longer a dream, but a real possibility. We’re doing it with energy, curiosity and sheer dedication, always learning from unique perspectives of those around us, expanding our thinking, growing our capabilities and redefining ‘impossible’. There are so many reasons to join us. If you’re hungry to build a varied and meaningful career in a community of brilliant and diverse minds to make a real difference, there’s only one choice.  Field Sales Representative II - DEKALB/Asgrow - Eastern Iowa  Your Tasks And Responsibilities  As a Field Sales Representative for DEKALB/Asgrow you will be responsible for growing the market share of the Seed & Trait business covering the following counties in Eastern Iowa: Iowa, Johnson & Linn. In this position, you will create demand for Bayer Seed & Trait products through retailers and top growers. This role will report to the local Area Business Manager.  The primary responsibilities of this role, Field Sales Representative II, are to: Achieve assigned targets with Bayer products in coordination with pod-mates; Develop and implement dealer business plans, manage forecasting proactively, inventory management and product line demand issues, set the business direction, and coordinate follow-ups with dealers; Serve as the key business consultant to retailers and dealer and effectively sell the value of Bayer Crop Science products; Demonstrate proof of product performance against the competition by being the champion of Bayer brands and product/technical/agronomic knowledge; Collaborate with pod-mate Field Sales Representatives (FSRs), Customer Business Advisors (CBAs) and Bayer Agronomists and Technology Development Representatives (TDRs) to maximize services, information, and sales to preferred growers and key customer accounts; Actively manage inventory concerns as appropriate to ensure success of meeting business objectives; Gather, assimilate and analyze market and competitive information; Utilize data to make key decisions to drive the business; Follow set strategies for achieving long and short business plans for key accounts and assigned area; Effectively manage expenses, discretionary dollars and program payments per Bayer Crop Science policy; Show initiative in expanding selling skills and product/portfolio knowledge; Ensure achievement of program execution and program fulfillment including national/regional marketing initiatives; Partner successfully with pod-mate FSRs/CBAs and manage the relationship with top growers and retailers; Act as the business expert for top growers and retailers, while planning for customer business needs; Act as mentor to FSR interns, Trainees, or more junior FSRs as requested by leadership; Manage area claims per Bayer Crop Science policy and process through effective problem solving, execution, administration and resource management; Travel approximately 60%; Grow market share of Seed and Trait business and create demand for seed growth, seed and trait and chemistry within territory. Who You Are  Your success will be driven by your demonstration of our LIFE values. More specifically related to this position, Bayer seeks an incumbent who possesses the following:  Required Qualifications: At least three years of experience in sales, marketing, account management or agriculture; Excellent communication skills (interpersonal, oral and written); Demonstrated initiative, assertiveness, and ability to drive results; Strong business acumen, account planning, influencing and critical thinking skills; Financial, time and territory management proficiency; Proven ability to multi-task in a rapid-paced and matrixed environment; Strong computer and presentation skills (proficiencies in Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook); Demonstrated digital acumen and ability to analyze data to influence decisions; Willingness to travel and live/work in a rural environment; Proven interest in supporting collaboration and teamwork within a pod structure; Ability to pass driving record background check (moving violations, accidents, License suspension, etc.); Position requires driving for the company that may fall under DOT/FMCSA jurisdiction. This may entail the hauling of trailers, product, supplies or equipment in a safe manner. Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree; Demonstrated product, portfolio and agronomic knowledge. Domestic relocation may be available for this position.  YOUR APPLICATION  Bayer offers a wide variety of competitive compensation and benefits programs. If you meet the requirements of this unique opportunity, and want to impact our mission Science for a better life, we encourage you to apply now. Be part of something bigger. Be you. Be Bayer.  To all recruitment agencies: Bayer does not accept unsolicited third party resumes.  Bayer is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Disabled/Veterans  Bayer is committed to providing access and reasonable accommodations in its application process for individuals with disabilities and encourages applicants with disabilities to request any needed accommodation(s) using the contact information below.  Location: United States : Iowa : Residence Based  Division: Crop Science  Reference Code: 485848  Contact Us  Email: hrop_usa@bayer.com

description: Company Overview The Account Executive is responsible for executing the sales strategy to increase company market share through account development and educating the medical community on services provided by the company while operating within set budget. CHRISTUS Homecare, a part of LHC Group, is the preferred post-acute care partner for hospitals, physicians and families nationwide. From home health and hospice care to long-term acute care and community-based services, we deliver high-quality, cost-effective care that empowers patients to manage their health at home. Hospitals and health systems around the country have partnered with LHC Group to deliver patient-centered care in the home. More hospitals, physicians and families choose LHC Group, because we are united by a single, shared purpose: It's all about helping people. Essential Functions Achievement of monthly Personal Production Goals and MC admit budgets for assigned locations. Successfully executes a weekly, monthly, and quarterly strategy to increase market share through key account development including prospecting/diversification and call frequency/routing. Plans activity to maximize territory coverage of both existing and prospective accounts. Responsible for executing effective sales calls that identify and meet the needs of the referral community and clearly communicate the features and benefits of the LHC Group. These include pre and post call planning, establishing rapport, effective questioning skills, proposing solutions, handling objections and closing. Works closely with the Executive Director/Clinical Director to drive a vision of growth by focusing every team member on the needs and expectations of the referral community and patients. Responsible for all sales administration duties including, but not limited to, Playmaker, CRM expense entry compliance, BOA with associated Policies and Procedures, payroll time sheets, Weekly 3LS meetings with strategic updates, PTO requests, paperwork (485/F2F) delivery or pick-up when needed, timely cell phone and e-mail correspondence. Responsible for being a good steward of the company's financial resources by projecting a return on monies spent and managing to a Sales and Marketing expense budget. Knows the features and benefits of the services provided by LHC Group. Is able to articulate competitive advantages, specialty programs, and Medicare guidelines. Educates the medical community about the services of our organization through effective sales calls and in-services with the appropriate tools and literature. Any other tasks that are assigned. Education & Experience Formal Education: High School Diploma or equivalent required; Bachelor's Degree PreferredExperience Requirements Two to three years of prior successful Home Health or Hospice sales experience preferred.Skill Requirements Excellent presentation, negotiation and relationship-building skills required. Must have strong computer skills to meet Microsoft Outlook and CRM software requirements. Must have the ability to work independently with minimal supervision and be self motivated.

description: Being a part of the SHAiR Team SHAiR is an innovative, technology-focused team with our main focus on the User. We carefully select self-driven and forward-thinking go-getter attitudes. We aim to collaborate in all that we do, with teamwork being a key focus on how we operate. You will always know how your contributions relate to the big picture, no matter what department you work in. You will always be encouraged here and there is never a dull moment.  Your purpose at SHAiR The purpose here at SHAiR is to create a group of professionals that are the top leaders in our field, best of the best, who provide concierge-level service experience as the highest performing SHAiR Team Member in the marketplace to date. Taking on this role means committing yourself to daily rituals of training, dedication, growth, and continuous development.  ACCOUNT MANAGER The B2B team, known as our Sales Managers, is mainly responsible for building business-to-business partnerships, recruiting Echelon Hosts (super hosts; 10+ cars) in addition to booking rides. They are expected to bring in leads, close leads, and get referrals - all while creating raving fans! Account Managers lead the brand and spend a majority of their time prospecting for new Hosts, building partnerships, and booking rides. They are the sales and marketing experts!  Responsibilities:  Responsible for business to business partnerships Responsible for Host acquisitions Hit monthly targets and showcasing sales pipeline Organizing, building, and managing relationships through cold calls, warm calls, outbound chats, existing relationships Apply effective troubleshooting techniques under pressure Continuously evaluate User health and improve User engagement Develop and maintain a knowledge base of the evolving products and services Ensure the voice of the Echelon Host is heard throughout The Company Document and update User records based on interactions; record any information about activities and or accounts in the CRM systems Manage Echelon fleets Mandatory to become verified on the SHAiR app Mandatory to learn and understand SHAiR policies Mandatory to learn the functionality of SHAiR app Participate in daily training and role play   Professionally handle inbound and outbound communication with Users and addressing any issues Report to your Team Leader regularly, to discuss your presentation of ideas, initiatives, and status reports for achieving established goals and objectives Uphold SHAiR in a professional manner at all times; represent SHAiR in a positive light, help raise brand awareness and provide Users with a memorable face-to-face experience Complete and submit all paperwork and or reports required by SHAiR Comply with any and all applicable legal laws, regulations, and rules Comply with SHAiR’s established policies and procedures Read one book a month from Team Reads Build a world-class B2B sales team that solidifies SHAiR as the clear leader in the carsharing industry. Maintain and optimize an annual sales plan that includes a comprehensive set of targets, programs, budgets, staff, and KPIs that guide our efforts and outcomes Build and manage a highly effective, productive, and engaged team of diverse B2B sellers Ensure that shared pipeline and revenue goals between marketing and sales are exceeded on a regular basis Develop strong cross-functional partnerships across the organization, especially with sales, account management, product, consumer marketing, and brand development. Distill customer insights and market research to help inform new B2B products and services Clearly communicate progress against targets, especially as it relates to tracking pipeline and forecasting  Qualifications: Passionate about helping people become financially literate Passionate about cars Enjoys prospecting for new clients and meeting with existing clients  Proven sales experience, ideally 2-year minimum experience  Full-Time Availability, Tuesday- Saturday, 10 am - 6:30 pm  Business knowledge - experience in business to business sales or experience owning a business - cold calling experience is highly preferred Open to remote work and travel depending on business needs Strong speaking and negotiating skills Problem-solving skills Excellent customer service skills Thrives in an independent and team environment, meeting with business Hosts and entrepreneurs  Have a clean record - you’ll need to pass a criminal background check to work at SHAiR  Someone with management aspirations and/or experience A motivated self-starter

At Loxone we believe smart homes and building automation should be simple and affordable. We enable people to live and work happier, safer, and more comfortable lives in homes and buildings through the intelligent use of technology.  In just 7 years, we’ve sold over 150,000 Loxone Systems installed by our global network of 13,000 Partners. In our Philadelphia area Headquarters, you can take part in the expansion of our operations.  Your Responsibilities Assisting partners (electrical contractors, system integrators) in project design and execution through phone, video and email support Onboarding new Loxone partners to make them comfortable with the products Regularly connect with partners to build a trusting relationship with the Loxone brand Increasing revenue with the existing Loxone partner network by understanding your partners’ business Plan and design showrooms with our best partners What We Expect Passion for automation / smart home / intelligent buildings Technology & Sales enthusiasm Communication skills Electrical / Network / Programming skills Strong desire to learn We offer  Furthermore, We Offer  We are offering steep learning curve by starting your role off with a one-month training in Austria with all costs covered. Opportunity to travel to Europe: 1-month training course in Europe to learn everything about working in the role High paced and fun environment with plenty of potential avenues of growth within the company A competitive and fixed salary. Benefits include 401k, medical, dental and PTO Flexible working hours between 7am and 7pm An upbeat team in a growth environment We call ourselves the best workplace for performers. Do you want to know why? Then send us your CV.  After 10 years, Loxone has become a leading smart home and building automation company. We're rapidly growing in the US market, which is why we need you. Now is the perfect time to join us on our journey to change the way people enjoy life in homes and buildings.  Just this past year, we moved into our new, totally modern and automated smart office with European flair in the Greater Philadelphia area - lighting that turns on as you enter the room with colors that set to your liking, temperature that’s always just right, even a fireplace triggered by cold winter days - creating the optimal working environment. You’ll also get to occasionally visit our Loxone Show Home (mainly used for smart home tours) where we’ll get to share a few drinks and stories in matching green slippers (yes, we’re that cool). Of course, with lighting and audio paired to create the ideal mood.  We’ve also released some revolutionary products (you’ll learn all about those later) that are now winning prestigious awards. And the team? Just as awesome. You could become part of a supportive, savvy and upbeat squad that has what it takes to make some major wins.

This position aids in the overall objective of bringing meetings of all sizes, demographics, and interests to Nashville.   Essential Functions:  Responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:  Database Management Tracking interaction and client activity conducted by sales managers with accuracy in order to maintain accurate records and create an invaluable tool for the sales team. This includes building new convention accounts, creating new contacts, entering and issuing leads, updating lost business information Sending definite notifications to hotel and industry partners to ensure effective communication Generating reports for sales managers to communicate the current status of bookings  Communications Providing updates to sales managers when requested by maintaining a working knowledge of sales managers’ current bookings and client interests Preparing hotel matrices and documents that demonstrate Nashville’s availability/interest in hosting conventions Answering general questions for clients about their upcoming visit, hotel information, proposal information, etc. to aid in the communication efforts of the sales managers Sending marketing collateral to prospective clients to further assist in their decision to select Nashville as their convention host With sales managers’ direction, gathers additional information from hotel partners for updates to room blocks and rates   Proposals Assists sales managers in preparing proposals based on client’s specifications in order to demonstrate interest in bringing their convention to Nashville­­  Site Visits Assists sales managers in planning and scheduling client site visits to Nashville  Qualifications: ·        Education- High School Diploma or GED ·        Skills- Oral and written communication; exceptional customer service; organizational skills and basic computer skills ·        Experience- Experience working in hospitality preferred; Experience in meeting/event planning and community outreach preferred.   Competencies: Customer Service: Listens and responds effectively to client questions; resolves customer problems; exceeds customer’s expectations; uses a team approach to best service the client; follows up to evaluate and measure satisfaction. Relationship Management: Builds relationships with clients, vendors, community members and all organizational stakeholders; demonstrates credibility in all interactions; demonstrates the ability to effectively build a network of contacts. Fosters Teamwork: Has the ability to work with others on a team, offers support, provides assistance to others when needed.  Environmental Conditions and Physical Demands: Employee spends a considerable amount of time seated, working at a desk in front of a computer monitor.  Manual dexterity sufficient to reach/handle items, works with the fingers, and perceives attributes of objects and materials. Well-lighted, heated, and/or air-conditioned indoor office setting with adequate ventilation.  How to Apply for Consideration Email your resume, along with a cover letter to Katherine Jordan at katherinej@visitmusiccity.com no later than 5:00 PM CST on Friday, October 8, 2021. Resumes received after that time will not be accepted. All questions and inquiries must be submitted electronically to the email above. Questions, inquiries or resumes received in any other format or addressed to any other source will not be considered. Resumes are active 90 days from date of receipt and do not constitute an employment relationship. Statements and representations on documents submitted for consideration must be complete and accurate. The NCVC reserves the right to verify the completeness and accuracy of any and all statements and representations as well as conduct background and job related checks.  The NCVC is an at-will employer. As such, employment may terminate at any time by either party.

The Company eBrevia (eBrevia.com) is a fast-growing subsidiary of Donnelley Financial Solutions (DFIN), providing advanced natural language processing (NLP) technology and tools for law firms, audit and consulting firms, and corporations to automate the reading and summarization of legal documents. eBrevia’s products have a wide range of applications, including due diligence, contract and knowledge management, and lease abstraction.  We are designing the next wave of legal software—artificially intelligent systems that actively assist the lawyer, using machine learning, NLP, and data mining to help them make sense of reams of information, all within a slick, web-based UI running on a scalable cloud backend.  Recently acquired, eBrevia maintains a nimble startup culture while leveraging the resources of an innovative market-leading public company as it continues to rapidly scale.  Position Description eBrevia is seeking a Sales Manager to lead and grow a team of new Sales Representatives within North America. You should have strong interpersonal skills, a desire to help customers achieve their business goals, and a passion for finding and developing key talent. Candidates should be comfortable wearing a variety of hats and adding value in multiple ways throughout the organization. This position reports into the President, eBrevia globally.  Responsibilities Build relationships and sell consultatively to drive buying decisions of C-level executives, lawyers, knowledge managers, and IT professionals. Recruit, train, and develop a successful team of Sales Representatives.  Coach, mentor and manage individual team members to maximize their strengths and exceed Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) targets. Create and execute the go-to-market and operational strategies to achieve business objectives. Focus the team to acquire new logos as well as close additional license agreements with new divisions or offices of existing global clients. Provide reps with the tools, strategies, and frameworks to achieve sales targets. Deliver ongoing coaching and training in sales skills, solution selling, value selling, and both technological and competitive trends.  Prepare regular and accurate sales pipeline and sales forecast reports for senior management. Develop key sales metric measurements for your team and senior leadership. Understand customer and market trends and maintain an in-depth knowledge of all key competitors. Work cross-functionally with other department leaders to advocate for customer needs and identify actionable strategies and initiatives that enable accelerated revenue expansion.   Qualifications Bachelor's degree coupled with a minimum of 7 years of experience in selling $50k - $500k-sized SaaS products into enterprise accounts; Legal SaaS sales experience highly preferred. Solid skillset in navigating procurement, security, and legal departments as well as other gatekeepers at prospective clients. 5+ years of SaaS sales leadership experience which could be in a player coach capacity. Proven experience leading Sales reps through changing environments.  Pedigree of working deals across different buyers, organization divisions, and seniority levels. Experience developing go-to-market strategies for new and innovative products. Track record of exceeding annual quotas/targets. Demonstrated skill in mentoring and coaching sales representatives. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, ability to work collaboratively and take ownership.  Experience managing multiple enterprise sales simultaneously and working in a team environment.  It is the policy of Donnelley Financial Solutions to select, place and manage all its employees without discrimination based on race, color, national origin, gender, age, religion, actual or perceived disability, veteran's status, actual or perceived sexual orientation, genetic information or any other protected status.  If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access jobs.dfinsolutions.com as a result of your disability. You can request a reasonable accommodation by sending an email to AccommodationRequests@dfinsolutions.com.

description: About Us: TTI is fast-paced, our team is high energy, and we reward out-of-the-box thinking to foster innovation in order to be the best in our industry. We provide a multi-faceted training program and hands-on field experience that will stimulate, challenge and reward you!    Duties and Responsibilities: - Perform best-in-class sales and service to consumers while demonstrating knowledge and enthusiasm for TTi products. - Maximize sell through of TTI Power Tool brands by properly merchandising point of purchase material. - Support and implement strategic corporate brand marketing initiatives and promotional activities. - Strengthen and maintain positive relationships with customers, Team TTi Management, and major retail account. - Maintain regular contact with assigned major retail account associates and management to cultivate strong relationships. - Monitor weekly sales and analyze monthly results to identify additional opportunities and understand the competition. - Participate in the training program and implement all acquired skills to deliver results. - Initiate and provide in-store product training sessions and demonstrations to educate store associates, management and customers. - Professionally communicate with all peers, customers and management. - Plan and execute demo events, stores walks, trade shows, etc. - Develop primary knowledge of the market place (users, applications, products, competition, and channels) to effectively analyze market potential and communicate competitor market data.  Note: Employee's duties and responsibilities are not limited by the above. Other duties may be assigned as deemed necessary by employee's supervisor. In addition to the basic requirements of the position, all employees are expected to meet the company's goals of continual improvement in the areas of knowledge, skills, processes and quality.  Education and Experience Requirements - Bachelor degree or equivalent work experience in retail sales, field sales or customer service required. - Valid driver's license required. - Relocation may be required for future promotional opportunities. - Ability to work nights and weekends. - Capable of lifting and transporting heavy tools (up to 50 lbs.) and requesting assistance as needed. Capable of reaching and/or lifting overhead in addition to ascending/descending ladders to move product.  - Capable of using hands to maneuver small objects, assemble tools and build displays. - Applicant should be self-motivated and a team player with strong organizational, planning and time management skills. - Applicant must be MS Office proficient.

Auxitrol Weston  Sales Manager  Auxitrol Weston welcomes people who share our determination and high standards to join us in doing work that moves the world forward. We design, manufacture, and market highly engineered products and systems principally for the aerospace and defense markets. Auxitrol Weston is a wholly-owned subsidiary of TransDigm.    Company Profile Company Name: Auxitrol Weston, a subsidiary of TransDigm. Industry: Aerospace/Defense Products & Services Number of Employees: @50  Job Overview Title: Sales Manager Job Family: Sales Reports to: Sales Director Works with: Senior staff, mid-level managers and supervisors Location: East Coast (Connecticut) Type: Full-Time, Remote  Job Summary Adopt, implement and oversee activities designed to promote the successful sales of Auxitrol Weston for the assigned accounts. Administer sales programs designed to maximize customer satisfaction. Provide support to the Account Director to assist in the delivery of business development targets within the assigned accounts. Primary Responsibilities As required and in line with the Advanced Sensors’ applicable processes, take ownership and accountability for the following: ·      Develop new business in line with the Auxitrol Weston’s Strategy for the assigned accounts ·      Once new business opportunities are identified, present and agree them as confirmed targets with the relevant Account Director. ·      Once new opportunities are agreed as confirmed targets, work in the scope of the applicable process to prepare the proposal. ·      Ensure close liaison with the assigned Project Manager throughout the Win New Business process; lead coordination meetings as required; define the bid submission requirements and timescales; prepare the commercial bid response seeking the relevant approvals. ·      Gather inputs (e.g. costs, volumes, timescales, etc.) and cooperate with Finance and Account Director to prepare the business plan and adjust pricing. Then seek the relevant approvals. ·      Review and negotiate commercial terms as agreed with the Account Director & Contracts Manager. ·      Be accountable for providing all required information for the transition to the NPI (New Product Introduction) phase on a timely basis with sufficient level of details to ensure a clear handover.  For projects in the NPI phase and in line with the Advanced Sensors’ applicable processes, take ownership and accountability for the following: ·      Participate as a core member of the NPI process, delivering 100% of the requested project information to the Project team within agreed timescales. ·      Ensure the commercial requirements are up to date, clear and available when required throughout the project (eg. PO’s, terms and conditions and pricing). ·      Completion of assigned tasks according to the agreed project timescales. ·      Manage the overall customer relationship whilst working with the Project Manager who will act as customer contact on project specific issues. ·      Provide the commercial input to the business plan (e.g. price, volumes, timescales, etc.). Notify changes to the Project Manager who will liaise with Finance to update the business plan. The Project Manager will seek the relevant approvals.  For the assigned accounts: ·      Prepare, within required timescale, accurate budget and forecasts revisions (FRQ) for the assigned accounts ·      Provide along the fiscal year comments about variances as required ·      Provide support to the Account Director in designing a long term strategy for the assigned accounts. ·      Maintain an accurate five year forecast. ·      Obtain continuous new bookings from the assigned accounts and achieve budgeted sales, both in revenue and margin terms. ·      Evaluate market opportunities keeping management informed of current trends and competitors’ activities in the market place. ·      Identify opportunities to leverage products and technologies across Auxitrol Weston. Manage the assigned account relationships; prepare for and manage customer meetings; clearly communicate customer issues; recommend actions and ensure follow-through on agreed actions. ·      Maintain customer and program related commercial records. ·      Provide reporting to the Account Director as required ·      Prepare and participate in trade shows as necessary. ·      Travel within the agreed territory in support of assigned sales objectives and responsibilities whilst complying with the Advanced Sensors’ travel policy. ·      Conduct purchase order and contract reviews as required and in accordance with all relevant company procedures.  Auxitrol Weston Competencies ·       Customer Focus Knows and understands the needs of internal and external customers. Is results oriented and works hard to consistently provide exceptional service. ·       Ethics and Values Adheres to an effective set of core values and beliefs and acts in accordance. Rewards the right values and disapproves of others. ·       Problem Solving Looks beyond the obvious to find effective solutions. ·       Integrity and Trust Widely trusted and seen as direct and truthful. ·       Functional/Technical Skills Possesses the skills to be effective in the job. Has the skills to perform the job at a high level of accomplishment. ·       Listening Practices active and attentive listening, able to hear others. ·       Action-oriented Full of energy, willing to take action. ·       Composure Cool under pressure, not knocked off balance by the unexpected, is a settling influence ·       Values Diversity Supports fair and equal treatment for all.  Auxitrol Weston is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other trait or characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.  Education/Previous Experience Requirements ·     3 years direct sales experience * 7+ years experience in OEM sales in the aerospace industry, aftermarket a plus ·     Degree complete (4 years or over). Technical, engineering, or business degree is preferred. ·     Demonstrates knowledge of sales, business principles, practices and operations as typically acquired by a college degree or the equivalent in related work experience. ·     Good technical knowledge with a working understanding of the technologies available within Auxitrol Weston. ·     Depending on account responsibilities have knowledge and understanding of contract and order fulfillment policies (FAR, JAR). ·     Demonstrates clear and effective oral and written communications with fluency in English. ·     Demonstrates good organizational skills and the ability to prioritize work effectively. ·     Must be able to effectively work to deadlines and submit reports and other related work in a timely manner. ·     Confidentiality is important as the position interfaces with all levels of management and staff. ·     Fluent in Microsoft Office. ·     As travel is required within the assigned area, a valid driver’s license and good driving record are required.  Work Hours 40 hour work week with time to complete duties as required, with up to 50% travel.  Questions? email hr.us@auxitrolweston.com or call (714) 736-7350

Destined Consulting Solutions is an up and coming event marketing agency, is looking for 3-5 energetic, Entry Level Brand Communications Assistants to join their growing team. This individual will support the agency’s business development efforts including planning promotional events for various clientele, preparation for client pitches and events, as well as execution of various on site events in the area. In addition, this person will also support our Brand Marketing team.  The individual we are looking for must be self-directed, able to multitask and prioritize. Excellent organizational and project management skills are a must as the support of in-house new business systems and on-site promotional events will be the main responsibility of this person. The ability to communicate essential information in an organized, logical way is also integral to the role. The ideal candidate is able to handle a variety of work, both in type and in quantity, and has the ability to collaborate with people at all levels of the organization.  DCS is a fast-paced, work hard, play hard environment. We value teamwork and collaboration, and we all chip in and roll up our sleeves to deliver the best work. Knowing that our employees are our most valuable asset, we work hard to maintain a positive and creative work environment - from being dog friendly, to having monthly happy hours, to providing catered lunches.  Do you have the passion and talent to be a member of our team?  Responsibilities Assist with the development and execution of promotional campaigns for various clientele Build and manage relationships with potential customers and clients Work strategically with the sales team in a business development and lead generation capacity Potentially help manage and oversee a campaign and team of associates Requirements Excellent research and writing skills, and strong communication skills Laser-focus attention to detail, be well organized and have the ability to juggle and prioritize multiple, competing tasks Must be a creative thinker Able to synthesize ideas and develop concepts and trends from information given Demonstrate poise, diplomacy, ambition Be proactive, eager and have a professional demeanor Passionate self starter who can work independently and work well under pressure Must be able to travel locally around the local area
