description: Company Info  Teva is a global pharmaceutical leader and the world's largest generic medicines producer, committed to improving health and increasing access to quality health solutions worldwide. Our employees are at the core of our success, with colleagues in over 80 countries delivering the world's largest medicine cabinet to 200 million people every day. We offer a uniquely diverse portfolio of products and solutions for patients and we've built a promising pipeline centered around our core therapeutic areas. We are continually developing patient-centric solutions and significantly growing both our generic and specialty medicines business through investment in research and development, marketing, business development and innovation. This is how we improve health and enable people to live better, healthier lives. Join us on our journey of growth!  Job Description  The ISRII is responsible for growing ANDA’s landscape nationally through various sales methods. Incumbent will be responsible for achieving their individual assigned pharmacy sales goals/KPI’s via national outbound and inbound telephone calls for the purpose of selling ANDA products and services. Expectation to add incremental value to ANDA’s AOP and market share. The incumbent will use consultative selling techniques to increase business with existing customers while procuring new business opportunities. Ability to execute new business opportunities on behalf of the organization. Specialties in supply chain include, but are not limited to vaccine, medical surgical products, surgical supplies, generic items, brand items, vet meds and consumer products.  Essential Areas Of Responsibility  All areas of responsibility listed below are essential to the satisfactory performance of this position by any incumbents with reasonable accommodation if necessary. Any non-essential functions are assumed to be included in other related duties or assignments. Initiates and answers inbound and/or outbound sales calls directly from/to prospective and/or existing customers with strong focus on new business development. Accepts orders, closes sales, maintains customer records, and completes required documentation. May have an assigned product line that may overlap other sales teams' territories. May have an individual or team sales/KPI quota and is likely to have a target earnings bonus or sales incentive opportunity Delivers differentiated value to customers through a growing understanding of the unique needs of customer segments and apply a sales execution model that is consultative and solution-focused. Responsible for analyzing and executing customer program metrics. Consistently demonstrates knowledge and expertise as it relates to industry standards and the growing marketplace changes. Identifies growth opportunities within organization and customers business models. Utilizes all analytic tools provided to them. Highly Proficient in your assigned segment of Pharmaceutical Sales. Carries out responsibilities in accordance with the organization’s policies, procedures, and state, federal and local laws with upholding company core values. Continuously promotes, enhances and maximizes ANDA’s e-commerce capabilities. Key stakeholder in market intelligence. Assists Sales Managers achieve/exceed established daily and monthly productivity goals. High Level of expertise in partnerships with focus on expansion of current program relationships. Ability to work assigned projects and campaigns efficiently and with a high level of success. Works well under minimum supervision. Must be flexible with work schedule. Shifts include 10am-7pm, 11am-8pm or 12pm-9pm. You will be expected to work one Saturday shift every 5 weeks from 10am-3pm.  Qualifications  Any equivalent combination of education, training, and/or experience that fulfills the requirements of the position will be considered.  Education/Certification/Experience Minimum of 5 years of proven successful sales experience Bachelor’s Degree with a minimum of 1 year of related experience; preferably in the pharmaceuticals, Medical or Vet industry; or equivalent combination of education and related experience Skills/Knowledge/Abilities Pharmaceutical/Medical/Healthcare experience preferred Demonstrate a complete understanding of internal systems that include but are not limited to Remedy (CMR) and TPS Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, Teams and PowerPoint) Has general awareness of business, financials, products/services and the market. Function  Sales  Sub Function  Telesales  Already Working @TEVA?  If you are a current Teva employee, please apply using the internal career site available on "Employee Central". By doing so, your application will be treated with priority. You will also be able to see opportunities that are open exclusively to Teva employees. Use the following link to search and apply: Internal Career Site  The internal career site is available from your home network as well. If you have trouble accessing your EC account, please contact your local HR/IT partner.  Teva’s Equal Employment Opportunity Commitment  Teva Pharmaceuticals is committed to equal opportunity in employment. It is Teva's global policy that equal employment opportunity be provided without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, disability, pregnancy, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, ancestry, veteran status, national or ethnic origin or any other legally recognized status entitled to protection under applicable laws.We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to support you throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience. description: As a Sales Manager, Strategic Accounts You Will As a Sales Executive, Strategic Accounts - North America you will be responsible for generating new revenue from our top accounts: creating, cultivating and developing accounts. You will be expected to exceed revenue goals by planning and executing successful sales within top-tier companies. You will be responsible for acquiring and possessing expert knowledge of all companies solutions. On a day to day you will: Meet and exceed sales quota through outbound work - strategically selling the company’s various solutions to new prospects in a consultative manner Management of entire sales cycle from prospecting, discovery, presentation, negotiating and closing Working closely with the Sales Development and Marketing teams to target appropriate accounts Build cross functional relationships in order to penetrate the account further by focusing on executive engagement Develop accurate forecasts and manage sales activity in CRM Requirements 5+ years online sales experience in sales and online marketing. You are a high performer with experience of exceeding sales targets with an established network of contacts High integrity, energy and dedication. We are looking for uncommonly good sales professionals with a highly collaborative, value-driven, honest and direct approach Excellent communication and presentation skills. Documented success in high-end SaaS sales. The ideal candidate will have experience client-direct sales and be highly successful at running consultative sales processes in large, complex prospect organizations. Experience in presenting to and interacting with senior management of prospect organizations. Ideally a deep understanding of current digital marketing including display advertising, SEO, SEM, Affiliates and Content marketing Ideally experience of working in a hyper-growth or start-up business Ideally experience of taking a new, disruptive technology to market HireResources recruiters are not generalists; they are specialists in their industries providing quick access to industry top talent in select industry sectors. We speak your language and understand the factors critical to your business. Each HireResources Sector Team has a specialized target recruitment function. In fact, if we do not have expertise in your industry, we will let you know this upfront.  HireResources was established in 2002, in 2015 we began a growth phase by restructuring our core business, today, HireResources is a fast-growing Staffing & Recruitment platform headquartered in Connecticut. HireResources is an open source staffing and recruiting model giving flexibility and support to top executive recruiters across the country. HireResources recruiters are thoroughly vetted and are proven professionals in the recruiting industry.

description: We are currently seeking a self motivated experienced Sales Rep for our Dealer's Choice branch in Nashville, TN.  Beacon Dealers Choice is a vibrant and fast-paced environment where self-motivation, passion and resourcefulness are rewarded. We are one of the largest distributors of residential and non-residential roofing and complementary building products in North America. Beacon currently has over 500 locations throughout the US and 6 Canadian provinces with more than 7,000 employees. We are known throughout the building supply industry for having the best team, integrity, exceptional service and quality building products.  Beacon Building Products is publicly traded on the NASDAQ stock market under the symbol BECN. In June of 2006, Beacon Building Products was named to the NASDAQ Global Select Market.  We are looking for bright minds that share a passion for outside sales and can deliver on expectations. If you are ready for this challenge, please apply today!  Our Ideal Candidate Will Meet or exceed the sales and margin expectations for the assigned territory. Have experience in 2-step selling. Develop new business opportunities through cold calls and lead generation. Use Salesforce, Cognos, and Mincron reports available to help manage a sales territory. Use the necessary phone and field selling skills to sell our products and services to our customers. Build strong customer relationships. Exceed the overall performance and development of assigned and newly assigned accounts. Develop and execute a comprehensive monthly and annual sales plan for the assigned territory to service and expand our business with existing and new customers. Coordinate closely with our inside sales support team and our vendors to plan and execute the promotion of products and services to customers. Organize sales activities so that face to face selling time to the customer is maximized. Demonstrate solid business sales acumen and professionalism to make a positive impact on all prospects and customers. Maintain social, ethical and organization values of Beacon. Conduct business activity, at all times, in a manner consistent with the company's corporate culture. Drive sales growth through consistent daily effort. Minimum Requirements Demonstrated record of year over year sales growth. Proven ability to develop new business while maintaining existing business. 4 year degree preferred but not required. Experience in residential or commercial sales is a plus, but not required. Sales, business management or distribution industries experience preferred. Proficiency in Microsoft Outlook, Internet, Word and Excel. Can gain agreement and acceptance of ideas, plans activities and recommendations. Creates a good first impression, commands attention and respect, and shows an air of confidence. Can demonstrate versatility. Is a self-starter. Will take action to achieve goals. Copes well in competitive sales situations with little supervision and possesses strong negotiation skills. Maintains an acceptable driving safety record.
industries: Construction and Building Materials

description: About Us  When pilots practice flying airplanes, they use flight simulators. When doctors train, they use models of bodies. When engineers design, they test their ideas in silico before sending them to the factory. When organizations test product development, marketing plans, and business strategies, they use Concentric Market™.  Concentric Market®, is a business simulation application that unifies a company’s analytics, forecasts customer and competitor outcomes, and automates the strategic planning process. With multi-year customers like Toyota, Microsoft, Whirlpool, and Scripps, we know our product works and delivers value that is unique.  About The Position  The ideal candidate is looking to gain exposure within a growing sales team at growth technology company. Daily you will: Work with the VP of Sales to provide administrative support for the sales team. Support the VP of Operations administratively. Be the keeper of all up-to-the minute information on sales opportunities. Attend all sales meetings to accurately capture information, record and assign follow-ups and be responsible for documenting them in Salesforce.com. Monitor Salesforce.com to ensure it has the most up to date information and representation of the current sales environment. Work to become a certified Salesforce Administrator to eventually assume all responsibilities of the Salesforce administration for Concentric. Necessary course provided by Concentric. Manage travel for the team when necessary. Be the go to thought leader on new and emerging technology that will provide the sales team with increased efficiency and success. Experience High-level proficiency in Microsoft Office. Salesforce.com CRM exposure a plus. Associates or Bachelors degree. The ideal candidate  A curious mind with exposure to a broad range of ideas. You must be looking for a strong culture that enriches people, builds teams, drives efficiency, and relies on scientific methods to make decisions. We are based in Cambridge, MA and enjoy being a scaling entrepreneurial business. If you are ready to join a team of trailblazers, disrupt industries, work hard and enjoy the rewards of building value over time, please contact us.  About Us  When pilots practice flying airplanes, they use flight simulators. When doctors train, they use models of bodies. When engineers design, they test their ideas in silico before sending them to the factory. When organizations test product development, marketing plans, and business strategies, they use Concentric MarketTM.  Concentric Market®, is a business simulation application that unifies a company’s analytics, forecasts customer and competitor outcomes, and automates the strategic planning process. With multi-year customers like Toyota, Microsoft, Whirlpool, and Scripps, we know our product works and delivers value that is unique.

description: At Tarkett we embrace every opportunity to improve and grow as a Group together. Our teams draw on our global strengths, working closely with customers to adapt how we design, produce and deliver integrated flooring solutions locally. We invite you to step into our world and EXPAND YOUR HORIZONS WITH US!  Position Summary  Tarkett has an exciting new opportunity for a Territory Sales Representative (TSR). The Territory Sales Representative develops new prospects and interacts with existing customers to increase sales of the organization's products and/or services. The TSR will become familiar with a variety of the field's concepts, practices, and procedures and will rely on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. The TSR will perform a variety of complicated tasks, may direct and lead the work of others, and typically reports to a manager or head of a unit/department. A successful Territory Sales Representative will have a wide degree of creativity and latitude.  Essential Duties & Responsibilities Work closely with Regional Business Manager and Distribution to achieve annual/quarterly sales budgets, market share, gross margin and key account growth targets Generate pull-through demand in local market place, primarily by focusing on selling activities in retail flooring stores, including Product Training, Display Placement, Merchandise Updates and Sales Performance reviews with store management Create and sell territory specific promotions and merchandising programs Execute sales blitzes and product launches Develop Territory account list prioritized by volume including Key Accounts, and Buying Groups Provide weekly sales and market updates for Regional Business Manager, including competitive activity, product trends, promotional activity and progress toward KPIs Conduct regular product training sessions for Distributor Sales Reps and Retail Store Associates Create productive, effective and mutually satisfactory long-term business relationships with Distributor Sales Representatives Participate in Distributor and Retailer sales and marketing events Represent Tarkett in a professional manner when engaging retailers, distributors or consumers Attention to Personal Development Plan REQUIREMENTS (including Educational Requirements) Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing or other related field preferred; or equivalent combination of education and experience Minimum of 4-6 years sales experience Overnight travel is required (up to 75%) By joining us, you will be part of an international culture where you can expand your horizons, change the game and design the future of society. And where our values of collaboration, creativity, commitment and caring underpin our success .  Come and see how is life at Tarkett!  https://careers.tarkett.com/en/home.html

DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE · 4+ years of successful sales experience with a proven track record of moving clients through the funnel. Healthcare insurance benefits, technology, SaaS, or banking experience preferred. · Motivated to gain deep understanding of Ocozzio client verticals and willingness to prospect and cold call daily · Must be able to establish and maintain rapport with C-suite professionals · Highly motivated to succeed and ability to work autonomously · Able to initiate and manage sales process through to closing ·  Ability to work with Ocozzio leadership to grow business relationships and develop outbound Ocozzio marketing  ·  Excellent interpersonal, communication, presentation and organization skills · Knowledge of MS Office software and CRM software · Must be self-motivated, proactive and comfortable working with a diverse team in a dynamic, fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment · Must be well-organized and able to perform under pressure and manage numerous prospects effectively · Personable with the ability to relate with customers and co-employees · Bachelor’s degree required · Up to 60% travel   RESPONSIBILITIES · Continually develop prospect list of businesses that need marketing and sales capabilities · Manage all elements of sales campaigns helping to generate new leads through email, direct mail, LinkedIn, etc · Effectively vet prospects to identify long-term financial viability · Initiate, manage and document sales process with C-suite professionals through CRM · Provide monthly reporting on current sales funnel  · Arrange sales meetings and travel to meet prospects and clients as needed · Attend all industry conferences, arrange sales meetings and gain prospects at events · Develop strong partnerships with account, strategy, creative and executive teams to enhance Ocozzio’s brand message · Work closely with Ocozzio leadership to ensure client implementation process goes smoothly   Apply today - send your resume and cover letter to jobs@ocozzio.com.

Job Description Commercial Operations Specialist role combines supporting Sales account management, customer service, and problem resolution. Sales interactions include providing contract data for both inventory and pricing, updating system data points,communicating information proactively, supporting our customers both internal and external and act as a general support profession for the Commercial Operations Team. This is a 12+ month contract opportunity with the potential to evolve into permanent placement. Who: Looking for hard working sales support professionals who thrive in a fast-paced, immediate response environment. People who can interpret information quickly, clearly, and accurately and communicate in response to our extensive Sales Team requests. Need to have the ability to document and organize with a high attention to detail; have excellent written and verbal communication skills, and can exercise tact, discretion, and judgement in accordance with legal, ethical, and financial standards. Must possess an ability to prioritize work and keep themselves self-motivated to get the job done and ask for more. What: Commercial Operations partners with Field Sales as a service and support partner to resolve requests for inventory, pricing, and ad hoc requests regarding order management. Provide timely and high-quality (check twice) service and communication. You are here to make their world easier. A broad array of issues may arise for resolution; or there may be a repetitive data entry need. Inventory reviews, pricing reconciliations, retrieve/generate documents as needed. High demand, hands on, 40 hour work week. Desk job, virtual training, in office/remote environment depending upon geographic location. 8 hour work shift, Monday to Friday. Provide best-in-class customer service, meet turn time expectations, work as part of a team. Demonstrate effective organizational, analytical, and independent judgement skills. Possess the ability to work simultaneously on phones, email, and system applications. Qualifications Want: High School diploma required; Bachelor’s Degree strongly preferred Business office experience in Customer Service or Sales Support preferred Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and basic PowerPoint) Experience with Oracle, SAP, or similar Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) software preferred. Must be able to understand the major responsibilities of accurate and timely communication. Foster a culture of compliance by operating within guidelines and procedures, lead by example and focus on risk elimination. Company is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and is dedicated to helping healthcare professionals perform their jobs more efficiently while enhancing patient care. Offering a diverse array of innovative medical technologies, including reconstructive, medical and surgical, and neuro-technology & spine products to help people lead more active and more satisfying lives

description: Company Description  Are you looking for a brand that will invest in you and your career?  Do you enjoy working as part of a team?  Could you make the difference to a customer’s day?  If you answered yes - we would love to hear from you... Here at COS we are recruiting a Sales Associate to join our amazing team in Newbury St - Boston, MA!  About COS…  COS is a fashion brand for women and men who want timeless, modern, functional and considered design. Offering reinvented classics and wardrobe essentials, we create pieces that are made to last beyond the season. Since launching in 2007 we have opened stores in over 40 countries worldwide, all in carefully considered locations, applying a design concept that preserves the buildings’ original features whilst creating a modern, contemporary space.  Job Description  About the role…  Although every day will be different, some of the things that you will do regularly include: Offering customers a high level of service, through styling advice, product knowledge and store experience Processing deliveries & stock replenishment Assisting with day to day running of the store Being a COS brand ambassador and providing the best experience for our customers Qualifications  About you...  To work as a sales associate, we look for people with the qualities below; Customer focused Self-motivated & positive Adaptable A genuine interest in others Open to learn about and sell our products Flexible availability, including weekends and evenings Additional Information  Why choose COS?  When you first join COS we will give you a full introduction, excellent training, and a mentor that will support you during your first days, weeks and months. In addition to this you will also receive lots of fantastic benefits including; 25% staff discount Up to $400 per year clothing allowance Company Vacation Pay Company wellness pay H&M Incentive plan (HIP/ESOP) Employee assistance program (EAP) Our Culture  Over the last 10 years we have carefully built a culture where our people are supported, inspired and encouraged to be the best they can. Our brand is creative, forward thinking and modern; choosing longevity over passing trends.  We set the bar high at COS; we are committed to recruiting great people, offering an environment where talent is recognized and valued. We believe that a diverse workforce plays an important role in the success of COS. We celebrate individual differences and appreciate the contribution that all our colleagues make.  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEOC guidelines.  EEO Classification: SLS

description: Who We Are:  Aviatrix is a well-funded, pre-IPO, hyper-growth enterprise-software company based in the heart of Silicon Valley (Santa Clara, CA). Aviatrix technology has proven solid at scale with nearly 600 enterprise customers, over 40 of the Global Fortune 500. We have a top-tier, experienced leadership team, combined with a collaborative culture built on proven success, trust, execution, and respect. We’re focused on getting things done!  Read recent article published in Bloomberg on Aviatrix’s incredible rise in value  What We Do:  Aviatrix is networking for the cloud era , delivering a superset of features and capabilities that leverage and control native cloud constructs and add advance network, security and operational visibility features that cloud providers lack, while maintaining the simplicity and automation enterprises expect in cloud. Aviatrix offers the industry’s first and only multi-cloud networking certification ( ACE ), empowering IT to lead and accelerate the transformation to the cloud.  ABOUT THE ROLE:  We are looking for an ambitious Sales Development Representative to join our cutting-edge Sales team! We have immediate openings for Sales Development Representative(s) that are eager to drive revenue growth for the company and be part of our Marketing and Sales teams. Your role will be to seek new Aviatrix business opportunities by contacting and developing relationships with potential customers.  To be successful in this role, you should have previous experience developing leads from marketing campaigns and meeting sales quotas. You understand that in this role relentless activity is what drives results, and you’ll use your communication skills to cultivate strong relationships with customers.  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Qualify leads from marketing campaigns as sales opportunities Execute the required prospecting activity to meet lead goals Contact potential clients through cold calls and emails Present Aviatrix to potential clients Identify client needs and suggest appropriate products/services Partner with sales to prospect key targets, follow up and adhere to sales processes Proactively seek new business opportunities in the market Set up meetings or calls between (prospective) clients and Aviatrix’s Account Executives. Document activity in Salesforce.com; communicate qualitative information as needed Report to the VP of Marketing on (weekly/monthly/quarterly) sales results  KEY REQUIREMENTS: 1-5 years proven work experience as a SDR, Inside Sales or similar role Hands-on experience with multiple sales techniques (including cold calls) Track record of achieving sales quotas through executing activity Experience with CRM software (e.g. Salesforce) Familiarity with MS Excel (analyzing spreadsheets and charts) Understanding of sales performance metrics Excellent communication and negotiation skills Ability to deliver engaging presentations Fundamental understanding of network technology concepts desired, not mandatory BS or BA degree in Marketing, Business Administration or relevant field  Aviatrix, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and does not make hiring decisions based on race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.  This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

description: WHY WE'RE LOOKING FOR YOU  Last year we built a small sales team and grew our revenue 3x. We’ve learned a lot, iterated rapidly on our process and approach, and added many customers to the Retool community.  Our revenue and business goals this year are aggressive, and we’re laser-focused on scaling our hiring, our processes, and our team. The problems Retool solves are varied and the customers we work with span every vertical and hundreds of use cases. We’re looking for a leader who knows how to build and scale world-class sales organizations to help us further accelerate our growth this year and beyond.  What You'll Do  You’ll be an integral part of the Sales leadership team targeting SMB, mid-market, and enterprise accounts. You’ll lead a team of highly motivated account executives and focus on coaching and developing the team, running strategic sales cycles to establish new customer relationships, and partnering cross-functionally to grow our footprint across our existing customer base. You’ll bring vision, purpose, and drive to the team while helping us refine our go-to-market strategy across the business.  You’ll also help us as we scale the Sales team to capture the market opportunity at Retool, by leading the team -- you will hire, coach, and help execute as we work with the team and broader company to accelerate our platform sales.  Who You'll Work With  In this role, you’ll collaborate closely with our Sales leadership team across Sales Engineering, Operations, and Sales Development to shape the vision and direction of sales at Retool. You’ll also work highly cross-functionally with Recruiting, Engineering, Marketing, Success, and Support. And, of course, you’ll be working with, and managing, the growing Account Executive team.  We are a team that is passionate about serving our customers and who love collaborating with each other to build an organization and company from the ground up. We’re building a winning, fun, and high ownership culture to propel this company forward, and we’re looking for someone who shares that vision with us.  In This Role, You'll Determine staffing levels to support annual goals, establish job descriptions, recruit new Account Executives, and lead the recruiting process to shape and grow the team. Assess go-to-market readiness across our sales team, identify gaps in our approach, and build new process to ensure the team is properly trained/equipped to successfully perform against our goals. Engage at the executive level in key deals (from venture backed high growth technology companies to Fortune 500 accounts) to build trust with customers and grow key relationships in accounts. Motivate individuals and team to exceed targets through coaching and mentorship. Accurately forecast your business to guide focus across Sales Development, Marketing, and Success. Identify, qualify, and help accelerate business opportunities through partnerships with Sales Development, Sales Engineering, and Marketing. THE SKILLSET YOU'LL BRING: 5+ years of increasing go-to-market responsibility and 3+ years of sales leadership experience, ideally selling to both high growth and enterprise accounts 3+ years managing technical and non-technical teams of 8+ people Experience working with large, Fortune 500 businesses A savviness for developer products or experience selling developer tools Demonstrated track record of hiring, training, and leading top-tier Account Executives and high performing teams History of consistently exceeding targets Capable of thinking strategically to build a team and tactical enough to execute on a day-to-day basis Excellent communication, organizational, and analytical skills Retool is the fast way of building internal tools through our low-code drag-and-drop platform. We were founded in 2017 and graduated from YC the same year. Our Series A was led by Sequoia and we're backed by Daniel Gross ), John and Patrick Collison of Stripe, and Elad Gil, among others.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: About Meg At Meg our mission is to create global citizens through language and intercultural experiences. Our primary service is our K-12 Mandarin and Spanish programs. We connect classrooms with professional teachers in Latin America and China who deliver our Spanish and Mandarin language and culture courses over video conference into the classroom. We operate in the US, UK, Australia, and New Zealand and teach over 50,000 K-12 students a week.  Does this sound like you? We’re seeking an empathetic, passionate and highly motivated SDR to support Business Development and to manage Lead Generation into K-12 schools. This person ideally has 1-2 years of sales experience, pursuing a full-time career in Sales, has a knack for building rapport quickly with others and has a personal story grounded in cross-cultural experiences. If you have a knack for nitty gritty, get your hands dirty prospecting campaigns, this might be the role for you.  Main Responsibilities Researching K-12 market and target market profile schools, districts, and networks Attending various lead generation conferences, webinars, mixers, and events Developing and executing cold call, Email, and social media lead generation campaigns Securing qualified leads for demonstrations of Spanish and Mandarin classes Building a book of relevant targets and maintaining a CRM  Position Requirements Bachelor's degree from an accredited University in relevant ﬁeld is strongly preferred Minimum of 1 years industry experience strongly preferred (i.e. language/cultural software sales or other software sales) Experience with Email marketing and/or cold calling campaigns is a must. Ability to navigate CRM (i.e. Hubspot, Zoho or SalesForce) is a must. description: DESCRIPTION CosMarketing Agency is a full-service Social Media and Digital Marketing Agency currently looking for Sales Agents, (3-5 people) to work online/remotely with our staff of industry experts. Our team’s goal is to help small to mid-sized businesses grow online.   If you enjoy working with people from all walks of life, communication, and a fast-paced work environment then this is the right job for you! We pride ourselves on the customization of our marketing plans and the creativity of our diverse and talented staff.   To work within the Agency a candidate should have high-speed Internet access, an updated smartphone, high-level customer service skills, must be a team player, and must have an understanding of how to use Facebook messenger. We are looking to work with people who exhibit attention to detail and can work with a team.   Anyone with experience with Sales and Negotiating is welcome to apply.  These positions are the best fit for someone with 3 years or more experience in the Industry. Hours can be tailored to your schedule. All calls must be done between 10 AM to 6 PM EST and will be booked in advance. All Contracts are provided on a case by case basis and the rate is negotiable for each project. We provide ALL leads and training.   All work is remote and is done online, over the phone, video chat, or email. Become a part of our network of millions of viewers and gain a valuable experience!  If this sounds like the job for you and you would like to be a part of a great team contact us! Send your resume to CosMarketingAgency@gmail.com. Include 3 references (include just their names and emails). Your resume should be up to date and include your contact information. The subject line of the email should be clear and easy to understand, as well as the body of your email. Thanks!   Our Links: www.CosMarketingAgency.com www.facebook.com/CosMarketingAgency www.instagram.com/CosMarketingAgency

description: A leader in the payments industry, Elavon provides end-to-end payment processing solutions and services to more than one million merchants around the world. Elavon is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.  Job Description  Individual filling this role can work remote, but must live in either Cleveland or Columbus, OH.  Develops profitable new business account relationships and increased profitability from existing accounts. Identifies business opportunities based on knowledge of clients, markets, products and services. Makes sales presentations to existing and prospective clients informing them of benefits of using the organization's products and services to meet their needs. Implements and maintains an effective referral network and call program to promote sales. Manages the on-going account relationship with existing customers. Establishes and maintains internal relationships. Establishes and maintains good public relationships with the community to enhance the organization's image and develop new business.  Basic Qualifications Bachelor's degree, or equivalent work experience Nine or more years of product sales experience Ability to travel Preferred Skills/Experience Expert knowledge of product marketing, client service issues, and organization operations Excellent marketing and business development/sales skills Strong negotiation and decision-making skills Ability to creatively resolve complex problems with general guidance Ability to manage multiple tasks/projects and deadlines simultaneously Excellent interpersonal, presentation, verbal and written communication skills Benefits  Take care of yourself and your family with U.S. Bank employee benefits. We know that healthy employees are happy employees, and we believe that work/life balance should be easy to achieve. That's why we share the cost of benefits and offer a variety of programs, resources and support you need to bring your full self to work and stay present and committed to the people who matter most - your family.  Learn all about U.S. Bank employee benefits, including tuition reimbursement, retirement plans and more, by visiting usbank.com/careers .  EEO is the Law  Applicants can learn more about the company’s status as an equal opportunity employer by viewing the federal EEO is the Law poster.  E-Verify  U.S. Bank participates in the U.S. Department of Homeland Security E-Verify program in all facilities located in the United States and certain U.S. territories. The E-Verify program is an Internet-based employment eligibility verification system operated by the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services. Learn more about the E-Verify program .  This is an Elavon posting. Elavon is a part of the U.S. Bank family.

description: Warby Parker is searching for a well-rounded Sales Advisor to help us deliver the best possible service to each and every one of our customers. In supporting our retail locations across the country (and Canada!), Advisors have a direct, immediate impact on the success of Warby Parker through customer interactions, process ideation and improvement, and various special projects. We've grown to who we are today thanks in no small part to them! In this role, you'll get to show folks firsthand what Warby Parker is all about while making glasses shopping a goosebump-inducing experience. Sound cool? Read on!  What You'll Do Communicate Warby Parker's values and brand philosophy on the sales floor Delight customers through nothing-but-wonderful service Demonstrate unparalleled product knowledge and offer exceptional style advice Dream up ways to reinvent retail and the glasses-shopping experience Anticipate the needs of your team and customers alike, and be at the ready to lend a hand Help foster an inclusive culture by treating customers and colleagues with respect Who You Are Excited to work and learn at a fast-paced, high-growth company Backed by customer-facing experience in a service-minded environment A proactive, adaptable problem-solver who reacts quickly in unexpected situations A positive team player who leads by example Able to effectively communicate with a variety of people Organized, attentive, and detail-oriented An energetic self-starter with an entrepreneurial spirit Interested in fashion and technology Not on the Office of Inspector General’s List of Excluded Individuals/Entities (LEIE) About Us  Warby Parker was founded with a mission: to inspire and impact the world with vision, purpose, and style.  We’re constantly asking ourselves how we can do more and make a greater impact—and that starts by reimagining everything that a company and industry can be. We want to demonstrate that a business can scale, be profitable, and do good in the world—without charging a premium for it. And we’ve learned that it takes creativity, empathy, and innovation to achieve that goal.  Since the day we launched in 2010, we’ve pioneered ideas, designed products, and developed technologies that help people see. We offer everything our customers need for happier eyes at a price that leaves them with money in their pockets, from designer-quality glasses and contacts to eye exams and vision tests.  Ultimately, we believe in vision for all, which is why for every pair of glasses or sunglasses we sell, a pair of glasses is distributed to someone in need through our Buy a Pair, Give a Pair program. Over eight million pairs of glasses have been distributed in over 50 countries; that means eight million people now have the glasses they need to learn, work, and achieve better economic outcomes.  At Warby Parker, you can look forward to company outings and events, volunteering and learning opportunities, and just great company filled with curious, kind folks. Dreaming up and sharing ideas aren’t responsibilities reserved for certain teams or leaders; the challenge (a really fun one) of innovation is on all of our shoulders. Teammates can also connect around common interests, backgrounds, and identities, no matter their home base, through our various employee resource groups. (We’re happy to say that the Human Rights Campaign has named us a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ+ employees!) That sense of community and belonging keeps us excited to walk through the door every day, wherever that door may be.  We're driven to continue building a workplace, based on inclusive behaviors and equitable systems, where all employees can bring their authentic selves, feel engaged, and share their perspectives as a valued member of Team Warby. Transparency is what we’re all about, and our annual Impact Report and Racial Equity Strategy lay out how we’re sticking to these values.

description: Welcome to the FUCHS Group, the world’s number one independent manufacturer of lubricants and related specialties. As a global company with roots in Germany, we expand the possibilities of whole industries, such as the automotive and aerospace sectors. More than 5,000 employees look closer, dig deeper and think further to create innovations and develop markets. That is what drives and connects us. We encourage our employees to expand their potential and grow together with us.Job description:Your responsibilities:  The Sales Manager will report to the Vice President of Industrial South and will be responsible for providing leadership to the sales group in our West Coast Divsion. This individual will be a strategic thinker with the ability to develop localized strategies that align with Fuchs‘ North American and Global strategic initiatives. Further aspects fo the role include: working across Divsional lines for holistic soluitons to customer needs; carrying out the development of sales representatives with specific focus on account management; developing new business and sales closing techniques; supporting the Vice President with input on strategic account management and divisional customer analysis; and sales P&L responsibilities.  Supervisory Responsibility The position will have 4 direct reports Travel Approximately 50% within the territory, dependent upon applicants plade of residence. Seeked profile:Qualifications we are looking for: Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Chemistry, or Business required. At least 10 years of B2B sales experience in industrial consumable products required. Experience in the Lubricants or Chemical industries preferred. A minimum of 3 years‘ experience in a leadership role. CRM experience (Salesforce desired) Demonstrated success in opening new business Solid understanding of direct selling concepts along with product and industry knowledge Ability to travel overnight when needed Excellent interpersonal and communication skills We offer:These are your benefits:  Fuchs offers a challenging and rewarding working environment where employees are encouraged to develop and grow as professionals. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work on projects that will expand your experience and challenge your abilities in the global marketplace. The position also offers an excellent compensation package and a comprehensive suite of benefits.  Fuchs Lubricants Co. is an equal employment opportunity (EEO)/AA employer and strongly supports diversity in the workplace (m/f/d/v).

description: OVERVIEW: We are hiring extroverted professionals to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for portraying our firm and our clients to the public with professionalism and positivity. Your goal is to connect with customers in the local market and ignite interest in the promotional packages our clients offer.  HOW YOU’LL CONTRIBUTE:  Increase brand awareness through direct sales Persistently pursue opportunities to promote products Creatively adjust product presentations to customer needs Build rapport with potential new customers Track and report sales daily Participate in training sessions Offer feedback and suggestions based on the successes and failures of particular approaches  WHY YOU’LL MAKE AN IMPACT:  You’re hungry to grow in your career You have outstanding communication skills You love being part of a team You’re a goal setter with ambitious dreams You have an entrepreneurial spirit You’re proactive about finding answers You’re tenacious and resilient You have a positive and professional attitude  As a part of our firm, you’ll enjoy unlimited career growth and earning potential. description: Skilljar is seeking an Outbound Sales Development Representative to join our fast-growing team focused on the B2B technology space. You will work closely with Account Executives, the Sales leadership, and the Marketing team in scaling a sales development process that's delivering data-driven results. This is an exciting opportunity to join a small and rapidly growing team, where you will have direct input into go-to-market strategy and how we improve the product.  Outstanding performers will have the opportunity to grow into other roles in the company including the Account Executive role to jump-start their career in SaaS sales. This is a fantastic opportunity for driven, strategic, and high-judgment individuals to get in early at a rapidly accelerating startup that is already serving hundreds of Fortune 1000 and mid-market clients!  Responsibilities Create a great first impression for prospects and customers by providing them with a world-class experience. Engage with potential customers via phone, email, chat, and LinkedIn to understand their business needs and identify opportunities where Skilljar can help. Maintain active engagement with new and existing leads through creative follow-up communications designed to increase customer interest in Skilljar. Schedule qualified meetings and develop new business opportunities to fuel Skilljar's growth. Partner with Account Executives and marketing to achieve mutually aligned sales quotas each month. Help the team continuously improve and optimize our process, training, use of technology, and other applicable aspects of our business.  Requirements Experience in an SDR role is strongly preferred. Experience in an outbound BDR role is a big plus. A desire to pursue a career in Sales coupled with a strong will to achieve. Call it what you want: grit, competitive spirit, hustle...the bottom line is this role is challenging. Why are you going to work harder when the going gets tough? Excellent organization skills, attention to detail, customer focus, and highly data-driven are musts. Enjoy working in a collaboratively competitive environment. Make others around you better while achieving your own goals! Innately and insatiably curious. Be committed to lifelong learning and continuous development (i.e. be better today than you were yesterday). Coachability -- don't just do what we say, but rather be self-aware and reflective, and digest feedback critically and adapt to overcome challenges. Startup experience is a major plus. Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent years of proven experience required. US work authorization and criminal background checks are required.  The Company  Backed by prominent financial institutions, including Mayfield, Shasta Ventures, Trilogy Equity Partners, and Insight Partners, Skilljar is the leading enterprise customer training platform, transforming the way organizations onboard, engage, and retain their customers. Trusted by leading global companies like Slack, Tableau, Liberty Mutual, Cisco, Verizon, and U-Haul, Skilljar provides the essential tools and foundation for successful customer and partner engagement and enablement.  We are a team of bright, dedicated Skillets with startup drive and a passion for education. Headquartered in Seattle, WA, Skilljar is currently operating remotely, with employees based in Washington, Oregon, California, Colorado, Arizona, and Florida.  Skilljar is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, gender, age, veteran status, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status or disability (in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act) with respect to employment opportunities.  Skilljar does not accept nor are we responsible for any fees associated with unsolicited resumes, LinkedIn bios, or any other candidate introductions.

description: We are seeking two, high volume call Sales Managers to join our growing team, each with a focus on a large geographic area of the US. We are a recently funded, hot start-up! The Managers will maximize Sophie’s Kitchen’s growth by building profitable sales of all products through expanding our market reach and advancing our current relationships. Bilingual English and Spanish candidates preferred, experience selling into Latin America is strongly preferred.  This is a 1099 contract position with opportunity to convert to W2 employment in the future.  We encourage every member of our team to use their creativity and expertise to take initiative in developing solutions and ideas. In addition, we expect every member of our team to be respectful and understanding of others’ opinions, ideas, and lifestyles, as we provide an inclusive workplace where each of our employees can thrive.  Ideal candidates will be accomplished deal closers, independent, and dynamic with an entrepreneurial spirit. Roll up your sleeves, high volume sales calls expected. Execute the existing sales strategy with internal and external collaboration. Candidates should have proven experience in food sales such as CPG, shelf-stable goods, frozen foods, or related business to retail suppliers and food service. If you are looking to make a positive impact on the world with your sales expertise, Sophie’s Kitchen is the place for you!  COMPANY SUMMARY Since our founding in 2010, Sophie’s Kitchen has been North America’s best-selling plant-based seafood alternative. We only use real food ingredients to create our full line of award-winning products: All 100% vegan, soy free, gluten free, non-GMO, and Kosher plant-based substitutes. We strive to call attention to the increasingly serious plight of the oceans, dwindling seafood sources, overcrowded fish farms, slave labor, and all other aspects that are involved in seafood farming and processing through providing healthy plant-based seafood alternatives suitable for any lifestyle.  RESPONSIBILITIES Aggressively create a pipeline of prospective clients and build and manage strong, long-term relationships with decision makers and influencers.  Develop and manage all phases of the sales process within the assigned region from prospecting and engaging clients to closing deals and onboarding clients. Continuously seeking improvements to the process. Execute end-to-end sales planning from market sizing, account segmentation, prospect tracking, client presentations, contract negotiations, and closing deals. Identify and achieve sales targets and contribute to business development through offering strategic positioning and sales campaigns. Conduct meetings in-person and virtually based on business needs and public health/travel statuses. Represent Sophie’s Kitchen at industry conferences and events. Additional duties as assigned.  REQUIREMENTS ●       Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, or related field preferred, or 10 years of proven sales execution experience. ●       Bilingual English and Spanish proficiency preferred. ●       Experience in frozen foods and canned/shelf-stable food sales required. ●       Experience in consumer-packaged goods (CPG) required. ●       Experience in both the retail and foodservice industry, various customer channels, and understanding of their corresponding points of leverage required. ●       Ability to analyze and interpret sales data and make necessary adjustments to sales operations is necessary. ●       Must possess interpersonal skills, dedication (taking ownership, prioritization, meeting deadlines), communication skills (strong written and verbal), flexibility, and have a positive attitude. ●       Must bring established network of prospects and customers in the foodservice/retail industry, especially the big players. ●       Be a team player, collaborative in your approach with the ability to work independently with initiative.  ●       Experience in customer relationship management ●       Strong negotiation skills ●       Experience planning and implementing successful sales-building strategies  EEO Sophie’s Kitchen is an Equal Opportunity Employer, we recognize that diversity is key to driving the creativity, innovation, and success of our business. We are committed to achieving a diverse workforce by prohibiting discrimination of any kind. All employment decisions made at Sophie’s Kitchen are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. We encourage all interested and qualified individuals to apply.

The Marketing Specialist is responsible for the execution of integrated marketing programs for clients that support product/service profit objectives, driving demand for our client's products and services through unique and competitive retail positioning and sales execution tactics.  Job Responsibilities Develops strategic marketing briefs with the internal team to ensure the attainment of new customer acquisition, business objectives, marketing objectives, sales goals, customer goals, and vendor agreements. Works collaboratively with internal and external partners to develop meeting material, secure approval, communicate status and achieve sales and expansion deadlines Provides the creative staff and agencies internally with collaborative direction on our firm's target audience, employee insights, marketing objectives, and meet recruiting efforts. Performs ongoing audits of existing supplies, merchandise, and materials, to ensure consistency of messaging, adherence to brand guidelines, compliance, and product/service accuracy. Collaborates to develop a set of measurement criteria to pinpoint the effectiveness of marketing strategies and tactics on sales, retention, and satisfaction. Monitors results. Maintains knowledge of retail capabilities, customer needs, internal operations processes, and competitive maneuvers.  External Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree OR HS Diploma/GED and at least 3 years of marketing experience such as product marketing, advertising, creative services, or customer insights. Experience using time management skills such as prioritizing/organizing and tracking details and meeting deadlines of multiple projects with varying completion dates. Experience developing ways of accomplishing goals with little or no supervision, depending on oneself to complete objectives, and determining when escalation of issues is necessary. Experience establishing & maintaining relationships with individuals at all levels of the organization, in the business community & with vendors. Experience developing and delivering presentations to various audience levels within an organization. Experience with MS Office Suite. Willing to travel up to 10% of the day for business purposes (within the state and out of state).  Preferred Qualifications BA Marketing, Advertising, Business, or Journalism. At least 2 years of marketing experience such as product marketing, advertising, creative services, or customer insights At least 2 years of experience in integrated marketing or marketing analysis. At least 2 years of experience working collaboratively with internal cross-functional teams and in environments with structured sales and marketing processes. Experience in marketing analytics and understanding quantitative analysis. At least 2 years of experience using competitive and customer insights to refine marketing plans or campaigns. Experience in consumer package goods, technology, or retail marketing. Experience implementing both acquisition and retention marketing initiatives. Experience working in a for-profit, corporate work environment.

description: Location:  Fort Wayne, IN, US, 46845   buttontext574c1b8bdc51cd11 a{ border: 1px solid transparent; } .buttontext574c1b8bdc51cd11 a:focus{ border: 1px dashed #4c4d4f !important; outline: none !important; } Company Description  Crown Equipment Corporation, one of the world's largest lift truck manufacturers, offers local support on a global scale with more than 15 manufacturing facilities worldwide and more than 500 retail locations in over 80 countries. Our global sales and service network provides our customers with a local resource for a wide variety of quality material handling equipment, fleet management solutions, warehouse products and support services to meet their needs anytime, anywhere.  Job Responsibilities Sell assigned products in a geographical territory and/or assigned accounts. May work in a team approach and assist other sales positions with territory management and communication. Make sales calls to qualify prospects. Generate leads. Involvement in information gathering efforts and/or tracking and follow-up of leads and inquiries. Participate in both training activities both locally, in the field and occasionally at the New Bremen, Ohio corporate headquarters. Work within various departments within the branch to understand their function and objectives with particular focus on activities related to the position for which they are training. The primary objective is to develop into an Account Representative, Customer Service Sales Representative, Account Manager, or other commissioned sales positions.  Qualifications Bachelor degree, preferably in business management, marketing, entrepreneurship, professional selling, or related business program Strong communication, organizational, and time management skills Strong problem-solving capabilities, strong sense of responsibility and self-motivation, and ability to work in a team environment Microsoft Office experience Valid driver’s license, good driving record, and the ability to safely operate lift trucks for product demos Work Authorization  Crown will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States. This is not a position for which sponsorship will be provided. Individuals with temporary visas or who need sponsorship for work authorization now or in the future, are not eligible for hire.  No agency calls please. EO/AA Employer Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled  Nearest Major Market: Fort Wayne  Job Segment: Sales Rep, Warehouse, Business Manager, Sales, Manufacturing, Management

description: Metro-West MA Territory  Company Overview  As one of New England’s leading spirits, wine and beer distributors, Horizon Beverage Group connects a network of makers, retailers and consumers across New England. Now in our fourth generation of family ownership, we employ more than 775 team members throughout Massachusetts, Rhode Island, New Hampshire, Maine, and Vermont.  Position Summary  The Sales Representative is goal orientated with entrepreneurial spirit and motivation to maintain a competitive edge in the marketplace, while selling to businesses within the assigned territory.  Daily/Position Responsibilities (Other Duties May Be Assigned) Develop and enhance customer relationships Answer customers' questions about products, prices, availability, product uses, and credit terms Responsible for forecasting and planning sales calls Consult with customers after sales to resolve problems and to provide ongoing support Demonstrate competent sales abilities through successful presentation of products and creditable promotion of new and existing portfolio items Utilize sample inventories to promote product sales Exhibit discipline and innovativeness to meet assigned monthly quotas Participate in sales meetings, on-site training, and trade events to maintain a high level of product/supplier knowledge Submit orders utilizing the company tablet Utilize Microsoft Outlook, Excel, and Word, to create sell sheets, and selling presentations Review customers credit status, collect monies owed, submits checks and cash according to the collection and deposit procedures Stock shelves and storage areas with product Education/Experience  Must possess strong wine knowledge  Associate’s Degree in Business or Management or equivalent combination of education and experience  2-3 years’ previous industry experience within the distribution, hospitality, and supplier community  Skills/Requirements  Previous work experience in the beverage industry highly preferred  The ideal candidate will be goal orientated with a strong attention to detail, and the ability to prioritize within a multi-tasking environment. Highly motivated with the ability to work calmly under pressure and meet tight deadlines; must possess strong analytical, negotiation and conflict resolution skills. Excellent presentation, verbal and written communication skills are also required. Must demonstrate intermediate level of proficiency within Microsoft Office applications. This role requires lifting and carrying of a 40+ pound case of product on a regular basis and requires extensive travel throughout assigned territory with personal vehicle; must possess ability to merchandise at the retail level.  What We Offer  Horizon Beverage Group provides benefits, support programs, resources and expertise to help employees live healthier and safer lives—at work and on the road. Eligibility for the following benefits depends on employment status. Competitive pay Medical & dental 401(k) Plan Paid Holidays Generous paid time off policy Company paid Short & Long Term Disability Company paid Life Insurance Employee Assistance Program Supplemental Insurance Options Horizon Beverage Group is an Equal Opportunity (EEO) employer. It is the policy of the Company to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status.

description: Description  Paychex is looking for high-energy, driven professionals with sound business insight and natural sales instincts to join our Sales Development organization. SDRs will help lay the foundation of sales efforts through prospecting and articulating the value of Paychex to small and medium-sized businesses. As a Sales Development Representative, you will work strategically with assigned field sales partners to find new clients. As the first line of contact, SDRs are able to understand the diverse business needs of our prospective clients. They are quick on their feet, agile, and possess the ability to overcome objections. As an SDR you will use your business acumen and conversational skills to create qualified opportunities for the full cycle sales team. You will use a process-driven approach to outbound prospecting that incorporates phone/email outreach, lead nurturing, and data gathering/validation/updating while leveraging a robust tech stack. Work from home environment Generates appointments for sales representatives utilizing technology as well as targeted telephone, email, webinar, and social media. Builds rapport via a multi-touch, nurturing approach. Partners with selling representatives to strategically target accounts and identify potential opportunities for Paychex. Continually updates and cleans SalesForce.com (SFDC) records. Manages calendar, campaigns, timely follow-up and engagement with sales representatives. Articulates competitive advantages in conversation and email communication with prospects by highlighting our differentiators. Consistently leverages CRM, social media, and automation tools/processes to find opportunities and capture market share via a systematic and disciplined approach. Expertise in overall value proposition tied to Paychex’s suite of products and services Requirements High School Diploma - Required Bachelors Degree - Preferred 1 year of experience in sales support / lead generation role working in a fast paced and agile environment Work from home environment Our Commitment  Paychex is dedicated to fostering a culture of intentional Inclusion and Diversity (I&D). Our valued employees and commitment to I&D is the essence of our internal and external success. Inclusivity is a key value of our corporate culture and is exemplified through our reputation as a top employer for employee development, diversity, and ethics, as well as a focus on fairness in recruitment, selection, and decision making.  Click here for more information on our corporate social responsibility.

description: Sales Representative  JOB DESCRIPTION POSITION SUMMARY  The primary role of a Sales Representative is to help grow the ImproveU business through prospecting and client acquisition. This includes working across company divisions to guide prospective clients to programs that best suit their needs.    ABOUT IMPROVEU We are ImproveU-- we enhance lives through unique nutrition and exercise programs to achieve personal goals and we are growing by the day. Our mission is to transform the lives of millions through the same movement, nutrition, and lifestyle habits that have transformed ours. We are dedicated and intentional in our pursuit to see every team member reach their personal, professional, and financial goals through the work we do together. Our core values are the backbone of our business and guide our hiring process: we are Accountable, Inspirational, Aligned, Disciplined, Transparent, and Results Oriented.  PERFORMANCE OBJECTIVES  Achieve assigned monthly customer engagement targets with ImproveU products as assigned by leadership Develop meaningful relationships with customers to encourage trust and loyalty. Follow up on warm leads to further the sales process. Understand and adequately describe the product or service to the customer. Improve sales skills to increase sales success rates through daily team training and homework. Follow set strategies for achieving long and short term business goals for all products and services. Show initiative in developing selling skills and product/portfolio knowledge; Partner actively within the sales team to ensure achievement of targets and goals set by leadership. Act as a knowledgeable business consultant for all clients and members of the social media pages, while planning for customer business needs; Manage ImproveU workload and process through effective problem solving solutions, execution of daily tasks, and administration duties. Some travel may be required.   KEY COMPETENCIES  Your success will be driven by your demonstration of our core values. More specifically related to this position, ImproveU seeks a candidate who possesses the following:  Required Qualifications:  Demonstrate initiative, assertiveness and ability to drive results; Strong business acumen, collaboration, influencing and critical thinking skills; Proven interest in supporting collaboration and teamwork within a strong team structure; Strong computer skills and highly proficient in MS Office Suite, Windows, Google Suite Demonstrates creativity, attention to detail and the ability to communicate effectively. Maintains a positive attitude and over delivers to customers by providing the highest level of service in the industry. Exemplifies what it means to be a team player, shows a willingness to work hard and is persistent in achieving results. Ability to monitor and manage leads within a CRM system. Ability to connect with prospects and illustrate what the value of a program will have on their life.   Outstanding organization and administrative accountability Willingness to travel to occasional team events and trainings; Be able to pass a background check. The Diagnostic Sales Specialist (DSS) is responsible for effectively communicating and selling the benefits of the APTIMA product line, the ThinPrep Pap Test and adjunctive testing, and the ThinPrep Imaging System, to clinicians in an assigned geographic territory. Additionally, the DSS provides educational support to OB/GYNs and other clinical professionals in the office and hospital setting as well as strategic business planning and development for primary and secondary product lines.  Duties & Responsibilities: Meet and exceed sales goals and achieve maximum sales in assigned territory Accurately forecast and maintain an individual territory book of business in accordance with a 90-day quota for assigned and acquired products as required Achieve individual sales revenue quota on a quarterly and annual basis for assigned and acquired products as required Develop and execute business plans for targeted accounts. Complete a territory business analysis for management review on a quarterly basis Maintain ongoing business planning with customers in territory; this includes periodic business reviews with customer's financial departments, as well as sales planning with customer's sales department Effectively route plan and manage business for assigned territory Attend quarterly Plan of Action Meetings within district Periodically provide Rapid fFN Fetal Fibronectin in-services and training to laboratory personnel and Labor and Delivery Staff, per the territory needs of the local Strategic Account Manager (SAM) Perinatal Support territory sales goals by maintaining core ThinPrep Pap Test business (Account Executive's Primary Line of Business), increasing usage, and prospecting new customers Effectively sell Hologic's sales message to all customers in the targeted territory Effectively insulate accounts against competition and regaining lost customer accounts Maintain consistent and structured communication with Account Executive counterpart and articulate summarized communication to District Sales Manager on a periodic basis Integrate successfully into team selling environment by partnering sales efforts with Territory Manager and Account Executive, and other Hologic colleagues and laboratory partners Assist in generating leads for other Hologic products Manage time effectively; prioritize and make good business judgments and decisions in relationship to efficiency, effectiveness while meeting daily call expectations Partner with marketing department to support the development and execution of marketing programs and sales materials Attend local and national professional trade shows and events and promote products to all customers Update and sync all relevant customer account information into Hologic's Data Management System daily Perform other duties as required  Qualifications: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the basic knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required: Demonstrated track record of success and sales accomplishments Ability to sell in a consultative manner such that the customer need is discovered and addressed in an individualized clinical and data-driven manner Strong persuasiveness and influence skills required Ability to understand and articulate complex scientific literature and use extensive and complex clinical data as a key factor in the sales process. Familiarity with clinical and economic outcome data, reimbursement, and managed care policies and procedures  Education: Bachelor of Arts/Science from an accredited university required  Experience: Candidate must have a minimum of two years sales experience Medical background/sales experience, laboratory experience, and/or managed care knowledge desirable Business-to-business experience highly desired  Additional Details: Since this position requires extensive driving during the workday, a valid driving license and satisfactory driving record, as well as a serviceable vehicle available for work use is mandatory  Agency and Third Party Recruiter Notice:  Agencies that submit a resume to Hologic must have a current executed Hologic Agency Agreement executed by a member of the Human Resource Department. In addition Agencies may only submit candidates to positions for which they have been invited to do so by a Hologic Recruiter. All resumes must be sent to the Hologic Recruiter under these terms or they will not be considered.  Hologic, Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer inclusive of disability and veterans.

Druva is the global leader in Cloud Data Protection and Management, delivering the industry’s first data management-as-a-service solution that aggregates data from endpoints, servers and cloud applications and leverages the public cloud to offer a single pane of glass to enable data protection, governance and intelligence–dramatically increasing the availability and visibility of business critical information, while reducing the risk, cost and complexity of managing and protecting it.  Druva’s award-winning solutions intelligently collect data, and unify backup, disaster recovery, archival and governance capabilities onto a single, optimized data set. As the industry’s fastest growing data protection provider, Druva is trusted by over 4,000 global organizations, and protects over 40 PB of data.  This is an opportunity to be an influential member of a high performing sales team at a fast-growing SaaS company. As an SDR you’ll work closely with our sales and marketing teams to drive new business by evangelizing Druva’s technology to prospective customers. You will be responsible for making outbound calls to target prospective accounts and generating qualified business opportunities.  What You Will Be Doing Generate new sales leads through a mixture of outbound phone and email prospecting, following up on marketing campaigns and inbound inquiries Schedule meetings and product demos for Account Executives Manage inbound leads process to maximize conversion and pipeline development Understand Druva’s offerings and competitive positioning to effectively communicate and apply them to a prospects needs Accurately enter, update, and maintain daily activity and prospect information in Salesforce.com Achieve and exceed monthly quotas and objectives What You Bring 1-2 years of prior SDR experience Experience in technology solutions, cloud and Saas preferred Experience with tools such as SFDC, CL, Salesloft, Linkedin, Zoom, etc. Ability to articulate technical capabilities in terms of business value A strong desire to learn a comprehensive software sales process Strong sense of urgency and motivation to meet and exceed aggressive goals Strong communication and presentation skills A plus if you are hard working, competitive, professional and comfortable taking direction and feedback.
