description: The ideal candidate is a competitive self-starter that thrives in a fast-paced environment. You must be comfortable making dozens of calls per day, working with partners, generating interest, qualifying prospects, and closing sales.   Responsibilities Source new sales opportunities through inbound lead follow-up and outbound cold calls and emails Prospect call preparation including company background research and other pertinent lead information Identify customer's buying trends and provide reports to management Enter, update, and maintain CRM information on leads, prospects, and opportunities  Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Business At least 1 - 3 years' of sales experience Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to multi-task, organize, and prioritize work

Do you have a passion for working with people? Are you motivated to create your own schedule? Are you tired of sitting at a desk for 8+ hours a day? If you answered yes to all of these then you may be our ideal candidate. We are looking for an enthusiastic sales and marketing representative to join our team! You will be responsible for planning and executing marketing strategies to generate new prospects and improve client retention to help achieve our goals. As an Outside Sales and Marketing Representative, you will act as the main point of contact for outside, inside and partner sales teams for the Alexandria, VA region. The Outside Sales and Marketing Representative will attract new clients, win new accounts, and maximize profitability within his or her sales territory. Candidates will work prospects through the entire sales cycle, including developing new leads, educating prospects, and turning interested shoppers into long-term customers.  Responsibilities Devise marketing campaigns with the goal of increasing product awareness and increasing sales and profits. Plan, organize, and execute marketing and sales programs. Track market and company sales performance. Work closely with marketing teams to create new ideas for leads. Generate leads and drive sales. Gather and report customer intelligence to sales teams. Develop marketing plans. Manage vendor contracts. Support all company initiatives, give actionable feedback, share best practices and serve as advocate and information source for company. Create programs that drive brand loyalty. Manage marketing budgets. Attend trade shows and events to market product. Travel throughout the territory and visit customers on a recurring basis. Determine product/service value delivered throughout customer operations and effectively communicate value to customers to promote new business and sales. Keep abreast of industry trends, competition, and new opportunities. Develop understanding of the industry and services offered. Answer customer calls. Maintain social media channels for brand awareness.  Requirements Strong desire to learn and grow along with professional drive Excellent verbal and written communication skills Excellent knowledge of MS Office Familiarity with marketing computer software and online applications (e.g. CRM tools, Online analytics and Google Adwords) Passion for the marketing industry and its best practices Familiarity with different sales techniques and pipeline management Self motivated and driven BA/BS degree or equivalent (Not a requirement, but preferred) Comfortable on the phone and in out in field prospecting potential leads Competitive attitude Able to work independently

Hospital Sales Account Manager needed! Join a Growing Organization, making a difference each day!  Onco360 Pharmacy is a unique oncology pharmacy model created to serve the needs of community, oncology and hematology physicians, patients, payers, and manufacturers. We have an immediate need for a Hospital Sales Account Manager in the Western area of New York state.  Summary  The primary responsibility for the Hospital Sales Account Manager will be to develop and manage designated accounts with the goal of maximizing and reaching sales forecasts. Expectations are you will be responsible for identifying, ranking, prospecting and developing key hospital, physician accounts and business relationships within targeted regional territory.  Benefits Medical; Dental; Vision 401k with a match Paid Time Off and Paid Holidays Tuition Reimbursement Company paid benefits - life ins., short and long-term disability Hospital Sales Account Manager Major Responsibilities Developing relationships with hospital account managers and key contacts as the lead contact once account has been established and contract signed Ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to the customer’s needs Use weekly reports to help uncover sales opportunities Manage implementation process for new accounts Familiar with 340B regulations and 340B reimbursement Achieving designated call expectations with a focus on top targets Delivering product presentations to customers Regular communication of activities, accomplishments, and future strategies, as needed. Travel to visit with key accounts when necessary Exceptional probing and consultative communication skills Self-motivated and results driven. Achieving quarterly and annual sales goals Hospital Sales Account Manager Position Qualifications 3-5 years previous sales experience preferred 1 year of hospital sales experience preferred Oncology sales experience strongly desired Familiar with 340B account processes Understanding of government regulations regarding 340B accounts Excellent interpersonal work and communication skills Team Worker, Team Player, Proven Performer Organizational and prioritizing skills Microsoft Office, CRM user experienced preferred Company Values: Teamwork, Respect, Integrity, Passion

description: Custom Manufacturer with owner that just merged two top factories in Lexington, KY & Sidney, OH (79k sq ft) last year. Since merging, our owner has invested in a $1M Trumpf laser, upgraded inventory system, new computers and website.  We're a group of committed people, excited about working in a start up environment - high growth > high reward mentality. We still have a very family-oriented environment, where no one is a number at work. We are growing fast and need a hunter to continue to bring in new accounts. S. Kentucky + Tennessee territory.  Existing book of business would be shared along with a focus on growing the territory.  Must haves 2+ years, sales in welding or machining, Associates Degree, travel 75-100% Track record of success selling CUSTOM engineered tooling, parts, machinery, plastics, etc. Interested in working as an “owner” for the business Demonstrated performance and success as a “hunter” Openness to sell across business units & learn from many in the organization  Nice to have Experience working in small company environment Midwest territory sales experience  Attributes Pace-Bias for action Process - Science/structured approach to selling process Philosophy - Pragmatic Realistic about probability/forecasting, strong at tracking, believes in improving skills Play - Openness to sell across business units & learn from many in the organization  90-day success profile Outbound prospecting metrics Face to face sales calls per week Number of net new customer proposals Target pipeline value  How you'll be supported: valenceindustrial.com with a heavy marketing strategy + Hubspot CRM system Manufacturing engineer / account manager to support you with bill of materials, design and estimating Training with the GMs across both factories, operations, estimators and peers Additional acquisitions targeted to be added increasing the breadth of products & services available to sell to the same customer base

Overview  Nearly 37 million Americans are currently affected by Chronic Kidney Disease. 37 million.  At Akebia we take that number very seriously and every day we come to work, with the purpose of bettering the lives of each person impacted by kidney disease and the renal community that serves them.  Our tenacious, passionate employees challenge the status quo and work to develop unique therapeutics that have the potential to set new standards of care for people living with kidney disease.  This is life-changing work, and we are all in, are you?  The Renal Sales Specialist (“RSS”) is a field-based sales position responsible for selling Auryxia® The RSS will be responsible for developing and building consultative relationships with Renal Health Care Providers and will provide comprehensive clinical knowledge of Auryxia, delivering branded sales messages and executing planned programs. This position requires an accountable self-starter who can develop customer insights, build and maintain strong relationships, leverage resources and has superior closing and follow through skills. The RSS will be accountable to deliver achievement of sales goals within their defined territory.  Responsibilities  Responsibilities Effectively communicate relevant Auryxia disease state and product information to a variety of Renal Health Care Providers Develop a local strategy and actionable business plan, supported by solid analytics, to achieve sales goals Develop and maintain in-depth knowledge of market, demographic, and managed care information relative to assigned sales territory Demonstrate ability to sell and close with impact Provide strong account management skills and detailed follow-up, within the renal care team, to support the initiation and maintenance of patients on Auryxia Communicate and capitalize on open formulary access, through effective implementation of the strategic targeting and pull through plan Embrace adversity and possess positive mind-set, in a changing environment Work productively in the face of ambiguity and uncertainty Sell ethically and in accordance with the company’s sales process, marketing strategy, and compliance guidelines Actively seek solutions and be open to both providing and receiving coaching/feedback Possess an internal drive to achieve sales results while working with others in a collaborative manner Effectively leverage available resources to generate prescribing within territory Attend Local, Regional and National Meetings as needed Assume accountability for sales results in their territory, including achieving and exceeding quarterly and annual territory sales goals Engage in collaborative and productive team approach to learning and sharing best practices Anticipate travel of 40% - 50% of the time Basic Qualifications  Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree Required Possess valid driver’s license Ability to travel as necessary or required, which includes overnight and/or occasional weekend travel Required to reside within territory geography Preferred Qualifications Documented sales performance – individual accountability with documented results Minimum 2 years of specialty sales experience to MDs in the pharmaceutical, surgical, or biotechnology industry Commitment to a compliant working environment Strong written and oral communication skills Are you an Akebian?  An Akebian is curious, empathetic, and values making connections to people and ideas. Akebian’s aren’t afraid of diving in and owning a process or a problem, because we all want to deliver a great solution. Akebian’s believe that we are better together because we are all working toward a common purpose – to better the life of each person impacted by kidney disease. Want to learn more about what it means to be an Akebian? Visit our website: www.akebia.com  Akebia Therapeutics is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes all job applicants. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other factors prohibited by law.
industries: Medical Devices, Hospital & Health Care, and Pharmaceuticals

description: Role Overview  Sales Development Representatives (SDRs) are the first touchpoints of Crimson Education for prospective students and families. SDRs will be required to share more about Crimson, qualify the leads, and schedule them for consults with the sales associates if qualified.  The purpose of this role is to assist the Sales Associates in qualifying potential sales leads in the early stages of a sales cycle. The SDR is responsible for creating an impressive and positive first impression for leads after identifying and creating new qualified sales opportunities. The SDR will become a trusted resource and develop relationships with prospects, acting as the initial point of contact. Approaching emails, calls, and texts with a positive attitude, can-do attitude, and willingness to serve is essential.  This is a full-time role based remotely in the United States or Canada.  What This Role Is Responsible For Build and maintain strong and productive relationships with potential students and guardians and serve as a positive, supportive, and high-energy first point of contact Take and share detailed notes to share with the larger sales team that will offer background, context, and tips on how to move forward in the sales process that best suits the lead Consistently brainstorm and craft new, efficient, and effective ways to reach and engage families Work collaboratively with team members across the company (and world!) to foster a dynamic and efficient SDR community Optimize the student experience, leveraging data to drive improvements across the sales team Create a customer-centric and polished first impression with prospects and customers Respond promptly to all new business opportunities from inbound and marketing-generated leads Monitor and respond to email, sales queue, and phone for sales inquiries Meet target quota related to number of qualified opportunities, meetings set, and closed business as well as assisting with online self serve purchases. Accurately capture, report, track, and manage required qualification data and lead statuses into Salesforce Provide prompt and regular feedback to marketing on lead quality and trends systematically via data entry and anecdotally in weekly marketing meetings Be an active contributor in a great team environment with a fun and energetic atmosphere Required Qualifications Excellent interpersonal communication skills (written and verbal) Outstanding time management skills Self-starter with lots of initiative High energy team player Demonstrated experience with CRM tool(s) Experience using Salesforce a plus The ability to pick up new technology quickly and with ease Fluent in English Bonus To Have Speaks a second language fluently Experience with Salesforce Knowledge of the US, UK, and/or EU university admissions application process Experience working and/or studying in an international, multicultural environment 2+ years sales and/or customer service experience with a desire to exceed the target Previous experience in tech and/or education Willingness to be coached and able to take feedback constructively Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university Passion for developing a career in sales or marketing What Success Looks Like Booking in consults with prospective, qualified families and the sales team Meeting monthly consult and sales targets Jumping in with company webinar and brand awareness events Punctual and timely communication with team members About Crimson  Crimson Education was founded in 2013 with the idea that through personalized education, we can transform students into the world leaders of tomorrow. Since then, we have rapidly grown a mission-driven team that is dedicated to building the education system for the 22nd century. Our network includes 2,400 tutors and consultants worldwide who work with over 20,000 students.  Our tech platform connects tutors and mentors to high school students aiming to achieve admission and scholarships to top universities in the US, Canada, UK, and beyond. We work with and support ambitious students that are willing to work hard to stand out in the admissions process.  Why work for Crimson? Opportunity for advancement Remote, flexible working lifestyle Paid time off + benefits A small and close-knit team while working together with team members across borders, around the world! If you're passionate about education and people and looking for a fast-paced, collaborative environment, and want to work with cutting-edge technology then we'd love to hear from you!  Please keep an eye on your spam/junk email folder for correspondence from Breezy HR.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Information Technology and Services, and Education Management

jobTitle: Sales Operations Specialist (Remote Denver, CO or Houston, TX)
description: UIH Solutions LLC is the Houston-based sales and services organization for United Imaging in North America. United Imaging is a global, award-winning company that’s been built for the modern world from the ground up, with more FDA-cleared products across modalities than any other recent market entrant. We continue to experience exponential U.S. growth, and our rate of innovation demands that we pursue the best talent on the market. If you have a passion for what you do, love teamwork, are highly accountable, and are at the top of your game, check us out.   The Opportunity  We are seeking technical business-minded individual who has a passion for business analytics and process improvement. The Sales Operation Specialist will work with the sales team to operate at the most efficient level by providing support in all aspects of sales operations. The ideal candidate will be a self-motivated “doer” who sees the needs, challenges the status quo, and provides the solutions for achieving the business objectives; “just gets things done”. Energy, work ethic, and a focus on quality are all important qualities for this role as we build a strong culture of ownership and empowerment.  Main Responsibilities Responsible for all Sales Operations executions while reporting to the SVP Commercialization; Proactively identifies opportunities for sales process improvement provide solutions, and drive Sales related improvement to completion;  Coordinates training for commercial team and provide general Commercial team support; Salesforce.com software management and identify, create, implement new productivity tools for Commercial team as needed.; Collect, analyze, and provide “lite” but effective reporting of sales data for the company to maximize commercial efforts. Responsible for maintaining and calculating sales commission payments process;   Qualification Requirements  Bachelor’s degree or above with a Business degree in Information Systems or Business Analytics preferred; This is a work from home position, but must be located in the Denver, Colorado or Houston, Texas area as some face to face meetings will be required.  Prior experience and knowledge with Salesforce.com preferred;  Strong Analytical Skills/Strong Business Acumen/Proficient with Excel and other IT Business tools; Light overnight travel required  Benefits Benefits Include Medical, Dental, Vision, Group Life Insurance, Short-Term disability and Long-term disability insurance and 401(k) employer match (vesting period required).  Full Time, Permanent position.
industries: Medical Devices

description: Hiossen is currently looking for smart and passionate Sales Associates to join our rapidly growing sales team! Successful candidates are passionate, positive and detail oriented person that can build a professional relationship with customers who are engaged in world-class Dental implant courses. As a Hiossen Implant Sales Associate, you will be part of a dynamic implant sales team that positively affects the lives of our customers on a daily basis. The Sales Associate will be responsible for dealing with any and all customer questions about the products and services the company offers as the public face of the company.  LOCATIONS Chicago, IL Tyler, TX Denton, TX Waco, TX Houston, TX Keller, TX The Woodlands, TX San Antonio, TX New Orleans, LA Minneapolis, MN Responsibilities Assist and support branch manager, assistant branch manager, and territory sales representatives with customers’ requests and sales related tasks. Regularly recruit and schedule dentists and other dental professionals to attend Hiossen trainings and seminars (Master course, One-day hands on, etc.). Find new leads and potential clients through cold callings and cold visits. Expected to visit/call six different dental offices per day on average and report to CRM system. Maintain the presentation of the products, signage, displays and training/seminar environment. Prepare to become Sales Representative by attending and satisfactorily completing Hiossen training programs, attaining the ability to demonstrate required product and sales knowledge. This position may include additional responsibilities assigned by Sales management. Required Skills And Experiences  In order to be successful at Hiossen Implant, you must be able to perform this job successfully; an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Excellent verbal and written communication skills Enthusiastic, energetic, personable and friendly disposition Proactive Team player Maintain a positive attitude and focus on customer satisfaction in a fast-paced environment Education And/or Experience Required  High school diploma or general education degree (GED); or one to two years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.  Benefits  Performance-based bonuses  $230/bi-weekly car allowance, plus fleet gas card.  Health, life, dental, vision insurance  Long- and short-term disability  401(k) with 50% company match (up to 2% of salary)  PTO (15 days for first year-[9 days paid vacation,6 sick days]);(20 days for second year)  Paid holidays  Cell phone reimbursement  Paid clinical and product training  HIOSSEN, Inc. was established in Pennsylvania in 2006 as a subsidiary of Osstem Implant. Osstem Implant is leading the Asian-Pacific market with the largest market share and ranked one of the top five implant companies on the globe. HIOSSEN Inc. produces a wide variety of implants at the state-of-the-art manufacturing facilities in Fairless Hills, PA. The quality implants are exported to more than 20 different countries in Europe and Asia. HIOSSEN is striving to improve implant quality by monitoring the market and gathering feedback from clinicians. All the ideas and opinions are analyzed with rigorous scientific tests and incorporated into the research and development process. The recent launch of H series (HS, HG) implants are a reflection of this effort.

jobTitle: Work From Home Sales Career ( Remote )
description: Full Time or Set Your Own Hours  Why Work Here?  “Incredible culture, set your own hours, work remote/home. More powerful than a job, you will develop a lifestyle and a career.”  If You Are Ready To Start a Career In a Growing Industry, Want To Work From Home/remote And Set Your Own Schedule, Ask Yourself These Questions  Uncertainties over the past year have impacted so many jobs and careers. The insurance industry has been around for centuries and grew in 2020. With a recession-proof industry, there is plenty of opportunity. Our sales agents were people who have been stay at home parents (moms and dads), food/beverage industry, corporate executives tired of the road life, sales professionals, teachers, automotive, nurses, cosmetologists and so many more. Most, if not all of them were affected by the changes in their jobs, or just ready for a career change. Do you enjoy being on the phone? Have sales experience and a desire to work with a growing team? Are you interested in acquiring an insurance license or have an insurance license? If the answer is yes, this might be your perfect fit. We are limited in our positions, so serious inquiries only. Our trillion-dollar industry is pandemic/recession proof, work from home opportunity and is never going away. We are a great fit for so many families, as you can work from anywhere, even if you move locations. No need to worry about childcare and set your own hours. We create qualified weekly English and Spanish speaking leads, no cold calling.  The following steps are what will be required for you to become a licensed insurance agent: Take a pre-licensing course. Approximately $50.00 Become licensed in your state. (Cost varies dependent on state. Between $75.00 $150.00) That's all it takes to start your career. We will provide the mentorship and training needed to become a successful member of our team. Why work here? Great opportunity, great managers, and endless room to grow * Our company has been on the Inc. 5000 Fastest Growing Companies List 4 years running. We specialize in selling mortgage protection (life insurance to homeowners), final expense and retirement planning.  At the Dorr Agency, we put people first. Through our positive culture and mentorship, you to set and achieve goals with a team that believes in success by putting relationships first. All sales backgrounds are considered, especially automotive sales and service sales professionals.  We are looking for a highly motivated, goal oriented and ambitious salesperson. Our main goal is to help families protect their homes in the event of tragedy. Our company promotes a work/life balance and gives the right person the tools to achieve this. If you are a team player and a leader with sales experience, we want to talk to you! We are the #1 company in the industry, showing continued growth and profitability every year.  Our Company Offers Typical commissions are $500-$1,000 per family helped 5% promotions every 2 months Complimentary life insurance for new agents Multiple incentives including vacations, monthly bonus, etc. Continuing education in sales, products, and self-development Part-Time Agents make approximately $30k-$60k the first year Full-Time Agents make the approximately $80k-$180k first year Agency Owners with consistent promotions every 2-3 months generate $200-$500k+ in a matter of years THIS WILL BE YOUR LAST STOP. If you are ready to break free from the desk and own your OWN business, this is your chance! We look forward to hearing from you! All sales backgrounds are considered, especially automotive sales and service sales professionals.  About The Dorr Agency  Our passion is helping to bring balance to the professional and personal lives of independent insurance agents and agency builders across the country. Our eight core values core values that include people come first, open, honest, and productive communication as well as continued support for personal growth. We are truly committed to sharing the wealth of opportunity with you, all the while delivering high levels of service and training to our sales force.  Years Experience: 1 - 3 years  Salary: $80,000 - $180,000 Annual  Bonus/Commission: Yes
industries: Internet

description: Chatsworth at PGA National is looking for a Full Time(Tuesday-Saturday, 10:00-6:30pm), Healthcare Sales Associate.  The Healthcare Sales Associate serves as the customer point of contact in the Continuing Care Sales Office handling customer inquiries and supporting the movement of the customer through the sales process to admission. The Healthcare Sales Associate will oversee all resident move-ins, move-outs, and transfers within Continuing Care, functioning as a liaison between community departments and residents.  This position interfaces with residents, family members, department managers, nursing staff, resident services, outside callers, social workers, accounting, medical staff, sales, and external networking professionals.  How You Will Make An Impact Responds to customer inquiries (phone and walk-in), answering questions about the community, priority list, reservation process and admissions process. Determines customer needs, assists in appointment with the Health Care Sales Director, and conducts sales appointments and tours. Manages all activities related to move-ins, move-outs, and transfers within Continuing Care (Skilled Nursing, Long Term Care, Assisted Living, and Memory Care). Coordinates details relevant to these processes with other community departments. Verifies financial information for official documentation and assists customers in application process. Coordinates with General Services staff on room refurbishing, room keys, and work order process. Executes apartment releases and move-in advice forms for all residents. Notifies departments of vacated units. Oversees daily census distribution process. Serves as a representative for Continuing Care Sales when interfacing with hospital staff, physicians, and other professional referral sources. What We Offer Competitive benefit packages including medical, dental, vision and 401K with a match after 1 year. Tuition reimbursement, certification reimbursement and student loan refinancing partnership programs are available. A culture of diversity and inclusion, which builds on our values, vision and mission. What You Will Need High school diploma or GED required. 1 year of administrative office experience required. Computer experience required. Must have sales experience and/or have a comfort level with sales process. Devonshire/Chatsworth is an upscale, luxury resort style retirement community and we are currently looking for everyday heroes who want to make a real impact in the lives of seniors. If you’re ready to take your career to new heights, join us. In addition to a rewarding career, you’ll enjoy an industry-leading total rewards package that includes a competitive salary, an impressive package of health and dental benefits, paid time off and volunteer hours, tuition reimbursement, 401(k) with employer contribution, opportunities for career growth and advancement, and much more!
industries: Nonprofit Organization Management, Health, Wellness and Fitness, and Hospital & Health Care

description: Company  US0055 Sysco Seattle, Inc.  Zip Code  98032  Minimum Level Of Education  High School or Equivalent  Minimum Years Of Experience  3 Years  Employment Type  Full Time  Travel Percentage  0  Job Summary  This is a Sales support position responsible for providing direct support to all assigned Account Executives. This position will support the Account Executive in the interpretation of all contractual requirements of the Master Distribution Agreement by maintaining contact with the customers, implementing and reviewing pricing agreements, and coordinating with the various departments with the base Company, other Companies within the organization and/or corporate.  Responsibilities Support Account Executive: Customer Inquiries (special orders, credits, transportation/truck, item issues, pick-up request), Manage outs, Monitor orders before cut-off, Tracking's, Manage Proprietary items (MUPA), 360 support RVP Tasks: Order Guide creation/Chart maintenance, New Item Requests/Limited Time Offers request to merchandising, New account set- up, coordinating with SBS Manage and support Local Contract Customer Lead House: Order Guide Management, Inventory Reporting, etc. Business Development: Scheduling visits, Menu Reviews, New Items/Samples/Broker Visits, Market Analysis/Trends Customer Onboarding/Training/Account Set-Up Experience  QUALIFICATIONS: Preferred 3+ years prior foodservice sales, B2B experience, restaurant management or culinary background 3+ year prior outside foodservice sales coordination or customer support experience Education  High school diploma or equivalent  Skills Excellent organizational and project management skills, including the ability to service multiple customers simultaneously; Able to thrive in a fast-paced work environment Expert in Microsoft Suite of applications (Word, Excel, PPT, etc.) Stay current on existing and new Sysco technologies (i.e. My Sysco Reporting, e-Commerce capabilities, etc.) to ensure customers have the latest information. Preferred: Demonstrated experience with and working knowledge of Sysco customers and sales support best practices Ability to tactfully interact with coworkers/customers, meet deadlines Physical Demands  The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.  Working Conditions The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by associates within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of associates assigned to this job. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Benefits Information  Candidates who start work in the months of May, June, July, August and September 2021 may be eligible for medical and prescription drug plan coverage effective on their date of hire*. Standard eligibility rules and timelines apply to all other Sysco benefits, including additional healthcare benefits options, retirement benefits, vacation, and paid sick leave. Please visit https://syscobenefits.com/careers to view additional benefits information. *Exceptions/exclusions may apply  COVID-19 Precaution(s)  HOW WE PROTECT OUR ASSOCIATES Personal protective equipment and masks provided Temperature screenings Social distancing guidelines in place Sanitizing, disinfecting, and cleaning procedures in place Overview  Sysco is the global leader in foodservice distribution. With over 57,000 associates and a fleet of over 13,000 vehicles, Sysco operates approximately 326 distribution facilities worldwide and serves more than 625,000 customer locations.  We offer our associates the opportunity to grow personally and professionally, to contribute to the success of a dynamic organization, and to serve others in a manner that exceeds their expectations. We’re looking for talented, hard-working individuals to join our team. Come grow with us and let us show you why Sysco is at the heart of food and service.  Affirmative Action Statement  Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States.  We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, creed, religion, ancestry, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status or any other protected factor under federal, state or local law.  This opportunity is available through Sysco Corporation, its subsidiaries and affiliates.

description: Overview  Remote Open Position Locations - Arizona, Arkansas, Washington, Utah, Colorado, Connecticut, Delaware, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Kentucky, Massachusetts, Missouri, Nevada, North Carolina, New Jersey, New York, Ohio, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, Tennessee, Texas, Virginia, Wisconsin  Are you looking for a fun, energetic, and dynamic company to advance your career in sales? Do you want to work for a company that receives thousands of warm leads per day vs. being forced to find your own leads? Do you want to work in an environment with uncapped earning potential? Would you like an opportunity to earn a way to work from home?  Ideal Image is North America’s #1 Skin, Face and Body MedSpa for non-invasive aesthetic services that helps you look and feel your best. Our goal is to help our clients achieve life changing results, whether it’s getting rid of unwanted hair, preventing or addressing the signs of aging with healthier, more youthful skin, or to improve their body shape. Being a part of the team gives you the opportunity to help clients change their lives for the better every day! All services are safe, effective, FDA cleared procedures that are tested in our Research and Development Center and are administered by a staff of Medical Professionals that are credentialed at a level of RN or above.  Responsibilities  $$ Great Earning Potential!! 100% work from home position - Equipment Included!!  By using a consultative sales process, educates clients about Ideal Image products and services via telephone and web leads. Completes the sales process in accordance with all standards and guidelines set forth by Ideal Image. Achieves assigned sales targets and promotes a favorable image of Ideal Image. Fosters and nurtures positive relationships with clients and fellow employees. Overcomes objections and differentiates Ideal Image from our competition. This is not a cold-calling telemarketing position; however, you will be required to follow up on web leads via outbound calling, texts, and emails.  The Inside Sales Representative will also: Build relationships with clients over the telephone and through web communications. Schedule and confirm consultation appointments. Articulate treatment protocols, benefits, features, and limitations to clients. Partner and collaborate with Clinics, Managers and other Associates. Use appropriate interpersonal skills and communication methods to gain acceptance of products and services. Overcome obstacles that prevent sales. Makes clients and their needs a primary focus of one’s actions; effectively meets client needs; develops and sustains positive and productive client relationships; and takes responsibility for client satisfaction and loyalty. Interacts with others in a way that gives them confidence in one’s intentions and those of the organization. Always acts with integrity. Identifies opportunities and acts to build relationships between individuals, teams, departments, units, or organizations to help achieve business goals. Clearly conveys information and ideas through a variety of media to individuals or groups in a manner that engages the audience and helps them understand and retain the message. Follows the Ideal Image sales lead management process. Leverages tools, reports and resources to maximize sales results. Is open to and responds to coaching and feedback on sales approach and goal achievement. Seeks guidance on areas of improvement. Be flexible: schedule varies and includes nights and weekends. Overtime may be required to meet business demands to service clients which may include evening and weekend hours. Other duties as assigned. Qualifications  Experience/Qualifications: Candidate must have excellent consultative sales and negotiation skills Proven success in a full commission and/or quota driven environment Strong communication, high attention to detail and rapport building skills Self-motivation, drive, initiative and outgoing and confident sales approach Experience using a contact tracking system, Salesforce.com preferred Education/Training:  High school diploma required, Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution preferred. Our award-winning team of nearly 25,000 associates is diverse and dedicated, caring and creative. Together we’re shaping the future of the timeshare industry by doing things never done before. That’s part of what makes our work fun and interesting. Every day is a chance to learn something new and influence the global business. Sales Support Representative-Ermi LLC-Allentown, PA and Surrounding Areas  Looking to break into Healthcare?!! Come grow with us!!! Ermi is THE standard of care for patients with severe motion loss. Our program of cutting-edge medical devices and expert support services are implemented in partnership with physicians, therapists, and other healthcare professionals to meet the needs of patients suffering from this outlying condition.  Join us in our mission of rescuing patients so they can live life to the fullest!  GENERAL POSITION SUMMARY: Position Purpose: The Sales Support Representative (SSR) will manage and support existing sales accounts within a geographically defined territory to achieve and exceed business plans as directed by the sales professional. SSR is responsible for providing excellent patient care, education, and instruction in addition to performing fulfillment duties, such as inventory and logistics, to support the selling function of the sales team.  ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Principle accountabilities and responsibilities include the following: · Build and maintain positive working relationships with physicians, therapists, and staff · Conduct presentations and educate physicians, therapists, staff on Ermi program including value proposition · Collect and review quality paperwork from select accounts for authorization · Schedule, coordinate, and complete patient paperwork · Educate and instruct patients on Ermi program/protocol · Maintain clinic and patient accounts in company CRM · Maintain clean and compliant storage facility and inventory counts · Follow all federal and state healthcare regulations and company policies · Other duties as assigned by supervisor   EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Must have reliable transportation.  Requirements: Bachelor’s degree required. Minimum of 1-year experience in a customer service industry recommended. Clinical background preferred.  Skills and Knowledge: Work Skills: Attention to detail; strong computer skills, and superior organization and communication skills to distribute the right work to the right place at high volume throughout the day.  Competencies: Focus on Customers: Aggressively seeks to anticipate, meet and whenever possible, exceed the needs and expectations of internal and external customers. Shows Adaptability: Willing and able to adjust to rapidly changing priorities, multiple demands, and ambiguity (Communication) – Listen Attentively, Write Effectively, Speak with Impact: Communicates clearly, concisely and with sensitivity to the needs of others in all aspects of written and spoken communications. Establish Relationships and Establish Trust: Fosters excellent achievement through teamwork. Show Drive and Initiative and Manage and Improve Processes: Embraces innovation and change as healthy, and as a source of opportunity. Generates new ideas and approaches to solve problems and creates business opportunities, while maximizing existing resources.  Benefits: ·      Competitive Salary plus variable compensation ·      Flexible Schedule ·      Mileage Reimbursement ·      Full Time ·      Free Health Insurance ·      Dental, Vision ·      401-K with Excellent Company Match  PLEASE NOTE: Each successful candidate MUST live in their territory otherwise will NOT be

description: General Overview  The Guest Communications Department is often the first point of contact for our guests, it is the face of our company. The Inside Sales Representative works in the Guest Communications & Sales Department to optimize revenue and guest satisfaction through business to customer sales.   Essential Functions  Identify, pursue, track and close new reservation sales based on availability - no cold calling Communicate with potential customers via  phone, text message, email, and online messaging in accordance with Heirloom’s internal policies and procedures Preempt, understand, and address customer needs and requirements - find creative ways to cross-sell Build rapport with customers through friendly, professional, and engaging communication Meet and exceed revenue goals  Continuously work to improve the guest experience  Mentor more junior sales personnel. Foster a supportive culture of professional development within the department. Assist with customer support on an as needed basis Participate and contribute to all scheduled departmental meetings  Requisites  A successful Inside Sales Representative is a creative team player and an exceptional communicator. While we certainly welcome candidates with a formal background in sales and/or hospitality for this role, it is not a prerequisite for consideration. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds with excellent communication, leadership, and critical thinking skills looking to build a career.   1-3 years experience working in a sales environment  Excellent verbal and written  communication skills, polished phone demeanor Native fluency in English (spoken, written, and reading) Knowledge of commercial hospitality  industry is a plus Lives in or within commuting distance to New Orleans, LA  High energy - thrives in a fast-paced work environment Meticulously organized, process/detail oriented Technology feels intuitive: comfortable learning and working with cloud based computing platforms    Schedule & Compensation  This role is based out of Heirloom’s New Orleans office. Our office currently has a hybrid work model, with work from home flexibility available.  In addition to a competitive base salary, this role also includes uncapped performance based pay (commission) and a benefits package (insurance, 401k, PTO, employee stays at Heirloom properties, etc). Resume  Cover letter specifically addressing the essential functions of this role in relation to your skills, background, and experience.  Any additional material(s) you would like considered as part of your application

GMS, one of the country’s leading PEOs, is looking for high energy individuals with aggressive hunting skills to join our Outside Sales Team.  Who are YOU? Are you a driven individual that thrives in an entrepreneurial environment? – Here at GMS, our Outside Sales Reps are hunters who have the ability to own and run their own book of business. Would you like to use your skills and abilities to control and plan for your future? – Our Sales Team has the ability to write their paycheck with an uncapped, residual commission structure. Are you looking to bring your sales skills to a new arena/industry? – Come and join us for a two-week training program teaching you all of the in’s and out’s to be successful here. Is it important for you to receive recognition for your hard work? – We recognize our sales team through incentive trips, company sales awards, and an unlimited supply of high fives! What Does an Outside Sales Representative Do? Prospect new business and handle the sales process from cold call to contract Meet with top level decision makers to present and educate them on the various services we offer to help make their businesses Simpler, Safer, and Stronger! 100% B2B Sales/New Business Development Expectations for our Sales Representatives: Daily cold calling to hunt new prospects Conducting introductory in-person meetings with potential clients Proposing the constructive solution to best fit the clients’ needs/wants Working towards and exceeding your sales quota  What’s in it for YOU: Competitive Base Salary + Uncapped, Residual Commissions Company Car provided after 90 Days! Benefits – Medical, Dental, Vision, 401(k), Short Term Disability, Long Term Disability, Tuition Assistance, etc. Monthly gym membership and cell phone reimbursement Great work/life balance First Class training program – both at home and hands on; plus continuous development throughout your career No assigned territories… openly call within your region! What is a PEO? A Professional Employer Organization (PEO) is a multi-service-providing partner that allows companies to focus on growing their business by outsourcing the management of payroll and tax administration, employee benefits, workers’ compensation insurance, and human resources to a team of experts. The PEO industry is an $150+ billion dollar industry, with an average annual growth rate of 20% Between 2 and 3 million people are covered under a PEO arrangement in the United States  For more information please visit our website at www.groupmgmt.com  Group Management Services is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
industries: Human Resources

description: Business Development Sales - Private Equity - BC Capital Group (a Bainbridge affiliate)  Job Type: Full-time  Position Location: Remote, location agnostic, U.S. preference  How to Apply: Resume and Cover Letter required. Cover letter is required for consideration.  BC Capital Group is seeking outgoing and highly motivated candidates with strong client relationship skills and business acumen to join our private equity services firm. Representatives will participate in many aspects of acquisitions and divestitures, such as primary and secondary source research, development of industry and company profiles, and other qualitative and quantitative analysis. In addition, team members will learn research methodologies and quality control measures, and receive education on the alternatives markets including: investments by private equity groups, family offices, institutional investors, and corporate strategic acquirers, teamwork, communication, and development of professional skills,  Responsibilities Produce a high volume of B2B outbound sales calls prospecting to specific owners of companies pre-selected by team managers Conduct research, analysis and recommendations to ensure timely client deliverables and formation of investment thesis Collaborate with the BC Capital Group deal team to develop a pipeline of companies that meets their clients’ investment criteria Qualify businesses and business owners to identify their divestiture posture, ownership structure, revenue, EBITDA, actionability, and growth strategy Assist in representing our clients’ interests to business owners Data gathering via primary and secondary source research Qualifications BA/BS degree in Business, Finance or related field. MBA highly desireable Exceptional communication (written, verbal and listening) and organizational skills Experience in professional services sales environment preferred Proficiency in CRM, Market Research, MS Teams, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint; quantitative and qualitative programming skills and data analytics software knowledge a plus Understanding of corporate financial analysis and financial statements Adept at managing multiple projects and completing deliverables on schedule Discipline to manage workload while working remotely Ability to work independently and interdependently within a team environment Exhibit a positive and professional attitude on a daily basis with clients and team members A high level of ownership, accountability and initiative Why Work Here?  BC Capital Group is one of the leading M&A professional services firm, serving the world's top private equity funds and corporate buyers. We have completed over $5 billion in small cap acquisitions for PE funds and corporations in all market sectors including: technology, healthcare, automation, global supply chain, machine learning and energy. After two years, successful team members are achieving results in their knowledge of markets, finance, the private equity transaction process and portfolio strategy. While becoming key to our clients' success, our professionals have the potential to earn or exceed six-figure compensation packages, and go on to become leaders within our firm, within our client private equity funds, at leading investment banks or graduate business programs.  BC Capital is a separately-owned affiliate to Bainbridge, a global strategic consulting firm, delivering high value advisory services to the Fortune 1000. Founded out of MIT, our main goal is to help clients achieve their strategic objectives while our team members achieve their highest professional goals.

description: St. Louis area candidates only please.  Nikco Sports is a St. Louis-based, fast-paced, nationwide sports sales and marketing company in business for over 28 years. We seek energetic, enthusiastic, reliable teammates who desire unlimited potential for growth and opportunity. Nikco pays very competitive wages and unlimited commissions, has an excellent healthcare plan, paid holidays, vacation and personal days. No travel or weekend work required. In addition, Nikco Sports is proud to have donated in excess of $2.8 million to various charities including Make-A-Wish Foundation, Boys & Girls Clubs, Ronald McDonald House, and many, many more.  Nikco Sports is seeking professional Inside Sales Representatives to join our team! This position is paid a base salary plus commission. We see this opportunity not as a job, but a career for the right individual. We are looking for a highly motivated, independent and self-driven sales professional who thrives on new business development sales with computer skills and a determined-to-succeed attitude. Experience in any sales-especially an excellent track record in inside sales-is a big plus!  Ideal Candidates Will Have The Following Skills Or Qualities Excellent Verbal Communication Skills Strong Sales Closing Skills Confidence Competitive Strong Time Management Skills Tenacity Team Player with a Positive, Upbeat Attitude Desire for Unlimited Compensation Nikco Sports Offers Base Salary + Uncapped Commission Health Benefits Vacation and Paid Personal Days Paid Holidays Training Program to Ensure Success A great career opportunity to join our team of long-tenured staff at our beautiful corporate headquarters in bustling Chesterfield Valley! We provide an upbeat, positive environment and, of course, fun and exciting products.  Employment is contingent upon successful completion of drug screening and background check.  Since 1990, Nikco Sports has proudly offered exclusive sports memorabilia to over 350,000 satisfied customers around the world. We pride ourselves on offering our customers unique and exciting products across all major sports leagues, including the NFL, MLB, NBA, NHL and NCAA.  We also aim to provide high-touch customer service in order to give our customers the best shopping experience possible. When you contact us, you will always get a live person to answer your call, never an automated system. We believe that treating others the way that we would like to be treated is the basis for a solid business.  We believe in giving back. As a company, Nikco's commitment to the community has taken the form of a wide-range of charitable contributions.  Since its inception, Nikco Sports has given over $2.5 million to the Make-a-Wish Foundation, the Ronald McDonald House, the United Way and hundreds of other deserving charities.  When you choose Nikco Sports, you're dealing with a company that some of the greatest and most respected athletes work with because they trust our integrity and professionalism.  Nikco Sports is a steadily growing sports sales and marketing company in business for over 30 years. We are always looking for energetic, enthusiastic, reliable people who desire unlimited potential for growth. Nikco pays competitive wages, has an excellent healthcare plan, paid holidays and vacation days.

description: St. Louis area candidates only please.  Nikco Sports is a St. Louis-based, fast-paced, nationwide sports sales and marketing company in business for over 28 years. We seek energetic, enthusiastic, reliable teammates who desire unlimited potential for growth and opportunity. Nikco pays very competitive wages and unlimited commissions, has an excellent healthcare plan, paid holidays, vacation and personal days. No travel or weekend work required. In addition, Nikco Sports is proud to have donated in excess of $2.8 million to various charities including Make-A-Wish Foundation, Boys & Girls Clubs, Ronald McDonald House, and many, many more.  Nikco Sports is seeking professional Inside Sales Representatives to join our team! This position is paid a base salary plus commission. We see this opportunity not as a job, but a career for the right individual. We are looking for a highly motivated, independent and self-driven sales professional who thrives on new business development sales with computer skills and a determined-to-succeed attitude. Experience in any sales-especially an excellent track record in inside sales-is a big plus!  Ideal Candidates Will Have The Following Skills Or Qualities Excellent Verbal Communication Skills Strong Sales Closing Skills Confidence Competitive Strong Time Management Skills Tenacity Team Player with a Positive, Upbeat Attitude Desire for Unlimited Compensation Nikco Sports Offers Base Salary + Uncapped Commission Health Benefits Vacation and Paid Personal Days Paid Holidays Training Program to Ensure Success A great career opportunity to join our team of long-tenured staff at our beautiful corporate headquarters in bustling Chesterfield Valley! We provide an upbeat, positive environment and, of course, fun and exciting products.  Employment is contingent upon successful completion of drug screening and background check.  Since 1990, Nikco Sports has proudly offered exclusive sports memorabilia to over 350,000 satisfied customers around the world. We pride ourselves on offering our customers unique and exciting products across all major sports leagues, including the NFL, MLB, NBA, NHL and NCAA.  We also aim to provide high-touch customer service in order to give our customers the best shopping experience possible. When you contact us, you will always get a live person to answer your call, never an automated system. We believe that treating others the way that we would like to be treated is the basis for a solid business.  We believe in giving back. As a company, Nikco's commitment to the community has taken the form of a wide-range of charitable contributions.  Since its inception, Nikco Sports has given over $2.5 million to the Make-a-Wish Foundation, the Ronald McDonald House, the United Way and hundreds of other deserving charities.  When you choose Nikco Sports, you're dealing with a company that some of the greatest and most respected athletes work with because they trust our integrity and professionalism.  Nikco Sports is a steadily growing sports sales and marketing company in business for over 30 years. We are always looking for energetic, enthusiastic, reliable people who desire unlimited potential for growth. Nikco pays competitive wages, has an excellent healthcare plan, paid holidays and vacation days.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Sports, and Retail

description: About This Position  M&A Sales Associate - BC Capital Group (a Bainbridge affiliate)  Job Type: Full-time / Salaried / Contract  How to Apply: Please submit resume and cover letter. Cover letter is required for consideration.  Position Location: Remote, location agnostic, U.S. preference  BC Capital Group is seeking highly motivated candidates interested in expanding their professional opportunities in Private Equity where their business acumen, professional services sales/client management, and analytical skills can be leveraged in the rewarding sector of buy-side Private Equity and M&A advisory. Associates will participate in many aspects of acquisitions and divestitures, such as secondary source research, development of industry and company profiles, and other quantitative and qualitative analysis. Although BC Capital Group seeks Associates with diverse backgrounds, candidates with a degree in finance or economics are preferred.  A BC Capital Group Associate should demonstrate maturity and initiative, excellent analytical ability, relationship building and strong communication (written and verbal) and teamwork skills. Also needed is an understanding of corporate financial analysis and financial statements, and the ability to adapt to varied assignments and situations.  Responsibilities  The Associate will assist with all aspects of generating deal flow on behalf of their clients.  This Will Include Working with the BC Capital Group team to develop a pipeline of companies that meets their clients’ investment criteria Calling and emailing with business owners of middle market companies in a diverse array of industries to build relationships with them on behalf of your clients Qualifying businesses to identify their divestiture posture, ownership structure, revenue, EBITDA, actionability and growth strategy Assist Team in communicating our clients’ interest and provide feedback to business owners Data gathering via secondary and primary source research Training Includes Education on the alternatives markets, including investments by private equity groups, family offices, institutional investors, and corporate strategic acquirers Consultative sales training Client account management To Qualify For This Excellent Opportunity, Candidates Must Demonstrate Top percentile Business Development Skills Proven research and analytical skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to work independently and interdependently within a team environment Adept at managing multiple projects and completing deliverables on schedule Education/Experience Bachelor's degree from an accredited four-year college or university, preferably in Business, Finance or related field Multiple years of experience in client-facing professional services sales Compensation: Salary + Bonuses Commensurate with Investment Banking Professional Roles  (To perform this job successfully, the individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.)  Why Work Here?  Forbes-rated award winning professional consultancy with exceptional growth in new technology, meritocracy, expanding management team.  BC Capital Group is a separately-owned affiliate to Bainbridge, a global strategic consulting firm, delivering high value advisory services to the Fortune 1000. Founded out of MIT, our main goal is to help clients achieve their strategic objectives while our team members achieve their highest professional goals. The company was recently ranked by Forbes Magazine among the 99th percentile of national management consulting firms and by Vault Magazine as a top 50 national management consulting firm. Our culture is one of teamwork, achievement, and excellence in customer service. From 2016-2020, Bainbridge was recognized by Forbes ranking of America's Best Management Consulting Firms across 14 industries of expertise. In 2016 Bainbridge was ranked in the Top 50 Most Prestigious Consulting Firms in North America by Vault. In 2007, Bainbridge Consulting was recognized as an employer of choice by the San Diego Business Journal, reflecting the values of teamwork, scholarship, excellence, and impactful value.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Management Consulting, and Financial Services

description: A Sales Manager with Washington Hilton is responsible for representing the hotel's services and facilities to prospective clients and customers in the hotel's continuing effort to deliver outstanding guest service and financial profitability.  Find our historic hotel within blocks of Dupont Circle and Adams Morgan. The White House and National Mall are less than two miles away. We feature a seasonal outdoor pool deck complete with fire pits and a kids pool. Visit LivingWell Health Club for a choice of exercise classes. Sightseeing buses pick up at the hotel, and we sell tour tickets in the lobby.  What will I be doing?  Responsibilities  Specifically, you would be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards  As a Sales Manager, you would be responsible for representing the hotel's services and facilities to prospective clients and customers in the hotel's continuing effort to deliver outstanding guest service and financial profitability. Respond to sales inquiries from potential clients and customers seeking sleeping rooms, meeting space, food and beverage services, etc. Initiate new sales, prospects and qualifies leads and solicits potential clients Host and entertain clients and maintain client accounts Conduct property site visits and answer questions Determine rates, prepare proposals, negotiate contracts, service accounts and analyze lost business for the hotel(s) Develop sales plans and strategies to meet or exceed established revenue and room night goals Partner with operations departments to ensure full participation in servicing accounts

description: At Loxone we believe smart homes and building automation should be simple and affordable. We enable people to live and work happier, safer, and more comfortable lives in homes and buildings through the intelligent use of technology.  In just 7 years, we’ve sold over 150,000 Loxone Systems installed by our global network of 13,000 Partners. In our Philadelphia area Headquarters, you can take part in the expansion of our operations.  Your Responsibilities Assisting partners (electrical contractors, system integrators) in project design and execution through phone, video and email support Onboarding new Loxone partners to make them comfortable with the products Regularly connect with partners to build a trusting relationship with the Loxone brand Increasing revenue with the existing Loxone partner network by understanding your partners’ business Plan and design showrooms with our best partners What We Expect Passion for automation / smart home / intelligent buildings Technology & Sales enthusiasm Communication skills Electrical / Network / Programming skills Strong desire to learn We offer  Furthermore, We Offer  We are offering steep learning curve by starting your role off with a one-month training in Austria with all costs covered. Opportunity to travel to Europe: 1-month training course in Europe to learn everything about working in the role High paced and fun environment with plenty of potential avenues of growth within the company A competitive and fixed salary. Benefits include 401k, medical, dental and PTO Flexible working hours between 7am and 7pm An upbeat team in a growth environment We call ourselves the best workplace for performers. Do you want to know why? Then send us your CV.  After 10 years, Loxone has become a leading smart home and building automation company. We're rapidly growing in the US market, which is why we need you. Now is the perfect time to join us on our journey to change the way people enjoy life in homes and buildings.  Just this past year, we moved into our new, totally modern and automated smart office with European flair in the Greater Philadelphia area - lighting that turns on as you enter the room with colors that set to your liking, temperature that’s always just right, even a fireplace triggered by cold winter days - creating the optimal working environment. You’ll also get to occasionally visit our Loxone Show Home (mainly used for smart home tours) where we’ll get to share a few drinks and stories in matching green slippers (yes, we’re that cool). Of course, with lighting and audio paired to create the ideal mood.  We’ve also released some revolutionary products (you’ll learn all about those later) that are now winning prestigious awards. And the team? Just as awesome. You could become part of a supportive, savvy and upbeat squad that has what it takes to make some major wins.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Construction, and Consumer Services

description: Group Management Services (GMS), one of the country’s leading PEOs, is looking for a high energy individual that can help drive success within our sales team. Launch your sales career by using your aggressive hunting skills to connect with business owners. What Does a Business Development Representative Do? Prospect new business through cold calling and lead generation Research new business opportunities and add leads into the system Help build relationships by assisting the Sales Representatives with administrative tasks and prospect follow up Help build GMS’s social media presence to generate interest in our services What’s in it for YOU: Base Salary + Commissions on meetings ran and leads that converts to a sale Benefits – Medical, Dental, Vision, 401(k), Short Term Disability, Long Term Disability, Tuition Assistance, etc. Monthly gym membership and cell phone reimbursement Great work/life balance First Class training program – both at home and hands on; plus continuous development throughout your career What is a PEO? A Professional Employer Organization (PEO) is a multi-service-providing partner that allows companies to focus on growing their business by outsourcing the management of payroll and tax administration, employee benefits, workers’ compensation insurance, and human resources to a team of experts. The PEO industry is a $100+ billion dollar industry, with an annual growth rate of 20% Between 2 and 3 million people are covered under a PEO arrangement in the United States For more information please visit our website at www.groupmgmt.com Group Management Services is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

description: Overview  We are experts in the beer, wine, and spirits industry looking for individuals who share our passion for customer service and are ready for a developmental sales role in preparation to become a Sales Representative.  As a Sales Development Representative, you will support the sales team as you rotate through different off premise territories as an apprentice and sales relief driving volume and profit of wine and spirit brands. You will learn best sales practices including territory planning, selling execution and effective communication with customers and sales leaders.  If you are passionate about the beverage industry and are ready to learn the skills to be successful in the next step of your sales career- and have a car to drive to our customers’ locations- then come join our fun, family-based culture.  Responsibilities Plan and execute a daily schedule of calls for assigned territory as route coverage. Solicit new business to increase revenue and distribution within route territory. Effectively plan on a daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly basis to meet goals to increase market share, space allocation and customer service. Ensures maximum brand visibility within accounts by utilizing effective and current point of sale materials when appropriate. Communicate and follow through on issues deemed important to management, our customers and suppliers. Ensure all required documentation is completed in an accurate and timely manner. Develop and grow your brand, market and industry knowledge to more effectively promote sales. Report on issues related to the competitive market and offer constructive suggestions. Communicate merchandising and POS tactics to accounts, coordinate and support merchandising activities/resets, as needed. Other duties as assigned. Qualifications Must be at least 21 years of age Must possess a valid Driver’s License Must have reliable transportation and proof of auto insurance College degree preferred or equivalent sales experience Proficient PC, iPad and MS Office skills Must be a detail and results-oriented professional with excellent verbal/written communication skills. Physical Demands Of Job Carrying and lifting 45-65 pounds Overhead and immediate reaching to perform various duties Standing and walking for periods of time to perform various duties Squatting or bending to perform various duties as assigned EEO Statement  Breakthru Beverage Group is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, genetic information and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster is available Here , if you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please call (708) 298-3536 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. description: Specialty Enzyme & Probiotics manufactures and sells enzymes & probiotics to nearly every major nutraceutical company in the US. We have a global footprint, selling to over 60 countries worldwide, with offices in the US, Germany and India. We specialize in tailor-made blends for customer-specific solutions. This position is tasked with growing our sales to new customers and being brand ambassadors for our Company. The role involves entirely business-to-business inside sales.  The ideal candidate is sharp, outgoing , trainable, and a self-starter. You will be cold-calling to generate leads, qualify prospects, and working alongside Account Managers to close sales. Our goal is to grow our Inside Sales Representatives into Account Managers. We are looking for people passionate about health and well-being, who genuinely believe in our products.  This is not a remote position. Applicants must be willing to learn and grow from other team members.  Responsibilities Become an expert in the Company’s brand, products and market position. Source new sales opportunities through inbound lead follow-up and outbound cold calls and emails. Prospect call preparation including company background research and other pertinent lead information. Enter, update, and maintain CRM information on leads, prospects, and opportunities. Work with clients to solve their problems and formulate enzyme and probiotic solutions. Represent the Company at trade shows, conferences, and other similar events.  Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Business or Health Science Knowledge of the nutraceutical industry, enzymes, and/or probiotics a plus. Knowledge of food sales a plus. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to multi-task, organize, and prioritize work. Must be able to occasionally lift boxes and luggage for tradeshows/conferences.   Additional Requirements Core Work hours 8:15 am – 5:00 pm M-F Professional dress code  Why Join Us? Excellent work-life balance in a friendly environment. There are many opportunities for growth. The Company is well-established for over 35 years, but rapidly growing and passionate about the future. Get all the benefits of a startup with the resources of a large one. Exceptional benefits, including 401(k) with profit sharing, medical, dental, vision, pet insurance, and free chiropractic/acupuncture insurance. The Company takes benefits very seriously, and spends a lot of energy each year figuring out how to deliver the best benefits possible to their employees. Work with a science-oriented company that is making measurable impact on people's health and well-being. We care about you! Strict safety measures in place for all workers.

description: This is your opportunity to join a team of truly collaborative sales professionals in a leading global life sciences company that advances patient health and powers clear, confident decisions through its diagnostics testing, while selling the benefits of LabCorp in multiple physician specialties.  Recognized as one of Forbe's 2020 World's Best Employers and named to Fortune Magazine's 2021 list of "World's Most Admired Companies," Labcorp is seeking to hire an Inside Sales Representative to help manage relationships that increase loyalty and accessioning volume across an assigned territory of existing small to medium sized clients.  Labcorp has built a solid reputation as a front-runner in the diagnostics industry. We're a stimulating company that consistently develops new testing across many specialties. Here you can leverage your existing connections and tap into the potential of new Labcorp customers to generate new business. You'll find a rewarding role fueled by your persistence; allowing you to make a difference in people's lives, including your own.  This position will be responsible for effectively communicating and selling the benefits of LabCorp in many physician specialties. This candidate is expected to increase usage with existing clients and develop and close their own sales targets on a monthly basis.  Job Duties/Responsibilities Sell laboratory testing services to professionals in a variety of medical fields Meet and exceed sales goals and achieve maximum sales growth in assigned territory Successfully build and execute an annual business plan with quarterly updates Build a sales pipeline that will provide ongoing revenue goal achievement Accurately forecast and maintain a sales funnel of new opportunities in-line with a 90-day quota Effectively manage activity to maintain revenue and encourage organic growth Collaborate closely with team members to retain current book of business Effectively communicate value propositions to all targeted customers and prospects Collaborate and actively contribute to new business opportunities with LCA counterparts Update all relevant customer account information into Salesforce CRM Provide ongoing customer support, education on focus products and market updates for current customer base Starting pay is $50,000 and commensurate with experience. Regular, full-time or part-time employees working 20 or more hours per week are eligible for comprehensive benefits. Click here to see benefits highlights: https://jobs.labcorp.com/why-labcorp  Requirements High school diploma or equivalent is required; Associates or Bachelor's degree is preferred Previous sales, customer service or account management experience is required; preferably 3 to 5 years Ability to collaborate closely with sales and operations teams to grow the business Strong consultative selling and closing skills Ability to understand scientific literature and use clinical data as a selling factor Strong communication skills; both written and verbal Excellent time management and organization skills Proficient in Microsoft Office including Word, Power Point & Excel If you're looking for a career that offers opportunities for growth, continual development, professional challenge and the chance to make a real difference, apply today  Shift  1  Schedule  Monday - Friday 8:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m.

description: Hi, We’re AppFolio  We’re innovators, changemakers, and collaborators. We’re more than just a software company — we’re a cloud-based powerhouse that creates products to make our customers’ lives easier. We’re revolutionizing the way people do business, and we want your ideas, your enthusiasm, and your passion to help us keep on innovating.  We love where we work, and you can, too. Identifying and prioritizing sales opportunities through direct prospecting and lead follow. Developing and maintaining a high level of knowledge about Appfolio Property Manager.
