description: The Diagnostic Sales Specialist (DSS) is responsible for effectively communicating and selling the benefits of the APTIMA product line, the ThinPrep Pap Test and adjunctive testing, and the ThinPrep Imaging System, to clinicians in an assigned geographic territory. Additionally, the DSS provides educational support to OB/GYNs and other clinical professionals in the office and hospital setting as well as strategic business planning and development for primary and secondary product lines.  Duties & Responsibilities: Meet and exceed sales goals and achieve maximum sales in assigned territory Accurately forecast and maintain an individual territory book of business in accordance with a 90-day quota for assigned and acquired products as required Achieve individual sales revenue quota on a quarterly and annual basis for assigned and acquired products as required Develop and execute business plans for targeted accounts. Complete a territory business analysis for management review on a quarterly basis Maintain ongoing business planning with customers in territory; this includes periodic business reviews with customer's financial departments, as well as sales planning with customer's sales department Effectively route plan and manage business for assigned territory Attend quarterly Plan of Action Meetings within district Periodically provide Rapid fFN Fetal Fibronectin in-services and training to laboratory personnel and Labor and Delivery Staff, per the territory needs of the local Strategic Account Manager (SAM) Perinatal Support territory sales goals by maintaining core ThinPrep Pap Test business (Account Executive's Primary Line of Business), increasing usage, and prospecting new customers Effectively sell Hologic's sales message to all customers in the targeted territory Effectively insulate accounts against competition and regaining lost customer accounts Maintain consistent and structured communication with Account Executive counterpart and articulate summarized communication to District Sales Manager on a periodic basis Integrate successfully into team selling environment by partnering sales efforts with Territory Manager and Account Executive, and other Hologic colleagues and laboratory partners Assist in generating leads for other Hologic products Manage time effectively; prioritize and make good business judgments and decisions in relationship to efficiency, effectiveness while meeting daily call expectations Partner with marketing department to support the development and execution of marketing programs and sales materials Attend local and national professional trade shows and events and promote products to all customers Update and sync all relevant customer account information into Hologic's Data Management System daily Perform other duties as required  Qualifications:  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the basic knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required: Demonstrated track record of success and sales accomplishments Ability to sell in a consultative manner such that the customer need is discovered and addressed in an individualized clinical and data-driven manner Strong persuasiveness and influence skills required Ability to understand and articulate complex scientific literature and use extensive and complex clinical data as a key factor in the sales process. Familiarity with clinical and economic outcome data, reimbursement, and managed care policies and procedures  Education: Bachelor of Arts/Science from an accredited university required  Experience: Candidate must have a minimum of two years sales experience Medical background/sales experience, laboratory experience, and/or managed care knowledge desirable Business-to-business experience highly desired  Additional Details: Since this position requires extensive driving during the workday, a valid driving license and satisfactory driving record, as well as a serviceable vehicle available for work use is mandatory  Agency and Third Party Recruiter Notice: Agencies that submit a resume to Hologic must have a current executed Hologic Agency Agreement executed by a member of the Human Resource Department. In addition Agencies may only submit candidates to positions for which they have been invited to do so by a Hologic Recruiter. All resumes must be sent to the Hologic Recruiter under these terms or they will not be considered.  Hologic, Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer inclusive of disability and veterans.

Project Sales Representative (Charleston, SC)  Growth-Minded, Established Rigging Contractor In the last 10 years, ProLift Rigging has become one of the nation’s leading rigging, crane, and transportation contractor serving fast growing US markets. Our local branch sales and operations teams collaborate to develop engineered rigging, crane, and transport solutions based on our customers operational pains. ProLift has deep roots in rigging, and brings fresh, innovative solutions to an established marketplace.  We are Driven by these Core Values Safety – Evaluate risk, plan to mitigate it to protect our customers, our team, the public and property. Superintend – Take seriously the opportunity to wisely invest our time, talent, and capital for the benefit of others. Diligence – Remember that any meaningful goal is achieved through diligent persistence and staying engaged. Do whatever it takes to achieve our mission within the constraints of our values. Teamwork – We are a team that needs each members’ contribution to achieve our mission.  Does the Following Describe You? Value-seller Sales Hunter Always prospecting Coachable Top performer who excels under pressure  Enjoys accountability  Who We Want As we continue to grow our market and customer footprint in Charleston, SC, we are seeking a local Project Sales Representative who believes they are a true Sales Hunter. They are self-motivated and take pride in exceeding their prospecting and closed sales goals. Our ideal Project Sales Representative can strategically prospect into new and existing top accounts within our ProLift Rigging major markets. They welcome the challenge of working our sales process to discover and solve their top account’s operational pains related to rigging, crane, and transportation scopes of work to build ProLift/Top Account lasting relationships.   What You’ll Do As a Project Sales Representative, you will be responsible for uncovering and qualifying new prospects in our Charleston, SC region. You will work with our team to learn and execute our sales process to solve our customer’s pain(s) relating to our core scopes of work. As a valued member of our branch team, you will collaborate internally with our sales, operations, and engineering departments to close quality work, continuously improving and growing our local Charleston, SC branch. You will maintain a high level of personal accountability by keeping our CRM system updated and actively participating in our branch weekly sales meeting.   Qualifications  Required: 5+ years of successful outside B2B sales experience Excellent hunting/prospecting skills  Preferred: Experience in the crane & rigging industry Strong CRM skills Consultative approach to building relationships and achieving sales goals  What We Will Include ProLift Rigging will set you up for success through a targeted onboarding process. For the right individual, it will be an amazing fit and opportunity. We offer a competitive base salary plus a performance-based bonus, retirement and health care benefits, PTO, and recurrent training.  How to apply Please click “Apply” & send a copy of your resume with a brief cover letter or email explaining who you are and why you believe you are the best choice for this position.

You Will Achieve quotas to produce Professional Services sales Lead the services pre-sales process with the sales team to understand the customer's business and technical goals, and solution requirements to build customer relationships and scope opportunities Provide guidance to the Sales Engineering team for the most relevant demo or POC creation Lead the Professional Services sales process, advise customers on preliminary solution architecture, and construct the Scope of Work related to the developed solution architecture Create Professional Services opportunities, manage pursuits, present project SOW 's and be an essential partner in closing deals Manage the customer relationship(s) from initial discussions to close of deal and maintain customer relationships to help ensure project success and support the sale of additional services offerings Conduct yourself as the liaison of each Tier I project engagement, providing status updates to the sales team in a proactive cadence , through engagement closure Promote the transition, post engagement, from the Professional Services Team to Customer Success, if applicable Present Professional Services offerings to existing customers and new prospects Forecast for accounts and opportunities Work with the Professional Services leaders for resource planning to ensure successful knowledge transfer and onboarding of new customers Perform other duties as assigned Requirements Two years of business experience Minimum of 1 year of Project Management Experience conducting customer workshops Experience positioning the value proposition of PS offerings Experience developing and explaining Business Cases / Return on investment studies Ability to travel up to 50% BS degree or equivalent, advanced degree highly desirable. Perks & Benefits 100% employer-paid medical, dental, and vision coverage for full-time employees Equity - Restricted Stock Units (RSUs) with all offers Lucrative Employee Stock Purchase Program (15% discount) 401k Match to help you save for your future (50% of your contribution up to the first 6% of your eligible pay) Monthly stipend to support your work and productivity Flexible Time Away Program, plus Incidental Sick Leave Up to 24 weeks of Parental Leave Personal paid Volunteer Day to support our community Opportunities for professional growth and development including access to LinkedIn Learning online courses Company Funded Perks, including a counseling membership, primary care membership, local retail discounts, and your own personal Smartsheet account Teleworking options from any registered location in the U.S. (role specific) About Smartsheet  Smartsheet is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to fostering an inclusive environment with the best employees. We provide employment opportunities without regard to any legally protected status in accordance with applicable laws in the US, UK, and Australia. If there are preparations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.  At Smartsheet, we strive to build an inclusive environment that encourages, supports, and celebrates the diverse voices of our team members who also represent the diverse needs of our customers. We’re looking for people who are driven, authentic, supportive, effective, and honest. You’re encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn’t precisely match our job description—if your career path has been nontraditional, that will set you apart. At Smartsheet, we welcome diverse perspectives and people who aren’t afraid to be innovative—join us!

description: Job Description  The primary focus of an Internet Sales representative is to sell solutions and services to existing Oracle customers and to prospect for new customers in the assigned territory or vertical.  As an Internet Sales Representative, you will sell products and services to an assigned geographic or national account base territory to achieve assigned objectives. Generates sales leads as well as closing the sales online or by phone. Utilizes inbound and/or outbound calls to pursue sales. Develops account penetration strategies and closes business. Responsible for understanding Oracle's product offerings and competitive issues. Identifies new business opportunities by creating and implementing territory campaigns with management assistance. Liaise with customer contacts to manage the customer relationship, identifying new opportunities, and selling Oracle products and services. Participates as a team member on sales teams, including field sales, support and education sales, and sales consulting.  Duties and tasks are standard with some variation. Completes own role largely independently within defined policies and procedures. Works under general supervision. Seeks intervention from his/her manager on complex deals that fall outside of existing guidelines. Three years of relevant experience. Ability to communicate effectively over the telephone with high-level decision-makers. Ability to work independently. Typically Bachelor's degree in Business or Computer Science or equivalent. jobTitle: Sales Representative - Fire and Life Safety
description: Eaton’s Life Safety Division is currently seeking a Sales Representative supporting Fire products to join our team. This tri-state position can be home based out of Eastern PA, Metro NY or NJ area.  Position Overview:  As a leading supplier in the Life Safety markets, Eaton provides decades of experience and innovation. Eaton’s solutions include Wheelock notification appliances, SAFEPATH in-building voice evacuation systems and MEDC harsh and hazardous devices.  The Tri-state Regional Sales Representative is responsible for managing existing customers while focusing on developing and closing new business opportunities within key sophisticated vertical markets.  Making what matters work at Eaton takes the passion of every employee around the world. We create an environment where creativity, invention and discovery become reality, each and every day. It’s where bold, bright professionals like you can reach your full potential—and where you can help us reach ours.  In this function you will Implement short, medium and long-term strategic and tactical plans that promote the product platform for the Life Safety solutions offered at Eaton. Aggressively manage and track business opportunity pipeline (e.g., private and public entities aligned with government/defense, transportation, petrochemical, higher education and miscellaneous sectors.) Utilize consultative style to evaluate the prospective customer’s existing Fire systems, processes and potential gaps. Identify solutions that incorporate the appropriate Eaton product line/technology Develop solution strategies to sell appropriate Life Safety solutions to top level decision makers, as well as project consultants, contractors, architects and engineers, code enforcement officials, and other end-users. Work collaboratively through a network of OEM, security distribution, engineer systems dealers and integrators in multiple vertical markets to meet target sales goals. Develop new relationships that will impact growth within targeted areas. Manage and coordinate the distributor & integrator network already established Aggressively manage and track business opportunity pipeline Support other business development initiatives as needed. Promote the company’s mission and vision by actively supporting Eaton’s ethics and values as well as quality policies.  Basic Qualifications: High School Diploma Minimum of 3 years’ experience in Fire and Life Safety systems products and/or services Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without company sponsorship Must possess and maintain a valid & unrestricted driver’s license Relocation is not offered for this position. Candidates must reside within Eastern PA, Metro NY or NJ area.  Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution 5 years’ experience in Fire and Life Safety systems products and/or services, focused in the commercial, institutional, and/or industrial market space 3 years outside sales  Position Success Criteria: Successful track record of building lasting relationships with distributors, end users, Intercompany leaders and sales teams Possess strong project and program management skills demonstrating attention to detail Strive for excellence in customer service and sales performance Self-motivated needing little daily supervision to outperform expectations Strong relationships and industry knowledge of codes and standards Excellent communication skills  We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.  We provide benefits that are industry competitive and focused on employee well-being. Listed below are programs that are offered globally, but program availabilities may vary by site. Flexible work options to help balance work/life demands (at participating Eaton sites) Healthcare/retirement savings programs Competitive compensation packages to reward skills and performance Tuition assistance or financial help for ongoing learning and development Health, Dental, Vision & Wellness programs Donation matching (U.S., Canada, Puerto Rico) MSJA  Job  Sales  Region  North America – US/Puerto Rico  Primary Location  United States-New Jersey-Long Branch  Other Locations  United States-Pennsylvania-Moon Township, United States-New York-New York  Work Locations  Long Branch NJ Loc  Organization  LSD Life Safety Division EMEA  Job Level  Individual Contributor  Schedule  Full-time  Is remote work (i.e. working from home or another Eaton facility) allowed for this position?  Yes  Does this position offer relocation?  No  Travel  Yes, 50 % of the Time  Requisition ID :108127

description: PaySimple, a division of EverCommerce, is seeking a resourceful, driven, results-oriented Sales Development Representative to qualify inquires from prospective customers and identify new opportunities to sell PaySimple services.  You  You are a highly motivated, self-starter with an ability to identify, engage, and convert prospects for new conversations with the sales organization. The SDR is often the first point of contact for the sales team – an important first impression. You will be tasked with speaking to inbound, prospective customers who have expressed interest in our services and also performing outbound activities to generate interest across a wide array of prospective new customers. You are fearless and get energy from talking to people You have a unique ability to reach prospects creatively and position solutions/products You are eager to learn world-class sales practices and advance your career You are eager for the opportunity to apply your experience, knowledge, and passion to help our organization grow/scale Us  PaySimple, an EverCommerce company, is the leading provider of payment management solutions for over 20,000 SMBs. Our APIs and SaaS products provide payment acceptance, billing automation, client management, ecommerce, mobile, and point-of-sale solutions tailored to the needs of service-based businesses. We are building an extraordinary company and looking for talented, energetic, and motivated people to join our team.  Where  PaySimple’s HQ is in Denver’s RiNo district, conveniently located on the A line, just one stop from Union Station. Our collaborative, open-plan office space is filled with high-energy, talented people who enjoy our weekly lunches, monthly happy hours, and hanging out and working in our amazing space with their co-workers. We are starting to reopen our offices, but will continue to work in a hybrid model for the foreseeable future.  Responsibilities Managing a large flow of incoming leads and inquiries with timely, professional response Executing on outbound campaigns to drive net new logos with a multi-touch campaign consisting of emails, phone calls, and LinkedIn outreach Making a minimum of 50 outbound or follow-up calls daily Overcoming prospective customer objections as well as answering initial questions Utilizing the lead qualification process as well as documenting sales information in Salesforce CRM Assisting marketing with testing, execution, and reporting on lead quality as well as messaging effectiveness and persona targeting Meeting weekly goals and established metrics for opportunity qualification and meetings set Utilizing the sales tools provided and collaborating with sales team members to schedule prospect meetings Identifying, initiating, and nurturing relationships with sales-ready leads, both over the phone and via email Experience And Skills 1+ years of experience in software or service industry sales Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth, rapidly changing environment Excellent phone presence and strong writing skills Highly coachable and naturally curious; a strong desire to learn, adapt, and grow Experience with Salesforce, Zoom, LinkedIn Sales Nav, Microsoft Office, and sales engagement technology is a plus Benefits And Perks Robust health and wellness benefits 401k with match Public Transportation reimbursement Gym stipend Start with 17 days of PTO, 11 holidays, and a day off to volunteer each year Snacks, lunches, and happy hours (as the office reopens) Continued investment in your professional development Compensation: $50,000 - $60,000 OTE in Denver & most remote locations. Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors including candidate experience and expertise and may vary from the amounts listed above.  PaySimple is the leading provider of Service Commerce solutions for SMBs. Its SaaS platform provides payment acceptance, billing automation, client management, ecommerce, mobile, and point-of-sale solutions tailored to the needs of service-based businesses. We are building an extraordinary company and looking for talented, energetic, and motivated people to join our unique environment.  EverCommerce is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We look forward to reviewing your credentials and getting to know more about your experience!

ESS Academy educates small business owners on how they can scale their company by securing large contracts using their own products and/or services. description: ConectUS Wireless is currently seeking a Channel Partner Representative responsible for cultivating and maintaining relationships among business partners while also developing strategies to increase overall Verizon sales.  This position will have a variety of responsibilities including developing and maintaining business relationships and designing policies that allow partnerships to thrive; identifying partner sales opportunities; strengthening existing relationships and collaborations; building professional networks; developing and executing business plans for strategic growth; managing forecasts and sales funnels on a daily basis; and possibly attending meetings and events to serve as a representative of ConectUS.  The CPR should be a strategic thinker with an amiable personality, a positive outlook, and expert communication skills. Organizational skills and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment are also beneficial.  The CPR will represent ConectUS Wireless and Verizon Wireless with responsibilities to provide our partners’ support in order to generate Verizon sales including 5g/4G Business Internet, Above-The-Network, and traditional wireless activities. The CPR will engage with all of ConectUS Verizon partners and their sales teams in prospecting, qualifying, and identifying sound business prospects as well as assisting in closing sales when needed.  The CPR will be responsible for managing a detailed sale forecast as well as an accurate 30/60/90-day sales funnel. These will need to be maintained daily.  Scope of Responsibilities: Must be highly motivated and able to function independently as well as within a cross-functional account team. Manage relationships with partners and vendors to build sales. Champion and manage new projects to create stronger partnerships. Liaise with partners to solve issues, communicate needs and create synergy. Analyze and report on detailed sales funnel and forecasts for VZW business. Excellent interpersonal, presentation, communication, and organizational skills are required. The CPR will be the main point of contact for all partners and will request assistants from others within ConectUS or Verizon as needed. Weekly sales calls and emails to all Verizon partners. Maintain a dossier on each dealer including; their key business verticals, number of reps in the field selling Verizon, coming events, new employees and training, and geographic areas that they sell within  Qualification: Must have Channel Sales experience, within the wireless industry a huge plus. Comfortable training and speaking to large groups in person and/or via webinars. High knowledge of CRM's Previous OMNI/B360 Verizon experience is a huge plus. Very fast past, multi-tasking is the key to success.

description: Ashfield Healthcare has partnered with Aimmune Therapeutics a Nestle Health Sciences company to create a unique team of Specialty Sales Representatives. Do you have some pharmaceutical sales experience, are excited to travel, work in a specialty field and have the ability to work remotely for extended periods of time? Are you are looking for an opportunity to learn multiple therapeutic areas? If so, this is a perfect opportunity for you.    The Specialty Sales Representative is responsible for sales performance of the full portfolio of gastrointestinal (GI) products within an assigned geographic territory through successful execution of marketing strategies. The role is responsible for growing business relationships with key decision makers and influencers. Responsible for focused detailing to specific targets with a carefully defined messaging strategy and call sequence, leveraging business and value solutions based on evidence, and outcome data, supporting the GI platform.    Key Responsibilities:  Focus on driving growth among GI specialists, PCP/IM and Cystic Fibrosis Centers Meets/exceeds sales and profit objectives in assigned accounts. Educate targeted healthcare providers on the benefits of a novel GI therapy within assigned territory Understand the GI healthcare environment and appropriately execute the selling process in a manner that is concise, compliant, professional and persuasive; and which addresses a need and leads the customer to action. Develop and communicate deep scientific understanding of GI disorders, assigned, and competitive products within the GI marketplace Cultivate and maintain long-term business relationships with key accounts and key opinion leaders within the GI community Develop and implement a territory specific business plan and utilize all available resources to foster a successful sales environment Effectively convey complex clinical and reimbursement product information to key stakeholders in a highly competitive marketplace Execute a customer centric needs based selling approach with targeted Healthcare Providers Utilize the sales reporting systems on a regular basis for call preparation, to record and track sales activity and to gather market intelligence data. Organize meetings and deliver content to health care professionals on the topic of GI and nutrition aligned with tangible account objectives and metrics as defined by the customer. Conduct promotional programs for both professional and patient audiences   Experience and Education Requirements  Bachelor's degree 3+ years medical/clinical selling experience with demonstrated success in specialty medical products OR 5+ years combined experience in sales with demonstrated success and clinical experience Consistently meets and exceeds sales targets Ability to develop solid and long-standing business relationships with strategic/targeted customers Demonstrated solid financial and analytical skills This position will require 25% or more travel to develop internal and external relationships (depending on geographical location) A valid driver's license and safe driving record Degree in Business, Marketing or a Medical Science. MBA preferred Proven ability to make decisions when dealing with complexity and ambiguity Able to work in a fast-paced and matrixed environment Ability to analyze internal and external trends and issues and take appropriate action Strong priority setting skills and timely decision making Strong presentation skills & written communications Microsoft Office, CRM/Veeva, Sales reporting technology skills   About Ashfield  Ashfield, part of UDG Healthcare plc, is a global leader in commercialization services for the healthcare industry. We partner with our clients across Advisory, Healthcare Communications, Commercial, Patient Solutions and Medical Affairs to build creative, scalable and tailored health solutions that are executed flawlessly, to deliver positive outcomes for patients and add value to your business.    Our mission is to partner with our clients, improving lives by helping healthcare professionals and patients get the medicines, knowledge and support they need.  To learn more about Ashfield, visit us at: http://www.ashfieldhealthcare.com/en/about-en/ Ashfield is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Individuals seeking employment at Ashfield are considered without regards to age, ancestry, color, gender, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), mental or physical disability, national origin, protected family care or medical leave status, race, religion (including beliefs and practices or the absence thereof), sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. Further, pursuant to applicable local ordinances, Ashfield will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.  We appreciate your interest in Ashfield. Only qualified candidates will be considered.

description: About DoiT: For many companies, the journey to cloud transformation can be more like a tangled web of complexity. DoiT International is a global organization that helps teams successfully evaluate, test, migrate, and optimize on the public cloud. As a strategic partner of Amazon Web Services , our mission is to enable customers to harness the power of the public cloud at peak efficiency so they can focus on building the best products for their own customers. Beyond just a helping hand, we’re building a suite of products to help our customers to optimize every facet of their cloud deployments. As a testament to our deep engineering expertise, over 1,000 tech-savvy companies such as Outbrain, JFrog, and Redislabs trust DoiT International’s Cloud Management Platform as their copilot in the cloud. Having raised $100 million from Charlesbank Capital Partners, we’re scaling all aspects of our company — especially around product innovation. DoiT’s Cloud Management Platform is a gamechanger in the industry that helps the developers at tech-savvy companies improve cloud operations, maintain security, control cost, and ensure governance of its growing cloud estate.  Our Core Values guide us in crafting a unique and stellar employee experience for all of our team members.  Target Locations: Anywhere within the Central/Midwest Region of the United States. We’ve created a remote first culture that thrives in a virtual environment so you have the resources you need to connect with talented people around the world.  In this role you will: As a Field Sales Representative, you will apply best-in-class pipeline generation, deal management, solution pitching, negotiation, and closing skills to identify and manage new prospects in medium-sized companies and startups. By championing the innovative power of AWS products, you’ll bring opportunities through the full business cycle, as well as identifying tangible opportunities for existing cloud customers. Using your passion for cloud, you help spread the magic of AWS to organizations.  Responsibilities: Deliver against assigned business and pipeline goals while prioritizing an outstanding customer experience for our prospects Contribute to territory strategy in generating and developing business growth opportunities Work with Customer Reliability Engineers and Customer Engineers as a critical member of the team, and work closely with AWS Sales Executives and Partner Managers in order to maximize business results and to cultivate other opportunities Drive business development, forecast accurately and achieve strategic goals by leading customers through the entire business cycle Explore and understand complex customer requirements on both a business and technical level Lead demand generation and other associated campaigns from conception, planning, execution, and launch to post-launch analysis, directly and with AWS  Qualifications: BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience. 3-5 years of quota-carrying sales experience in the technology industry with SaaS, PaaS or IaaS products and platforms. Proven experience selling AWS products/services. Consistent record of meeting and exceeding sales quotas Cloud Economics and TCO based financial selling experience preferred High degree of self-discipline and experience of using CRM systems and sales forecasting Technically minded, with an in-depth understanding of the technology and cloud computing market, and a passion for AWS products. An entrepreneur at heart who is independent, creative, passionate and approachable Networker with the ability to create, join and grow social circles and partnerships easily, with the ability to build influential relationships and to deliver results in a cross-functional/matrixed environment Self-organized, Goal-oriented, self-motivated individual who is confident, thorough and tenacious Analytical, Data-driven, detail-oriented and able to “zoom” in/out from the big picture to the minutiae. Ability to effectively operate with flexibility in a fast-paced, constantly evolving team environment. Excellent communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal A great sense of humor and enjoys having fun at work  Benefits And Perks Health Insurance including Medical, Dental, and Vision plans from top carriers Professional Development, including certifications 401k matching Employee Stock Option Plan Uncapped PTO Parental Leave Flexible working options Home Office Allowance Work-life balance

description: Outside Sales Representative - Pittsburgh, PA Base Salary $50-60k plus Commission   Good things come to those who wait, like earning over $100,000 a year. And look, you’re in sales, so you understand that patience is a virtue.  The 1st year will see you lay the foundations. In years 2 and 3, you’re getting there - with a structure in place for your income to build up on top. But it’s that 4th year when you’ve established your client base and cemented those key relationships where the rewards will truly flourish. In the case of this Outside Sales Rep role, you can expect to start hitting 6 figures.  Because let’s face it. Making a huge splash right off the bat means you’re either having serious beginner’s luck, or you’re working for Jordan Belfort. And we all know how that ended.  There are no wolves here, so you won’t need to pick up the phone and start dialing. You will be primarily out in the field - meeting with contractors. In time, you’ll become their go-to contact for high-end building materials.   To help you succeed, our showroom and experience center will place your products center stage, allowing your prospects to see them in the best possible light. You’ll get support from management, ownership and autonomy, and the power of an industry-leading brand behind you. Anything is possible here if you’ve got the right skills and attitude.  Saying that, you will be challenged. But then, you chose sales... Would you have it any other way?  It’s important that you’re energized by the hunt (showing the type of enthusiasm for your work that can’t be faked). You’re from a B2B sales background, or maybe even a construction background with an itch for the sales game. Of course, you’ll be willing to put in the work and be motivated by the potential returns. Otherwise, what’s the point?  You’ll get a $50-60k salary, plus commission. You’ll likely earn between $70-95k in years 1-3, but after that, you’d be expected to reach 6 figures. Also, you will need to live somewhere in the Greater Pittsburgh area and drive some sort of SUV or hatchback in order to have samples at the ready. And even if you don’t drive one of these vehicles currently, if you are willing to get one, that works too.   So. If you’re ready to start building up to a level of income that could change the entire trajectory of your life, then apply now. Everyone will get a response. Hit the apply now button or call 877.860.6767 and ask for Andy Schmad (or email him at aschmad@persevus.com). And don’t worry if your resume isn’t up to date; we’ll suss out the details later.    And we don’t ghost people, so expect a response in the not-so-distant future.  Andy Schmad, Talent Scout (877)860-6767 - Ask for me aschmad@persevus.com https://www.linkedin.com/in/andyschmad/
industries: Building Materials and Construction

description: We AreMedical Informatics Corp. (MIC) a medical software company that aims to save lives by improving how patients are monitored. Our solution, Sickbay, collects patient data, stores it, transforms it and delivers results to doctors and nurses in real-time. We continue to build on Sickbay to identify early warning signs of patient deterioration in data which was previously lost within hospitals. This allows us to provide predictive alerts to care providers who can remotely or locally diagnose the problem and intervene before symptoms become life-threatening.   You are  Are you a technology enthusiast who would like to work with a group of diverse, smart, innovative problem solvers in a rewarding, fast paced growth environment?  Are you an active learner interested in challenging the status quo to disrupt the current model of remote patient monitoring and predictive analytics in healthcare?  Would you like to work with a unique, state of the art FDA cleared platform that improves patient outcomes and ultimately saves patient lives?  Are you looking for a new opportunity with a clear path for advancement based on your success?  At Medical Informatics Corp, we are committed to:  Curiosity and the freedom to explore A spirit of collaboration and understanding Making sure the work you do is meaningful, fun and well balanced with the rest of life’s priorities  Duties and Responsibilities  Execute lead generation and prospecting activities to develop net new sales opportunities Nurture, create relationships and develop Marketing generated leads for new opportunities from webinars, conferences, and inbound requests for information Research potential prospects for target health systems using LinkedIn Sales Navigator and the internet to customize outreach Develop and implement campaigns to specific personas within Salesforce to expedite tracking of campaign success and performance measurement  Understand clinical roles and responsibilities within the healthcare setting, especially critical care Draw conclusions for customer gaps in current solutions and recommend possible MIC solutions to assist in solving customers clinical needs Document customer clinical environment (eg. current provider workflow within acute care settings such as ICU, Telemetry, ORs, etc.) Ensure that account, contact, and activity data is entered in Salesforce in a timely and accurate manner  Organize and schedule appropriate resources for sales meetings Set and track sales targets and OKRs  Use customer feedback to generate ideas about new campaigns, features, or products  Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s Degree and/or relevant healthcare experience preferred Experience in a similar role with a track record of exceeding targets Driven and ambitious individual with a strong desire to succeed Strong written and oral communication skills Dynamic, professional presence for video meetings Strong analytical and organizational skills Creative problem solving, listening and curiosity Experience with SalesForce CRM, LinkedIn / Sales Navigator and the Google Suite of products preferred     Your mission  The Sales Development Representative is the front line for outbound sales prospecting to increase revenue generating opportunities and ultimately expand the client base for the Company. This involves working both with organizations that do not currently have MIC solutions as well as those that have a current footprint that can be expanded to include additional solutions and/or facilities.  Your reward  Market value base salary for a Sales Development Rep ($45,500 - $63,500) Plus a competitive Incentive Compensation Plan Health Benefits (med/den/vis/company paid STD/LTD/Life Ins./FSA’s) 401k Investment Opportunity Travel reimbursement Flexible work schedule Increase personal knowledge base Knowing that the work you do makes a difference in the lives of patients and the clinicians that take care of them Working with a great team with different backgrounds     "This position requires in-person meetings at the Houston office or at client sites. COVID-19 vaccination is mandatory, unless otherwise accommodated, in accordance with company policy."     Required submissions  Please submit all of the following. Incomplete applications will not be considered!  Resume Cover letter (Why do you want to work for MIC? What makes you a great candidate?)   Kindly provide us with:  Three references with contact information (We will not contact them until later in the hiring process) A joke (Something that makes you laugh!) Create a new portmanteau, define that portmanteau, and use it in a sentence. (Tell us the two words you used to create one!)

description: Job Description  The Inside Sales Representative, Entry Level is responsible for identifying then securing new and repeat business from commercial clients by targeting vertical segments including hospitality, retail, manufacturing, property management and healthcare.  Inside Sales Representatives Responsibilities Follow up on web generated inquiries and orders to identify key decision makers and secure orders while seeking referrals to other customer locations and prospects Maintain CRM contacts to effectively contact customers and build your territory Gain a command of lighting products, PPE, air purifiers, disinfection equipment, competitors and applications that will facilitate efficient identification of client needs and result in building ongoing client relationships Understand and use technology including Microsoft Dynamics CRM, Outlook, Excel, MS Word, company website, back office, internet search engines as well as online industry tools Cold calling Inside Sales Representatives should have the following skills, education and experience: Associates Degree, Bachelor’ s degree preferred Sales experience, phone sales preferred Good writing and verbal communication skills, working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, internet, high school math skills, competitive spirit CRM, lighting or technical knowledge and aptitude for learning technology Strong desire to be successful If interested in this position please send your resume immediately to bandrade@knft.com.  #WETEMP  #BOTEMP  #Indeed

description: This position is full-time and is remote work from home.  Bbot is a rapidly growing startup that makes contactless in-venue and online ordering technology for bars, restaurants, hotels, and other hospitality establishments.  As an early member of the team, you’ll be empowered to drive the strategy and growth of the company by building relationships with, and signing up, new customers.  We are seeking a professional and charismatic Sales Development Representative to join our incredible sales team. Your goal would be to find creative ways to activate and engage venues and users as we expand our reach throughout the United States. Recent college graduates or college athletes with a competitive spirit are particularly well suited to this role. This is a great gateway to launch a career in sales/start-up tech.  Your primary goal will be to generate new leads, develop a diverse pipeline of well-qualified opportunities for Bbot’s Account Executives, and meet both monthly quotas.  What You Will Do Research major US geographies and hospitality verticals, to identify the leading food & beverage venues in those markets that are most likely to align with Bbot’s software products Develop efficient and repeatable methods for reaching the influencers and decision-makers at those prospective new accounts Educate prospects and clients about Bbot’s products through presentations and product demonstrations Utilize Salesforce CRM to manage all sales activities and pipeline Become a student of Bbot’s fast-growing product set and the fiercely competitive landscape, to determine how to best position Bbot in the market Plan and approach an inside sales strategy with your team for Major Markets Generate business opportunities and manage your sales prospect pipeline Call restaurant owners, managers, and hospitality executives to determine if Bbot is a good fit for their businesses.  What You Will Need Confidence, positivity, and eagerness to Learn: we have a collaborative and high-energy sales team Strong phone presence: The phone is your greatest tool - dedication and resilience are critical to success in inside sales Strong Writing/Email Skills: in this day and age, one must be well equipped in writing emails that could open the door to big prospects Sales Instincts: you have strong sales instincts and an ability to sniff out opportunities and roadblocks. Excellent verbal and listening skills: communication is key, whether internally with our team or when speaking with clients Adaptability: as a fast-growing startup, things change in the blink of an eye - you need to be able to adapt, grow, and evolve at lightning speeds  Employee Perks + Benefits! Competitive Medical, Dental + Vision Benefits (100% of premiums covered by Bbot for individuals, 50% of premiums covered by Bbot for dependents) Responsible PTO Policy Company-Provided Laptop 100% Remote-Work Environment + Flexible Work Schedule Parental Leave Paid Holidays 401k (Coming 2022)  Expected On-Target Earnings (OTE) For This Role  $57,000-$72,000  (This range was determined based on expected commission as well as prior work or industry experience, education level to the extent education is relevant to the position, as well as unique skills we are seeking - this range is negotiable and non-binding)  Eligibility Full-time employment positions are open to all applicants in the United States. However, preference for qualified applicants will be given to the following states where the company already has employees and associated tax registrations in place: PA, DC, NY, MA, TX, MD, IL, IN, NC, FL, CA, WA, GA, UT, KY, ID, HI, AZ, KS, VA, ND, TN, NJ, SC, CO, CT, and RI Candidates must have the right to work in the United States. Visas cannot be sponsored.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Bbot. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, parental status, veteran status, or disability status.
industries: Food & Beverages

description: Description  ON24 is on a mission to transform the way businesses drive revenue and customer engagement through data-rich digital experiences. Powered by the ON24 Platform, marketers create and deliver live, always-on and personalized webinar, content and virtual event experiences to engage audiences in real-time, to generate powerful buying signals and to accelerate pipeline. With billions of engagement minutes created, ON24 is the network where enterprises engage prospects and customers at global scale. Headquartered in San Francisco, ON24 has a wide international footprint serving the regions of North America, EMEA and JPAC. For more information, visit https://www.on24.com.  The Sales Development Representative (SDR) is responsible for prospecting to generate leads and opportunities for Account Executives in the Acquisition and Expansion organization. This is a great opportunity to join ON24’s sales organization and begin the path towards becoming an Account Executive. You’ll be trained to sell our market-leading Webinar-Based Marketing Solutions, and will also have access to our Mentorship from ON24’s top salespeople.  Successful SDRs have an opportunity to become a quota-carrying Account Executive in 12-18 months. To be successful, you’ll need a passion to succeed, a clear vision of your goals and career path, and the desire to be part of a dynamic team environment.  Job Details 90% Calling marketing-generated (inbound) leads to qualify and schedule meetings for the sales team. 10% Miscellaneous tasks such as email campaigns and other tasks. Your Skills And Experience A hunter mentality to find and cultivate new business. Bachelor degree or equivalent years of experience preferred. Experience and previous success with prospecting and selling via phone. Proven success in a role with weekly, monthly, and quarterly targets. Must be a self starter who is able to drive self towards goals. Strong capacity to develop relationships quickly over the phone. Skilled at prospecting for new business by discovering need for ON24 solutions. Comfortable with detailed conversations both at a business and a technical level. Strong written and verbal communication, time management skills, and team orientation. Ability to build cross-functional relationships. Experience with tools such as SalesForce.com, Hoovers, and “standard” inside sales tools is a plus Benefits & Perks! Competitive base salary + commission + equity 401k Matching plan Excellent Health, Medical & Vision Insurance plans Monthly catered lunches Strong team culture Monthly team outings & events 15 days of PTO + paid holidays ON24 is proud to be an equal employment opportunities (EEO) workplace to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, ON24 complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.  Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, ON24 will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.  States
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Information Technology and Services, and Computer Software

description: As a Field Sales Representative, you will grow our business at LINQ. We have the top K-12 software for ERP and are seeking top-level sales performers to help us achieve incredible results.  You will sell our solutions to public and private school districts in an assigned territory. The Field Sales Representative’s role is to achieve company-designated sales targets, and as part of that prospect, qualify and build relationships with new customers, and retain and extend relationships with our existing client base in their assigned territory. The Field Sales Representative must be proficient in creating and developing leads, presenting, and explaining the benefits of LINQ solutions, building strategic business plans, overcoming objections, and closing sales.  What We Are Seeking Presidents Club award or top sales performers in their organizations Consistent track record of meeting and exceeding assigned quota SaaS and K12 ERP experience required Essential Duties And Responsibilities Include The Following Along with your sales associate and marketing department, develop leads through outbound calls, emails, marketing campaigns, and conferences. Use a consultative sales approach to sell LINQ products to K-12 school districts Manage pipeline and submit weekly forecasts through Salesforce Coordinate customer meetings and product demonstrations Deliver proposals that show total cost of ownership and other points of value (i.e, we are not seeking reps that sell based on cost) Other Duties As Assigned Qualifications Include 4 years of sales experience, with strong achievement against quota Team player mindset with strong integrity p Ability to consistently gather feedback from customers and adjust messaging based on competition In depth knowledge of K12 market with experience calling on the business office Frequent work under time restraints Significant travel Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: We are a Forbes Global 2000 company looking to expand in Minneapolis within the next year. In order to do this we need to hire leaders, not just managers. Our management team would like to start the training process within the next 2-3 weeks and we will be reviewing resumes and conducting telephone interviews this week.  Our culture is fast paced and challenge driven. We work together to grow and develop new ideas and new innovative ways of reaching our goals. Our ideal candidate would be goal oriented with a strong work ethic and desire to move into a leadership role. Your resume should emphasize your previous customer service experience, your leadership ability and your demonstrated work ethic. If you did not have a management title simply highlight the leadership and/or training functions in your past positions. To apply please submit your resume and a cover letter with available start date and a key reason we should select you for an interview. Good luck!

Ascend Learning is a national leader in data driven, online educational solutions for learners, educators and employers in high-growth, licensure-driven professions spanning healthcare, fitness and wellness, skilled trades, insurance and financial services. We are passionate about accelerating learning while impacting job readiness, employment success and employee retention with the belief that our work changes lives.  Our culture is intentionally results-driven and selfless with a relentless focus on our customers. We believe in trust, transparency, freedom and responsibility with a commitment to meritocracy, inclusion and diversity of thought. Continual investment in our over 1400 employees is also a core principal realized through ongoing professional development and providing opportunities to grow, develop and lead. Ascend Learning is headquartered in Burlington, MA with additional office locations and remote workers in cities across the U.S. and in the U.K.  Since 1989, the National Healthcareer Association® (NHA) has awarded more than 1,000,000 allied health certification and credentials. We are committed to helping organizations employ quality professionals who, in turn, help improve the standard of care.  Reporting to a Sales Team Lead, we are searching for Sales Representative in our NHA business unit. The Sales Representative will be responsible for using consultative and value-based sales techniques to understand prospects’ business needs and recommend our product solutions to potential clients. Additionally, this position is responsible for cold-calling, prospecting and obtaining new business while growing and managing existing clients. NHA’s B2B prospects are comprised of educational institutions and health systems within a designated territory. Conducting effective, efficient, and professional telephone, email, webinar and social media communications to achieve performance metrics is essential and required. Ascend Learning offers the ability to Work from Home and unlimited PTO.  This is a remote opportunity.  Education And Experience Professionally aligns with our company culture: http://www.ascendlearning.com/about/culture/ A minimum of 3-5 years of recent successful sales experience with a proven track record of overachieving annual quota. Proactively identifying opportunities, creating a sales plan, effectively prioritizing time, and executing on a consultative sales strategy to drive results and consistently achieve quarterly and annual quotas. A Bachelor’s degree in Business, Education, Marketing or a related field. Understanding of health care or education industry considered a plus. Ability to travel to client locations, corporate training, and tradeshows about 10-25% of the time. Advanced experience using CRM to manage territory. Previous experience, efficiency, and comfort level working remotely. Bonus: Previous exposure to the Miller Heiman sales methodology Skills And Abilities Develop and execute a strategic territory plan using effective research methods and individual account tactics to effectively penetrate and identify additional sales opportunities with ultimate decision makers. Ability to exceed sales quotas by creating and communicating the value of certification, credentialing and training with prospects and existing clients. Current proficiency presenting to small and large group audiences either in-person, via conference call, and/or in web enabled environments using PowerPoint and other technologies. Proficiency is defined as being a clear, concise, error-free, yet persuasive spoken and written communicator. Ability to ask the best questions to identify client needs and provide current product solutions by communicating the value of NHA products over the competition with active and empathy focused listening. Able to obtain agreement from multiple decision makers throughout all stages of the sales cycle and asking for commitment to confirm a sale through high trust and efficient rapport building Ability to successfully collaborate and communicate with team members to ensure strong, positive, and profitable client relations by way of continual support throughout and beyond the sales process. Demonstrate a high level of professionalism with colleagues and clients daily. Demonstrate a high level of intellectual curiosity, problem solving skills and constant pursuit of knowledge with a willingness to be coached. Ability to offer solutions in a productive and professional manner to both clients and team members. High level of follow-up both internally within the organization and externally with customers. Ability to be self-motivated and driven with attention to detail. Proficiency utilizing Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint. Proficiency with Microsoft Teams, WebEx, and similar remote conferencing platforms. Ascend Learning, LLC is proud to be an equal opportunity employer (M/F/Vets/Disabled). No agency or search firm submissions will be accepted. Applications for U.S. based positions with Ascend Learning, LLC must be legally authorized to work in the United States and verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire.

description: Job Title: Territory Sales, Process Filtration Division  If you are looking to join an established, growing global leading vertically integrated company and feel you have the sales skills and relevant work experience to be a major contributor as part of our dynamic team, then I invite you to learn more about Sefar, Inc.  We are expanding our sales team to meet the growing market demands and are searching for an individual with strong sales, prospecting and technical/problem solving skills to manage our territory sales growth efforts of our technical liquid solid separation and filtration solutions covering Ohio, Indiana, Kentucky, Tennessee, West Virginia with a focus on Life Sciences, Mining and Refining, Chemical and Food applications, (visit us at www.sefar.us under Process Filtration tab) . The successful candidate will have current territory sales experience covering this same geography as well as strong technical/problem solving skills, demonstrated success in prospecting and qualifying new customers and relevant customer contacts in our core markets.  Core Primary Responsibilities Responsible for achieving individual sales goals in the assigned region. Develops a sales plan for the region and implements Sales and Marketing programs and activities to achieve the plan goals. Develops sales leads through business relationships, Lunch and Learns, investigation within the region. Qualifies those leads through the analysis of the potential product use and sales potential. Establishes specific account strategies for major sales opportunities. Maintains required Sefar product and customer application/technical knowledge in a range of markets to service customer needs. Submits regular summaries to record pertinent information regarding customer needs, new applications, competition, general trends, etc. Submits required sales reports to summarize accomplishments, information gained and to outline upcoming month’s activities. Provides input during the preparation of annual regional sales forecasts and plans. Take advantage of the support team designed to perform many of the tasks that take time away from selling for the outside sales person. On your team we have people who will… Inside Sales Team…managing the orders and facilitating internal activities for existing accounts, new business support by developing quotes for you, etc. Market Management Team…providing strategic support, marketing tools, and overall support. Product Development/Engineering…we are a solutions company and we have the engineering resources to assist with the technical application of our products. We have the support team in place to help you, what we need is someone to drive the sales growth within their assigned territory.  What We Have To Offer Position is eligible for commission/bonus, company car provided and expenses covered. Full company benefits are part of the compensation package, such as a 401k match plan, etc. About Sefar North America, (Sefar Inc & Sefar BDH)  We are part of Sefar AG who is headquartered in Switzerland with subsidiaries and fabrications centers in 25 countries on 4 continents provide local technical service for the broad range of solutions offered by Sefar. In 2020 the Sefar Group achieved sales over $350+ Million and employed some 2000+ employees worldwide. Sefar AG has been in business since 1830, Sefar Inc. and Sefar BDH, have been operating in the USA & Canada since 1925 & 1991 respectfully. We are the leading global fabric manufacturer and as such have established a vertical integration of our companies from polymer to finished products that gives us a unique selling advantage in the marketplace.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Chemicals, and Consumer Goods

description: Job Duties Include Sales support to the existing sales network; Quote prep Prospecting Sales visits, calls Presentation preparation Demos/Creating Order Releases Creating Repair/Parts Quotes Creating New Laser Quotes Qualifications 1-2 years experience in sales/marketing preferred BA in business or a related field Excellent knowledge of MS Office, marketing computer software and online applications Exquisite communication and people skills Founded in 1993, Photonics Industries is the pioneer of intracavity harmonic lasers. With 24 issued patents and multiple pending patents, Photonics Industries is at the forefront of developing, manufacturing and marketing a wide range of nansecond, sub-nanosecond, picosecond and femtosecond lasers for industrial and scientific industries.  Today, Photonics Industries is one of the largest solid state laser manufacturers in the world, with its headquarters and state of the art manufacturing facility located in Long Island, NY. Photonics Industries also has facilities located in Korea, Japan, Taiwan and China. Its volume manufacturing capabilities for some of its product lines are unmatched within the industry.  Photonics Industries has also recently added an applications lab in our China facility for sample processing and feasibility studying for our customers. In addition to its standard product offering, Photonics Industries is always ready to customize its products to meet even the most challenging requirements for design, performance, reliability and a total system package.

description: Outside Sales Representative for Paper Retriever of Texas  We are a family owned waste and recycling company, looking for a highly motivated sales person with experience in the solid waste and recycling industry for our Chicago area locations.  Job Description  Paper Retriever of Texas is looking for an ambitious person with good soft skills (people skills), and the ability to follow up and maintain client relationships. The right person would have excellent organizational skills and be driven to develop relationships while providing our clients with a dependable and clean service.  The successful candidate will need to be able to sell in the field and generate leads, have great follow through and have the ability to close the deal. Candidates should be high-energy and self-motivated. Our focus is on new business and growing our companies. Candidate would go through comprehensive 90 day training so they have all the tools necessary to be successful.  Daily Duties Include, But Aren’t Limited To Maintaining records and files on CRM Salesforce Conducting sales presentations/audit Preparing and sending proposals Telephone outbound lead calling Learning our products and services Job Requirements 3 years of sales experience in solid waste or recycling. This position would primarily work out of the Chicago area and would require a personal vehicle for traveling/meeting purposes. Must be results driven and comfortable while making presentations and cold calling. Proven experience in increasing gross margin. Solid lead-generation experience. Good computer abilities. Strong interpersonal communication techniques. Project a positive, professional appearance. Must have a High School Diploma/GED. Compensation  This is a full time, salary position with complete commission package and car allowance. We also offer medical/dental/vision benefits and 401K with a Company match.  Draw Enterprises has operated a secure recovery facility in the Chicago land area for 40+ years. There are four facilities throughout the Chicago land area that specialize in purchasing recyclable commodities that most recyclers can not handle. Other recycling sites are located in Florida, Tennessee, Mississippi, Texas and Indiana. These include recyclables ranging from commercially generated cardboard, all grades of printer paper, office paper, shrink wrap, and various types of plastic to many other commodities. We are dedicated to providing prompt, quality recycling services. Our goal for our customers is to reduce their waste stream through recycling.
industries: Construction, Automotive, and Environmental Services

description: Job Highlights Provide marketing and sales support for product offerings in the North American markets, including market research, market intelligence acquisition, maintenance and revision of product literature and other commercial materials, and participation in trade events. Provide input to the development of marketing plans and budget as needed through the direction of the Marketing Managers and Head of Sales considering the input from Field Sales Reps, Distributors, Agents. Prepare sales / GM analysis reports to the BL BIO management Investigate and develop new customers (cold calls) within BL Biocides market through the direction and coordination of BL BIO Market Segment Managers and Head of Sales. Support pricing activities in accordance with the company policy under guidance of the Market Segment Managers; provide related cost / margin analyses and monitor customer profitability. Prepare and amend, as needed distribution, agency and supplemental registration agreements. This would include pricing, supplying necessary documents to support the business and updating the distributors on our state registration. Support and follow up on customer visits, coordination of sample requests, customer complaints. Maintaining customer & pricing databases and process customer debit and credit memos Interact with Supply Chain Planner and CSRs for availability of material against forecast, allocations in times of unavailability or shortages increases Assist customers with regulatory and product safety questions and completion of customer specific forms with guidance from the Regulatory and HSEQ Groups. Support Regulatory Affairs with sales information needed for various State registration forms along with assisting when needed during state audits.  Requirements Bachelors in Business Administration or equivalent. Technical degree of advantage, Master degree of advantage Strong skills in the areas: planning, organizing, negotiation, coordinating, controlling and innovation. Self-management: be able to operate independently with guidance where necessary with minimum supervision. Ability to cope with occasional stress, for example, urgent timelines, product shortage, customer requests. Communication skills: both verbal and written are critical. Familiarity with LANXESS systems such as order entry, pricing, accounting, costing. Have a general understanding of regulatory and product safety information (including FIFRA) and how this relates to each product. Ability to work in interdisciplinary teams, taking ownership and motivating collaboration. Computer Skills: MS Office, SAP, Lotus Notes, CRM. Use of confidential information in a confidential manner
