description: We offer an excellent opportunity for not only a job, but a career with growth potential. At Transtar, we seek applicants who roll up their sleeves, enjoy hard work, thrive in a team environment, and who embody our core values of Safety, Honesty, Action, Relationship, and Product.  Transtar Autobody Technologies, a business unit of Transtar Industries, is a coatings manufacturing company in the automotive refinish business headquartered in Brighton, Michigan. At Transtar Autobody Technologies, we are dedicated to developing, producing, and marketing quality refinish products for the automotive aftermarket. TAT is prideful of our history of creative and innovative research, which enables us to bring products to the marketplace in a manner highly beneficial to our customers, the industry and our environment.  We have an immediate opportunity for a Territory Manager in our San Antonio, TX market and surrounding areas. This position will primarily service customers located in the metro San Antonio area, but may also include customers in the surrounding areas.  WHY TRANSTAR AUTOBODY TECHNOLOGIES?  The Territory Manager is responsible for managing a territory by selling products through our established distribution channels. As a Territory Manager, you help developing and established customers leverage our various products and programs, optimize their product, and maximize their utilization.  WHAT YOU WILL DO WITH YOUR TALENTS: Execute the TAT sales plan, work within company policies & programs, and meet annual sales performance goals expectations. Plan Pre-call sales, establish customer relationships, identify sales opportunities, present & demonstrate product /programs, and close sales. Develop annual Business Plan, submit annual territory review, monitor customer inventory levels, partner with customers to improve metrics, identify & capitalize on opportunities, and complete post-call activities & follow-up. Manage accounts – key, existing, and new, supervise distributor activities, evaluate distributor performance, and train distribution personnel. Control sales expense, manage time efficiently, develop monthly sales forecast, and address & resolve problems. Improve product knowledge, selling skills, and business acumen.  WHAT YOU WILL BRING: Three + years of outside sales experience (automotive aftermarket preferred). Excellent oral and written communication skills, as well as presentation abilities to people at all levels of management Prior PBE experience Product Knowledge & Confidence Business Acumen which includes financial literacy, market orientation, and strategic perspective Territory Planning & Management Proficient computer skills; MS Office products  EDUCATION:  Bachelor's degree (B. A.) from four-year college or university preferred; or a combination of education and experience / training. Management experience or desire/ability to lead a sales team is desired but not necessary.
industries: Automotive

description: Purpose  Dividia produces a leading edge DVR platform for the surveillance industry. This job will be to procure new business within the security and surveillance business by selling both wholesale and retail customers. The large majority of our business is commercial and industrial. Additionally, we offer a line of security (alarm) systems that are marketed to both commercial and residential customers. This is an outside sales job.  Duties Perform targeted cold calls Attend appointments at customer facilities Generate quotes and close prospective deals Work with customer support and installation departments that will oversee your jobs Report directly to President DIVIDIA Technologies was founded in 2002 to bring remote security and surveillance solutions to market. With headquarters in Fort Worth, Texas, we are strategically positioned to deliver world class solutions throughout North America.  With complete control of our DVR platform, we have transformed stock DVR technology into a business management platform. We integrate with Point-of-Sale, Alarm, Billing, and Weighing systems to provide you with time critical information. Our products are used in Residences, Universities, Hospitals, Warehouses, Retail Outlets, and Restaurants to name a few. By building a network of security professionals, we are able to provide sales, installation, service, and support that is second to none.  We believe in building relationships with our customers that will stand the test of time. We consider each customer a partner in our success. Listening closely to the needs of our customers is what enabled us to begin this journey in the first place. In 2002, we listened when a prominent restauranteur (Bobby Cox Companies) was looking to increase visibility and efficiency in their stores and provide more training tools to boost productivity. By keeping all engineering in-house we were able to deliver an enterprise solution that has enabled them to better manage over 67 locations.
industries: Computer Software, Telecommunications, and Security and Investigations

description: Job Description  This position is responsible for identifying, progressing, and closing Cloud opportunities across a portfolio of Enterprise Accounts. An Enterprise Cloud Sales Executive works to identify, progress and close Oracle IaaS, PaaS, Autonomous Products and Engineered Systems opportunities in our most strategic accounts. Responsible for the account plan to drive goal attainment in assigned territory. Coordinates with the other members of the sales team (employees and partners) to support cloud sales and business development strategies. Learns the customer’s business and critical strategic imperatives and becomes a trusted advisor to key customer decision makers. Also is able to call on both IT, positioning our Cloud differentiators, and to LOB to map PaaS solutions like AI, Machine Learning, IOT, High Performance Computing, and Blockchain to solve modern business problems. Follows all companies' methodologies and processes related to sales opportunity pursuit. Ensures that the company's sales programs are known and executed in assigned territory, including personal follow-up and engagement in selected opportunities. Achieves or exceeds quarterly and annual sales goals for both cloud solutions. May travel frequently, as needed. Sales Portfolio Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) - A comprehensive set of integrated, subscription-based infrastructure services that enable businesses to run any workload in an enterprise-grade Generation 2 cloud managed, hosted, and supported by Oracle. Platform as a Service (PaaS)/ Autonomous Products – These solutions help enterprise IT and key LOB stakeholders rapidly build and deploy rich applications and/or extend 3rd party and Oracle Cloud SaaS apps. Requirements Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. Work is non-routine and involves problem solving skills during sales engagements. Preference for experience with 2+ years of enterprise cloud sales with ideally a Bachelor of Science or Bachelor of Arts degree. Energy, Manufacturing or Oil/Gas vertical industry sales experience is a huge plus! Knowledge of cloud infrastructure Sells a subset of product or services directly or via partners to a large number of named accounts/non-named accounts/geographical territory (mainly Tier 3 accounts).  Primary job duty is to sell technology software products and related services in a defined territory. Identifies, qualifies and closes new opportunities. Manages accounts including the entire sales process from business development prospecting and specifications through contract negotiations, signing, and post-sales support. Leverages the Oracle sales model to maximize revenue growth and increase local market share. Builds and expands business partner revenue and self sufficiency.  Duties and tasks are standard with some variation. Completes own role largely independently within defined policies and procedures. 3 or more years of sales experience including technology sales experience. Ability to forecast, manage sales expenses, and successfully close new Oracle business. Business development, prospecting and presentation skills. Excellent communication skills and problem solving ability. Proven track record of exceeding sales objective and territory/account development. Experience as the focal point for clients for all sales and related issues. Oracle knowledge and/or knowledge of Oracle's competitors. Travel may be needed. Bachelor degree or equivalent.  If you are a Colorado resident, Please Contact us or Email us at oracle-salary-inquiries_us@oracle.com to receive compensation and benefits information for this role. Please include this Job ID: 125558 in the subject line of the email.  About Us  Innovation starts with inclusion at Oracle. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can be themselves and do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued, that we are inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. That’s why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.  Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.

description: Forward Financing has been recognized as one of the fastest-growing FinTech companies in Boston for the past five years, as recognized by Boston Business Journal, Inc. Magazine, and Deloitte Fast 500. We help small businesses spend less time finding capital and more time helping their customers and managing their businesses. Our mission is to create a world-class FinTech company so that our customers and our people can reach their full potential. We accomplish this by investing in our people, technology, and customer experience – with long-term success in mind.  As Sales Coordinator, you will help push deals across the finish line by quickly learning our industry and process. You will be the point person to keep the wheels of the group moving. You will collaborate closely with Account Managers to work with our partners and other internal teams on making sure we have all required sales documents to complete a deal.  In this role you will: Manage the flow of deal requirements and help to keep the sales pipeline moving along in a timely manner. Respond quickly to sales partners to make sure that the group is maximizing new business opportunities. Support the sales team with administrative tasks such as reporting, with the goal of enabling better outcomes. Problem solve with internal teams to figure out opportunities for process improvement. Talk directly to sales partners as needed to discuss deal details. Build strong relationships within the sales team and across the company.  Requirements: Six months to one year of professional experience and an interest in sales. Bachelor's degree required. Proactive, strong communication skills, ability to prioritize. Ability to learn quickly and a desire to grow within a sales organization. Proficient in Microsoft Office: Word, Excel and PowerPoint. Exceptional organizational skills. Top notch phone etiquette -- working with internal and external partners.  Forward Financing Core Values: People First – We build relationships and support each other. We Before Me – We prioritize team success over individual success. Be Candid – We are authentic, honest, and direct. Do the Right Thing – We act with integrity, and we don't cut corners. Continuous Improvement – We push ourselves, never settling for the best we did yesterday. Be Positive – We are optimistic and assume positive intent.  About Us:  Forward Financing is a Boston-based FinTech company that provides fast, flexible, and reliable capital to small businesses nationwide. Since 2012, Forward Financing has provided over $1.2 billion in financing to more than 30,000 small businesses. Forward Financing has been consistently named by the Boston Business Journal and Built in Boston as one of the best places to work in Massachusetts.  Forward Financing actively promotes a focus on diversity, equity, and inclusion in all we do. We encourage a workplace where trust and respect are paramount and all employees feel valued, heard, and accepted. By accepting diversity of thought, background, and identity, we will continue to become a stronger team and a better organization.  We are a diverse and driven group of over 150 people, located in the heart of Boston's Financial District. Our employees come to work knowing they are helping thousands of small businesses while advancing their own careers. If this sounds exciting to you, learn more about our leadership team and our open opportunities.  Perks & Benefits:  At Forward Financing, we believe that if our company succeeds, all of our employees succeed too. We offer a comprehensive benefits package including but not limited to; medical, dental, vision and commuter benefits along with a flexible time off policy, 401k match, wellness reimbursement, paid volunteering days, annual professional development budget, and charitable donation match.  When we aren't on a Zoom meeting, supporting our customers, or working on a project, you can likely find us taking part in a scavenger hunt, a virtual trivia game, or celebrating team wins together!  CCPA Notice at Collection for California Job Applicants

description: The ideal candidate for the Sales Development Representative role will be excited about working at a high-growth technology company with a high-performance culture. We will ideally find someone who is excited about a career in Sales and is smart, positive, personable, and always looking for new and creative ways to drive customer engagement with Xometry.  Responsibilities Follow-up on inbound marketing leads and identify qualified opportunities providing appropriate levels of information at the right time for interested prospects Be responsible for educating and developing prospects leading to hand-off to sales teams Create target prospects lists and penetrate key accounts Cold call into prospects generated by variety of outside sources Identify key players, researching and obtaining business requirements, and presenting solutions to begin sales cycle Profile strategic accounts identifying key individuals, researching and obtaining business requirements and presenting solutions to start the sales cycle Set appointments for Account Management sales team when a lead reaches a qualified stage Nurture new marketing leads by educating and developing prospects until they are ready to speak with an Account Management sales representative Drive attendance for webinars and live seminars, set meetings for conferences Collaborate with sales and marketing team members on strategic sales approach Ensure successful follow through of sales cycle by maintaining accurate activity and lead qualification information in CRM application  Requirements Exceptional communication skills, both oral and written, coupled with excellent listening skills and a positive and energetic phone presence Extremely self-motivated with a diligent work ethic High level of integrity and strong commitment to building a successful company Ability to work independently as well as part of a team in a fast-paced environment Adept computer skills using multiple systems and tools simultaneously Bachelor’s degree preferred Xometry is the source for on-demand manufacturing, offering massive capacity, instant online quotes, fast lead times, and affordable pricing. Our global network of over 5,000 manufacturing facilities enables us to maintain consistently fast lead times while offering a broad array of capabilities includes CNC machining, injection molding, sheet metal fabrication, urethane casting, and a industry-leading 3D printing service. We have a diverse customer base, ranging from startups to Fortune 100 companies and can make anything from a single prototype to millions of parts.  If this job isn’t for you but you have a friend who may be a perfect fit - share this job with them!  Xometry is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.  Xometry participates in E-Verify and after a job offer is accepted, will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S.

well-versed in our value proposition, technology and corporate messaging Generate prospective customers through cold-calling and lead qualification from marketing programs and sourcing target accounts Leverage calls, emails, social channels to engage ideal audiences and set appointments for both Sales Representatives and Solution Architects, and prospective clients Direct marketing qualified leads individual with a strong desire to achieve top results with a dependable, positive "no excuses" attitude over the phone Consistently meet or exceed sales metrics set by sales leaders and manage Requirements Previous work experience handling inbound and outbound sales and inquiries Ability to understand technical concepts, possess enthusiasm for technology and to articulate clearly to all levels of technical aptitude Ability to adapt quickly to a fast-paced environment Proven work experience as a Sales Development Representative, Field Sales Representative, Sales Leader, or similar role Hands-on experience with multiple sales techniques Track record of consistently achieving sales quota Experience with sales technologies (e.g. Salesforce, HubSpot, Outreach.io, DiscoverOrg) Flawless communication and negotiation skills Ability to deliver engaging presentations Entrepreneurial self-starter mentality with excellent time management and strong work Bachelor's degree in description: D.R. Horton, Inc. is currently looking for a Sales Representative. The right candidate's primary responsibility is to manage the sales process while providing excellent customer service. The Sales Representative continuously sources new customers, helps customers find and design their dream home, and ensures a smooth sales process.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Effectively communicate DR Horton’s value proposition, product vision and capabilities to potential customers Uncover and understand customer goals and challenges then establishes DR Horton as the best solution available Overcome objections and closes for the sale Maintains accurate documentation of transaction from sale through loan, options, and construction Continually source new sales opportunities Creates and provides to management a marketing plan for establishing new customer relationships Networks and performs outreach to realtors Manages time efficiently, meet sales goals and works effectively with other members of the team Maintains and expands database of prospects Attend sales meetings Conducts all business in a professional and ethical manner to serve customers and increase the goodwill and profit of the company Develops and maintains good rapport with prospective customers, realtors, and team members Execute policies to ensure compliance with quality standards D.R. Horton, Inc., the largest homebuilder in the U.S., was founded in 1978 and is a publicly traded company on the New York Stock Exchange. It is engaged in the construction and sale of high quality homes designed principally for the entry-level and first time move-up markets. The Company also provides mortgage financing and title services for homebuyers through its mortgage and title subsidiaries. Please visit our website at www.drhorton.com for more information.  Job  Sales  Primary Location  Florida-Tampa  Organization  Home Builder  Schedule  Full-time  Job Posting  Sep 24, 2021, 5:00:00 AM  Required Qualifications Associate’s Degree or 2 years related experience Must have a vehicle, valid driver’s license, and be able to drive in daytime or nighttime Ability to utilize DRH Sales applications on a smart phone, tablet, or laptop Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral form or via DRH Sales applications Proficiency with MS Office and email Ability to stand and walk for 4 hours straight or up to a full 8-hour day; sit for extended periods; kneel and bend at the waist; walk up and down stairs; walk on unlevel terrain; use hands to finger, handle or feel; reach with hands and arms; talk and hear. Ability to lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision ability required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision and peripheral vision Regular exposure to outside weather conditions. The noise level is generally moderate Preferred Qualifications Licensing requirements vary by state Prior CRM software experience Previous sales experience, knowledge of industry preferred Excel in intercommunications and interactions Strongly motivated We Offer An Excellent Benefits Package Including  Come join a winning team with a Fortune 500 company. We are growing fast and are looking for enthusiastic attitudes and team players to join our success. Medical, Vision and Dental 401(K) Employee Stock Purchase Plan Flex Spending Accounts Life Insurance Vacation, Sick, Personal Time and Company Holidays Build YOUR future with D.R. Horton, America’s Builder.  #WeBuildPeople2  Follow us on social media @hortoncareers for an inside look at our company and connect with us on LinkedIn for up to date job listings! description: EPOS is part of the Demant group – a global hearing healthcare and technology group started in 1904 and built on a heritage of care, health and innovation offering solutions and services to help people connect and communicate with the world around them. The Demant Group operates in a global market with companies in more than 30 countries, employs more than 16,500 employees, and generates an annual revenue of around DKK 15 billion.  Based on pioneering audio technology, we strive to unleash human potential by perfecting audio experiences and delivering innovative design and performance with all of our audio solutions.  More information about EPOS at http://www.eposaudio.com  You will be a key player in building up our sales clan in the USA. Your goal is to deliver sell-through with our retail partners, to ultimately increase our market share, grow business and reach our commercial objectives aligning to our brand guidelines  Responsibilities  The Inside Sales Representative promotes and sells products and services to new and existing accounts through effective telemarketing sales techniques to ensure end-user satisfactions and meet or exceed company assigned revenue goals. Contacts prospects through effective telemarketing methods and cold calling to qualify needs. Generates sales revenue to meet or exceed sales quota Promotes and sells products and services through suggestive sales techniques to meet and surpass profitability goals. Provides customers with accurate information regarding all products and services. Applies the company's sales policies and procedures to provide proper and effective treatment to all customers. Follows up sales as appropriate. Keeps management informed of all activity to include timely preparation. Maintains a log of activities in CRM including sales call summaries, sales progress, new account updates, sales pipeline in-formation etc. Engages in technical discussions with potential and existing clients and distribution partners. Maintains knowledge of industry trends and competitive advantages. Works with Channel ISR/Managers/Partners to effectively promote products and services Qualifications  What we are looking for Bachelor’s degree (preferred) 2+ years’ experience high-volume outbound sales position with a proven track record of meeting metrics May consider lesser education with additional years of related sales experience. Ability to work independently; self-reliance Competitive drive and ability to meet clearly defined metrics Dynamic phone personality The Company is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

description: forteq is an integral partner of the automotive and consumer electronics industry worldwide. We provide design, development, manufacturing, assembly and packaging services for high precision transmission systems and precision plastic components. forteq is headquartered in Nidau, Switzerland and employs approximately 800 employees at several engineering and production sites in Europe, USA and China.  forteq North America is currently seeking a well-qualified Sales & Engineering Coordinator at our W. Henrietta, NY location. This position will support and assist the Sales & Engineering departments. They will facilitate and track the quotation & order entry processes. They will maintain various reports and databases to ensure accurate information and reporting.  Essential Duties Prepare annual Sales (MTP) budget forecasts and pricing lists and review quarterly for Accounting based on knowledge of customer forecasts and trends, as well as input from Account Managers. Performs full departmental support to sales team including ability to act as backup in sales functions with minimal supervision. Performs administrative duties that include collecting, organizing and summarizing data used for quotations into proper format for analysis and response by Engineering department. Compile request for quotations to the Tooling Manager & Purchasing Manager as directed by the Development Engineering Manager and/or Program Managers. Maintain all Sales files to include filing quotes, email correspondence, etc in the appropriate quote folders. Maintain & distribute various databases & reports to include: Monthly Hot list report, Request for Quote report, Pending Purchase order report, Shot count report, Quotes on Time report, and Current product list. Interface directly with customers to gather or communicate information and ensure continuous communication including timely delivery of quotations & proposals by Engineering & Sales staff. Support customer retention and growth by providing immediate responses to all inquiries or concerns. Follow up and remind Account Manager(s) of open customer issues, as needed. Expedite special requests for pricing, samples, and prototypes when necessary, as requested by the Sales Account Managers and Development Engineers. Review all new customer sourcing & tooling agreements for accuracy. Review purchase orders for all new tooling & new and existing part orders for accuracy and compliance with quoted terms. Communicate with Account Manager, and customer if appropriate, changes needed, or send signed acknowledgements, on behalf of the Account Manager. Prepare correspondence, reports, spreadsheets, presentations, etc. for Sales & Engineering departments and/or Managing Director, as needed. Provide additional administrative support for any Sales & Engineering projects to include requests such as tooling inventory lists, etc Keep track of scheduled price changes for parts and update IQMS, as needed. Input all new Bill of Materials in IQMS for new parts, as provided by Engineering. Update IQMS Bill of Materials for current parts per ECO change requests made by Engineering. Work on special projects for Director, Sales & Engineering and/or Managing Director, as needed (such as Ebit analysis) and make recommendations for improvements to processes or customer negotiations based on findings. Knowledge: Associates degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or other related field.  Experience: A minimum of three years’ experience in similar role.  Skills/Aptitudes: Strong written and verbal communication skills; Strong organizational, analytical, innovative, problem solving skills, and planning skills required. Proficient with Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint. Ability to interface with various customer groups including quality, manufacturing, engineering, supply chain, finance, and product planning and capable of working independently and on teams as required.  Working Conditions: Office environment. Occasional overtime is required.  forteq North America is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
industries: Automotive

description: Role Overview  Sales Development Representatives (SDRs) are the first touchpoints of Crimson Education for prospective students and families. SDRs will be required to share more about Crimson, qualify the leads, and schedule them for consults with the sales associates if qualified.  The purpose of this role is to assist the Sales Associates in qualifying potential sales leads in the early stages of a sales cycle. The SDR is responsible for creating an impressive and positive first impression for leads after identifying and creating new qualified sales opportunities. The SDR will become a trusted resource and develop relationships with prospects, acting as the initial point of contact. Approaching emails, calls, and texts with a positive attitude, can-do attitude, and willingness to serve is essential.  This is a full-time role based remotely in the United States or Canada.  What This Role Is Responsible For Build and maintain strong and productive relationships with potential students and guardians and serve as a positive, supportive, and high-energy first point of contact Take and share detailed notes to share with the larger sales team that will offer background, context, and tips on how to move forward in the sales process that best suits the lead Consistently brainstorm and craft new, efficient, and effective ways to reach and engage families Work collaboratively with team members across the company (and world!) to foster a dynamic and efficient SDR community Optimize the student experience, leveraging data to drive improvements across the sales team Create a customer-centric and polished first impression with prospects and customers Respond promptly to all new business opportunities from inbound and marketing-generated leads Monitor and respond to email, sales queue, and phone for sales inquiries Meet target quota related to number of qualified opportunities, meetings set, and closed business as well as assisting with online self serve purchases. Accurately capture, report, track, and manage required qualification data and lead statuses into Salesforce Provide prompt and regular feedback to marketing on lead quality and trends systematically via data entry and anecdotally in weekly marketing meetings Be an active contributor in a great team environment with a fun and energetic atmosphere Required Qualifications Excellent interpersonal communication skills (written and verbal) Outstanding time management skills Self-starter with lots of initiative High energy team player Demonstrated experience with CRM tool(s) Experience using Salesforce a plus The ability to pick up new technology quickly and with ease Fluent in English Bonus To Have Speaks a second language fluently Experience with Salesforce Knowledge of the US, UK, and/or EU university admissions application process Experience working and/or studying in an international, multicultural environment 2+ years sales and/or customer service experience with a desire to exceed the target Previous experience in tech and/or education Willingness to be coached and able to take feedback constructively Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university Passion for developing a career in sales or marketing What Success Looks Like Booking in consults with prospective, qualified families and the sales team Meeting monthly consult and sales targets Jumping in with company webinar and brand awareness events Punctual and timely communication with team members About Crimson  Crimson Education was founded in 2013 with the idea that through personalized education, we can transform students into the world leaders of tomorrow. Since then, we have rapidly grown a mission-driven team that is dedicated to building the education system for the 22nd century. Our network includes 2,400 tutors and consultants worldwide who work with over 20,000 students.  Our tech platform connects tutors and mentors to high school students aiming to achieve admission and scholarships to top universities in the US, Canada, UK, and beyond. We work with and support ambitious students that are willing to work hard to stand out in the admissions process.  Why work for Crimson? Opportunity for advancement Remote, flexible working lifestyle Paid time off + benefits A small and close-knit team while working together with team members across borders, around the world! If you're passionate about education and people and looking for a fast-paced, collaborative environment, and want to work with cutting-edge technology then we'd love to hear from you!  Please keep an eye on your spam/junk email folder for correspondence from Breezy HR.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Information Technology and Services, and Education Management

description: Description  ON24 is on a mission to transform the way businesses drive revenue and customer engagement through data-rich digital experiences. Powered by the ON24 Platform, marketers create and deliver live, always-on and personalized webinar, content and virtual event experiences to engage audiences in real-time, to generate powerful buying signals and to accelerate pipeline. With billions of engagement minutes created, ON24 is the network where enterprises engage prospects and customers at global scale. Headquartered in San Francisco, ON24 has a wide international footprint serving the regions of North America, EMEA and JPAC. For more information, visit https://www.on24.com.  The Sales Development Representative (SDR) is responsible for prospecting to generate leads and opportunities for Account Executives in the Acquisition and Expansion organization. This is a great opportunity to join ON24’s sales organization and begin the path towards becoming an Account Executive. You’ll be trained to sell our market-leading Webinar-Based Marketing Solutions, and will also have access to our Mentorship from ON24’s top salespeople.  Successful SDRs have an opportunity to become a quota-carrying Account Executive in 12-18 months. To be successful, you’ll need a passion to succeed, a clear vision of your goals and career path, and the desire to be part of a dynamic team environment.  Job Details 90% Calling marketing-generated (inbound) leads to qualify and schedule meetings for the sales team. 10% Miscellaneous tasks such as email campaigns and other tasks. Your Skills And Experience A hunter mentality to find and cultivate new business. Bachelor degree or equivalent years of experience preferred. Experience and previous success with prospecting and selling via phone. Proven success in a role with weekly, monthly, and quarterly targets. Must be a self starter who is able to drive self towards goals. Strong capacity to develop relationships quickly over the phone. Skilled at prospecting for new business by discovering need for ON24 solutions. Comfortable with detailed conversations both at a business and a technical level. Strong written and verbal communication, time management skills, and team orientation. Ability to build cross-functional relationships. Experience with tools such as SalesForce.com, Hoovers, and “standard” inside sales tools is a plus Benefits & Perks! Competitive base salary + commission + equity 401k Matching plan Excellent Health, Medical & Vision Insurance plans Monthly catered lunches Strong team culture Monthly team outings & events 15 days of PTO + paid holidays ON24 is proud to be an equal employment opportunities (EEO) workplace to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, ON24 complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.  Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, ON24 will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.  States

description: Are you competitive? Self Driven? Outgoing? Enjoy traveling? At SAFinc we are all of the above! Whether you are looking to spring into your next sales career, hit the ceiling with your last company with no more growth or are looking to start your first career within the industry we are hiring!  We are currently looking for candidates that are: Comfortable meeting with business owners and clients in person Natural leaders that can demonstrate how to lead from the front Outgoing and willing to network Willing to learn and generate their next own success looking for a challenge  Job Requirements: Commute to office daily 18 years or older Business professional attire Minimum 1 to 2 years of customer service experience Highschool diploma or higher Pass background check  Benefits: Hands on training and development Room for self-driven promotions Weekly competitions and incentives Team oriented office 0 seniority, strictly merit based

description: About Us:  Torch is a rapidly growing start-up (5x last year) that has raised over $30+ million from top VCs including Bessemer Venture Partners, Felicis, Health Velocity, and FJ Labs. Torch is targeting the $100+ billion office-based healthcare supply industry, starting with dental practices. Our innovative e-commerce software platform streamlines healthcare professionals’ procurement process and helps them secure the best prices.  Our founding team has experience from Blackstone, SmartAsset, Dropbox, and Datadog, from schools including Harvard and MIT. We’re a close‑knit team that enjoys working together every day to solve real‑world problems. We’re working to create better solutions to help healthcare professionals succeed, and we’re looking for people like you to help bring them to life!  Your Contribution:  The ideal candidate is a hands-on, highly motivated, experienced seller with a track record of success in selling to small and midsize businesses. You will own the full sales cycle from prospecting to close. You succeed when given the opportunity to pitch a vision, demonstrate tangible value and actively move prospects to close. You will work as an individual contributor while collaborating with the broader team to meet and exceed goals. We empower our team members and allow them to take on significant responsibility at an early stage.  Your Day To Day:   As an Inside Sales Representative / Account Executive, you will leverage existing proven sales strategies to promote Torch’s platform and close accounts. You are expected to prospect and build rapport with potential customers, conduct discovery to understand customer needs in depth, and effectively onboard customers and close new business. You will own your own territory, and you will have the opportunity to grow into a strategic role with organizational ownership.  What We’re Seeking:  •1-4 years of professional sales experience, including conducting outbound prospecting and demonstrated success in closing new business •Experience selling into small and midsize businesses (e.g. doctors, restaurants, bars, etc.) •Ability to ask thoughtful questions, listen actively and empathize with the buyer •Demonstrated track record of meeting or exceeding sales quota •Excellent written and verbal communication skills •Ability to learn quickly and become a subject matter expert  Bonus Points:  •Interest in the digitization of healthcare •Interest in tech start-ups  •Interest in supply chain and marketplaces  Why Torch:  •Collaborative, team-oriented, high performing culture •Structured training program with clear performance based career track and potential for quick growth •Competitive base salary and uncapped commission plan with significant earning potential •Demonstrated investment in benefits for employees (i.e., medical, dental, 401k, commuter benefits, Teladoc virtual health and TalkSpace online mental health memberships) •Social outings & team events (Virtual & In Person)   https://www.torchdental.com/
industries: Computer Software, Hospital & Health Care, and Information Technology and Services

description: We offer an excellent opportunity for not only a job, but a career with growth potential. At Transtar, we seek applicants who roll up their sleeves, enjoy hard work, thrive in a team environment, and who embody our core values of Safety, Honesty, Action, Relationship, and Product.  Transtar Autobody Technologies, a business unit of Transtar Industries, is a coatings manufacturing company in the automotive refinish business headquartered in Brighton, Michigan. At Transtar Autobody Technologies, we are dedicated to developing, producing, and marketing quality refinish products for the automotive aftermarket. TAT is prideful of our history of creative and innovative research, which enables us to bring products to the marketplace in a manner highly beneficial to our customers, the industry and our environment.  We have an immediate opportunity for a Territory Manager in our Tennessee market. This position will primarily service customers located in the metro San Antonio area, but may also include customers in the surrounding areas.  WHY TRANSTAR AUTOBODY TECHNOLOGIES?  The Territory Manager is responsible for managing a territory by selling products through our established distribution channels. As a Territory Manager, you help developing and established customers leverage our various products and programs, optimize their product, and maximize their utilization.  WHAT YOU WILL DO WITH YOUR TALENTS: Execute the TAT sales plan, work within company policies & programs, and meet annual sales performance goals expectations. Plan Pre-call sales, establish customer relationships, identify sales opportunities, present & demonstrate product /programs, and close sales. Develop annual Business Plan, submit annual territory review, monitor customer inventory levels, partner with customers to improve metrics, identify & capitalize on opportunities, and complete post-call activities & follow-up. Manage accounts – key, existing, and new, supervise distributor activities, evaluate distributor performance, and train distribution personnel. Control sales expense, manage time efficiently, develop monthly sales forecast, and address & resolve problems. Improve product knowledge, selling skills, and business acumen.  WHAT YOU WILL BRING: Three + years of outside sales experience (automotive aftermarket preferred). Excellent oral and written communication skills, as well as presentation abilities to people at all levels of management Prior PBE experience Product Knowledge & Confidence Business Acumen which includes financial literacy, market orientation, and strategic perspective Territory Planning & Management Proficient computer skills; MS Office products  EDUCATION:  Bachelor's degree (B. A.) from four-year college or university preferred; or a combination of education and experience / training. Management experience or desire/ability to lead a sales team is desired but not necessary.  rritory Manager
industries: Automotive

This is a highly innovative role, which requires you to drive use of Pulmozyme in your assigned territory through brand messaging, focused call plan execution, utilization of product materials, and access support.    This is your opportunity to join Ashfield Engage and represent a top biotechnology company!    What's in it for you?  Competitive compensation Excellent Benefits - accrued time off, medical, dental, vision, 401k, disability & life insurance, employee discounts/promotions Generous performance-driven Incentive Compensation package Competitive environment with company wide recognition, contests and coveted awards Exceptional company culture Recognized as a Top Workplace USA 2021   What will you be doing? Bachelor's degree 3-7 years B2B or B2C sales experience 1-3 years of pharmaceutical sales experience A proven track record of driving results, customer service, hospitality or equivalent sales/industry experience Competitive, outgoing, motivated with trailblazing mentality Ability to learn scientific information and be able to educate other people on it Able to handle fast pace and high volume of face-to-face interaction Involvement in extracurricular activities/programs Strong interpersonal and relationship building skills Strong work ethic Positive attitude Excellent communication skills Ability/willingness to travel as needed Timeliness Valid driver's license and clean driving record   About Ashfield Engage    Ashfield Engage, part of UDG Healthcare plc, is a global leader in commercialization services for the healthcare industry. Our mission is to partner with our clients, improving lives by helping healthcare professionals and patients get the medicines, knowledge and support they need.  To learn more about Ashfield Engage, visit us at: https://ashfieldengage.com/   Ashfield Engage is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Individuals seeking employment at Ashfield are considered without regards to age, ancestry, color, gender, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), mental or physical disability, national origin, protected family care or medical leave status, race, religion (including beliefs and practices or the absence thereof), sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. description: As one of the world's top RPO providers, PeopleScout is dedicated to encouraging collaboration,  ownership and growth in all our employees, no matter where they are located. PeopleScout's teams are  distinctive and unique, and with so many diverse personalities and differing contributions, PeopleScout is proud to provide all employees with a common thread of positivity and achievement. Discover your  potential, learn from the best and be part of an authentic, confident culture when you work with  PeopleScout.  PeopleScout is renowned leader in the RPO industry. We are always looking for innovative and dedicated talent to join our team because, like our clients, we know that our success depends on the strength and expertise of our people. PeopleScout employs thousands of people across the globe in a wide variety of disciplines. We are looking for passionate, energetic people to help further our success in the global market.  This position can be located anywhere in the US except for the state of Colorado.  Primary Responsibilities  The Affinix Solutions Consultant will offer guidance and expertise on the Affinix product portfolio as well as educate customers on the Affinix technology value proposition across the globe. The Affinix Solution Consultant will drive business growth and adoption through customer and prospect solutioning and product demonstrations.  You will work with our product and technology team, internal stakeholders from sales and delivery, corporate marketing, and product launch to prepare a wide-array of story-telling resources. You will use a range of tactical and strategic skills including researching, developing, and solutioning related to technology as the product representative on new business and expansion/renewal pursuits. This position requires outstanding sales discovery skills to identify prospect pain points, strong technology solutioning expertise, and masterful live technology demonstrations and presentations.  Core Responsibilities  Assess business challenges for clients/prospects and offers technology solutions to meet needs. Supports new business and expansion growth in existing clients with technology. Uncovers key problems through sales discovery practices in partnership with sales and delivery. Listens, researches and presents technical solutions to clients to solve business challenges. Articulates the value proposition for new features and offerings. Partners with marketing to create story-telling assets in support of new features and offerings. Communicates product feedback to product and technology teams for roadmap consideration. Prepares and presents technology presentations including customized, live demonstrations. Creates scripted demos for analyst briefings and industry award submissions. Serves as the product representative for all client renewals and prospect pitches. Requirements Excellent communication, presentation, and technology solutioning skills. Demonstrated experience building and delivering tech solution demonstrations in a B2B setting. Ability to partner with internal stakeholders to achieve organizational sales and renewal goals. Strong persuasive skills and ability to articulate value-proposition and cost benefit for each client. Experience working in a team-oriented, diverse and collaborative environment. Ability to recognize and adapt to changing business priorities. Experience working in an organization with international operations is desirable. Ability to travel up to 15% of the time for prospect and client engagements. Qualifications  Candidate must have 1-3 years of experience in B2B technology consulting/solutioning, sales/solution engineering, and/or product marketing  Education  BS/BA Degree or higher preferred  PeopleScout is an equal opportunity employer, strengthened by the diversity of our workforce.  Veteran hiring efforts are core to our mission at PeopleScout, and we are proud to have placed more U.S. Military veterans in full-time employment than any other recruitment firm in the world.  PeopleScout provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. PeopleScout complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall and transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.  PeoleScout expressly prohibits any form of unlawful employee harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of PeopleScout's employees to perform their expected job duties is not tolerated.

description: Are ready to grow your career with an exceptional Patient-Centered Specialty Pharmacy? Give us a copy of your resume to find out! Onco360 is seeking an Inside Sales Representative - Oncology. See details below! This is a fully remote position.  Summary  Using a balance of account management and direct telephone outreach, the primary responsibility of the Inside Sales position will be to develop and manage a designated territory with the goal of providing education and care coordination to prescribers for all Onco360 products and services. This position acts as a single point of contact by assisting the prescriber in evaluating referrals and performing care coordination to ensure service level requirements are met. In most cases this responsibility is carried out in coordination with a mirrored outside sales representative. The targeted customers are physicians, NPs, PAs, nursing staff, office managers, administrative and pharmacy staff within both hospital and community oncology settings.  This position will be home based with minimal travel as required to execute the following:  Regional Director Major Responsibilities Seeks out opportunities for prescriber experience process improvement and collaborates with Pharmacy OPS and outside sales to achieve prescriber experience improvement and sales goals Achieves designated call expectations for assigned prescribers with a focus on top targets, key influencers, and pipeline leads Responsible for identifying, ranking, prospecting, and developing key oncology practice and hospital-based business relationships within targeted regional territory Assists with sales escalations and communicates routinely with field sales representative partner about details impacting prescriber or patient experience Supports education and delivery of key messages and product presentations within initiatives (i.e. Selling our Success communication, drug launches, etc.) designed to ensure territory meets performance requirements Responsible for forwarding calls pertaining to clinical information and questions (i.e., dosing directions, adverse events, counseling, etc.) to Staff Pharmacists Documents and meticulously makes notations in each patient’s profile and/or CRM regarding every update and aspect of a customer’s/physician’s care or needs Uses discretion and independent judgment in handling customer complaints received, while documenting and forwarding to appropriate administrative staff. Obtains and manages prescriber communication preferences Nurtures and manages prescriber relationship to improve loyalty, and retention. Utilizes SPOC Tool to ensure all SPOC account prescriptions are processed quickly and efficiently throughout the workflow process. Assists operations staff and prescriber offices with prior authorizations by following up on outstanding issues and assisting with coordination and communication. Ensure that prescription renewal requests are communicated in a timely manner to ensure continuity of care when applicable. Works collaboratively with sales to achieve monthly, quarterly, and annual sales goals Regional Director Qualifications: 2 years’ retail or specialty pharmacy technician experience preferred - Must be familiar with general pharmacy terminology, billing quantity, SIG codes, roman numerals, brand, and generic names of medications, and IV dosage calculations/day supply. 2 years inside or outside sales experience for pharmacy or other health services-related industry preferred Oncology sales experience desired but not required B i-lingual desired but not required Exceptional probing and consultative communication skills Familiar with oncology providers, drugs, clinic, and hospital communities Understanding of oncology drug reimbursement, Managed Care Medical Specialty and PBM drug benefits Self-motivated and results driven Highly effective in working objectively with a diverse group of people and must demonstrate communication, organizational, administrative and office skills Proficient in data entry, verbal skills, computer skills and the ability to learn the department’s software system including CRM Must be a team player willing to accept and promote organizational goals and function with minimal supervision. Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from customers, employees, or senior management. Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as statistical inference. Ability to apply concepts such as percentages, ratios, and proportions in practical solutions. Maintain HIPAA patient confidentiality.
industries: Insurance, Hospital & Health Care, and Pharmaceuticals

description: Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 160,000 employees who are committed to safe, responsible and sustainable ways to nourish the world. This position is in Cargill’s protein and salt business, where we provide wholesome, high-quality food products to a wide range of customers, from foodservice operators and grocery stores to manufacturers and exporters. In this role, you will help identify and contact prospective customers and build relationships and contribute to assessing customer needs and suggest appropriate products, services and solutions that maximize product revenue and improves profitability.  Key Accountabilities Align with customer partners to sell products, quoting and negotiating product pricing within pricing function guidelines. Develop customer sales strategies to meet customer goals and objectives. Process customer orders and manage overall order fill rate and on time delivery service. Gather and communicate channel, market, customer or competitive information and intelligence and interact with team on strategy and pricing functions. Manage contracts and risk with pricing and trade promotions teams and resolve and coordinate the investigation of claims and disputes. Proven negotiation and selling skills and experience. Able to work in a team environment. Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Vet

description: Aesculap Inc.   Sales Associate, Healthcare Solutions  US-PA-Philadelphia | US-NJ-Trenton   Job ID: 2021-18999 Type: Regular Full-Time # of Openings: 1 Category: Sales Remote U.S.  Overview  Aesculap, Inc., a B. Braun company, is part of a 180-year-old global organization focused on meeting the needs of an ever-changing healthcare community. Through close collaboration with its customers, Aesculap provides advanced technologies for general surgery, neurosurgery and closure technologies. Aesculap continues a proud heritage of leadership and responsiveness as we strive to deliver products and services that improve the quality of patients’ lives    Responsibilities  Position Summary:    Responsible for contributing to the company's strategic objectives of revenue growth, market leadership and quality customer service through the sale of Aesculap products to assigned accounts. Aids in exceeding territory and regional sales objectives.    Principal Duties Responsibilities:  Calls on customer accounts as assigned by HCS Sales consultant providing technical, marketing and administrative product information and demonstrations; quotes appropriate customer prices. Schedules, picks up and delivers repair orders for assigned accounts. Responsible for product installations and in-services. Responds to customer needs, requirements and problems in accordance with company policy seeking direction from HCS Sales Consultant as needed. Remains informed of new products and other general information of interest to customers. Develops relationships with Sterile Processing, Operating Room managers and other appropriate personnel within assigned accounts. Maintains within Salesforce.com; contacts, account records, opportunities and report activities.. Manage and submit sales expenses in accordance with budget and company policy. Acts as liaison between customer and Marketing, Customer Service, and Credit Departments at Aesculap. Monitors and gathers information on competitor activity. Completes special projects as assigned. Effectively manage personal sample inventory and ensure Setworld product is returned timely. Attends training sessions as assigned by Supervisor/Manager. Possess the ability to exceed expectations with the customer in mind and take responsibility for driving key results as well as empower others to achieve desired outcomes. Demonstrate behaviors that drive efficiency by understanding and improving processes as well as sharing best practices. Must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 (i.e., at least 2 weeks after last dose) and, if hired, present proof of vaccination by start date.   The Company is committed to equal employment opportunity and providing reasonable accommodations to qualified candidates and employees pursuant to applicable law. We value and encourage diversity and solicit applications from all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, gender, sex, age, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, military and veteran status, gender identity or expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. If you require reasonable accommodation as part of the application process please contact AccommodationRequest@bbraunusa.com    Qualifications  Expertise: Qualifications-Experience/Training/Education/Etc    Required:  Associates Degree required; B.A./B.S. preferred; preferably in business/marketing or biological/physiological sciences. One to two years previous sales experience preferred. Account management skills, which include problem-solving and customer relations. Excellent organizational, oral, computer and written communication skills. Language and mathematical skills; reasoning ability:  Language Skills: Ability to read, analyze, and interpret common scientific and technical journals, financial reports, and legal documents. Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from customers, regulatory agencies, or members of the business community. Ability to effectively present information to top management, public groups, and/or boards of directors. Mathematical Skills: Ability to add, subtract, multiply, divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs. Reasoning Ability: Ability to define problems, collect date, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to use hands to handle or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.      B. Braun offers an excellent benefits package, which includes healthcare, a 401(k) plan, and tuition reimbursement. To learn more about B. Braun and our safety healthcare products or view a listing of our employment opportunities, please visit us on the internet at www.bbraunusa.com    Through its “Sharing Expertise®” initiative, B. Braun promotes best practices for continuous improvement of healthcare products and services.    All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, or other legally protected status.

A career with Labatt involves forming new customer ties and nurturing customer relationships that last over many years.  Responsibilities Present the company to potential food-away-from-home customers and create long-term relationships Perform the full sales cycle from generating leads and prospecting to closing and implementing the sale Manage customer expectations, provide exemplary service, and maintain customer relationships Defend against competitor sales tactics and be able to critically analyze and explain the flaws in competitor proposals to your customers Conduct effective sales meetings with prospects and customers to engage and teach them new ways to think about their businesses Requirements Bachelor’s Degree or Chef trained at CIA or equivalent Excellent communication skills Energetic, goal oriented, and competitive with proven examples of initiative and above-average performance Ability to excel in a fast-paced and competitive sales environment Ability to multitask and prioritize in order to work on multiple prospects and maintain multiple accounts all while constantly focusing on growth A bias for action Experience in food service, restaurants, and sales is a strong positive An extroverted personality and skills at dealing with other people Good problem-solving skills and equanimity in stressful situations Send resume to hr@labattfood.com

description: Company Description  Mesotech International, Inc. is a growing engineering and manufacturing company in Sacramento that focuses on meteorological and industrial monitoring systems. With over 28 years of experience in software design, hardware design, system integration, and installation, Mesotech is an excellent place to begin or expand your career.  Mesotech provides products and services that are critical to national defense and has remained open and fully operational throughout the COVID-19 pandemic. We took early action to successfully protect the health and safety of our team including physical distancing, minimum on-site staffing, and other measures. Salary: $18/HR  Employment type: full-time, in-house  About Glyder  We are a Santa Ana based activewear company designed for women who never say the words “I can’t.” From day one, our mission has been to cultivate a community of women who live life without limits. Those who see a boundary and break through it. Since we are all unique and no adventure is the same, we make it our focus to design multifunctional pieces that will perform with any activity. We are a relatively small company experiencing huge growth in both our wholesale and online markets. Glyder is looking for an energetic and qualified Customer Service & Sales Admin Assistant to join our team.  There’s no dream too big, and the possibilities are limitless - Glyder.  Position Summary  We are looking for full-time Customer Service & Sales Admin Assistant to join our team in our new headquarters in Santa Ana, CA. The perfect candidate should be a personable and energized individual who loves the outdoors and active lifestyle, thus truly identifying with our brand. The candidate will be responsible for providing excellent customer service, maintaining high customer satisfaction by providing product/services information, resolving any issues, and supporting both internal and external sales representatives with daily tasks, shipments of orders, returns and special handling requests. The perfect candidate is able to take direction well and possess outstanding communication skills and attention to detail. This position will directly report to VP of Sales & Merchandising; and assist the team of internal and independent sales reps.  Responsibilities  Sales Admin Assistance: Handle wholesale order related administrative duties: data entry, managing / updating orders, backorders, resolving shipping errors, processing RA’s, order entry, etc Answer inbound wholesale phone calls, either handling the customer’s needs or transferring to appropriate rep and/or department Support outside sales reps with order inquiries, updating customer accounts, inventory inquiries, RA’s, order processing, etc Assist with sales reporting Attain knowledge of Glyder’s history as a brand and our mission, and successfully communicate this message to all customers/accounts Attain expertise in our fabrics, price points, and fit of 200+ revolving and Core styles Job Requirements Must have a positive and strong work ethic Customer orientation and ability to adapt/respond to different types of characters Superior verbal and written communication skills Proficient in Gmail Platform, Excel, and Word. Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail Ability to multi-task and manage time effectively Plus Factors Knowledge or experience in the fashion and / or active industries Experience with NetSuite and/or Shopify Qualificatons Successful candidates are goal-oriented, outgoing, motivated, persuasive, able to multi-task and possess a desire to learn and grow within the company Must have ability to work well both independently and as part of a team Retail experience (required) High School Diploma (required) Bachelor’s Degree- Business (preferred) Experience with apparel ecommerce and/or retail What Glyder Offers You Medical Insurance 401(k) / Profit Sharing Hybrid workplace allowing employees to mix in office and home-based work (based on job functions and business needs) Paid holidays Employee/ Family discounts Career advancement opportunities Be part of a growing brand! Glyder provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (gender), age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, medical condition, genetic information, sexual orientation, or any other category protected by federal, state, or local laws.  We are a Santa Ana based activewear company designed for men & women who never say the words “I can’t.” From day one, our mission has been to cultivate a community of those who live life without limits. Those who see a boundary and break through it. Since we are all unique and no adventure is the same, we make it our focus to design multifunctional pieces that will perform with any activity. description: Job Description Do you wish you could work outside on a beautiful summer day? Do you prefer to be on the road or on your feet instead of sitting at a desk? Are you looking for a sales role that has you meeting new people every day? We are looking for a dynamic sales person who loves talking with people, being outside, and helping homeowners solve their backyard needs. We pride ourselves on our solution-selling methodology and innovative products, which makes our sales team top-notch problem-solving fence gurus.  To be a Peerless Fence Group Residential Sales Representative, you need more than basic sales skills and the gift of the gab. We require our sales reps to be detail-oriented, conscientious, and clear, consistent communicators. You also should have basic math and writing skills and know your way around a computer. We use Salesforce to document all of our customer projects, and we use a digital estimating tool to figure each quote. We strive to get it right the first time, which starts with our sales team being accurate in the field. This role is not always a walk in the park. We provide estimates year round, rain or shine. But each day is different than the last, and you’re always learning something new. If you’re a friendly and outgoing person with a flair for organization and detail, please apply. We need you on our team!  Position Overview The Residential Sales Representative is responsible for the daily management of all residential sales appointments for the geographic area which they are assigned. The Residential Sales Representative is accountable for achieving sales, margin, and conversion targets while delivering an exceptional customer experience. Our Sales Team uses a solution selling, consultative approach to working with customers. To be successful in this role, the Residential Sales Representative will be focused on delivering the following:  Serve customers with Quality, Service, and Integrity; provide a high-level customer service experience Achieve sales growth, margin, close rate objectives Maintain full utilization of Salesforce program and sales processes Clear, consistent communication throughout the sales process  Role and Responsibilities Maintain appointment schedule and arrive to each appointment on time Measure client backyards and compose project proposals based on project specifications, customer needs, and product preferences Maintain high level of clear, consistent communication with customers throughout the sales process Respond reliably and quickly to client requests and needs Provide a professional, informed sales presentation Achieve sales goals, margin targets Adhere to and uphold company policies and sales procedure Deliver an exceptional customer experience Effectively utilize Salesforce to record all appointments, emails, interactions with customers Use digital estimating system to produce project quotes  Required Skills Excellent verbal and written communications skills High-level customer service skills Ability to excel in a fast-paced environment Self-motivated to achieve daily responsibilities;
