Sales Professional for Classic Car Dealership Compensation: $100-125K/Year Performance Based (Salary + Health/Dental + 401K W/Match)  About the Job Streetside Classics is searching for a self-driven, goal-oriented, energetic sales representative to join the team at our Nashville, TN (La Vergne) showroom. If you have a passion for classic/exotic cars, and also have excellent sales and customer service skills, then apply today! Responsibilities: Consistently execute vehicle sales to hit monthly & yearly sales goals Provide excellent customer service to buyers from start to finish on all deals Sell with integrity/attention to detail to minimize post-sale risks Utilize sharp negotiating skills to maximize company sales revenue Engage with consignors/sellers to ensure accurate presentation on incoming inventory Dialogue with existing consignors/sellers to ensure market pricing is correct and competitive Qualifications: MUST be a self-starter who can work independently, execute quickly and move to next task. MUST have strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communication. MUST have exceptional computer and writing skills. MUST be able to work Saturdays. Professional personal appearance (no visible tattoos or piercings). Compensation: $100-125K/Year Performance Based (Salary + Health/Dental + 401K W/Match)  PLEASE ONLY APPLY by sending your cover letter, and resume through LinkedIn. DO NOT call our showroom. Please, no unscheduled appointments regarding employment (although if you would like to come stop by to see our facility you are of course welcome)! THANK YOU!   More About the Job Specializing in the consignment and sales of collector vehicles, Streetside Classics is one of the largest and fastest growing classic car dealerships in the nation. We currently have showrooms in Charlotte, NC, Atlanta, GA, Fort Worth, TX, Nashville, TN, Phoenix, AZ, and Tampa, FL, with future growth expected. We’re searching for a quick learning, self-driven, goal-oriented, energetic sales representative to join the team at our Nashville showroom.  Our Nashville, TN facility holds approximately 240+ classic and collector vehicles, and each sales person is responsible for ensuring they continue to grow and expand their knowledge about each car in our inventory, as well as market trends as a whole. With classic cars, each vehicle is unique and our relationship with our consignors is also integral to our success—therefore we need people who can get to know each customer just as well as the products they’re selling. We sell approximately 40+ units from our Nashville showroom every month, and each sales person is responsible for ensuring their part in maintaining that performance. Performance goals are met on a team basis rather than individually; we approach the sales process much differently than a typical car dealership.  If you have a passion for classic collectable vehicles, or even just a casual interest in them but have excellent communication skills then you can excel. We can teach you the nuts and bolts of the collector car industry but you must have excellent people skills, and be coachable in order to succeed with our company. Because of our aggressive growth plans, there is potential for promotion and increased income.  Compensation: 2020 was our biggest paying year ever, and 2021 is going to beat that. These are real numbers, as 2020 was in this range... $100-125K/Year Performance Based (Salary + Health/Dental + 401K W/Match) Salary that includes fixed pay, commissions, and bonuses.  Benefits: Health/Dental benefits 401k with 4% match $50,000 Life Insurance Great work environment Accessible and open-minded leadership Opportunity to work with a great group of people and learn a lot about classic cars!  If you’ve always dreamed of working with classic and collector cars and have the desire to sell the strongest inventory in the region – this is the job for you.  Job Type: Full-time Pay: $100,000.00 - $125,000.00 per year  COVID-19 considerations: Employees are provided masks when necessary, and sanitizing stations are available.

Company: Oak Street Health  Title: Sales Representative Location: Gary  Oak Street Health is a rapidly growing, innovative company of community-based healthcare centers delivering higher quality health and wellness care that improves outcomes, manages medical costs and provides an unmatched experience for adults on Medicare in medically underserved communities. By providing holistic, comprehensive and integrated care right in our patients’ communities, we can help keep them healthy and reinvest cost savings in further care for those same communities and others. Since 2013, Oak Street Health has brought its singular approach to tens of thousands of people across the nation. With an ambitious growth trajectory, Oak Street Health is attracting and cultivating team members who embody Oak Street values and are passionate about our mission to rebuild healthcare as it should be. For more information, visit www.oakstreethealth.com.  Role Description and Responsibilities  The Outreach Executive (OE) reports to the Outreach/Sales Director and is responsible for developing relationships with key businesses and organizations within their assigned territory in order to create patient acquisition opportunities. The OE will also engage prospective patients, introduce Oak Street Health, and guide them through the new patient journey. The key responsibilities for this role are as follows:  Sales Develop, implement, and execute an effective sales strategy to achieve patient acquisition targets Demonstrated ability to develop, maintain and grow a rigorous sales pipeline, with accurate forecasting and reporting Deliver highest level of sales and customer service to our prospects, patients and community partners Generate leads by prospecting, building and maintaining relationships throughout the community Nurture prospective patients and prospect for new patients with an ambitious mentality via email, phone, and networking Demonstrated ability to think strategically when developing local relationships and sales plans. Account Management Prospect, engage and create new trusting relationships with local businesses within an assigned territory, at multiple levels including employees, key contacts, manager and business leaders, to drive patient growth opportunities  Create and manage an account development plan and report on results Capture and record customer information and sales activity data into customer relationship management (CRM) system and appropriate business systems  What we’re looking for:  This is an exciting opportunity to own sales strategy and execution in a value based care organization that is changing the way healthcare is delivered. We are looking for: Sales or account management experience preferred Degree from 2 or 4 year institution preferred Access to personal transportation with a valid driver's license required  Ability to use E-Mail and computer reporting tools, Salesforce experience preferred Healthcare knowledge a plus Passion for sales, and a drive to succeed Ability to quickly connect and influence the right people  Someone trusted and comfortable in tough situations Ability to settle disputes and negotiation skills Someone who steps up to conflicts and sees them as opportunities to shine High energy, self-motivated, ambitious individuals that want to control their own income Knowledge of various Microsoft Office products including, but not limited to, Excel and Word Team player and contributor to the overall effectiveness of the team Someone to represent Oak Street Health professionally and ethically and demonstrate good judgment in all activities  What does being “Oaky” look like?  Radiating positive energy Assuming good intentions Creating an unmatched patient experience Driving clinical excellence Taking ownership and delivering results Being scrappy  Why Oak Street?  Every day we work together to transform healthcare and improve the life of each individual we serve. In our collaborative, energetic culture we offer:  High levels of responsibility Leadership and development opportunities across a rapidly growing organization Comprehensive, competitive total rewards package including health benefits, 401k match with immediate vesting; paid vacation / sick time; tuition reimbursement Placement opportunities as our national footprint expands And more!   Oak Street Health is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and encourage all interested readers to apply at oakstreethealth.com/careers.

GMS, one of the country’s leading PEOs, is looking for high energy individuals with aggressive hunting skills to join our Outside Sales Team.  Who are YOU? Are you a driven individual that thrives in an entrepreneurial environment? – Here at GMS, our Outside Sales Reps are hunters who have the ability to own and run their own book of business. Would you like to use your skills and abilities to control and plan for your future? – Our Sales Team has the ability to write their paycheck with an uncapped, residual commission structure. Are you looking to bring your sales skills to a new arena/industry? – Come and join us for a two-week training program teaching you all of the in’s and out’s to be successful here. Is it important for you to receive recognition for your hard work? – We recognize our sales team through incentive trips, company sales awards, and an unlimited supply of high fives! What Does an Outside Sales Representative Do? Prospect new business and handle the sales process from cold call to contract Meet with top level decision makers to present and educate them on the various services we offer to help make their businesses Simpler, Safer, and Stronger! 100% B2B Sales/New Business Development Expectations for our Sales Representatives: Daily cold calling to hunt new prospects Conducting introductory in-person meetings with potential clients Proposing the constructive solution to best fit the clients’ needs/wants Working towards and exceeding your sales quota  What’s in it for YOU: Competitive Base Salary + Uncapped, Residual Commissions Company Car provided after 90 Days! Benefits – Medical, Dental, Vision, 401(k), Short Term Disability, Long Term Disability, Tuition Assistance, etc. Monthly gym membership and cell phone reimbursement Great work/life balance First Class training program – both at home and hands on; plus continuous development throughout your career No assigned territories… openly call within your region! What is a PEO? A Professional Employer Organization (PEO) is a multi-service-providing partner that allows companies to focus on growing their business by outsourcing the management of payroll and tax administration, employee benefits, workers’ compensation insurance, and human resources to a team of experts. The PEO industry is an $176+ billion dollar industry, with an average annual growth rate of 14% Between 2 and 3 million people are covered under a PEO arrangement in the United States  For more information please visit our website at www.groupmgmt.com  Group Management Services is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
